reviews.review: A must do attraction in Sydney. On a nice day the ferry ride from Sydney's Circular Quay to Manly is a fabulous way to see a large section of the whole harbour area passing the iconic bridge and opera house along the way. The ferry takes 30 minutes each way and with ferries running regularly throughout the day (twice per hour?) getting to Manly is easy. Once in Manly have a meal or just stroll on the beach with an icecream!This is a very popular trip with tourists so ferries can be busy. Top tip - go on a Sunday when there is unlimited public transport on an Opal Card for $2.50

Easy trip from the Sydney Harbor launch to Manly/Manly Beach. I purchased an Opal card (just like the UK's Oyster system) to get around Sydney and surrounding areas. You can buy them at most groceries and sundries around the downtown area. I had some extra time on the weekend and was encouraged by my local co-workers to head over to Manly Beach by way of the Manly ferry. I'm glad I made the trip! In about 30 minutes you go from dock to dock and get to experience the beautiful Sydney Harbor with all the major site from the water. You also get a sense for just how beautiful the area is around Sydney. The visit to Manly Beach was well worth it, too. Quaint beach town with all that comes with it. Great place to hang out and people watch.

Doesn't take too long. I've been on the manly ferry a few times and it doesn't take too long at all to get to manly. Probably around 20/30minutes. It's nice to sit outside on a sunny day and take in the views on the way over.

An easy and pleasant way to get to and from downtown Sydney !. Not much to say, it's a ferry, it takes you, on time from Manly to Sydney circular Quay, or Darling Habour, or even Watson Bay. Just a ride is pleasant, it's the best commute you can imagine !

Great ride!. Took the ride to manley and it was easy and wonderful. I forgot my binoculars on the boat and when I returned hours later they had been turned into the ticket office. I was so greatful that a ferry employee was willing to call the office and check for me.

Mainly Manly. Did a return trip on the Manly Ferry during the week and enjoyed the outing on a nice spring day. It was easy to find the Ferry at Circular Quay and even though there seemed to many people in the queue, the crowd dispersed on board and it was easy to find seating. The trip takes 30 minutes one way and its a nice way to enjoy Sydney Harbour,

Wonderful entry to Sydney. We are visiting Sydney with our kids, and decided to live at Manly side rather than city side to combine both beach & city. We used the ferry a few times including our first trip into the city. The view of the Opera and harbor was amazing and all at a extremely low expense due to Sunday rebate.
trip to manly. well worth a trip to manly on the ferry when in sydney.If its windy then rug up as it can get cold on the water

Best way to Manly. From Circular Quay to Manly these ferries run regularly, easy and not expensive way to see the sights of Sydney Harbour as you sail down the centre. we had a wet October day, but it did not spoil the trip, but it would have been even better on a fine day.
A must do when visiting Sydney. The Manly Ferry (Public Transport) is a great way to get from Circular Quay to Manly and offers some most rewarding views of Sydney Harbour including the Opera House.

such a beautiful way to see sydney. on a gorgeous sunny day we floated around the harbour taking in the gorgeous veiws, it was easy to find a seat outside (make sure you pick the side with the views of the bridge) and was an affordable day trip to Manly which is an incredible beach.
A busy and vibrant area. All sorts of eating places dotted around. The ferries leave from here as do the buses to Coogee Beach and Bondi Beach.
Captain Cook with commentary. This stopped at all the stops but we are entitled to land only at Manly. This was not fast but commentary was very informative and good.

Ferry ride to manly . If the weathers clear it's a leisurely ride but then I enjoy the water anytime of year so if you don't mind it getting a bit bumpy at times just enjoy the ride. On a clear day it's beautiful to see the harbour and homes along the shore from the water

Quick, clean and reliable. What else can be said? The ferry was in good running order, the crew was nice, and the views were fantastic. We got over to Manly easily and found the ferries ran regularly so getting back was easy. Worth the hype

Great day on the harbour. Great way to spend a beautiful day on Sydney Harbour. Great view and a very smooth and engaging experience. Don't pay for a harbour cruise if you just want to see the sights. Good value.

Nice quick way to see the Harbor. . The hubby and I hopped this ferry to go to Manly and back strictly to see the Harbor. Cheap and quick! You have a 30 minute wait once you arrive in Manly to head back.

Great Un-touristy ride over to manly!. Take the ferry over to manly beach and get a great view of the harbour and visit a fun beach with nice shopping. And it's a cheap ride over!!
If I knew before I went I'd skip the zoo (not great) and just do this instead. ;)

Great views of Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Loved to ride to Manly from Central. Gave a great tour of Sydney Harbour and fantastic views of Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Fantastic photo op of Opera front front and side of ferry as you sail right past it. Opportunity to get a different perspective of the city. Manly itself is definitely worth a visit and great view as you sail in.
Day trip. Go here if you want litter, Toilets that rank at the top of the disgusting scale, cafe's that are average....so dissapointing from our last visit...Come on Manly Council????

Always Worthwhile. Was with someone who has not taken the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly, so once again, I decided to take the trip. We went on Sunday morning at 9am, and I do suggest if you prefer to not stand in long queues, to set off early. Sydneysiders are not known for rising early, so there were not a lot of people around at this time. The view of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and inlets along the trip are stunning. We chose to take the slow ferry as it provides more photo opportunities. The trip is around 30 minutes one way. No ticket office open on Sunday, so will have to purchase tickets via machine. Suggest you take the trip if time allows.

Day trip to Manly. The best, most economical way to see Sydney Harbour on a sunny day. Enjoyed every minute of the trip to Manly and back again. (We have paid a lot more to see a lot less on harbour cruises elsewhere). Manly itself not so much, horrible yuppie chunky wedges with a piece of cardboard fish, terrible tourist shops and generally a shadow of its former glory. but the trip there and back well worth it.

Took Nephew for fish and chips.. Our Nephew was viditing from America and we took him on the Manly Ferry to Manly. On the way there and back he took some stunning pics of Sydney harbour and the bridge.We had fish and chips on the beach before returning on the ferry to Circular Quey. He had a brilliant time.

Manly excusion. We went by Manly Ferry over to Manly and back. The ferry was very comfortable and the areas of sight were plentiful for people that the ferry ride is a first. Very safe for families with little children too. Was so much fun

Ferry ride - a Sydney must do!. This form of public transport is ssoooooo special. What a way to see the beautiful Sydney Harbour. Travel from Circular Quay, adjacent to the Circular Quay train station, to Manly Wharf. Depart from the Quay wharf between the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge, and travel part Taronga Zoo to Manly. Worth a day to look around Many and enjoy the beautiful surf and harbour beaches. One of the only places in Australia where both the calm harbour and exciting surf beach, with lifesavers, are within 500 metres (flat walk) of each other. Don't forget to thank the crew. They jump off and rope the large ferry securely to the wharf at each stop.

A must when you are in Sydney. One of the great Sydney experiences and an absolute must to appreciate the beauty of the Harbour city. Great views of the harbour Bridge, skyline and he heads. Give yourself time to wander from the Manly terminal to the beach at Manly and find somewhere to eat and make a day of it. Get an Opal card before you visit Sydney so you can use it on the ferry and other public transport. If its a fine day get to the terminal early to snag an outside seat and swap sides for the return trip so you can see all of the harbour

Seven miles from Sydney and a thousand miles from care!. It's not the comfort of the ferry but the beautiful Harbour foreshore you feast your eyes on during the 30 minute trip to the village-style suburb of Manly. Less cosmopolitan than its rival Bondi, My tip take an early ferry on a week day and swim with the locals on the ocean side then breakfast at an array of cafe choices!

Really efficient and a good trip with all the sights. A great way to travel when leaving Sydney to get to Manly - some great photo opportunities to get great pictures of the sights you have seen from land. Also a quick trip to get you to your destination.
What a beautiful view!. We took ferry from Sydney harbour. It's absolutely amazing experience. Prepare your camera for the postcard style photos.

A well deserved Sydney icon. A well deserved Sydney icon, the Manly Ferry we recommend as a must-do to our overseas visitors. A cheap way to see the harbour, birds surfing on the wind and overall, just a lovely way to travel. Also recommend the Balmain ferry. Going under the Sydney Harbour bridge is also a great experience. Balmain is the second oldest suburb in Sydney and has a string of great bars worth visiting.

What a view. This must be the best ferry journey you will ever take. We have done Hong Kong and many others but the view of Sydney once you turn at the Heads is something that will stay with you forever.The Manly ferry is a great leisurely half hour crossing and the colleagues are good on the ferry. Highly recommended this even if you are not based in Manly.

Beautiful harbour cruise. The Manly ferry, was easy to find, use and really comfortable. We had purchased the opal transport card, so we could use it on trains, buses and some of the ferries including the Manly ferry. It was relatively cheap, has a regular schedule, even on weekends, and was clean and tidy. The crew were always happy to share a smile, on entering and exiting. Did I mention some great views of the iconic Sydney landmarks!

don't miss a trip to manly. Check times and wharf number - make sure your opal card is charged - beautiful trip across the harbour - million dollar views - fantastic photo shots of bridge and opera house. Have lunch at pub on the waterfront - good deals and great views.

Quick and reasonably priced . I have used this ferry several times on trips to Sydney to go to manly beach, and find it very reasonably priced and quite a short enjoyable trip. The views are great, there's plenty of seating and free wifi. The one thing I would say about my most recent experience (last Saturday) is that there were not enough ticket machines and the queues were very long- we missed getting earlier ferries both going there and coming back due to the queues. The ticket offices weren't open so you had to use the machines and they didnt seem to offer return trips? We didn't have opal cards so we had to buy single trips and there is surely a way to make the purchase of tickets more efficient? Other than that, it's a great service :)

Beautiful experience. Best views while on the journey especially of the harbour bridge and opera house as well as the north heads and water... and then exploring manly at the other end is just fantastic! A little expensive for public transport about $7 each way but not terrible for visiting the area.
Fast ferry to Manly.. Very professional and very well run.Fantastic views along the way and a wonderful trip.A must do for anyone who's going to Manly.

Great Day Out. We caught the ferry out to Manly and was pleasantly surprised. The ferry was wheelchair friendly and runs quite regularly. If you go in the late afternoon you will have great views of the harbour and opera house and on the way back you get to enjoy the city lights.

Sunday deals. Beautiful view from the Manly Ferry! On Sundays the Manly ferry is particularly popular due to its cheap price of onky 2.5 dollars for the ride. It is still worth it paying the full price any other day. Manly beach is a nice place to hang out.
Great way to experience the water and beach. Really enjoyed this quick trip to Manly by ferry, wandered the very enjoyable town, and headed back. Perfect.

Cheap & easy ferry trip. Catching the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly is a cheap & easy way to enjoy the panoramic views of Sydney Harbour and experience the Northern beaches. Operates 7 days a week and only takes 30 minutes.

A great and inexpensive way to see Manly Beach!. Highly recommend this Ferry. It just goes back and forth from Circular Quay to Manly Beach, which is a delightful place. Took the ferry on a Sunday and it is just $2.50 AUD. All the modes of transport like the buses, trains and ferries are $2.50 on Sundays.

First Activity - Trip to Manly on the Ferry. Lots have things have changed since travelling this ferry some 45 years ago. The terminals are modern, turnstiles are electronic and the ferry interior no longer has wooden bench seating. A speedy trip over and back and very enjoyable.
Day trip to Manly. My partner and I used the ferry to get across to Manly from Sydney. Very good service, all you could ask for in a short ferry ride.

Best views. The Manly ferry has great views of both the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House, which is even more interesting from the water side. Enjoyed a few hours in Manly, sitting on the beach promenade watching the surfers.

If you visit Sydney...... If you visit Sydney a trip with he ferry to Manly is a must. Just make sure you pic a sunny day. Like you have to ride the Cable cars in San Francisco...you have to ride the Manly Ferry. Beautiful ride.
Great way to see the city and harbour. Great way to relax and enjoy the great views of the delightful harbour and city from the water. Very relaxing and pleasant.
Cheap and reliable. The title line says it all! We took an Uber to the beach, but decided to catch the ferry back to Sydney. Easy and efficient. Cost around A$8 one way.

Ride the iconic Manly Ferry. Ride the iconic Manly Ferry and experience Sydney Harbour like the Sydney locals do. A magical way to make your way to the picturesque Northern Beaches of Sydney and have a lunch in the centre of Manly. To get on you need to make your way down to Circular Quay, easily purchase a ticket from the machine (or use your Opal travel card) and simply jump on - ferries run every 1/2 hour. The trip also takes half and hour and has inside and and outside seating + a small kiosk for coffee and refreshments. Tip, the ferry doesn't ever turn around - so the bow of the boat one trip will be the stern when travelling back the opposite direction.

Lovely ride from Sydney to manly. This is one of the longer ferry rides, approx. 30 minutes. A bigger boat with refreshments available on board. Great to do when its dark and the gulls follow the boat and are lit by the boats lights - very atmospheric.

An enjoyable outing. Ferries run from Circular Quay to Manly and back all day long, usually at half-hourly intervals. You can buy single trip tickets at machines, but an Opal Card is more convenient. The trip differs from Inner Harbour ferry rides in that you do not need to "tap off" when exiting either wharf. The ferries are quite large vessels, double-decked, with a shop selling refreshments on board. The journey takes about half an hour in each direction. If the weather is fair, try to get on in time to snare an outside seat, as the views are great and inside seats, although comfortable, allow for less viewing - also, often the windows are none too clean due to salt spray. Seats outside at the front of the vessel can be windy but there is nothing quite like the experience of crossing the entrance to the Harbour, when the Pacific Ocean rollers are coming through the Heads, with the bushland on one side and the horizon stretching away in the direction of New Zealand on the other. The fast ferry" services, which are privately operated and take only 15 minutes in a catamaran (not a hydrofoil) cost much more than the government service (from Wharf 3 at CQ) and are really meant for commuters who are not concerned about an experience and just want to get to or from work - also Opal Cards do not work for these services. When you reach Manly, walk straight ahead along The Corso for about 400m to reach Manly's wonderful ocean beach.

Must do while on circular. Ferry to Manly from Circular Quay is one of must do if you are in Sydney. You will enjoy great relax even greater view from back of ship... unforgettable world iconic look onto Sydney Harbour Bridge together with Sydney Opera House. It's too many woow in one picture. .. You have it all like on your hand.I'd you seen Enough enjoy complimentary WIFI on board. Cost of ferry is $7 i quess and it's paid by Opal card.. Once on Manly. Enjoy pleasant walk to Manly beach.

Must do!. This ferry, which runs every 30 minutes, is a tradition and distinctively part of Sydney life. Taking about 30 minutes to cross the Harbour the old boats, which are spacious and atmospheric, travel back and forth from central Sydney to the quieter world of Manly and it's famous beach.
Great way to get to Manly from the city. Cheap transport, regular service, and due to the size of the vessel, a very smooth ride, highly recommended...

Easily the best value-for-money experience in Australia!. There are two types of ferry going to and fro to Manly: the slow one (30 minutes) and the fast one (15 minutes). The slow one is definitely better because it is roomier, larger, gives you ample time to take in the passing scenery, especially the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge, Fort Denison, Garden Island Naval Dockyard, the Governor-General's and the Prime Minister's Sydney residences, the many bays and beaches and "the Heads" (entrances to Sydney Harbour). And the cost? $17.90 one way. A bargain! The ferries leave from No 3 wharf and tickets are available from easy-to-use machines, which take coins, notes and credit cards. There's a snack bar on board; also toilets.

Rude Hydrofoil Staff. A wonderful visit to Sydney was marred, for me, only by the extremely rude and psychopathic staff on the hydrofoil from Circular Quay to Manly. Can't see any scenery from the seats and staff shout at anyone who ventures outside. Use buses (great driver didn't charge anybody because the ticket machine was broken!) or trains if possible. I note that I am not the first to report on the ferries' poor staff attitudes. This is God's own land, the best country in the world, and there is no place for lowlifes, most of whom are, thankfully, confined elsewhere and never sully its shores. Long live white Australia and long may it defend itself from lawbreakers.

A relaxing ride...with cellphone chargers!. At the suggestion of a friend I hopped the ferry to Manly and was treated to a stunning ride out of the harbour, past the front of the Opera House (and also beautiful views of the bridge on the return trip). The ferry itself was a smooth ride (good, because I'm prone to seasickness) and there were chargers to plug your phones into to recharge on the inside wall. So handy! The ride itself was about 25 minutes, I believe.
Easy ride. On time, very clean, staff extremely courteous nice ferry ride. Perfect for seeing the harbour so highly recommended
Sydney icon.. Classic sydney means of transport and a great way to experience the best harbour in the world. However the staff on board need to be friendlier

Still a wonderful ferry ride and stunning beach at Manly. Ive been here before but the ferry ride and the stunning beach is such that it requires another review. The views from the ferry are stunning and the trip is worthwhile just for that alone. The ferry's there and back are starting to look a little tired and the upholstery is wearing. The crews are always very friendly and will help you if you ask.Manly itself is very welcoming and the wonderful beach is just a short walk away with full facilities. Altogether this is a must for visitors to Sydney

Great views. A friend recommended this as an economical way to see the city from the Harbour. Tickets are available from kiosks, which are easy to use. Docks are clearly numbered and signs indicate time until the next departure. The ferry itself offers inside and outside seating and viewing areas, and drinks and snacks are sold once underway. The terminal in Manley offers several cafes and shops, some under cover and some outdoors.

Must do.. Took the Manly ferry over to Manly as it is a great way to view the harbour and beautiful views of Sydney. Went over during daylight and returned after dark and the night lights from the ferry were beautiful. We had a smooth trip.

A nice slow trip across Sydney harbour. This was a nice cruise across the harbour to Manly and back. The only mistake we made was going on Easter Sunday. The boat was packed and the outside deck was near impossible to access. On the way back from Manly we managed to snag seats at the back outside which made the trip much more enjoyable.

A must. This is a must whilst in Sydney ! We traveled over on a morning ferry and it was very pleasant . The boarding is sleek and organised and you are quickly on your way. The trip is good and you get to see lots of the different areas of Sydney on your way to Manley. Manley is just beautiful you walk from the dock on one side of the finger of land to the beach on the other side. There are lots of cafes and shops on the way and the whole place has a lovely holiday feel. The beach is stunning and we walked from one end to the other along the esplanade. At one end you can walk around to cabbage point which is a marine reserve, this area is very well looked after as is the whole of Manley. I hope I can return here one day.

Great trip!. We took the ferry to Manly for a day.Ferry was clean & tidy, staff very helpful and friendly.They had drinks and snacks you could buy if you wanted to.This is a really great way to see the harbour.
Great Fun. We had a great day out in Manly and enjoyed our ferry trip each way. The scenery from the ferry is stunning and Manly itself is a fun spot to spend a few hours in.

Good to slow down the pace in Sydney. Catching the Manly ferry at Cicular Quay is a way to unwind from the hectic Sydney life, taking kids is a delight as there are no stops and they can look out on the water and relax

Only way to Manly . Nice, easy 1/2 cruise to Manly and back to the circular quay. Use your Opal card. A word of warning on summer days there's a lot of beach goers so it can get crowded. Also try and get on the upper deck for the best views along the way.
Simply Brilliant. . Costs just under $15 and worth every cent. Great views great photographic opportunities, this is a must. Best views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera house ever.

daytrip with friends. we took the ferry to manly from circular quay with friends we hadn!t seen for 43 years we had a opal card which is for the buses and ferrys ,great sights of the opera house and bridge,
Great ferry!. Wifi included, very clean and nice with a cafe too! It's a beautiful trip as well. Get on early so you can grab a seat on the front!
Scenic ride. It's a bit of a pain getting the tickets for the ferry at the terminal because of the long lines and lack of kiosk but once we got our ticket and boarded all was good.

Class operation. They showed up on time, they left on time and the ride was smooth. You couldn't ask for more. They boats were clean and the staff was professional. The tickets were a bit on the expensive side, so that's why I only rated it a four.

Iconic part of the Sydney transport network. We took the Manly Ferry to finish off a planned tailored tour (Spendour Tailored Tours) of Sydney's Eastern Suburbs & Lower North Shore. It is a great journey down what is probably the most spectacular harbour in one of the prettiest cities in the world. A cheap way of getting a tour of the harbour, although you obviously miss out on the historical commentary & close views of other lovely parts of the harbour you would get with a paid cruise. Well worth the time.

A Great Way to See the Harbor. We took the Manly Ferry over to Manly Beach. It leaves from Circular Quay approximately every 30 minutes. The round trip fare is $16.00 and is a wonderful way to venture out of Sydney.It took about 30 minutes to dock at Manly and about another 10 minutes to walk to the beach. The views of the harbor are great and if the weather if good be sure to sit outside.
Beautiful day out. Impromptu trip to Manly on the ferry. service was good and the trip was efficient, whilst the ferry was clean.

Nice view . Easy to find ,accessible and regular timetable make catching Manly ferry a breeze into central downtown Sydney Plus a great view of harbour bridge and classic Opera house view from on the water . Probably best to avoid main commuter traffic times if you want a seat as fill up pretty full Bonus on Manly side great little Thai restaurant worth a visit for a quick tasty meal
Cheap and rewarding!. Best way to see Sydney harbor. Wind jacket helpful. Manly is best beach for watching surfers. Definitely would repeat.

10 miles from Sydney, a million miles from care. This must be one of the best ways to commute to work anywhere in the world, particularly when the sun is shining, the is not a lot of wind and the swell is small. The gentle rock and roll of the ferry is relaxing and enjoyable as the sights of Sydney roll passed.

Why pay for a tourist sightseeing cruise.. The Manly Ferry basically covers the length of the harbour. Grab a guide book and cruise the ferry. So much cheaper and you can get off at each end and explore. And remember just $2.50 all day on Sundays.
Take the slow one...not the high speed ferry!. Great opportunity to see Sydney from the water. A differing perspective for the camara. Don't forget your opal card, paper tickets not used anymore.
Nice transportation to a must see spot. The ferry was reliable, fairly inexpensive, and less than 30 minutes. The ferry isn't the cleanest, but it gets you to where you need to go.

Australian Travellers. A half hour trip from Circular Quay on one of the Sydney Harbour ferries will bring you to Manly, passing the Opera House and Harbour Bridge as well as having a great view of the city. There is no need to book this trip but it is popular so arriving in good time is recommended. Purchasing an Opal transport card (kiosk at the Quay) with sufficient funds on it to cover the return trip is the most efficient way to travel and can be used for other public transport in Sydney. Arrival in Manly has easy access to the beaches, town area, shops and eateries. A ferry trip to this part of Sydney makes for a relaxing day out.

Iconic Journey. This is a must do Iconic Journey in Sydney. If you get an Opal card free at the newsagent and put $15 on it that will cover your return ferry trip and all other travel you do on the day will be free. There are a lot of good places to eat in Manly so ideally make a day of it. Get the ferry during the day, have dinner there or maybe walk up to the amazing view point at North head and come back at night that way you get to seethe harbour day and night.

A trip out of the harbour. The manly ferry was busy on the day we used it but managed to get a good viewpoint,to see the sights of Sydney harbour on our way to manly .the weather was good so bright skys and calm weather.we had an intergrated ticket which also included the bus from coogee beach.

Off to Manly via the Sydney Harbour, it's almost a bargain cruise!. This is a must if planning to take a ferry from Circular Quay to explore, you gotta do the Manly Ferry plus you gotta do Manly.The Manly ferry gets extremely busy but being one of the largest on this particular route room is rarely a major issues. It usually takes around 35 minutes and is the perfect way to enjoy the harbour, treat it like a cruise without the price tag.Small kiosk on board that sells snacks (hot and cold), drinks, tea & coffee.Don't forget to pick up your free Opal Card as this is the only way you can travel on these ferries now.Trip Advisor's South Melbourne's #1 Reviewer

Childhood memories. As a young child what a great treat it was on a perfect sunny day to travel to Manly for fish and chips. 40 years later and still a simple pleasure that is hard to beat anywhere in the world
Great time taking the slow very to Manly Beach. This was a super way to see the harbor and travel to Manly Beach. The walk through the small town was nice and the beach there is beautiful.
Great way to see the city. Great way to see the city, make sure you line up early so you can get a spot outside. It can sometimes be very busy coming back also keep that in mind.
Iconic. Always enjoyable. Good way to see the harbour. We stayed in Manly, just a 30 min crossing, always a good way to start and end the day. $7 one way with an Opal card.

Very cheap way to see the sunset over the Harbour bridge. The public ferry to Manly from Circular Quay is a pleasant 30 minute trip to see the relaxed seaside resort of Manly. However come back on the ferry about 15-20 minutes before sunset and sit outside and see the sun setting over the city skyline

fantastic. get the $7.50c government green ferry, not the expensive private ferry, buy an OPAL card at any 7-11 store or others showing opal sign, $15 bucks for a return ferry and you see the bridge and opera house up close, great time.

Sailing Away. Did this as a must and the best way to get to Manly. The ferries were regular and fast taking around 25 minutes. Plenty of seating inside and out if the weather was good. Great views of the city skyline and harbour looking back to parks, city, naval base etc. Also had a small shop on board selling coffee, tea, cold drinks and snack food. The best way to travel is with an Opal pass that allows you to use all public transport with a spend of $15 max for the day, so there and back you can then travel on trains and buses for the rest of the day for free. Only hassle was buying the cards as you could only pay by Eftpos or credit card unless you went to ashore you could then pay cash.
Good value. And a beautiful ride. We went to Manly beach for a wander and lunch. Highly recommended. Not too crowded, there is always another ferry just behind.

Great way to see the harbour sights. Great way to spend an afternoon, ferry took about 20 mins from Sydney Circular Quay, good views of the Bridge and Opera House from inside - even better sitting outside (but it was raining when we went!!) Lots of lovely shops and cafes in Manly to wander round before making the return journey

An alternative of cruising the harbour. Once you stepped onto the ferry boat, you then enjoyed the Sydney Bridge, Opera House, and the beautiful skyline of Sydney. It surely is a pleasant short ride to commute between Manly and Circular Quay. Sitting on the sundeck at the front, you'll meet different tourist from various countries and it is so lively. I love to ride on it every year I visited Sydney, not to mention visiting restaurants close to Manly Pier.

A day trip to Manly. First thing you need is an opal card- Ezy Mart, newsagents. You can't get a ticket like you used to. Once you have the opal card its so easy and you can use on trains buses, even to the airport. topping up money is easy. the ferry service runs on time and has a regular service. Great views from both sides- if you want to be up the front and outside line up early, especially on a Saturday when the sun is shining.

I just love this ferry. Quick and easy. Every time I go to Sydney and visit manly I get the ferry never take the car.It is quick and easy and drops you off at a perfect location to walk manly.price is reasonable and fair.I have not yet encountered any rough trips.use it again absolutely.

A wonderful ferry ride!. A half hour ride to Manly. A great way to take in the scenery of the Sydney Harbour, the bridge and the opera house. When you get to Manly you must disembark and if you wish you may board for your return trip.

Excellent service.. We love the Sydney ferry service. Get yourself an Opal card online and preload the amount. The Manly trip is great, lots to see and do from the Wharf, Mall, Beaches, walks and restaurants. Recommend the walk around to Shelley Beach.
What a view! . From the ferry you can see the most amazing view of Sidney Harbour. A very pleasant sail that offers the possibility of taking beautiful pics!
Nostalgic boat ride. Nice experience... I value the fast ferry which I would recommend if you are in a rush to get to Manly... Cheap and as it describes... Fast and effective

Nice trip but often long lines. The trip to Many (and back) is very pleasant, weather permitting, but be prepared for long lines during weekends or peak hours. Especially on the Circular Quay to Manly ride, there is less waiting space, so on a hot day it can be quite unlpeasant.

Spectacular night time views. We took the ferry in the evening (around 7 PM). The views of the Harbor bridge and Opera house were spectacular! Did not spend much time in Manly however. On the way back, had birds flying next to us on the boat. Very nice!
Way to see Sydney.. This is a great way to see Sydney and you get Manly at the end with dozens of restaurants and lots of great walks.

Ferry ride into Sydney Harbor. Took the Manly ferry today into Sydney to spend the night just off Circular Quay. It was not a great day for the ferry as the southeast winds were pretty stiff and it was a bumpy ride from Manly based the Heads. As they slowed nearing Sydney, the ride smoothed out. We had some spray early on and many people went inside though I stayed out and got a little wet. When we approached Sydney Harbour and some terrific views, people came out and blocked many of the views for pictures and selfies. This was a little frustrating since none of them were willing to deal with a little spray early in the voyage.At under $9 AUS, this is a worthwhile trip. Take the slower ferry which offers longer views and go to the upper deck.
Ferry ride . Nice view. About a 30 minute ride. Lots of good food spots when you get to manly as well. We went for a lunch trip.
Always a breeze to get the ferry!. Fabulous view of Sydney's Harbour as you travel over to Manly. Seating inside or out depending on the time of year and weather.Friendly staff and always on time.

Bargain views of the Bridge and Opera House. The Opal cards cap your daily spend at $15 and as the Manly ferry charges only slightly more than that, essentially the rest of your travel for the day is free!We took the ferry at 1730 and got phenomenal views of the Bridge and Opera House at Sunset. Then came straight back, and saw everything beautifully lit up.Breathtaking, romantic and impressive. This was one of the best (and most cost-effective) things we did in Sydney. If I had to recommend one thing to do, it would be this.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. No need to take a tour of Sydney Harbour. Just take the Manly ferry for a fraction of the cost. In 30 mins you get to see the harbour, then you can have a nice lunch in Manly.

Nice view of Opera House from Sea Side. I took this ferry for manly beach. This ferry provides great views of Opera House, Harbour bridge, botanical garden, and rocky walls separating the bay from high sea. Nice experience. Enjoyed full...

Cheapest and best way to see the harbour. Catch the ferry, see all the sights in 30 mins, get off and see one of the best beaches around, grab a few drinks and a feed, see the sights on the ferry on the way back at night. It's a win win really.
Good way to see Sydney Harbour. Nice 30 minute trip. Good way to see the harbour. Nice & relaxing. Manley nice spot to visit. Nice coffe shops. Recommended visit.

Travel on Sunday. The ferries to Manly Bay are much less expensive on Sunday (although are a bit more crowded.) Sit on the right side of the ferry on the outbound ferry for better views of the Opera House, etc.

A great trip. I always enjoy the ferry ride to Manly. Especially when the see is not rough. It is a great trip from Circular Quay and allows you time to walk around Manly and their beach before returning to the city. It does have food available and toilets on board.

" A most pleasant experience indeed ! ". My wife and I travelled to and from Manly by Ferry and it was a most pleasant experience indeed. The views were outstanding, the seats were comfortable and the exterior views were lovely.
Trip to Manly. My mother, sister and I caught the ferry in both directions. Bang on time both trips. Extremely clean and safe.

Best seat on the harbour. The ferry trip from Circular Quay to Manly is a great way to see Sydney harbour. 30 minutes to view Sydney's most famous harbour-side attractions.
I enjoy the outside seats to get a real feel for the harbour and the occasional sea spray.
Great way to see Sydney harbour without stretching the budget.

Take the Hop-On Hop-Off option!. Our family of 3 kids and 2 adults chose the HOHO option and did not regret it. The ferry has a circuitous route which covered highlights like the Taronga Zoo, the spooky Quarantine Point, Manly Beach and Darling Harbour. The ferrymen were, as a whole, jolly fellows who delivered catchy stories and described the background of the locations well enough to be remembered!
Nice ride!!!. Enjoy it very much. You need an opal card to get around. Te scene leaving and arriving the Sydney hardboard is simply amazing. A must do.

Beautiful visit . You can take manly ferry from wharf 3 at Circular Quay. One way tickets are about $7. The ride to manly has breathtaking views and once there you can visit the beach and take a short hike with views to the ocean. Is a short trip you shouldn't miss.

Just go. Yes, you get to Manly only by this Ferry which is great - different way of travelling, you can see Sydney from a different point and also all the little towns and villages around.
You can use your Opal card on them and they are all well organised and professional.
snacks and coffees available on board.

Travel like a local. Many Sydneysiders commute each day to the city on one of the many ferries that criss cross the harbour. The Manly Ferry is one of the longest trips and most scenic. You will get all the views that you would have on a commercial tourist boat but minus the expense - between $6.00 - 8.00 one way depending on time of day and if using your Opal card (cheaper option). Manly has lots of things to see and do plus some great eating on any budget.

Be Aware. Many operators offer a trip to Manly, different prices schedule. If you want to get to Manly to explore like we did, best bet is Manly Fast Ferry from circular key. Hired bikes on Manly had a great time touring around, awesome ocean cliff views. Traffic not tourist friendly so keep left.
Great ride. 30 Minutes to Manly on a unique way to travel staff were very good don't miss it. A really relaxed way to travel.

Great trip out for virtually nothing. Buy the opal card and get on the Manly ferry, which will take you all along the Harbour to Manly for virtually nothing. During the trip you have the best view on the Opera House and Sydney's outskirts.
Really nice views. Was a very nice ride and had some really cool views. Was a great place to get away for lunch and was very easy to do.

Great way to see Sydney. Fast easy reasonably priced a good way to see parts of Sydney. Upon arrival at Manly Wharf your met by a clear clean small beach area. To the right of the wharf once you exit is a great bar restaurant where you can watch the world go by.

Whenever I'm in town-gem!. Even when I lived in Sysney, catching the manly ferry, laying back and enjoying the chug-chug of the engines as the world passes you by is special. Certainly much easier to get to and more scenic than Bondi. Now having the Gernan Alehouse at Manly Warf, there is no better place in Sydney to watch a sunset!Tip-opposite the heads, look to the left and find the concrete Pillboxes in the National Park (built for a possible invasion by the Japanese in WWII)!

Best ferry. Of the 5-6 ferries that you can get from circular quay... This one is the best... It's this Ferri that gives you the best view is both the opera house and harbour bridge.... It's a lil shorter 35 mins I guess compared to Parramatta Ferri which is good 1 hour plus .... On the return you can actually capture opera House and harbour bridge in one shot
Good views of Sydney. Good leisurely trip to Manly which provides an excellent way to see Sydney and the headland entrance to Sydney harbour
These harbour views you should not miss!. Take the ferry back from Manly towards the city right before sunset and be garanteed to have the best photo of your Sydney stay.

Slow boat to Manly. No trip to Sydney should be without a trip to Manly on the lovely old Ferry. This is iconic and a relaxing outing . Have lunch at one of the lovely Cafes on the beach . A delight !
Easy worthwhile trip. This trip only takes about 20 minutes each way and you get good views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Lovely beach at Manly.

Fast, easy & fun. This is such a great way to see the Harbor bridge & Opera house coming from circular Quay to Manly. You can have the option to sit outside or inside. Being outside provided some nice photo opportunities and in the summer is nice and cool.
Been several times and each time has been clean & a fun journey
Enjoy a sunny day. Give yourself a relaxing few hours on a sunny , calm day , because the crossing can be rough . Exelent photo oppertunaties

Still running like clockwork!. I last travelled on these ferries 22 years ago and the same ones are still chugging to and fro! They may be dated but it's still a great ride across to Manly from Sydney's Circular Quay. The trip takes 30 mins exactly and you get a close up of all the harbour sights. Manly is a charming seaside town with waterfront restaurants and coffee shops. There are some wilder walks on N head for the more energetic.
Good fun.. Catching the manly ferry to manly across the harbour was good fun ,seeing the sights of Sydney as we travelled and the exit to the Pacific Ocean.

Manly Ferry, Sydney, AU. Manly Ferry, Sydney, AU is a great way to get from downtown Sydney or the Harbour over to Manly Beach and back again. It's an enjoyable ride and you have great views of the Harbour Bridge, Sydney Opera House and do much more.
famous Manly Ferry is a "must do". I went on a ferry at night and the title Manly Wharf was blue.Nice area to stroll around and have a drink

What a view. If your a visitor to Sydney there is no better way to see the city than to hop on a ferry from Circular quay to Manly. On a sunny day or at night you get to see the opera house in its full glory, the harbour bridge, all of the foreshore areas in Sydney's eastern suburbs as well as north and south head. It's a relaxing way to travel and when you arrive at manly you can wander through the coral to manly beach and do the walk around to Shelley beach . Just glorious.
The WAY. This is the way to get around in Sydney. Really cool too that the ferry hits ocean water half way to Manly. Makes for a neat experience. Moderately priced as well.

Awesome views!. We took a quick trip to Manly beach from the opera house main terminal. Wow the views were amazing and the air had the hint of salt you dreamed you would smell. 30 minute trip pier to pier. Great service and polite staff.

Great way to experience Sydney Harbour. The Manly Ferry trip is a great way to experience Circulay Quay area the Harbour and Manly. Leave plenty of time and make a day of it. The Opera House is a short walk from Circular Quay in one direction and The Rocks cafes old buildings and quaint shops in the other direction. The Manly ferry is an inexpensive way to see and experience Sydney Harbour. Manly is a great place to visit with cafes, shops, the aquarium and the surf beach. The

Cheap harbour cruise. For those wanting a different perspective on the iconic waterfront including its Opera House, then the Manly Ferry is a cheaper option than the pleasure craft offering harbour tours at a cost. The ferry also provides a great way to see the Sydney Bay Area as it makes its thirty minutes crossing to Manly.The off-peak service interval is half hourly and ferries leave from Wharf No 3 from Circular Quay. Seating is both indoor and outdoor and refreshments can be purchased.

Sydney harbour by ferry. Having walked from The Spit to Manly- a fabulous walk with superb views of the harbour,there is no better way of getting back to the city than by Manly ferry.Sydney Harbour is a wonder and to be on it in a ferry is iconic.The ride from Manly to the city takes approximately 25 minutes and really showcases all the harbour has to offer.I would recommend it to any visitor to Sydney.The ferry runs on time ,you can sit in or outside and the staff are really friendly and helpful.

Sunday is only $2.50. I got in the Ferry on Sunday. And my friend from Sydney told me that Opal ( Sydney transport card) cost only $2.50. What!!!! That's way so many people in the ferry to enjoy the sunny Sunday with families.

A Must for visitors. This is one of the most enjoyable ways to experience Sydney Harbour and its second best known beach (after Bondi). The views passing the Opera House, Fort Denison, Kirribilli House and so much more, with the mighty effect of heading straight towards the beautiful Harbour Bridge 'are to die for'. i never cease to appreciate the experience, and when time permits, a meal or snack back at City Express at Circular Quay, watching the ferries come and go, is a delightful end to the outing.
Very busy on the weekends. The queuing was difficult. People pushed and shoved to get the best seats. Seats were worn and uncomfortable. Not as enjoyable as our last visit to Manly.

Inexpensive way to enjoy Sydney Harbour. Nothing nicer than being out and about on Sydney Harbour on a lovely fine day. If you are on a budget a trip from Circular Quay to Manly on the ferry is a must and a graat way to expeirencce the iconic Sydney Harbour.

A truly wonderful Sydney experience. There isn't much not to like about a ride on the Manly ferry. The boats themselves are a bit tired and old but who is looking at the floor and seats when our beautiful Harbour is on display? Such a pleasant journey even with the rolling sea as we passed the Heads.A must for locals and vistors alike.

LOVED it !. The last time we had visited Sydney was in the summer of 2007, and Manly and Shelly Beach were 2 of our favorite spots. It was too cold to swim this time, but the ferry ride over is a wonderful time on the water, and the walk along the beach lined with Norfolk Island pines is so beautiful. Found quite a bit of beach glass around Shelly Beach, which is always exciting.
see sydney opera house from different angle. it is relatively short ferry. not expensive. It offers different view of the opera house and bridge. It has enough seats inside and outside.

On time. Efficient Service with great views of Sydney Harbour Bridge and The Opera House. Travelled this route five or six times in a two day visit. Always accurate, always on time. Staff are a bit 'automaton' but that might make it simpler. Just don't bother asking anyone to 'hold the barrier' as they won't. It runs on a schedule and there is zero tolerance if you are even 10 seconds late at the gate. You will just have to wait an extra 30 minutes!

Well organised. Just because you get through the barrier doesn't mean you will get onto the ferry. Gates are closed promptly 2 mins before departure. No waiting for anyone at all. As long as you know this it isn't stressful. The times are not regular so check if you are in a hurry. We didn't try the fast ferry. The Manly ferry worked well for us. The card system is super too.
Take the Ferry. The ferry ride takes a short time. You can visit the beaches and go for a lovely walk. While on the ferry you will enjoy great views of the Sydney Harbor. Enjoy!!!

Delightful Views. These ferries are the biggest in the Sydney Ferry fleet. They are "reversable" in tthat there are pilot houses on both ends of the boat so very efficient. Also double deck loading. Takes about 30 minutes so you can do a round trip usually in about an hour for about $3
Great way to see Sydney from the water!. Was an excellent way to have some nice pictures of the Sydney Opera House from the water. A nice trip to Manly and back on the slow ferry.

Great day or noght. The view of Sydney from the water must be experienced. The trip to Manly gives city views, panorama of the harbour and a glimpse of Harbourside real estate. Take a walk along the promenade or beach before returning at dusk to see the Opera House and Harbour Bridge come to their nighttime shimmer.

Amazing views. For a few dollars you can travel to Manly by ferry. We used Opal card, which is terrific for all public transport. Trip is about 30 minutes and the views are nothing short of sensational. Locals probably take it for granted! Large ferries, and not too busy (but we did not travel at peak times). Manly is a lovely spot to visit, highly recommended.

As good as Finding Nemo's whale. Manly Ferry is like the whale that transported Dory and Marlin to Sydney. It gets you to Sydney efficiently.Service is every 20 minutes or so. If you missed one, grab a coffee and a muffin from the many cafes at Manly Wharf or the Circular Quay and before you know it another ferry is arriving.Seats are plenty. You can seat on the front or aft side of the upper deck for best views. Toilets, diaper changing facility and cafe available. It costs AUD 7.18 one way. You only tap the Opal Card at origin. No tapping off required at destination.
Fun. On a warm sunny day it is fabulous and invigorating. The views are wonderful from the ferry and harbour is spectacular. I must for all tourists.

The way to see the Harbour Bay is by Ferry!. The Ferry ride was a great way to get from one point to another with a great view of the Barbour. Got some great pictures of the sunset and they even stopped in the water for us so we can get great angles of the sunset. The fare was cheap and they do get packed, but they have several pick ups through out the day and night. The boat holds about 100 to 200 people, with upstairs, downstairs and along rails outside. When we went it was packed in the night time. You can see all the sites and the lights was beautiful. Sights to see!

A must do in Sydney!. Enjoyable ferry trip to Sydney, a must do. Very clean and tidy. You get to see many attractions along the way such as: Harbour bridge, opera house etc Toilet facilities and shop on board.

Interesting. This is a nice peaceful trip, you see a lot of the famous Sydney Harbour, it has other boats around in the water to observe. Trip takes about 20 minuets, you can enjoy a cup of coffee, and cake too. then arrive in Manly to a lot more tourist attractions. There is also a fast ferry, if in a hurry take that. If you are adventurous,(I like it being an old seafarer) then take this trip in stormy weather, although they stop the service if the weather is too bad.

Don't miss. The ferry ride to Manly takes in some of the best harbour views for a very inexpensive cost. Sometimes going through the heads can be a bit choppy but well worth it. Manly at one end and Circular Quay at the other, both good spots for sightseeing The trip is about half an hour.

Boat trip. A really great 30 minutes boat trip for City center Sydney to calm and nice Manly. Visit the Manly beach, have a lunch a just see the people enjoying it. The boat trip back to Sydney with the views is really worthwhile the trip.Do it:-)
Manly Ferry. Wonderful trip on the ferry - the harbour is beautiful . Manly has a great beach and plenty of eating places.

One Stop, It Takes Us to Manly!. Only one stop, you can reach Manly. Handy and quick. One the way, you would have a close look at the Sydney Opera House. Also a great spot to take pictures of both the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge, especially when you come back from Manly at Sunset time.
Good ferry ride. We took the NSW ferry to Manly and enjoyed he ride. Pleasant ride and always on time. I would recommend this ferry for any quick rides from circular quay.

Go late afternoon for the sunset. This will be the best tourist dollars you'll spend in Sydney. This is public transportation, so the cost is ridiculously low for what you'll see on your trip to Manly. It can get crowded with tourists who have figured this out, so be prepared for a little jostling. The best part is the return from Manly to Sydney as you approach and sail past the Opera house. Keep your camera ready so you can snap a shot when the ate afternoon sun covers the Opera in a golden glow.
Relaxing harbour transport. Manly is well worth a visit when in Sydney and what better way than to take the Manly ferry. Inexpensive and enjoys a good view of harbour during trip
man lee and manly. when you get off the ferry, turn left to the art gallery - its worth the short walk' the exhibits are confonting.....

An Australian Icon and a must to include on a visit to Sydney. We always treat the Manly Ferry as compulsory on our "to do" list when visiting Sydney. A wonderful trip though the Harbour across the heads and into Manly.
A cheap way to see the harbour and enjoy the magnificent views of the "bridge" on you return journey.

Great trip over to manly . We took the ferry to manly and it was a very picturesque and scenic trip. We could have taken the fast ferry for 10 $ more each but this was the longer and very scenic way of going. Each single ticket was about $8 each per way and I recommend you sit up front, especially when leaving the circular quay as you will get amazing pictures of the bridge and Sydney Opera house as well as the city skyline.
Australian vacation. Easy access to a beautiful beach town.What a lovely boat ride.You can sit outside or inside.Wheel chair accessible.Loved it.
Peaceful cruise to Manly. Comfortable sitting on front of Manly Ferry sailing on the Sydney Harbour to Manly.Not rushed the journey was comfortable,peaceful and scenic brilliance

Great harbour views at sunset. The return ticket to Manly may be a little steep compared with the rest of the city's relatively affordable public transportation system, but opal card owners (which you should be even if only a tourist) will be relieved to know that the system caps at $15 - meaning that taking this ferry for one return trip renders the rest of your daily transport free.Personally, I would say that the best time to take the trip is just as the sun is beginning to set. As it leaves the harbour you will be treated to lovely views of the sun descending behind the bridge, and the 35-40 minute trip ensures that you arrive in Manly with a little bit of light left to take a stroll along the Pacific waterfront with.Manly is nice in itself, with a decent selection of chain shops as well as independent ones offering better deals than you'll find in the city centre - particularly on alcohol. The advantage of a sunset ride is that one will arrive at the waterfront just in time for happy hour; with a discount glass of wine in one of the many restaurants one can see the Pacific gradually get darker and darker before catching the ferry back after some food.At night, the views are even more priceless; particularly when seeing the Sydney Operahouse, Harbour Bridge, and city centre all lit up. The outer deck gets a bit cold with the spray after dark in winter, but the inside is of a normal temperature if you want to briefly thaw. Regardless, I really recommend taking the trip over for an evening; it is well worth it for the view alone, never mind the lovely town of Manly itself.
Use of Opal card super easy. Travelling over to Manly using the Opal card was easy and appropriate. $2.50 on a sunday is a bargain.

Enjoyable trip to Manley. Lovely trip, friendly staff, initially easy to purchase tickets. Regular trips over and back making it a great day out. The boat has facilities on board and the Quay was well equipped with bars, cafes and restaurants.

A 25 minute ride from Circular Quay to Manly. The ride costs very little and you will have great photo ops of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Manly is worth a visit year round for walking and beaches.

Best way to see the harbour. Don't take the fast ferry to Manly, take the traditional ferry and savour the sites of Sydney Harbour. You get a very different perspective of The Bridge and the Opera House as well as the city skyline.Manly provides great places to eat or if you wish just sit in the pub and watch the crowds wander by.If you travel on this ferry at night, have a look at the seagulls fishing in the Ferries wake, they use the Ferries lights to grab the small fish that are on the surface. This keeps the kids entertained for the whole journey.You can use the OPAL card for this trip and you only pay for one leg as the fare meets the maximum daily fare restriction.

Lovely trip with close view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Been many times on this ferry ride, especially on Sundays (cost -effective). Its a lovely ride on beautiful ferry, probably for less than 30 mins. You get to see Opera House and Harbour Bridge very closely against the blue waters. Manly again is a beautiful beach. You can enjoy the beach, take a swim or just stroll along the beach and the nearby market. Very relaxing and enjoyable at the same time.

Fast and convenient . A scenic 23 minute ferry to manly beach. Once you arrive it was another 15 minute walk to a wonderful beach. It is safe and easy to navigate for any tourists. Plenty of things to see along the way. I think it cost less,the $20'AUS round trip. Strongly recommend this excursion.

Beautiful views!. The ferry was very clean and spacious. There was seating located all around the ferry and it was very wheelchair friendly. The free WiFi was very fast and helped me and my family plan our day out in Manly. The ferries also came regularly which meant small waiting times and the travel time from Manly to Sydney was around 30 minutes.If you are trying to take pictures of Sydney/Sydney Opera House try and get a seat on the outside of the ferry. The sky turns a lovely colour around 5/6pm which led to some incredible pictures. You will not be bored since there is lots to see.

Cheapest way to crusie the harbour. The trip from Circular Quay to Manly by ferry is a cheap way to see the harbour. And once you arrive at your destination, there are great places to eat, drink and be merry. Recommended.

Fast, Convenient, Free Wifi. Went on a Sunday, which Sydney transport caps your expense at $2.50 (Opal card). The ferries are clean and large. Despite seeing a big crowd waiting to board the ferry, the ferry was very spacious and had no problem finding a space.The Manly ferries (on Sunday) run every 30 minutes, and it take about 30 minutes to reach your destination.Would recommend queuing early in line to get an outdoor seat in front of the ferry. There are about 7 benches in the front, which will give you excellent view of the harbor, especially when returning from Manly (i.e. Opera House, Skyline, Harbour Bridge).The ferries offer free wifi (need to sign on), which was a nice bonus.

Fun way to travel to Manly . Great way to get a different view of the Sydney opera house - ferry goes right past. Can use your Opal card for travel on this ferry, trains and buses so this makes it a cheap way to travel

Lots to see. Great trip over to Manly. Gorgeous views and plenty of room. Fun way to see Sydney Harbour. The line onto the ferry was pretty manic and not policed, but fine. Would def recommend this trip to others.

Fun trip. We took the Manly Ferry to Taronga Zoo. The staff was informative and helpful. The views of the Harbour were great! Definitely got terrific photos of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge in the background

Like a mini cruise. Took the ferry to Manly for the day, it was like a mini cruise with fantastic views passing by the Harbour Bridge and Opera house. Manly is a lovely town and the beach is superb, would definitely return. Got the ferry back to the city at dusk and witnessed the city lights, amazing.

As good as tourist cruises. See everything you want to with Manly ferry -- Bridge, Opera house, the Harbour and waterfront area. Can sit inside or out on the deck for better views, but it is cold and windy outside. The ferry station on the Manly side had cafe, chocolate shop, gelato (very yummy). So it's easy to wait there for return ferry

Ferry ride to Manly. Great for photo ops for the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Best bet is to buy the Opal card. There is also a high speed ferry but very pricey. I went on a Sunday and the ferry was packed.
Woo hoo. Loved doing the manly ferry takes around 35 minutes even on my last day I jumped on the ferry for 1 more trip

Ferry views. This was probably the best way to see Sydney and surrounds. See the different bridges and homes, the Opera House and Harbor Bridge, the cliffs at Watson Bay and enjoyed Manly Beach and shopping. Have a true decadent chocolate experience at Max Brenner.You don't pay more than $15 per day and you can go anywhere around Sydney as many times as you like. Lovely easy go days.

Half an hour of amazing scenery . A trip I used to do daily on my journey to work, but now as a tourist back in Sydney from the UK, I can't believe how lucky I was to have this as my commute. A must do for everyone, even the bad sailors. Sit outside on a sunny day and see the little bays and the iconic sites of Sydney Harbour. Being a Sydney map with you. Sit on the back of the boat on the way to Manly and the Bridge and Opera House are photo ready. It's a half hour trip, and the ferries come about every half hour I think. There is also a fast ferry, but this is worth the extra time spent.

Unique way to get around Sydney. Best kept secret in Sydney! I use the ferries to get around Sydney instead of busses. It's fantastic - they drift past th e Opera House and go under the big bridge - so scenic and cost effective. They are always clean and on time! Where else in the world can you say you "ferried" around town! Don't miss it!
Relaxing short ride to Manly. We visited Manly by riding in one of the ferries, and we had fun! It was clean, and staff are friendly and courteous!

Meh. Everyone raves about Manly but seriously I have still to see why. It's a seaside town like any other boring seaside town. There's a great strap bushwalk & yes the views of Sydney harbour are great but you'd b far better off taking the Watson's cove ferry which is far prettier. Don't listen to the hype leave this one out!!

A cheap harbour tour. There are a lot of over priced harbour tours. A cheaper way to do it is to just take a few ferry rides. One to manly and maybe on to some of the inner harbour stops. Cheap enough that you can do it in the day and at night.
Mrs O . We used the ferry during our visit to Sydney was a really good service, got to see the Bridge and Opera House, we used the opus card we purchased which was a really good idea.

Value for money on taking a closeup view of Sydney harbour. The ferry journey takes 45 minutes to complete one way. The facilities onboard are basic but the harbour view from the water is worth so much more! The first 15min leaving Circular Quay is the highlight for me. So be ready with your photo shots! The other compatible habour ferry trips are Parramatta River (on the opposite side of the Manly ferry for the Harbour Bridge) and Watsons Bay (for spectacular Harbourside mansions) although they take significantly longer time to complete as there are many stops along the way. Worth it if you have spare time.

Best way to see the harbour. Manly ferry is the cheapest and best way to see the harbour - you can use your public transport travel cards ("opal" cards) and the fare is roughly $7 or so. Journey time is half hr and it takes you out past the iconic harbour bridge and opera house, views of lunar park, taronga zoo, Fort Dennison, along with many other parts of the harbour and the opening to the ocean. Manly is worth a visit as one of my favourite suburbs of Sydney with a great beach. Probably my favourite thing to do when I visit with plenty of photo opportunities on the journey.

Across the harbour mouth. One of the best ways of seeing the differing shoreline of Sydney and part of the western suburbs is via the Manly ferries. So many things to do when you get to Manly - stroll along the beach. No end of food and drink opportunities.

A cheap and fantastic way to see the harbour and Manly. You can either just stay on the ferry and travel to Manly and back to see the most beautiful harbour in the world or you may choose to stop over at Manly. There is always something to see on the journey from the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge, the Zoo, the million dollar houses, sailing, the heads and then the welcoming Manly Cover. Once in Manly there is plenty to see and do from the Aquarium to the beach, to the heads, to Shelly beach and up to Queenscliff. Have a beer and a steak at the Steyne Hotel and a surf in the ocean

FERRYING TO MANLY. The Ferry trip to Manly is an extremely pleasant outing, particularly on a fine day.Sometimes it can get a little rough going past the Heads. Views are spectacular. Once in Manly there is much to see and do, browsing in the shops, plenty of places to eat, walking along the beach..Having fish and chips on the boardwalk behind the beach is a nice option.Also a walk around to Shelley Beach is well worthwhile.

million dollar views for a few dollars. Traveling the ferries is a wonderful day out for the entire family. Not only do you go to world class beach town like Manly but you get the amazing Sydney Harbour cruise thrown in for only a few dollars. The old ferries are full of history and teh kids love running around and and checking out the decks. And they have toilets on board!!!

The cheapest way to see the Harbour. Take a trip on the Manly ferry for the cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour, you won't get a commentary but you will see all the sights along the way. When you get to manly it's just a walk of about 1km to manly beach and along the way there are many good restaurants and eating places.

What a fun way to get from the city to the beach. The Manly ferry is a fun way to get from Sydney city to Manly, with all it's attractions including the surf beach. On your trip you get to enjoy many of Sydney Harbour views, passing by the iconic Opera House, historic Kirribilli House, just to name a few. Well worth a return trip.

Relaxing and fun all at the same time. What a way to enjoy Sydney Harbour, A sunny day and an awesome ferryr ride to Many, Whilst ships are aging they still have all that is needed for this trip There was a kiosk open with snacks and drinks. The day i travelled the what is normally a little rough area as you cross the heads was calm.A definate must for both tourists and locals alike.
A great view. This is the best way to travel to and from Manly to Sydney. You get a top notch view and saves tons of travel time you would spend in a car.

Like the fast ferry but slower. The Manly Ferry is easily the best way to travel back and forth to Manly. Yes, the fast ferry has beer and is quicker but during peak hours, it's far too crowded. And honestly, what's the hurry? Why not spend an extra ten minutes in the morning on the beautiful Sydney Harbour? You can read a book or stare at your phone—your options are pretty much endless. I like sitting on the top deck and towards the front but it just comes down to taste. Some people like sitting on the lower deck while others sit outside. Probably best to try out a few different seats and work out what's best for you. You really can't go wrong because the worst seat on the Manly Ferry is still better than being stuck in traffic on Military Road. I'm comfortable with my Trip Advisor five green circle thingy rating but I'd like the Manly Ferry even more if they also sold beer.

Must do!. Even if you get off at Manly and come straight back, this trip is an absolute must! Fantastic views of the harbour and a nice little rollercoaster ride as you get close to Manly and you feel the effect of the rougher water from the Pacific, as it pushes through the Heads. The beach at Manly is very nice and there are plenty of eateries and pubs. Pop into St. Matthews church. It is worth a look.

Cheapest Sydney Harbour Cruise. Ok, so it doesn't go under the Sydney Harbour Bridge and it doesn't visit all the nooks and crannies, but it does take you past the Sydney Opera House and you do get close to North Head (you can even see the recent rock fall). Then there is Manly itself and lots of things to see and do with it's own character and charm and unspoilt views of the open sea. The ferry runs twice an hour and takes 30 minutes. You use your Opal card, there is no need to tap off and it takes your money on the tap on. With the $2.50 Sunday fare cap we actually did this for free!

Great scenic ride. Whilst this is an amazing scenic ride into Circular Quay, I found it annoying that the three ferry companies allegedly don't know when each other run and there's no obvious signage to sort it out. As a tourist this sort of info would've made a great trip even better. Sort it out guys....

Not to be missed . The ferry ride from Manly to Circular Quay is unmissable. I'm local and I love the ride and always encourage business visitors to take the trip. It's best after dark as the City opens up spectacularly.
Best way to get to manly. Such a pretty way to take to Manly. Whether you sit inside or out, it's a relaxing ride to see parts of the coast you wouldn't otherwise see.

Pleasantly surprised. We haven't been on a ferry for many years and found this trip quick, easy and very cheap - travelled on a Sunday. We went to meet friends for Sunday lunch and not having to drive or park made the whole day enjoyable. The ferry was clean and the staff very helpful.
top attraction. fantastic views over the harbour an entrance to the ocean ,superb views of the opera house and also the sydney harbour bridge ,arrival on circular quay,spectacular
Great Ferry ride.. I always enjoy a ferry ride over to Manly and back. It is one of those " Must Do " things when you visit Sydney.

great ferry service to Manly. We hopped on the Manly Ferry (only $2.50 for all day travel on Sundays) to take a ride over to Manly. Manly was a cute little beach town and we enjoyed watching the people frolic in the ocean. It was a wee bit too cold for these American's but we enjoyed our day nonetheless. The ferry ride back to Sydney was spectacular at sunset to view the beautiful Opera House and Harbor Bridge. Needless to say we were not the only tourist wanting to see the view so it was a bit crowed on the front of the ferry. Ferry was very clean and ran professionally.

Buy your ticket in advance if no OPAL card. The Manly ferry is a great way to get some beautiful on water photos of the opera house, Garden Island, harbour bridge and north shore of Sydney. Due to new transport rules though, I would recommend purchasing your single ticket (no returns now!) in advance if you don't have an OPAL card. There were many tourists who missed their intended ferry trip and had to wait for the next one (30 minutes later) because the line at the Manly Ferry Terminal was ridiculously long and many did not understand how to use the machines (don't go to the OPAL card top up machine only). Ferry Terminal staff no longer sell tickets over the counter but were assisting in tourists using the machines to buy their one-way tickets. Overall, once on board the ferry it was beautiful. Calm day. Perfect weather for winter. Mostly a lovely experience, despite the wait to purchase a one-way ticket at each wharf. Will buy an OPAL card next time I travel to Sydney for convenience sake.

What a way to see Sydney !. Manly Ferry - one of the first things to do in Sydney - if only to see the bridge, opera house and skyline by water and then go for a stroll along Manly beach. Bliss and low-cost....

Everyone in Sydney does this - it is awesome. The Manly ferry is a the cheapest, best boat ride on the harbour. With regular service cheap price and cool desitnations at both ends, it is favorite of locals and tourist a like.
This is a great ride. We really enjoyed our ride to Manly Beach. It got a little rocky, which was very fun. The Ferry was clean, and the ride was beautiful.
holiday. the trip on the ferries were very great dropped you where you wanted to go you can stay in side the ferry go on the deck

Harbour Cruise. This is a very good service to and from Manly Beach. We travelled both ways and the sights on the harbour are very good. It is a cheap way to have your Harbour Cruise while in Sydney. Lovely views of the Heads and also of the Opera House and Bridge.

Great way to see the harbour. The Manly ferry provides a stunning view of the Opera House, harbour and takes you to a festive beach with surfers, restaurants and small shops. Some of the best selection of aboriginal art and souvineers. A great way to spend a morning or afternoon. The ferry itself is a fun experience - sit inside or out.

TRIP TO MANLY BEACH. There are 2 options. One is the regular ferry which takes about 40 minutes and the fast cat which only takes 18 minutes. We chose the fast cat and were very happy we did. You see the same scenery but get to spend more time at Manly Beach. The return fast cat left late and the captain really opened it up at high speed which was exhilarating.It has a bar on board with just enough time to enjoy a beer.

Great Harbour tour. Get the ferry, cruise to Manly, chill and return at sunset for the best view of the city. This is great for photos of the bridge, opera house and bot. Use your Opal card and this is the easiest tourist trip in the city.

Lovely ride, glorious food, great island. Wonderful ferry ride. Manly Island has nice little quaint shops and wonderful restaurants. The ferry ride back provided us with a wonderful photo opportunity with the Opera House in the background.

Great views. The circular quay to manly ferry offers great views of Sydney harbour. The boat takes its time to make the journey. There is a fast boat, but that misses the point of making this journey.

Manly ferries. It's just too easy to get to Manly by clean, comfortable ferry. Clean facilities. There is the main boat and speed boats for a little more. It's a beautiful part of the whole Sydney experience.

Awesome way to get to and from the Harbour. What a fun way to travel from manly to the harbour! A bit rocky when I went on it but the trip is short enough that sea sickness doesn't appear to be an issue!
Efficient. Enjoyed the ride. Enjoyed the view even more! The ferry was clean. The wifi was strong. Prompt service.

Tourist friendly. A regular commute for some but a worthwhile trip across the harbour for the day tripper, whisking you from Circular Quay to Manly. Great on a fine day but can get a roll up in a storm.

Some Brief Fun and Sightseeing. There are two Ferry Services from Sydney City (Circular Quay) to Manly. One is the Government run Sydney Ferry and the other is a fast, private service - Manly Ferries. Sydney Ferries are large but slow, taking 40 minutes for the trip. The fast ferry takes 18 minutes. We love the slow pace of the Sydney Ferry, especially when we have the time to simply enjoy the ride. The views are beautiful, especially on a good day (on a rough day, I'd avoid the Ferry unless you're a "thrill-seeker" with a strong stomach or you don't have a choice)! We normally "make a day" of it and take our time having lunch or the many attractions of Manly. The Manly Ferry trip is one of our favourite Weekend activities.

Take to the Harbour . Love the Manly Ferry, it's a fantastic way to see the harbour and experience the spectacular views. A seat outside up the front of the boat gives the best views as you head back to Circular Quay.
great views. Travel half an hour from Circular Quay to Manly . From the ferry there are many nice views of the harbor and the bay of Sydney.

Exceptional. Manly Ferry operates on time and they've got this down to a science! Great way to stay in beautiful Manly and see Sydney. We chose to stay at the Quest Manly situated just across from the Wharf. Rather than stay in Sydney we preferred the Manly community and the ferry service enabled us to safely and efficiently sightsee in Sydney and the Taronga Zoo. What's great is the beautiful water views on the ferry ride. Relaxing!

Beautiful views on a sunny day. Amazing ferry ride to Manly. The views were great and a nice sunny day added to the pleasure. Took the ferry from circular quay and it took around 40 minutes to reach manly.

Looooove the Manly Ferry. A great ride in an iconic ferry with vistas of Sydney's best! With an Opal card, it is a good and inexpensive outing.The ferries run every 30 minutes and there is plenty to see and have both at Circular Quay and at the Manly depot whilst you wait.There is a little kiosk on board for those who have to have something...but I recommend you wait. The Manly ferry is a must for both tourists and residents alike.

Frequent and practical with good views as you travel. Trouble free access without any delays. Just look up the time of the next ferry posted up. I used my Go Card for all travel around Sydney including the ferries. A trip to Manly is a must on a visit to Sydney. I never miss it.
A must do!. We caught the ferry to Manly and were very impressed with the service and price, Manly is certainly worth a visit and the views on route are wonderful.
Beach trip.. Worth the price of the ferry trip just for the fantastic views. Takes half hour or so to cross from Sidney harbour to Manley and I highly recommend it as a must do trip.

Lovely Beach. The ferry is about $8 ish and its either buy a ticket on the dock (3) or tap in with Opal card. 30 min trip, excellent views of the dock, opera house, bridge etc as leaving. Manly has good shops and lots of different eateries on the main drag to the beach, but the jewel in the crown is the beach. Why everybody flocks to Bondi is a total head scratcher with Manly being so pristine and un-spoilt. One of the best walks is to Queenscliff (1 mile) and back, on the prom. Ferries run about every 30 mins through the day for your return.

Quick and Easy. Quick and Easy trip over to Manly. Manly may have been my favorite area of Sydney as it is quaint and beautiful! The $15 round trip journey is well worth it and recommended to anyone visiting Sydney.

The Manly Ferry is a must do!. The Manly Ferry is a perennial favourite which every visitor to the City needs to experience. It is even great during winter as in the case of our recent holiday visiting our son in Sydney. The Old Lady of the North shore still offers a vibrant ride and stunning views despite squalls of rain and bursts of wind. And then there is the reward at Manly lunch and dinner restaurants at the end of the journey to consider!

Scenic ride.
