If you want to visit a beautiful little town, and get amazing views of the harbour, and the Sydney opera house at the same time, I definitely recommend you jumping on this ferry from pier 3 down at circular quay! The ferry goes every 20-30mins, and takes 30mins to get to and from Manly. There are loads of indoor seats both upstairs and downstairs, and there are a few outdoor seats at the front of the ferry as well. Get there first to get the best views as everybody rushes there, and can only hold about 20 people comfortably. There is a shop onboard which of course is expensive, and several toilets too.

Great Trip. Travelled to Manly & back from Circular Quay as tourists to Sydney. Trip a pleasant one, offering a great perspective of Sydney from the harbour. Travelling on a Sunday & return trip was only $2.50 for each person, considered very good value. Plenty to see & do in Manly, a worthwhile trip for any visitor to Sydney.

Relax & Enjoy. What other great city in the world allows you to travel in such a relaxed manner. Just hop on the ferry at Circular Quay and enjoy the best views of Syney Harbour that you can get. In 30 minutes you will be at one of the best beaches in the world at Manly. With 3 ferries it is a convenient schedule and runs about every 1/2.hour at most times. The cost is good compared to other forms of transport. There is also a snack shop on board. The automated ticket booths are Ok, but they need to be able to deliver more than 2 tickets at a time.If you are pressed for time there is also a high speed ferry that takes just 20 minutes for about a buck more.Slow down a little - relax and take the Manly Ferry.

Classy way to travel. Don't get stuck in traffic, we took the fast ferry from Manly to Sydney harbour. Not to expensive, quick and regular service and views to die for. As you sweep around into the harbour, with the best view of the bridge and Opera House you really know you're somewhere special. Definitely recommended!Don't pay for a site seeing cruise, save your money this is just as good.
Great experience and easy to use. From central quay to Manly was wonderful, travelling through the harbour and the sights that tourists only usually see on the TV.

Worth taking.. This was recommended as the best way to see the opera house and bridge from the harbour. There is a choice of slow or fast ferry and the journey is a pleasant 15-20 mins. Manly is a nice suburb with its own town centre and lovely beach. Worth a visit if you have time.
Nostalgic and lovely. Worth the trip for sure. Manly was an awesome place. Ferry was a great way to see the harbour. The hours of operation are great too. Lovely Italian guy serving nice coffee.

Great ride to Manly!. In addition to taking you to Manly, this ferry allows you to have great views of the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour. The ferry is clean and the staff is friendly. It also sells some snacks, wine, beer, and sodas. We went in July and since it is winter in Australia, I suggest taking something to keep your head warm (Particularly if you are planning to take pictures outside on the deck).

A must do when in Sydney. Manly is fantastic, and it is a great ride on the ferry. Try to get up to the Q Station for a bit of history when in Manly. Dont go on a rough rainy day as going through the heads can be quite a challenge and rough.

A nice service if you plan to visit Manly Wharf. Costs about 8 Australia Dollars each way. These ferries are an enjoyable ride. You could use them to go across to Manly Wharf, a 30 minute ride each way. The Manly Ferry service is well organized and efficient. Clean ferries, professinoally run, provide a sense of comfort when you use them.

Easy transportation. This ferry ride is nice and easy and not too expensive. It drops you right in the heart of Sydney and runs frequently. The free wifi was a nice bonus, if a little patchy. It gives you some great opportunities for pictures too.

Circular quay to manly round trip. There are many options to see the sydney harbour bridge and opera house by ferry....but the most economic and popular is Manly Ferry which costs just $15 per person for a round trip between circular quay and manly beach which takes about 45 minutes....we have seen the sydney city standing by the river and it was great for photography (esp Harbour bridge, Opera house and the Circular Quay)....from August 1 2016 no paper ticket is available ...you have to use Opal card for purchasing ticket....

Great way to see the sights of Sydney from the harbour. Ease of access. Excellent timetable. We had a short stay in Sydney and the Opal card made our trip a very affordable way to travel the harbour to see all that was on offer.
Love it. . We always make sure to have a trip or two on the Manly ferry when we are in Sydney on holiday. Great way to see Sydney Harbour.

Perfect short trip.. We spent a lovely afternoon traveling to Manly......once their we spent time on the beach and in a fabulous little cafe.
Excellent way to see Sydney and get out on the harbour. Manly is a delighful place.

Sydney Harbour Icon. What a better way to see Sydney Harbour than the Manly ferry!!!Departing from Circular Key it is only takes about 30 minutes to reach Manly. Lots of sights and attractions to see on the way. The ferries are extremely well maintained and clean. It's an inexpensive trip especially if you use the Opal Card.Once at Manly there is lots to see including many restaurants. We donned at Hugo's on the wharf - seriously good!!It's a must do if visiting Sydney!!
Worth it!. We travelled on a week day and had a beautiful and hassle free trip. The cost is fair at $15, the seating is comfortable and the views are spectacular.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. Caught the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay, Wharf No. 3. You'll need an Opal Card which you can buy from the Ezy Mart on Wharf 2 and 5. Sunday's only cost $2.50 for travel on ferry, train or bus anywhere in Sydney. Great value compared to usual ferry cost. Takes about 30mins to Manly and there's a cafe with food and drinks available onboard. They also have charging stations for your phones & devices free of charge. Sit inside or outside. Lots of fun especially for visitors to Sydney. Highly recommended.
quick and easy trip. We had a day to burn in Sydney and we were coaxed into going to Manly and glad we did. Very nice shops and coastline hiking through the bush.

Gorgeous Australian beach. We chose to visit Manly instead of Bondi due to recommendations of others and we weren't disappointed. It was a gorgeous day and it was just as I thought an Australian beach would be with surfers included.We walked along the beach and soaked up each moment. It was spotless clean along the beachfront.
Great trip. Good way to experience being on Sydney Harbour. At Manly can see the harbour side and the ocean beach side. Fish & chips on the beach a good choice.
A nice way to spend an afternoon . MANLY IS lovely and easy to get to on this ferry. Just hop aboard and take a walk down the path to the beach. Take your camera because it is lovely.
Great!. Handy Ferry service to and from Manly. Clean spacious and good timetable. Can't remember the price but was reasonable and you get great views of sydney harbour as you enter.

Best way to Manly is by boat. The Manly Ferry is a great bargain. Midweek you can virtually have the ferry to yourself, and the ticket price is reasonable. Manly is a toffee sort of place but you will get a warm welcome from the retailers. The beach is also famous a a place for spotting attractive young women.
Excellent day trip to Manly.. Enjoy the ride, have your cameras ready, bring your bathing suit. Manly is full of shops and restaurants.

Convenient way to see Manly Beach. For a tourist, this is a very convenient way to go to Manly Beach. You can take the train to Circular Quay, get on the ferry then it docks right across the street from Manly Beach.It runs on a schedule and is punctual so better make sure you are there on time. It has multiple so its easy to plan your schedule. Also, you can pay using your OPAL card.Before riding the ferry, we got some fish and chips at the Circular Quay then ate on the ferry. The ferry is clean and goes on a good pace.
Very nice.. beautiful beaches and cool blue water. It was like you were on a different island...very peaceful and fresh air. Restaurants and people treated you nicely.
$2.50 return to Manly from Circular Quay on a Sunday. Excellent value for money, there's even an option to buy a hot drink on board on your journey over.Well worth it.
Nick60. The best way to get to Many beach which some say is better than Bondi beach. This ferry was about hourly.

What a way to go ..... Who likes going to work? But if you've got to go, there couldn't be a better way than on the Manly Ferry. And I don't say this lightly. Most Rock Stars don't get a better ride!A brisk walk from home to the Terminal and I'm off! Fast ferry, or otherwise, wind in your hair, sun on your back, bright crystal water, well, whatever the day throws at you, it can't start better than this! And coming home to beautiful, fun and lively Manly every evening, reprising the fabulous sights of the Sydney 'Coat Hanger' and the amazing Opera House, is just unreal. Every one should live here and do this.... If only for a week on vacation.
The way to see Sydney Harbour and Manly!. This ferry is always packed with people so try to take an early one. With bad weather this ferry becomes a rollercoaster on the waves.
Manly Ferry. Loved the trip to Manly on the Ferry, each time I have been there. It can be a bit rough at times going out through the heads, but that just adds to the experience.
Great trip. this is an amazing boat ride, it's very inexpensive and worth every penny. You get very good view of the opera house and the bridge. Once on Manly there is plenty to do.
Best way to see the Harbour. Simple pleasure, great views. The best cheap way to see the harbour. Makes going to work special every day.
Scenic trip. Really nice trip to and from manly. Make sure you sit on the side facing the opera house for some great views.

Great Trip. I have been going on the Manly ferry for over 70 years and still enjoy every moment.Wait until there is a good storm and then take the ferry..a roller coaster ride of great thrills ..not for the feint hearted but a lot of fun,wear a rain coat.
Long weekend. Ferries leave every half hour, best views of bridge and opera house. Use an Opal card, quick and easy to travel on public transport.

A classic. In other cities you may go "on a cruise" to see some of the sites. Here, you get on the Manly ferry and for a few dollars you have the whole Harbour, and much more, in your lap. It is absolutely amazing and fantastically great value. There are restaurants and cafes and all kinds of shops you may visit too. And the ferry ride is quite a great experience too.
Long trip but nice. The ferries are somehow old and if you don't jump firstly you miss sitting at the deck. Sitting inside is not recommended.

Great way to appreciate the harbour. I love a good ferry ride. It's great to sit outside if it's not too cold and feel the wind blow in my face. It's wonderful to look at the beauty of Sydney Harbour and be thankful that I live in such a fabulous city. Try matching your return journey with the sun set and be amazed at the beauty of creation.

Well worth a few hours. Taking the ferry across the harbour was easy and fu and you get amazing views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge.. Lots of eating places in Manly and the shops are geared for tourists. A number of people were swimming even though it was wknter ( nit me though). We even got to see a pod of dolphins near Manly.

A must trip while in Sydney.. The trip from Circular Quay to Manly is the best value and scenic tour you can do while visiting Sydney and the bonus is the destination Manly with a great beach and dozens of restaurants to enjoy. As a change and a opportunity to see a little more of Sydney take the Public bus from Manly Wharf back to the City which travels via the middle Harbour and the Spit Bridge and crosses the Sydney Harbour Bridge on the way to the center of the City
Manly ferry. Going to Sydney isn't complete without going to manly on a ferry, it's a great way to explore the harbour. Manly is a lovely place to have a stroll around, lots of restaurants to visit.
lovely Ferry. another lovely ferry ride out to Manly, this was the best way to visit our family and to see the Amazing Harbour.
Cheap way to see Sydney Harbour. Taking the Manly ferry across and back is an economical way to see the beautiful Sydney Harbour. Manly is also a good place to have lunch.

circular quay to manly, another great day out with the family, an enjoyable ferry ride along the harbor.. If you haven't done it yet its a must, i have always loved this ferry ride and once over at Manly there's lots to do.

Scenic view, and a lovely way to travel to manly :). Ferries are regular and reasonably priced, If you are planning on going to Manly beach, this would be the perfect mode of transport between the city and manly

A worthwhile (and manly) thing to do. If you're a visitor to Sydney, like we were, this is a very worthwhile trip.It's a bit like the Statton Island Ferry in New York (except it's not free) - you can see all the things you want to see, but not have to pay for an expensive tour on the harbour.You catch the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay in Sydney city, down towards the Sydney Opera House (but if you arrive at the Opera House - you've gone too far!).On the ferry, you'll get to travel on the magnificent Sydney Harbour, with views of the city, the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Sydney Opera House, Pinchgut Island (Fort Denison), the various bays, and out to the Heads.When you get off at the ferry terminal at Manly, follow the crowds towards the ocean. There's a pedestrian/shopping mall, the beach, cafes etc. Watch the surfers. You might even see a whale (as we did), while having coffee overlooking the beautiful sea.Manly is a great area to visit , and you'll have the advantage of going on the Harbour and seeing all the Sydney icons that you'll want to photograph from the water.Brilliant on a nice day. 5 stars.

Great and inexpensive way to discover Sydney harbor. Nice ride and much cheaper than the sight seeing boats. Great views. Cafe onboard for drinks and snacks. Limited seating outside so be quick when boarding the ferry if you want a seat in the sun.

Great value trip. Manly is better if you are prepared to walk.. The ferry ride to Manly from Circular Quay takes 30 minutes with lots of good sights en route plus a great view of the iconic Opera House and Harbour Bridge. The fare is a tad over $15AUS return, so it's a screaming deal for an hour of scenic boat riding.Manly itself is more surf beach and shops, but hang a right at the end of the Corza and keep walking. You will find less touristy restaurants and for the hardy, cliff walks.

Something everyone should do. The manly ferry is an iconic trip for anyone visiting Sydney. It doesn't take long, it's cheap to do and the views of the harbour are fantastic. I recommend a trip from circular quay to manly, a walk along the Corso to the gorgeous Manly beach and grabbing a gelato for the trip back. Will only take 1.5 to 2 hours and it's some of the best sightseeing in the city.

A great time had on the Harbour!. We went to Manly last week on the ferry, what a spectacular view you get of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House from the water. We took some fabulous photos. It was a beautiful sunny day on our trip to Manly, which took about 30 mins, nice and leisurely to take in the view. Had a good walk around Manly, which is so nice. I really recommend this trip.
Great way to see Harbour. Ferry from Manly to Circular Quay is a great way to see the Harbour. Must be one of the best commutes in the world. Sit back and enjoy the view.

Superb view of the city. Do take this ferry ride. Make sure you take the ride before it gets dark
You get a superior level of view of the city. You get opera house and harbour bridge in one view with thos ride.
A great bay cruise. We came back as foot passengers from a day at Manly. The journey was at dusk as we got great pictures of the setting sun over the Harbour bridge.

A must do in Sydney. Great way to see Sydney harbour. OK, there's no commentary and you have to buy the coffee, but if you pick up a harbour map and keep your eyes open, you'll save a mint and see almost much as you would with the opposition.

Seven miles from Sydney and a thousand miles from care. Manly's advertising "blurb" described the ease of travel from Sydney CBD to Manly. Across the harbour, the passenger can easily forget the cares of the world as he is transported to Manly. Apart from the chatter of tourists and other passengers, the quiet and constant sound is the ferry going through the waves. The effective timetable means that there is rarely a long time waiting for the next ferry. One can choose to sit indoors, or sit outdoors with the wind blowing through your hair. Views crossing the harbour are spectacular.

Great ferry trip to Manly. I took my children to Manly from Circular Quay return for the 1st time in the school holidays. We arrived on Manly beach just on dusk and the kids had a run around as too cold to swim. We had a very comfortable ferry ride there and on the way back; although dark the ferry ride was comfortable and surprisingly quick. The kids loved the landmarks lit up coming back into Circular Quay. Will definitely do it again.
Lovely old boat.. Easy to use and a must to visit Manly. They run SOOO often and are great fun to be on. Comfortable with plenty of seating inside and out... where it is the most fun to be.
One of the worl;ds great ferry journey. Highly recommended to locals or anybody visiting Sydney. This is one of the great ferry journeys in the world and a must do for any overseas visitors

Best place to get panoramic view of Sydney. I recommend to arrive the wharf earlier in order to get the good point on the ferry. The ferry could cruise from both sides, so make sure that you sit in the correct direction. From Sydney to Manly, right side on second floor in back of the ferry.From Manly to Sydney, left side on the first floor in the front.

Fuss-free ride to Manly. Boarded the Ferry at Circular Quay for a short day trip to Manly. Really quick and convenient way and the Manly Ferry Terminal is located at a central location with plenty of dining options available. There were plenty of seats onboard and with ample personal space. Great option for people who prefer a less tourist-y (but still touristy) beach location in Sydney

A great day out. The ferry trip was very relaxing and Manly is an ideal place to get away from the busy city. Fish and chips on the beach is a must, take a leisurely stroll through the shopping mall, walks around the coast line are very scenic.
Our means of travel to the surrounding area. Our family enjoyed taking the Ferry daily to the surrounding areas. The schedule was very user friendly.
Nice and cheap. From CBD to Manly and vice-versa, there's no better means of transport. Cheap, tidy and safe. City views from the bay are a plus.

Not Just For Commuters, Tourists Will Love It. Good and Cheap day trip from Circular Quay to Manly. Walk to Manly Beach for Fish and Chips and return. Great harbour tour with the dollars (no guide or commentary though)

Enjoyable ferry ride. Travelled on this iconic ferry one Sunday afternoon along with many other travelers. Plenty of room to find somewhere to sit, despite there being many travelers on the day. The trip takes about half an hour and travels past some iconic sites in Sydney harbor. As pensioners, the Opal Fare is the best way to enjoy one of the world's best ferry trips
A must do ferry ride. We take a trip to Manly when we visit Sydney and going by ferry is part of the attraction. Fantastic photo opportunities and no traffic to slow the journey down

Easy access to Manly beach. We had a few hours to kill on a Sunday morning, so we went to the Sydney wharf, conveniently got tickets from the kiosk, and boarded the morning ferry. There weren't many people, so we got comfortable seats in the front row and enjoyed the spectacular views of the Opera House, harbour, and Sydney skyline, with the wind in our hair as we cruised towards Manly beach.The timings are convenient, both to and fro, and I would highly recommend taking this ferry if you're in Sydney - just because Manly is such a refreshing place to be in the mornings.

Quick way of getting there. There are a couple of different ferries that go directly to Manly. One is called the Fastferry to Manly on wharf 6-7, a bit more cost than the other one we took from wharf 3. Both are modern, comfortable. Has a snack bar on board.

Great Way to Travel. An iconic ferry ride from Sydney CBD to Manly is a terrific way to sight see while travelling to Manly. The journey both ways is terrific & the ferries run regularly although they can be crowded at the usual peak travel work times. Very cheap & something for everyone
My favourite of all the harbour ferries. The Manly ferry has always been my favourite. I love the views the space and you can also grab a coffee, sandwich or pie at reasonable prices.

Great and cheap way to see the city from the water. Ferries go every half hr from the pier. The boat is large enough that even in windy conditions no one get seasick. For locals its basic transportation. For the visitor its a great way to see the city from the water.

Excellent views, can get crowded.. We took the ferry to manly in the day time and aDuring the night on the way home so we were able to experience the best of both worlds.When you get on the ferry I suggest quickly getting a good seat outside on the second level facing Sydney both ways.The views are spectacular, I personally really liked seeing Sydney at night all lite up. However it's hard to see some of the islands so going for both day and night is ideal.The boat was fast and smooth with tones of room.The only down side is that it is very touristy.... Lots of people pushing to the front of the boat to take pictures.
Good ferry ride to take visitors. It's so nice to be able to take your visitors from abroad on a quick ride on a ferry to Manly , after sighseeing the harbour bridge and the opera house.

A must for all. Catching the ferry on a cold blustery day was not exactly an excellent idea, But.. It was lovely, the guide on board the ship was very informative and comical. The views are beautiful and really is a must for any tourist visiting Sydney

Cheap, Fun Family Outing. We chose to visit Manly on an incredibly cold, windy winter's day - but the seating inside the ferry is very warm and comfortable. I spent some time on the deck and froze - but the views were spectacular. This is a relatively cheap journey (especially if you have an Opal card) and a nice way to fill in some time on a holiday with something different.There are many cafes, restaurants, places to have lunch once in Manly, the ferry leaves every 30 minutes or so, and it gives a really great view of the Harbour.

A Ferry Ride with a View. Manly Ferry is the best way to go to Manly Beach from Sydney Harbour. Here are a few points:1. The ferry leaves from the quay near the Sydney Opera House every 30 minutes and is about a 30 minute journey. It is accessible by using the Opal transit card that can be purchased near the ferry (and all over town).2. It is a nice way to get a unique view of the opera house, harbour bridge, and coastline. If you sit inside, make sure your window opens as soon as you choose a seat because sometimes they are very dirty- not the best for picture taking.3. The journey takes you to Manly. At the offloading point there are shops, as well as information about Manly Beach. It is a relatively short 300-400 metre walk to the beach. The beach is crowded, and perhaps not as iconic as Bondi.4. Lots of restaurants and shops along the way. For those wanting to save a few dollars on bottled waters and snacks, there is an Aldi market among the convenience stores and tourist spots at Manly Wharf. They have 1.5 litre water bottles for 65 cents.

Great views and best way to get to Manly from Circular Quay. When we have visitors, taking the ferry to Manly from Circular Quay is always on our list of things to do. It's an inexpensive way to get around and my kids love to try out different modes of transportation, even though I tend to get seasick on the ferry. The view is spectacular and Manly is a great place to spend the day with all the beach, shopping, and restaurants just a stone's throw from the ferry. There always seems to be live entertainment and a festive vibe. The ferry operators are always cheerful as well.

Ride it for the views.. It is essentially just transport across the harbour. People will ride it to and from work.The reason a tourist should ride it is for the views. Along the way, you will have great photo opportunities of the Opera House from the ferry, the views of the harbour including the Harbour Bridge, the Naval, yard, Fort Denison and the expensive homes by the harbour. You will pass Sydney heads where the boat will rock from side to side. If you are outside, you might get wet. I have been riding on the Manly ferry regularly since the 1960's I have been on the ferry when the railing has dipped down and touched the water while crossing the heads.Some people will ride the ferry to Manly and not bother to get off as they are only interested in the harbour views.However, In Manly, walk to the beach, go for a swim if it is hot enough! Get yourself some real Aussie fish and chips. Feed some chips to the seagulls. It is not healthy for them but they don't care! There are pubs you can drink in, ice cream parlours, souvenir shops etc as well. When you have finished at the beach, walk back to the wharf and catch the ferry back to Circular Quay.On current pricing, the ride to manly and back will use up the whole of your $15 daily cap on Opal. But the good news is that any other travel that day on public transport with an Opal card will be free. Whether it is another public ferry, a public bus, the light rail system or a city train.
Manly Ferry Views. The ferries chug faithfully for years and the views never get old. Easy way to enjoy an hour or so of this delightful city and the homes built around the body of water.
Great trip across the harbour past the opera house.. Plenty of things to do at Manly. We visited the aquarium for hours. Walked through the the mall to the beach.

Great way to see the Harbor from a different perspective. This ferry is the most popular of the ferries in the Sydney Harbor so it might be tight during the evening and morning commutes. However, this is a great link out to Manly. ( it will be about half the cost of an Uber during non peak time).
Pleasant ferry ride. Been on the ferry a number of times and it's very pleasant, comfortable and scenic. Especially being on a seniors ticket a tip to Manly is a rail treat! .

Another worthwhile visit. . Whilst traveling around Sydney Harbor, go to Manly either for the afternoon or the day. There's food options there so you can stay for as long as you like, and there's also a lovely beach. I personally went, walked around the island for about 2-3 hours and got the ferry back perfectly satisfied. Although watch out - the ride itself is pretty long and time-consuming.

Must do for visitors. . Pick a nice day and get the ferry from Circular quay to Manly. It's a great look at Sydney from the harbour. People still catch the ferries to work and back each day in Sydney. It's very affordable. Another great destination is the zoo. Best zoo with million dollar harbour views. Take the ferry from circular quay to the zoo. Then you can ride the chairlift to the entrance and get a Birdseye view of Taronga zoo. Kids and adults love it. I love the ferries they are old school, local and beautiful. Get to front of queue and get a seat outside.
Convenient. A great, hassle-free way to travel to Manly in a clean and safe vessel - even on a cold and drizzly day. Trips left on schedule too - which was great as we had a lunch booking in Manly.

Views and adventure. No matter which direction you go. A Manly Ferry ride is sure to impress with views and adventure. The most economical way to explore Sydney Harbour, the heads (north & south) and visit Manly - a place thousand miles from care!

not a bad way to while away the afternoon. not a bad way to while away the afternoon, especially if you don't want to fight the traffic. parked at the cruise terminal ($25.00 flat rate) and took the ferry across. had lunch, shopped walked about at the beach and then returned at a leisurely clip on a unseasonable balmy day. many other attractions accessible from this departure point.
Crowded refugee ship. Beautiful overlooking Sydney skyline, with operahouse and everything, it's a pety that you cannot get your arms up for a photo. What is this like in summer??
Visiting Manly by ferry. A good and easy way to travel to Manly. I takes you only 30 minutes and you have absolute stunningviews on Harbor Bridge and The Opera House!

Quick and efficient. We were going to Manly so that my husband could swim with the sharks in the Manly Aquarium. The ferry was quick and easy to book and although the day was cloudy and dismal - we enjoyed the iconic views of the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge and some great photos were taken.Our return journey was fine, and both journeys (thankfully) were not rough. Would recommend.
Quick and easy. No hassle getting on and off. A very efficient and simple operation. Good value for money and fun for the kids too.

Nice views from the ship going to Manly. Nice views from the ship except when everyone stands up right in front of you to see the Opera House and the harbour bridge. The ticket machines should sell single tickets but don't, so go to the ticket office on wharf 4 to get your ticket. Works a lot better if you do not have an Opal card.Recommend Italian restaurant Hugo's at the Manly side harbour. Excellent location and food :)
Love it!. Many stops to tourist attractions. Sit on top and enjoy the views and wind! Sydney is such a nice place!

Best and cheapest way to see the Harbour. If visitors to Sydney want to see the Harbour, but do not want to spend a fortune on an organised tour, the Manly Ferry is the best way to see the Harbour. If you get on early, you can score and outdoor seat up the front for the best views. The windows open , so even from the inside, you can take great photos. The seat are comfortable. Toilets are on board as is a small place to buy drinks and munchies.

Perfect Trip to Manly . Took the wonderful Manly Ferry on an absolutely perfect Sydney Winters day. The weather was perfect, the trip was great and just love the whole experience. The ferries are well kept for their age. Managed to score an outside seat and was able to take so many perfect photos of all of the iconic Sydney sites- Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Sydney Heads and Manly Harbour.Used the opal card which you tap on at Circular Quay and do not have to tap off at Manly. It works the other way on the return trip to Circular Quay. The staff on the boat were friendly and efficient. It's a great thing to do on a sunny Sydney day.

More than just a mode of transportation. If you live in Sydney taking this ferry is just a way to get from A to B. But if you are from out of town, part of getting to Manly is taking the ferry. You get great views of the Sydney Harbour and the coast along the way to Manly. Very enjoyable and only a 30 minute ride.

The Only Way to Travel To The City. Our family stayed in Manly and traveled to Sydney proper by this ferry system. If you are going to be using the ferry frequently, get an Opal pass as it's cheaper and easier to tap on. The Manly ferry has the very best views of the opera house and bridge, great for photos. Even if you aren't staying in Manly, hop on the ferry just for the great views of those two attractions.
Great ferry trip. Were told that this ferry was the best way to see the harbour and loved the ride. It took about 30 minutes and has space both inside and outside to sit and watch the scenery.

Used several times very efficient service. Used this service several times while visiting family in Sydney. Easy to access, very affordable and extremely efficient service taking just 30 mins point to point. Visiting Manly is a must, easily best part of Sydney.

Take this 'tour' of the Harbor on the cheap and end up in Manly.. This is the way the locals tour the Harbor. travel to Manly Beach as the bonus. Stroll the shops and take the walk along the scenic Tasman Sea. Stop in for some sushi or a gelato (at the terminal, if not before) and ride the ferry back to the Quay - keep an eye out for seals, and whales.
Old but gold. Great way to capture the unparalleled beauty of the harbour. The trip to Manly from circular quay is always beautiful from start to end. I must for every tourist in Sydney!
Beautiful location. Loved Manly the ferry ride over is one of the best trips in the harbour. You go by the Sydney opera house you can see the harbour bridge and it is very in expensive.

Great way to see Sydney harbour attractions.. Plenty to see and do in Manly. Visit the Manly Gallery, turn left as you get off the ferry and walk along the path. They have a great permanent ceramics collection and always have something interesting on exhibition, and it's free😄

A Sydney Icon. A must do in Sydney.Manly is a great little place with a beach side town feel. There are fantastic seafood restaurants and plenty of shops if that's what you want to do. The beach is beautiful. Definitely worth a visit on the iconic ferry which would be just a good length trip if you have kids. There is a café on board and comfortable seating both inside and out. There's not a lot of room outside so if you really want to sit there you'll have to be quick.
too easy!. Great and cheap way to get to manly! Not only that but you get some great views for pictures or what not! plenty of room for everyone also!

Always a great trip. By taking the Manly ferry you get a 30 min trip across Sydney harbour with great views of Circular Quay, the bridge and the opera house. It can be very busy at peak times with large queues waiting to board. The ferry can take about 1000 passengers in total and loading finishes 2 minutes before departure. Manly is a great destination for a half or full day trip and the ferry adds to the trip. Be aware on windy days that the swells near the Heads can be quite big, we've seen tourists who ignore the advice to sit down thrown over on days like this.

Great way to see the Harbour.. We used this ferry a few times. The service is every 1/2 hour and can get busy at times, It is the best way to get to and from Manly and Sydney, with some really great views.

Lovely cruise. The ferry takes about an hour out to manly and you get a great view of Sydney skyline opera hous and bridge it's especially nice on the return trip if it's starting to get dark as view is spectacular. You get the ferry from pier 4 on circular quay

Easy little half day trip. Just a short (maybe half hour) ride from Circular Quay. Jump on the ferry and enjoy a look around iconic Manly. Beautiful beach, and great fish and chips! The ferry was very reasonably priced, and the kids loved riding up front in the wind!

Sydney excursion. A day in Manly Beach is worth adding to your itinerary. We didn't do Bondi Beach, so can't compare. You probably don't need to do both. You don't need to take a tour, just hop on the ferry and enjoy the beautiful harbor ride. Great views of the Opera House. About 1/2 hour to Manly Beach. Get on 20 minutes early so you can snag good seats on the right side of the boat. We liked sitting outside.

Manly to Circular Quay. Could not fault this ferry service - well run and easy to use. Ferry was clean, safe and fast. We travelled at night and had no problems, everything ran very smooth. Highly recommend!

Day or night a lovely way to get to Manly. Avoid the traffic and the stress of parking etc when you get to Manly. The gentle motion of the ferry and the great places to eat once you get off the ferry make this the best way in my opinion to get to Manly
Do it. If you don't visit Manly on the Ferry when in Sydney you are really missing out on some spectacular scenery.

Quick and Easy. This was a great way to see Sydney Harbor (make sure your camera is ready!) and spend a relaxing afternoon on the water. The ride from Circular Quay to Manly is 30 minutes and the ferries run every 30 minutes. The price was also very affordable.

Enjoying the sunshine. We just love jumping on the ferry to manly... The kids love the ride, in particular the bit past Sydney heads where it gets a bit rough!!Manly has plenty to offer.... a stroll along the beach (with an ice cream of course)... a walk through the shops, the aquarium or a fabulous meal at one of the many cafes and restaurants along the shoreline.If you haven't managed to take the ferry ride across- it's a must do.

Scenic views of Sydney Harbour. Take the Manly Ferry (city-run) if you want an inexpensive ride thru Sydney Harbour. The views are outstanding—sit on the forward outdoor deck (board early!) for the best views. No commentary, of course, just great views of one of the prettiest harbors in the world. Oh, and enjoy walking around Manly, too.
Beautiful ferry ride. Def recommend doing. Very nice ferry ride and you see the sites on the way. About 30 mins one way. They have snacks on board if you are hungry. Use the opal card to travel

Manly Ferry Is A Must!!!!. Visiting Sydney is a must going on the Manly Ferry! Use your Opal card to go on the Manly Ferry. Do not take the Fast ferry! Manly ferry offers breathtaking views and free onboard wifi. Do worry where to sit because once you start sailing you won't be sitting down! You be walking around the ferry to take photos.

A truly fantastic way of seeing Sydney Harbour. Sydney Harbour is truly iconic and breathtaking. Nothing can prepare you for its majesty. A trip from Circular Quay is the cheapest and easiest way of appreciating it. Forget specialist trips. A waste of money.
Great trip. Went on this 4x during my recent stay. Its simply a wonderful 30 minute trip and Manly is lovely. A definite do!
Beach. Beautiful Winter Sunshine, manly was packed, the ferry trip across was without incident and using the opal card was an economic way to get to Manly

Great Trip, would definitely reccommend. The trip over to Manly on the ferry is definitely worth while. Lots of views on the way over and only takes about 30 minutes. Manly itself was clean and not crowded in June with some excellent walks and lots of cafes and fish and chip shops. We bought fish and chips and took them to the beach front to eat at the many tables provided and enjoyed the view!

Excellent way to see the Harbour Bridge & Opera House. The institution that is the Manly Ferry is well worth a return trip especially on a sunny day. You can buy a single or return ticket at a booth by one of the piers (approx $15 return) or use an Opal card (much cheaper). You get to experience the Harbour from the water, see the Harbour Bridge and Opera House at a much closer distance and all the little bays along the way. Used by tourists/visitors and locals too. Seating inside and out. If you're quick an outside seat up front on the upper deck provides for the best views. Manly is one of the iconic seaside destinations in Sydney. Definitely recommend a visit if only to stroll along the seafront. Lots of beach view cafes and restaurants as well as other retail opportunities too. Good cliff top walks too - pick up a leaflet at one of the Tourist Information Centres.
Quick visit. It was night time didn't see much. Waned to go down but it was raining and no available parking. But will go back next time.
Great way to travel.. Only way to get around the Harbour! Very easy, fairly inexpensive. Highly recommend Buy the opal card! Ferries run like clock work. Enjoy being on the water.

chill out, relax, let the beauty of the harbour overwhelm you. super cheap way to see some of the most beautiful things in Sydney for the price of a ferry ticket you can see all the life on the Harbour, the bridge, the opera house, Fort Denison. A 35 minute trip that crosses the heads and gives you a feel for the wonder of Sydney Harbour and how amazing it was that he found it. At the other end are good places to eat, Manly beach through the Corso - or stay on board and enjoy the view back ot the city

Quick 15 minute ride from Sydney - Circular Quay. From Circular Quay, it's only a quick 15 minute ferry ride to Manly (make sure you catch the Fast Ferry, or you will be stuck on it for 45 minutes - which also isn't a bad thing if you want to enjoy the scenery of the harbor). From the Manly harbor, there are tons of restaurants, bars, and shops.

A great way to get around. This is a great way to get around Sydney. The harbour does not look complete without this yellow/green ferry. There are many routes to take and my favorite one is by far the one going to Taronga Zoo.

Manly Ferry Trip. What a magnificent trip from Circular Quay to Manly and return is. The seats are comfortable,there is a cafe on board if you need a snack. The scenery is spectacular. I love sitting on the top deck outside with the sea breeze just admiring the view. A fantastic day out,
I will never tire of this trip. A highlight when I come to Sydney. This ferry takes you past the Opera House and Bridge, then past the heads to Manly. A 20mins trip that is well worth the journey.

Best ferry trip on the harbour. Head across in the afternoon and then catch it back to town as night descends and all the lights are coming on. It is a great way to get out on our beautiful harbour. When in Manly make sure you walk around to Shelley Beach - great little walk.

Majestic Manly and Manly Ferries are a must do.. One of the best ferry services in the world- approximately 40 minutes from Circular Quay to the first of 21 bea hes of northern Sydney. Named by Captain Phillip, leader of the First Fleet arriving in 1788, the famous Corso of Manly is a pedestrian walkway which connects the harbour to the Pacific Ocean some 20 minutes from the wharf. The regular ferries move approximately every 40 minutes across North and South Heads. Buy an Opal transport access pass, which can easily be topped up, and cruise on a Manly ferry, across one of the finest natural harbours in the world.
Did it twice!. Excellent way to get around and see more of the harbour ,runs every half hour. Great pictures as you return passing the Opera House and approaching the bridge.

Good option to see the harbor and opera house. Taking the ferry to Manly is a cheap option to see the harbor, the opera house, and the harbor bridge. As a bonus, you arrive at Manly, a nice place with a classic surfing beach.

5 Star Views for a fraction of what they're worth. If you're visiting Sydney or even a long term resident you've got to take the Manly Ferry at some point. Million dollar views of the harbour bridge, opera house, taronga zoo, kiribili house, rose bay and the north and south heads don't come any better than on the water. Standing outside with the wind in your hair and the smell of the sea mist makes a great trip even better. It's a definite must do.

ferry takes you for 2.50 return for pensioners to manly from circular quay there is an express one you pay more for it o. there are 2 ferries going to manly one is express and cost more and the regular ferry is very chea even for pensioners only 2.50 whole day excursion ticket you can also use the train for free with this ticket

always the best value trip in sydney. when in Sydney I always do the many ferry. great way to see the harbour and great value. the tickets are heaps and you get the real feel for the harbour. recommend. best views of the bridge and opera house.

A Great Way to See the Harbour. The is no better way to see Sydney Harbour than being on Sydney Harbour. The ferries provide an affordable way to do this and in my opinion the best ferry is the one to Manly - you get the harbour views but also a bit of wave action as you approach the heads. Sit outside and enjoy the wind in your face and the smell of the sea

An easy trip to see one of Sydney's better beaches. Manly is one of Sydney's better beach suburbs and it is far more enjoyable taking a ferry than the stresses of traffic along Military Road - an easy trip and you can see so much of the beauty of the harbour suburbs.
Great way to travel . I've been taking the ferry across Sydney for many years. Great way to travel in both wet and dry weather, as you can stay indoors or sit outside.
Great way to see the harbour. We went on the ferry to go for a walk along Manly beach and had the best day ever,so much to do in Manly go and have a look

Manly Ferry. Fabulous way tlo see the Syndney Harbour, Bridge, houses and beaches, and of course, Manly. The harbour is busy and interesting, with alot of history. Well worth the trip, if just for that. Alot of people just webnt for the out and back trip from Circular Quay. Very convenient with the trains as well.

Quick trip across the seas!. We were heading to Manly to see the Aquarium that w had as part of a 5 venue pass. Also a chance to see the streets of Manly and the beach in real life! Fantastic to ride on a ferry, a real piece of iconic Australiana. Lots of seats on the boat and quick trip to Manly!

Great way to see Sydney harbour and see manly beach.. Love the gentle ride across Sydney past the Opera house, Harbour Bridge, Fort Dennison and other landmarks. This is a great way to see Sydney harbour and enjoy manly. Lots of great food and things to do in manly including the beach just a short walk away.

Bumpy. On Manly ferry in January and it was torrential rain ! Was alright going out but on the road back to circular quay it was very very bumpy Indeed ! Would love to do it in the sun and I think it would be very different .
Must do!. This is a must for anyone visiting Sydney and you get some great views. I think its cheaper on Sundays too and you can use your travel card that you can top up/buy from 7/11s

Winter Sunday. Have been on the Manly ferry many times over 50 years and it is still a great trip across the harbour, even got a bit of a swell between the heads on the way back. Great value on your Opal card on a Sunday - $2.50! - all day for public transport.

The Manly Ferry cuts its way to Circular Quay. This is an absolute must for anyone visiting Sydney. It's a half hour journey across and the views are phenomenal! This was the absolute highlight of our overnight stay in Sydney. The prices are very reasonable,$35 return for two adults and a teenager. Worth every penny! Loved it.

Trip to Manley. Visited on a very hot and sunny Sunday so the queue and footfall was huge, but stood on the upstairs deck for the breeze and the views were incredible! I wouldn't bother paying for a boat trip in the Harbour, just do this reasonably inexpensive trip and you will see the abridgement Opera House, the Northern suburbs and Manley itself. Recommend taking a right turn at the big Manley beach, itself stunning, but fairly busy, and doing the walk around the coastal path towards Fairy boer and Shelley cove? There's a nice little restaurant there too called The Boathouse!
Nice trip. If you have a spare day in Sydney take the ferry to Manley Beach. Nice atmosphere, good restaurants and overall a very pleasant experience.
Should do. Beauiful way to get to manly , the view on the way is fabulous, the ferry not that cheap and they are sometimes not running on time .

SEE THE SEA & DE STRESS. Get off the roads get off the bus & train & get on to the ferry.Your driver awaits for you it is all about the journey to Manly.Boats,beaches,bays,buoys ,buildings,bridges & backyards all waiting for you on this spectacular ride across Sydney Harbour.See the city skyline,the Zoological gardens,Lady Macquaries Chair,Sydneys' North & South Heads while watching all the sailors racing their yachts.I have cruised the Mediterranean & Sydney Harbour is right up there.A MUST for any visitor OR local.
Ferry to Manly. OMG! On time all the time and so efficient. Great all around views as you pass the Opera House. Outdoor seating great!

A MUST while in Sydney. When in downtown Sydney, visit circular quay and buy a ticket on the Sydney Manly Ferry. Sit outside if the weather is good and enjoy the spectacular ride across the large Sydney Harbor. We took the entire family to Manly and had a great walk on the street there. Manly has some great small restaurants and within a few blocks the open ocean is at your feet. Walk on Shell Beach and watch the surfers and diving beginners at their lessons. A delightful day and highly recommended.

Nice trip. One of the longer trips of about 30 mins. It worth the time and cost because you really get to fell the waterways and see outer parts of Sydney. Can be a bit rough during bad weather but the service will be shut down if the weather gets too rough. Worth the trip

Very reliable Transport. As a traveller, I was very impressed with Sydney's public transport system. It is easily accessible, reliable and there are always officials around to ask if you need to. The Manly ferry runs every half hour between Circular Quay and Manly, and you get to see the harbour entrance to the ocean, with the Northern and Southern Light Houses on either side. As a tip - public transport is $2.50 on Sundays regardless of where you go or how many trips you take. Its a good day to plan your Manly trip

Visit Manly - just catch the Ferry at Circular Quay. This is an amazing ride and a must do when visiting Sydney. The Manly Beach is so beautiful and the boardwalk is a eclectic mix of people of all ages and nationalities enjoying the fresh air and sunshine (well i have been lucky and always struck good weather even in the winter it is gorgeous)
Fun Boat Ride. This was the first thing I did in Sydney. Was a smooth ride over to manly. the weather was great and the sights were awesome.

The best way to see Sydney Harbour is by ferry. Catching the ferry to Manly is a must do for any visitor to Sydney. It's the best way to see the Harbour and once at Manly, there are great cafes, restaurants and walks including the Manly to Spit walk.

A SYDNEY MUST DO. You cant just stand there and wonder what it would be like...Get on board! For Sydney locals this is probably just another ordinary daily necessity. But for tourists like us, it was something we always wanted to do. So when we were staying in Narrabeen we caught a bus down to Manly and travelled across the harbour to town. A very memorable trip. Lots of photo opportunities. We hopped on board and sat at the front...Hmmm not many here.. must be a quiet day, we thought. It was when the ferry started to move off we realised we were sitting at the back! These things are double ended! So, up to the front we went, great views and a very smooth ride. A Sydney must do!
Manly Ferry and Beach walk. This is a fun ferry ride and Manly beach is a gorgeous walk with interesting coast line and beautiful flowers along the way. Ferry ride is inexpensive and walk is free!

Stable and scenic trip on board of a spacious rustic ferry. Payment is easy with Opal card. And with all the different caps imposed, you may well be riding the ferry for free.Departure is every 30min, at the 00th / 30th min mark from Circular Quay, and 15th / 45th min mark from Manly Wharf. Trip between both piers is exactly 30 min on a very stable and scenic harbour. Free seating, so you can move about. For fresh and cooling air, i strongly recommend venturing to the front of the vessel but seats there are pretty limited.

extraordinary, relaxing, comfortable, well-organised, affordable.. Using the govt Manly ferry service is easy to get around Sydney Harbour, It is extraordinary, relaxing, comfortable, well-organised, affordable.
M anly very good. this ferry is very efficient makes good time lots to see on the way, the Zoo is one of the highlights
Quick and Regular. Efficient and timely services to get to and from Manly, which is an interesting beach suburb with good restaurants and cafes.

Good sort excursion. Ferry is very accessible and easy to use once you familiarise yourself with the opal card. It was simple to pop over to manly for a few hours, walk the hills and come back to Sydney to enjoy the harbour in the evening.

Not the best in Sydney. I find that ferries are the best way to travel in Sydney - they are quick and if you love the wind in your face on deck, there's nothing better. However, the ones that run on the Manly route are old ferries so not the best ones for you to try if you are a tourist.

Great views, but really crowded!. I was up in Sydney for Vivid recently, coming up from Melbourne. My first time in Sydney, and was told the ferry was a must. It was great views from the water. However, I only just made it on - i wasn't aware that the gates closed five minutes before departure. It was very crowded from Circular Quay to Manly, but thre ride back was much more relaxing

A very relaxing way to travel.. These slow, chugging ferries are a great way to get over to Manly without dealing with the traffic. We thought that the time taken was a great way to relax, and enjoy the scenery on the way. The ferries may be old but they retain their charm, and with a modern cafe on board, it turns the journey into a relaxing. morning or afternoon tea break. Highly recommended. An additional advantage is the Opal card which sets the upper limit of costs for travel at $15 per day, but for Seniors/Pensioners, that limit is $2.50 per day, so make sure you have your pension card with you as they will want to verify your pensioner details.
A great day trip!. Best to do on a sunny day. We hoped on the ferry to manly from circular quay and had a great time ! It was so quick and easy to use and the views were stunning !

One of the best trips on Sydney Harbour. Just take the return trip just for the spectacular views of the Harbour But stay at Manly for fish and chips on the beach just a short stroll from the Ferry TerminalWould recommend this trip for anyone looking for a low cost day out

Manly Ferry. The Manly Ferry is a great ferry to get you to Manly and more importantly Manly Beach. The ferry is not expensive, it runs quite regularly and the Manly Ferry port is lively today as it was 10 years ago when I was first in Australia. Shelly Beach is also really good and more of a private cove area and Freshwater is a great location for people watching, all of these are accessible on the Manly Ferry and a walk or quick bus ride.

Must do ride. At the end of our tour with Bailey's Sydney Private Tours, Peter dropped us off at the Manly Ferry station to take the ferry back. Peter recommended a good spot to sit and indeed, we were able to take in the view of the Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House on the way into Circular Quay. It was quite windy so we only popped in and out to take pictures. A great way to see the harbor!
Excellent way to see an amazing city.. Travel by ferry on Sydney Harbour on a beautiful day is an experience not to be missed. Cheaper than a harbour cruise.

This is the best route for a ferry ride in the harbor. This is the perfect ferry ride from Sydney harbor into Manly. I love the walk, the shops and the views en route. The last time I was on the ferry, Dolphins played at the front of the boat. It was a rainy day, but still quite enjoyable.

Good way to see the harbour . The Manly Ferry would have to be a iconic part of Sydney, couldn't think of a better way to see Sydney Harbour from the Bridge past the Heads down to Manly , it's interesting to see the mixture of tourists with their cameras clicking all over the place, and the Sydney workers going to and from work or getting there shopping, using the Ferry as most would use a bus! I can't ( and don't) visit Sydney without doing the return trip!

Fun for a family. We took the Manly Ferry from where we were staying in Manly to Circular Quay so we could go to the Zoo. Definitely a great experience and something fun to do. It's a nice way to see Sydney from a different perspective. It's rather expensive compared to other public transport options but as a once off as tourists we enjoyed it. Staff were helpful and it was easy to navigate around Manly Wharf and Circular Quay to find where we needed to go.

Fun. The Manly Ferry is a fun way to be on the water and get some photographs of the Bridge, Opera House, Fort Denison and the harbour. Manly is always worth a visit. It is a bit grotty in a tourist kind of way. People enjoy themselves and the ferry is the best way to get there.

A beautiful trip to be had. The ferry over to Manly is one of the iconic things to do when in Sydney. It is a beautiful boat ride, especially on a sunny day and there are great views to be had. Spend some time in Manly looking at the shops and having fish and chips on the beach before returning on the ferry again. A great day trip!

No trip to Sydney could be complete without this journey. Of course there are other ferry rides around harbour suburbs which are delightful (e.g. to Mosman Bay and back) but only the Manly ferry goes past the 'heads' or entrance to the harbour.Once you get to Manly make sure you walk through the corso across to the other side to see the ocean beach where Captain Cook spied the 'manly' aborigines.You'll also get the idea of the difference between the harbour beaches like at manly Cove and ocean beaches with the rolling surf.

A Wonderful Family Journey. The Manly Ferry is an excellent way to get out on Sydney Harbour on a budget. You will travel from Circular Quay down the harbour towards the ocean. The views are awesome as you turn and head towards Manly Beach. This is a great idea for all ages. Plus you can expect great fish and chips at Manly!

Cheapest way to see the Harbour. Travel on Sunday for $2.50 max. You'll see some of the best parts of Syndey Harbour. Plenty of spots for lunch and coffee in Manly, then catch the ferry back to the city.
Day trip. Loved this place . Trip on the ferry was pleasant and enjoyable . Manly beach and surrounding area was beautiful . Would strongly recommend visiting here

Relaxing trip. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and had a lovely relaxing trip of about 40 minutes each way. We got off at Manly and had a look at the beach and around the shops which were interesting although quite 'touristy'.

Slow trip to Manly to take in the views. If you want to get to Manly fast, then take the hydrofoil. But if you want to relax and enjoy the scenery, take the Manly Ferry. The views are spectacular, there's so much to see, and when you get to Manly, you can spend a couple of hours walking around, have a lovely lunch at a seaside restaurant, then mosey back to the ferry again. One of my favourite things to do when I visit Sydney. The locals love it too.

Relaxing cruise to Manly. A great way to travel over to Manly Beach, great views along the way and such easy access on and off at both ends of the journey. Plenty of seats both inside and out.An easy flat work from the ferry terminal at Manly over to the beach.

Amazing Night Time Views. I did a return trip from Circular Quays to Manly one evening to meet a friend, it was my first trip to Sydney so a night trip on the ferry was an added bonus!Pretty reasonable fare each way and the ferry was clean and warm.I managed to brave it outside for a short while, definitely a must do when the weather is good, may be not in winter!You get great views of the Harbour Bridge on the way out and amazing city skyline views on the way back.A great way to travel whether you are a daily commuter or here on holiday!

Good trip to get a flavor of Sydney . Ferry seating isn't what you'd hope for to sightsee, but it was a great afternoon outing - seeing the harbor and surrounding neighborhoods from the water, a stroll along the Manly beach promenade watching the surfers, a meal and then a return trip. Line up early to get a good seat! The ferry is double-fronted so pick seats based on the ferry moving in the direction away from the dock.
Ferry. Trip was good but the weather was bad but still a good way to see some of Sydney's sights from a different view.
Only way to travel to Manly. Such a great ride. Been doing this for years and it never gets boring. It's a nice steady ride from Circular Quay to Manly for a quick day trip.

nice ride and day out. Nice way to spend the day catching the Ferry out to Manly. You can either sit inside and enjoy the view or venture outside and can a closer look at the view and watch for any wildlife. Reasonably smooth rides. depends on the weather for the day. on how smooth or rough the ride is. Watch for water splashing if sitting outside.
Very good service. You must visit Manly beach and the by far the best way to it is by this ferry. Were well run and managed.

Great afternoon out.. What a great afternoon, a must whilst visiting Sydney. The ferry ride smooth and effortless. We just enjoyed walking around and loved seeing everyone out and about enjoying Sydney's winter.

The best way to see Sydney Harbour. Travelling on the Manly Ferry, gives you a few opportunities in Sydney. The journey from Circular Quay runs past the Sydney Opera House, view the Sydney Harbour Bridge, past the Zoo, past the houses of Australia's rich and famous, past harbour islands and national parks, past beautiful bushland and arriving in Manly which has a harbour frontage and a seaside frontage. Spectacular views for the cost of a ferry fare. Manly is full of interesting restaurants, cafes and pubs, a full size ocean aquarium, beaches, an art gallery or two, and is the start of a harbour walk which goes for many kilometres. So take the Manly Ferry on a sunny day and you won't be disappointed.

Vivid trip. We timed our visit well, lights for vivid came on as we saw the Harbour Bridge. Make sure you plan to get there early if Vivid is on as the lines were huge. On our return trip we sat up the back on the left so we could see and photograph the Opera House and bridge together.

Great day out. Spent a great day in manly and used the ferry to get there and back, they depart every 30 minutes and takes approx 1 hour to get there and back, on board there is a small shop for snacks etc. Very busy from 10-12 departing and from 3-5 returning

Easy too Ride. It was a sunny day and a great ferry ride. Use your Opal Card, hint use your Opal card all day for $15 and Sunday its less we rode everything on Saturday, bus, metro light rail, ferry and local train, jump on and jump off. It a big boat and a smooth ride. Inside or out its a pleasant ride.
Best ferry route ever. What shall I say. This ferry route from Sydney harbour to Manly is just gorgeous! You have a great view to the opera house and the harbour bridge. A must for Sydney.

Use it on a Sunday. To be honest the ferry in itself is old and rusty. However, the journey will provide you some wonderful vistas of the harbour and the two icons of Sydney. Plus you will end up in Manly which is totally worth a try. By doing it on a Sunday with your Opal card (travel card you can buy at 7/11) it will only cost you 2.50.

Everyone should ride a ferry to Manly. A must do activity when in Sydney if time permits. The scenery along the route and the arrival at Manly pier, followed by a short stroll to the Cafe/Restaurant strip worth every minute of the fare and the ride.

A real gem. Love the Sydney ferries, our trip to Manly on a sunny Sydney day was just perfect. Staff were friendly and helpful. Opal card for public transport around Sydney works well. A man dropped his wallet overboard when we were leaving Circular Quay staff were trying to get it never found out if they did?
The best way how to get to Manly. If you want to get to Manly, this is the must! You will have a stunning view to the downtown of Sydney and to the Opera House

The Ferry Best Way to Travel in Sydney. Planning on heading to Manly Beach? There's no better way to get there than by ferry from Circular Quay. Avoid peak hours and nab yourself a window spot, or if it's a great day, an outside bench at the rear of the ferry. (The front and sides can be quite windy and views leaving one of the most famous harbours in the world are perfect photo ops.)Getting home from Manly? If you've had too much sun and rather a faster ride back to your hotel, pay the extra few bucks and hop on the Fast Ferry back to the city.

If you are in Sydney you must visit Manly by Ferry. We travel from Geelong to Sydney and the first thing we do is get a ferry to Manly. Sights of Sydney harbor and the bridge are the most photographed

Ride the ferry to Manly. Every half hour the ferry departs and for a couple of dollars and 35 minutes later you arrive into Manly. A 5 min walk through the shopping area full of cool urban brands you come to the beach and can while away time strolling the beach watching the surfers.

Take the ride for the experience !. Take the ride for the experience. Cheap fares, runs both ways very often..I would avoid peak hours as workers use this service. Cafe & Toilets on board the two level Ferry, seating inside enclosed or front and rear open areas. It's a stroll from the Manly dock Brough the Mall to the surf beach. Lovely area. Great way to view the Opera House & Harbour Bridge from the Harbour.

Unreliable timings & unannounced cancellation. Unprofessional service.. We took the ferry from darling harbour to manly & wanted to take the direct ferry back to darling harbour in 17 minutes. However it was cancelled & no announcement was made on the cancellation trip. Only when we asked the staff then we will told it was cancelled & had to go to circular quay first then take a shuttle ferry back to darling harbour. We paidAud $58 on both ways for 2 adults pretty expensive for such service , bad timings & unannounced cancellation. Service was really bad. When we reached circular quay & made enquiries at the counter they told us we had to pay for the return trip to darling harbour. Only when We made noise & complained that we've already paid in advance for the trip back that the manly staff routed us to the next ferry to darling harbour without paying extra. I mean why should we when the cancellation was done by manly ferry & no updates or announcement. What was supposed to be a direct trip from manly to darling harbour in 17 mins took us an hour of travel from manly to circular quay to darling harbour!Humbug! For this kind of substandard service we might have taken the public ferry at a fraction of the cost & service is far better in terms of timings/schedules.

You don't feel like you're in Sydney. Cross over to Manly on the Ferry. About 25 minutes each way. Your ticket will be return - hence the high price for it compared with our rides. We had a great afternoon - walk off the ferry and follow the mall to the end. Your view will be amazing - Manly beach. Lots of places to eat on the esplanade.

Amazing Trip from one beautiful part of Sydney to another.. Amazing low cost trip to or from beautiful Manly , with its trendy cafe life style and one of the most famouse beaches in Australia, you can't afford to miss out by not taking the trip across the most beautiful harbour in the whole world on one of the best little ferries you could ever hope to board.
Relaxing. Nice way to see some of the Harbour at a peaceful pace. For Seniors Card holders - Not expensive.The ferry even after a full load of people disembarked was clean.

A cheap way to see the view. Go for a Manly Ferry ride. Don't get off at Manly, just turn around and again look at the great sites. Views you pay heaps for on the charter boats. Food and drink available. A great cheap family trip. Room for the kids to run around

Reasonable Priced way yo see the harbour. Nice way to see the harbour with an excellent end destination for a day out.
$38.00 for 2 adults and 1 child return to Circular Quay
Plenty of seating allowing different views of Sydney harbour Bridge, Opera House and other locations around the harbour such Fort Denison, Watson Bay etc
Clean for public transport and quiet a relaxing trip

A Must Do. When in Sydney, to see the best harbour in the world, see it from a Manly Ferry, low cost, great views, you cant go wrong.
Scott

A great ferry ride in sydney harbor. Pass many of the key landmarks in the harbor and when you reach Manly have several enjoyable alternatives ahead-swimming at the beach, coastal walks or dining along the promenade. An inexpensive tourist trip with direct access to the metro from the ferry landing.
Best view during night. There is amazing view at Sydney... especially during the night is the view at Opera House just unforgettable - try it, you wont regret :-)

Perfect way to get to Manly. As the title says this is a really great way, on a nice day, to travel to Manly, you'll get off at the wharf where there is loads of activity, restaurants and bars. This is also the start of a great walk to the surf beach down "The Corso", with more restaurants and bars and usually some sort of live music.The best part about the ferry is the views you get to take in of the harbour on your way across.

FAREWELL MARGRET . We went aboard the Manly Ferry with 10 people and our late mother's ashes. Were she use to love going Manly beach and Sydney Harbour .Fantastic day even with the cold rain , it's safe beautiful fabulous journey. Grab a opal card and save .Leaving Manly Margret was on her way sprinkling her ashes in the harbour . God bless you Thank you for the experience.
Loved this trip. We sat back and enjoyed the ferry trip from Circular Quay to Manly. The weather was gloriously sunny, which enhanced our view of this wonderful waterway.

Manly Ferries. There are many ferries operating. Ferries are big enough and it is stable. It go to various locations, i.e. Darling Harbour, Taronga Zoo, Manly, Balmain, Cockatoo Island etc. For ease of convenience in Sydney to use public transportation buy Opal Card which is usable for suburban and intercity trains, ferries, buses, light rail. You can travel all day and for no more than $15 per day for adults.

A relaxing way to spend a Sunday. Saturdays can be very busy with families, but the trip across the harbour is generally relaxing and soothing, you could even find yourself nodding off. Crossing Sydney Heads can sometimes be a bit bumpy, but this iconic ride is a lovely treat for sydneysiders and visitors. Once you arrive, there is lots of galleries, the beach and great shops, bars and cafes to enjoy.

Great way to travel across to Manly! . Had a nice day out in the city a few weeks ago. Decided to pop on the ferry to Manly. Had a fantastic day out! The ride was very enjoyable and definitely easier than driving. If you want a good seat with a view make sure to get on early as it fills up fast

Great fun. Manly is a great day out, with plenty of food and shopping, and a fabulous walk to Cabbage Tree Bay for calm water if you don't like the surf, and wonderful snorkelling in the marine reserve.

The best way to get to Manly. Forget those tiresome bus transfers, take the ferry. It's part of the Sydney transit system, so your Opal card works. And you get the sea air in your face, so what's not to love. And the stark contrast of city workers going to work in expensive suits lined up with guys with surfboards is enough to tickle your funny bone. So take the ferry to Manly.
Good views. One of the best boat journeys on a commuter boat ever :-)Lovely journey, manly highly recommended for a day out and the views of the circular quay are fantastic

Great way to "Cruise" the Harbour. This is a lovely way to spend the afternoon and get good views of the Harbour Bridge and the opera house. If you stay in Manly for the day there's plenty to do and see including kayaking right from the dock where the ferry pulls in.
Great Ride. Enjoyed ride on Ferry. The view all around was very nice. It took about 18 mins from Circular Quay to Mainly beach. Must visit manly beach by ferry.
Good way to spend an afternoon. But rug up if you want to see anything as you will need to be outside and it was just a little nippy
Visited Manly Sealife. Ferry ride was good and manly was a cool spot it self. it was a rainy day and we thoroughly enjoyed that trip.

good trip. When i lived in Sydney a few years back this was a favorite activity of mine The one day ticket on your day off could take you all over town This was my first trip to Sydney since the Opal card and i found it runs out very quickly. Think it was about $8.40 one way to Manly stillba lovely way to travel and see the famous sights from the sea
FunTime. When we where in Sydney we took a few Ferry rides, and we found it to be a very relaxing way to travel. Very clean and comfortable rides

One of those things you just have to do. There is nothing better than taking a boat ride on Sydney Harbour on the Manly Ferry. When the sun is shining, the views are amazing and if the weather is bad, it becomes a fun ride! Hop off at Manly Wharf and take a stroll around The Esplanade or over to Manly Beach and dig your toes in the sand. Grab some fish and chips and enjoy the adventure. This is a must do when in Sydney.
A Great Way to see the Harbour. After a morning spent on business, we took a ride on the ferry out to Manly. Whatever your budget this is great way to see the harbour.

Fastest trip across the harbour. Manly is worth a visit and the ManlyFastFerry is the way to go. Catch it at Circular Quay and it takes just a few minutes to cross. This is not a sightseeing cruise -- simply the most efficient way to cross.

great value. We went on a sunday and it only cost us $2.50 for the entire trip, including the return trip with the opal travel card which you can purchase at several places in Sydney the wharf and train stations, this card can also be use on the buses/ The Manly ferry was very popular and you can purchase refreshments on board.

Sydney Favorite. A must do! Takes you out of Circle Quay right at the bridge & Opera house for great pics then about a 30 min ride to Manly with great views of the city, Darling harbor, etc. Manly beach has a lot of shops, beach side restraunts & a nice path to Shelly beach. Watch the sunset at the beach and ride the ferry back for a great night time view of all the same Sydney sites. We got some great pics. We road the Ferry 4 times to Manly.
Visit Manly!. We found many souvenirs to be better priced in the Manly Beach area. The ride over and back is enjoyable and the beach is well worth visiting.

Nice ride with great views!!. We have been on the ferry more than once because it is very good. It is cheaper to use the ferry on Sundays so one must keep this in mind. It is the best way to reach places like Watson's Bay and Manly Beach. You get beautiful views of the Harbor Bridge and Opera House. The ride over all is great. Just stand in the breeze and look around you. I would also recommend to take this ferry on a full moon night. The views are more beautiful and pictures shot of the Opera House turn out to be spectacular.

Well worth doing!. I would highly recommend doing this, and if you only want to do it one way definitely do if from Manly into the city. Its best on a sunny day as the views coming into the city are spectacular. Also lovely in the evening maybe after a few drinks when the bridge is lit up.

Great Ferry ride. We took the ferry to Manly bay with very little expectation. The ride took roughly 30 minutes and is very smooth. No chance that any will get sea sickness. There are lots of nice shops in Manly where one can get Australian souvenirs at almost 50% cheaper than what you will get from the city. Nice jerseys, tshirts, boomerangs, caps, and magnets are relatively cheap. The ferry leaves Circular Quay every 30 minutes. One way ferry ride to Manly cost $7.25

Quicker than Driving.... ...I guess because I did not try. The ferry was very quick at about 35 minutes. You just have to remember this leaves from slip 3 cause I did not know this from the get go. Pay for your ticket at any of the booths then go to No. 3. then you are good. Make sure you don't have to wait too long. There is plenty of food and drinks in the area. The nearby Hungry Jack's Frozen Coke for a buck ($AU) is a quick refresher for the ride to Manly, I discovered.

Manly Ferry is a must!. Can't miss this trip across Sydney Bay over to Manly. Go on a Sunday using your Opal card, and the round trip is only 2.5$. Stroll in Manly as long as you like and then head back after sunset to catch a nice night view of the lights on the Opera House. Have fun!
A definite must. Wonderful day trip to Manly. Excellent way to see the stunning Opera House and iconic harbour bridge. Quick, comfortable trip with polite and friendly staff. Definite must

Great day out. I'd really recommend getting the ferry to Manly. You get a great view of the city as you leave and return and manly is a lovely pace to visit. We went for a walk, had a boozy lunch and relaxed on the beach before catching the ferry back and enjoying the view.

Short trip to the Manly Beach area. A must to go place while visiting Sydney, please go and enjoy Manly Beach. After arriving to the Manly Ferry Pier, take a short walk to Manly Beach in the Pacific Ocean side.
This a great place to spend the day with great food and a relaxing beatiful beach area.

Beautiful Sea Ride. Lovely sea ride all the way to manly. Good service by the employees of the NSW transport service. Awesome view of the opera house, harbour bridge and the city skyline on the way to manly.

Go to Manly Beach; you won't regret it.. It takes under an hour to get to Manly Beach on the ferry and it's worth it. The trip is beautiful and Manly Beach has many little stores and restaurants that will keep you busy for as long as you want. If you have any extra time while in Sydney, I recommend a trip there.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. Used Opal card to Manly, return. Travelled mid morning, and returned just after lunch, so was able to get a seat outside in the sun. As others have said, no need to tap off for the Opal card.
Excellent views of Harbour Bridge, Opera House. One of the must dos when in Sydney.
While at Manly, walked to Shelley Beach.

Not to be missed . A trip to Manly is worth the effort and using the iconic Manly Ferry is the way to get a view of the Harbour the Bridge and the Opera House without paying for tour. Using your Opal card if you are a senior you get a maximum charge of $15 a day so you can travel all day on train light rail bus and the ferries. Great value.
Cheap but crowded. If u like to go to manly beach you have to take the Ferry. You can pay cash or with your Opal card. The Ferry is save but crowded and you will have to fight for a seat.

Fab sights of Circular Quay, Opera House and Bridge. Sailing every half hour, the Manley Ferry provides a perfect opportunity to view the Opera House and Bridge from a different angle - great for photos as it's possible to get them both in the background of a selfie if you are standing in the right place on the boat.Crossing to the seaside town of Manley, keep an eye open for the amazing houses on the hillside overlooking the water. Wonder how much these cost and who lives there? Just fabulous!
