A 30mins Relaxing Journey across Sydney Harbour. Riding on the Manly ferry is my favourite compared to the other destinations on Sydney ferries. It is a moderate 30mins ride from Circular Quay to Manly. Most of the other ferry rides are relatively shorter. If you are using the Opal card to travel on this route, you only need to tap on, no need to tap off. The views are beautiful, and the sea breeze or wind is refreshing as you cruise across the harbour. I have taken this ride many times, sometimes during the day, and at other times at night. The night ride is always cooler and more enjoyable.

Breathtaking views. This ferry ride is a must on a sunny day to see the harbour. I gave the manly ferries 3 starts for few reasons, one is they only run every 30 minutes which can get very full, two on the weekends screaming kids who are not supervised by the parents running around can make the journey unpleasant, three the bathrooms are not clean, four if you dont have an outside seat and you are visiting Sydney for the first time it's difficult to see the most magnificent view of the harbour. If you decide to travel on a Sunday it's a lot cheaper. Purchase an opal card near the entrance and you can hop on and of all public transport for just $2.50.

It's Vivid.. Now's a great time to get on a night ferry and cruise around the Harbour.The Vivid festival of lights is starting now,and Highlighting and colouring in of some huge Sydney Buildings is a star attraction.Don't Miss It.
Best Views. A great trip, even if you don't want to go to Manly. Most of Sydney ferries are a great way to get around, and remember seniors card holder, it only costs you $2.50, for all day travel

Great way to spend forty five minutes. Getting across to Manly from Darling Harbour can be done via fast service or if you prefer the more serene pace take the Manly ferry from Circle Quay. Great views, a bar and a great way to see Sydney from the water

RTW trip. The Manly ferry is a quick, reliable and cheap way to get to the sea at Manly beach. Ferries operate every few minutes and are an experience in themselves. Standing out on deck on a hot day is a great way to cool down.

Sydney from the Oceanside . Great way to experience Sydney from the ocean side. As you get on the boat going from Sydney to Manly, I would recommend to sit in the back of the boat and preferably outside if weather permits. On the way back from Manly, sit in the front of the boat. This will allow you to get stellar views of Sydney's iconic landmarks. The journey to Manly is real nice and relaxing. Once in Manly enjoy this neighborhood.
Not to be missed. Go over on this ferryWe loved manly. Have a bite to eat. Good shops.Super 20 min trip .A must do. We did it twice as lost to see

Great day out. Took Manly ferry from Circular Quay on a lovely sunny day and had a wonderful view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge along with harbour and surrounding areas.Ferry on time both ways, very good value for money. If the weather is right, sit outside along the side of the ferry for a great view.

Great day out at Manly Beach. Caught the ferry to Manly, which was really easy and very efficient. A short walk from the ferry dock up the main street and you are on the beach. We walked up the hill to the right of the beach and found a really lovely little cafe.

A great way to see the Harbour, Bridge & Opera House. For a relaxing break from the hubbub around the Harbour, take the ferry (the slow one, not the fast hydrofoils) over to Manly. It's a really great way to get views of the sights from the water. We were sitting next to an elderly gentleman who gave us a running commentary on what we were seeing - as a boy he had worked in the grounds of the Governor's House, which you also pass. On the way back we could see a storm heading our way, and were lucky enough to get back just in time before it poured down! Very good value, very cheap.
Relaxing Travel. Perfect way to get around the main parts of Sydney. Very reasonable price. Great for hopping on and off to visit various sites.

Ferry Interesting !!!!!. Ferry was on time, clean, comfortable and a great opportunity to take pics from a different angle of the Opera House and numerous sites of Sydney from the water. You can conveniently pay for the ferry by swiping your pre-loaded subway pass. You can also update your Facebook page and send Snapchats to friends and family because they offer free WIFI on the ferry. We got around Sydney by train, bus and ferry because my daughter lives in Sydney. If you are a tourist and looking to save some money, I suggest you do some research and pre-planning on-line of how to use the public transportation system to make your short trips a little cheaper than paying for a taxi. We also found that most merchants are very helpful to tourists and answered our questions or provided us with assistance whenever we had questions.
My favourite ferry ride. This is a great public transport to Manly. My favourite ferry ride with gorgeous views from the harbour. It is very cheap and always a pleasure.

Manly Ferry. When you are in Sydney it is well worth a ferry trip over to Manly, there are plenty of restaurants to eat while you are there and some small beaches near the ferry terminal and you can walk to the far side to Manly beach. A nice little trip while you are in Australia.

don't go when there is a storm but fine on a sunny day. this was a great way to get to manly but when we went there was a big storm and the boat went everywhere but on a normal sunny day it well be fine
Good value . A good regular service. The staff are generally polite and happy to help. Travel is good value but if you purchase an Opal card travel becones much cheaper.

Afternoon wander along the beach. A great trip on the train linking to the ferry. A paddle and walk along the beach followed by some stunning seafood watching the sunset. Have to admit a couple of cool Aussie beers.

Nice trip out to Manly. A great short little jaunt out to Manly.with easy walk on and off procedures with a friendly crew and there are ample opportunities for some great photographs in and out of both Manly and Sydney.Restrooms are on board and as well you can purchase coffee and some snacks.In Sydney you tie up/dock next tote train station so you can easily then take the train to wherever you need to go.
Best way to get to Manly. Any visitors to Sydney should hop on the ferry to Manly. Not too fast but comfortable and you can sit inside or get. Great for photo opportunities.Well priced and clean.

Manly Warf Here We Come!!. This was great...sit inside or out and get great views of the Sydney Harbour.....wonderful leisurely ride across to Manly Beach.....opal card is the way to go and if you go on a Sunday, like we did, it's even cheaper!! Plan on spending the day, eat lunch, and just shop!!!! So much to do......
loved this. great little excursion for a Sunday. Ferries are on time and warnings were given about rough water. Manly has many shops, restaurants and beaches to enjoy.

Part of transit system. When we first arrived in the Sydney area we were staying in a caravan park north of Sydney so we used the Manly ferry to get from that area to Sydney. The Manly area itself is well worth a look but the ferry is a fantastic way to get around.

View. I always choose the ferry. I like the boat ride and to look at the view of the opera house from another angle plus I like the ocean in general. If friends come to Sydney to visit me from overseas, I always take them to Manly by ferry. Its peaceful but can get very crowded in the busy times. So if you want a good seat outside you better be early or be the first in line to get in!

Easy to catch.. . Get yourself to Circular Quay and you can go any where on the ferries of Sydney. (Make sure you get Opal card- it's what you use on all forms of transport). Circular Quay (where the Harbour Bridge & Opera house is located) is only a 30minute ferry ride to Manly. Be sure to have your camera ready because the views are amazing on the ferry. Once you arrive Manly be sure to walk down the main road to the main beach. It's a great day out!

The only way to get to Manly. This is a great way to view the harbour and get to Manly without the car traffic worries. Our opal card fee was $7.40 one way I think- cheap. Duration is 30 minutes and regular services every 30 minutes. We always take Sydney visitors on this ferry and then walk back - as far as we can.....beautiful harbour !!!

Being on a ship and not leaving the harbour. Took the whole family for a trip, being a Sunday with the Opal card, very cheap day out. Such a nice way to get around the harbour without having to worry about traffic and lights, everyone enjoyed the day out, visitors to Australia also think this is fantastic as well.
Manly Ferry. See my remarks about about "Sydney Ferries" in general. Would recommend the "old fashioned" ferries, though if in a hurry, the Hydrofoil would also be interesting.

Nice ferry trip to Manly Beach. We took this ferry ride to see Manly Beach. Manly Beach is pretty much similar to Bondi Beach. However, the areas around Manly Beach offered various types of food. The ferry ride itself was excellent, with great views of the surrounding areas.

Sydney's best Commute. We always recommend this ride to our overseas visitors. For much less than what you would pay for a tourist harbour cruise, you can catch the ferry from Circular Quay to manly. You get a 30 minute ride across the harbour, get priceless photos of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, and Sydney's foreshores. You can get off at Manly, explore this beachside suburb, have a meal and catch the ferry back. With 20 minute service at peak times, and 1/2 hourly otherwise, its a great way to spend an hour or a day.

Outstanding ride from Manly to Circular Quay. Ferry is easy to use and runs frequently. About a 25 minute ride form Manly to Circular Quay. We went to a show at Sydney Opera House and rode ferry back to Manly.

Beautiful spot. Definetly catch the ferry to manly comfortable seating smooth 30 minute trip across harbour beautiful sights food and toilets available. Inside or outside seating, boats leaving every 30 mins. Beautiful place to visit

Best ferry service in the world. Cities such as San Francisco can only dream of a system such as this one. The ferries in Sydney are efficient, reasonably priced and take passengers around one of the most beautiful harbours in the world. We love using Trip View Lite app to hop on and off ferries. They always arrive at the scheduled times and offer spectacular scenery. Our favourite trip is to catch the Circular Quay ferry to Luna Park, walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge and catch the Darling Harbour ferry around to the Maritime Museum at Pyrmony. A great day out!

Manly beach on a dull day! . It was a windy cloudy day when we took the ferry to manly but we enjoyed a view of the harbour regardless - stopped at Manley beach for a coffee and a walk through Corso mall then back to Sydney

Sit back and enjoy.. We took the ferry across to Manly for lunch and a walk around shopping area.With the concession as a pensioner it is a no brainer to move your car in Sydney we got a $2.50 ticket all day travel and that's one reason we used Ferry.
Manly Ferry. A great way to go to Manly is by ferry ! Also a great way to see Sydney by the water , beautiful views

Enjoyable ride. Manly ferry is worth the trip. Views are exceptional on both sides. Going past the heads is awesome as much larger than looks from long way away. There is a cafe on board as well plus toilets. A beautiful clear calm day is better especially if with children.
Brings you to Manly. Does what it says. Brings you to and from Manly on a ferry. Can be rammed jammed on a sunny summers day so arrive early

Link to a walk to North Head. The ferry trip to a manly on a sunny Sunday was so fun, and an unexpected bonus was a surf-lifesavers carnival on the main beach, in addition to the small Sunday market in a street off the Corso. We took a bus to North Head and walked the easy trails, which include a set of memorials to various Army units, to the lookouts over the sea to the east and south. Make sure to check the times of the bus, as not all go right to the beginning of the trail at the former barracks, and the last service is rather early in the day despite it being summer EDT.

Take The FastFerry. A beautiful, affordable, comfortable ride on the Fast Ferry to Manly and back. Comfortably sit inside (with plugs to charge your electronics) or outside (to feel the wind upon your face) and a simple bar onboard!
Trip to Manly. Travelled mainly for the beach. Received commentary on the way and back. Ferry clean and tidy. Smooth journey with various areas of interest pointed out along the way

Go on a wet and windy day on an older ferry. This is an opportunity to get on the harbour when the weather turns wet and windy.Ferrys are a great way to see the harbour shoreline. Ferrys take many routes. The best route on a windy day is too Manly.Stand at the front and take the sea breeze and the spray; and enjoy daily life as it might have been in the 40s, 50s and 60s.

Fast quick and reliable. Used the service a few times and as we were staying close to the quay area easy to find and use.Quick efficient service regular timetable and price acceptable - makes getting to a lovely area very easy.
Nice ride even though it's slow. If you are going to Sydney, you should be going for a visit to Manly and sure you can get there on the fast boat but it's so much more enjoyable on the Manly Ferry :)

Great way to see the Sydney harbour. We were in Manly and decided to take the ferry to get to Sydney. Coming around the corner and seeing the opera house and Sydney harbour bridge is amazing. The ride was very pleasant and as we travelled on a Sunday, it only cost $2.50 each. What a great way to travel.

Best way to travel in Sydney!. The Manly Ferry is a great way to travel in Sydney! It is a direct ferry from Circular quay to Manly and takes about 20 mins. You go past the Opera house and you get great views of the bridge. A great perk is on Sundays all journeys are capped at $2.50 which is a bargain!

Several different options. Go to doc six and you will have options of "fast ferry", captain Cook or public ferry. We used public once to manly and Fast Ferry to zoo then many again.Public is more frequent and very nice large older boats.Fast Ferry had a bar and snacks, relatively new boats and "Fast"!Either is fine. Views are fantastic so be prepared with camera!

Must do if you want to see Sydney from a different perspective . Loved the ferry trip from Manly to the Harbour. Was really calm so don't worry about feeling seasick. The views are amazing, sit on the left / port side of the boat for the best views on the opera house. Boat docks right by the opera house and the Sydney bridge so you can then easily explore the centre on foot.

Always fun to travel by ferry to Manly. The ferry to Manly is an absolute MUST for any visitor to Sydney. For a small fare, you get to sail across Sydney harbour, past the Sydney Opera House, with a view of the Harbour Bridge in the background!! What could EVER beat that for value for money? It's a pleasant trip and at the destination a feast of food, fun and festivity awaits. From decadent varieties of ice cream, to pies, seafood and traditional fish and chips, your taste buds will thank you. Head off to the white sandy beach, catch a wave, build sandcastle or just relax with coffee for a friendly chat with friends. Oh yes, the Manly Ferry is a HUGE favourite with this traveller!
Always great to take the ferry Manly. Visiting our customer who is located around Manly we always take the ferry to get to Manly wharf. It's the most relaxing half hour of traveling you can think of.

A must for vistors. Brought my relatives from Melbourne on a trip from Manly to Circular Quay . Was a first time for them after many years and they felt it was still a most memorable experience especially being a pleasant summer day . The harbour sights would have to be some of the best in the world and the Manly Ferry trip a must for interstate and overseas visitors; especially with so much to entertain you at either end with shops, restaurants and sightseeing!

Take the ferry instead. This was my 2nd visit to Manly and I drove there this time which I concluded that the ferry (during my 1st visit) will be a better experience! The traffic and parking....yucks!

Efficient and scenic transport. You can take the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay, wharf 3, but check the electronic board in front of each wharf for times and wharf number in case of any changes. You can use your opal card, just swipe when you get on. This particular trip, you do not need to swipe your card when you leave as it deducts the trip when you get on. Other ferries you wipe getting on and getting off. The trip is about 35-40 minutes and very scenic thru Sydney Harbor. It is very efficient and timely and with ample staff both on the wharf and on the ferry itself. Inside and outside seating, lower deck has snack bar. Loved it.

Pleasant outing. Caught the ferry to see Manly. Smooth ride and great scenery. Manly very pretty with good shops and plenty of bars, cafes, restaurants etc along the side streets. Felt a very safe area to walk around. People very friendly and the beach was very big with soft sand. Sea was a little rough though tomswim in.

Iconic 30 min ferry city - Manly. Using an Opal Pre paid electronic card, this enables use of this ferry taking about 30 minutes between the city and Manly. You pass great history, cruise ships, sailing boats, and the entrance to the Harbour "The Heads", and it can be choppy or breezy. Watch out for the very confident seagulls that will cheekily swoop down and grab your food! An iconic well run service, every 20 minutes and more during the rush hours, and use the Sydney City Ferries not other private 5 times the cost cruisers. This is fun, and very enjoyable and great fun. Windy days and turbulent currents make it a thrill ride!

amazing views. The last time we took the ferry to Manly was 8 years ago. Then the ferry used was much smaller and packed with passengers. The ride was choppy especially in the open sea.This recent trip was a pleasant surprise. A bigger boat with larger capacity, comfortable seating and a smoother ride. Slight choppiness in the open sea but lasted only a couple of minutes.The views are amazing with the Opera House, the Harbor Bridge and the surrounding bays.A trip to Sydney is incomplete without the ferry ride to Manly. The beautiful harbor bridge is a sight to behold.We told the evening ferry ride back to the city to catch the sunset. This is even more breathtaking. With the sun setting behind the Harbor Bridge, the sight is unforgettable.Highly recommended.

Amazing views. You cannot go to Sydney without taking the Manly ferry. Get on at Circular Quay wharf 3 towards Manly beach. Sit outside and enjoy Sydney Harbour view. Once you tap on the wharf, your Opal is already charged. So don't go tap on and tap off like it will get reversed.
Amazing 30 min. Great views. Perfect on a sunny day. Especially at harbour bridge and opera house awesome scenes. Very quick and enjoyable trip.
A Convenient Way to Travel. The ferry was a convenient way to get to Manly, its beach, and the restaurant that we wanted to go to there.

On your way to one of Sydney's top spots "Manly". Catch the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and you will have the best harbour cruise on public transport. Great skylines of Sydney to photograph or video. Sailing past the Opera House and fantastic views of the Harbour Bridge it's pure joy. You can easily spend a day in Manly and likely want to go there again. Great beaches, restaurants, walking tracks and much more. Go and explore, you will not be dissapointed.
Enjoyed. Try to sit in the front, outside for the views of the harbor, ships, boats. It's about a 30 minute ride so you get to see a lot.
beautiful view. Just take the ferry, sit on the right side and you can have the best view over sydney harbour and circular quay! without paying too much
Go to Manley. Great way of getting to Manley, a place where everyone should visit. Lovely beaches and plenty people surfing. Ferrys run lots through the day and are relatively cheap.

One of the best Ferry trip in Sydney.. By far one of the best ferry trip in Sydney. In all it's an half an hour journey from Circular Quay to Manly. Great opportunity to take pictures of both the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Once at Manly you can enjoy as much as 30 mins or a few hours walking along the beach or looking at the Manly Aquarium.
The Manly ferry is a must. If your in Sydney you have to do the Manly ferry. Great views of the harbour and opera house. Definitely worth doing on a Sunday as its caped at $2:50 for the day.

Good way to see the Bay. We really enjoyed the Manly Ferry ride, but loved the port even more. Short walk from the pier to the beach down a palm lined street with many shops and restaurants. The beach is super even in the fall (May). There are picnic benches so you can take your own food if you wish and eat on the shore.Since the ferry is on the Opal Card, very easy to access. We spent about two hours here and then headed to another bay. Easy to see more than one in a day and with a $15 daily expense limit, definitely a good use of dollars.

Manly. Don't miss a visit to Manly on the ferry. It is a half hour one way journey and affords great views of much of Sydney Harbour bay and it passes the entry to the bay which is remarkably narrow. Manly itself is well worth a visit. Very pleasant ambience and a beautiful beach. Lots of shops and good value bars and restaurants and certainly cheaper than central Sydney.

Nice view of harbour. Came recommened by friend. Went on a Sunday so roundtrip was included in $2.50 all-day fare. First attempt fell apart because of medical emergency wanted to transfer us all by bus so went in afternoon instead. Nice for views and spent brief amount of time in Manly itself.
So much to see. So much to see, fast and enjoyable. Wasn't sea sick at all but others were. Good price. Fun and well scheduled for tourists. Seating and standing outside.

Manly trip. Great view of harbourside properties as far as Watson's Bay and then a stroll through Manly to the beach. The return journey allows good views of the northern coastline. Good value and trip not too long for any dodgy sailors. Avoid on Sundays as crowded+++.

One of my favourite things to do on Sydney Harbour. On a sunny day or moon lit evening there is not much better way to view Sydney Harbour than by catching a ferry to or from Manly. Usually a ferry one way and the fast cat the other. Manly Wharf is also a great place to catch a meal or drink. From here it's a short walk to Manly Beach along Manly Corso shopping strip. The real joy however is the ferry trip

a relaxing way to travel.... this my preferred way of traveling to manly. i always find it relaxing (weather permitting). enjoying the rolls of waves and breathing in the sights is the only way to go!

scenic ferry ride. as all ferries go, this does its job. but it does offer a good vantage point to look back at the opera house and the harbour for photos - pretty nice!! i took this to also go visit manly beach

Best public transport views. The manly Ferry is a great way to get to see the harbour and helps you realise how vast it is, it is also a great way to get to Manly.
The price is reasonable , the views are great and it is a nice way to kill a couple of hours. Manly itself is very overrated.

A great way to spend a day in Sydney.. During our April vacation in Sydney, we had to visit one our their famous beaches. Catching the bus from our hotel to the Circular Quay was very easy. This brought us right down to Sydney Harbor and a short walk to the Manly Ferry terminal. We used our bus Opal passes to catch the ferry for a short ride to Manly. We visited the area for about four hours and rode the ferry back to Sydney Harbor.

Great way to see the harbour. The 'slow ' ferry to Manly only takes about 30 minutes. It doe give you a chance to a feel for the size of part of Sydney harbour. You get great vioews of the bridge and Opera house.

Perfect Sydney view. The Manly Ferry gives you some of the best views on the City, the Botanic Garden, the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. It is worth taking only for the views, but in the end it takes you to one of the best beaches.

Traverse the waterways. Take the Manly Ferry, see the Sydney waterways at a bargain price, land in Manly and enjoy the atmosphere, cafes, bars, pubs and restaurants. There's even breweries there 4 Pines a favourite haunt !

Relaxing way to fill in the time.. Having exhausted our energy with sight seeing around Sydney, but with the afternoon to fill we hopped on the Many Ferry (Cost $2.50 for a Gold Opal Card from Central Station for seniors). This was a great way to see the beauty of the Harbour, its many islands and small beaches and inlets-not to mention the waterfront mansions. Manly provided many options for shopping, dining, wining, and had some lovely art deco buildings. The beach was busy, surf was up- lovely. The return trip in the late afternoon light was fantastic- especially as we passed the Opera House.

WONDERFUL WAY TO SEE THE HARBOUR. A cheap and beautiful trip from Circular Quay to Manly. We visit Sydney frequently and never get tired of the Manly Ferry. Get an outside seat if you can and sit back and enjoy one of the most spectacular harbours in the world.

Nice way to visit Sydney Harbour. We took the ferry on a lovely sunny Sunday and headed to Manly Beach. Once there we strolled down the main street to the beach itself. We watched the surfers, old and young. We had lunch. We just spent the day there and it was a lovely day. On the way back we just took the ferry back and enjoyed watching each stops on our way back to circular quay.

Never fails to be the best way to see the harbour. I've been on this ferry many times over the years and I still love it. It doesn't matter the weather or the seat. Only take the slow ferry, who wants to rush?

Great way to cruise Sydney harbour by simply taking the ferry. The Manly trip is deservedly popular and recommended if visiting Sydney. It's trip takes in most of the east side of the harbour and Manly has its own very good beach if you visit for that purpose. As a tourist it is a good value trip to understand the essence of Sydney which is its harbour. Take the Parramatta River ferry to take in the west side of the Sydney waterway.

A great ride out to Manly!. One of the best parts of getting about Sydney is taking ferries and going to Manly on the ferry is amazing. I did it the first time 8 years ago and then last March and it's still such a nice trip. Relaxing and full of great scenery and heaps of fresh air. I loved it and think that getting to Manly is half the fun of going there.

Summer delight. The wharf look old but the ferries leave on time its a very cheap on Sunday the trip from the wharf to manly is about 25 minutes its nice to sit in front of the ferry with a pie and chips staffs are quite friendly. Sometimes it can be very challenging when the sea is rough but its all fun.Travelling on the ferry when you visit sydney is a good idea have fun.

You get so much for paying so little. A free from no 3 will take you an island which is as beautiful as it is captivating. Hire a bike when you get there to see the many beaches and wonderful suburbs. Caution it can be hilly but if you take your time then do it. Trust us, a great day out for such little outlay

Manly ferry. A nice boat trip to Manly Beach, cheap and with great views of Sydney itself. Boattrips are always a recommendation because of the perspective from a distance onto the city. Manly Beach is a good place to enjoy the Ocean, for me a better place than the more famous Bondi Beach. This is because there are lots of nice shops restaurants and bars available alongside the beach. Worthwhile a trip.

Low Cost Harbor Tour. Of course, there wasn't audio; but, the sights on the way to Manley Beach were spectacular. Find a spot outside near the bow. Place your bag on the bench and stand against the rail. We found one on the starboard/right side and have a great view of the Opera House. There is an express ferry; but, we weren't in a hurry.

The sights of the city at commuter prices. Running every half hour the ferry trip to Manly is a stunning way to see the wonderful Sydney Harbour by day or by night.In fact travel from Circular Quay across to Manly in the day. You can walk across the narrow strip between the harbour and the ocean beach and go surfing or sit and have a coffee. Take the harbour walk around to Fairy Bower, visit the weekend markets.Visit one of the many restaurants or a local hotel.At the end of the day catch one of the evening ferries back to the city and look at the city by night! Wow that is some view

That was fun.. A nice day to be out on the harbour. The trip from Circular Quay to Manly was a great opportunity to see more of the harbour sights. Great views and the harbour bridge, the Opera House, the navy yards and as a bonus a submarine was heading into port as we travelled toward Manly.

Great views of the city!. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly on a weekday morning at around 8.40, it was very empty, even the quay area wasn't as busy as I had expected it to be. Obviously boats coming into the city were busy. Lots of seating on different levels and both inside and outside. Facilities were clean and well maintained. There is a cafe on board although we didn't use it. Free wifi while on board. Great views on both journeys. Cost AUD 17-18.00 per adult return.
Very handy!. It was great to have such an easy way of getting to/from Manly. We went to Manly for a day out at the beach and it was so easy. A very relaxing and serene ferry ride, with great views.
Quick Ferry. We used this one in preference to the harbour ferry, quicker. Was on time, and more comfortable that the other ones. Worth the extra.
Very peaceful and restful. This is a lovely way to get from the city to Manly particularly in off-peak when it is not crowded and when the seas are calm. A great way to relax.

An Afternoon in Manly Is Worth It. The ferries are fast and clean and easy to negotiate the pass system. We would have liked to stay longer than lunch and a stroll and to do a few of the coastal walks.
love ferries. Great trip, comfortable reliable and on schedule See more of the harbors and then in to the tourist area and clean quiet streets and shops travelled Jan2014

Discover the harbour- go to Manly. Buy an Opal card and discover the harbour- Manly is a lovely part of town. After your trip over wander amongst the shops and cafes/restaurants or discover the beaches on a diy walking tour. Its as easy or hard as you want it to be.Then enjoy a quiet shandy at the Manly wharf hotel before you head home.Always an enjoyable outing.

What a beautiful ride. We rode the ferry from the Quay to Manly terminal as a 1/2 day trip. The ferry was an excellent and comfortable way to see the sights of the Harbour and to be to beautiful Manly Beach.Manly has a very nice beach and hundreds of nice restaurants and shoppes. The beach is about a three block walk from the ferry terminal. We walked one of the trails that start and end at the ferry terminal along the beaches and to the National Park that sits above Manly. There were many spectacular views of the waves crashing on the rocks below and we were able to see beautiful views. You should wear sturdy shoes and carry water if you decide to walk the trails but they are worth it.The visitors center at the ferry terminal provided us maps and directions. They encourage us to carry water and there any many free water bottle filling fountains all along the town center and beach area. Manly was beautiful and clean, and the people were friendly and helpful.A great side trip as part of a Sydney visit.
Inexpensive and good. Easy to find and easy to access with public transport why pay the fast private ferry when you want to see the scenery. Enough space and very comfy seats.

A fantastic way to see the harbour. Every visitor to Sydney should take this ferry over to Manley and back. The fare is inexpensive, and the views of the harbour and beautiful waterfront houses are superb.

Awesome ferry ride.. What an enjoyable 1/2 hr ferry ride this is. You get to see Sydney's harbor first hand and how beautiful it is. We went on a Sunday, the fare was only $2.50 each....that's super cheap!! ( I think this might have been a one off special) From memory they leave every 1/2 hr from wharf no. 3, so plenty to choose from. To come back they also leave every 1/2 hr and last service was well into the night.

Manly on a Sunday. We used our Opal Card to the max last Sunday. You can travel anywhere on a Sunday in Sydney for $2.50 so we caught the train into Circular Quay, then the ferry to Manly. Clockwork precision timetable, beautiful photo opportunities, walked to the beach and the markets. Had an icecream and then caught the ferry back. So check and got the best photos!
Smooth saling. Had an enjoyable trip across to Manly. Saturday morning, so lots of markets and a school fair. Lovely swim in sea, so warm and clear, clear water

Cheap way to see more of the City.. I think in only costed about $16 AUD to ride the ferry all the way over to Manly beach. The beach was gorgeous! We didn't get a chance to walk the National park like I would have loved to do, but the views from the beach were spectacular.

Best ferry trip. To truly enjoy Sydney Harbour take this ferry, personally I just love the breathtaking city views you get, particulartly of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge, as you approach from Manly.The trip is 40 minutes each way, buy an Opal card and it will cost you less than purchasing a ticket at Circular Quay ( you also get to avoid the queues). Also make sure you get off the ferry and spend time in Manly, you could easily make it a day trip, go to the beach, have breakfast or lunch, visit SeaLife (not sure if that is it's correct name). I never get bored of this ferry trip.
Fun day trip. Great ferry ride to see the area and Manly is a wonderful destination. Not a fancy ferry, but worth the trip especially if you are a visitor.

Just t ride the ferry to Manly was a highlight as well as walking around The Corso.. Plenty of great restaurants in Manly to choose from. Lots of varied cuisines available and many have fantastic views right opposite the beach.
Excellent value for money. Brilliant trip, great staff, Really enjoyed the views and a great way to see the Opera house and bridge.
A must do. The Best view of Sydney Harbour with the Opera House is the view from the harbour on the Manly Ferry. Great fish and chips in Manley and sandy beaches too.
nice day trip to Manly. Lovely day trip to Manly, walk around town, have a beer at the ferry building, then get ferry back. Good swell made it exciting

Perfect Sunday activity . Sunday is the best day to visit manly as transport is cheaper $2.50 rather than $15Cute little island with lots of unique shops.Nice restaurants and bars - a little pricey The beach is great on a nice day Overall lots to do

Highly recommended, a MUST DO in Sydney. I went to Manly by ferry on a bright sunny morning and it was best time for photo shooting of the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge. Highly recommended because the ferry ride was very pleasant.
Inexpensive way to see the harbour. This is very popular on a weekend with locals all going to enjoy Manly beach. An experience in itself.

Best value in Sydney. I recently took my overseas relatives to manly for lunch and went via the manly ferry. it is the cheapest way to view our fantastic harbour. No matter how many times I have been on the ferry I always enjoy the trip.

Great day out. A wonderful family day trip, great beach, shops and cafes.
The tip is to buy an Opel travel card, it's valid for 9 years and your train, ferry and bus trips are at local rates. Big savings and just top up.
Also Sunday is only $2.50 to Manly instead of $16 return.
Easy transportation.. The central location and ease of using the ferry was great. Multiple locations can be reached on the ferry system.
Manly is a must. The Ferry ride to Manly was beautiful, we spent the day at Manly beach, this is worth a day while in Sydney.

U must get this!!. There are 2 ferries to Manly (go there for Manly beach - beautiful place). There is a high speed ferry taking approx 20mins (direct) and costing $18Aus (u can't use the Opal travelcard on this service). Or there is the state run ferry service where u can use their transit card (Opal - similar to London's 'Oyster card') which takes longer as it stops off at other places (nice if u want to take ur time) and costs c$11Aus
Terrific experiene. Th best Harbour Trip we reckon, even better than Hong Kong!On a good day I wonder whether others think the same.
GO MANLY Ferry. While in Manly a stroll to the Aquarium, or Beach for a View, Swim or Surf is highly recommended for the young and anyone not so young who love water.

Late night visit to Manly beach. Visiting Manly beach via ferry from Circular Quay.After dark on our last night in Sydney, we enjoyed a relaxing ferry ride to Manly.The rush was over only 50 or so people on a calm, not cold evening.To stroll hand in hand through the near empty mall towards the open sea.Sunday10.00 pm only a few people to enjoying the misty view & serenity.Who else saw this side of Manly? All peace & quiet until tomorrow!

A must do. Really the only way to travel into Sydney in my view! The entrance into Circular Quay, with the Opera House on one side and the Sydney Harbour Bridge on the other, plus the backdrop of the city behind, is really quite something.

Fantastic views and value. The trip to Manly was better than Manly Beach itself!
The ferry is quite choppy but then why wouldn't it be?!
The views are spectacular and worth doing just for that.

Disappointing Manley on a Wet Day. Disappointing because it was cold, cloudy and wet. On a sunny day it is transformed but it is a bit like Blackpool with a couple of superb beaches. Disembark the Manley Ferry and a 5 minute walk takes you from the Sydney Harbour side to the Pacific coast side and beaches. Best parts for me are the walks you can do from Manley. Some lovely walks depending on your energy levels.
No better way to get to Manly!. The slower the ferry, the better, as there's so much to see, as you take this bargain basement approach to a Sydney Harbour tour!
great way to see the harbour. Very efficient and easy to negotiate as a tourist. Just make sure you get on the right ferry. It is worth it to see Many and the beaches

A great way to see the sights in the Harbour and travel to Manly. A very economical way to see Sydney Harbour and travel to Manly. Great views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge, mainly smooth seas. Frequent service.Lots to see and do at Manly too.

Don't book a harbour cruise!. Take the ferry instead and have a nice meal over at manly. That is the only advice I can give as it makes for a great day and gives so many options, such as chose your favourite type of food and timing your trip to see the harbour in it's many faces, can't beat sunset.
Love this harbour . Arguably one of the best harbours in the world.What a great way see it from a ferry.Circular quay to manly on one of the slower ferrys is a fantastic trip.

Sydney must do!! . Great for the day you head out to see Opera House and Harbour Bridge as the ferry is right there. The ferry to Manly runs about every hour / half hour even. The cost was $15.60 return (we didn't have an Opal card). Ferry duration is like 20 minutes each way and a great way to get a different view of the sights. Try to sit on the outside seats on the side of the boat for the best photo opportunities!!

A cheap way to see the harbour. The ferry runs from early morning to mid evening , it's not fast but cheap to travel and you can see much of the harbour and views of the bridge and opera house in a journey of about twenty minutes . This takes you to the delightful beachside location of Manley with plenty of cafes , restaurants and scenic walks along the cliffs .

Circular quay to Manley Beach on the Ferry. One of the best ways to see some of the sights of SydneyGreat views of the harbour bridge and Opera house.At just over $15 dollars for a return trip it is the most reasonable way of doing a harbour cruise.The trip to Manly runs every half hour and takes about 40 minutes.Leaves from Quay 3Spend a few hours strolling around the shops at Manly and enjoy an ice cream sitting on Manly's wonderful beach.

Worth doing. This was good as the weather was great, it's very busy so be prepared to queue. A point of interest, we are seniors and had purchased opal cards at central and the return ferry price was included in our capped transport price for the day $2.50?Manly was a good way to spend the day

Great views, sea air but can get very busy. I went to Manly. Ferries every 30 mins, fast and efficient with some breathtaking views.The ferries can get very busy and getting on and off is a bit of a scrum.Also, as you approach Manly, there are some big swells. Even though the ferry is quite big, it rolls up, down and sideways.
Manly transort made easy. The ferry to Manly is not fast, but the trip is so picturesque that it doesn't matter. The boat is clean, well appointed and comfortable.

An easy, relaxing trip. My daughter and I were off to Manly for the day. It was so easy catching the Manly ferry, they leave every half hour from Circular Quay. It was only $15.00 round trip, you can either buy a ticket, (which is great for out of towners) or use the Opal travel card. The views are wonderful and how relaxing to get so far out of town avoiding the traffic rush.The areas on board were spacious and catered for all types of travellers. If I lived here I would be using the ferry for my commutes.

Superb cheap trip.. I guess this ferry was originally introduced for commuters from Manly to Sydney - but these days there are more tourists using it for a cheap harbor cruise - and why not? A$15 return is great value and Manly is a super place to while away a few hours walking along the beach or eating a lunch at one of the many nice restaurants. Don't miss!

Magical afternoon trip.. I travelled on the fast ferry over and enjoyed the speed. Coming back I did a scenic trip ion the fast ferry and totally loved it. We headed out to the Heads then meandered to some other harbour highlights. So relaxing and beautiful. A great cup-filler and felt grateful for a blissful trip in a beautiful place!!

The busiest ferry in Sydney. " love it or hate it " . These ferries are always busy but once again on the weekend it's crazy busy. They are also expensive so if you want to save money then go on Sunday because on opal card it's $2.50 using any transport in Sydney (including Ferries) so I would recommend Sunday because of the price. Once again they do have WIFI on board but most of the time I tried to use it doesn't work. The ride it self takes 30 minutes from Circular Quay but of course there is also faster service with different company but it costs more. They also have cafe on board which serves light food with pre made sandwiches. I had coffee twice from them and both times I had coffee I felt I was drinking tea. The milk was really hot and burnt. Once you arrive to Manly I would recommend visiting the North Head national park because the views are magnificent.
The Best Harbour Cruise. Don't spend a fortune on Harbour cruises when you can see the best views for less than $10 each and get to visit beautiful Manly.
Day Trip. Went for the day and throughly enjoyed the experience. Ferry such a bargain with magnificent views. Leaves every 30 minutes. Manly such a nice one day trip.

Great views and a nice destination. Having walked around Sydney for some hours we decided to take a ferry ride to Manly. These Sydney ferries are great and the Manly trip is one of the longer rides ( as is Watson's Bay on the other arm of the harbour opening) giving great views of Sydney from the water. Definitely do one of these ferries even if you haven't time to explore at the destination. It doesn't have to be Manly unless you want to visit the area.

Great Views. This is a nice and affordable way for seeing around the bay, getting a different perspective of the Opera and the bridge, and of course, walking around in Manly that is a great experience.

Wonderful trip and experience. The best $13 you can spend is going to Manly and return on the ferry. The views exiting and entering Circular Quay are amazing. See the active harbour boat activity up close and feel the slight turbulence as you leave exit the heads. Have a meal at the pub at Manly on the beach and if a nice day if the upstairs area is open, a great place to have a drink and view the beach.

A must do for any visitor to Sydney.. See Sydney harbour from its best viewpoint, an upper deck on the ferry. Good value and get to have a walk around the slightly touristy charm of Manly thrown in for free.

Great views from the Manly Ferry. We took the ferry to get to Manly and we got the best views of the bay, Opera House and bridge, as we approached Manly you get this beautiful view of the pine trees that are so much part of their city.On our return it was early evening and as we were approaching Sydney the sun started to go down, with beautiful combination of colors. It's a great opportunity for amazing photos....I will do it all over again!! This is also a quite inexpensive experience and also to be able to witness such great views

A must do in sydney . This is a must do activity in sydney. Amazing views from public transport - and you can spend the day (or overnight) in manly where there are plenty of cafes, shops and great beaches (don't swim where the ferry comes in - walk straight ahead through the town and you'll get to the beach on the ocean side. This is much nicer - and from here you can walk left along the beach or right and follow the oath around to quieter Shelley beach)
This is what Sydneysiders enjoy. Just a beautiful ride passing many sights and landing you in an even more beautiful place. The Manly ferry is iconic and amazing in every respect.

Great trip for all ages. We like to go to Manly. We go there about 2-3 times a year, sometimes more. The ferry trip is the best. Free wifi, toilets available, food. Heaps of seating, and standing room, and even then, you can go upstairs or downstairs, inside or outside back or front! The trip is quite smooth, except if the weather is bad, and the sea is rough.The ferrys leave every 10-20 minutes.Tgeir very reliable, and the staff that operate them are always very polite and helpful!

First thing to do in Sydney!!. Without doubt, this is the best, cheapest, way to appreciate what a beautiful city Sydney is!! Hop down to Circular Quay no.3 wharf, buy a return ticket, and away you go!! ferries run every half hour, and take half an hour each way. Get off in Manly, walk up The Corso to South Steyne surfing beach, buy an icecream, and watch the locals! Return at leisure.
Beautiful Beach. Nice ride on the ferry giving you an opportunity to view the harbor from a different perspective. Nice cafes and shops to visit as well as the beautiful beach

Great day trip. We had a great day going to Manly on the ferry, the weather was sunny and warm and the water was calm it couldn't have been a better day! Loved the views around the harbour. It was school holidays so the ferry was full but still felt roomy. Manly was worth seeing but the ferry ride was the highlight.

Don't miss sunset on the Many Ferry. Took the ferry over to Many.. Wow so popular... Not many cafes offering cake and coffee when you get there, but the ice crean at the Manly terminal is amazing.. You might want to wait until the ferry crowds gave gone, before you buy one though. They did offer drinks on the ferry on the way over if you can't wait to dock... But the real reason I'm writing is the amazing sunset trip back from Manly to the quay.. A must do, standing outside on the deck, the sillouette of the hills, the sun reflecting off the water, the amazing colours as you approach the bridge... Priceless.. Loved it.. Better than the lights at night although they are pretty good too.

Great way to get around!. As a Sydney resident my whole life, i remember as a child going on the Manly ferry, an attraction i still commonly do now! For tourists, this is a great way to get around and see the harbour. Plus on Sunday it is $2.50, very affordable. Sometimes it may get a bit rough when passing the heads, but not too bad. Then once you are on the other side, beautiful Manly awaits...

The perfect way to travel. The Manly Ferry is an institution and if visiting visiting Sydney is the only way to get to Manly. With the chance to view all of the beaches and bays, Its also very good value. The ferries run regularly so there is no panic if running late.

Great way to get a good view of Sydney Harbour. The ferry goes every half hour from circular quay. Is very inexpensive and takes about half an hour to Manly. Walk down the main street to the ocean and have a lunch of fish and chips on the beach.

The best transport. These ferrys are the best way to around to see other districts in Sydney. As this was our third visit we decided to go to other areas and it was a lovely couple of days. It is worth the watch to see these expert workers how the sail these ferrys especially at the weekend

Best way to get to Manly!. This is so easy and organised. About a half hour trip across the harbour. About $14.50 return. If you use your Opal card its free travel after you spend $15 in a day so its great value.

Best way to get to Manly. Manly can be such a pain to drive to or park at so I always choose this option. Great views on the way. Sit outside for air and the best views. If not in the city get a bus or train to Circular Quay then the Ferry to Manly. Much cheaper and easier than driving.

A must do in Sydney. The Manly ferry is a cheap way to see some of the most iconic sights in Sydney. I highly recommend it for all visitors. It's a half hour journey from the city with plenty of amazing photo opportunities. Enjoy!
A must-do in Sydney. This ferry trip gives great opportunities to photograph the Sydney harbour and icons. The bonus is Manly Beach which is a pleasant place to explore.

Great way to see the harbour. The ferry to Manly is another must do while in Sydney you get to see the whole harbour and all the little bays etc one of the best views of the Opera House and the Harbour bridge from the sea.

Nice day trip. We went to Manly with the ferry, and while Manly was also worth a visit (if one has more than a few days in Sydney), the ferry ride was the best: great view onto the opera house and the city, past all sorts of ships, we even saw dolphins. Very nice!

Beautiful views at a great value. Take the longer, scenic route. If you go in the afternoon and return after dark you get the best of both worlds! I recommend sitting in the back for the ride out to Manly and in the front for the return. If you're lucky, a cruise ship will be departing the harbor and you'll get to stop and admire the skyline for a while!

Great first ferry trip. We travelled across to Manley Wharf on a Sunday. It's only $2.50 all day travelling on a Sunday, so it gets busy. Go early & it's not too bad. Buy your Opal card before travelling, so easy. (Like a London Oyster card)
Great service . Amazingly good value for money, the ferries are a relaxing way to get about. Also gives you a new angle to photograph the opera house.
Harbour sightseeing . Beautiful morning round trip to Manly on the ferry. This gave us great views of the Opera House, city skyline and Harbour Bridge. There is a snack bar on ferry.
Great tourist Day Trip. If you are visiting Sydney a day trip to Manly is a must. Jump on the ferry, have lunch in manly and then cruise back. Perfect
Fabulous place to Go and Eat, walk the cliffs. Watch the world go bye. Swim in season. Walk to Shelly Beach, eat @ Garfish. A spectacular day if it's nice!

Convenient and on time. A great ferry to get to manly beach. I was on a business trip and took the ferry to the beach on a Sunday. It was a little crowded but nothing unbearable. It was easy to manage with plenty of staff to answer my questions.

TRAVEL on SUNDAY!. Taking the ferry to Manly offers some GREAT views of the Bridge and Opera house. Manly is also fun to walk around. More important, if you take the ferry on Sunday, the fare is capped at $2.5 if you have an Opal card. Be sure and get an Opal card when you arrive. Make sure you do not put more on the card than you will use. There are no refunds and you buy in $10 increments.

Manly ferry- do it! Great day!. Went to Manly -on the fast boat there.. - An on the manly slow ferry back. Both were excellent.. Got a seat easily.. Only took 20/25 mins from circular quay.. A beaut day out ..
Sydney visitors. Travelling to Sydney and seeing the harbour is a fantastic experience. The Manly Ferry gives a great trip, try out in daylight, have dinner and back in the dark to see the lights

One of the longer routes from Circular Quay into the Harbour. A 'must do' trip if you want to see a little bit of the fantastic Sydney Harbour. Some of the ferries go direct to Manly (30-35 minutes) whilst others stop at various points along the way (up to 60 minutes). At the end of the ferry ride get off the ferry, walk directly forward over the small Manly town road. Through the delightful town to the famous & beutiful Manly Beach. Lots of interesting surfer & other shops & cafes along the way. Be prepared for one of the best public beaches in the World

Most enjoyable. Never took this ferry when I lived in Syndey. Did I make a mistake there. A most enjoyable trip. Although crowded, the trip was smooth with great views. Lots of seats available. I absolutely loved it. Highly recommended, a one way trip is about 30 minutes long.

What a great day. Going by ferry to Manly is a must do when in Sydney. The ferry ride is about 30 minutes and they have a cafe and toilets on board. The ride is mostly smooth but can be a tiny bit bumpy in parts depending on the weather. I highly recommend travellers do it.

Very nice. The ferry is half the price of a round trip train ticket to/from the airport and the views are infinitely better. Take it to Manly beach, which has great shops and restaurants. On the way there you'll get excellent views of the bay, bridge, and opera house. The ride is 30 minutes each way and they run every 30 minutes.

A great ride from Circular Quay to Manly and back for the day. Jumped on the ferry for the trip down the harbour to Manly Beach for the day. Great way to pass some time and get a great view of the housing along the shore and all the little bays and inlet. Certainly excitement among the the traveller and sitting in the sun was a pleasant way to pass the time. The Dock area at Manly could use an update and was grubby. After some time spent at the beach we jumped back on a ferry for the trip back. Unfortunately it rained and the trip was wet. There was plenty of room inside and the people cheery and it provided another view of life and action on the ferry. Definitely one experience I am glad I added to the Sydney holiday.

Manly and Manly Beach were worth the ferry trip.. Got some great pictures of the Opera House and the Sydney bridge. We didn't know enough to snag outside seats when we first got on so had to squeeze out to get photos - it was no problem. On the way back we did get good seats on the Opera House side.

Go ahead and get on the water for a fun excursion. The ferry to Manly Wharf/Beach is a nice trip. Not much money and you'll get great views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and the CBD from the water. At Manly, you'll find plenty of shops and restaurants on the short walk to the beach.
Excellent time. $2.50 for the day on a Sunday was wonderful vale. The whole family enjoyed the return trip from Manly to Sydney. Ferry was tidy, punctual and enjoyable.

It is a ferry.... going to Manly!. The Manly ferry leaves from Circular Quay and takes about 30 minutes. The ferries are quite old and dated, but it is a very nice way to travel to Manly as you tour Sydney Harbour. There is also a faster ferry departing from the Quay, but it is more expensive.

Fun trip to Manly Beach. Enjoy a lovely ride from Circular Quay to Manly Beach. Get an Opal Card to use on ferries, trains and buses. The ferry runs like a Swiss train, right on time. Great views and very relaxing. You can sit inside or enjoy the sights from outside.

The best way to get to Manly.. There are 2 options to get to Manly either you take a bus or a ferry from Circular Quay. To take a ferry, is a bit more exoensive but I would reccomend the ferry because on the way to Manly, you get to have a really good pic of the Habour Bridge and the Opera House. The ferry is clean and the service is on time.

Night visit to Manly. Sensational trip to manly on this old timer. Big impressive ferry that dwarfs all others in the harbour. It was an impressive trip over to manly but coming back in darkness bought out all the light of ol' Sydney town and it was just magnificent. Definitely with a trip over in day light and back in the dark of night
30 min. ride to the beach. great slow ride to manly where you have the beautiful views of the north and south head - great place to take pictures and enjoy the beautiful water

A great way to see Sydney Harbour. A simple way to see Sydney Beaches and the world famous Harbour. The cost in April 2016 was AUD$15 return and the trip takes approximately 20 - 25 minutes. There are lots of photo opportunities of the bridge opera house and Sydney Skyline. Once you get to Manly spend some time to walk down the Corso towards the beach. There are lots of places to have lunch and afterwards have a stroll along the beach.

Nice sailing. Took this after walk from spit bridge to manly beach. This is a massive ferry, consider i take ferry for daily commute to and from work, this like 4 times big, with cafe on the lower deck. The view along pretty good, not that fantastic. What i like is the ferry is fast, nonstop from manly to circular quay.

Great views of the harbour!. The ferry is only half an hour long from circular quay to Manly (and on Sunday it is only $2.50 return!). Although there is some jostling for the best view spots when it is busy, the views that you do get from all around the ferry are amazing. Insider Tip - head to the back of the boat when you go from Circular Quay to Manly - it gives you the opportunity to get a shot of both harbor bridge and the Opera House in one picture.

Great way to spend some time in Sydney. The Many ferry is worth the ride for views across the harbour. It is around a 30 minute ride. Once at Manly there is a short walk to the ocean beach which is full of activity. Lots of places to eat or simply wander and enjoy an ice cream or people watch.
Great Service. What a great trip across to manly, easy to use and cheap and cheerful, clean and has coffee on board with snacks....

A must see. Oh yes you must go to this great little town. Great for shopping and a great way to get to the beach away from the city life. I found my favorite gellatto stand and there are a lot of eateries nearby. I worth the ferry ride. I brought an Opal card at the information booth which help with the transportation. It's a loadable card that you can keep for years.
Thumbs up. everyone must try it at least once everyone must try it at least once everyone must try it at least once
Don't miss Manly beach. This is a quieter beach and beautiful. The Ferry takes you right there and runs often so go see it and enjoy the beach and shopping.

Essential Public Transportation. The Manly Ferry is essential public transportation if you need to get across the river, it would be better if the prices were more reasonable and the service was more regular.

MUST DO. We loved the ferry ride to Manly.... fabulous views and wonderful sunshine that kept us going as we got off an overnight flight. We were all hungry and the restaurants on the pier at Stanley were great.

Recommend an evening return trip!. Recommend a trip just prior to sun set, can watch the evening close in over the harbour and opera house. Then get a late ferry back and see so the lights off the city. Comfortable ferry, easy check in and out.
Stunning!. A must do! For the price ,one of the best things to do in Sydney. Amazing views of the Harbor,Opera House,

A Trip Back in Time.. For a slower paced view of Sydney from the water, one cannot beat the Iconic Manly Ferries.With a bow at both ends there is no need to swing around. Just into the wharf and straight back out again.The gentle chugging of the engines is soothing as you take in the views of The Harbour Bridge and The Opera House and everything Sydney Harbour has to offer.Watching the yachts at play, the high speed ferries and if lucky the cruise ships coming and going.We had a smooth trip crossing near the Heads but it can become a bit rough at times.We had a quick look at Manly Cove where the Fairy/Little Penguins come at certain times of the year.There is a large shark proof swimming area and there were plenty enjoying the warm Autumn weather.The return trip was taken on the other side of the Ferry so that we managed to see both sides of the Harbour.A great Tourist Attraction and a transport option for City workers.
Like taking the ferry on Sundays . It's a good choice if you have free trips on your opal card. If not, it might be expensive. It fits a lot if people and it is usually on time.
Not the fastest route. There are faster ways of getting over to Manly but this is cheaper and you can enjoy the views along the way. It runs quite regularly which is handy.
On Time. The Manly Ferry is a great way to see the iconic sites from the Harbour such as the Opera House and Bridge for no extra cost. The Ferry is comfortable and runs on time.
A great trip. A great day out taking the ferry to Manly, enjoyable trip over and then do what you like in Manly, we just walked along the beach and had a drink in the pub.

Take the sites in from the water. Definitely a must on anyone's itinerary. The very enjoyable manly ferry passes through the Sydney harbour en route to the famous Manly Beach. Much much better than driving or catching a bus.

Spectacular Harbor Views on the trip to Manly. One of the main reasons we chose to visit Manly over Bondi was the trip on the ferry and we were not disappointed. Only 30 minutes but a world away. The views of the harbor were fantastic. After an afternoon in Manly and an early dinner, we took the ferry back after dark - seeing the lights of the city and the surrounding neighborhoods was beautiful.

Great views of harbour. A lovely half hour trip to Manly. This is an ideal and inexpensive way to see the harbour and some of the coast line near Sydney. It cost $15.20 for a return ticket. (We did not have opal cards). Sit outside to make the most of the views. Manly had lots of shops and lots of places to eat, and a very nice beach, so worth getting off the ferry and having a stroll before your return trip. Ferries leave every half hour both ways. There is a fast ferry, but why would you want to cut 10 minutes off your journey in that spectacular setting?
Excellent return trip to Manley. Spent half a day at Manley - great for people watching. Did some last minute shopping before leaving on our cruise.
Quick and efficient. Only took 30minutes direct from quay harbour. The ferry gets busy but plenty of seats inside. Cheap as well with a return journey only costing $15.20

great thing to do. the best way to see the harbour and get iconic pictures of bridge, opera house etc. Goes every 30 mins from circular quay, And of course it takes you to the long golden sands of Manly beach.
Great. One of the best experience to have if you are in Sydney. They are not very costly but give you a most memorable experience and view of the city.
Nice trip. Buy the Opal card and u will get a nice discount. Very often and very comfy. It is just a short trip to Sydney, and here u are...in the heart of Manly&Sydney

Essential Sydney tour. Done this many times before, and will do it again.
The must do in Sydney, especially on a nice day.
An ice-cream in Manly & then the return ferry - a great few hours.

Wow! What a view!. Travelling on the ferry from Manly to Sydney gives the traveller the full visual experience of Sydney Harbour, the bridge and the Opera House! Well worth the trip and really not expensive.

From Circular Quay to Manly in 23 Minutes!. Excellent fast ferry service from the heart of Sydney to Manly, the Corso, and the beautiful beach, just a short walk from where the ferry docks. One way is approximately $8.00, and the ferry is clean and serves beverages, including a full bar.
Super Trip. Loved the ferries especially to Manly. Stayed outdoor on the deck feeling the wind in your face and enjoying the scenery. So easy to use, using the Opal pass.

Great ride and Manly is great too . A must do for all tourists in Sydney. In most cities with picturesque harbours, a boat trip comes at an eye-watering price. But for no more than a few dollars on an Opal smart ticket card you can get the ferry over to Manly.It is a very pleasant boat trip through the harbour and if you're quick getting on you can grab one of the sought-after seats at the front of the vessel. You'll get great views of the Sydney skyline, as well as the iconic Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Manly itself has an excellent beach, loads of shops and some good coastal shops - so in my view it is the best boat trip to get out or the harbour.

Cheap Thrill!. A fun and inexpensive way to see the harbor and enjoy a trip to a lively beach town. We were so tired of walking everywhere we hoped on the ferry at Circular Quay and then to the beach in Manly.

Manly Fast Ferry. This is a great way to get to Manly without stopping at all the other ferry stops in the harbour. You can relax inside the cabin or spend time on deck viewing the sights of the harbour. It takes about thirty minutes to travel from Circular Quay to Manly, with its many shops, beach, and restaurants on the Esplanade.
The famous ferry. Second time around, went from circular quay to Manley for lunch, lots of choices for lunch all great went to a seafood restaurant, fantastic, returned fat dumb and happy to sydney

fabulous. The trip to Manly by the green manly ferry is a must. Wonderful views and very reasonably priced. You can go on a faster one for a bit more but we prefer the green one. It takes about 30 minutes

A wonderful way to spend an afternoon. 30 minute ferry ride with views of the opera house and harbour bridge on your trip. Manly was a lovely area and a short stroll down the main street to a beautiful beach
Pleasant ferry ride. We took the ferry and felt the cool air around. After some minutes we reached our destination. The ferry has lots of seats to offer.
Pleasant trip over to Manly. Had a trip in the late afternoon to visit friends and then back to Sydney after dark. Enjoyed the ride sitting outside.
Quick Trip to Manly. Get aboard early if you want the premium views on the bow or stern of the ship. Nice views of the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge.

Iconic Sydney. The Manly ferry is a "must do" in Sydney. It is about half an hour each way. Lovely to sit on the open deck in the sun, if you don't mind being splashed in choppy waters.It can be a real scrum getting on and off as they don't open the gates until a few minutes before departure, and there is no apparent queueing system.

A great way to spend some time on a sunny day.. If you have some time up your sleeve take a ride on the Manly ferry and view the worlds most beautiful harbour . Have a lunch at Manly , walk along the beach front then return to Sydney and take another look at our fantastic harbour and you may see sailing boats with their coloured sails .A GREAT day out .

Must do Trip when in Sydney. This is a must do trip when in Sydney, even just to see the sights from a different angle. Ferry to Manly takes around 20-25 minutes and is well worth the money. Then you have Manly its self which again should be on ever ones must do list when in Sydney Great place to visit, and nearest beach to Sydney Go and enjoy both
Day trip. Clean ferry service. Great food and shops. I clean mall, easy to manoeuvre, plenty of seating in the mall. The beach was very clean with plenty of seating, shade and garbage bins

Best way to see Sydney Harbour!. Don't bother with expensive boat tours that only do a mini lap of the harbour. Get the manly ferry and for a decent price ($2,50 on Sunday with opal card) you can have a wonderful 30min trip seeing the whole harbour. Make sure you return at night so you see the city lights at night. Always do this with friends and family from overseas!!!

The best public transport option of all!. A trip to Manly, via ferry, is a great way in order to appreciate the sheer grandeur and magnificence of Sydney Harbour. Sparkling blue waters, hidden bays and tourist trails, and a thousand other sights for keen photographers, including the iconic Bridge and Opera House. Manly has great beaches and a host of dining and accommodation options.
Trip to Manly. My daughter and I went late afternoon over to Manly. Had fish and chips on the beach and travelled back and looked at the lights of the harbour and city. Very beautiful.
Great journey. Very efficiently run service running very regularly with good food & toilets on board and comfortable seating

all the views you would get on a cruise. We stayed at Manly on this visit and found the ferry so easy to get to Circular Quay. We sat at the front of the boat and could view all the houses and boats in the harbour, THEN wow, the harbour bridge and the opera house came into view, it was a view to die for! Totally awe struck that we were there.

Great trip along the harbour. This is a must do in Sydney as you get the chance to see the harbour whilst taking the 30 minute visit to Manly. There you can relax and the beach is greatA word of warning though. Choose the day you go if you can as the trip across "the heads" can be rough and wet.

Amazing at sunset. Inexpensive thirty minute trip, leisurely but be prepared for a rush of people. This ferry is very popular. There are two deck entrances to ease a crush. This ferry goes backwards and forwards so if you wish to be at the front of the boat, choose the end which is furthest from shore.
quick way to get across harbour. takes about 15 minutes leaves every quarter past the hour and quarter to the hour 8 dollars one way takes you right up the mouth of sydney harbour

awesome at sunset!. We always do the Manly Ferry trip when in Sydney, We like it the best when the sun is setting and city the lights are coming on. Also some great restaurants at manly and a good spot for a quick beer or 3!

Still one of the great experience in Sydney. Sliding past the Sydney Opera House - looking back at the Sydney Harbour Bridge - free wifi on board - heading down Sydney Harbour - plenty to see before you get to Manly.The return trip is equally as enjoyable especially as you pull into Sydney Cove with the city skyline in front of you.

Great way to visit Northern Beaches !. The Manly Ferry is such a great way to access the Northern Beaches ! Very punctual, it leaves each half hour form Circular Quay, travels for 30 minutes towards Manly ! It is a wonderful cruise, very relaxing, and gives a very nice view of Sydney, passing just next to its Opera House and famous Sydney Bridge !

An amazing view, fun, and cheap. Go to Circular Quay and take the Manly Ferry. They leave every half hour or so and you get a cheap view of Sydney from the Harbour. It's amazing - it really is.When you get off at Manly walk straight ahead and you'll arrive at Manly Beach, another spectacular vision. This is such a good way to spend half a day in Sydney. Inexpensive, fun, and it will be a memorable experience.Lots of restaurants in Manly - take your pick. The ferries leave so frequently that you can take the ferry over, cruise the area, have lunch, and take the ferry back to the city.

great and economical way to tour Sydney's waterfronts. The Manly ferry travels from Darling harbour to six different points of interest across the bay and returns the same way. It's a hop on hop off, for 24 hours at a cost of $40. Don't bother with any of the harbour cruises - you will pay more and only be allowed one trip. The boat is clean, efficient with a friendly crew. Comfortable seating on two levels - great for photos. Get off at Manly and have a 'hug mug' hot chocolate at 'Max Brenner's' chocolate bar, right opposite the ferry terminal. Behind it is a very useful Aldi supermarket.

Go early in Summertime on the weekends. On a hot sunny Saturday or Sunday every man and his dog and every mother and their stroller pour onto the ferry at Circular Quay and then pour off the other end at Manly and turn the Corso and the beach at the end of Corso into a sea of sunburnt fleshy family madness.Ferry sailings from about 11am onwards resemble 30 minutes of being in a giant floating creche' and you can't move for strollers or hear anything over children sounds. Avoid. Take an earlier sailing (<= 10am) or leap on the Manly Fast Ferry instead.

THE way to see the Harbour. My experiences go back to the days of the (private) Port Jackson and Manly Steamship Company. The service is clean and quick (there is a faster service that goes from another wharf).Try to go to Manly as the sun is setting, with the sun through the Harbour Bridge and the afternoon yachts are scudding around. Magic.
Handy dandy. It's almost like catching a bus, so easy. Either get a ticket or an opal card and tap on. All of which can be purchased from the terminals. Lovely scenic way to travel to Manly.

A regular treat on my trips to Sydney. It is always a pleasure to take a trip on the ferry to Manly. They depart regularly so there is never too long to wait and I have my Opal card so 'touching on' is an easy way to pay the fare. I try to alternate travelling on the port and starboard sides to vary the scenery but I confess, I still look from left to right all the time anyway! I don't generally try to go outside or upstairs as there is usually a crush of people doing that. Once you get to the other side you can do whatever takes your fancy and spend as long or as little time as suits you. I always get a gelati and some Japanese food to takeaway. Perfect :-)
Great way to see Sydney Harbo. Even if Manly is not your destination, take the 30 min ride to Manly and back for some of the best views of Sydney and it's harbor
You must go here. If you have time it is worth it to visit Manly Beach. On the way out you will have a nice ride and see Sydney from its best side.

Ferry ON !. It has definitely been a while since I've been on a ferry and it was just like my childhood memories! The ferry was on time and definitely well used by many Australians enjoying the beautiful harbour we have on a Summer's Day.It was a great family experience to have and inexpensive.

Interesting tour of the east harbour and harbour entrance. This ferry ride is useful for those wishing to visit the great Pacific Ocean beach at Manly or those who just want to see what the Pacific entrance (big cliffs!) to Sydney Harbour looks like. As the ferry comes into Manly, the ocean swells can be felt strongly, even on a calm day. It's easy to see how early explorers could miss the harbour entrance in a bit of fog or weather; whereas, other harbors of lesser size (Botany Bay) are a bit more apparent.

One of the "must do" things in Sydney. Even for a born and bred Sydneysider like me the Manly Ferry is still something you feel you must do from time to time. It is the simplest, cheapest and most enjoyable way to travel across Sydney Harbour. On a nice day the Manly Ferry is just a great place to be.For most of the day they leave Circular Quay (Wharf 3) on the hour and half hour for the gentle 30 minute trip. They leave Manly wharf at a quarter past and a quarter to the hour.And if you are a visitor to Sydney, the short walk along the Corso to Manly beach is another must do. Manly has plenty of cafes, restaurants and pubs too if you get hungry.
Very relaxing. Lovely trip takes about 30 minutes buy your ticket from the kiosk and away you go Lovely scenery and very relaxing most enjoyable

Fast direct service, great views!. Who doesn't love Manly? Such a laid back burb of Sydney, I could easily live in this area. The ferry from Circular Quay is quick and easy, lots of great vistas a long the route.
Beautiful views. We took this also, and the views were beautiful. I would recommend getting a seat as it got crowded outside.

Relaxing and romantic voyage.. It's a soothing and relaxing way to travel accross to Manly.
Enjoy a bit of seaway motion once the ferry meets some swells as she leaves the enclosed waters of the Harbour.
Fast ferry. We enjoyed the fast ferry over to Manly. It was quite busy both ways but we all got seats. Great way of getting an idea of Sydney Harbour.

a novelty. When my friends come to Sydney I always recommend that they get the ferry to manly for the day and try to come back around sunset for the best views. It’s a relatively inexpensive way to see the harbour and the novelty of being out on the boat never seems to get old.

Great way to see the Harbour. We took several trips in this fery aacross the Manly and back on our OPAL cards - great idea for interstate pensionesrs - daily limit $2.50 .The Ferry ride was really a great way to see all the sites of the city of Sydney and out to the heads and beyond right up to manly wharf. Everyone wanted to sit in the front 9or the back) to get this great view so, if you want to do this, get on board early - they run every half hour on the hour (Circular Quay end)

watch the harbour go by. Whenever my friends and I go to the city we, if we have time, go for a ride on the Manly ferry. It's not long but very enjoyable and relaxing. Even the days when the swell comes in from the ocean through the Heads. A walk down the Corso takes you to the ocean and then back to the harbour where we indulge in a gelato before we head back to the city.
We used this ferry to go to Taronga Zoo. Decent ferry ride in historic 135 years old Sydney ferries. But the view is the best thing when we went to Taronga Zoo
Best way to travel. Manly is worth a visit and this is the way to go. The ferry is easy to navigate and takes you across the harbor where you can enjoy the great views before hitting the town.

Awesome way to see Sydney. Inexpensive and fun way to see Sydney from the water. It is also fun to get to go over to Manly and get a different feel for a different part of the city. As a note, we had some rainy weather while we were in Sydney and although it isn't great for walking around Manly or walking around Sydney, as long as it isn't too foggy, the ferry is enclosed and you can do it in the rain ( I am sure it is prettier in the sun but it was pretty in the drizzle as well.)
