Best Views of Sydney. I'm not sure if this is the longest trip east from Circular Quay that the Ferries make, but it must be close to it. For around $30 return the two of us enjoyed all the the harbour had to offer and the trip takes close to 30 minutes each way.My personal opinion is that once you arrive at Manly the best thing that you can do is get on the ferry and head back again, but that's for another review.The trip will take you right down the harbour and near to the Heads while you are free to move about on the ferry to take in the views from every angle. Watsons Bay is also a great trip.

Cheapest Way to see the harbour from the water. Undoubtedly the best and cheapest way to view the Harbour Bridge and Opera House from the water whilst enjoying the trip over to Manly. Definitely better than taking a more expensive formal harbour tour. Cost is around $15 return which you can buy either as a ticket or by using an Opal card.

A great old ferry boat. This route has large ferries as it has to cross near the entrance of Sydney Harbour and there is always a swell coming in. The ferries are fascinating as they are so old. You can sit inside or outside and watch the suburbs go past.

Best way to get to Manly and see the Harbor. The public transportation system is incredible! In Sydney, you just need an OPAL card and you can go on any method of transport. The ferry to manly and back is about a 30 minute trip. The ferry is huge and pretty stable. The only rocking you may get is near the mouth of the harbor when you are almost at Manly. Very comfortable and reasonable.

Clean and Efficient. We took the Manly Ferry to have a quick visit to Manly to fill in some time . We used our Opel Cards to "Tap on " So much better than queueing for tickets . The Ferries run on regular timetable , We found the service to be on time , the Ferry was clean and comfortable . A very good service.

Easy to use! . The ferry was a perfect way to get to Manly Beach. Plenty of room on the ferry to sit, even on a Saturday. If you are in a rush or just want more wind in your hair I recommend the fast ferry or a water taxi!

A must in Sydney. Just a brief comment to say you must do this trip if you want to see Sydney Harbour. We can also recommend the Paramatta Ferry which goes up the harbour. It is more modern than the old Manly Ferry.

Great way to get to the beach!. The Manly ferries operate from Circular on a regular basis and take about half hour to get to Manly. My tip would be to sit out back on the way to Manly and up front on the way back if you're looking to get great views of the harbour.
Quick trip to Manly. Picturesque ride through the harbour to Manly, lunch and a couple of beers at Four Pines Micro Brewery.

Beautiful way to view the bay. We took the round trip to Manly using OPAL card. Very pleasant boat ride across the bay, made better by meeting a 91 year old who told us stories of his life, and describing the sights we saw from the boat. His tip was to walk to Manly Beach and catch a bus round the peninsula, then back on the ferry later to Circular Quay. We enjoyed the buzz of the Corso, not too hectic and more down-home than the urban centre of Sydney. A great morning activity when on holiday here

Definitely worth a trip. The trip from Manly Wharf to the harbour bridge is certainly worth paying for. It isn't expensive and views are excellent throughout the half hour trip. The highlight has to be the view as the Opera House and Harbour bridge as you round a corner and they slip into view. Worth the trip just for that. Be aware that on a windy day the ferry will be a little exciting as it crosses the ocean inlet between the heads.
Great way to check the harbour. A Wonderful trip to Manly for lunch. The best way to travel in Sydney by far.Walk up the Corso to Manly beach.

Comfortable boat trip and boat runs on time.. We were first time travelers to Manley and joined the crown on the ferry. It left on time and we enjoyed a comfortable boat trip from Circular Quay to Manly.
30 minutes and a world away. If the hustle and bustle of big-city Sydney highrises and power suits has you longing for a getaway, definitely take the ferry over to the laid-back beachy town of Manly.

Harbour cruise and iconic Sydney walk.. I recently employed myself as an interstate tourist guide for my visiting Swiss friend Rene. Our 4 day Sydney escapade included my very fav Manly Spit Walk. For the inexpensive price of a ferry trip to Manly this is a must-do day trip for similarly inclined active travellers.The ferry trip to Manly as always was a treat. To be out on Sydney's gorgeous harbour and so near The Heads is a must for all visitors. The day was perfect and the choppy swell added to the experience.Arriving in Manly we bought a few picnic supplies from the ferry terminal situated Aldi. After a quick stroll through the mall up to the beach we started our 10k walk. As always it was wonderful and for Rene it gave him yet another insight into Sydney's spectacular natural harbourside environment. Stopping frequently at small beaches and coves along the way and taking time to appreciate the lookouts my regard for this walk was again cemented. A well deserved coffee at La Plonk at the end and the easy bus ride back to,the city made for a perfect day out in Sydney.Catch the Manly Ferry and walk the harbour. You'll love it.

Great Beach Short Ferry From Sydney . Great beach experience a 45 minute ferry ride from Circular Quay. If in Sydney, put this on your list of things to do. Easy trip, you can check out the beach town for a couple hours or an all day experience. Nice beach, good selection of restaurants and bars, usually their is something always going on. Last time I caught the Australia Open for surfing.
Circular Quay - Manly. Really enjoy the Manly ferry trip. Great experience. Every half an hour have ferry to Manly, very convenience.
Perfect way to see the harbour. Why to take a cruise on Sydney harbour when the Manly ferry gives you the exact same view for peanuts and you end up at Manly!

Nice trip. If you want to experience a good value for money trip of the harbour then is thus perhaps the best valued ticket in town. Taking about 35 mins you experience wonderful views of day to day living on the harbour as well as the two iconic sights of Sydney.

The way to see the Harbour. They have this down to a science. Leaves precisely on the half hour from Sydney and on the quarter hour from Manly. Short 30 min ride gives you views of the harbour, of the rocky coasts at the mouth of the bay, and a chance to use a great beach in Manly as well as explore all sorts of dining opportunities on the esplanade. Most economical way to see the harbour from the water.

Convenient and scenic way to get to Manly Beach. You get on the ferry from the Circular Quay which is easy to get to by train. Then you pay for the ferry with the same Opal card for the train.It leaves in 30min intervals and was very punctual. It was clean and orderly and as you leave the wharf, you get great views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.When it docks, Manly beach is less than a 500m walk.

My first ferry ride..memorable one too. Heard/read so much about manly ferry ride before coming to Sydney.Tried it on my first day of the trip . Ferry is bit old. But that's what makes it special i guess.Ride to Manly is comfortable and quick by this ferry.But the crowd is huge..u have to wait for 20min in queue before getting on board.There's a small coffee shop which sells some snacks n beverages.You can definitely try a ride.

The Best Way to have Ice Cream at Manly!. We caught the Ferry to Manly to try a Movenpick Ice Cream at manly which was recommended by our Coach Drive on the Gray Line City Tour. It was well worth it - an affordable way to have a brilliant Harbour Cruise.
Quick and cheap. We used the ferry to go to manly beach for the day. The service was quick and efficient. The views from the ferry whilst making the journey were lovely

perfect way to see the harbour .... and get to Manly...!!!!. Was one of the highlights of our trip to Sydney.... we went late afternoon.... had a cocktail on the beach!! and took the ferry back to circular quay..... would definitely recommend this to all travelers as one of the must do activities when in Sydney... didn't realize Manly was so pretty... would love to stay there for a few days as the beach is beautiful.....

Beautiful journey on a beautiful Harbour. Take the Circular Quay to Manly trip if you ever visit. This is a must do tourist attraction, you travel on the famous Sydney Ferries, enjoy the beautiful Manly attractions and the wonderful restaurants and bars in Manly.

Nice relaxing ride. Was a nice relaxing cruise across the harbour, got really great shots of the Opera house and the Harbour bridge going both ways. Loved that we also went past what looked like an old prison? Out on a small island. Could see Taronga Zoo on the way past and will definitely go visit that next time. Love the Opal card discount for travel in general! Would recommend anyone visiting to grab one.

Looking old. I haven't been on a manly ferry for years and it looks like they haven't done anything to them since then. The seats were shabby and the toilets were old and smelly. one of the worlds most stunning harbours and the transport looks so old. Cmon Australia you can do better than that.

Great views. Great way to see the harbour and go to Manley which is a nice place to go. Great views of thebridge as you come back. Gets a bit choppy just before you arrive in Manley. Check out the tourist info centre in Manley. Its cool.

Got-to-do-thing during your Sydney holiday. I was alerted to this by TripAdvisor and was very happy we made the trip. The ferry ride itself is amazing due to the route which shows the main landmarks of Sydney from the water-side as well as the views of the ocean. And Manly itself is a nice laid-back beach area which during nice weather conditions is a great place to be; both at the beach as well as in the area between the ferry harbour and the beach.

It's a good way to travel. The ferry is old but it's a good way to travel. It's just quite slow compared to the fast ferry to manly but it's much cheaper. Sometimes, if you're lucky, a newer, faster ferry is used (maybe the old ferry broke down or something.)
The only way to get to Manly Beach. Short trip, twenty minutes, but scenic along the way. Many boaters, kayaks and you may see a cruise ship in the harbor. Price is very reasonable.

A trip to Manly. An excellent experience, ferries run on time, are frequent and there is plenty of room for everyone. The journey gives a good view of the harbour, bridge,Opera House, transformed old warehouses into upmarket apartments, Mrs Mcquaries chair and lots more, Manly is a lovely seaside town with lots of good restaurants, bush walks, surf and swimming beaches, shops, lovely atmosphere.

Very Convenient. One of the many many ferries that serve the waterways of Sydney. Bit like a bus service but on water - So much easier to use this system rather than try and drive all round the roads. Very cheap (£2.50) for 24 hours.. works off of an Oyster Card type system

A pretty way to see the harbour. We took the ferry back from Manly to the city. The trip provides a wonderful view of the city from the waterside, while giving an up close view of the bridge and the opera house on the tour into Circular Quay.

Awesome and inexpensive. The perfect opportunity to catch and amazing view of the harbour and the opera house! The ferries go every 30 mins. until late. It is worth noting that on Sundays you can ride all public transport in Sydney for a $2.50 flat rate (with your opal card)! The ride takes about 30 mins. and if you lucky you might spot dolphins :-) Be aware that they close the gates a few minutes before departure. When going towards Manly the best spot is on the rear upper deck, so be quick to catch a seat there. When going back it is definitely worth to time it with sunset: the sun will be right behind the CBD skyscrapers and will give you yet another stunning view. When waiting for the ferry back, grab a quick beer in the awesome 4 Pines Brewpub right across the street.

A must do. 30 minutes over to Manley, which you just have to visit. The ferry itself is nothing special but offers 30 minutes each way of looking at the scenery going by. There is one section though, known as the 'heads', which is where the Tasman Sea cuts across the route. If its a 'bit choppy' the ferry can move a little, but more importantly the waves can splash over the bow. If you are sitting up the front, you will get wet. If the locals move, I suggest you do too!
Fun trip. We took the Manly Ferry for an afternoon visit and enjoyed the trip and the many photo opportunities it provided. We also enjoyed a relaxing stroll down the beach.Good value for money.

Great and cheap!. Why pay more to other ferries when you pay 7 bucks for a ferry all the way to manly. Easy way to travel with the opal card! Great way of transportation and easy to find at the harbor! Just buy a 20 bucks opal card and you are off!

Go and spend the day in Manly.. This a must do in Sydney . Cost next to nothing on our ferries . Go around 11.00am and have lunch in Manly , go the beach and have a walk along the waters edge in the cooler weather and if it is hot just find a spot in the shade and enjoy for hours. Take the ferry back when it is dark and enjoy the city lights as you arrive back.

Beautiful Day in Sydney. Catching the Ferry to Manly provides a very pleasant 'Day In Sydney'. Catching the Ferry at Circular Quay offer the stunning views of The Harbour Bridge and the opera House as you depart and also on your return.I like to arrive at Manly and walk through the Corso, walk along the beach to the South end and walk around the path al the way to Shelly Beach which takes about 30 minutes at a nice steady walk. At Shelly Beach there is a beautiful Restaurant (The Boat House) which also has a café/Coffee section as well as a couple of places open at Fairy Bower half way to Shelly. (Bookings maybe required at The Boat House).It's a pleasant return walk back to the Ferry so you can walk off lunch. There are plenty of Shops along the Corso and then the nice ride back to Circular Quay.

Great Day trip to Manly. A great way to see Sydney Harbour is to catch the Ferry to Manly on a Saturday. The Harbour is very busy with racing sailing boats, cruisers, and other water-crafts. From Circular Quay, be ready to take photos of the Opera House, Fort Denison , the Harbour bridge and more. You may experience a bit of swell when sailing pass Sydney Harbour Heads on a rough weather day. You will enjoy the arrival at Manly ! Go for a walk through the mall, along the esplanade and if it is a nice sunny day , enjoy a swim. If you feel speedy, hire some roller-skates ! The surf is always good. Plenty of restaurants, take aways food and shops as well ! Make it a day trip !

The best value thing to do in Sydney. To catch the Manly ferry on a sunny Sydney day is one of my favorite things to do. Living in Sydney I can honestly say for a visitor it represents the best "bang for your buck!" You get to see the amazing jewel of my city. A sweep past the opera house and you are heading east towards Manly. A good half hour trip where you'll catch glimpses of secluded beaches, national parks and the fortunate few Sydneysiders that call the harbor home. Once at the other side Manly offers great restaurants, shops probably Sydney's best beach and a lovely "must do" walk around to fairy bower on the eastern side or head left off the ferry and walk around the foreshore past Fairlight and around to forty baskets beach or continue walk until you arrive at the spit for a great lunch and a bus back to Manly. Either way it's a day well spent.
great adventure across the harbour. great adventure across the harbour to Manly - another little suburb full of attractions for locals and tourists. very nice.

Best value in Sydney!. The ferry to Manly is very affordable, takes les than 30 minutes and is a relaxing and beautiful activity! Manly is a great neighborhood of North Sydney. Beautiful beach with tall conifer trees, small streets with upscale shopping, and enough restaurants and cafes to keep a foodie happy!
Great way to get to Manly. Take the ferry on Sunday it will cost u only 2.50 AUD $. 30 min and u r in Manly. During holidays it is slightly crowded still there is enough space ti everybody.
Nothing exciting. Manly itself is superb and definitely worth a visit. The ferry ride is exactly what it says. Certainly nothing exciting but you get back and forth easily.

Lovely trip. There is a choice of the regular ferry or the "Fast Ferry". If you are in a hurry (fast ferry is 12 minutes faster) or if you are prone to seasickness, you might want to choose the Fast Ferry as the catamaran configuration is more stable, particularly when passing across the Heads where the swell from the Tasman Sea can be large, causing the regular ferry to roll and pitch and occasionally spray those on the forward outside decks!
Trip to Manly Beach. My friends and I rode the Manly Ferry on a Sunday, which is of course a very busy day! You have to arrive early to get on the ferry you want.

A harbor cruise for a fraction of the price, plus a beach town at the end!. For less than fifteen dollars you can see a good chunk of Sydney's massive harbor, from the Opera House all the way out to craggy North Head overlooking the Pacific. This is the largest of the ferry boats that ply the Harbor and it's easy to see why when you start bouncing over the swells as you get closer to the ocean (and also big, of course, because it's mobbed with beachgoers on a nice weekend day). Keep an eye out for tiny beaches, old sea caves, and wartime fortifications along the bluffs.Once you get to Manly it's a straight walk through a pedestrian mall to get to the beach itself, where you can gaze out into the Pacific towards New Zealand while you snack on ice cream.
Nice. Took the ferry from Circulay Quay on a gorgeous day specifically to see Manly Beach. The ferry is a comfortable and cheap way to travel.
Great ride on the ferry. What a great ride on the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and back.We had really nice weather and will do this again. Nice boat and friendly staff.
Must do. What a great little trip to Manly we had, ferry was very spacious. Manly was a fab place and the beach was beautiful

The ride is almost as much fun as Manly Beach. On our last full day in Australia, my girlfriend wanted to go to Manly Beach. I didn't know much about it but I was up for some fun. The ride over is cheap, the fast ferry may be a little misleading, you're thinking you're going to be going at a pretty good speed and while it's not slow, it's not overly fast either. That's not a bad thing considering the view you have especially on the way back. It would be great do to it at sunset or on a beautiful day. We went on the day after Australia Day which was overcast unfortunately. Definitely a must thing to do in Sydney and certainly something I would do when I go back.

Good service. We stayed in Manly for a week and this was the best way to get there from Sydney, great commute with fantastic views of the Opera House and bridge. It also ran till late so you could have a night out in the city and still get back.
Very good. One of the only places in the world we felt at (home) we walked for miles, and the ferries are superb.

Relaxing ride + great for sight seeing. As we were visiting Sydney (staying in CBD) + decided to go and check out Manly on a nice warm/sunny day. I'd been on the ferry about 15 yrs ago (much smaller boats then) - but remembered how nice it was compared to taking a bus or train.The boats are pretty huge now - but a bit more luxurious. Despite being a Saturday (and lots of tourists like us) - we had no problems finding good seats. Ferries ran really regularly so we didn't have to wait more than about 5 minutes each way (although that might have been luck).It's also a great way to see the Harbour bridge, Opera house and other islands/channels from the water - you can go outside and get a bunch of great photos + views.If you had to commute every day for work not clear how good/efficient it would be - but for us was a perfect outing (not often you can say the actual transportation was as fun as the destination).Price wise - we had an octupus card + already used up the $15 daily limit with other train trips etc - so didn't really cost anything at all too!.

You just have to do it!. The title says it all! An amazing way to see Sydney Harbour. The return fare to Manley was about $14.40 or £7.60. Terrific value. The ferries run a half-hourly service and once you get to Manley, it is but a short walk to the world famous Manly Beach; surf and surfers abound. Good walks around Manly as well.
You ain't seen nothing yet. Wonderful ferry trip to Manly and then a great time wandering around Manly. Not expensive and beautiful views from the ferry.

A trip you must do, Manly Island.. So pleased we were told to go to Manly Island.The ferry across was easy enough and reasonable, go early though as gets so busy we went across at 9am which was great not crowded and walked to the beach for breakfast great big breakfasts for good prices and watched the surfing taking place.Looked like the local school had come down for there P.E lesson great to be able to do that. Ah?The shops opened around 9.30am and have some good offers.The ferries run all day every day told Saturday and Sunday very busy so avoid if you can.

Best way to see Sydney from the harbour . Done it copious times and will do it many more. Had guests from OS and they loved it. Great fish and chips in Manly too! If you visit Sydney you MUST do the Manly ferry trip from the Quay.
Beautiful manly. The ferry to manly from cicular quay was very informative.and a smooth ride and pretty cheap they are very frequent to and from manly Manly is a beautiful town and beach

Fast ferry for a fabulous view. A must-do when visiting Sydney. You can't beat the Manly fast ferry on a sunny day for views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Manly itself is a fun destination with two of the best beaches for swimming (don't miss snorkelling at Cabbage Tree Bay reserve near Shelly Beach) and loads of good places to eat. Buy an ice-cream at the ferry terminal for the return trip!

A pleasant journey. The vessel is spacious and comfortable. Be sure you get a early place in line to be able to sit at the front pf the boat as there is limited seating there. A great relaxing journey to Manly

Great views of Sydney. I was meeting some friends for dinner in Manly and took the Ferry over around sunset. Beautiful views of Sydney and the inlet. Reasonable prices, pretty quick journey. The best way to reach Manly from Sydney.
Quick and easy.. we used our opal card and spent a few hours in Manly beach . Great time.I believe it was about 3o min . No need to get a tour of harbor since the ferries take you everywhere.
So easy a real pleasure . Went on a Sunday so with the train as well it cost $2.50. Beautiful views. Easy to access from circular quay.

Nice outdoor ride. Using the ferry to get to Manly is an experience in itself. You might see dolphins as you travel but even if not the views of the harbour are great. The ferries are busy and the best seating is quickly taken but head up front outdoors or to the back outdoors with your camera!

Reliable ferry is best way to see Harbour . The Manly ferry is an old ferry and has been running for decades from Sydney harbour to Manly. It's a large ferry so holds a lot of people. Great views of the harbour so there are fantastic photo opportunities. We went mid morning and returned before dusk. I'd like to go again at night to get a different view of the harbour. If you have an Ooal card, the ferry accepts this as payment. Worth the trip just for the harbour views alone.

Back using after a few years. I hadn't used the Manly Ferry for a few years, but also remember using it a lot in the sixties.We had a call from our daughter to go to Manly for dinner as we were in Sydney. We caught the 4.00 pm Ferry across and found that the staff at the terminal were friendly and polite. The Ferry was clean and certainly is very different to how it used to be in the sixties. 30 min later we were at Manly, just a little swell as we crossed the heads. The sights on the harbour are always enjoyable. After dinner with our daughter and grandchildren we caught the 8.45 pm back to the quay. We were right on departure time when we arrived but the staff made sure that we got on without trying to hurry us up. The trip back at night paints a totally different picture of eh harbour as the foreshore lights up. You "turn the corner" and there in front of you is the Opera House and Harbour Bridge.We also were lucky as the Queen Victoria was at the Overseas Terminal, just to add to the occasion. You never know what cruise ship will be at the terminal and this can just add to the occassion.The trip across to Manly is certainly something that we should more often on the Ferry

Take ferry and mix with the quality. I take the Manly ferry every time I am in Sydney. The beach at Manly is very good and rarely crowded. The ferry leaves from Circular Quay in h heart of the city. Try and travel off peak if you can, many people the ferry is a means of getting to and from work Manly has the reputation of being a high class suburb.

Great link to Manley from Sidney. This ferry runs every 30 minutes from Sidney to Manley and enables you to experience the lovely beaches of Manley within 30 minutes travel time. Only 16 dollars return is a bargain.
Great way to see the harbour!. Such a fun way to get from the centre of Sydney to Manly Beach! Amazing sights and photo opportunities. Beautiful on a sunny day :)

Great views of Opera House. This is a terrific excursion, with a lovely beach and town destination at the end, and glorious views of Sydney and the Opera House. Try to get a seat in the front for the best photos.

Iconic - YES best way to travel - Maybe. The Manly Ferry is one of the iconic vessels on Sydney Harbour, is it is fit for purpose. It is a nice 30 minute ride and suited to a nice slow pace. On occasion I have found it to be a bit tatty and often unclean. But generally it OK, the ferry is always safe and in the evening/night it is good to see that they have security, this is most valuable on Friday evenings and the weekends when there are a lot of traveler that have had a drink. I have been catching the ferry for about 10 years and have never seen any trouble. The down side is it is slow and you can't get a beer on board (Unlike the Manly Fast Ferry). But all in all. If you need to get home. it is fine.

Hard on seat Great on views. This iconic ferry doesn't seem to have changed since I was a child 40 years ago but that is what gives it it's charm. the seats are hard and there is a lack of outdoor setting down stairs but the views of the harbour are amazing . There is a chance to buy a snack and drink on board . A must if you are visiting Sydney and / or Manly

One thing you must do when you are in Sydney. Great day day out - just sit outside and enjoy the views and fresh air. Then wander up the Corso towards the beach. Have a swim and enjoy some fish and chips. You can then keep walking to Shelly Beach which is a lovely walk and a great place to have a coffee. There is a sea pool and a sheltered beach.
Relaxing. When I stayed in a guesthouse in Manly I used to take the ferry to and from Manly to the city and v v. Specially after a day walking around this was a relaxing moment.

A must do in Sydney. Riding the Manly Ferry is a great way to see Sydney Harbour from the Bridge to the Sea. It is really a good idea to have a map on your mobile phone or tablet so that you can see where you are. The trip can be an interesting introduction to some of Sydney's history crossing Rose bay the home of Sydney's first airport.

Manly Ferry Ride. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly mid afternoon, and enjoyed the relaxing trip across the Harbour, past the Opera House. Arriving in Manly we walked along the Corso checking out the shops, bought ice creams, waled up the beach front for a while before having a quiet drink at an Historic Pub before going back to Sydney on the ferryIt was a really relaxing outing.

the wind in your hair. love going on the ferry for ride over to Manly, stop have a coffee and a bite to eat and then back on the ferry for another ride back. so relaxing to chill out, smell the fresh sea air and feel the wind on my face. time out of the hustle and bustle of the city. well worth it and get to take some great photos shots along the way

Ferry Ride when in Sydney ,a must do.. I was in Sydney for 2 days ,the Manly ferry was a great way to be on the Sydney Harbor at minimal cost,Watching all the other water craft and just enjoying the incredible views across the Sydney Harbor .Manly itself has many interesting sites and shops ,well worth a visit ,although to me the ferry was the highlight of the day

Great half hour cruise to Manly using your Opal card for visitors. This ferry operates quite often and is large enough to comfortably seat lots of people, on a warm day sit outside and enjoy the supurb harbour. There is a snack bar and it is a real pleasure to arrive in Manly relaxed.
Many Ferry. Just the best, its a must do in Sydney and we love Manly beach! Its a no rush trip across the harbour, we went mid afternoon and came back 7ish to ensure we saw the city lights coming on.
Great Location. I was in Sydney in Dec 2015. One of the good places for a tourist is to take the Manly Ferry and see the facinating sights of syndney
Gorgeous day, must do Sydney experience. I love the Manly ferry, it's fairly quick and a great way to see the harbour. They have a cafe on board, also the ferry is SO cheap! It was about $8!

Efficient And Fun... A Great Combo. The Manly route is one of many along the Harbour system, with Circular Quay being the focal point (pronounce Quay "key" and you'll instantly sound like a local). Manly seems to be one of the longer rides, and it's a great way to just get out on the water and enjoy the views. Excellent.

Great way to explore Sydney. Fabulous way to travel on Sydney Harbour and explore Sydney. We travelled to Manly and Balmain. Both trips were delightful. Balmain had a free shuttle bus at the ferry stop, which was fabulous as it is very hilly. Would recommend as a great way to see different parts of Sydney.

Reliable ride. While in Australia we took the ferry from Sydney Harbor to Manly. The boat was crowded but we got an outside seat. Big mistake. When the boat crossed the current flowing from the ocean into the bay we were drenched. It was more of a surprise than anything and there were warning signs. Although there was a fast ferry available, we were not in a rush and the ride to and from was pleasant.

Really quick. Great ferry takes you directly to manly beach in a short space of time. You feel like you've been transported to a completely different city in a short space of time as you move away from the hustle and bustle of the city to a beautiful beach.
Great way to see the harbour. This is a must for visitors as you get awesome views of harbour, bridge, opera house and downtown plus ferry takes you to famous Manly Beach
Great day out.. A fabulous and relaxing way to see the sights of the harbour, including the Bridge and Opera House,as well as Manly's great beaches. The ferry timetable is convenient.

Ferry across the Mersey (not quite). Manly Ferry...forgot how fabulous this is...meet new people see the sights at your leisure. A most pleasant unhurried journey across to Manly. ferry staff first rate, service first rate. Would recommend this to everyone.
Pleasant Ferry Trip. On a hot Saturday afternoon the ferries are very busy, but a very pleasant 30 minute trip on a lovely old Ferry

its slow; its old; its relaxing_its Sydney. Never sick of travelling on this lump of steel - you have to be quick to nab a seat outdoors up front on any deck - but as it curls itself around various coves it takes you back to yesterday-year in a nice calming manner........dont drive to and from Manly - do yourself a favour and queue up for the push'nshove up the gang plank...once in Maly plenty of watering holes and place to grab a bite.
does a job. takes you where it is supposed to go, costs enough to justified journey and offer light refreshment and snacks, toilets and a view. Can not ask for more

A great ride. This iconic ferry ride is well worth the ride. Taking about 40 minutes from Circular Quey to Manly, with food available on board and seats inside and out to accomodate all travellers. The service can be very busy on weekends ferrying surfers and tourists to Manly and each weekday morning and night bringing passengers to the city and back to work. Rough seas makes for an exciting ride as does the yatchs and water craft big and small using the same harbour.
Good trip. Travel across the harbor by ferry is a must do for our visitors. Walk to Shelly Beach after arriving in Manly and have a swim.
best way to see the harbour. This is a great cheap way to see the harbour. Spend the day in Manly and go back after dark to check out the city lights
Transports. Timely and convenient from Circular Quay. Nice scenery. Comfortable and easy mode of transportation. The stop is at a good location. You walk about 15 minutes to get to the beach.

Great. Love the ferry i always take a trip on them everytime i visit sydney. I find it nice and relaxing, sensational views of harbor and that salt air so invigorating.
A ferry ride is a must do when you visit sydney.

Great views in fine weather.. Bring your camera. Well worth the time. Walk to the beach and back along street with many shops. The one offering aboriginal art is very good. The views from the ferry are exceptional.
A "must do" day out. We took this brilliant old ferry to Manly for the day. The trip out is informative and the the views of the opera house and bridge far exceed the land-based ones

Great harbour cruise at a fraction of the cost. Want to see Sydney Harbour without the high cost of tourist charters? This 30 minute journey takes you from downtown Sydney, east to Manly for $15.20 return per adult. Be quick to board and grab an outside seat (weather permitting) to truly enjoy the scenery. Tip is sit on the opposite side to and from to see the view from both North and South perspectives.
Going to Manly. There is a couple of ferries going across one faster than the other. This makes a good trip as you have a good vision of the Sidney harbour as well as a look around Manly
Manly. we used the hop on hop off ferry to go to Manly stayed a few hours and then back on ferry later on in the day and stopped off at fort Denison on way home

A MUST do on a good day. It has been around 15 years since I last caught the Manly Ferry and while my last trip was a bit unpleasant because of the weather......this trip was on a sunny day with a gentle breeze. It takes around 30 minutes both ways and its best to travel when the peak travel times have passed. The seats are great and the views of the harbour are truely stunning. Try to get on the top deck and if its not too crowded try stepping out the front - the photos will be brilliant.

Beautiful view of the harbour. I had a day to visit Sydney before flying back home. The ferry to Manly was a perfect way to see the harbour from the water. The views were spectacular as was the weather. I would highly recommend the ferry and then spending a few hours in Manly enjoying the beach, a drink by the water and some shopping.
Best Way to Get to Manly from the City. About a 30 minute trip from Wharf 5 to Manly. Great views of the Harbour and lets off conveniently by the Manly Corso.

Busy on a Sunday. But a must. Absolutely solid on the 11:30 but well behaved and minimal pushing. Walk a hundred yards from ferry terminal and crowds melt. Walk four hundred along the beach and very few bodies. Wonderful setting and you have to go for $13 return

Spectacular views on the world's most beautiful harbour. But it can get a bit hairy.. From Circular Quay, you get a great view of the coathanger (Harbour Bridge), travel past the Opera House, Fort Denison (Pinchgut) and Garden Island naval station. On most days it's a nice journey on the world's most beautiful harbour with plenty of sailing boats, pleasure craft and the occasional cruise ship floating by. As with any boating experience, a little caution goes a long way. The Manly ferry often has to negotiate the prevailing currents when the ocean is pumping through the heads. Sitting outside is very pleasant when the conditions are benign but it's not unusual for people to come running inside after getting soaked by the waves.  If you have young children then supervise them very closely, especially outside on the lower deck as it can get a bit rough and wet underfoot.

A Good Harbour View. This is a splendid way to get a good view of the extent of this great harbour and at a reasonable price, about £15 return for the two of us. There is a small cafe on board and the seats aren't too uncomfortable, since this is just a commuting ferry we weren't expecting too much. It's easy to move around and get a whole raft of photos along the way. After 30 mins. the Ferry lands right in the centre of Manly, a smallish town with Aquarium and a short walk to the long beach on the Pacific side.
great trip across to manly. While there is a quicker ferry the local boats are clean and quick with great views of the harbour. Be sure to get there early to get seats outside or near window.
Excellent way to see the harbor. This is the best, most affordable way to tour the harbor and drops you over to a fantastic beach. There are plenty of places to eat lunch while you are there.

A great day trip. We jumped on the Manly ferry, not quite knowing what to expect, and had a great time. The ferry is frequent, well run, and generally comfortable. The trip down Sydney harbour is simply spectacular, and a great view of the "Sydney Heads" just before reaching Manly.Once onshore we had a stroll around, went down to the beach, and then had a seafood lunch. On the way back to the ferry stopped at the pub for a couple of beers.A real nice and relaxed time. Great, and thoroughly enjoyable.

Run every half hour ..... a great way to travel to Manly. Beats using Sydney buses, every time, when you going to/from Manly. A terrific way to view the Harbour and Opera House and at the end, once through the Manly Corso, you have the beach ...A fantastic way for visitors to Sydney, to see the Harbour and one our Sydney's great beaches. Good fun, when there is a big swell coming through Sydney Heads! However, watch the crowds using this service, particularly on Sundays, as reduced rates apply for familiesp.s. don't sit inside, stay out on the sides

Breathtaking views. Often stay in manly and travel to city by ferry as it is faster than going by taxi (30 minutes compared to over an hour at peak times) and also allows you to get some fantastic views of the harbour, opera house and bridge.
Cheap at the price!. If you want a cheap cruise across the harbour this is the trip for you.Whilst not luxury travel you can enjoy the sights and sounds of Sydney Harbour!
Worst ferry in the world. Slow, always late, smelly too, not very clean(floor sticky, toilet dirty) expensive too, ticket gate staff and information are rude and useless , don't bother
Brilliant. What a lovely scenic way of transport and it's a nice way to relax and enjoy the ocean breeze. There's a cafe on board which serves delicious refreshments.

Beautiful way to see the Harbour andget to Manly. Half hour ride with the best views of Opera House and Bridge. Charming older ferries. Manly is a charming place to visit even if you don't go tot he beach. Be sure to visit Q station. Very interesting and easy to get to by bus from wharf in Manly.
Efficient. More expensive than bus, but you get to manly much faster. Also the view of the harbour that you get to see is quite nice.

Quick and easy journey. The ferry to Manly is quick and easy, it only takes about 15 mins and they run every half hour during the day, more frequent in the peak rush hours. $15 return for adults which is really good value for money.

Believe them when they suggest you move indoors!. A great, low cost way to get super views of the bridge and the Opera House. It also gives you a clear idea of the scale of the bay. If you do sit at the open front of the ferry, do beware of the cross currents as you near Manly and take the advice to go indoors!

What's not to like?. The Manly ferry is a great way to travel (except at the weekend maybe when crowded!)
Tickets are reasonable and what views!

Great Value and Fun. Very clean, great staff. Sit up stairs forward or down forward. Great views of the bay. It is disable doable but keep in mind much of what is worth seeing in AU is not disabled friendly. Major curbs have ramps but most sites have stairs and no ramps or lifts.

Never get tired of this trip. I am an occasional Manly Ferry traveler and always enjoy the trip. This day the weather was superb so we sat outside on the side and took the opportunity to have a closer look at the western shore's bushland, little beaches and coves.So thankful someone had the foresight to retain the much of the western shore as bushland in comparison to the over developed eastern/southern shore.Heading from Manly back to the city every time you turn around Bradley's Head it is fantastic to see the vista of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and the Sydney skyline unfold before you. World class view!As a special treat, catch the ferry to Manly and leave Circular Quay around sunset in Autumn when the bridge can be spectacularly silhouetted against an orange sky.If you are feeling braver, take the trip when big seas are running. You will have 5 minutes of excitement as the ferry crosses "The Heads".
see the harbour.. Best way to see all the harbour sites. Deals to include entry into attractions around harbour. The zoo deal is especially good value. Friendly helpful staff.
Just brilliant . I love the Manly Ferry and endeavour to travel on it most days when we are in Sydney. Not unknown for me to jump on just to cool down from the city heat and grab an hour.
Manly "Cruise". The cheapest way to see all the sights around Sydney Harbour. Regular service at reasonable rates. A must do!!

Neatly maintained; Kept time well; great time. We had a chance to ride this ferry after our day tour; Neatly maintained and the ferry was right on time.
Looks to be a major source of commute to the locals....
Cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour. Best and cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour as well as going to Manly beach. Get off the ferry at Manly and walk around 400 yards through the mall to the beach.

Best roller coaster ride ever!. The trip to Manly on the Sydney Ferry is not to be missed. There are lots of private alternatives but the older, classic ferry is a great (and affordable) way to go. You can use your Opal card, which is a great investment if you're in Sydney for more than a day or two. The ferry has indoor and outdoor seating which afford fantastic views of the harbour, the Bridge, the Opera House, and the bays along the coast line. The crossing from the south side to the north side can be quite rough at times and it makes for an exciting and sometimes disconcerting ride for a few minutes. If you're standing or sitting on the lower outside decks you could get quite wet.Upon arrival in Manly it is a short walk down the Corso to the gorgeous expanse of sand and sun. We lucked upon a market with local craftspeople displaying their wares. A fun diversion from the heat and sun. A great way to spend a day!

Great value for a spectacular ride.. The Manly ferry is a great way to see the beautiful Sydney harbour. Its about A$7.5 each way on weekdays and $2.50 on a Sunday. Its general easy to get on the ferry but be warned Sundays are busy as! The ferry takes 1000 people so if you arrive and there is a big queue it moves quickly once the ferry arrives and passengers get on. We arrived for the 12.30pm ferry at 12.20pm (optimistic in hindsight) but easily got on the 1pm ferry. Staff do a brilliant job of keeping you appraised, but be patient - for $2.50 a 30 minute wait is worth it. Beats trying to park at Manly, particularly when there are surf carnivals on and it is a sunny day. Oh and if you are at the front...watch the spray when you cross the heads...there is a sign but many people are surprised.

Best way to see Sydney harbour.... This is a great way to see the full breadth and width of the harbour as the majestic Manly ferry takes you all the way past ritzy waterfront mansions to the Sydney heads (the entrance to the harbour), where the trip can get somewhat choppy. Once you get to Manly, you can wander down the Corso, check out the shops and of course head to the beach for a swim or just to check out the lifeguards and surfers. Take a stroll around (or swim) to Shelly Beach or if you have ample energy, consider walking from Manly to the Spit Bridge.

Reliable service . Traveled on the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly beach on a Sunday. The price of travel on a Sunday is only $2.50 for the entire day, no matter how many ferries or trains you catch. This was fantastic. Ferries ran on time and where a cost effective form of transportation.

The only way the cross the bay. Free WIFI on board, buy a Nova ticket as single one way is $7.60 but with a Nova its $5.40 each way. Lovely on a sunny day but wear a jumper if you want to take pics on the open fore deck area

Efficient and Scenic Trip to Manly. Schedule for the ferries is very convenient leaving I think approximately every 30 minutes. I believe the cost was around $15 pp and the trip took about 30 minutes.If you sit outside you may get wet depending on the harbor conditions. Did get a little rocky on our trip as the boat approached Manly due to the need to avoid other traffic. We had to head a little out of the harbor.Plenty of seating so don't worry about being left behind. They do provide safety information as well.Once off the ferry walk directly straight ahead down the pedestrian pathway which ends at the beach. Many shops and restaurants along the way.
Good ride to Manly. We liked the ferry. It held lots of people and was a deal for the cost. Its a wonderful sight seeing cruise too with such a beautiful harbor.

Wonderful views.. This ferry goes roughly every half hour from Circular quay & gives you fantastic views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and all the bays & beaches on both sides of the harbour.Once you are in Manley it’s a short walk to the Corso and then the Ocean coast.One word of caution - the ferry can get very busy at the weekends so pick your time to go with that in mind.
Great Trip. This is a great way to see the harbor and Sydney for what it is the ferry is great as well it is a large ferry with plenty of room and runs frequently

The Perfect Ferry!. The classic ferry for locals and tourists. The ride provides a lovely view of the Opera House, Sydney Bridge, and the shining blue waters dotted with sailboats, other ferries, and cruise ships. Lots of photo-ops. Food and beverages are available. Your route may vary slightly, as the captains always avoid choppy water and stay on smooth seas. You might want to save your appetite for Manly, a beautiful destination filled with the best fish and chips shops. If you do a little research first, or print out a harbor map, you will know the sites you are passing, such as North Head and South Head. The ferry runs often, usually every half-hour, until later in the evening. There is also a "fast" ferry run by a different company. It costs a bit more and is a hydrofoil. A good choice if you're in a hurry. A little choppy for the first five minutes, for those with queasy stomachs.
Fast service. Fast regular service to Manly. Stops less than ten minutes from the beach and the coastal walk. Great views of Sydney from the water
The best way to see Sydney Harbour. This is a great thing to do with children or visitors from overseas.. It is best on a nice day. Good value for money

Reliable and Comfortable. This was our first visit to Sydney and we had been told that Manly was worth seeing. The ferry is easy to find at circular quay and the staff at the ticket desk were very helpful. There were plenty of seats - most shaded from the sun - and it was wonderful to experience the harbour from the water.

Wonderful views. We used the ferry to Manly twice during our visit to Sydney. It is big and the boarding and disembarking are well organised. It runs to time. The views as you cross the harbour are magnificent.
Scenic ride. The ferry from Manly to Circular Quay offers remarkable views of the landscape. Really enjoyed it. Put plenty of sunblock though.

Great trip to Manly. There is no other way to get to Manly and also see one of the best harbours in the world. The ferries can be very busy at weekends and in the Aussie summer. Try and get a seat outside for he best views.

Don't go to Manley on a warm Sunday but a visit to Hugo's restaurant is a must. The ferry does give great views and is a good way to see the harbour as a cheap tour but avoid Sundays as the rate is reduced to $2.50 which is great but the queues to get on board are long as a result and the views of the back of peoples heads crowded all around somewhat spoil the view of this lovely city. Better to pay the $15 and go another day. (Also beaches packed out on Sunday)

A great way to experience Sydney Harbour. The ferry ride takes approximately 30 minutes, leaving from pier 3 at Circular Quay and is such a great way to experience the harbour and enjoy wonderful views. We took a ferry late afternoon to enjoy a dinner on Manly beach and returned at night experiencing the city lights reflecting on the harbour and the Opera House and Bridge beautifully lit up. Highly recommended.
A Day at the Beach. This was a fabulous day! We took the convenient, clean ferry from Sydney Harbour to Manly on this ferry. It was quick and convenient.
Use this ferry. This ferry departs circular quay every 30 minutes from circular quay wharf,use your opal card for this ferry

For great Sydney experience. The ferry leaves from the pier 3 every 30 mins. It will cost you about 7 AUSD with your opal card which you can get when you arrived at the airport. The journey takes about 20- 25 mins to Manly beach . Not only does the ferry take you to Manly Beach , it gives you a great opportunity to see the harbor and the opera house from a different angle. A must
Nice ferry, beautiful boat ride . This is a gorgeous boat ride with beautiful views. Manly beach is so much better than bondi, it's worth the ride over.
nice trip to Manly. nice trip from Sydney to Manly relax on a working ferry basic seating but fine a good way to see the harbour
Trip to Manly always a must. I love this trip. I never tire of it. There is always something you see which you may have missed on previous trips.

A great way to travel. If the busyness of the Sydney Harbour is one of the most memorable features of this exciting destination, then the Manly Ferry must be the most distinctive “must do” when you visit Sydney.We visited during the peak of the holiday season yet the service was able to cope with heavy morning traffic aiming for a day on the beach. These big powerful ferries and their dingy livery are an appropriate Australian icon – powerful, abrupt, singular and “Manly”.
Go for the ride.. Not only is it a nice 45 minute ride but you get to see Sydney harbour and at Manly was see a very attractive suburb plus a local beach.

Rough ride to a beautiful spot. We enjoyed the ferry to Manly until we passed by the break into the open water. Then we were tossed around. On the way back we sat up front and got soaked. We did have fun, but be aware of it.
Plenty of Room in the ferry. Easy to ride, plenty of seats, smooth ride. Drops you off in the Manly with several eatery in the station.

Ferry ride with splash of sea water on your face.. You can buy a return ticket from Wharf 4. Catch the ferry from Wharf 3.
Sit outside if you want the cool breeze & a spray of sea water. It is fun. Its a long ride & good views of
Opera House
Harbor bridge
Navy dock & ships
Good houses on the shores

Wheelchair accessibility. Wonderful trip to Manly in a wheelchair, sadly at Circular Quay staff couldn't,t be bothered to offer us a ramp to help with boarding. Manly end there was no such problem. Overall a very manageable journey.
Gorgeous views!. Very much a must if you go to Sydney. A 25-30 minute ride, great little restaurants when you arrive. Great for pictures and to enjoy the beauty of the harbor.
Great views across the bay. The ferry takes 30 minutes to travel from circular quay to Manly. It is a regular service which provides great views of the Sydney harbour sights from the water.
Scenic!. The ferry from Darling harbor to Manly is beyond scenic. Too good and too nature loving. Must Visit for nature lovers!

Great way to see the sights from the water. If you visit Sydney then you must catch the ferry to Manly. At 15$ (£7.50) for a return ticket it is amazing value for money. Not only does it offer you different views of Sydney Opera House, Harbour bridge and the city skyline it takes you to Manly which makes for a good day out. A word of warning - don't turn up a minute later than the scheduled departure time and expect to get on, you won't, these ferries run like clockwork!!

Brilliant harbour service. You can et everywhere around the harbour on the ferry services. Now you have the equivalent of Oyster Cads to make a it even easier and less expensive if you plan to make multiple trips. Ferries run until about 21:30. Check the timetables at Circular Quay.

Worthy Ferry Ride with Great End Point!. If you are going to take a single ferry ride in Sydney Harbor - from Circular Quay, take this one. Grab your OPAL card (travel card good on trains and ferry (probably buses to) - pick card up at airport and put $30-50 on it for a couple of day stay. Views are great, Ferry ride is about 30 minutes. Manly Beach shopping area on the Corsa - the pedestrian road between ferry landing and Manly Beach on other side of peninsula (short distance - walking) is a nice finishing point. Grab a beer, lunch and / or dinner and head back.

A Must Do Trip in Sydney. Really, this is one of the best public transport trips in the world. Seven dollars (one way) to sail right across one of the world's great harbours. Sit outside and be amazed at the views. If its a choppy sea, it's even more fun when you cross The Heads, the opening to Sydney Harbour.

Great way to visit Manly Beach!!. I took the Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Island and the experience was great. Smooth ride, service was timely and the ferry had plenty of both indoor/outdoor seating. They even have a bar onboard to purchase drinks and snacks. Many locals take the Ferry as well so it is very safe and family friendly.

Cheapest best way to see the harbour. $7- 30 minute Sydney to MANLY. You can't beat it. Always leaves on time. Has great view of the heads, harbour bridge, opera house, manly cove amongst other things.
Must do.

EXCELLENT WAY TO SEE SYDNEY HARBOR. Apparently there is the fast ferry ( like a catamaran ) and there is a slow one which is pictured here. Obviously price is cheaper for the slow one but difference is no big deal for casual visitors ( 15 vs 30 minutes? ). In fact the big slow ferry maybe better for taking pictures compare with the faster catamaran.....

It's the Must Do Ferry. What's not to like your on a boat in Sydney Harbor headed to one of the well know beaches. Ferries get very busy on the outdoor decks but if you can find a place outside you can't beat the views.

Always a pleasure. We've done this ferry so many times and it's just a great way to arrive at lovely Manly and back to bustling Circular Quay. Always manage to strike up a conversation with visitors from around the world to this 5 star destination.

Wonderful way to see Sydney . The Manly ferry is an institution for visitors and locals and one of the best ways to see Sydney and get a sense of how big and beautiful the harbour is.It had been years since I had caught the ferry, but a friend and I spent a weekend enjoying the city as part of a birthday celebration and caught the morning ferry across to Manly to spend a few hours at the markets and having lunch. If you enjoy the water and boats you'll love this trip. The trip takes you from Circular Quay past the bridge and Opera House across the harbour and out through the heads. The day we caught it was a beautiful early spring day so the combination of nice warm sun and the gentle rocking of the ferry across the currents was just wonderful.Sit outside on the deck and just take it all in as the old boats take their time across the harbour.

Sea Breezes to Manly. Nice 30 minute hop to Manly where's the a lot of great places to eat. A stint sitting out the front of the boat is refreshing and blows away any cobwebs from a day in a meeting room.

A great Ferry Trip. We took the Fast Ferry to Manly to have our Lunch there.Really enjoyed the leisurely harbor cruise. We sat on the top deck to experience lovely weather and scenery.Highly recommend this cruise.
Great day out with the kids. Highly recommend the ferry. Cheap. Fabulous views of the Harbour. Manly is a great place to visit. Unbeatable really.

great sightseeing trip opportunity. there's a fast ferry to Manly that probably saves 10 mins, but we thoroughly enjoyed the big ferry and slow pace going thru Sidney Harbour out and back to Manly Beach. In fairness, the fast ferry is more frequent (~15 mins) compared to the ferry (~30 mins), so you may wait longer to take this ferry

Use your Opal Card for a great harbour cruise. During the one hour trip to Manly and back you see all the sights and have some fabulous photo opportunities. Opal travel card gives unlimited travel in the city of $15 a day and just $2.50 on a Sunday. A must for any visitor.

A great, inexpensive harbour cruise. A trip on the Manly ferry on a sunny day will make it clear why Sydneysiders are so proud of their harbour. This is a great way to have a leisurely harbour cruise. If there is a swell coming in through the Heads, the ride can get a little rough for a part of the trip, but kids of all ages love it, not to mention the refreshing (sometimes drenching) spray. Whatever the time of year, it's always a fabulous trip, and a "must do" if you are a visitor to Sydney.

One the best ferry rides. This is one of the great ferry rides!!!!! Takes about 45 minutes. I prefer to sit outside how ever because this is not always possible there are 2 decks where you can sit inside. Great city and harbour views. Highly recommend this ride

Can't visit Sydney without hopping on a ferry. So glad we finally got to ride on a Sydney ferry! Took an afternoon ferry over to Manly on a Friday afternoon as we had plans for dinner (Hugo's). We arrived as the workers were making a mad dash to get home on a Fri arvo & was probably extra busy due to a cruise ship in town. We used our Opal card to swipe on & off, asked for direction to the appropriate wharf & waited a short time for our ferry.On board we took a seat outside which gave us a great view of the wharf area, was quite warm with the sun beating down but once we were moving the breeze cooled us.After dinner, we wandered over to the beach and strolled up and back. Most of the shops had closed other than eateries so we made our way back to catch a ferry home. We sat in the same spot as on the way over which this time turned out to be the back of the ferry as it does not turn around when leaving the wharf. Very happy we accessed this mode of transportation, was convenient and relatively cheap.
Fast Boat to Heaven. Like all the ferries from the Circular Quay, the Manly Ferry and the Fast Ferry provide stupendous scenery and ideal destinations.
Best Harbour Cruise!. simply the best mode of transport in Sydney.This trip takes in the best of Sydney Harbour, and sets you down a few hundred metres from the beach!

Easiest way to Manly Beach plus a tour of the Sydney Harbor!. We had a few hours left of our last day at Sydney so we took the F1 ferry to Manly from wharf 3. I do not remember the cost because we paid cash but I think it was under $20 AU round trip. We also got a close up view of Fort Denison (my maiden name). We sat inside so we did not witness a mad scramble for seats outside or on the top. Ferries run frequently so we did not have to wait long either going to Manly or coming back.

Last day fun. If you combine city rail tickets and ferry fare it gets pricey but the boat ride is worth it. Make sure you get the top seats on the ferry. Views from the ferry are amazing and you will love it.

Brilliant ferry trip. When in Sydney you have to go to Manly on the Ferry. It's a brilliant way to see the harbour and the view as you come back to Circular Quay is spectacular, especially if you do it at twilight. Go to Manly, walk up the Corso, have lunch, walk up the esplanade, go for a swim, walk back, catch the Ferry. Intersperse with drinks breaks as you wish. Idyllic.
Needed Direction. As first timers, we were not clear on boarding etc, and got caught up in a mad rush. Once on board we felt we were scrambling for seats, and areas.

There and back. . We only had about one and a half hours, so decided to do the trip to Manly there and back for the views of the Harbour from the deck. We weren't disappointed as you get aspects of the main attractions that you wouldn't from land. Great ride.

Take a trip to Manly ,an escape from Sydney. Take the ferry across the harbour bay area to Manly ,very scenic crossing , can get a bit rough ,but well worth the effort to get away from the hustle and bustle of Sydney ,its Sydney's play ground on the beach, and a really nice beach too, coastal walks and plenty of sand , Manlys restaurant and bar life ,is very popular and has something for everybody ,its a great day trip,but also a great place if you have a few days to spend to,relax/party/and enjoy .
Excellent Ferry and lovely trip to Manly. Excellent Ferry and lovely trip to Manly beach, taking 30 mins with great views of harbour bridge and opera house.

Manly is a must to visit. When on holiday in Sydney everyone should visit Manly.Half an hour on the ferry from Circular Quay, Manly is a beautiful seaside location.Go onto the magnificent beach or stroll along The Corso, Manly is a perfect family destination.
Love it. Take it just before sunset from Manly. You will see the sunset behind the Harbour Bridge: it looks stunning!
Cheap harbour cruise!. loved it! A super ferry ride to a lovely beach with water dragons basking along the way! Lovely walk around the bay.
Cheap and Cheerful. Great way to get to Manly, ferries run very frequently and the views if the harbour are spectacular, and Manly doesn't disappoint when you get there

spectacular views. great place to experience Sydney from the bay with some truly amazing views. Harbour bridge, Opera House , etc. Get an opal card anad on Sunday you can travel all day for a mere AUS$ 2.50. Must be the best public transport price in the world!
Great trip with views all around the harbour. Fabulous beach and plenty of restaurants and a nice walk around the boardwalk to the next little beach.

Fun little ferry ride with great views of the harbor. We took this ferry to come back from the Zoo, and it was an inexpensive and fun way to cross over back into Sydney. You definitely get a unique view of the Opera House and the Harbor riding this ferry.

Great!. Sydney is all about the water! Taking the Ferry to Manly exposes you to the Sydney Harbour and all its beauty. Then the town of Manly is quaint, interesting and a great alternative to the hustle and bustle of Sydney. Plus its a great beach.

Our Canadian relatives were pleasantly surprised.. Late summer and sea breezes beckoned, so we took our Canadian visitors to Manly by ferry.The first comment heard, after an ocean swim and a walk around the pathway to Shelly Beach (approx 2km round trip) was that this inexpensive outing is one of the unsung great day trips of Sydney. Our visitors were more than satisfied.Everything was reasonably priced - perhaps dirt cheap. The ferry trips, the pie for lunch and the iceblocks from a well-known German supermarket. The change rooms are free, likewise the surf, beach walk and other facilities, each of which was clean and welcoming.Of course, dearer options are available, but why not have an energetic, relaxing day and grab a few classic photos of the world's best harbour from the upper deck of the ferry?This is a great way to spend a day.

Took the trip to Manly. The Manly Ferry is about a 35 minute ride to Manly beach and I am sure a much better option than trying to get there with ground Transportation. When riding the ferry system around Sydney Harbour, purchase an Opal pass and you will save of few dollars.

well worth the trip. Good 30 minute ride to manly but some great eateries once there. Take your camera and see Kiribili house, the harbour bridge, the opera house and much more. However one of the ferryticket gate attendants managed to keep me waiting for 10 minutes , yep 10 minutes whilst they chatted to a friend and when i had to butt in politely to ask a question about the service they didnt bother to help me and said i dont know and went back to chatting to their friend. Possibly the worst customer service i have ever encountered !!
Good ride. The ferry is the best way to get to Manly. It can be a wild ride if there is a bit of weather, otherwise, sit back and enjoy
Must do activity. The Ferry makes stopovers at multiple spots . Kind of like a hop on hop off. a Must do if you ask me . We got off at Taronga/ Manly and finaly Darling harbour
Simply amazing!. Such an amazing way to see sydney harbour! The views and photo opportunities from the ferry are amazing! This is a must in Sydney

A must do trip for overseas visitors or even if your a local. One of my favorite things to do in Sydney is to take the manly ferry over, have fish and chips on the beach and get the ferry back to the city, its a wonderful way to get out on the harbour. Highly recommended
nice day trip. Manly is so relax and beautiful place to visit. How can go to the beach and then have a nice seafood lunch near the ocean. The water look likes mediteranean

(Little) trip of a lifetime.. If you like ferries, say the Star ferry in HK, or Staten Island you'll love the Manly Ferry. Stately solid it's a great way to approach Sydney or leave it for that matter.

Pretty cool. If you haven't been to Manly, go now. Our only regret is that we didn't spend a night there. The ferry location is laid out very well with all kinds of ways. It has a nice retro vibe and the food was amazing. There are a lot of beach goers but it didn't feel over crowded, and it has a feeling of getting out of the city without going too far.

a comfortable ferry even in rough weather. it is a 20 minute ferry to manly,the ride is fun ,get to see the skyline of Sydney n pass by the rich n famous house n villas which dot the beaches,also it is fun being in manly,

One of the best parts of our Sydney trip. Going to Manly Beach was great, getting there by fairy was awesome too.Having a beer from their on board bar and going out and being up front outside was just great feeling the air, seeing the views and dolphins just made this trip a highlight of our trip.I highly recommend it even if you're not going to the beach. They had some great restaurants there so just go for a lunch head back to town if your staying downtown.We liked the area so much, we checked out early and stayed at the Sebel Apartment Hotel.
Easy and accessible. Nice views around the harbour Clean Efficient and reliable serviceBrings you to the heart of Manly from the heart of the Sydney CDB
Great family trip. Grown family all enjoyed a fantastic day heading across the harbour and over to Manly. Staff were friendly and proffessional

A must do ferry ride. Caught the public transport "green" ferry to Manly for about $15 return. The Sydney siders are so lucky to have this great service where they can travel the harbour every day. The ferry leaves from Wharf 3 at circular quay. The views along the way are amazing as you travel past the bridge, the opera house, and then past the heads before arriving at Manly. You can sit inside or out on the ferry. It's a "must do". Make sure you take your camera.

Great for views of the Harbour. Definitely worth taking the Manly Ferry, gives you great views of the bridge and Opera House as you leave circular quay. It's an adventure in its own right, even if you're on your way to visit Manly.

Quick and efficient. On our first morning in Sydney we sat at a café in Circular Quay having breakfast as the ferries cruised in and out of the Quay releasing passengers on to the quayside and absorbing many more back on to hurry them on to their next destination. Later that same day we decided to travel to Manley and used the fast ferry. We had no problem buying tickets, the service was efficient and we left on time both going out and on the way back. We sat on the open deck on the way to Manley because it was warm and sunny. However, on the return journey the weather had turned and it was cold, wet and windy so we sat under cover.

Great day trip. The Manly ferry is an easy way to head from Sydney to Manly's beaches or Aquarium for the day. They run regularly, you can catch one whenever you want to head back to Sydney, and the journey back and forth gives great views of Sydney harbour.

By Manly Ferry I mean the Fast Ferry from wharf 6. This (relatively)high speed catamaran service offers a service every half hour to Manly in 30 minutes from Circular Quay. Provided it is not wet or too windy, try the open seats at the front, outside. In high winds (as I experienced) these seats are still good fun, but not for ladies (or gents) with well-quoifed hair! It was fascinating watching as the captain made his way between some ocean going yachts having a race in the harbour!
A must for tourist. Best way to see the harbour... better than any private cruise esp during rough sea days n winter.... yeee haaa

Takes you to Manly. Does what it says on the tin. The Manly Ferry is a regular ferry to Manly.
We'll worth the trip as Manly beach is better than the more famous Bondi.
Worth the trip just for the views. A great way to get a cheating sort of harbour cruise. Go on Sunday when the daily travel cost is capped at a fantastic $2.50!

Manly has a great walk- vigorous but not athletic achievement. Get on right side of Ferry on way out. Plenty of seating. Pricing on standard tourist stuff like thirst much better than in Sydney. One store in particular-sorry but don't remember name- good quality items at giveaway prices. From ferry walk straight to beach and it was on right maybe 2nd block.

For a real Sydney Harbour experience - do this. From the sails of the Opera House to the waves of Manly Beach, the Manly Ferry lets you have it all,
On a gorgeous Sydney day there is so much to love about a trip across the Harbour.
It's a must do for every visitor to Sydney and of course us Sydney-siders love it too.

Nice boat ride. Took the ferry to Manly for a day at the beach - the ferry wasn't crowded, there was plenty of seating for everyone, and the ride was scenic. Ferry dock is on the other side of the promontory from the beach, but it's just a short walk to the other side where the beach access is.

Take the Trip. Very reasonable ferry to Manly which has beautiful beaches with many restaurants and bars.
A Buzzing area

Had such a good time we went two days in a row!. Boat ride is great way to see the beauty of Sydney Harbor. Boat is in excellent condition , super seating and views are spectacular! It takes about 25 min to get to Manly Beach. Wear suits and bring a towel. You can rent chairs and umbrellas , a little expensive at $45 AUD, but worth it. Great choice of restaurants and little shops.

Most beautiful ferrry trip. There is nothing better than a good old Sydney Manly Ferry ride across Sydney's Beautiful Harbour and past the heads. One of the must do things in Sydney, always have your camera ready you never know what you may see and the Sydney skyline masked by the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House is always a post card picture, you can visist Manly when you get off or just stay on and do the return trip

A Must Do in Sydney.. Relax as you cross the harbour to scenic Manley Beach. Great photo opps. Sunscreen needed if sitting outside. The ferries are clean and run lije clockwork from Circular Quay to Manley town. You'll see sailbiats, Double and Rose Bay as well as The Heads along the way.
Great way to get to Manly hassle free. Easy way to get to Manly without having to worry about parking, The ferry was clean and well maintained. Also a nice ride in the harbour with great views

Easy ferry ride. The ferry to Manly Beach is a quick 30 minute ride that takes you within about a block from the beach. Right off the ferry there is an information booth where you can get all sorts of information about rentals etc and they even will make the arrangements for you right there and direct you to the place to pick up snorkeling equipment or whatever you are renting. Found this very helpful. Make sure to visit Hugos restaurant next to where the ferry lets off - good food, right on the water. Also, take a walk to Shelly Beach from Manly Beach while you are there. The snorkeling is great there too.

The City to Manly by Manly Ferries. If you want a true Sydney experience you can't go past the ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly. There is so much to see in Manly and it is the most scenic way to travel there.
Good way to get to Manly. This is a workhorse ferry, no guid or commentary. However, a quick easy journey with some good views, especially of Opera house and bridge.
Great harbor cruise and local transportation experience. Very affordable self guided tour around Sydney harbor. Highly recommended. Buy the day pass especially on a Sunday. Please do try it.

Always fun. I love a ride on the Manly ferry. There is outdoor seating on the lower deck and out the back and front on the upper deck, giving fantastic views of the harbour and yachts etc. There's also lots of indoor seating. There is also a food bar on board. Yesterday there were 2 cruise liners on the harbour and they looked beautiful in the summer sun. Please remember - the ferry can get very busy if there are famous cruise liners at Circular Quay and Garden Island, resulting in full ferries, so you may have to wait for the next one.

steam passed the Sydney heads and roll with the swell. great way to relax and ease off the sore feetgrand old way to take in the harbour, big ferries very comfortable and see the small heads that provide protection for our wonderful harbour
Great over view. We used it as a tour and hopped off at stops we liked. Very friendly staff gave us suggestions for lunch and a walk about.

Views are great!. If you're in Sydney - make sure you get on the Manly ferry! A bit of fun for kids - but also extraordinary views of Sydney Harbour! Only half an hour from Manly to Circular Quay so its better than a bus! Great views, a must of Sydney.

A FERRY TRIP TO REMEMBER. I live in Sydney and do the Manly Ferry trip frequently simply because it is so magnificent and it is. It is a journey each way of 30 minutes and it is very leisurely. Not to be missed. From Manly Pier you can walk to Manly Beach which is only about 5 minutes away.

Best outing in Sydney and still a local commute to work.. Best outing in Sydney and still a local commute to work.Enjoy a beer on the way home as you slip over the harbour. Go on a day with big surf and enjoy the power of the waves as the ferry master skilfully ducks and weaves amongst the swell.

Cool view during ferry ride . This ferry ride starts near Sydney Opera House and cruises through Sydney Harbor to Manly Beach. I highly recommend this ferry ride for it's beautiful views on way to great beach community Manly. Combine this ride with a visit to Sydney Opera House before and it makes for a fantastic day and/or evening.

Seven miles from Sydney.. 100 miles from care. Quite simply the best tourist deal in Sydney. Not only do you get a cheap and scenic ferry ride on Sydney harbour, you end up in Manly - the best best in Sydney. When we host overseas guests, this is the primary suggestion for an activity in Sydney.Don't get the fast ferry to Manly though - you don't want to rush this trip. Sydney harbour bridge, the Opera House and Sydney Harbour are all on the watch list.Two best ferry trips in the world? This one and the Star Ferry in Hong Kong.
Very busy Ferrry. The ferry can be a bit busy. But is worth the trip to Manly to have lunch, go to the beach, visit the shops.

Eclectic travel.. This is bar far the only way to travel to Manly. It only takes 30 minutes and they are very punctual. The boats carry hundreds of people and just getting them on and off is an experience to watch.

Day out. What a way to see the Harbour and Sydney. Combined it with a trip to the Rocks and had a thoroughly enjoyable day. Especially suitable for visitors to Sydney. Could add a visit to Manly Beach if you wanted

Manly is GORGEOUS. The ferry is okay but Manly is so cool!!!!! Beside the ferry stop you will see a guy doing twerking (I guess he will be there everyday). Along your way to the Manly Beach (it takes about 5min to walk from the ferry to the Beach), you will find a lot of convenience stores, deli, ice cream shops, and churches (there is one we saw a band doing service, a lot of people singing with them, that was so cool).You will LOVE Manly not just because of its landscape but the people.P.S. Right before we took the ferry to go back to the city, we encountered a current failure of the whole peninsula. Everyone looked freaked out.

Be Prepared For A Long Wait If Using Transport NSW Ferries. I was never sure what there was about Manly Beach that made it so special except that it is one of the few beaches easily accessible from the City. I last went there in about 1983/4, and I remember taking a picture with just ONE person sunbathing on the beach.... I guess its fame and popularity mean that it is now packed, however I decided to take the ferry and go and have another look... Except...Like most (Australian) cities for getting about on the buses and trains in NSW you need to have a ''travel card'', an Opal card. On Sundays you can get on any of the Sydney harbour ferries for only A$2.50, so guess what the queue for the Manly ferry at Circular Quay is miles long as every man and his dog is going there.....
