In fact the Sunday I was there they announced that there was a one and a half hour wait, which I would say makes Manly a very crowded place on a Sunday.You can of course take the fast ferry which you have to pay a lot more to get on, but strangely most of the tourists seemed prepared to wait for the A$2.50 fare!I ended up going to Watson's Bay instead which was very pleasant and at least gets you a ride on the harbour for some nice picture of the Opera House and the Bridge, but then you can get good photos of both from the Botanic Gardens...You have been warned!!
Great views. Crazy cramped and packed. You have to make a run for it to board. Great way to see the harbor but get to the slip early!

A must do, to experience sydney and sydney harbor. The Manly ferry is a must. It is a brilliant way to travel up the harbour. Past the harbour bridge, opera house, fort Dennison and the harbour. And there is plenty to see in manly.

You just have to. . Go out and be sure to come back at sunset. It's a beautiful view of the city, harbor, and opera house. Be sure to sit outside on the upper deck. Really easy to use and well worth it. They close the gates a few minutes before departure so be sure to get there 15-20 min early.

Must do!. Taking the ferry from Manly to Sydney is an experience that every tourist has to have. It's a fantastic, short and very beautiful route. You can't get that view from anywhere else. It's just amazing. Make sure you get a seat outside in the front.

Great. The quickest way to get to Manly!
Very clean and safe always on time! A great way to Sydney Harbor! Used our Opal card

Totally worth the trip. Easy to ride, a great view of Sydney Harbour, and if you're self-guided, a really fine alternative to taking a more expensive harbour cruise. Manly is a great place to sit at a bar and watch people or walk around and experience the place. I definitely recommend at least a half day tour over to the place via the Ferry.

Catch the regatta, if you're lucky!. It's a gorgeous view from the ferry to capture the sights of the harbour. You'll get to enjoy also views of the real estate along the water front, and cast a green eye on passing yachts. If you're lucky, a regatta race may pass you by - that was exciting and fun and certainly brought back great memories for me!
Great way to see the harbour without. I recommend the Manly ferry as a great way to see the harbour without the cost of one of the full tours.

Manly ferry. A half hour trip from Circular Quay in the city brings you to the beautiful and well known Manly. The ferry ride is a great way for visitors to see our city, you can purchase refreshments onboard or eat on arrival at many of the restaurants and bars. A cheap way to travel for visitors to Sydney.
Great . Ride. Manly beach has tons of places to eat and is pretty busy. The ferry to Manly runs quite often and is pretty quick. Sit outside and enjoy.
Stunning trip. We took a ferry from circular quay to many and it was a wonderful experience! The view from the ferry was just stunning!
Manley. Manley great town, lovely beaches, restaurants, shopping lovely place for a holiday 20 minute ferry ride from circular quays Sydney.

Just do it!. Worthwhile taking the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay. Fab view of all the famous Sydney landmarks along the way. Once you reach Manly it is a short easy walk to the main Manly swimming beach. We had a picnic lunch on the grass overlooking the ocean. There was plenty of activity on the beach with bathers, people enjoying a surfing lesson etc.
Great trip. Very relaxing trip from Sydney to Manly, actually saw a Dolphin along side ferry, if using during winter months don't venture outside.

Views of Sydney skyline . A great way to travel to Manly and view Sydney Harbour Bridge and the opera house from the water. The views from the deck are stunning and there are good facilities on the boat itself with plenty of comfortable seating. The service is frequent and efficient.

A must-do in Sydney. On a warm, calm day, there are few better things to do in Sydney than take a ferry to Manly. Stunning. The 10 min walk from Manly Beach to Shelly Beach is a must.Take the ferry to Manly, go for a swim and then have some fish and chips on the beach. Nothing would be more Australia.Ferry ride takes about 25-30 mins. Great views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. And cheaper than a harbour cruise.

Best experienced when seas are choppy. I love the way the ferry rocks and rolls when it turns towards Manly when it is close to the Heads (North Head and South Head - entrance to the ocean). During this half hour trip you can purchase a hot drink from the on board canteen. Very popular trip for seeing the main sites on Sydney Harbour such as the Harbour Bridge, Sydney Opera House, Fort Denison, Garden Island, Shark Island etc

Great transport. This is the way to go. To get to Manly on the Northern beaches this is the way. We use it when coming and going from the airport and after a 24 hour plane ride, it is a heavenly way to unwind, get some fresh air, take in some lovely scenery in order to travel to Manly and nearby areas. The service is totally dependable and even in rough weather the trip is exciting. It leaves every half hour and takes 30 mins. For the journey. The ferries do need upgrading but there is something romantic in these old boats. The whole experience is well run and efficient and there is a cafe on board in case you didn't pick up at either end. Love the journey. Good way of travelling to Sydney to see the sights there.

Iconic Iconic Iconic. What can you say the best short cruise in the world. Take an early evening ferry from Circular Quay to Manly, eat at the Fish Shack then catch the ferry back when the lights in Sydney are just coming on round the harbour...just magic.

Quick and comfortable. We took this for New Years Eve. The ferry was quick and comfortable - there was more than enough seating despite the thousands of people thronging all modes of transport that night.
Great wee sail. Took the trip down to Manly for lunch and enjoyed both , staff on the ferry were helpful and the trip was very smooth

Best view on the harbour. Cheapest view of the magnificent Harbour.... relax and enjoy the scenery while you travel to the iconic Manly beach for brunch the markets or just to wander and explore. Love the Manly ferry it is Sydney at its very best.

Manly Ferry. This is a great way to view the sites of Sydney Harbour. The trip is relaxing and carefree. The only down side is on weekends this service tends to be packed so finding a seat to view the sights can be difficult to find.

What to do when you don't have your own boat. Another must to do whilst visiting or living in Sydney. A magical experience being on the harbour. Yachts, boats, views to die for. Stop off for a cocktail at Manly Wharf; walk towards the beach for some of the best seafood and ambience. A wonderful day without spending a lot of money. I do it often with friends.
A they do it well. A relaxing trip from Circular Quay to Manly on one of Sydney's best ferries across Sydney Harbour. What could be better. You won't regret the experience.

Lovely afternoon to Manly but to the Olympic park is better. We took a few hours out to have a ferry trip to and from Manly. It was lovely but if you only have time to do one trip take the cat from Darling harbour to and from the Olympic park. The scenery is stunning
Must do. Great way to see the harbour and great views of bridge and opera house. Stroll around the beaches at Manly and have an awesome day out!

brilliant cheap way to see the harbour. great views of Sydney harbour - we travelled from manly and was a super trip - sunday was only 2.50 dollars too so much cheaper to travel on this day (usually 7,50 dollar)
Very affordable way to enjoy the bay. The ferry runs every 20 minutes, it is quite inexpensive and if you get on board at the beggining, you can get a good seat to enjoy the view
A beautiful place to visit.. Manly was a lovely relaxing place to visit, we had a picnic overlooking the beach and the ocean. We walked through the town it was lovely.

Great Way To View Sydney Harbour. We recently took the ferry to Manly and it was a delight to view Sydney from the water. Great views of the skyline and Sydney Opera House. Return trip to Circular Quay just as fun!
Highly recommended.

The beaty of Sydney Harbour. Sydney has the enourmos advantage of having one of the most beatiful harbours in the world. And the best way to experience it is to go with the Sydney Ferries for example to Manly. You see the beauty of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Bur also Cremorne Point and the other settlements on the south and north shore. Ticketing and the handling by the ships crew is fiendly and cunning. The short trip to Manly is like a a mini-cruise.

Great way too see the harbour. I went to Manly on the fast ferry and returned on the slower ferry. Both were great fun. This is a great way to see the wonderful views on Sydney harbour for a small cost.

Relaxing way to travel from Sydney to Manly. Relaxing form of transport from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf. Great way to spend a day, especially for overseas visitors. Comfortable seating and coffee available on board.

Always a great trip. This is well worth the trip if you visit Sydney. Head over for a swim and some fish and chips. Its always a fun day out for our family and easily accessible. Just beware that it can be busy at time so be prepared at peak times.

Gentle, comfortable 30 minute cruise to Manly. On time, seats in or out (but the outside seats at the front and reae are very popular - be first, or settle for a side seat), cafe on board.
Worth a go!

One of my favorite ferry route.... This is excellent and picturesque way to visit Manly from Circular Quay. This route offers the personal and up-close way to see Sydney Opera House too. The ferry ride is not too long and perhaps the best way to go Manly beach.
I recommend everyone not to miss this while you are in Sydney.

Top Sydney experience. All aboard for MANLY on this this "must do" Sydney experience. Sydney Opera House to the left & Sydney Harbour Bridge to the right as the ferry leaves bustling Circular Quay Ferry Terminal. It doesn't get better than that unless there is a cruise ship in the Terminal at the same time.The trip to Manly provides special views of residences & attractions all the way.Ferry's are well patronised all year around.The return trip is equally enjoyable as there may be yachts sailing, naval ships berthing & pleasure boats cruising. Other ferries are always busy crossing the harbour.

Cheap cruise. What a great way to get on the water and view the spectacular harbour on a budget. To see Sydney from the water is something not just travellers should do but great if you are from Sydney too. Its like when you fly over Sydney at sun set. Spectacular

Most enjoyable!. It's been a while since I caught the Manly Ferry. But am glad I did it this time - it was on a perfect day! The crowds can be rather daunting and the ticket price is not super cheap but it's a much cheaper alternative to a harbour cruise. Upon arriving at Manly there are so many options - lunch/dinner at all different price points, visiting the beach and souvenir shopping. Great for tourists and locals alike.
Sydney. Fantastic way to get to manly no hassle no stress and its relaxing and peaceful i would do this trip daily its that relaxing
Perfect introduction to Sydney. The ferry was a great way to spend the day upon arrival - beautiful sights - best view of the bridge and opera house from the water!

Couldn't Have Been Better!. This is a great way to see the harbor and more. We were fortunate to take the ferry on the morning of Australia Day. Seeing the decorated boats and boat races was amazing. We enjoyed Manly Beach and our lunch there before returning to Circular Quay.
Only way to Travel . We used this Ferry for getting around and for getting a great view of Sydney. It is very affordable and you will have a good time on the Ferrys. It is well worth using them.

Best way to visit Manly from Sydney and vice verso.. If you are a tourist arriving in Sydney and maybe you do not have a car ,the best thing to do if you want to visit the famous Northen Beaches ,is to take a ferry in Circular Quay and go to Manly .The ride only takes 30 minutes and you'll be surprised by the many sailing boats and the beautiful views of the city from the ferry . Once in Manly enjoy the beaches and the holiday atmosphere and even a nice chocolate , ice cream or coffee at the Manly warf .

Very efficient service. The ferry departs about every half an hour and it's a very efficient and well-oiled operation; passengers are smoothly disembarked and then the ferry is reloaded! Typically a popular crossing but there were plenty of seats when we travelled, there is a cafe and toilets on board.

Comfortable trip. A relaxing and comfortable trip from Circular Quay to Manly. A perfect way to get to Manly. We paid $15 for a return ticket. I would suggest going on a Saturday as Sunday had a very long line and wait to get on the ferry.

Good way to get a Harbour Tour - Bring Camera!. We took this ferry to Manley beach. It's about 30 min. The views of the Harbour, Harbour Bridge, Opera House and surrounding coastline were awesome. Bring a camera!! Cost was 15$ AUS return to Sydney... They run quite often and not too overcrowded.
Reasonably priced and quick. You can pay your fair with the train/bus ticket. $7 each way. They get you right to Manly without much delay. Clean boat with bathrooms and cafe.

Great little cruise. This is a very cheap way to cruise the harbour. You have the bonus of Manly beach at the other end which is just a short walk from the Manly ferry terminal. Take a towel and bathers but take note of the signs showing where it is safe to swim.
Great Ferry Ride. This was a busy ferry most times but well organized, especially with your OPAL card. Nice trip across the water, especially at night - great view of the city.

Great ride... Awesome view, esp at night. Nice 35 min ferry ride from circular quay to Manley. On return, sit in the front. At night, extraordinary views of Sydney all lit: opera house, harbor bridge, etc... And Manley was very nice, too, with the shops, beaches, and walk through the national park.

Big Ferry and Great Views. If you're headed to the beach, the ferry to Manly is the way to go. It's reasonable, runs every 30 minutes, and the harbor views are great. Plus, if you travel on a Sunday with Sydney's Opal Card, you can essentially go for free, since all transit (including ferries and trains) are $2.50 TOTAL all day.

Definitely worth a trip. We went across to Manly today on the ferry and it was a great trip. It cost about $15 return, they run every half an hour and it takes about 30 mins to get across. It was a bit rocky on the way over, despite it being really sunny and generally calm, but on the way back tonight it wasn't as bad at all. The views that you get of the centre of Sydney are really good, especially of the harbour bridge and the opera house. There were also loads of sailing boats out this morning and it was fascinating watching them all on the water, especially when they had to move when the ferry sounded its horn!You can get refreshments on board too, which we didn't buy, but worth knowing. Good to be queuing to get on from about 10-15 mins before sailing time as it gets really busy. They open the gate about 10 mins before it's due to leave, once they have emptied the ferry coming the other way. The best place to be I think is the back/front of the ferry, depending on which way you are going. You can stand up and get the best views. Watch out on the way back though as this is that is the area most likely to get wet!

a rough crossing. We decided to go on the Manly ferry because that is something you just do. Unfortunately the day was a little breezy and at one point where ferry crosses a stretch of water open to the sea it got a bit rough and the ferry rolled a bit with spray coming over the bows. Did not bother me as I used to be in the Merchant Navy and had seen much worse, but my wife was not impressed.Other than that it was an interesting way to see the extent of Sydney harbour and surrounds. Gives you an excellent view of the opera house and the bridge, It leaves from Circular quay.

Great. Lovely half day out, wonderful views of the harbour, ferries every half hour enabling a leisurely meander round the town time for refreshment, meals etc.Opal card enabled so a reasonable priced treat.

Cheap way to see the harbour sights. I did this on a Sunday when all your train bus and ferry travel (combined) costs just 2.50 on your Opal card!! Great views of the Opera House and the bridge. Sunny day so outside decks full but room to move about and get a coffee inside. The boat is fast so you get to Manly quite quickly and there is one every half hour so getting back when it suits you is easy. I browsed the shops, walked the beach, had lunch and then came back but some groups were obviously going for the day, picnics and all!

Across the Harbour to Manly. It's as it is a boat trip over the Harbour to Manly.It's a steady ride on the day I went it was very calm but as the trip goes past the entrance to the Harbour entrance there is the possibility it could get fairly roughDont be put off its worth the ride , plenty places keep and eye on the last ferry times to get back

Worth the visit. Travelled by ferry from Sydney. Great way to travel with trip taking 30 minutes. Beach 5 minute stroll from ferry terminal. Lots of good souvenir shops and restaurants en route. Beach well patrolled by life guards. Changing facilities available on promenade.

A great outing. This trip is already highly rated on Trip Advisor, and rightly so. Catch the ferry at the circular quay; the ferries are clearly marked and you can pay with your Opal card. We caught the 6 PM ferry. It is a beautiful ride out thru the harbor to Manly, taking about 45 minutes and costing about $7 AUS. Once in Manly we splurged and ate at a restaurant with a seaside view. We also walked around town; very nice vibe. On the way back we watched the sun set over the harbor; so beautiful. And for an extra bonus there were fireworks over the harbor as we walked around "The Rocks" after getting off the ferry.
Sisters. A great way to have a river cruise and then end up at Manly Beach.Swim at Manly , lunch on the foreshore then toddle back to Sydney Hotel Excellent day out.

Lovely weather made it worthwhile. I travelled by ferry to Manly last week while I was in Sydney. The service is good, it is easily accesible from the Circular Quay. The total ride takes around 20 mins one way and there are ferries every half hour. It is reasonably priced - $15.20 for a round trip per adult. It gave me a great opportunity to click some great photographs of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House.
Trip to Manly. Loved the ferry ride to Manly the scenery is just beautiful looking back at Circular Quay is breathtaking.

Fantastic ferries. We took the ferry to Manly this week Wow what a great trip .the boat ride is spectacular with great views of the bridge and opera house. Across the heads with spectacular vistas all around . The beach at Manly leaves sad old Bondi for dead. The return trip treated us to a spectacular Sydney sunset...A great day

Great trip. Great trip to Manly, good wiev of the bridge, CBD, opera house.
Many cute little town with a good beach. Take you towel and enjoy the beach.
Forward of the ferry great to take photo on the way back to city.

Great trip. Great journey you see all the beautiful scenery on the way for a fraction of the price of a boat trip and then you arrive in lovely Manly,loads to see and places to eat near the pier especially Hugo's ,they have the most amazing Pizzas and you can spend the time people watching

Great photograph opportunities. We took the high speed option takes about 10 to 15 mins. Lots of opportunities to snap the harbor bridge and the opera house in the same pic. The ferry is fast clean with lots of good places to sit. Upstairs can be shaded or open and is very airy as you sped along the bay. Watch out for the point where harbor meets the seawater breaks it can be quite spectacular. The seas outside the harbor are quite rough.... hence the great surfing waves.

Stunning views of Sydney and Manly. Only 30 minutes to Manly from Sydney.The views of the Opera house and harbour bridge are iconic.The cliffs as you approach manly are stunning and Manly itself is a lovely holiday-resort type place which was bathed in sunshine on the day I arrived.

Fantastic way to see the harbour and Manly. A cheap but effective way to see the best of SYDNEY from the water (Opera House, Harbour bridge) and then get to Manly one of the nicest beaches in Sydney and the world.Attractions galore in Manly and a beautiful walk along the promenade.Nice restaurants.Return to Sydney for the most spectaculars views.Fun also to see how the ferry driver avoid hundreds of skilful sailors enjoining Sydney harbour ....or maybe is the other way around (sailors avoiding the Ferries)!
Better than I remember.... Took the Ferry to Manly for lunch ...a good service well managed and relaxed. Great views of the Harbor and beaches. Plenty ofseating despite it being peak holiday time.

Wonderful views and wheelchair accessible. We took the Manly ferry and were pleasantly surprised by all aspects. It was wheelchair accessible inside and outside and provided great views of everything in Sydney Harbour
There and back. If you're staying in Sydney, just take the Manly ferry there and back at least once - even if only to have a beer at the Manly Wharf Hotel. (It's a great pub.)

I loved the ferry to Manly!. This is the best deal in town. For very little money, you can board the ferry to Manly at Circular Quay and ride through some of the most spectacular views in the city. It will take you past the opera house, the Harbour Bridge, spectacular views of downtown, and on to more stunning views of the Harbour that you probably aren't going to see otherwise. Once you arrive in Manly, there is a great beach there to greet you (though it's somewhat crowded). We just got a drink in a nearby bar where we met some friendly people and then enjoyed the ride back again. Do it.

Convenient transport to Manly. It departs every 20 or 30 minutes and offers an extrodinary view of the Opera house. And if you are lucky enough you migt spot some dolphins or whales on your way.
It can be a bit bumpy so if you'll get sea sick easaly you might want to consider another option.
My transport of choice. Such a cool way to see the harbor up close. It is relatively cheap and some of the ferries even offer wifi.

Nice trip to Manly. The ferry takes about 30 minutes or so to get to Manly Beach. The main section of town is quite touristy, but about you expect. We did a bit of the beach walk to the right, and that is a nice pave path. You can go as far as you like. We had some rai starting so turned back, but it is a nice walk. Beautiful seaside homes ring the area.The ferry itself is convenient leaving every half hour. It is large so no worries to fit everyone on even if it looks crowded.
Quick way to travel to Manly and back from the city. Very well priced, alternative way to travel. Good even if it's to take the kids on the ferry to hear the commentary....

A Trip with my boy. The manly Ferry is a kind of a tradition growing up in Sydney as a young child. Now a father of two and a third on the way it was lovely to take my 3 year old on an adventure over to Manly. I'm glad to say it hasn't changed over the years, the kiosk is still on board there is still the mad rush to get a seat upstairs up the front, the cost is probably appropriate considering the maintenance and up keep involved. It's lovely to take the arvo off and stroll down to the beach for a play in the water then leisurely stroll back and take the next ferry back to the city, my little boy loved every minute of it.

check the weather. great way to see the harbor for not a lot of money watch the weather if its rough it gets a bit hairy otherwise its a worth while trip there and back plenty food at the wharf at both ends we enjoyed the trip

A relaxing trip to Manly. Catching this ferry to Manly is a great way to get to sit and relax. No traffic to worry about and fantastic views from the ferry. It is a nice quick service and very good value for money.

Gateway to an icon !!!. Whether you take the fast or the slow ferry, this trip allows you to feast on many inspiring views. Travelling from Manly to Circular Quay, you are soon travelling past The Heads, being the gateway to Sydney Harbour, the largest and deepest natural port in the world !!! Many other points of interest gradually come into view until the most iconic one of all, the Bridge and Opera House making it a trip to savour for all the right reasons and great value at 7.6 dollars. Enjoy.

Great way to see the sights. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach during our stay in Sydney. The ferry had plenty of comfortable seats for taking in the views of the Sydney Harbor, the Sydney Opera House, and the Harbor Bridge. For a cheap, easy, and scenic way to visit Manly Beach or view the harbor, the Manly Ferry is the way to go.
a nice relaxed way to reach Manly. Takes about 35 minutes from Circular Quay (Sydney harbour) to Manly. Smooth ride and great views over the water.

Great views of Sydney to Manly. I am far from a sailor and always worry about motion sickness but I needn't have worried - although the ferry was packed due to holiday season it was a very pleasurable journey both to Manly from Sydney and the return trip - takes in views of the harbour; bridge and Opera house and get to see those speed-boats doing there thing to the tourists
Great Ferries.. These ferries are amazing value for money and run everywhere and always on time, cant fault them.Highly recommended.

Amazing views, really cheap & manly rocks!. The views from this ferry are unbelievable. Go on a Sunday from Wharf 3, circular Quay (the Sydney Harbour) and get an opal card with $10 on it. The fare for the whole day caps at $2.50 so you can make it a really cheap trip, as that will get you there and back. When you get to manly, the main beach is not the one just as you get off the ferry, you have to walk a bit through the town to get there. Grab some cheap snorkeling gear on the way (I'll explain soon). There's a restaurant on the front called The Manly Grill which does the best ribs and sweet potato fries you'll eat in Sydney. From there, go to Shelly Beach. I cannot recommend the snorkeling enough, for both adults and children. You see some amazing fish, catfish and other sea life and it's all free. What an amazing day, all for $2.50!!!
Going away over the water. Taking the boat, from almost in the centre of the city, exciting. A nice trip watching Sydney shores to arrive at a beach resort...well worth a detour

Great views of Sydney Harbour. We started our day in Manly, after catching a train and a bus there from North Sydney. We wanted to catch the ferry from Manly into the Sydney harbour. It was a great day out and fun was had by all. It was a pity the weather wasn't as great as we were expecting, but you could really get some fantastic photographs of the harbour and the boats coming and going on a clear day. As with all of Sydneys public transport, it was really well organised and efficient!

The range of place you can go on one of these ferries will amaze you.. The ferries are part of the soul and spirit of Sydney so you must take some time out to do at least one or two trips on them. You can make them part of a ferry and walk adventure which will cost you very little and get so much out of it. Just do you research and ask locals if you need help.

Great harbour views. I had more than 1 local tell more to ride this ferry even if I didn't want to visit Manly just to see the views. I can see why. It is an inexpensive way to see the area although I recommend actually stopping in Manly. Of the 7 Sydney beaches I saw it was my favorite. The beach is an easy walk from the ferry and there are plenty of shops and cafes asking the way. If you are looking for the quick trip to Manly this isn't it but it gives you more time to see the harbour.
Awesome way to see the harbour!. A fantastic way to see the harbour. Also the best way to get to manly from the city. Definitely recommend this one! an awesome scenic experience

The Views Cannot Be Beaten. I often take the Manly Ferry just to enjoy the beauty of Sydney Harbour. On a sunny day, regardless of the month, the trip takes in the most beautiful aspects of the harbour. The ferries have always been clean on my trips and if one could only convince other passengers to be courteous and NOT stand in front of your seat then everyone would probably have an enjoyable experience. So try and do the run outside the busiest times or choose a seat on the side of the ferry. This limits the sightseers needing to take their endless photos in front of your view.
Great Harbor Trip. What a nice, inexpensive way to get great views of Sydney Harbor and visit another town (Manly) in the greater Sydney area. Well worth a half-day.

Fast and cheap. We love catching the ferry to Manly just for a day trip. I would highly suggest catching this ferry if you are just going to visit the awesome Manly beach because it is not too far from the dock.
Harbor scenery. Great and cheap way to get another angle for opera house photos. Allows a good working knowledge of Sydney upscale homes across the bay

Best day out on Sydney harbour. There is no better experience in Sydney that a trip on the Manly ferry. It costs less than the harbour cruises, and it takes you past so may icons - the Bridge, Opera House, Botanic Gardens, Garden Island naval base, the ritzy homes on the harbour, past the marinas and yachts out racing, and then across the Heads to the best beach in Sydney at Manly - harbour beach and surf!

Best route the Manly. Done this trip many times and is a fun way to get to Manly and the beach. It's cheap. Get your opal card or buy tickets at the wharf. It gets choppy half way across owing to the open sea. On rough days the boat will seriously list. However you are safe. Toilets on board and a dodgy little cafe. Does anyone use?

Fairly quick and cheap. If you travel around Sydney using an Opal card then use it on the ferries - it has to be the best value possible, as the most you can spend in any one day is $15. The ferry boats are fairly basic but they do the job.
A must do while in Sydney.. The Manly ferry is a must do while in Sydney. The views on the way are gorgeous and great opportunity for a photo.
a ride to manly beach. nice country and a good view to ride on the ferry to manly where we pass by harbour bridge and opera house.
Quick, cheap and easy. Loved our little afternoon trip to Manly with an easy trip over on the ferry with great views there and back.

Great Exprerience!. Took the ferry from terminal 3, Sydney harbour to Manley, visited the beach, great experience, $15 for the return trip, great value, yes full of tourists, it was Xmas so no shock there!!

Why go by road?. We found this a great way to get around Sydney without having to worry about the traffic... Using an Opal card that we purchased at Circular Quay, the main city departure point for the F1 (Manly) Ferry, to tap on/tap off it was so easy & not expensive... Leaving every 20-30 mins, the journey from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf was a pleasant way to spend 30 mins or so enjoying the spectacular Harbour views...Used the 'Transport NSW'' downloadable time table to plan our trip (Wharf gates close 2 mins before ferry departure times)...Knowing that many locals use the ferries for their regular commute we planned our day to avoid peak hours...

day out on the manyly ferry. nothing to do, well its worth doing a round of the city Queen Victoria buildingacross to the fountain and then a short walk down to the wharf,we went across to Many on the ferry and spent a lovely day looking around manly enjoying the great cafés .all our visitors will love the trip on the harbour best one in the world try it for yourselves,

Sunday Must. Great value to see the Harbor and witness a great little village of Manly .Took the Sunday $2.50 special and had a ball watching the spectacular Sydney Habour at workManly is a buzz and has some amazing little restaurants along the main road .DO IT

Well worth it . It is $15 for a return from Sydney harbour over to manly, Manly is a nice area and worth visiting. The ferry is big with plenty of seats the trip is about half an hour in total, they come every half a hour and it takes about half a hour to get over

Great Day out.. The Manly ferry is a cheaper and excellent way for any tourist to see the beauty and sites for the Sydney Harbor. This Ferry takes you to other parts of the harbor stopping on the way at other places around the Harbor. It takes you to one of Sydney's most popular beaches where there are great shopping areas and places to have lunch or dinner. Our favorite place is a Cafe called the Four Olives where my husband and I enjoyed lunch many times when we have visited Manly while staying in Sydney.

The best way to see Sydney harbour. This lovely ferry ride is a great way to get views of the harbour bridge, the Opera house and the many suburbs and beaches around the waterfront. The lovely community of Manly is a great place to walk on the beach, have an ice cream or stop for a meal, before taking the trip back.

Great ferry trip on Sydney Harbour. Just a beautiful trip out to Manly - spectacular views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Did the trip on a Sunday and it was just $2.50 return each!
Best ferry system in the world. Go anywhere you want, you can't beat the Sydney ferry system. The trip to Manly beach, Taronga zoo, Darling Harbor, all good

Great on Sundays especially. On Sundays there is an one price for all the transport (on your Opal card), so take this ferry which crosses nearly the whole harbor. Enjoy the beach, eat some ice cream and go back.
Very well run ferry service. Enjoyed the trip. This is a very well run service and not expensive. Not too busy which was good. It needed a bit of a clean up.

Another must on any Sydney visit.. Watch out for the rough sea when the ferry crosses the heads but generally it's very calm and even if rough only lasts for a few minutes. Take a taxi to Fairy Bower for afternoon tea. Alternatively stay in the town, walk towards the beach and your find many opportunities for eating and drinking including the famous Manly fish and chips. Don't miss it, you get a wonderful view of the harbour and the suburbs and it's a day out or an afternoon out to the seaside.

Not just a mode a transportation, . From Circular Quay, take the F1 ferry to Manly on wharf #3. On weekdays, it's busy with locals getting to work/home. On weekend, it's less crowded as only tourists are around. This is the best ways to view Sydney harbor, bridge, Opera House and get your panoramic million dollar view of Sydney I one photograph! Or enjoy the cruise and watch the many sailboats flip over, million dollar homes, and cool breeze. Form Manly, you will be amaze as the view of Sydney Harbor slowly come into view. Well worth the price of admission.

Easy ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly. We travelled on the Manly Ferry both in the daytime and at night. The Ferry was clean and tidy and the crew were welcoming and helpful. Each time we went on the ferry it was packed with people but everyone managed to have a seat and it was a great experience.

A must for any first-time visitor to Sydney. One of the best harbour boat rides in the world (as long as the weather is nice). The Sydney Opera House is 5 minute walk from this boat's departure point.

A must when in Sydney. Used the Ferry to go from Sydney Harbour to Manly. A great way to see the sights and views and a good price too. The ferry has plenty of seating on 2 levels inside and there is also seating outside for great photo opportunities. There is a kiosk serving hot and cold food on board too. There are different ferries going to different parts of Sydney, all with great prices. A good way to get around and see the sights.Manly is a nice town with lots of souvenir shops, some clothes shops and plenty of restaurants, food eateries with lots of choice. There are also 2 beaches, a little one near the harbour and a large one on the other side, ideal for surfing.

Very easy to use, reasonably priced. Had one day to explore Sydney and a friend of mine had suggested the Manly Ferry. Cost was reasonable and would have been even cheaper had I kept my OPAL card which I bought to get from the airport to the city. I think if you spend more than $15 in a day, all your rides after that are free. Something like that. Anyhow, the ferry was easy to find and board. Nice views. Sit upstairs if you want even better views. Snacks are available for purchase. Coming back in the evening was REALLY nice to see the different color shades of the sky against the Opera House and the Bridge. I'd highly suggest using this to get out to Manly if you want to get out there.

Nice way to see a few sights. We were on the ferry to see the celebration of the 2016 new year "Beyond the Wharf". It was an affordable way for a MUST see while visiting in the Sydney area. They gave you a bottle of water and chips if you wanted. It was only about 3 hours. Would definetly recommend if your on a budget and want to see the fireworks. It's also a nice ride and great scenic views.
Classic! . Old but classic ferry. We took the trip on a Sunday which for a family of four cost us only $10 return. Great views of the bridge and Opera house to boot

Great way to see the vistas of Sydney. . It's only half an hour to manly from circular quay. The views are beautiful and plenty of photo ops. There is a kiosk on the ferry serving drinks and light snacks. A pleasant way to spend an hour or so.

Best view for the money in Sydney.. Okay, truthfully, I didn't look at all the views in Sydney, but I would highly recommend taking the ferry, either just for sightseeing or to spend the day in Manly Beach (its beautiful). The ferry takes about 30 mins and cost around $8 AUS each way. You can sit up front and be outside. On a beautiful day, it feels like absolute heaven. It can be a little rough on bad weather days, but if you're going for sightseeing, definitely plan on a clear, sunny day. You can purchase a separate ferry ticket or pay with your opal card (you won't need to tap off). I believe they ran every 20 minutes or so up until about midnight.

great ferry. manly is a lovely town with 2 great beaches and plenty of eateries and a few pubs the shops are mainly tourist shops but are very good value to get presents to take home. the ferry is very good value for money and also has a cafeteria the other good thing it has is a water station for you to fill up your water bottles free !!! get the opal card for travel on busses trains and ferries for best value as they are tap on/tap off and much easier to travel as paper tickets are being done away with you can get these cards at most newsagents and you just top up with the amount you need - very efficient.

So if you throw your hat off the Manly Ferry, it's gone forever!. Quickest way to get to Manly (beautiful beach and restaurants) while seeing Sydney Harbour. Perfect outing for the family for the price of ferry fare!

Million Dollar Views for under $10. The Manly Ferry is a must do. With Opal Card in hand, you are able to see the Sydney Harbour at its best. Leaving Circular Quay, you get to see the Harbour Bridge and Opera House in all their magnificence and enjoy a great ride to Manly which has plenty of attractions for families.
Get your Opal card and enjoy this superb service. Went to Manly a few times and the ferry makes it WAY closer than the bus or, still closer than the bus to Spit Bridge and the walk.
Awesome. The ferry trip to Manly is amazing no matter the weather conditions. You can enjoy amazing views of the harbour and opera house and everything in between.

Everyone says do The Manly Ferry. One of the few recommendations we had before we went to Sydney was to go on the Manly Ferry. I'd certainly be happy to pass that recommendation on to others. It was a great value-for-money way of seeing the harbour and once at the Manly Wharf, there's only a short walk to the beach and around a great area.

The busiest hub. Probably one of the busiest wharfs in Sydney. Connecting ferries with a legio of public transport in the heart of the City. Great views, street musicians, tourist shops, restaurants and plenty busy bodies. A buz of activity.
Meh. Not bad wharf. You dont have to tap off when you get off the ferry as it automatically does it for you. A few mini cafes around and restaurants on the water front.

A Sentimental Journey Again. Not much has changed in sixty five years that I can remember. It is a magnificent harbour journey which should be experienced by everyone. Especially when the seas are up.

Buckey list - must do!!. Travelling from Circular Quay to Manly across the heads is a must for visitors to Sydney. Takes about 30 minutes and the price is very reasonable. The kids loved it - then the anticipated return trip while taking copious pics for the family album. Do it!!!!

Manly = Must see. The ferry is a must do for tourists. Manly Beach is stunning and there are plenty of shops and other activities for those that are not enthralled by the beach. The ferry terminal is easily signposted, the staff are helpful and the price is reasonable. The trip to Manly has the added advantage of a fab view of Sydney Harbour and some time relaxing out on the water

Great day out. Informative crew with commentary over speakers as you are travelling. The captain even stopped on the way so we could watch some dolphins. Manly is a must visit, lovely little town with a breathtaking beach, beautiful.

The Best Sydney Ferry. The Manly Ferry is the best Sydney Ferry. It's a 30 minute trip with the best views of the Harbour you'll see in Sydney. You can sit on the upper deck or lower deck, indoors or outdoors. I always love the upper deck at the front for the views and fresh air. It runs between Sydney and Manly, two of the best places in Sydney to spend some time. Great for locals and visitors alike. A view like this never gets old!

Great trip to Manly and back. The kids loved the ferry trip to Manly where we wandered through the Corso and down to the beach.....however it wasn't cheap costing $38 for a return trip for a family of 5.

Use your Opal card for your trip to Manley!. The Manly ferry leaves circular Quay every 20 to 30 minutes. The trip each way takes about 30 mins! Plenty to see and do at Manly! You can use your Opal card to get you there and back!

Great Cheap way to see the Harbour. This is a great way to get to Manly, especially for any tourists as it provides a great view of the beautiful harbour! It is also very cheap compared to sightseeing tours, so this is a great way to see the place on a budget. Also a great thing to do on a Sunday afternoon if you have done your 8 trips on your Opal card and you can travel on the ferry for free! :)

Fab Sunday activity. Caught the Manly ferry last Sunday to catch up with some friends for lunch on the Many Wharf, prompt load and unload of a large number of people handled very well by staff. Biggest bonus, it was free! A must do activity when in Sydney.

nice trip to Manly beach. The ferry is the best means to go from Sydney city centre to the beach (or the other way round if your hotel is at Manly). Spectacular views of the skyline, the famous opera house and harbour bridge. Fast and pleasant crossing through the beautiful bay.
Cheap way to go for harbor tour. Do not buy the harbor cruise, buy the Manly Ferry and you will see all. Plus, Manly has wonderful beach that you can hang out.

If you are visiting Sydney, experiencing the Manly Ferry is a must. We were looking forward to spending time with friends over the weekend and a trip on the Manly Ferry was on the agenda. They arrive every 20 minutes and getting on and off the Ferry went very smoothly. Sitting outside gives you wonderful Harbour views and there is so much to take in. Loved every minute of it. There are also a number of food and drink options at both ends of the trip as well as a small cafe on the ferry itself. I would highly recommend anyone visiting Sydney to make sure they went on the Manly Ferry
Loved it. Took the Ferry to Manly twice, definitly a must do in Sydney to admire the fantastic view off the Harbour.Manly is also a very nice place to visit.

Great service. We took the Manly Ferry from
Circular Quay. It was very good and personally i love the exit points on two levels of the ferry. Very well design !

An amazing way to see Sydney Harbour. The Manly Ferry is just wonderful - especially for kids. Wouldn't recommend as highly for a wet/rainy day but at any other time it is just lovely. The views are spectacular on the ferry trip (plenty of good photo opportunities) and the kids love all the excitement. If you have time I would definitely suggest staying in Manly for a while (you could easily spend a whole day) - walking to around to Shelly Beach, exploring the Sea Life Aquarium and grabbing lunch. It is a great outing for tourists and locals alike.

A mini cruise.. It takes approximately 30 minutes from Circular Quay to Manly by ferry. There are faster ways but what's the rush? The ferries are old and often crowded but that adds to the charm. The views across the harbour are a visual delight and the cost is more than reasonable.
Great scenery. Had a lovely ride to Manly on the ferry, great weather and scenery along the way. Go on a Sunday it's as cheap as chips.

Manly ferry on Sundays all day for $2.50. As of January 2016 you are still able to travel as much as you want on Sundays on all Sydney public transport for $2.50 with an Opal card. While this is still in place, one of the best things to do is to get out onto the harbour by taking the ferry to Manly from Circular Quay. Note the express Manly Ferry is a private line which takes 20minutes - great if you are in a hurry - but is not part of the Opal Sunday deal.You however want to enjoy the ride on the one that takes 30minutes and it still gets you to the same destination. Be prepared to get there early (15 minutes ahead of schedule) to get you towards the front of the queue so you can get yourself an outdoor seat. Be aware that, while that sunny open deck seating you found feels good quayside, after 10 minutes in the blazing hot sun without sunscreen/hat, you may find it to hot to handle, so choose wisely. Getting an outside shady spot is the recommendation to keep cool and get to take in the harbour sights but predicting which one this will be in advance given the time of day/direction of the ferry etc is harder than it sounds! Good luck!

Great way to see and experience the harbour. If you're going to Manly, the views and the experience of treading Sydney's Harbour waters are an added bonus. The ferry is always on time, it's fast and the tickets are reasonably priced for a return trip.
Take the Fast Ferry. Manly Beach is a busy beach community. Full of shops and restaurants. The restaurants along the beach and harbour offer good food and nice views.

Great way to see the Harbour AND visit Manly. What a view! Cruising from the Quay to Manly is a true pleasure. The ferry, although old and really needs an update, is still one of the best ways to get from south to north!

Comfortable and affordable. A comfortable and affordable way to get out to Manly. Lots of seats and free WiFi on board. It can get a little choppy between the two headlands / exit to the Pacific so if you're bad with waves, best to be seated at that part.

Great picture opportunities. For about $15 you can get a return ticket. It goes passed the opera house and bridge for views not possible from anywhere else! Manly is really nice too. When the busy streets of the CBD become too much it's a really nice change to be in a relaxed atmosphere:)

Manly Ferry Ride. A nice scenic 30mins trip from Circular Quay to Manly. The ferry is comfortable and clean and a fairly smooth ride. A few big waves when you near Manly passing the passage to the open sea - but very safe. Watch out if you are on the bottom front deck as some passengers got unsuspectedly sprayed by waves on our windy day! A cheap and enjoyable way to see Sydney Harbour via water.
Amazing. Great way to see the harbour and Manly Beach of course.Pity we didnt realise the great value of the Opal card before we bought tickets.Ferry fine. No complaints.

A beautiful way to experience the harbour, its just a pity Manly is at the end of it!. I've done this trip so many times and every time I enjoy the trip on the ferry more than Manly itself. I love sitting outside on the ferry on a sunny day taking in the view and the sea spray. However as much as I enjoy the trip itself, the destination isn't worth it so if you were a traveler with only short time to spend in Sydney I would take the ferry to Cockatoo Island and stay on for a few stops before disembarking on the island for a stroll around the heritage shipyard and woodfired pizza and cocktails at the island bar on deck chairs with the most amazing view of Sydney harbour.

Good service and ferries clean but ticket system unfair. The ferry to Manly can get very full so board on time. The fair at around $7.50 is reasonable but because there are no paper tickets any longer one has to load a card - these can only be loaded with certain amomuts, so although I only needed $15, I had to load my card with $20 - the remaining $5 I lost. I tried to load for $30 so that I could make 4 trips but this wasn't possible either, only a card for $40. A fiddle really,

On time, great views. We stayed in Freshwater, so we took the Manly Ferry to Sydney multiple times over the course of our 2 week stay. Dependably on time and easy process to board/unboard. Great views coming into Sydney. Great value with the Opal card - especially on weekends when there is a max 2.50 charge for the entire day.

the weather was fine the sailing was soothing. went on a ferry ride to Many the weather was warm the sea breeze was soothing the gentle waves felt like a baby being rocked in its mothers arms people embarked and disembarked in a friendly manner children were smiling enjoying the school holidays and a pleasant ride to the beach

Great . There is something magical and romantic taking the Madley ferry at night time. The lights of Sydney are beautiful, don't miss the Sydney Opera House which is lovely. The trip is interesting and you arrive in Manly feeling good. Manley is worth a visit with its friendly shops and streets and 5 excellent beaches all within walking distance. Watch out for laughing Kookaburra and screeching cocktails.

The best way to see the city. Sydney is a beautiful city best viewed from the water, and there's no way to do it like catching the ferry to Manly for the day. Around $15 will get you a return ticket and spectacular views. Then take a walk to Manly beach for fish and chips and ice cream before the return journey.

Ai think a must for a Sydney visit. Every visit to Sydney, we have taken the Manley Ferry. Not only is the ride enjoyable but the sights of bridge and opera are different from what you see rambling about. And the short walk to Manley Beach to watch surfing, swimming is a freebie. A great way to spend a morning or afternoon.
Good day trip. We had a lovely afternoon at Manly. Great ferry ride over there, frequent and you see all the sites of Sydney Harbour.

Fast ones for drinkers. An excellent trip just for the views of Sydney,the bridge and the Opera House. The big green ferries are 'dry' but the smaller ,faster 'cats' have drinks aboard. Prices vary according to time of day and they have equivalent of UK Oyster card.
Easy travel. A good way to get around the different areas of the harbour. The Opus card is a must to get around easier and can be bought from quite a few vendors dotted around the quay

A great way to see the city and get the snaps . Went to see friends so hopped on the ferry. Great day and nice ride. Not great if your in a rush and it's crept up price was but a great way to see the city.

Cheap, very cheerful and very crowded. The obvious way to get to Manly and a good chance to see harbour views, especially of that bridge and the Opera House. Be prepared for the hustle and bustle of major crowds when busy. An iconic harbour ferry experience really. Very reasonably priced.

Fantastic. Used their hop on hop off boat trip from Darling Harbour. Hopped off at Taronga zoo and Manly. Would have liked to have hopped off at Watsons Bay too but ran out of time. Very easy service to use. Gentleman selling the ticket at Darling Harbour was lovely.
Relaxing way to travel. I loved taking the Manly Ferry what an enjoyable way to travel. Seats are comfortable and the ride enjoyable for a vessels of their age

Good way to see the Harbour. Obviously the ferry is great if you want to go to Manly. We also recommend it to our visitors as its a nice way to see the Opera House and city from the water, without having to pay for a tourist boat tour. It can get really busy in the summer time, so try and arrive nice and early to make sure you can get on.
the only way to travel between the city and manly. efficient and enjoyable - the ferry is regular, covers the harbour in 30 minutes and also with cafe onboard provides food (if you need it)

An icon for me. I love the circular quay to manly ride or vice versa. The scenery is breathtaking and you see so much. The ride is about 20 minutes....just enough time to take in the sights and atmosphere.
Good 1 day trip. Sydney harbor to manly beach is good 1 day trip. Manly beach is very good. It has all good market and restaurants nearby.

Very pleasant trip to a lovely place to visit. We took the ferry to Manley on a beautiful September day. The views across the bay were beautiful. The ferry trip was very pleasant and light snacks were available on board. The frequent, reasonably priced service runs throughout the day into late evening so you can really have a full day in Manley. It takes about 30 minutes. The beach is very nice and you can walk along the front for quite a long way - a very pleasant stroll. There is a full range of places to eat to suit all. Then coming back of an evening to the buzz of Circular Quay really completes a lovely day.

Inexpensive way to see the sights of Sydney harbour. Took the young Grandson (6years old) to Manly for the day. First part was lining up to get on board the ferry as on a weekend it can get very crowded but it takes more that 500 people so don't let the crowds distract you. Once on board if it's a fine day an outside seat would probably be the best for a first time visitor but be warned it can get very hot on the 30 - 40 minute run across from Circular Quay to Manly and you could lose your hat unless tied down, but you can still just walk around outside whenever you want.. This is a great way to see some of the sights of Sydney Harbour as the ferry makes its journey to Manly. There is also a snack bar on board for food and drinks both hot and cold. Awaiting at the end of the journey to Manly wharf is the main surf beach 150 meters away plus many shops and restaurants down the main Corso to the beach just follow the crowds. All in all this is a rather inexpensive day to see the harbour and the beach if ever in Sydney. For our overseas folks. The ferry wharf at Circular Quay is about 100 metres from the Opera house/Botanical gardens and 200 meters to the old rocks area. You can also get a ferry from here to Darling harbour if you wish. Something not to be missed when touring in Sydney.

Worth a visit to Manly Beach and the Ferry is a great way to get there!. Manly Ferry was an easy and affordable way to commute from Sydney to visit Manly Wharf and Manly Beach which was an awesome town.
Good day out. The ferry is a good way to experience Sydney Harbour .very regular. .really cheap. And you can hop off and on were you like . good day for all
Manly. Took the Ferry to Manly and had a lovely day there just walking around, window shopping, nice cold beer and lunch by the beach... Well worth the ferry ride..

Worth the trip. What a great way to see Sydney Harbour and cheap too.If the weather is good, try to get on first to get an outside seat, it is well worth it. I could have run backwards and forwards on this ferry for the entire day.Manly itself is worth a walk around and the cliffs nearby are beautiful.Top tip is that if you are going to be tootling around Sydney for a few days, get the Opal Card to bring the price way down. Even paying day ticket prices it is worth the trip at AUS $15.20, but with the card you can bop around the harbour all day for less than that.
Ferry Ride. Great way to travel to Manly and a beautiful way to see the city lights at night. On every visit to the city we make sure to take a ferry ride.
Manly. Manly beach was superb it was the only beach in Australia that was so packed although it was a Sunday. Manly ferry was also packed because of so many people travelling to Manly

A pleasant journey to one on the beach ares.. We had just arrived in Sydney and our Daughter decided we would go to Manly beach by ferry. I was on a Sunday so I understand public transport is much cheaper I think it was $5 against $15 any other time. The journey was great we travelled quite a distance and saw many places. The prime ministers house was one of the place pointed out. The ferry itself is quite old but this ads to the fun and experience of it. You can buy snacks on board an there's toilets. You can sit outside or inside when its too cold. Manly is worth a visit and there's a very pleasant walk to do around the bay. Lots of cafes bars etc.

If you miss it, you've missed a big part of Sydney. Don't miss this iconic trip across the Harbour from Circular Quay to Manly and back again later in the evening.See the Bridge and the Opera House at their very best from the Ferry which takes you as close as you need to be to imprint the views onto your memory, forever. A real must do for any visitor to this special part of 'Oz''She'll be right, mate!'

Peaceful. Great journey
Regular ferries
Had a super time in manly
Great viewing platform for Sydney and the harbour

Good service. Used the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. Clean and on time with great views of the City, Opera House and Bridge. Very busy at Manly due to rain but queues were well managed and seemed like extra boats put on to clear congestion.

Easy way to get to Manly. We hopped on the ferry to Manly in the morning along with a lot of other people, but there were plenty of seats, so a pleasant trip over. We had a good look around, good shops and food.

A good way to spend some time!. Now that we took the ferry we understood why so many ferries. To take roads it is a long way round. This ferry gives some good views of Sydney and the Opera House as well as once you get to Manley it was an interesting little town - a bit touristy though.

To experience the Sydney Harbor - TAKE A FERRY!!. Take this ferry for a nice long ride through the harbor. Or take any one of the many ferries! A ferry ride is the best and only way to truly experience Sydney Harbor1

Relaxing experience. Sydney harbour is a magnificent sight from any form of transport, but the ferry is right there in the middle of it. Fabulous views of the harbour bridge, and the Opera House, little bays with moored boats and some of the most expensive houses on the shore line. A wonderful way to spend half an hour that is totally relaxing and exhilarating - especially if you are sitting outside! There is always lots happening on the harbour to keep you entertained during the trip.

The iconic tourist must do trip in Sydney. We travel to the city from Manly at spasmodic intervals. Parking the car nearby is a nuisance, but we manage. The boarding of the slow or green ferry is also slightly disorganised first time, but the staff seem very pleasant and helpful. On the city trip we sit on one side (port) and return on the other as the ferry does not turn around having dual helming positions. Viewing the Manly foreshore is always a delight and unless there is a very rough sea, the crossing of the Heads creates an impression of the big wide ocean world beyond the Heads. The nudist beach below the south head is mainly populated by men. Watson's Bay and Vaucluse, also the homes of the wealthy, soon give way to Nielsen Park swimming pool. Having passed the rocks of Sow and Pigs you can see why many a sailor has met his nemesis on them, The wide bay opens up to Clarke Island , Sydney's most expensive suburb of Point Piper, in between Rose and Double Bays. The naval dock - Garden Island looms in the foreground next to Darling point. Sydney's early settlement was centered around Farm Cove which sits in the shadow of the Opera House. All the time a full view of the Harbour Bridge dominates the front. A turn to port (left) and the ferry is sliding into Circular Quay. Disembarking is straight forward in that a lot of transport emanates from "Quay". Turn left and follow the covered walk to a large selection of restaurants and at the end the Opera House. For the return trip pick up a guide map to show you the location of the Kirribilli House and Admiralty House.

Great service. Took train from Blue Mountains to Sydney for a day trip. Caught the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay. Didn't have to wait very long at all for a ferry. You can use your Opal Pass for all public ,transport which makes it simple and easy. Trip was quick, ferry was clean and I just love being on the water. Plenty of photo opportunities
Great way to see lots on a day trip!. We were only in town one day, sho this was perfect for us to be able to get around and see more! Reasonable price, on time, great views, great service!

Great Way to Cruise the Harbour on a Budget. The Ferry takes about 45 minutes in each direction and is a great way to see Sydney Harbour without the cost of an expensive cruise.Manly is a great lunch spot and can walk from the ferry terminal through to the ocean at other end of shopping street.So if your looking for a great way to see this beautiful harbour, take a drink and some food and your camera and ride the ferry.

great day in sydney. A lovely day in sydney spent walking through barrangaroo around to circular quay. Plenty of coffee spots at circular quay for a coffee, then caught ferry to Manly for lunch. Walked the esplanade to the beach, had a nice swim, then casually strolled back to wharf to catch ferry back. A very good day without being too expensive, very good for tourists who want to enjoy the beautiful harbour

Short ride to manly. Took the manly ferry which takes about 30 minutes. Onboard you can get a selection of drinks ice cream etc. Fantastic views of the harbour bridge and the opera house. It also has free wifi.

Easy and cheap way to see beautiful Sydney. If you are fortunate enough to be in Sydney in the summer time them you must take a trip on the Manly ferry.The glorious day provided just the right ambience and the summer holidays ensured that the ferry was busy. Locals and tourists commenting on the beauty of the scenery. Children giggling at the procession of seagulls overhead. Great day out. Recommended for all

The one and only. Probably the best ferry ride in the world. Certainly the trip from circular quay to Manly gives the best view of Sydney, its harbour, waterfront homes, beaches, inlets and historic monuments.I prefer the old style ferry to the modern hydrofoil - it's just so quintessentially Australian.It's cheap, interesting and there's oh so much to take in. It may require a few journeys just to put the scale of this inland waterway into perspective.

Easy ferry ride. An easy way to get to Manly Beach! The ferry ride is very scenic with the harbor bridge on your left and the Opera House on your right on the way to Manly. Ferry service is at every 30 mins which is great. If you take the ferry back just before sunset, you will get a good view sunset view of the harbor.
A must do great value on a Sunday. Buy a oyster card and it costs $2.50 round trip including city loop and a return ferry ride. This is like having 2 25 minutes cruises across the harbour....

The feel of Sailing to Manly Beach. The best way to get to Manly Beach. The ferry was clean and offered Beverages and snacks along the way. The sites of Sydney along the way were awesome. The breeze was an added bonus.

Manly is a must. Manly is a must place to visit which is so easy to do on the ferry from Circular Quay. Easy to use and a very regular service going late into the evening so you can make the most of watching the sun go down in one of the bars which are close to where the ferry docks. I have used the ferry and also driven from Sydney. The ferry is far easier.
Manly beach is the one to visit. If you only have a day or 2 in Sydney, take the ferry to Manly Beach. The boat ride is wonderful, only about 45 min. & the beach is gorgeous
Fun ride to Manly. This is the best mode of transport to get to Manly quickly. The views are breathtaking. The breeze is really enjoyable. Use this next time you have to get from Sydney to Manly

Good ferry ride. Went on the public ferry to Manly Beach. Large comfortable ferry that took about 30 mins to get from Circular Quay to Manly. Nice scenic trip that took us to a family friendly beach with some shade as it was 34 degrees. Bonus is only pay for 1 child.

Quick and Easy Ride to Manly. It only takes about 30 minutes to get over to Manly. It is a quick boat ride over, so it is hard to really mess this one up. You can purchase food and drink on board if you can't wait.
Great fun easy to book and use. Brilliant way of getting to your destination and quite reasonable. Also found to be very reliable and prompt. Would recommend this service.

Best Sydney Ferry Ride. I travelled the Manly Ferry several times over the Christmas and New Year holiday period. Although very busy at times I never had to wait more than 20 minutes for a ferry. The cheapest way if you are making multiple trips is to get an Opel Card which can be topped up, and has a maximum daily fare limit. There is usually a rush to get the best seats for viewing the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Also note that when the ferry reaches near to Manly it passes the open sea entrance to Sydney Harbour, and the boat does roll with the sea swell.
Ferry to Manly beach. A very good ferry service to Manly beach, clean and runs on time. A good way to enjoy the waterways of Sydney.
Regular user. Being based in Manly, I became a regular user of the ferry, using my opal card to pay....very efficient and reliable service to get you to Sydney and back.

Lovely day to Manly. Went to Manly on the ferry yesterday, it was hot and very busy. We qued for about half an hour to get on the ferry, but when we got on it was definitely worth it. The views back to the city were very good especially for photos of the bridge and opera house. Would recommend

First try using this ferry. Well, we wanted to leave Sydney for a day and choose the Manly ferry ride to the beach. Didn't know schools were on a holiday so we were really surprised by the volume of kids. It was packed. Affordable round-trip....look into purchasing a OPAL card if your in town longer. Clean ferry, well organized and a beautiful boat ride. Do it!

The only way to travel! Best views ever!. The Manly ferry is simply the best way to travel into the city.There is nothing better than coming around the corner and seeing the bridge & opera house for the first time. My 6th visit to Sydney but this is always one of my favourite parts of the trip!

On time and quick. Sit back and relax on this lovely ride to manly . Very efficient and inexpensive transportation. CleanFriendly staff to answer any questions you may have. Very pretty views along the way
From City to Zoo Return. A fresh way to take in the harbour, plus a visit to Taronga Zoo. The ferry makes stops on its way and runs punctually to a schedule.

Unique Travel to Manly. The ferry to Manly is a truly unique way to travel. The views all around the Harbour are breath taking. We travelled on a day that was very rough which only added to the excitement. A must during any Sydney visit.

The Fast Ferry to Manly. The ferry is fast, efficient and punctual, taking you all the way to magnificent Manly. This is a great place to visit. There's a fabulous beach, lots of shops bars and restaurants. Why not try a walk along the promenade to take in the fabulous views towards Cabbage Tree Bay. A family beach, with safe bathing and life guards on duty. Surfboards and deckchairs for hire. Everything you need for a great day out.

The most crowded ferry ever experienced. We caught the ferry from Sydney harbour to Manly on long weekend. People are so rude especially tourist who tired to get on and off the ferry. The view along the trip is great and the length of time is perfect for a shirt trip. Price is reasonable.
We took this ferry to manly. Nice way how to get to manly's beach. Ferry was pretty busy but you should accept it while traveling in a very lovely hot day.

To many people on the ferry. I loved the ferries in Sydney and used them a lot but the ferry to Manly was the worst but a good way to go to Manly. On the trip to Manly there were to many people on the ferry.

A must do for new visitors.. The Manly Ferry is my first choice for any overseas visitors to show off the harbour and relax after a long flight. I have taken this trip neumerous time and enjoy it myself but visitors are always amazed at the beauty of the harbour and the sights from the ferry.
Its public transport not a tour. Be advised the Manly Ferry is a means of public transport. It has peak hours. The view is obviously much better than the bus alternative from CBD to Manly.

$2.50 on Sundays. The Manly ferry provides really great panoramic views of circular quay, and Manly at the other end is one of the nicest beaches we've visited in Sydney.I don't know how much it normally costs, but it's only $2.50 each way on Sundays with an opal card.
Use this ferry for Manly!. We used this ferry to Manly, and it worked out great. Easiest, most economical, and prettiest way to head to Manly!
Love the Ferry!. Travelling on ferry has been a really good experience. All we need is a camera and just keep clicking.. Beautiful views - blue skies and blue sea
Summer day. The Manly ferry is a lovely trip across the harbour for about half an hour.The trip is lovely, but Manly has become extremely crowded and dirty.I would not recommend to go.

Good way of exploring the beauty of city. Sydney is photogenic. The Manly ferry helps to discover this attribute. 30 min of great views and when windy the you can have fun as well. Being on open deck in front you can be splashed by plenty of water.
great ride. this takes about 1 hour to go from Manely which is the north shore to sydney. it's a relaxing ride and you can get snacks onboard.

A fun day out. The best way to spend the day. Catch the ferry and spend the day at the beach. Ferries leave regularly and there is plenty of seating. Make sure you buy an opal card, travelling by ferry without one is going to seriously cost you.

Cheap way to see the city. Take the ferry to Manly and get a great view of the Sydney skyline and the Opera House and the bridge. Manly is a nice place to walk around and have a coffee or maybe lunch. A cheap outing for those wanting to avoid the more expensive tourist type coffee cruises.

Cheap, Direct Route and Free Sight Seeing.... The ferry runs frequently although can get busy, direct route to Manly and you also get the chance to do a bit of sight seeing. Uses OPAL card system so no need to get a ticket, simply top up and tap your card on the barrier. Ferry clean and plenty of room. Ideal for getting to Manly.

timeless. I was born & bred in Manly, so I have travelled on the ferry countless times. I haven't been for a trip on the ferry for approx. 20 years! Well, I'm a grandfather now and it was evolution that I take my two and a half year old grandson on the Manly Ferry. To see the joy and new experience that he was taking in was memorable. The ferry whilst not the old classic "South Steyne" was still delivering the timeless feeling travelling from Manly to Sydney. If you are visiting Sydney, and in my bias opinion, I would rather take a ferry ride to Manly Beach rather than a bus ride to Bondi Beach!

Great tour of Sydney Harbor on the way to a great beach!. The Manly Ferry is a great way to see Sydney Harbor, and Manly Beach is terrific. The Ferry provides close up, picture perfect views of the Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Harbor Bridge, and it's a nice ride through the harbor on a pretty day. There's a reason this is rated in the Top-10 of things to do in Sydney. It's more than worth the price of the ferry, and Manly Beach is a great place to hang out. As a tip for travelers coming to Sydney from overseas, I would highly recommend ordering Opal Cards on-line a month or so before your trip. We received the cards and activated them on-line before we left the U.S. for Australia, and they worked perfectly well on the train from the Sydney airport to downtown Sydney's Circular Quay moments after walking off the plane. The Opal Cards work for most of the trains, ferries, and busses in Sydney, and they couldn't be any easier to use in order to get around.
Take the fast ferry. Speedy and great way to see the harbor on your way to Manly. Just a short walk through town to the beach.

Holiday 2015-16. We took various trips across to manly and the boats great and all staff helpful and friendly .
Even the toilets on boat surprised me as so clean

Cheap way to enjoy Sydney from the water!. Have been recommending the Manly Ferry to visitors for years - and as a regular commuter myself, still do. Don't bother with "harbour cruises" - jump on the ferry at sunset and enjoy both the savings and the ride!!
Inexpensive. For an inexpensive cruise on Sydney Harbour take the Manly Ferry,it is very enjoyable, especially when the weather is good.
Beautiful day to manly. We caught the manly ferry to Manly on a beautiful spring day. .wonderful views of sydney as we sat outside. .

An inexpensive return trip to become part of a sea going relaxing experience. This ferry ride takes about 30 minutes each way. You are at water level in busy attractive harbour life, sailing craft , sea gulls circle, ever changing scenes. A trip to seaside Manly, the surf, perhaps a swim and return across the best harbour in the world. I have been doing it for 72 years, and never tire. Go for it!
Always a fun trip. We caught the Manly ferry and it was as always a fun ride. So much to see in ther 30 minute ride there and back.

Best way to the beautiful view of Sydney harbour the bridge and opera house. Have been on the manly ferry many times during my 44 years in Australia . The view is excellent from the front as well as the back ,inside is lovely too when it is cold in winter. The Sydney heads is a lovely sight to see . Ie when the sea meets the harbour where there is an opening where the big ships can come in especially the cruise liners. Have seen the war ships come to the harbour . The harbour and opera house are on opposite sides but after a few meters away they seems to be close to each other. A must for tourists most wonderful place to be on a hot summers day cool breeze .
Great experience for the price. I took the ferry to Manly Beach. It was a great for sightseeing. Its possible to see the Opera from all sides.
Inexpensive trip to Manley. Inexpensive local ferry. Route passed the Opera house as well as Sydney harbour bridge. Great way to see the sights.
Best Way. It's the quickest way across to Manly, that's for sure. Probably the most scenic option too. The service is frequent and fast and takes you right to where it's all happening in Manly.

Good value just for the scenery. My husband and I visited Sydney in june and it was actually not too cold. We went on the ferry ride out to Manly mainly to see the sights along the way. it was very nice and when we returned back to darling harbour the view of the bridge was awesome.
Great way to see Sydney. Why buy a harbour tour ,when the ferry to Manley only cost $18.00 return and a running commentary from our hosts

Great way to travel.. Left on wharf 3 to Manly Beach, found it great having ferries every 30 minutes or so until midnight (not including public holidays) It made it very easy to travel with young children. We were travelling during a storm and the waves were very nippy (the whole ferry was rocking) as expected. We found it better to stay in the upstairs middle of the ferry if your traveling with people who suffer with sea sickness. You get a great view coming back into the harbour if you stand at the front of the ferry. (but be aware, if it is a exceptionally nippy day (storms, rain, high wind) standing at the front of the boat whilst going through the heads might result in getting soaked as a huge wave crashed. (As we discovered)

Great trip. Definitely get there early for the ferry and try to get seats outside as you get the spectacular views of the harbour at both sydney and manly. Staff are great... very fast and efficient service.

Cruise Sydney Harbour on the Manly Ferry. If you can't afford an ocean cruise, then take the Manly Ferry across Sydney Harbour and back and spend a bit of time at Manly. The ferry takes about half an hour and is well worth a trip, especially when a big swell comes through the Sydney Heads. If you only have a short time in Sydney, a trip on the Manly Ferry is a must as it gives you spectacular views of the Sydney skyline, the Harbour Bridge and a taste of what the yachts go through when they start the Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race. When you arrive at Manly, follow everyone up the shopping precinct to the ocean beach. While there walk around to the right to the island beach and look at the water dragons which live in the rocks there. A wonderful outing for anyone wanting to experience Australia's beach and seaside cultures.

Great way to see the harbour. Relaxing way to see all the sights of the harbour. Many photo ops along the way .Get a return ticket. Spend the day at the beach or hire a bike to get around. .For the not so energetic have a meal at the warf and return on next ferry.

Public "tour" ferry ride. Best way to see the harbour views. For a $12AUD return ticket, you can see all the harbour sites from the water. If you want to get oriented on all the attractions in the harbour area to plan what to visit, use this as a great primer.

Great views of Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The journey to Manly from Sydney takes about 30 minutes. If you can, I'd recommend getting there 15 minutes before your ferry leaves to try and get a good seat outside so you can make the most of the spectacular harbour views.
Great beach. Good service to Manly beach,preferred Manly to Bondi beach just as nice with a sandy beach and people surfing
