Nice ride. The Manly Ferry provides comfortable, quick ride to Many. The ferry was clean and facilities were good. The view along the way was lovely.

Sightseeing transport. We stayed with a friend in Manly for our Sydney trip so we had quite some ferry trips. As you leave Circular Quay everyone is making their way to the front deck to take the best pictures. Tip: sit on the lower deck on the outside deck on the side of the boat. You wont have to fight over the best spot as you will have no one in front of you. You will have the opera house on the right as you leave Circular Quay and the bridge on the right as you make your way back. Single way fare is 7.18$ off peak.

Best commute ever. We rode the ferry every day for 5 days and loved it every time. Runs on time, friendly staff and Sydney residents will chat to visitors all the time so friendly. Get an opal card for ease of travel and discounts on trains buses and ferries. Seeing opera house from water is the only way to go

Does the job. You can't really complain I mean its a very nice neat ferry with all the basic comforts you need has a small cafe for a coffee and nice chairs to relax only down side is its quite expensive on the opal card and they could be more frequent but hey it's a ferry not a bus.

This is an essential activity more than once per visit to Sydney. Night or Day. Seriously, as an australian citizen I implore every visitor to Sydney to ride the Manly Ferry more than once per visit to the city. Spectacular views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera House, harbour and surrounding attractions day or night. As the sun sets the city just glows! Cafeteria open on board by day. Allow 40mins each way plus at peak times you may have to disembark at Manly but its a chance to view Manly beach and stunning sydney cuisine.my kids came with me this trip and they really ennoyed taking photos and riding the ferry.

Just a lovely 30 minute trip up the most beautiful harbour in the world. This is primarily a mode of transportation, but the 30 minutes between Circular Quay and Manly is still spent on the most magnificent patch of water in the world... Highly recommended as a cheap way to see Sydney Harbour from the bridge to the heads.

Recommended quick trip. Can't rave on about this ferry trip enough. It's cheap and regular and the views are just awesome. If you want to see the views and get some amazing photos of Sydney and it's landmarks then you have to take this trip. And to top it all off you end up in Manly which is just so perfect to spend the day on the beach.

Manly Ferry. Taken a while to write this review, don't know why as it was a great way to see Sydney.Trip itself is pleasant and Manly is a fantastic location for a day out. The ferry journey back into the city is a perfect way to see Sydney - perfect for camera shots of the bay, the opera house and the bridge, all in one go.I would recommend the Manly ferry trip - if only for the fantastic views on the way back.
Day out in Sydney . What a great form of transport cheap reliable and comfortable. Iconic ferry as well most enjoyable experience
Nice ferry ride. This must be the best way to go to Manly. The historic ferry was lovely and the ride very scenic.Do not recommend the toilets, especially if the water is a bit rough.
well travelled. Beautiful area of Sydney, refreshments readily available with the option to walk back to main town, or use one of the frequent ferries to return to circular quay
Really Fun!. This is a thing to do Sydney. On the way to Manly, you will be able to take the best pictures from the Ópera House and Harbor Bridge, as well as enjoy the wonderful landscape.
Go for custard. A great way to tour the harbor. Get off at Manly for custard. Don't be late for takeoff; they wait for no one!

Amazing. i went to there a several times it was great view and l love it a lot if you love vie of ocean and look at the view with many of boats and people who surfing so you definetly like it a lot highly recommed it
Why pay more?. Pay $15 return and see the sights of the harbour, try to be at the front of the questions though as the viewing decks are prime real estate.

Great way to see the harbor. My wife and I took the Manly Ferry from Manly Beach to Sydney harbor. It's a great way to see the land surrounding the harbor and it docks near the Opera House so there are opportunities for pictures of the bridge and skyline. Its worth the ride.

Traditional Means of getting to Manly from Sydney. Classic Sydney harbour transport - though the original ferries - incidentally sailed out from the UK under their own steam - have long gone - the new - er about 30 - 40 year old ferries have retained much of the old world charm. Excellent views are available of hte harbour and easy access to the beaches of Manly (harbour & surf). Relaxing way to make the crossing in shade and protection if wet.

Exciting on a Stormy Day. We made our first trips on the Manly Ferry in rough weather. The trip was like as any other harbour ferry until we were outside the heads. Then things became exciting. I enjoyed seeing people who were silly enough to be on an outside seat coming inside soaking wet!

A great ride from Central Sydney to Manly.. An excellent ride through Sydney Harbour. Wouldn't recommend it on stormy days as the harbour can be a bit rough. Highlights are view between the heads, and the old quarantine station.

Nice trip to get to Manly. We wanted to see Manly beach so went over on the ferry. Lovely trip over and lovely day on the beach. Only downside, on our return, I got through turnstile and my wife got stopped as enough passengers had gone through. It took a while to get back through and persuade staff I couldn't go without my wife.

Great views of Sydney . I've done this journey multiple times. It's a must do if you are here in the city. Only issue is it can be a fight to get on and if you aren't at the front of the que you can forget about going on the deck.

Great way to see the harbour. The Manly ferry is a fantastic way to take a tour of the Harbour and it only takes about 1/2 hour. Great photo opportunities of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Be careful if you take the ferry from Pier 6 as it is the fast ferry and is more expensive and does not accept Opal cards.

Relaxing trip, Ferry more like a sightseeing ride. It's part of the public transport system but to sit back and watch the harbour slip by, that's what our holiday is about. And Manly a magic place to explore away from the hustle of the Cbd.

Surprisingly nice excursion.. We went there on a spur of the moment.We had originally set our plan on Bondi beach. But we met an Italian tourist who suggested we go to Manly instead. WOW! What a great discovery. Manly is an envious location. The beauty was unexpected.
But the ferry is ordinary! The ride is not to be missed.
Fantastic Views. Great trip on the ferry over to Manly, stopped off at Watsons Bay and fantastic views on the trip of the Bridge, Opera House and various bays
Must do in Sydney. I always take the Manly ferry if time allows. Cheapest harbour cruise around. All of my friends also love it.

Busy. Caught the ferry on a Sunday, which must be the peak day due to the cheap fares, very comfortable and enjoyable trip, but extremely busy. Great way to see the Harbour and the Sydney head, beautiful scenery.
A great way to travel. We used the ferry every day to access the different attractions in Sydney. The maximum cost of $13/day was also an asset and made traveling easy and convenient.

Allow a seat that offers views on both sides. A wonderful trip, with spectacular views, make sure you take in both sides, with Sydney's Navy base on one side and the Prime Ministers house on the other.

Be at way to get around. This is a great way to get to manly if you don't have a car. The bus isn't bad either but you get incredible views of the harbor this way and it's only something like $7. Takes about 30 minutes but it's incredibly efficient and clean.

Transport for Taronga Zoo. Used this service to get from Circular Quay over to Taronga zoo - Although the boats seem a little dated compared to the other passenger boats travelling around the Harbour the boat is clean, large and had so far always been on time

Ferry left Manly without taking any people on it!!!. Then ferry itself is fine and reasonable priced ($15 return approx.,) but what my issue is with the ferry service is that on return from Manly, we waited for the ferry, it arrived, dropped passengers off and then took off without anyone of the 100+ customers waiting!!!! We then had to wait for another 30 mins until the next one arrived - all without explanation on why it heading back to Sydney empty!

Ferry trip. A great way to see all they major landmarks of Sydney and the beautiful harbour! Taking the ferry from Circular Quay wharf to Manly was a pleasant trip and a first for my 5 yr old who was so excited to experience her first ferry trip! Its about 30-40mins from Circular quay to Manly but it seemed really quick as we were busy taking in the sunset ( best time to go ) . There is a cafe on board and toilets but this visit we didnt use either. Very enjoyable trip- take a jumper and a camera as there are heaps of photo opportunities along the way ! The one downside is purchasing tickets. It is so confusing and the machine will only print out 1 ticket at a time. For those with an Opal card they obviously dont have to worry about this probably.
Ahoy ocean!. Weirdly this is the quickest way to get from Manly to CBD. Hold on to your seasick prone friends. The open ocean is beautiful but bumpy.
Nothing special. I found the ride on the ferry to be pretty unspectacular. Maybe it´s because I already had plenty of views on the harbor and everything.

A must for visitors. Always a highlight for a Sydney visit. It's a beautiful trip through the harbour to Manly. Walk down the main street, check out the beach, grab a bite then head back for another beautiful ferry trip. Best to be outside on the ferry.

Great way to visit the beach..... A return ticket for two adults cost $30.40. Ferrys depart regularly and they have plenty of indoor seating if you want to get out of the sun. They can get busy and the outdoor areas don't have a lot of seating so you need to get there earlier than the departure time if you want to get a prime spot at the front of the ferry for shots of the bridge and opera house on the return journey.
Iconic. One of the famous "things to do" in Sydney. A beautiful 20-25 minutes ride from Circular Quay wharf to Many Beach (can use your Opal card for ferries too).

Great way to get to Manly and see the sights. Was a sunny morning and we saw a pod of dolphins as we went to Manly. We were on the front going but didn't realise to see the Opera House and bridge on the way back we needed to go to the other end of the ferry as it doesn't need to turn around! Refreshments and toilets on board if you need them and pleasant 30 minutes ride. Leaves from wharf 2 at regular intervals.
Great way to Manly. Great ferry service to Manly. Plenty of great views and sighting of dolphins on most journeys. Very comfortable trip.

Easy way to manly beach. Regular ferries to manly beach from circular quay and easy to purchase tickets at machines Just follow the instructions at ticket machine ,and buy the all day ticket well worth it . Ferry takes about 30minutes and it is a five minute walk across main road to the beach

LaRGER FERRY. sailed to Manly on this ferry, it is no different than any other ferry. Interesting sail, same staff as other ferries,
got there and back safely but think all the 'sailors' are very competent.

Manly ferry. Took the ferry to Manly. Great views of the harbour. I sat outside on the way took about half an hour. There was drinks and food on board. The ferry goes every half an hour from circular key. Very good value costs about 15 dollars. You can use opal card to pay.
Lovely way to see Sydney harbour

The Best Of Sydney. We took the ferry again yesterday. Manly is such an excellent part of Sydney with its fabulous beach and at the end of the journey you arrive at Circular Quay, the heart of the city. The 45 minute journey up Sydney Harbour provides so many photographic opportunities, think The Opera House and Harbour Bridge, that you won't want to arrive at your destination. No wonder we love living here!

The old ferries are a great way to enjoy the Sydney harbour views. The manly ferry is well worth the visit and its a pleasant half hour trip across the harbour. The old style ferries are far better than the newer quicker ferries, and thy offer a great trip across the bay providing great views of Harbour bridge, the opera house, and a number of other locations. They server cold drinks and snacks on board and the trip s well worth it.

Best Way to See Sydney Harbour!. The Manly Ferry is relatively cheap for a 40 minute ride down Sydney Harbour from the city and site of the First Settlment across to Manly - named by the first governor because he thought the local people were a "manly" looking group! It is a great trip and takes you past the Opera House and Bridge for photos, Garden Island and the naval ships, around Bradley's Head with its Masthead of HMAS Sydney, next to Taronga Zoo, and then past Middle Head and the entrance to Middle Harbour, past the opening to Sydney Harbour and thence to Manly. Once there you can walk up the Corso to the ocean beach. The ferry is used by commuters in the week and by many visitors when it is packed on weekends. There are toilets on board and a small cafe with coffee, drinks, cakes etc. You can wander around the ferry and if the sea is rough go to the front outside and have a shower! Many people stay inside and look through the salt encrusted windows but outside gives you the fresh sea air and much better photographs. Enjoy!
Great way to travel. The ferry was on time and was a sedate way to travel and see some of the sights as well as enjoy the beach and shopping in Manly.

Great trip. We have spent one day at Manly. Ferry was great, spotless, on time and clean. We enjoyed views and vacation type atmosphere at the ferry. Highly recommend for all, couples and families. Take a towel and sun cream even if you didn't plan to go for a beach since You might change your mind once you see it ;)

A go-to part of the Sydney experience . Sydney is an Amazing place to visit.You're spoilt for choice with a myriad of options.But Sydney Harbour is a visitor magnet and whilst you can see it from many different angles the Manly Ferry, in our humble opinion, gives you the fullest perspective.It accepts the Opal Card but beware, in a good way, that you don't need to touch out!A potential costly mistake if you do.It's a short journey but worth every cent.The on/board catering leaves a lot to be desired (the Coffee is awful) but as an experience its amazing plus Manly, when you get there, isn't too shabby!!!
fun trip to a super beach and fun resort. best way to reach manly from town . great views of the opera house and harbor bridge especially at night

The trip is as good as the destination. This large and old ferry leaves circular quay every half an hour and arriver in Manly in 40 min. During that time you have superb views of the Rocks, the Opera House, all the coves of north Sydney, the Spit, the Heads (entrance of the harbor, and Manly. This is probably the cheapest way to see the majority of the harbor. The ferries are old but well maintained and with a great character. There are seatings inside and outside and the passengers constitute a mix of locals and tourists. It can be crowded on peak hours and on weekends.

Got to do it, part of the package. A trip to Sydney without a ride on the ferry to Manly is like a trip to Hong Kong without a ride on the Star Ferry. It gives you a great view of the harbor and the sailboats. Also, a nice short walk to the beach that is not as famous as Bondi but surely a fun place to be on a weekend. Street market has lots of things to look at and shops lining the streets from the ferry to the beach are fun to browse. Lots of fast food if that's your need or desire.Can be very crowded on a Sunday when the fare is reduced so get there early or expect a wait of up to an hour to get on at Circular Cay. Suggest you get check the schedule so you don't get out of sync. Great family day out.

Must do ferry half hour ride. One way. The town of manly us surrounded by a lovely beach. On a sunny mellow day the water is great for a family swim and picnic. There is a great walk over to shelly beach,and you can walk the headlands. The ferry is large, if you like to ride outside the space is limited so line up early. If you want to see the lights of Sydney on the return trip I suggest not to take the sunset cruise I would wait to after dark. The draw back is if it is late the drunks are loud rude and obnoxious. No staff around to stopit

Scenic trip to Manly. The express ferry leaves every 30 mins or so and is a smooth scenic ride capturing Sydney Opera house and Harbour Bridge views that are a must for every tourist and a great way to see

Has to be done !. This is one of those tourist things that has to be done. We travelled in early December and the ferry was busy but not packed.We then strolled to the beach ,sat for an hour ,had an excellent lunch and caught the ferry back to circular quay.

Timely fast service. No need to pay for the Fast Ferry. Love the ferries in Sydney. This is a favorite because of the size of the ferry (it take a storm with barely a flinch) and it's fast reliable and scenic.

A beautiful, cheap way to explore Sydney Harbour. Highly recommend this cheap, unique and beautiful way to explore Sydney Harbour and the surrounds. The ferry will take you directly past the Opera House and Harbour Bridge (great for photos!), and take you to the wonderful Manly Beach where you can shop and have lunch.
Nice view of the harbour. We took the ferry to manley, a frequent service and smmoth ride, you get a great view of the opera house and bridge as you sail to and from the port

not to miss. Do not miss the ferry ride to Manly Beach from Circular Quay. It is scenic through the Harbour and Manly Beach is beautiful. The water is calm, unlike Bondi, so bring a swimming suit. Along the beach there is a beautiful walking path to Shelley Beach, not to miss as well. There are lots of places to eat and shop. I had Barramundi grilled fish and chips, delicious.

A great day trip. A trip to Manly is a great day trip if you are staying in Sydney. The ferry is convenient and cheap although there are faster and likely more expensive alternatives if you want to get there in speed!

Plan the sunset ferry trip according to the sun!. You'll hear a lot that you have to do the Manly ferry during sunset but make sure that you're in that time of the year that the sun sets under the Harbour Bridge and not just behind the CBD.

Cheap access to an incredible harbour. A return ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly is a must do for all visitors. This is public transport at it's most beautiful and gives you a fantastic point of view of a remarkable city.
Beautiful Harbour. Travelled to Manly to meet friends for lunch. Very pleasant trip with fabulous views of all the harbour

A fun trip to Manly on the Ferry. We couldn't resist a ride to Manly last Friday on the Narrabeen. It was such an enjoyable ride looking at all the different boats on the water and all the various landmarks.

Take this Ferry. We loved the ferry ride, we bought our tickets in the morning *choice of get on or off/or stay on. We took the boat up to Manly and all the stops along the way. The scenary was beautiful, lots to see and go with someone who knows the history and you will have a great visit.

A Cheap Way To See Sydney Harbour. Most of the ferries are an excellent and cheap way to see all the sights of Sydney Harbour. The Manly Ferry is one of the best since it goes right up and past the entrance to the sea. At Manly come out the Ferry Terminal and carry straight on to cross to the other side of the peninsula. This brings you to Manly Beach on the Sea. Stop here for an excellent place to soak up the sun on the lovely sandy beach. Alternatively, turn right and follow the coast right round the tip and back eventually! to the Ferry Terminal. This is quite a long trek (I'm guessing over 3 miles) but well worth it for the views - collect a local map to make sure you don't get lost. Back in the middle of Manly there are lots of good shops and restaurants and try the local ice creams! Eventually take the Ferry back to Circular Quay for fantastic views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge.
A Must do. This is a must on any visit to Sydney on a dry day I really enjoyed the half hour trip from Circular Quay to Manly and had a relaxed llunch at Manly before returning to the City
The best . The manly ferry is an old style ferry. Chugs along at a good speed to get you to the harbour that is called sydney. A worthwhile ferry trip at a great price.

Fabulous way to see the Harbour. Great views, easy and affordable. We walked to Manly beach and had a swim and then walked round the headland to the gorgeous Shelley Beach. What a find with a great restaurant alongside. Try the waterMelon cooler - yum!
Bit slow, but nice views. Took the Manly Ferry to Manly beach. It's not too pricey but slow. Lots of departure/return times which is a plus.
Loved it. Loved the trip to Manley which is a lovely place to visit for the day. Views along the way are beaut

Top 10 Sydney. Manly ferry is one of the absolute must do's in Sydney, you see all the best parts of the harbour including the opening to the ocean (the heads) and once in Manly if you're an activity buff the kayaking from the wharf or surfing from the beach are great fun.
Recommended for all visitors and residents alike.

Manly to Sydney Harbour, is a must.. We loved Manly to shop, gorgeous beach, but also you can catch a ferry to Sydney Harbour for the day. Views out of this world, seeing the Opera house, bridge and plenty more while you sail. its got to be a must, we loved this day out
Visit to Manly. Manly is a must do visit whilst in Sydney, great beach, good shops, bars and a nice atmosphere. This is all rounded of by the ferry ride giving great views of Sydney Harbour.

Not just Manly, Classy Ferry !. The ferry is almost like a luxury liner with excellent interiors, very comfortable and airconditioned, spacious seating minus the rocking and swaying that brings sea-sickness to some. As others have said, yes the outside seating does offer you spectacular views of the harbour but if it's cold and raining, as it was when we travelled, you'll beat a hasty retreat to the warmer comforts inside. The staff is very professional and courteous, the boarding and alighting at the wharfs is so comfortable and orderly, and ferries arrive and depart on schedule. Considering all the above the ferry tickets are priced pretty reasonably. An excellent service.Manly itself is a fun place to be and it would seem that the place wakes up only at dusk and stays awake until the wee hours of the morning. Teeming with nightlife. There's also a long beach at the other end of the road, that's good for a long walk, with plenty of seats under shades where you could relax and have a bite and a drink. Seems clear to me now why there's this legend painted on a wall as you come out on to the road from the wharf : "Manly: Seven miles from Sydney, a thousand miles from care." Spot on.

Go on it to see the Harbour.. I love the Manly ferry. I used to go on it when I was really young to the Manly Fun Pier. Like a second rate Luna Park, but I thought it was better. They had a cool spinning house. Not anymore. But still, they have the aquarium. The Manly beach is really close too. If you wanted to have a really good Sydney experience, you could catch the Manly Ferry to Manly pier, then walk through the Mall to the beach. It is a proper beach too. With waves. Not like in Melbourne.

Good views from the ferry and Manly is a nice location to spent some time. Travelled from Circular Quay across to Manly on a overcast day. Ferry takes about 30 minutes and there is plenty of seating the best being outside then you see Sydney from every angle. Passing the Opera house and under the Harbour bridge great for taking pictures. Ferries are clean and on time. Get an Opal card for use on local transport system. Once in Manly, there is a good choice of places to eat and drinks along the beach front. Take a walk along the beach front for some great views and some very nice homes. Go on a Sunday when there is a market selling interesting gift items. The best thing about travelling on Sunday is that it will only cost $2.50 all day.

My Favourite pastime. It is a great thing to do is get a pass to and you can enjoy the trip looking at the beautiful countryside and people watch .There are many resturants of all types of food for you to enjoy.The beaches are great to swim and are clean .

Easy to get tickets, Easy ride. Theres certainly not much of a hassle in getting the ferry ride tickets from Manly ferry. I got the hop on hop off tickets that comes together with Taronga Zoo admission @ $55. The ferry brought us around to Manly wharf, Watsons Bay, Fort Dennison etc. Quite an eye opening trip to see various water sports activities which Sydney has to offer. Great for old couples who like to a short sightseeing and theres just a great sense of safety to be on board with the people working on it. Heres my pic with the lady who multitask so many roles to make sure that tourists like myself can have a good safe trip. Kudos to her.

Great service. Little bit expensive. Definitely one of the best way for enjoy the view of Sydney by the sea. Fast enough and really frequent as every 30 min. Just a bit expensive . One way is more less 7 au dollars but if you get an opal card( prepaid for free) and maybe take 8 rides ( need stay minimum one week so) you can take the ferry to go everywhere for free from Friday to Sunday including. Someone could think you already pay for it ( which is true cause one ride by bus, from western or eastern subburbs to the city center is 3,50 au dollars !) but come on ... Is Sydney :-)))
Easy. Buying a ticket is straight forward, departures are every 30 minutes and you get stunning views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera house each way.

Putting the 'Ma'n in Man-ly (Not really). Cute little wharf, lots of food and drinks and there's even a nice little beach that when the ferry comes in creates a nice little wave that you can't surf. Lots jelly fish in that beach though. They sting.

Wonderful views of the Harbour. Any Ferry Ride on the Harbour is worthwhile. A return trip is suggested without stopping over but if you have time, Manly Waterfront and the Mall area is diverse and interesting.
Fast and efficient. Went to Manly on a sunny warm day, calm sea, beautiful views and discount is offered to senior citizens
Easy. A great way to get to Manly. If the weather is good, siting outside offers great views of the coast. Travel time is about 30 minutes.

Great way to spend your day. Very enjoyable way to get out on the water and enjoy the incredible sights of Sydney. The ferry is prompt, clean and affordable. The trip over to Manly is only part of the days experience. Manly is a very fun place to go and visit.

Quait town. took the Manly Ferry - enjoyable afternoon strolling the streets, shopping and walking along the beach. Lots of places for lunch. Used or Opal card for the ferry. Great views on the return when the Opera House and the Bridge appear.

Fantastic trip for seeing Sydney. Travelling from Circular Quay across to Manly is the most wonderful experience. You see Sydney town from every angle. Passing the Opera house to views of the bridge are views equal to the best in the world. Once in Manly, the choices of meals and bars cannot be beaten. Manly itself is a great place for swimming or just doing your own exploring.

Add to your Sydney to-do list!. Came to Sydney for a 3 week visit for business and had to do something. I was advised to go Manly Beach on Sunday via ferry as travel is capped at $2.50 for the day. For a person who normally drives to Germany and takes the ferry I can say this is definitely worth it. Taking the slow service you do have a lot to admire on the way to Manly, including the bunch of other yachts. It is usually busy, so gunning for the front seats will be hard.
Panoramic view of Sydney harbour. The ferries are punctual, clean with more than adequate seating providing a very pleasant ride to Manly island

Good opportunity to see more of the harbour. This was a very enjoyable and inexpensive trip with lovely views of the harbour. Manly seemed a pleasant town, with a pedestrianised shopping street leading to the beach which is about a fifteen minute walk from the ferry. Manly beach is beautiful, and was well patrolled by lifeguards, on the beach and in the water. I am a confident swimmer, but found the waves too powerful to want to swim, but I enjoyed paddling up to about waist height and being pounded by the waves, which could sweep you off your feet if you were not careful. Great fun though! The ferries were regular and on time, and clean. Very enjoyable!

The best. Harbour cruise hands down... Always sit outside at the back....The ferry takes 30 minutes each way and is the best way to see Sydney with limited time... Sydney Harbour in all its glory.Don't bother with the JetCat... It is faster but it is not better.There is a snack bar for drinks and chips type of stuff.The swell in the sound can be big. Very occasionally it has been seen that surfers could ride a swell past the opera house. And that is quite something indeed.
Runs Every 30 minutes in Peak. Great sevice. Very clean. Takes up to 35 minutes. Great views. Best way to travel between Manly and Circular Quay.
hustle bussle. very useful ferry , cheap, well organized and on schedule, great way of transportation as well as sightseeing

leisurely look at the opera house, governor house and the harbour bridge!. Relaxing opportunity to view the harbour bridge, opera house and the governor's house which is probably only really visible from the water! Really nice trip over to Manley which is really quaint with a fabulous beach and walkways.

Do not miss it. No trip to Sydney would be complete without a trip to Manly on the ferry. In good weather be sure to sit outside up the front if there is room, if not, sit on one side on the way over and the other side coming back. The view is fantastic.

A great asset for Sydney. This ferry takes you on a slow, but very pictuesque journey to Manly. Plenty of Reasonably comfortable inside and there are wooden seats available outside as well but you have to be early to get them. I actually like going on this 40 minute ride getting a coffee and cake on one of the Harbourside cafes and then travelling back to manly and my home.

Courteous, Fun and Efficient Transportation. It was great. Staff was best of all the ferries in providing assistance (I was on crutches). Smooth ride, 12 minutes per schedule. Boats were clean, staff friendly.
great views on the way. Great way to see harbour on your way, easy simple access, well organized, regular servic, even coffee on board.

A must for all visitors to sydney. The perfect and most inexpensive way to see why Sydney people love Sydney! See the houses from the water and enjoy seeing the boats sailing past you. If you take the ferry from manly to the city just before sunset great picture opportunities exist with the magnificent sunset behind the harbour bridge. If you just want to get to manly take the fast ferry which operates on a different pier at the quay. Check when returning as you line up in a different place as well.
See Sydney the right way. Very regular service and reasonably priced. Views from the boat are excellent. Cannot recommend enough and the crew were brilliant

Fantastic day trip. Ferries are amazing you get an amazing view whilst sailing to Manly. Manly beach is fabulous, lots of great coffee bars beachside and a walk looking at all the fabulous apartments. Full of little shops and fantastic restaurants, especially fish restaurants.

Go on a Sunday: cap limit on Opal card includes ferry!. Manly is great!!We went twice: 1. to stroll until Shelly Beach (an easy afternoon)2. a full-day to hike the Manly Trail from Manly Ferry to the Spit Bridge (this is more physically demanding).Best of all, on Sundays, the Opal Card is capped at 2.50 AUD (if I remember correctly) for the entire day, making it a total bargain to travel on the ferry.
Magic way to travel into the city. We are regular travelers on the ferry and there is always different to see. One of the best commutes anywhere in the world.
Consider taking from Manly. Drove to Manly and took return ferry trip to enjoy the scenery. Free 2hr roadside parking in vincinity of ferry. Circular quay parking is notoriously expensive.

See Sydney and our AMAZING Harbour for under $10 ... It's awesome. Whilst Sydney's Ferries look old, they offer you the cheapest way to see the wonderful harbour Sydney has to offer. For under $10, you can travel to Manly - arguably the most beautiful beach and town that has an amazing beach, restaurants and cafes. I took my family which includes 3 kids under 7 on the ferry on a sunday morning. You need to be near the front of the line to secure a seat outside the ferry - which is the best spot to be. With spectacular views of the Sydney Harbour, Harbour Bridge, Milsons Point, Kirrabilly House (PM's residence) and then you are treated to a 30 min ride to Manly. Up until the NY, if you decide to go out with your family on a Sunday, you can take advantage of the $5 all day pass per person. This allows you to travel around Sydney by Bus, Train or Ferry ALL DAY ... You simply can't go wrong ! But you need to have kids to qualify for this ticket.Upon arrival in Manly, you are then in a HUB of shops, cafes, bars & restaurants - only to be outdone by Manly Beach which is truly amazing. Smokers - you will need to refrain from lighting up in Manly - it's pretty much a smoke free town ... unless you sneek one in the side streets ! With such a variety of places to eat, there's something for everyone's taste and budget. Breakfast / Brunch venues are bursting with customers - it can be a challenge to get somewhere for the kids to sit down or play .. My favourite place is Ribs and Rumps - which is on the main street overlooking the Beach. Not cheap, but it serves up Ribs and Steak to perfection.You'll have a great time, and then you get to relax and take in the sea air on your journey back to the city ! It's a must for any Tourist to Sydney.

Could do better. We have one of the most beautiful harbours in the world. I feel privileged every time I take a ferry or sail on it. I travelled on the Manly ferry recently. The cleanliness can be improved; also noticed some of the seats were not in the best condition. These are little things, but considering the number of tourists that use these ferries it may be worth taking note of.

Manly Ferry, an absolute MUST!. The cheapest and best way to experience the outstanding Opera House, Harbour Bridge and amazing Sydney Harbour is aboard one of the regular Manly Ferries.Do the round trip from the Circular Quay wharves, out across the outstanding harbour to Manly, where you can embark, enjoy the beach, The Corso pedestrian shopping street full of restaurants, bars and takeaways, then return to Circular Quay, passing sailing boats and the best views Sydney offers, for a cheap fare.Using the Government OPAL Card, you can link the ferry to other public transport (rail, bus) and further reduce your costs with a daily maximum. Weekends are even cheaper using OPAL.
Pleasant . The ferry ride is very smooth . There are plenty of seats inside & outside . Good for families too and any age riders . The ride is short . There is restrooms available .

I hate the beach but love inconvenience. I hate the beach even though I love on it LOL. But a trip to manly on the ferry then a walk across the mall and to see the same beach I see every day only further north in the next state is a great reminder of ok lets turn around and head back. Look they have popped up a Ben & Jerry's so points for that but for me nothing beats a trip with a stormy day and a high swell its a thrill.
Enjoyable trip to Manly. Comfortable crossing over to Manly. Enough choice for sitting either outside or inside Ferry. Quite a busy service at weekends.
Ferry extraordinary. Get the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly for only 4 dollars. It only takes half an hour to get there.

Fantastic views. once again if you take the Manly ferry from wharf 3 at circular Quay you will get another view of the Harbour bridge and the Opera House from a different angle . When you get to Manly be sure to take a stroll anong the beach before you return to Circular Quay

Great way to explore Sydney Harbor. No need to purchase the expensive tour boats or the fast ferry to Manley!!! The Manley Ferry was an economic choice for a smooth, quick ride to Manley, which dumps you out at the port. A short walk from the Manley port brings you to Manley Beach. The ride allows for great views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Sydney Opera House.
nice way to chill. Whether half day or full day offers fantastic views of the harbour. Regular and cheap device for the more relaxed scene of Manley
t is a must to do trip to Manly. When in Sydney with some free time, I am always trying to go to manly by ferry, where you can see the Bridge and Opera House from a different angle. again.

Really enjoyable. Used the $2.50 Sunday pass to use trains, buses and the Manly ferry. Great value. Took the ferry to Manly. The travel was stunning - a beautiful harbour. Enjoyed some cold drinks and nibbles at the Bavarian Bier House at Manly beach, walked on the golden sands and dipped our feet in the water. Then headed back on the ferry.

A good trip. We used the Manly ferry as a way to see Sydney harbour and while not cheap its a lot cheaper than a cruise .. It's fast and comfortable with great views .. Plus Manly itself is abreast place to visit after the hassle of Sydney

Free ride. Made it just about in time for the ferries departure. The gate had just closed. Explained that we had not yet bought a ticket. The nice people re-opened the gate and let us through for a free ride.
Always a treat. The best thing about Sydney Harbour is that there is always something going on. As well as the great scenery we got to watch yacht races and a blimp flying overhead

Great way to visit Manly. Good way to visit manly.Very good trip across Sydney Harbour with plenty to see on the way.When you reach Manly it is a great spot to walk around and visit the many shops and has a great beach with many eateries to choose from.

Always in time!. Mainly is beautiful, just 45 minutes to go and 35 to come back to Sydney, it's always in time and there are frequent ferries during the day. Great to see the other side of the Opera House!

Best harbour on the planet. There is no better way to see Sydney Harbour than on one of the old ferries. A cruise across to Manly, a stroll down the Corso, fish' chips on the beach wall is a great way to enjoy any day in Sydney. They run frequently and both terminals are well served by public transport. A must for both tourists and residents alike.

You will not be disappointed - Easy to do. When in Sydney this is a must do. Do not be intimated by the number of people lining up to take the ferry. Once aboard take a seat either inside or up the front and be prepared for the best views as the ferry departs Circular Quay. Have a stroll at Manly buy an ice cream and sit on the beach. Then catch the ferry back to Circular Quay.....A Must do.
Great way to travel. Great way to get to Manly and back from the centre of Sydney whilst also taking in the sights from the water.

Excellent harbour views!. This is the cheapest way to see the harbour! The trip to Manly allows you to see a very big part of the harbour. You can take great pictures of the opera house, the harbour bridge and the rest of Sydney! Sit outside to catch the sun and have the best place to take pictures (only possible on the lower deck, not many places!).Use the opal card: if you've spend 15 dollar on public transport in one day, the rest of the day is free travel, including the ferry! Otherwise, after the ferry, the rest of your public transport will be free that day.

Must do. The ferry is such a good transport tool.We are 3 weeks in Sydney and we use the Opal public transport card.For a few dollars you can make the trip. The trip is around 25 minutes. You have a spectacular view on The Bridge and the Opera House.Manly has many beaches, lots of cafees and restaurants.

Incredible views of Sydney Harbour. Best way to see the Harbour. Save your money and take the ferry to Manly rather than a tourist tour boat. The ferry was lovely and very easy to use. Sat outside in the sun and just took in the dramatic views that Sydney has to offer.

Relaxing Cruise to a Beautiful Beach. we took the Manly Ferry out to Manly beach, and it was a fantastic casual harbour cruise. Why bother paying for a more expensive option when you can have a leisurely cruise across the harbour. Tickets were about $15 round trip. Once you get to Manly There is a fantastic surfing beach with shopping and a street market. Perfect way to spend a Sunday. I would just recommend going earlier in the morning to avoid long lines. Plenty of great photo ops along the way.

Perfect for surveying the extent of the natural harbour. A wonderful, 30-minute ferry ride to Manly was a picturesque end to a busy day of sight-seeing. Sit back and enjoy the gentle bounce of the ship against the waves. Watch as the sun's rays sparkle over the water and out to sea. And, most of all, survey the full extent of one of the world's largest natural harbours.

Handy Transport Option - Great Views. Having gone to the Northern Beaches by bus we were travelling back to Sydney Airport with full luggage and used the ferry. We had a 'free' trip as we were running down the pier and the staff waived us through to make sure we made it. Typical Oz attitude to help and not obstruct. The trip is just a great view of Opera House and Bridge but also so practical -- what a lucky city Sydney is.
great trip in rough sea. we had a great trip in slightly rough sea, enjoyed myself, the view was fantastic, great to see so many people on the water

"Good views on the way". Ferry takes around 25 minutes from circ quay. Free wifi on board. There is a larger ferry a well as the smaller one. Costs around aud$ 7 so better using Opel card if you are using other journeys that day as it has a daily max of 15. Sunday's the card has a max of 2.50 so well worth getting one.
EHK. We took Manly ferry from Sydney Harbor to Manly beach, about 30 minutes ride. Great big boat could accommodate 300+ passengers. Smooth ride. We had a great time

Nice trip to Manly beach. The ferry is quite old but very well maintained and effective, especially with its faculty to go on both way avoiding long maneuvers. Mainly has a lond and nice sand beach with many surfers jumping on large waves.
The best boat trip. You have a nice boat trip and can take lovely pictures from the Opera House and also can visit Manly with a nice beach, many shops and restaurants.

Easy way to see the harbour. Ferry across to Manly! It's a great way to experience the harbour and get superb views of both the Opera House and Bridge. Do lunch at one of the many eateries on the Corso or beachfront, stroll up the Promenade, take it all in. The trip takes a bit over half an hour one way, tickets available at the terminal.

Leisurely, scenic ride to Manly. You can buy a ferry ticket at Circular Quay by the Sydney Opera House. You can buy a pass that is good for public transportation for the day (buses, trains, ferries). With our pass, we took a ferry to the zoo, then returned to Circular Quay and took the ferry to Manly. The ferries come about every half hour and it takes about half an hour to get to Manly. The ferry goes past the Opera House and is scenic all the way to Manly. When the ferry docks in Manly, there is a beach there. That is NOT the famous Manly Beach. To get to the real beach, you have to walk a short distance through the town.
Fantastic way to get around. This is a great way to get around Sudney. Once you have an Opal Card you can travel on and off the ferries and only pay a max of $15 per day. Terrific for tourists.

TAKE A RELAXING RIDE TO MANLY ON THE FERRY. This ferry boat ride takes around 30 minutes, 30 minutes of looking at all the famous icons like the Opera House, The Sydney Harbour Bridge, the beaches and coves, the yachts and of course capturing these images on film. Manly is a great stop to have a walk around, grab some lunch and of course have a swim at the beach.
Excellent. We used the ferry many times, during our time in Sydney, to go to Manley, Taronga zoo, easy to use, reasonably priced.

Best way to see the city from the water!!. Manly ferry is a great way to see the city whilst making the most of using local public transport.
The ferries run really frequently and usually without delay. Such a great way to see the suburbs.

Ferry trip. Noting exceptional, just a ferry ride across the harbor but a bit slower then the other commuters something it gves you a bit more time. Gives a nice view of the Opera house and the Sydney Bridge and some of the shoreline along the harbor. About a $15 AU for a round trip.
cheap way to see opera house. Instead of taking an expensive harbour cruise see the harbour Bridge and Opera house form this ferry. manly is also very pleasant with a good shopping and a nice beach.
Great way to spend a rainy afternoon. We took the ferry to Manly after the reading the rave reviews on this forum. It was great to see the harbor from the water and on the other side of the bay.

Beauty all around. No one should miss this lovely and relaxing trip to Manly about 45 minutes away. There is plenty to see and the ferry is quite comfortable, however can get very crowded. One should not miss a quick trip if in Sydney

A real must while visiting sydney. To take the ferry across to Manly from Circular Quay is a real must - JUST DO IT.It is a relatively inexpensive way of seeing the iconic sights of Sydney and when in Manly there are shops and cafes everywhere the beach front is marvellous, so don't miss out on a real treat.We have done this trip many times with visitors and they all say it was a highlight of their trip.

Always runs like clockwork. The ferry system in Sydney is superb. They all run from circular quay and unless you want to get to your destination quickly opt for the Green and Cream painted Sydney Ferries vessels. They look old but are regularly replaced and have more character and are spotlessly clean.It takes around 30 minutes to get to Manly and is a great way to view the various bays. Manly was a bit 'kiss me quick' and not very sophisticated.

Cheap way to go to Manly with amazing views of Sydney and the bay!. It was only AUD 7,- oneway and it was perfect! Enjoy the views while leaving Sydney Harbour and in Manly do the walk along the beach. It is so pretty! We really enjoyed! And have some of the best fish and chips at the beginning of the pedestrian zone!

Takes little time but most convenient . Though it takes 45-50 mins from from darling harbour to reach manly, but it's the most convenient way to reach the beach. Some of the ferries also have cafe inside and all have provisions to park cycles and strollers.

Use Your OPAL Card on Sunday. Living in Sydney all my life, yet hardly ever go to Manly. Forgot what a great gem we have, and easily to access particularly on a Sunday if you have an OPAL Card so all trains, ferry, and bus rides can only cost a max of $2.50 for the day. This is the cheapest harbour cruise you can ever get, enjoy the 30+ minute journey each way, with great photo opportunities through out.
Great way to commute in to Sydney. I took this this morning and I thought it was great. Terrific views of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. A must do in Sydney!
Fast ferry to Manly for lunch. Nice quick trip on the fast ferry, a great way to see the sights of Sydney Harbour on a fine day. Will be back for sure.

Relaxing, affordable trip to Manley. We took the ferry to Manley on our first day in Sydney. What a wonderful introduction to Australia. The price of the ferry is covered on the Opal card, which we bought when we arrived at the airport.

Trips from Manly to Sydney and beyond. Regular ferry, helpful staff. We travelled on the ferry to visit Sydney-I'll never forget the first time you see the familiar landmarks as you sail towards the city! We also used it to start the first leg of our journey to the Blue Mountains and also going to and from the train station on our way to and from the airport. Used Opal card ( not accepted on fast ferry) no problem.

Very efficient way to travel!. Definitely by far the most efficient way to travel to manly plus you can't beat the breathtaking views of the harbour on the way! Takes around 20 or so minutes. I would however advise to sit inside once past the harbour as it does get quite windy and rough!

A Great Way to get to Manly. Took the Manly Ferry in the evening to have dinner at the Garfish Restaurant in Manly. It was a fun way to travel for an evening out. Especially fun as it was Halloween and many of the riders were in costume. Definitely the way to go!

Trip to Manly for the day. We bought an Opal card at the airport and used this to travel to Manly. Better than expected visit to Manly. Easy getting on and off ferry, times regular. Took 30 mins to get there. Easy getting on as used the opal card to tap on. Clean and comfortable ferry
Fantastic way to get to Manly. Terrific trip to Manly and very helpful crew. Love Sydney harbour. Cant wait to return to Sydney for another trip on the ferries there.

What Fun To Ride The Ferry. This is our 8th year returning to Sydney on vacation. The Manly Ferry provides the most beautiful views of the Sydney Skyline, Harbour Bridge, and The Sydney Opera House. The ferry is always crowded and the ride to Manly is just great. Would not think of coming to Sydney and not riding the Manly Ferry multiple times.

One of the best and cheapest tourists rides in Sydney!!!!. This is a must, relaxing on the Manly Ferry across the harbour. The journey takes about 40 mins and there is a small café on board or bring your own eats and drinks. Sitting outside you get a wonderful view of the Harbour Bridge and also the Opera House. One a clear day this is a must and a night ride is even better - the view of the city is breathtaking. Cost is not a lot, Adult return is about $15 AUD. When you get to Manly walk down to the beach and enjoy fish and chips overlooking the Pacific Ocean before you stroll back to the terminal for your ride back.Ferries go from Circular Quay every 30 mins or so.Enjoy!

Clean and very good service.. Excellent service, use opal cards and after 8 journeys free travel(within 7 day time period).
On Sunday's price is capped.plenty of seats even when busy, very safe service and such a great 30 min ride to Sydney Harbour.

Manley Beach from Circular Quay. Using our senior travel card we caught ferry to Manley Beach. Had a walk arround and paddled in sea. Was a lovely beach and area, with food and icecreams in terminal of Manley Beach. Ferries ran to time and the catamaran back was very fast and smooth.

Great way to travel on Sydney Harbour. We enjoyed a trip to Many on the ferry recently. The weather was perfect and the ferry was on schedule and charming! The staff were courteous, efficient and helpful.
Such a nice way to spend the afternoon. We got out of the city and saw the beauty of the harbour from all angles. Lunch over at manly is totally worth the trip too!
beautiful harbour. The manly ferry is a beautiful way to see one of the most beautiful Harbors in the world. The ferry stops at Manly where there are some wonderful restaurants on the harbor.

Sightseeing at its best. The ferry is reasonable and a nice ride. Manly is quite different from Bondi. The street to access the beach is lined with shops a several small restaurants. Beach was crowded, but pretty. Walked along the walkway to a saltwater pool which spills into the bay.

Trip to Manly. We took an afternoon trip to Manly - wonderful views of Sydney Harbor. So fun to walk to the beach and on the trails. We returned at dusk and so fun to see the lights of the city, the Opera House and the bridge.

Lovely way to see the Harbour. This is a cheap way to see the harbour & go to Manly beach too. it cost us AU$14 return. There is indoor & outdoor seating & the ferries seem to run regularly. On board you could get food & drink.

The highlight to being in Sydney.. Bondi has nothing on Manly. Do not forget this unforgettable ferry ride from Circular Quay across the Harbour to a place that remains very special to anyone who has visited. Manly is in need of a refurb however this will happen in time yet it is true Australia and a lot of fun to visit. Swim between the flags, eat ice cream, drink at the top of the Steyne. The ferry times are easy and download an app to assist. Don't miss the last one or a bus will take you back to Circular Quay. The beach is safe and free of trouble, a unique aspect to being on the Northern Beaches of Sydney. The ferry has a nice little kiosk - I used to eat the doughnuts and they still have them - they are worth trying. Always sit at the back of the ferry on the outside. You really forget about any issues and just take in the beauty of the harbour. I used to commute on the ferry each day to work and miss it.

Efficient boats. As a tourist in Sydney you will need to use the ferries. Check the tourist booth on Circular Quay to see if they have offers for day trips or various tourist locations. e.g. combined ferry and Zoo entrance. Your hotel may display booklets including various offers.

Nice trip. For my latest visit used the quick ferry once, but the Manly ferry 3 times. As long as you have your Opal card and know from which warf (in Sydney) the ferry leaves, quick and easy way to go to Manly. Even without the Opal card, thoguh a bit more expensive, just prepay a single or return ticket. Though plenty of people travelled the ferries, it was not packed. It did get close to crowded when they open the gates to embark or disembark the ferry itself. Quick ferry is 20 min, the Manly ferry is 30 min, the latter a bit cheaper. Once in Manly plenty of things to do, make sure you grab a time table so you know at what time the ferry heads back for Sydney.

Iconic and Enjoyable. Good way to experience a Sydney ferry trip. Easy to purchase ticket at Circular Quay for half-hour trip to Manly. Lots of passengers, but we moved easily on and off. Ferry was clean and comfortable.Can walk easily from Manly Wharf through mall to Manly Beach in about 10 minutes. This ferry travels across the heads so it would probably be quite rough on a bad weather day.
efficient. Easy access from Sydney harbor to Manly. Plenty of runs during the day. Get the pass and it makes it even easier.
Great ferry service. Great way to enjoy the sea. These ferries used locals to get to the city from Manly, so try to avoid using it in pick hours.

Easy transportation. The ferry is very convenient and Manly is a great stop for tourists. Getting a transit ticket from the transit office will save you on your ferry fare. The ride is pleasant and you get a good view of the harbour, the Sydney bridge and Opera House.
Great day trip. In Manly there are many options to choose...must see is to visit North Heads go there by walking or take the bus...also the scenic walk to Shelley Beach is a must
Nice views. This was a nice way of traveling to the city from the northern beaches area. View of the opera house and harbour were fantastic.

Best view of the harbour. The ferries run regularly (every half hour or so) from Circular Quay. Nab a seat outside for the best view of the Opera House and harbour! Careful, as when the ferry approaches Manly, it gets choppy and splashy! Bring a sweater as it's colder than you expect on the water, or you can sit inside to escape the elements if the weather isn't great. Good fun, and a relaxing way to get out of the city for a bit.

Great in the sun!. With the new Opal card travel is really easy in Sydney,on buses, ferries and trains. The ferry took about 25 minutes and gave great views of the opera house, the bridge and the islands as you sail to and from Manly. There are lots of great bars, coffee shops and food outlets at the Manly terminal and well worth a visit and a stop before heading for the beach.
Great Value. The Manly Ferry is a great way to see the harbor, Opera House and bridge. The ride was smooth and the views were terrific! It's a nice afternoon activity on a sunny day!
A great way to see the sights and get to Manly. A relaxing and inexpensive way to get from Circular Quay to Manly and see up close the Opera House and Bridge.
Lovely journey . Nice way to see the views of Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. 30 minute journey each way and not expensive to do. Manly is nice to see also.
Not on Saturdays or Sundays!. Extremely busy when we went on Sunday end of October. Mostly young people and understandable - probably the first nice day of their Spring.

Manly Ferry. I had seen an article on walking tracks around North Head, so my choice of taking the Manly Ferry was at least 90% made for convenience. That being said, it's efficient, relatively cheap and gives great views. You can walk off to Manly Beach which was pretty or walk/catch a bus up to North Head which is what I did.
Cost effective . Really cost effective mode of transport and get to see a lot on the way. Would definitely recommend as you get to see Sydney from an awesome view

An iconic ferry. A simply must-do thirty minute ferry ride across one of THE great harbours in the world. Passing the Sydney Harbour Bridge on one side, the Opera House on the other, and a leisurely cruise past the urban coastal capes and bays makes this one of the best travel bargains in Sydney.

The world's best commute. A great trip - the view coming into circular quay is fantastic.... Doing this backwards and forwards to work is the ultimate commute. Great for a day trip or any other reason though...
Another great ferry ride. This is a trip for the ages, truly is an excellent way to get from Manly to Sydney and the only way in my opinion!
Great transport option. We used the ferry a few times and enjoyed the views. Just love being on the water great way to see the sights.

Wonderful way to see Sydney harbour.. The crossing is great. Manley is very vibrant place to visit with lots of good restaurants. The whole experience is very relaxing and it is the best way to see Sydney Harbour
Part of Sydney. When you have a picture of Sydney Harbour in your mind, this ferry is definetly a part of it. 30 Minutes through the Harbour to One of Sydney's nice beaches.

Beautiful sunny day ride on the water. I rated the ferry 4/5 due to the beauty of the ride on a sunny day, the dependability of the service for the price, and the holiday spirit of they day. However, the restrooms services were limited and the crowds were overwhelming. I do not think the safety of the ferry was compromised, but the crush of people on the ferry was oppressive mid-Sunday afternoon. We made our return trip after dark, crowds were non-existent, other passengers were mellow and appreciative of the beauty of the night sky. Beautiful views of the Opera House coming and going. Manly Beach: This is a gorgeous beach with great waves for surfing. (Unfortunately, the day we were there, surfers were on the beach but a shark sighting kept most out of the water so we missed a full display of their talents.) We took the ferry from Circle Quay in Sydney to Manly Wharf and walked over to the beach and around to Shelly Beach. It was a Sunday afternoon, and even though cloudy, this was clearly a “happening” place. Lots of young adults, lots of music, lots of families, lots of couples, and all having a wonderful time at the beach. The walk from Manly Beach to Shelly Beach is dotted with “art”, a salt water pool, and beautiful houses just above the trail. Walking more informal trails on cliffs just beyond Shelly Beach, we saw 2-3 whales out from the shore, breaching–a beautiful, breathtaking sight. Parasailers were out on the Manly Beach when we wandered back just before dark in late October. Most of the crowds were gone from Manly Beach by then. Restaurants were still open and sparsely occupied on this Sunday night. The ferry, though very crowded on the mid-afternoon ride to Manly Wharf, now had very few people and it was very easy to get beautiful night photos of all the striking sites on the way back to Circle Quay. TRAILS: There are many and they are varied. There’s plenty of walking to be done on flat level surfaces. At the end of the paved walkways, there are more irregular trails that are very walkable though not level nor clear of roots and rocks. Beautiful day at the beach with as much or as little activity as you chose. OPAL CARD: We used an Opal Card for all travel during the week we were in Sydney. Maximum charge is $15.00 a day/person for any combination of bus, trains, light rail, and ferries. Sunday travel on ferries is $2.50 max for all travel all day. Purchase Opal card in convenience stores in Sydney for immediate use, and to avoid lines at stations. Cashier can explain details further.

Trip to Manly. Our trip to Manly was a bit of an over cast day, however it was still lovely going out there. The trip on the ferry was quite enjoyable and relaxing. There is a cafe on board which is great. Highly recommend the trip!

Excellent trip. The ferry to Manly is a must-do in Sydney. The views of the opera house and the zoo are fantastic. Be sure to stand outside so you can get pictures as you cruise by these icons.Manly is also beautiful. Get off the ferry and walk straight through to the beach to be rewarded with some lovely views and nice walking areas.

Great trip. This is a 30 minute cheap boat ride around the harbor offering great views of the harbor bridge, opera house, botanical gardens, and downtown skyline. As a bonus, you get to go to Manley which is a quant beach town with shopping, boardwalk, bars, and of course, the beach. Highly recommended.
Great trip at any time of year. A good way to see the harbour and escape to the seaside , sit outside and enjoy the stunning views of Sydney harbour

A Day trip for all.. Can't beat to views. With a map or tour book in hand you get history and perspective on Sydney. The half hour journey is a relax start and finish, to hiking, history, beach activities, shops, Waterview dining, and exploration. Check this out.

Day trip to Manly. If you go to Sydney you cant miss a trip to Manly on the Manly Ferry. I sat outside right up front. Great views of all the harbour, Opera House, Luna Park, so great to take some pic's. Coming back i sat inside the ferry which was nicely air conditioned. I was happy to relax on the nice comfy seats after a long day out at Manly. Highly reccommend.

A must do trip. A lovely ride across the harbour to beautiful Manly where there are beautiful beaches, lots of places to eat and shops, aquarium and other tourist attractions. The more energetic can hire bicycles to ride around the suburb.
Nice ride to Manly. Runs every 30 mins, the ferry rider to Manly takes 30 mins. Nice smooth ride where you can enjoy the harbour view and breeze. Highly recommended, enjoyable experience.

One of the world's great ferry rides.. Commuters read books or play on electronic devices while travelling across the most beautiful harbour in the world. From the Bridge to the Opera House to Fort Denison and on to Point Piper and the Heads into the quiet Manly Cove is such a great ride that is hard to beat. The ferries are comfortable. Sit outside on the starboard (right) side on the way to Manly & watch the ocean come through the Heads. Get off in Manly & have a walk to the beach then catch the ferry back to Circular Quay for another great scenic spectacle. No commentary but it doesn't matter.

Very good. Took the ferry over to get to Manly beach for the day. Used our opal cards (I think it was about $7 each way) took about 25 minutes. Very pleasant, if you sit outside be wary of the wind making it feel much cooler than it may be, quick way of getting burnt!! Manly beach is easy to find once off and there is plenty to see and do.

Forget the commercial sightseeing boats and take the cheap ferry to Manly.. Beautiful boat ride to Manly and its crescent beach where you can surfer watch, swim or just take a long oceanfront walk. Views of the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House are free.

Manly Ferry. MANLY FERRYA trip on the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay in the city to Manly Wharf is a worthwhile trip for visitors. The arrival and departure times may change at short notice due to safety regulations because of unexpected severe storms or very rough, choppy sea conditions, check for announcements. It takes about 30 minutes for this journey. Tickets for the ferry ride could be obtained from dispensing ticket machines at the wharf.At Circular Quay visitors can expect a hive of activity. Arrive earlier at Circular Quay to see and enjoy the many activities happening at wharf side. On the day of my visit there was a cruise ship docked at the cruise ship passenger terminal. There were many buskers playing the guitar and other musical instruments and statue men dressed in costumes with faces and hands painted in bronze or gold, standing still like statues, or performing slow doll-like movements. There was a group of Aborigines, one was playing on the didgeridoo, while another was performing an Aboriginal dance mimicking animals. The dancer’s movements keeping in time with the deep resonant music coming from the didgeridoo’s long wooden tube wind instrument. A few other Aborigines were looking after their works of art on display. Hand painted Aboriginal art on boomerangs, shells and materials were displayed on the pavement. When the ferry arrived at the pier, people on board disembarked first before passengers could board the ferry. There are two levels to board the ferry. The cabins are air-conditioned with comfortable seats and sliding windows above the seats to look out to sea. There is a kiosk where hot beverages, drinks and snacks are sold. There are toilets on board. No smoking is allowed on the ferry.After the ferry has left the wharf, as it cruised across the harbour it was delightful to look at the many picturesque sights of Sydney icons like the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House. A great opportunity for enthusiastic photographers to get good photos of these sights. The harbour had its usual activity like fast jet boats zipping past, sailing boats with sails swinging to the left and right trying to catch the wind and a seaplane flying low over the harbour taking tourists for sight-seeing tours of the harbour. One just have to sit back to look at the many sea activities, ocean views or enjoy the brisk sea breeze and look at the spectacular harbour and scenes of the shoreline greenery melting into the sea.On this trip, the ferry encountered the rolls from waves from incoming swells coming in from the North Heads Entrance. This caused the ferry to roll and pitch as the ferry turned to approach Manly Wharf, but after it turned, it sailed into calmer waters. Quite a thrill for passengers. A very pleasant journey on the ferry.

Cheap way to see the Harbour and a quick trip to Manly. The Manly Ferry gives you chance to see some parts of Sydney Harbour and some good photo opportunities of the Bridge, Opera House and the some of the exclusive Harbour residential property. When you get to Manly there is Aquarium, plenty of restaurants and the Manly surf beach.
Fast Ferry. Manly ferry is the main transportation used get easily from circular quay station going to Manly and the beach. Very convenient, relaxing to ride on. Highly recommended.

Cheap, fun, bring a camera!. $7Cheap and a great trip across the harbour. Great opportunity for photos, I suggested doing it at sunset after a day out in Manly. Get to the front of the queue for the deck seats!

Must Do Thing To Do. Since the ferries are part and parcel of Sydney's public transport system they are a very cheap way to have a fantastic sightseeing experience of Sydney Opera, Harbour and Bridge. Especially the Manly Ferry is fantastic, costing you AUD 2.50 per person one way. Making for a nice stop to walk and explore Manly, all immediately around the Manly Ferry Wharf, and then have the ride back. I know people that do this daily as commute and still enjoy it every day after many years.
Lovely trip. The quickest 30 minute ferry ride I have ever experienced. clean, efficient! Comfy seat, beautiful scenery.

A Sydney Must Do!. Even if you only have a day or 2 spare in Sydney, travellers must take the time to experience this memorable attraction - more than just a ferry ride, the Manly Ferry trip offers one of the best budget maritime rides in the world, and through the best harbour in the world - past Sydney's iconic attractions, it's scenic national park, the harbour islands and only 35 minutes to the popular cosmopolitan yet laid back beach side suburb of Manly - a truly fantastic way to spend the day!

Cheapest activity on Sydney Harbour. A must do when you visit is to jump on a ferry to Manly or Watsons Bay. While the destinations offer a Miriam of great activities and eateries & stunning views, the journey is much more important. You will get all the benefits of being out on Sydney harbour with unbelievable views for a few dollars. Just do it !

Great Value. Although you do not have a tour guide pointing out interesting features along the way, you can arm yourself with a map or a guide book and for a significant ssaving you can view the beauty of Sydney Harbour. Manly is a wonderful place to hop off and enjoy lunch or a coffee by the beach and a walk along the promenade. Good value/great views and a great day out

Best Cheap Way to see the Harbour. Hop on the Manly Ferry to be 10 miles from Sydney, 100 miles from care. The yachts sails past your ferry in either direction, as you make your way saying goodbye to the Harbour Bridge and ultimately hullo to Manly for a swim and fish and chips on the bech. A true Sydney experience.

A harbour that can accomodate 'a thousand ships of the line'. This was what Lt. James Cook, Royal Navy, said of Sydney Harbour in 1770. The ferry trip is inexpensive. It takes you past primes sites along the harbour foreshore offering excellent views and delivers you to Manly which in itself in another discovery in its own right.

Beautiful way to see sydney harbour. take a ferry to Manly as you leave from Circular Quay and you can take pictures of the Harbour Bridge then the Opera House and enjoy a beautiful cruise to Manly beach

Never tire of this journey. I loved this ferry - used it many times and love the free wifi ( if it works ) My sister lives in Sydney hence why ive visits a few times now and hates this journey as did it daily for work. I LOVE IT though. I love the smoothies at the port also ha
Great way to see the city. A must do for any tourist who wants to see the city sights and visit the amazing Manly beach. More cost effective than most.

"A must for all visitors to Sydney". If you are visiting Sydney a trip on the Manly Ferry is a must. As you are leaving Circular Quay you travel past the amazing Sydney Harbour Bridge on you left and the Sydney Opera House on the right. Then as you are travelling towards Manly you will have the opportunity of seeing how the rich and famous live passing some historical homes. Arriving at Manly you have a choice of some great Seafood Restaurants or you can just walk down to the Esplanade on the Beach, purchase the popular "fish and chip" sit by the beach and enjoy your meal

A great way to get around. We used the ferry to go from Sydney to Manly simply because we hadn't done it before and it was a lovely experience. Plenty of ferries at regular times, quite often used by commuters going to/from work so not a fancy cruise-ship style vessel, but a comfortable, well-run service with friendly staff who were happy to help us with our luggage.

Iconic. A must do if you're in Sydney. Easily accessible from circular quay. Busses and Trains run directly to the Quay so it's an easy transport option. We love the ferry for all kinds of day trips. We have visited Manly, Taronga, Darling Harbour, Cockatoo Islamd, Watsons Bay, Balmain, Luna Park and Pinchgut (Fort Denison) especially for its unique architecture. So much fun over the years. From the ferry there is so much to see on the harbour. If you want to see Sydney harbour without paying a fortune for a cruise then a ferry ride is your best option. It's a leisurely outing and well managed by staff. Ferries run to time and their usually a kiosk aboard most ferries. As I write this we are heading off today to take our granddaughter on the ferry to Watsons bay for the day.

A great experience. Be aware that hundreds of people catch the ferry everyday to go to the city.
Beyond its role of public transportation for the suburbian commuting to the City, it has to be recommended for the tourists too, to reach Manly from the city center.
An enjoyable ride on Sydney's bay!

You can't miss this... This is the way to get to Manly from the city centre. Get a seat in the open front area and let the sea air fill your lungs and ruffle your hair ! Brilliant views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge as you approach Circular Quay coming from Manly. Great photo opportunities. Refreshments are available on board. A great way to get around.

Wonderful little town!. Took the ferry from Circular Quay in Sydney to Manly - took about 30 minutes each way. A good way to see Sydney harbor - you go past the Sydney Opera House. Manly is a wonderful little town to wander around. If you walk right through the town you come to the Manly beach - fabulous surf and lots of places to walk!!
Ferry trip to Manly. Thoroughly enjoyed this ferry trip to Manly. Great opportunities for taking snaps of the Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House from the boat.

The best and cheapest way to see the harbour. I really like the manly ferry as it takes you through the most spectacular parts of the harbour. Manly itself is nice enough with a pleasant beach so its worth the trip. Try and sit near the front for the best views. Beware that it can get a bit choppy as you pass the harbour entrance!
Great trip on a sunny day!. Join the locals and others on a lovely ferry ride to Manly for a beach visit, stroll or just for a meal.

Harbour views. Travelling to Manly by ferry is a great trip. Not only is it inexpensive but you get to see all that this spectacular harbour has to display. Make sure you do a return journey and sit on the north side going over and the south side coming back. This way you get to see the whole panoramic view. Many too is a worthwhile destination with lots of interesting shops and wonderful beachfront at the end of the mall.

Great way to see the Harbour. We were first time visitors to Sydney and we wanted to see the Harbour in an inexpensive way. This was perfect. Ferry runs often and on time, we bought a round trip ticket very cheaply. The opal card would have been a good value but we didn't need a lot of other public transportation. People friendly and we all had great views.

Awesome. They had a great deal where if you have a child with you each fare was $2.50 all day to and from the zoo including the bus. It made the ride sweeter knowing I didn't have to pay so much just to get to the zoo. Beautiful views, lovely weather, lovely little ferry ride!

Manly Well Worth A Visit. The fare in October 2015 for a return trip from Circular Quay to Manley was AUD$15.20 per person and given the destination alone that is worth every penny. Plus it's handy that you get different views of the bridge and the Opera House as well as seeing something just a little outside the city centre. When you get off the ferry at Manly we were advised that if we crossed the road into the main shopping street or The Corso as it's called and walked to the end of that, it brings you straight to the main, large beach which is lovely. However, we were advised that once we'd arrived at that point turn right & follow the obvious coast path and that took you to Shelly Beach, as you get there, there is a lovely restaurant called The Boathouse, the walk along the path is great, but likewise the food at this restaurant was also great, see the main review for that restaurant.
Overnight stay . Used the ferry too go too a concert in the city. Fast n grt value for money. Amazing views Very clean n tidy. Very helpful staff. A must do on any trip too Sydney.

Mnly Ferry. It is a great way to veiw the Opera House, The Harbour Bridge , Fort Denison and then on the left you see Taronga Zoo,and opposite you have Garden Island with the NavalShips and the Botanical Gardens and Mrs Maquarie's Chair then Rushcutters Bay and the luxury houses of the Eastern Suburbs and then further on you witness Neilson Park, then Watsons bay, South Head and the Gap. It can be rough and scary sometimes crossing the heads but then you see North Head and the Quarantine Station where they have ghost tours, Accommodation and a beautiful restaurant. Then you are lucky enough to arrive at beautiful Manly where you can take a short stroll to the beaches or visit the Manly Aquarium. The Harbour beach is a great place for young children to swim.
Lovely ride to manly. It's just a lovely ride like other ferry to manly beach. The fee is low. The view along the harbour is spectacular.
why take the harbour cruises. its cheap efficient though a little crowded.It gets you there without any fuss and great views of the harbour,opera house and bridge

Relaxing Ride to Manly. We had free time and had purchased an all day ferry ticket, so went to Manly Beach. It was a nice ride through the harbor. You walk several blocks by many shops to reach the beach. It is a beautiful beach, but we were only sightseeing. Did stop at a nice aboriginal art store and bought a few things there. Had a very good lunch at a restaurant facing the water. Since we are 80, we are not the target audience for most of this area, but still enjoyed seeing it.

Sydney's own Staten Island Ferry. I haven't enjoyed a ferry ride like this since I travelled from the Scottish Mainland to and from the Outer Hebrides. And this one is considerably shorter and for us, the weather was considerably warmer. This really is a great way to see the approach from Manly to the heart of the Sydney downtown/CBD. Sydney is not actually on the coast, and this ferry ride from possibly the most well known coastal suburb, provides a wonderful ride into the heart of the city, and made me more fully appreciate the selection of what was to become Sydney. Today the ferry passes naval dockyards and shore communities while the famous sights appear and start to fill the view. This is the way to see the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House.
