We came from having been dropped off in Manly, so it was an exciting arrival in the CBD for us, but I suspect doing the return from the Wharf out to Manly and back would be just as exciting. Only New York's Staten Island ferry could possibly challenge this experience.
Great ferry ride to manly. This is a relatively cheap way of getting to and from manly with ferries departing every hour and sometimes every half hour on peak days

What fun and great sites.. This is a must do along with the many other wonderful sites in Sydney. The views along the cruise and the destination at Manly are truly Australian. Be sure to visit the beach there and take in a Pub or two for a real taste of proper Auzzie fare.

Superb way to see the harbour. It Costs aus15 return to go to manly from circular QuayGet the opal card and top up when you need itYou can get the opal card at news agents anywhere in Sydney and top up at any newsagents too

Must-do Manly Ferry. There is no better way of seeing Sydney Harbour than a trip on the Manly Ferry. An unpretentious journey on a regular ferry from Circular Quay - but what a view! Sydney Harbour bridge on one side and the Opera House on the other, followed by Woolloomooloo and the other suburbs, north and south. And all for something like $8. At the end you reach Manly - the start of the best beaches in Sydney (forget Bondi, the northside beaches have everything without all the crowds). Manly is interesting in itself and there are a couple of very nice walks to enjoy.
Cheap and okay. Recommend it for being affordable. It stops every 30min which is a good deal, great access to the main spots around Sydney.

The Best Way to Get into Central Sydney. Staying in Manly and want to get into Sydney CBD , this is the best and most scenic way to do it . Ferrys run to Circular Quay at regular intervals and price wise are very rerasonable

Great way to see Sydney - from Manly to Sydney return. This was an amazing experience with my hubby and three children aged between 7 and 10! The kids LOVED riding in the front of the ferry. The views of the opera house and harbour bridge were spectacular. We left early morning, so the morning sunlight on the icon's was brilliant!Word of warning though, if your vehicle is higher than 2.1m all the parking in Manly City does not allow for this height! Ours is 2.3... so we couldn't park anywhere. All the street parking is only for 2hours. We ended up parking at a friends house and taking a bus in.

A good way to see the Harbour. Atrip on the ferry to Manly is a good way to see around the harbour. It can become very exciting if a heavy sea is running through the Heads, but they have done this many times and it adds adventure to the trip.Sit back and enjoy the Harbour sites and take time on arrival at Manly to see one of Australia's famed beaches and its surrounds.

Excellent view if you sit at the front of the ferry. It is a very pleasant ride from Circular Quay to Manly and on the way back. I sit at the front of the out outdoor at both ways, it is so nice. I don't feel like I was on a boat because it is so stable and windy and sunny make me feel like I am sitting at the beach.View are amazing on the way back from Manly to Circular Quay. Make sure your camera is ready when you are almost back there as you can take a photo with different angle that you can't take any where else!
April 2015. First time on the ferry's - clean, on time and dry during rainy days. Great way to view Sydney Harbour, lots of photo opportunities along the way. Make sure you have an Opal Card

Great way to see the harbour. Caught the ferry from Darling Harbour to Manly for $15. return. The weather was a little choppy and it made for an exciting trip. Wear comfortable shoes as Manly streets and beach are worth looking at.

Its a very underated tourist thing !!. If you catch the ferry to Manly , you get some of the best views of the harbour , the bridge & the opera house ... for a very reasonable sum ... It,s just a no brainer !!! & you see Manly too Which is quite quirky but lovely..

Cheap cruise on the Harbor. We were staying at the Harbourview hotel, and getting to the Circular Quay to catch the Manly ferry was a piece of cake. On the Nth Sydney Train station to Wynyard and then to Circular Quay and off to terminal 4 to the Manly ferry. Sit back, enjoy the view of the bridge, the Opera House and the rest of the gorgeous Sydney Harbour past the heads and to Manly. We went for a walk towards the Spit Bridge, though I'd drop by the Information Centre to get the most out of your visit. Lovely cafes and ice cream shops to tempt the taste buds, or a swim if you feel so inclined. We come here each time we visit Sydney. And the return back to Sydney town is just as easy. Don't forget the ferry runs every half hour so check your times before you leave the ferry terminal. Enjoy!!

Easy way to travel. For only about $15, you get a return ticket from Circular Quay to Manly. The journey is only 30 mins on one of the best harbours in the world. The service operates every 30 mins so there is little waiting time. Great way to get to Manly.

Great experience but choose the cheapest means!. We took the manly ferry and enjoyed going to Manly Beach. Seeing the Harbour from the water was great! However we didn't know to buy the Opal card. Instead we paid $15 return per person. On Sunday using the Opal card you max out at $2.50 for as many rides on all public transportation.m
The Ferry. Such awesome fun, and so much to see from the sea. Cheap to travel for views you simply couldnt reach by land. Loved our little juant on the Ferry.
Awesome ride to the beach. This was one of my trip highlights. Gorgeous day for a boat ride on open waters. Great view of the harbor going out and of the skyline coming back. Highly recommend.

The best view of the Opera House!. There's nothing like the perspective the approach form the sea gives you. This is no exception for the Opera HOuse although the skyline of the City is remarkably uninteresting. The Harbor Bridge however is an impressive piece of work and claims to be the tallest arch int he world. The two landmarks together make a very satisfying picture. The Ferry was comfortable, quiet, on time and efficient. At Manly it is just a short walk down The Corso to get to the beach. A pleasant walk towards Shelley beach and you can eat at The Boathouse, which has contemporary Australian food and views of the beach.

Lovely way to get up close to Opera house and bridge. We have been on the ferry before but its a lovely way to see the surroundings. The Opera house and the bridge. Manly is a lovely place to visit for the restaurants as well as the beach.
Fun, but in desperate need of TLC. The ferry ride was excellent and a lot of fun, however was very expensive and the ferries look as though they need to either be upgraded or a good overhaul.
Quick and easy. Definitely recommend this, scenic views of the city, quick trip to Manly where you can then walk or enjoy a lazy day on the beach.

Great views of Sydney Harbour. If your first time to Sydney, take the Manly ferry @ Pier 3 in Circular Quay. Bargain return ride over to Manly, a wonderful and quaint seaside town with nice pubs/restaurants, fantastic beaches, and shopping for the tourists. The town is for strolling as are the seaside trails and famous beach. Watch the school kids take surfing lessons, go for a swim and take in the sailing races from the ferry. No better way to pass an enjoyable day.

A must do for any visitor to Sydney.. A trip to Manly is a must do not only for Manly itself but also for the great photo opportunities it offers of the harbour, the bridge and the opera house. The trip takes 30 minutes each way and represents amazing value if you use the ferry that is covered by the Opal card. The Manly fast ferry is more expensive. Ferries leave Circular Quay on the hour and half past and head back from Manly at quarter past and quarter to the hour.

Don’t miss the chance to explore Manly Beach.. This 30 min ride provides exceptional views of the harbor and the ocean inlet. Get to the boat early to get a spot in the front to enjoy the best views. Unlike the other ferries, the Manly Beach ferry doesn’t turn around so the front of the boat will be facing the water, not the dock.

Great view on the Opera. When you leave the harbour with the ferry to manly you have a great view on the opera.
On top you have free wifi on the ferry.
A return ticket costs 15.20 dollar.
The essence of Sydney. When you take this 35 minute ferry ride you enjoy a panoramic view of the gigantic Sydney harbour and all its nooks and crannies

Take it slow and enjoy the view - Manly Ferry. Before booking on packed, expensive harbour tours, try the freedom and space of the classic green and cream working ferries from Circular Quay. Hop on and off for a short dash under the Bridge to Milson's Point, or a long and winding journey up river to Parramatta, but best of all is the 'slow' ferry to Manly. Heading East with perfect views of The Opera House and Fort Dennison, then turning North across the Heads and views of the open sea, before docking at Manly. A perfect 30 min boat trip.
Brought back memories. It had been years since I caught this ferry service. It was great to sit back and relax, enjoy the ride and see Sydney harbour again.
Just a ferry!. The ferry is showing its age. It's not an attraction in itself, but it is your ride out to manly. It's comfortable and easy.

Release the child within, maybe discreetly.. Thirty minutes of pure delight, coming or going to either destination i.e. Manly or Circular Quay, different each time, never tire of the experience, look forward to it each time, whether upstairs or down, inside or out, summer or winter, with camera or without. Pure nostalgia, simple but an inexpensive rewarding experience.
Great trip. Great scenery on the trip.Don't bother spending the money on private tours. Just buy around trip ticket enjoy the day and save a bundle from the privately run tours
Ferry. Best way to see the harbour, grab a ferry and head to Manly. Head outside and enjoy the sea breeze and watch the sailing boats, birds and other ferrys as you tour the harbour

A must visit. Manly Beach is a must to visit whilst in Sydney. The ferry is the best way to get there, great value travel with amazing views all the way. Visitors or locals, there is no better way to travel. Hop on board and enjoy the day out.

Travel in Style. If you havent caught a ferry in sydney, your missing out. Many is a great location, and there is no better way to get there than by the ferry. Its probably the most fun form of transport in sydney and certainly the one with the best views.

A must do in SYDNEY. I have been doing this trip every visit since I was 10 years old Great cheap way to see all Sydney views of Bridge ,Opera House and other attractions .At the end you get to Manly nice place to spend the day by the beach and lots of eating drinking walking tracks check when the last fairy leaves because you may enjoy Manly costs a lot in a taxi back if you miss it

No visit to Sydney would be complete without a trip to Manly. There is no better way to see Sydney's landscape then from the deck of a Manly ferry, then a brief walk on the Corso with a stop to buy fish and chips before returning is a great way to introduce visitors to this beautiful city.

Perfect on a rainy day to admire the coast view. Very comfortable, clean ferry with plenty glass windows for excellent views! We were travelling on Thursday morning, there were lots of elderly couples and retirees! So relaxing trip!

Great holiday thing to do.... A simple ferry ride but with a difference - it's in Sydney Harbour! Amazing views and lots of room when travelling at tourist hours like mid morning. Kids loved it. Hung around in Manly then got the ferry back. Good cheap holiday fun.

Worth ditching your car for. Everytime I go to Sydney I just have to take the Manly Ferry, great views fast as is needed but a trip worth doing just for the ferry ride. Apart from enjoying Manly & all the great eating & drinking establishments at either end it feels like a slice of history the Aussie Crawl song Reckless always plays in my head as I relish the wind & spray, even though the inside seats are comfy. Not just a commute!

Fun but busy. We travelled with 2 kids aged 3 and 18 months to Manly beach which was very busy. The weather was fantastic and it was a long weekend for the Australians- so busy was expected. The ferry was ok price and once at Manly not that far to the beach.

Great way to see Sydney Harbour and the city skyline. Known in our family as "the poor man's harbour cruise" taking the ferry to Manly is a very economical way to see Sydney in comfort (well, on a calm day anyway!) and have lunch at pretty Manly. Combine the ride with a walk along the Manly coastline after fish and chips on the Manly Corso and you have the makings of the perfect relaxing day. A must for the tourist, local and international alike.

Excellent cheap way to see the harbour and visit Manly. Rather than pay the high rates for a harbour cruise, we used the Manly ferry to see the Opera House and Bridge from the harbour. This ferry does not go under the bridge and takes half a hour to get to Manly. Like Bondi, Manly beach is nice but there's not much there. Best view of Opera House is from this ferry. But to go under the Bridge, use the Daring Harbour ferry!
Cheapest harbour cruise around. Sure this is a useful commuter ferry line but it's also the best way to see Sydney harbour for $15 return!

Bargain! . If you're here for a few days get an opal card and the journey is very cheap. 30 mins or so and the ferries are every 30 minutes. Spacious boats and they even have a cafe on board. On a nice day you can even spot dolphins.
Beautiful views of Sydney Harbor at a resonable cost. Manly Ferry is a 30 minute trip and provides excellent views of Sydney Harbor. To get best photos get a seat up front on the upper deck.

Great day trip with a beautiful boat ride. Manly Ferry was a very relaxing way to get to beach. Clean and comfortable with slow enough pace to enjoy the journey. Once we got there, we followed the crowd to the beach. Great way to spend the day.

Fast, frequent service. Fast, frequent service with free wifi onboard makes for a great journey to and from the city/Manly.
Return ticket cost me about $15 (I think!)

Very pleasant. Great trip across harbour to Manly. Had uncle in wheelchair & received great assistance from friendly staff on and off boat. Good to see homes along the harbourside. A very enjoyable day out. Discount for pensioners. Comfortable ride inside or smelling the salt air outside. Plenty of seats running length of boat.. well done Manly ferries.

Ferry's Views Worth the Trip; Manly a Bonus. We spent a day touring Manly Beach, an interesting "suburb" of Sydney. The ferry ride to and back were worth the trip and fare. Manly itself reminded us of many U.S. seaside communities, but with friendlier people. It is worth a stroll, but don't expect Coney Island' or Venice Beach's "peculiarities."

Cheap and easy way to see Sydney. To get the true feeling of Sydney harbour this is the way to get around. To take you across to the Rocks, Luna Park and beyond. This is a must do if your visiting Sydney.
Gr8. Buy the black card ride all ferries all day long no reason to buy a tour Manley is a gorgeous beachy place to have a gr8 day there are shops places to eat drink etc
great day trip when in Sydney. used the NSW day pass to go to on all NSW Public Transport Manly is just one of the places we visited.

Love this Ferry. Manly Ferry and all the ferries on the Harbour are a wonderful way to spend a day in Sydney. Our week long Bus, Train, Ferry and also the Light Rail ticket was only $65 for the week. Well worth it, in time and money.

Great. this is a must do in Sydney
Manly is worth a visit and the views from the ferry are magnificent
There is a little cafe on board with reasonable prices
Signage at Circular Quay not so good and getting a ticket can take time at busy hours

Day Trip to Manly. It took less than 30mins going to Manly... they have a nice beach... then we eat our lunch at Harry Phat's and yogurt desserts at the Sugarland... went back again to Circular Quay by 4pm... it was a nice ride anyway... we have fun!

Ferries are Fun and Relaxing. Taking any of the harbor ferries is enjoyable and the one to Manly is no exception. The bonus is that you end up in Manly with lots of options of things to see and do. As noted, it's also the best way to get good photos of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House that you can't get from shore. The ferry is often crowded so if you want to sit on the upper deck, be sure to arrive at the dock a few minutes before the ferry arrives and board via the platform that services the upper deck of the ferry directly from the dock. You can,, of course, get to the upper deck from inside the ship but it may take too long to do so and the good seats will already be taken.

Cheap thrill and scenery. Well. The ferry to manly island I believe is 7 dollars per journey. But the good thing is that it is included in the daily quota of your opal card of 15 dollars max cap. Definitely to go since it's 'free'. Heard also that Sunday it's only 2.50s the cap for the oral card . But again, not everyone reaches Sydney just on Sunday. As for the journey, it reminds me of the free ferry to Staten island. first advice and tip.go to the back end of the boat which is facing the jetty which you board. You leave the boat, first greeted with the scenery of the jetty and the skyline of the Sydney,then followed by close up of the harbour bridge on your right and the Opera house in your left. Then followed by both the bridge and Opera house view and followed by all ( Opera house harbour bridge city skyline) Reaches manly island in 40 minutes. will, u can enjoy urself at manly beach. But it was beginning to drizzle so we quickly returned back to the city on the same ferry. Nice way to relax and chill in the evening as well. And since it's one of those it's a must do thing in Sydney, just go with the hype and enjoy urself there :)
Amazing as one word. If you to have a better view of Sydney harbour bridge and Opera house caching a ferry will be ideal and it does not cost much only. feeling like being adventurous I recommend it

Great way to see the Harbour. It's a half hour sail from Circular Quay to Manly and you get to see the Harbour Bridge and Opera House from a different angle. The day we sailed it was a bit windy and choppy but nevertheless it was a trip worth doing and the ferries are large enough so you don't feel too much movement.

Dolphins If You're Lucky!. I've been on the Manly Ferry 4 or 5 times while living in Sydney. On two separate occasions I was lucky enough to see Dolphins. Not just one or two but maybe 5-10 dolphins swimming within 50m of the ferry. I'm not saying that this happens all the time or even often but you never know your luck. Regardless of whether you spot a few dolphins the ride is always pleasant and gives you a harbour cruise for a hardly anything. Sometimes the best view of the harbour is from the the water.
Slow leisurely ride. Had a great time traveling on the Manly Ferry. Good weather and clear blue sky and the outstanding Opera House and Harbour Bridge was simply breath taking.
trip to take. we have gone on the ferry to manly so many times to eat ice cream at ben and jerry.the trip was good as the weather was excellent and we enjoyed window shopping there

Day trip to Manly. We were surprised how low the prices were to use the ferry. Excellent service and nice to see different areas around Sydney.We had lunch in Manly at a fish restaurant which was very nice

Cheap way to view Sydney Harbour Sights. We love this inexpensive ride on the Harbour from Circular key to Manly. But get the return trip it is really good value. You will pass all the major attractions, Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Botanic Gardens, Mrs MacQuarie's Chairs, Sydney Heads, Rose Bay, Watsons bay, Cremorne Point....Endless beauty on a sunny day day. A little cool, rough and windy in August when we went but during the Nov-Jan the water are smoother and the cool afternoon breeze is a refrshing break from the heat.

Great way to see the harbour. Get an opal card for cheap hassle free transport.. Half hour harbour cruise for $7.18 with opal card - $15 daily maximum fee for travel on all buses, light rail, ferries and trains (except airport trip which is another $13). Lovely trip up the harbour on a stately old ferry, take a map so you can spot the land marks. Toilets clean, food snacks ok. Sit or stand outside to get the full experience. We spent an hour in Manly which was time enough to walk through the corso to Manly beach for a little paddle and have a quick lunch before heading back to Sydney.

"Just around the corner". For the first time with the ferry from Manly to circular key. Sailing round the corner and then your mouth is just fall open,.......what a magnificent look. Seeing the "opera house",... an amazing building. My most beautiful building i ever see.

The best way to commute to the city. Taking the ferry to and from the city to Manly is the best way to unwind after a long day at work. You can literally leave all your troubles behind you and see them wash out to sea. The service is fast, comfortable and friendly. If you're visiting, it's a must to visit Manly enjioy the beach which in my opinion puts Bondi to shame.

Great view of much of Sydney along the river. The Sydney ferry system is s great way to get around the parts of Sydney near the river. The ride to Manly has a great view of the Sydney Harbour bridge and the residential areas of Sydney along the river. Arriving in Manly, there is a nice walk from the ferry landing to the beach on the ocean side of Manly..

World Famous..... The trip to Manly is a must for anyone visiting Sydney. Not only is the ferry ride a great way to see the harbor, the Opera House and various areas of the harbor but it is an efficient fun mode of transportation. The ferry system here has it down....

beautiful harbour. The Manly ferry trip (and indeed all the ferry trips around Sydney Harbour) is a must for all visitors. It is a 30 minute trip from Circular Quay and on the return journey you will get spectacular photos of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. When you arrive at Manly Wharf walk along The Corso to the famous Manly Beach. You can stop for fish and chips or ice cream and make a day of it. The walk from Manly Beach to Shelly beach is also wonderful either looking at the beautiful scenery or the spectacular houses that line the path. One of my favourite walks. If you haven't already indulged in fish and chips there are a couple of lovely tea houses and restaurants along the way to Shelly Beach (a bit more expensive than fish and chips though!)

A must everytime I visit Sydney. A great way to see the harbour bridge, opera house, heads and Sydney harbour. The terminal at Wharf 6 generally has someinteresting street theatre happening nearby. Just a lovely way to spend an afternoon
Its s classic. 30 minute, smooth trip on a classic ferry. Why rush on the fast ferry... The coffee onboard is good too!

Taken for a ride. Manley, unlike Bondi, is well worth a visit and the best way to visit is by ferry from Circular Quay. There is a fast ferry but for tourists the regular ferry is preferable giving one time to appreciate the harbor and its views and history. No commentary but read the guide it's sufficient. The ferry also crosses the shipping channel at the harbor entrance (The Heads) and one often feels the full might of the Southern Ocean as it rolls in. Great fun and not long enough to induce sea sickness. Since 2015 is the 100th anniversary of Gallipoli it was easy, and sad, to imagine all those young men, fully of hope and vigor, sailing past The Heads never to return. The war memorials across Australia bear testament to their sacrifice "Lest we forget"

Great way to see Sydney. The ferry can get crowded (both ends) but if you can keep away from holidays and peak times through the week, its a great way to see Sydney from the water passing by a number of iconic spotsNote that you can purchase an Opal card from most newsagents which allows you to travel on public buses, trains and ferries plus it is very cheap on Sundays albeit a bit crowdedA really worthwhile trip to do

A great place to visit. We loved our day trip to Manly. The ferry ride was fun and gave us a chance to see the Sydney Harbour and beyond. We strolled Manly Beach and loved the quaint seaside cafes. We shopped along the esplanade that connected the ferry terminal to the main beach area. A great day. So glad we went.

Old Ferries! But Ferry ride is must do!. The ferries to manly beach from circular quay are quite old and run by the government.
however the ferry ride to reach manly beach is totally worth it

An iconic trip!. The ferry ride is a great way to experience the harbour and get to the wonderful Manly beach. It is 30 minutes one way and on weekends leaves every 30 minutes. There are lots of seats on the ferry, but seats at the window provide a better view. It was about $15 for an adult return ticket, but only $2.50 for seniors.

Great views. The trip on the Manly Ferry was great. We bought our ticket and boarded straight away. We went to the upper deck for better views.The trip was quite smooth, though I've heard it can get a bit bumpy we were fine. It certainly wasn't rough so don't let the thought of sea sickness stop you. On the way back we were careful to get on in the first group and headed upstairs to the front of the boat. We were rewarded with amazing views all the way back into Sydney. The Sydney skyline for the ferry was fabulous.
Wheelchair Very Friendly. Wonderful staff helped make a bucket list wish come true for our courageous Mum , making sure she had easy wheelchair access and nothing was too much trouble. Thank you!

A brilliant relaxing and peaceful journey around the harbour.. What a pleasant day we had travelling to Manly and back on the ferry. We enjoyed it so much that we went twice during our stay in Sydney.

Worth a visit to Manly. Ferry is easy to use and cheap enough. Be sure to check the weather. The crossing can be very choppy and the boat sure rocks about. It's quick though and you see Sydney Harbour from the water without the ridiculous price!

best way to see the harbor bridge and opera house. This ferry was amazing - it leaves every 30min from circular quay, easy to get to and on/off. Manly is beautiful and this was the best way to see the harbor bridge and opera house with that iconic view.

A fantastic family outing on a Sunday. What a fabulous family outing on a Sunday with ticket prices capped at $2.50 for the full day! Either hop off at Manly and explore, or stay on the ferry and enjoy the sights and ride back to Circular Quay. The onboard kiosk is also very reasonably priced.

Perfect by Day - Beautiful by Night. We took the ferry ride over to Manly mid afternoon. We explored the beach, the shops and had a relaxing dinner at one of the hotels before strolling back down to the ferry terminal to visit the chocolate/coffee shop (not cheap but delicious) and enjoy a late return to Circular Quay. We had been advised to take a night trip back as you can see the spectacular sight of all the lights of the city, Opera House and bridge. We were not disappointed and would certainly recommend this as a must do for any tourist visiting Sydney. It is very affordable and the ferry service is frequent.

Great way to see the harbour. There is nothing better than getting on the ferry to come to Manly from the city - you leaving the vibrant, busy, crush of Circular Quay its like the world slows down as you slowly pass by the Opera House and Passenger terminal, waving to the Prime Minister's Sydney Residence hoping to get a sneak peak of the man himself in sight. For adults and children alike the ferry trip is a must - depending on the weather braving the outdoor seats to get a better view, (the outdoor seats aren't for the fain-hearted in a big swell) or just relaxing inside and taking in the wonder of Sydney harbour and the foreshores.. Arriving into Manly you might as well have popped into another country, the feel is immediately laid back and relaxed - with plenty to do in Manly - the Ferry is a must for any visitors to Sydney.

despite the staff and management the sheer relaxing beauty of the harbour saves this service. poor Sydney Ferries -- stuck in some time warp of Them vs Us management vs union era -- the ferries are bit clunky, bit old timer but part of the appeal -- wish they would sort out the gangplank and mooring rope stuff to stop the endless snarling and stand back STAND BACK from the staff.Let's talk about the staff -- some are good -- agreed -- GOOD -- but holy sheet, some need keeping away from the public or at least sent to charm school or just given an upper-cut before they start work each day -- some have been there so long they think its their ferry and they can speak anyway they like to passengers -- as an Aussie I am embarrassed sometimes at the way they yell rudely at people who are clearly new to Australia or tourists , migrants, whatever. Get some manners -- realize you are dealing with the public not loading and unloading cattle for export!!!!!

Brilliant. Buy yor travel pass for all transport systems and jump on this ferry it takes 30 mins and is a great way to see the harbour and the outer harbour and visit manly beach just sat in the sun and watching dolphins in the harbour one of the best mornings in sydney toilets and coffee on board loved it great place to take pictures of the opera house.

Travellers must do. If you are visiting sydney the one thing you should do is get the ferry to manly on a nice day(don't pay for a tour of the harbour) this is as good and cheaper. Get off at manly walk down the corso take a right at the beach and walk along to fairy bower to the bay and if that is not better than the french Rivierra I am a poor judge. ( much nicer than concrete Bondi! Let me know if your agree
Great place to visit. Lots of bars, restuarants and cafes and a good beach. Good for shopping. About 30 minutes on the ferry.

Wind in the hair for great price. The feeling of freedom and salty air on your face is priceless. If you head to Manly, there are great attractions such as the beaches, aquarium and kayaking. If you want to get from Manly to the city (Circular Quay), there are restaurants, Museum of Contemporary Art and the Opera House at your feet.A much more pleasant experience than the bus or driving!

Amazing views of the harbour. Manly ferry is a great way to see spectacular views of Sydney harbour for a low cost. Catch the ferry out to Manly, have lunch and check out the beach, and then ferry back to the city. Highly recommended.
Best Ever!. The Ferry crossing was choppy, but breathtaking! Loved everything about it and Manly is the gift that just keeps giving.
Shabby but reliable. Efficient and a good way to see the harbour. Frequent service at a reasonable charge. Good place to stop for coffee on arrival.

Beautiful. Something that cannot be missed when visiting Sydney, Australia. The ferry ride is one of the most beautiful and affordable things to do in Sydney and it brings you to Manly, which is another place you cannot miss out on visiting Sydney.
A GREAT HARBOUR CRUISE. this a fantastic way for visitors to get a great and cheap harbour tour and visit Manly and it's attractions

One of the best water rides I've been on. Just been on one of the most gorgeous ferry rides to Manly and saw the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera house at sunset on the return. I would highly recommend this ferry ride, look up the sunset time and then plan a round trip that will end up back at circular quay around sunset.You will have about 30 minutes leeway after sunset time before it gets dark and you would still get the spectacular views on the return leg from manly. If you have an opal travel card it is a very cheap excursion. Stay on the boat and don't get off at Manly and then it's an hour long ferry ride.I would recommend trying to go to the upper deck at the back of the boat for good pictures.

You cannot miss this.. This along with Manly Beach might just be the most beautiful place in Sydney or near Sydney. I like the overall vibe at Manly more than Blue Mountains. And the funny thing is that I am not even a 'beach-person'. It is nice to do some cycling, have beers at four pines, shop around or do some whale watching. You have to allocate 1 day to spend at Manly.

Inexpensive Opera House photo-op. Grab the train to Circular Quay, and hop onto this ferry over to Manley. The beach is but a few blocks once you arrive. Use the OPAL card because it has an upper limit and you may get a break on other travel for the day upon return. As you leave Circular Quay, sit outside, at the stern for the best photos of the Opera house and bridge.

Strangely familiar yet still exotic. Taking the ferry across the fabulous Sydney Harbour allows you to get better views than the wealthy sitting on their balconies of their mansions overlooking the water and you don't need to pay $10,000,000+ for the privilege. For someone used to taking the train or driving to work, it is a fun experience to be on a ferry with your family and see people using it as their regular means of transport to and from the city - commuters next to tourists. We were lucky, the water was calm, the air was warm and it was an absolute delight.

Do it on a stormy day !. Nothing quite beats doing the Manly Ferry on a rainy, windy day where the swell is running through Sydney Heads. If there has been Southerly Winds blowing for a fe days then the waves through the Heads can be huge. Make sure you do it - it is so much fun (our young kids love it) !

Take a ride. If you have some time take a ride to Manley on the Ferry as it gives you some great views of the Harbour and there is a nice beach and good eateries at Manly. If you get a combined day ticket to ride all the public transport in Sydney the trip will cost you almost nothing
Great views. Lovely trip to Manly, with all the sights of Sydney harbour. Staff were very friendly and ferry is comfortable.

Lovely way to view the Harbour. Always enjoy the trip across to Manly. Large ferry with a variety of seating in or outdoors. Small shop on board. Short stroll from the ferry to Manly beach via the esplanade. A great trip.
Very comfortable. The ferry was clean and on time. I loved travelling on this vessel. Altho there was quite a lot of people queuing up everyone was seated comfortably

a great way to see Sydney Harbour. we had an amazing sunny Sydney day. We went from Circular Quay to Manly I can just say excellent for any tourist to see. We sat at the back of the ferry which gave us a good view if the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour bridge and of course arriving at Manly such a great place something for everyone there the beach the cafe's etc etc

Slow and Leisurely. The ferry departs on time and given its large seating capacity, it should not have difficulty getting on-board. But suggest to get to the wharves ahead of the departure time so as not to be disappointed.The ferry though passes through the famous Opera House and also the few Bays (Double Bay, Rose Bay, Watson's Bay) in the distance, before reaching Manly. For those who are not in a hurry to do many things at Manly, this is an good option to choose as compared to the Manly Fast Ferry.
Best way to see Sydney Harbour. Great institution when visiting Sydney. Great for showing visitors the wonderful Harbour, the Bridge and the Opera House.

Manly Ferry. The best ferry ride in Syney. You get to enjoy a lot of great sights from historical buildings to views of the houses of the rich and famous. On top of this the trip is very comfortable and there is much to see at either end of the journey

Quick way to reach the beach from Sydney City area. Quick and easy way to get to Manly on the iconic Manly Ferry. Was very busy on the public holiday on the nrl grand final weekend, also the Manly Jazz Festival. Enjoyed seeing the sights as we cruised over to Manly. Very organised moving hundreds of people very quickly.
couples getaway. Great way to get to Manly beach for the day it gives you great views and picture spots along the way.

Lovely way to travel. Take an early morning ferry ride to Manly. Grab an Opal card to make it easy. Ferry runs on a regular basis, but watch the times for weekends and public holidays. Ferry does not sell anything on-board, but you can bring your own food & drink aboard. On Sundays, go early as the ferry gets very busy from mid morning.

Cheap way to see the harbour. A great way to see Sydney Harbour from the water and to pass Kirribilli House and some of the expensive real estate on the way over to Manly. Watch out for 'the heads', which can be choppy at times.
Love Manly & surroundings. .... Nothing like enjoying the feeling of freedom on the ocean whilst on the way to Manly on a beautiful day ☺

Awesome and Cheap!. Taking the iconic Manly Ferry is a wonderful way to travel on the harbour. It is frequent and the service efficient - at least it was the day we took it recently during the school holidays.If you buy an Opal card, the cost of public transport for the day (to travel on the ferries, buses and trains) is capped at $15 for adults and $7.50 for students. Given that the paper ticket cost of a return ferry trip to Manly is just over $14, this represents terrific value and means that public transport for the rest of that day is virtually free!Who would have thought you could cruise around Sydney Harbour all day (if you chose) for a maximum cost of $15. It doesn't get any better than that!
Great ride. Great, convenient service and an excellent way to see some of the Harbour. We took this from Circular Quay to Manley and back in the early evening and thoroughly enjoyed it.

Day trip to Manly. There's no need to book some fancy harbour cruise just make sure it's a nice sunny day, sit outside and enjoy the wonderful views of the harbour on your way to/from Manly. Great scenery.

Best Harbour View in Sydney. Do yourself a favour pay $2.50 or tap on with your Opal card and take the ferry to Manly. The view of the Harbour, the Bridge and the Opera House is outstanding not to mention all the inlets and coves. Relax on the half hour ride and just enjoy the scenery and the fresh air. Sunday morning the queues were insane on our return so be savvy and head over early for breakfast.

Part of the Sydney experience. I love the Manly Ferry trip. It s on a fabulous old ferry with lots of seating options and the views are fantastic. It's worth going there and back with just lunch or coffee in Manly. A good day or half day outing.
Great way to see Manly. This was a fantastic experience. With the extra swell on the day, it was an experience as the ferry listed from side to side as it made it was through the head.

For those photos you wanted.... Since I'm not from a city that has ferries, this was a very nice experience in itself and gave me great views of Sydney. It takes about 30 minutes to reach Manly and is a cheap way to get there. You can catch some great views at sunset if you time it right. The ferry runs about every 30 minutes and is only $2.50 on Sundays....but it's also more crowded then too.

Best friends wedding. Having stopped on Manly Ireland for a few night i needed transport to the main land the ferry was good reliable it had WiFi on board it stopped about midnight, but the cost was included in my city travel pass so any public service, train, bus or ferry. I thought it was great.04/2010
Great way to get to Manly. Pretty good day trip ...,. nice way to get to manly .... great trip there and back. Sit up the front outside :)

A recommended activity when in Sydney. Be sure to be early for ferry departure. We arrived five minutes before launch and they already closed off access. Plenty of seating inside and out. Smooth ride across the harbor. Beautiful views of the Opera House. Plenty to do in Manly - walking trails, shopping, restaurants.

Good Price, Stunning Scenery. Another "must do", even if you don't get off. The harbour is so beautiful that to take the ferry is terrific, the views are worth it. Let the commuters go before you do, it's only fair, you've got all day.If you do stay in Manly for a while, you will be glad, it's a lovely place. There are "Manly Lifeguards" on the beach too!

Lovely Trip to a (Near) Perfect Place. Having grown up having to get a Ferry Across The Mersey to get to my Senior School, I have a deep affection for Ferry Trips. The ferry to Manley, is my joint favourite ferry journey, the other is the journey to Tarronga. It's a lovey trip. You pass by the iconic Opera House affording exemplary photo opportunities. There,s usually an odd war ship to see, and then when the water starts to get choppy, you know your in deep waters and nearing your destination. Superb.
A lovely trip to manly. Reasonably priced , takes about 45 minutes to get to manly I thinkWe sat outside and got great views of the harbour

Amazing views on Sydney !. Ferry from Manly to Central is just an amaxIng way to discover Sydney as it gives you superior views on Opera House, Botanical Garden, Harbour bridge, Neutral Bay ....in combination with a fresh ocean breeze and the nice boats on the water! Must Do !
City visit. A "must do" when in Sydney. A great & cheap way to see the harbour, city & Manly.Avoid weekends as it can get very crowded

Must-do Sydney icon. Every visitor to Sydney should catch the ferry to Manly from Circular Quay - and if it is a nice day, you should sit outside and up at the bow. Some great views to be had of the bridge, the Opera House and much more. And from the bow, not only do you get to see the harbour in all its glory, you get to taste and smell it as well. Go during the week (outside commuter hours) for the most comfortable trip, though if you travel on Sunday and you have an Opal card, you get a big discount from the fare. For Sunday travellers, my advice is to go early as the ferry does get very crowded later in the morning.
Good option to se the opera from different views.. Great option to see the opera from different (nice) views - especially after sunset. Takes you 2 * 20 min to go to Manly and back.

A relaxing way to spend a day. An essential for every visitor to Sydney. These ferries have 'stabilizers' so you wont feel the 'rock and roll' as it crosses the 'Heads' (two rocky outcrops where the swell is strongest. A wonderful experience especially at twilight.Enjoy the best seafood in the world in Manly , the destination at the 'seven miles from Sydney and a thousand miles from care' slogan.
A World Best Boat Ride. A wonderful relaxing way to experience the best harbor in the world. Ferries clean & efficiently run, terminals efficient. Manly a lovely beach very busy at week ends.
Views to die for!. Jump on the green and gold Manly Ferry at Circular Quay and say goodbye to all your worries while you enjoy a coffee just looking at the beautiful harbour.

Must do experience. Great way to see the harbour, natural vistas and experience another Sydney away from the hussle and bussle of the CBD. Little wind and bright sunshine made for a wonderful morning trip.

A beautiful trip accross the best Harbour in the world. Traveling to Manly, we meet a staff member Bob Stanbridge who was so so helpful polite and informative. He went above and beyond his duty to help us. the journey was relaxing and a beautiful day on the harbour made even better by this staff member

Manly ferry to the Opera House!. Great way to travel from the City to Manly and back! Great harbor views too! In Manly there are great shops, cafés, beaches an aquarium. It is well worth a visit. If you are in the Northern Beaches and wish to go into the city or the Opera House this is a great way to go.

Cheap harbour highlights. Great for views of the harbour, the bridge and opera house.
Can be a little rough through the heads, but worth any discomfort.
Efficient service takes approximately half an hour from circular quay.

So lucky to have this in Sydney. Great service, fantastic views of harbour bridge, opera house etc. quite cheap to travel.
Would highly recommend this place to visit.m

Ferry to Manly. The manly is a scenic and inexpensive way to get to Manly beach from Circular Quay. For me this is the best way to get to Manly if not in a hurry. Fast ferry service is also offer by another company which is more expensive.
just okay. we took manly ferry back to circular quay. with rainy day, and rough sea, it was a bit uncomfortable trip. but the ferry has good facilities and offer viewing deck.
Manly ferry, beach. very quick access to Manly and Manly beach, just a short walk from the ferry. Manly beach was very pleasant
Relaxing. When you've walked around museums and shops and the aquarium I suggest you unwind and relaxing on this beautiful ferry ride! Amazing views,a must do!

Great way to see Sydney Harbour at a low cost. I live in Manly, so I take the Manly Ferry regularly. It's such a beautiful ride, and an amazing way to get to work! I've seen both dolphins and whales on the ferry (this is rare and it does happen).If you can grab a seat outside, make sure to do so as you will have great photo opportunities for the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. The ride is 30 minutes and will take you to Manly where there is the spectacular Manly beach and lots of nice cafes and restaurants for any meal of the day.
great sites across the harbour whilst travelling on this ferry. Recommend catching the ferry from circular quay across the harbour to Manly, great views very quick.

Great ferry trip . We went from circular quays to manly on ferry. The views there and back was awesome - a lot of photo opportunities. This is a comfortable way to spend half a day. You can also wonder down to the beach etc. at Manly and spend a whole day if time allows.
Great Views. Great service, great view, easy access to the beach, worth the trip to enjoy the views of Sydney harbour

A little rocky at times. Most people were hurrying to get up the stairs to the top for the best seats and views. We opted to sit down the bottom as it was less noisy. Nevertheless the views were still amazing. Ride over was around 30 mins or so. After about 10 mins refreshments and snacks could be purchased from the small kiosk. I must admit that the ferries do run pretty much spot on time so arrive 10 minutes before departure.

best way to see Sydney bay. This is the thing i do each time i go to sydney - just the perfect way to see all the Sydney iconic places in 20-25min... from the Opear, the bridge, the city skyline, the whole bay, fancy neighborhoods by the water, sailing boats and entrance of the Sydney bay.And just for the price of a normal opal trip

Excellent shopping mall leading down to the beach. Well worth doing! Manly is an excellent shopping mall leading down to the beach with nice pubs and coffee shops along the way. Covered by a multi ferry pass so great value too
Love the Manly Ferry. Love the Manly Ferry trip. Such a great way to beat the traffic and chill out before and after work.

Water view of Sydney Harbour and trip to the coast. What could be more Sydney than a trip on the Manly ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and back, so on a sunny afternoon we jumped a ride to Manly. The ferry was full of a variety of locals, holiday makers and sightseers. The trip down the harbour provided a great chance to see how the city wraps around the harbour and to note the different areas. The ride was smooth and sunny which was just a perfect way to sit back and relax. The crowd on board was cheerful and the was an expectant air of excitement of the beach to come. The ferry are functional without being super comfortable but have toilets. The trip passed quickly and was a rest chance to sit, talk and take photo's. The trip back from Manly to Sydney was wet, as the weather had changed and the ferry was packed as people sort to return home. The weather made for a bumpy ride but nothing to cause concern or (for those who get queasy) sea/motion sick. The ferry area at Circular Quay soon was in sight and day ended. Tickets are easy to purchase at self help machines and if unsure there are assistants around. 95 of the people travelling that day knew how to use the machine and time tables are posted on the walls. TheSyndey terminal could use some modernisation but is functional. From the Manly terminal it is only a short walk to the shops and beach.

A "must do". This is a "must do " for all tourists visiting Sydney - at dusk on a sunny day it is beautiful. Even if you dont spend time in Manly its worth the trip Note : it operates in rough weather

Always a pleasure. The best (and cheapest) way to really see what Sydney Harbour is all about is to take a ferry to Manly. I've done this trip over 20 times and I still get a kick out of seeing the foreshore, the sunshine and the mighty impressive harbor of my hometown.

Must Do. Anyone travelling to Sydney must take the Manly Ferry, such a great way to see a beautiful harbour. No need to take a tour this is the way to do it. It is so relaxing taking in some of the great sights on the harbour not to be missed.

Merriment in Manly. The trip to Manly is worthwhile. We were welcomed by a delicious candy store and then walked to the beach while munching on delicious treats. We bought the most stunning bathing suits at one of the local stores and soaked up the relaxed atmosphere of Manly.

Enjoy a lovely ride to Manly on the ferry.. It is a lovely ride to Manly on the ferry. The ferry passes several little islands on its way to Manly. When you arrive in Manly I suggest you turn right and walk along the coastal path. Stop on one of the many seats an enjoy views of the river and surfers riding the waves.

Manly Ferry. Manly Ferry is a line that leads you to the Manly beach which is worth the visit. the main street is full of little shops and when you go to the beach you'll enjoy the rest of the day by laying and looking around the crowd

amazing view. The view on the Manly ferry is just amazing. Go early to the Manly ferry terminal to get a good seat for the amazing views on the journey back to Sydney Harbour. After this ferry ride you don't need to do a Harbour cruise anymore.

Take the sunday ferry instead of an expensive cruise!. Take this ferry on a Sunday to travel through Sydney Harbour by boat. Way cheaper than any other cruise and a nice way to see Sydneys highlights from the water. Make sure you safe yourself a good spot on the ferry and enjoy this 30 minute ride before exploring Manly!

One of the first things that I highly recommend to my clients when they visit Sydney. One of the first things that I highly recommend to my clients when they visit Sydney is to take the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay as you get a fantastic view of Sydney harbour, our famous bridge and famous opera house, and then get to see one of our beaches as well. Sydney has a large number of beaches, all of them beautiful in their own right, so even though Manly Beach isn't a stunner in comparison to our other beauties like Bondi and Cronulla, it is still close enough and accessible via this ferry that it is worth recommending.

Ferry with a view!. If you're visiting the beautiful city of Sydney & you can spare the time to catch the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly, you will have the opportunity to see the magnificent harbour first hand. Ferries run every half hour but can get very busy at peak times, however, the Manly ferries are the largest so there's never any worry about not getting on. You will see the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, Fort Denison, North & South Head, small harbour beaches & the approach to Manly pier & its beautiful harbour swimming beach, along the way. You can sit inside or outside on two different levels, at the front or rear of the ferry. There is a small kiosk on board & the 1/2 hour trip is just long enough to enjoy a relaxing cup of tea or coffee.The ferry is the perfect way to enjoy the harbour & then the wonderful destinations at either end! If you want to see something magical, take the trip at night & see the city of Sydney shine- magnificient!

Refreshing. My favourite thing to do, too early in the morning after a long international flight to Sydney, is to take the Manly Ferry. Just get a train from the airport to Circular Quay, then buy a ticket (on the slow ferry, not the fast one). Enjoy half an hour of sunshine and sea air on the open deck, then get coffee or eat at one of the many nice fish restaurants in Manly.By the time you get the return ferry, your hotel room will be ready. Plus you will be wide awake and ready to face the rest of the day.

Great views. Why pay for a harbour cruise when for a few dollars you can take the ferry. It's a bit confusing for a tourist but follow the signs, the crowds or ask the staff. It's worth the trouble. Sure the on board wifi doesn't work but the views are breathtaking.

Scenic Trip to Manly - Views of Opera House and Harbor Bridge. The Manly Ferry runs the route from Circular Quay to Manly every thirty minutes and costs less than $15 for a round trip. Though a trip to Manly to visit the beautiful beaches and shops is worth the fare alone, the Manly Ferry also happens to be the harbor ferry that offers the best views of the Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Harbor Bridge. As others have mentioned, a return to Circular Quay around sunset it recommended for great photos of the Opera House and Harbor Bridge.

What can beat the Manly ferry . My parents come over once a year and we always go to Manly. The ferries are great, unless the king tide is up!
A definite part of the manly experience that can't be missed

Great Views. Try and time your ferry back from Manly for sunset, the views as you approach the Harbour Bridge are some of the most beautiful you'll see.
Can be pricey, but pick up an Opel Card, and you can get a return trip for $2.50 on a Sunday.

Manly has beaches!. Use the ferry to have a nice round trip to and from Manly. There's a couple of beaches there. It's like a seaside town with the shops, cafes, and restaurant you'd expect. The smaller beach near where the ferry stops is part of the bay. The longer beach is a little walk through the town. This front has strips of beach, grass, walkway, and road. So, you can rest on the grass if you're not in the mood for a swim. The ferry is usually crowed and there's quite a bit of people herding getting on and off. The trip is quite pleasant and can be part of your plan to get to know the harbour.

great trip on ferry to see Sydney from a distance. This was a great boat trip. Very nice to see Sydney from a distance, especialy on the way back to Sydney from Manly. Not quite cheap, but worth the money. Very confortable boat with enough space to sit inside and outside.

Essential. When you visit Sydney, you need to go to circular quay and catch a ferry to manly. It should be a condition of being allowed to enter the city. It forces you to go to the harbour and see the bridge and opera house. The view you get off both from land is great, but once you go out onto the ferry the views are astounding. Once in manly you grab a meal (preferably fish n chips from ivanhoe hotel) then walk across the corso to the beautiful beach. The entire experience is astounding.

Ferry Lovers Delight. If you love travelling around on ferries then you will love this trip. Can get a bit bumpy at times but great views on the way. Well worth a day out in Manly with loads of nice restaurants with prices to meet all budgets. Very long sandy beach and a great place to either watch or join in with the Surfer's.

Must try when yu are in Sydney. cheap way to explore sydney suburb area... especially manly region... and also good to take photograph of Sydney major landmarks such as the opera house or harbour bridge, from the sea...
A very enjoyable ride.. A beautiful ride with amazing views the whole way. Very reasonably priced and on time. They go quite often so you have no trouble going when you want to.

Manly ferry trip. We took the normal ferry and not the express one, it was a nice ride to Manly while enjoying the beauty of sydney harbour. The trip back from Manly was in the evening and you have another view of Sydney with the opera house lit and the sydney harbour. Manly is a nice place to go for the day!

Great views. My wife and I went on this ferry and it was amazing.So romantic and awesome views.highly recommend this trip to Manly and there is heaps to do in manly too!Nice sitting on the pier area and having a drink on a sunny day while waiting for your ferry to arrive.
Awesome Ferry Ride. Brilliant and Spectacular, Scenic Ride from Circular Quay to Manly by Sydney Ferries. Enjoy this Ride during Spring and Summer.

The Only Way To Travel. Although we live in Sydney we hadn't been to Manly for ages and the ferry ride reminded me that we do live in paradise. The ferry runs every half hour or so and the journey down the harbour takes 30 minutes. The city and harbour views are amazing, (take your camera), the ferry is quiet, the ride generally smooth, although it can be a bit lumpy crossing The Heads, and there are toilets, a cafe and wi fi. Tourists love to ride in the open at the bow and in summer outside is the only place to be, although you will have to be quick getting on to secure a good spot! This is a Sydney experience not to be missed.

Very nice ferry ride. Try taking this 45 minute ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly. At times, depending on the weather and wind conditions, the ride can be a bit bumpy. However, it is very enjoyable to cross the Opera House on the right hand side,enter the mouth of the Sydney Harbour, then taking a left turn towards Manly.

Worth it for sure!. For $15 you can travel the 30 mins to manly and back. The stunning beach is ahead of you when you dock....There are plenty of little shops, coffee shops, pizza shacks and bars. The atmosphere is great and the views from the ferry astounding! Go sunrise or sunset to add that other dimension....far cheaper than any organised harbour cruise!!!!

Get a different view of Sydney Harbour. If you're in Sydney you really need to go across to Manly by Ferry. You get to see a large chunk of the harbour and then to see the slightly faded streets of Manly - which is fun.
Great for tourists. The Manly ferry is of course used to transport people to and from work. It is also however an excellent activity for travellers and kids.

Great views of Sydney. Recommended to go over to Manly Beach. Friends were correct. Journey was so smooth and provided unbelievable views of Sydney skyline, Opera House and bridge. Plenty to do in Manly, as well. Fully recommend.

An iconic trip that showcases the harbour.. A great way to spend a few hours exploring some of the harbour in comfort, with the opportunity to wander through Manly and visit yet another great Sydney beach.

Iconic ferry ride. Every trip to Sydney should include this ferry ride. I've done it many times and the views of the harbour never get old. It's a great way to see a different view of the opera house and experience the harbour. Bring a sweater and get a seat outside for the best views! But even if you don't, the inside is comfortable and you still see a lot.
Wonderful. this was my commute for 5 months. Dolphins and great views of the harbour to be had. The cafe on board was not so great though.

30 minutes ride from Cricular Quay to Manly. We went with friends last November, just for a day outing. We enjoyed the ferry ride which we can see all the nice houses of the rich people near the water. Free wi fi in the ferry is a bonus too. It only takes about 30 minutes across and there are ferries every 30 minutes. Once across the ferry, we walked to the beach and had lunch near the pub. What a good day for outing.

TOPS!!!. Go early, especially on the weekend. A great ride! SYD Harbour is wonderful and the float can get "bumpy" on the way over. Manly is too cool. If you will be in town for a week, buy the ferry/train/bus pass for about $75 as it gives you access to all, even Bondi … train & bus will get you there. If U R going to 1 thing in SYD, do the ferry Manly!!!

traveling from Circular Quay to Manly beach. Wow, loved driving on these ferries. They are affordable and much faster than train when you want to get to some locations. Also, FREE Wifi!!! Truly enjoyable ride.

Nice View to a cool Destination. When you take the Manly Ferry from Sydney Harbor to Manly you are able to see the Harbor Bridge and the Sydney Opera House from a different perspective what is definitely worth it. Furthermore Manly is worth a visit wile in Sydney too.

A good day out.. The ferry to Manly leaves from Circular Quay every half hour and takes a further half hour to reach Manly. It is well worth the journey and at a price of 15 dollars a reasonable price. Manly is a lovely day trip with good shopping, eating places and the famous Manly Beach. A great day out.
Highly recommendable.. Beautiful must-do if you are in Sydney on a sunny day. Beautiful scenery. Levying from trendy Circular Qay to vibrant Manly Beach.

Relax and Enjoy. A trip to Manly on the Ferry is so relaxing as you watch the scenery and harbour traffic go by and rest from the rush and tear of the City life. A great way to enjoy one of the best harbours in the World and at the end of the journey Manly awaits to be explored with it's shops, restaurants, harbour side and ocean side walks.
Manley Ferry. Taking the ferry was a great treat. Such a beautiful trip with the rain and the sun alternating and the water gleaming.
Nice view of the city. This is a very affordable way to see some of the highlights of Sydney, and Manly itself is well worth the trip. Nice beach, bars and restaurants.

Great ferry ride give yous great views of Opera house and bridge. Taking the ferry to Manly is recommended. Manly is a great place to go for the day. There are different stops along the way and to the animal park.

Manly ferry. Great value for money with excellent views of the harbour
Manly beach is a national icon Two ferries are available a faster one and a slower one

a nice way to see Sydney on a budget. An excellent way to see Sydney and its harbour but by a ferry ride to Manly wharf, a short walk to its famous Manly beach or a visit to the Sydney sharks aquarium a must to be visited.they fast 46 minutes each way at a cost of $2.50 with an opal card or at the machine/counter $7.60 oneway $15.20 return the same day. The ferry have different floors with plenty of outside are to enjoy the Sydney views.You can purchase soft drinks, tea or coffee and all sort of snack and sandwiches A trip in Sydney is not a trip without a cruise or ferry ride on its harbour.A fast ferry system is averrable and at different fares pass are not valid on these ferriesrefer to the website for full details

User-friendly and most convenient!. If you use an Opal Card to get around in the city of Sydney, Manly Ferry is one you find most convenient and time saving. We passed by the Sydney Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge to catch great pictures. The ride was comfortable and not very breezy even that we sat on the open deck at the time of early Spring.

Must do for everyone. Do not miss the ferry ride to Manly. Comfortable and relaxing. Spend some time strolling the wide boulevard and window shopping. I would recommend an earlier departure so crowds aren't a concern.

Must Do Sydney Tourist Attraction. Love the Ferry, cheapest ever tour of the Harbour and those views are a photographers dream. Never fail to be impressed with Sydney Harbour and the Manly Ferry is just an icon to be enjoyed by all travellers both Aussies and from overseas.
Manly Ferry trip. Best way to get a taste of Sydney Harbour is to travel by ferry from the city to Manly! Wonderful outing and the trip is worth a lot more than the price of a ticket!

A great sighsteeing trip for $2.50 return on a Sunday with Opal Card. The Manly ferry is one of the best ways to see Sydney Harbour. It rund frequently every day of the week until late. If you are travelling on a Sunday it is worth getting an Opal Card as the maximum you will pay will be $2.50 return. This must be the cheapest sightseeing trip ever.

Very crowded on weekend.. If you can avoid it-don't get there on Sunday, we had to wait for more than half an hour since there were too many people waiting, and not all were allowed on board.The ferry itsel was, of course, croweded as well, once we got to get there.

From history to the present day.. The Manly ferry has an iconic history going back to 1923 when the Scottish built ferries were sailed to Australia to provide a transport service between the city and Manly. Into the war, on to the 50's and 60's and beyond, these same ferries transported commuters to and from their work and homes. Rolling across the swells that came through 'the heads' of Sydney Harbour, nobody was late for work thanks to these marine workhorses. Of late they are more anonymous in their design but still give commuters an ocean cruise at the start and finish of their working day. For a tourist, the Manly Ferry unfurls the beauty of Sydney harbour as surely as the first sailors and settlers must have seen in 1788.

A trip around the bay. We wanted to try the ferries to get to some of the nearby resorts. The ferries were were very frequent and kept to the timetable. It was easy to figure out which of the ferries you needed for your destination, all well laid out. As we approached Manly the tannoy suddenly announced a whale sighting and told everyone where to look.The ferries were clean and tidy with plenty of room, the docking was very smooth. Definitely would recommend a trip to distant shores on these ferries.
Perfect . Where else can you pay just $15 to enjoy a trip with such spectacular views as the return ferry to Manly? It doesn't matter if you're a local or visitor, it never gets tiring

Best ferry ride :). Loving the ferry ride from CQ to Manly onboard the Manly Ferry - provided it is not on a weekend -when it can be very very busy- having to miss out on a ferry because of lack of room is not uncommon on a summer weekend - plan ahead those days.

Memories.. I was born in manly so the manly ferry is one of my fondest childhood memories, I loved it then and I love it now, just the way they are. I now love taking my kids on the manly ferry, great experience.

Beautiful views and Manly is a fun place. Go to the Circular Quay No. 6 to take the ferry to Manly. A person can enjoy the fresh air or sit inside for the 30 minute scenic ride to Manly. The view of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House are phenomenal. Manly is a quaint area with interesting shops, brewery, beaches and the best Mexican restaurant, Chica Bonita. It is a bit hard to find but don't give up because you will be treated to the best margaritas, food and friendly service.

Such good fun. The Manly ferry is such a must-to-do for Aussies and well asall international travellers. The ferry leaves from the iconicSydney Harbour - pass the Opera House - pass the famousSydney harbour bridge - cruise over to Manly - about 20 minride. Crossing the harbour on a ferry is priceless. The returntrip is even better as you come back you are totally facingthe Opera house and the bridge. Priceless.

Why pay for a cruise boat?. The Manly ferry is an institution in Sydney. It makes me wonder why so many tourists pay to go on cruise boats; just ride the ferry. Cruise around the harbour, sit inside or out and take all the happy snaps you like with phone or camera. The ride is just long enough about 25-30 mins, then stroll around Manly and see the surf beach and/or bay beach. If you feel like a walk go to Fairy Bower from Manly surf beach or take in the aquarium on the far side of the bay beach. Then take the ferry back and sit on the opposite side. I do it every time I go to Sydney.

Quick trip, but a little rough . The ferry is about 30 minutes from Circular Quay to Manly (one way). The boat is clean and the crew are friendly. Only negative is that it can get choppy near the headlands. So if you get seasick I would recommend you take sometime before travelling

Great and economical way to travel. we just had a fantastic voyage over to Manly, the Ferry was very comfortable, with outdoor seating (limited) and a small canteen if you require a coffee. the trip over to Manly took 30 min, the seas were fairly calm which made for an enjoyable ride over

Excellent. The manly ferry is great takes you from Manly to the city in around 30 mins - You pass lots of the famous Sydney sights and it is great coming in past the opera house.Not very expensive and so easy!

Is there anything as relaxing as a boat ride. On a sunny day it is hard to think of anything better than a ride on the Manly ferry across beautiful Sydney harbour. Sit on the outside and take in the sunshine and sea air, and check out all those places you could live in (if only your lottery ticket would come in). Worth it just for the ride but the bonus is strolling around Manly beach or shops for as long as you feel like before your return trip. Maybe some fish and chips on the sand ...
great beach. Took this ferry to manly beach a few times and its such a great little spot with really good restaurants.

Excellent transport & tourist attraction. Manly Ferry is an easy and wonderful way to travel while we stayed in manly for a long weekend, the Manly ferry travels frequently and affordable It's a tourist attraction in itself with great view of Sydney harbour.

Great view on the way out. Lovely view of the harbour on the way out, great selection of bars and restaurants and reasonable prices. Can't comment on the beach as we went for a sunset view of the harbour!

See the most beautiful Harbour in the world by ferry. Anyone can afford to see Sydney by boat, just jump on a ferry. It gives you another prospective of just how beautiful Sydney Harbour is. After all it is the most beautiful Harbour in the world. Enjoy

There is Sunny in Manly only!. Every times on the Ferry, from or to Manly, you are always forced to be given the bright sunny energy.The Opera House is greeting you with kisses and the harbour view....then the Manly beach relaxing you into haven. What a luckiest dream keeps on getting- so get on the Manly Ferry now! with your friends, your family...and the kids- there is the Manly Aquarium for them too!But you must be too busy to talk right now of having the best fish & chip...

As the Manly Ferry cuts it way to Circular Quay. I always do this when I go to Sydney, catch the Ferry to Manly, get fish and chips, have a look at the markets, go walk along the beach, it is the easiest beach to get to from Sydney, and you have a relaxing mini cruise on the way there. Just a word of warning, going past "the heads" (with is the opening to the deep wide sea) it can get a little rocky, but it doesn't last long and makes the trip more exciting.Also seeing the yachts, the small islands on your trip makes the trip. Life be a mongst it.

Manly Ferry is more than just Public Transport. The Manly Ferry is usually used for public transport between Manly and the City of Sydney CBD however, it is an excellent way to view the harbour and its splendid coast lines.

Showing off the Harbour on a budget. Perfect for families as these ferries are public transport, therefore cost friendly and run regularly, no need to book just show up at the wharf at Circular Quay. Spend the day in beautiful Manly on the harbour as well boasts a beautiful, pine boardered safe beach along with National Park walks around Quarantine Station. Upon your return trip you are treated to the best views of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge in town. :-) Not to be missed if you're visiting Sydney town.

Brilliant and cheap! Why go on an expensive cruise?. Brilliant experience of Sydney and the harbour for a normal commuting ticket price. You do not need to take some expensive cruise. Just take the Manly ferry, especially at dusk. The view of the city CBD, the opera, the bridge, will be awesome. Then have a coffee or dinner in Manly, preferably on the beach side. Return by ferry to Circular Quay and enjoy the view of the items above at night. Awesome!

Best if the bunch. Thus really is the way to see the whole of the harbour plus you get to see manly as well. A world away from sydney manly is such a dream to visit anyway. Quite reasonable the derry is $15 return for an adult. Plus you get to see all the little niches and spots in the harbour as the manly ferry goes the furthest. Take a late ferry back and take a photo of the Sydney Harbour Bridge with the sun going down through it as a bonus.

The easiest and cheapest way to get the best views of the Opera House. At peak time ferries leave every 15 mins or so so you can just turn up and buy a ticket without much of a wait. Outside seating can get quite busy with tourists so grab a spot quickly. This is the best way to get great pics of the opera house without hiring a boat and the ferry runs really late so you can get nighttime ones too. You can obviously also see the Harbour Bridge from it too. Free wifi on board so you can snapchat or instagra your pics instantly!

Great deal on Sunday. It's the ferry to take if you want to see the Sydney Harbor. It's only $2.50 on Sunday. Manly is a great town to walk around, get some food, catch a wave, etc. Highly recommended.

LOVED IT. We traveled on the manly ferry and we loved it nice rough weather made for a fun trip over. Very well priced we paid 32 return for both of us which is very fair i think considering adelaide public transportation is so expensive this is a MUST DO just the views u get from being the the ferry are worth every cent and make sure u either sit at the front or the back and definitely not inside to experience everything around you

Every trip to Sydney needs a ride on the Manly Ferry. Every time we go to Sydney it is a must to go to Manly. We make the trip may be twice a year. On the ferry late morning, lunch from the Corso which is eaten on the beach front, a cup of coffee and an icecream and back on the ferry. The only problem is pesky gulls which will fly in and take the food out of your hands. Love, love the Manly Ferry.
Great ferry trip, not to be missed.. One of the best Ferry trips. If you haven't been on the ferry before is suggest taking your first trip from Manly to the City after dark.

A must for tourists. The ride to and from Manly on the classic old ferries is an amazing way to experience the greatest harbour in the world. Watching the city, suburbs and other water craft go by is wonderful and if you can sit outside on a nice day even better. Be wary of the splash zone at the front of the ferry when passing the "Heads", my daughter and I got drenched, but laughed about our experience. A fabulous way to see the sights such as the Habour Bridge and Opera House! $2:50 return on Sunday...bargain!

The low-cost alternative harbour tour. When we're in Sydney we almost always take a ferry trip out to manly. It's a great way to see the harbour and Manly beach (walk through the mall to the other side) is a pretty good beach. Line up early for these ferries that leave every 30 minutes and try and get one of the small number of deck seats - great views to be had.

Cheap way to see the harbour.. Loved going over too Manly on the ferry. Seeing the harbour from the water is the best. Nothing much to say about the actual boat it's not fancy but it's good to go. Found out too late but would take the ft ferry back and it's the same cost.

Easy way to travel. This was an easy way to travel from Manly.Tickets were easily purchased from the machines about $22 for three adults - so a reasonable price.The ferry was clean and spacious.It was a little choppy at the start but nothing you cant deal with for a 26 minute trip.The views from the ferry are beautiful - Much better than travelling by taxi.

Great way to see the harbour . It's great that you can jump on a public ferry, see the habour, get up close to the bridge and opera house and go all the way to Manly for a total of $15 return. I don't understand why anyone would bother with the ferry tours in the harbour when public transport is offering this. It was a great way to spend the afternoon.

Great ride, beautiful view of downtown Sydney.. Nice ride, convenient, fast, clean, and free wifi on board. The ride from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf costs AUS $15.00 round trip, which is totally worth it especially the views of the Opera House, downtown Sydney are incredible. Sunset scenery is also beautiful!If you buy Opal Card, round trip to and from Manly already qualifies you for free public transportation for the rest of the day, whether buses, trains, or other ferry, which is a good deal.
Great. Always on time. Clean and good staff onboard. A pleasure to travel on. And I will do so tomorrow to.probably.

city to beach in half an hour. great ferry, with toilets and a cafe on board, it did get a bit rocky in the afternoon on the way back, and an announcement came over to warn people the swell could come over, but they still stood there and got wet!!
Sydneysiders favourite day out. Use your opal card and take the ferry from quay 3. It runs every half hour. Great views of the Opera House and Bridge.

If you have more than a couple days, a trip out to Manly should be on your to-do list.. Great views. I can't imagine the Manly fastferry is any better than this one and the price certainly can't be beat.

A great way to visit Manley from Sydney.. A very relaxing and fun ferry ride to Manley. Some trips are at 'no charge'. Perhaps a 30 minute ride, spend a few hours in Manley, visit the town or relax on the beach. Then catch another ferry back to Sydney.

If you only have a short time in Sydney, please spend a few hours and take the ferry to Manly. If you only have a short time in Sydney, please spend a few hours and take the ferry to Manly. It's a trip through a good part of the harbour and great value when you sit up front on a windy day

A great way to travel and see parts of Sydney.. This is an economical and enjoyable way to travel to Manly. Being on the ferry is an experience in itself, and I feel that people who have to use this mode of transport are very blessed. Would be a nice way to relax after work. Aside from that, our one had a great wee cafeteria with awesome sausage rolls and a very friendly attendant. Worth mentioning is the efficiency of the ferry as well, they stick to schedule which is great.
Great ferry services. cheap transportation for local and tourist. With view of harbour to throw in, excellent way to see Sydney

Quick and easy trip. Easy to purchase tickets with tge automatic machine and boarding was hassle free . Takes approximately 26 minutes to complete the trip The ferry is cleanI did feel a bit sea sick as it rocked but it was all ok.
One of the worlds best commutes ?. This commute would almost make it worth being a wage slave again ! On a sunny Sydney day, this ferry trip is a great day out for visitors

Inside or outside Manly Ferry is a must. What can you say that has not been said before. Even as a local I love taking the Manly Ferry for the trip.
