It really is the best if not the cheapest way to see the outer part of the harbour go by. When you get to Manly, there is of course the beach and loads of wonderful cafe's and restaurants. If visiting Sydney then the Manly Ferry has to be on the list of things to do.

Sunset Trip to Manly. We took the Manly Ferry late afternoon to attend a function in Manly. With the sun setting, it was the perfect time to take Harbour photos from locations not available on the shoreline.

Great way to spend an eevning. Great way to spend an evening.we took the ferry to manly and had drinks and dinenr there. Was a great way to get away from sydney and you get some stunning views of the harbour bridge and sydney opera house. a definite must do to relax and chill. .

A leisurely ferry and walk around Manly. My daughter and I took this 30 minute ride from Circular Quay to Manly beach and sat outside on the deck since it was a sunny blue sky winter day. It had been about 30 years since I was last at Manly, so it was interesting to see the changes since then. The mall with little restaurants, cafes and shops gave it a modern feel. A half-hour walk around the paved walkway along the side of the hill was very pleasant and gave a wonderful scenic view of the northern beaches. It was also enjoyable to see kids hopping on the seaside rocks. An hour was plenty to see around the Manly area and the return ferries every 30 minutes was conveniently timed for return trip to the Circular Quay.

Cheapest Harbour Cruise Available . The ferry to manly is one of the best ways to view Sydney Harbour and great value. I recommend it to all my visiting friends as a shorter and far cheaper option than the standard harbour cruises. Hint: take a late afternoon cruise and enjoy dinner at one of the great beach side restaurants in Manly and do a night cruise on the way back to Circular Quay.
Harbour Crossing. Regular service from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf, about 30 minutes. Food and drink on board, plenty of room inboard on on the upper deck.
Lovely.. It is a good way to see the harbours and meet the locals. Many cafes and shops at Manly and do the walk down to the beach.
Simply the best way to go to Manly. What a wonderful way to travel across the Sydney Bay and indulging in the fresh breeze rather than being stuck in traffic...
Very easy to navigate. Quick and easy way to get to Manly! I enjoyed the view as it travelled around the harbour. It was a new experince for me. Easy to buy tickets, quick wait times.

A different perspective on Sydney. At just over $15 return ($5 if you have an Opal card) the 30 minute ferry trip to Manly is a good way to see Sydney from a different perspective. Ferries are busy but run every 30 mins. The beach at Manly is a 5 minute walk from the terminal. Lots of bars, restaurants and holiday shopping.
Scenic views. Enjoyed travelling by ferry to Manly. Our visitors got some great photos and scenic views of the city and sites.

MUST DO!. I almost took a job in Sydney just so i could travel to work via ferry through Sydney Harbour! Manly is a MUST SEE with some of the finest bars, restaurants and Cafe's in Sydney. I lived here for over 3 years and its one of my fave spot in Australia!
free ride due to opal card. loved the ride on the ferry.luckily the weather was awesome so we sat in front and we were lucky it was free as we had purchased the opal cards.the view was great
Great cruise of the Harbour. The cruise to Manly is a great way to take photos along the Harbour including the Bridge and the Opera House. The crossing takes 30 minutes.
Nice ride. For $17 round trip you can go from Sidney Harbor to Manly. Refreshments on board are available and in my case, we had entertainment on board. Please use this transportation.

Enjoy every minute of the ride. This is a 30 min ride from Sydney to Manly Beach, and you will enjoy every minute of it! You get to see Sydney's Iconic building from different angles and shades. Feel the wind on your face and take in every beautiful sight.
Ferry trip to Manly. A great trip on the ferry to Manly, so much better than the road trip, relaxing and intereting, a lovely long ride and a great view of the Sydney waterways

"Sydneys friendly ferry service". An experience for the whole family to enjoy. Sit back and relax and enjoy all that the harbour has to offer, great views on the water of the iconic Sydney Harbour bridge and the beautiful Opera house. A fun, family trip to Taronga Zoo was a delight for the kids.We used this service many times while in Sydney and were particularly happy when advised to use this option as an alternative to the hour drive to the netball championships, a ferry ride and a short bus trip got us to the game without the stress of the Sydney traffic or the huge cost of a cab.A big thank to the ticketing staff for your friendly, heplful advice.Keep up the great work guys.
Lovely sunsets. Such a nice way to see the harbour and visit Manley. Great sun sets, so worth travelling at dust. But a one day travel card, as the ferries are free.

A must do in Sydney!. Please, do not miss the Manly Ferry. This is the number one thing to do in Sydney. The Ferry ride to Manly will give you spectacular views of the Opera House. If you're leaving during day and returning during night, then you'll get nice night views of the Opera House as well. In Manly awaits the nicest beach in Sydney... Manly Beach! Once you've visited Manly Beach you'll start asking yourself why you did bother to take that bussride to Bodi Beach in the first place... Manly itself is a nice suburb with a beautiful esplanade with nice restaurants and small boutiques.

Exciting trip from Circular Quay and Manly...rough seas added to the adventure.. Traveling on the Manly Ferry give one a great overview of Sydney's great harbour and at the same time is a grand ride especially if there is a Pacific swell coming through the heads. A definite must for anyone to really get the flavour of Sydney Harbour.

Might be your best outing while in Sydney!. Just do it! The best experience you will have while in Sydney. I live here! You will see the best views of Sydney harbour. The ferry is about a 30 minute trip from Circular Quay where the Ferries depart, to Manly. Arguably one of the best beaches in Sydney too. Lots of food outlets at Manly. Toilets on board Ferry. Take your camera, take your sunscreen or you can burn your skin. Take a hat & water! The Ferry can be very full so check the timetable and line up early to get a good seat. Outdoor seating and indoor seating is available. Just divine.Have a fantastic day out.
Makes Sydney unique. Nothing speaks of old school Sydney like the Manly ferry.. Think James Reyne.. Have used this so many times;never miss a trip across the Harbour. Please don't modernise.

7 miles from Sydney and a thousand miles from care.. The trip over to Manly on the ferry is well worthwhile, with wonderful sights as you travel along with great photo chances. A short walk along the Corso brings you to Manly Beach a great surfing beach or paddle and walk along the sands, Sundays can get a bit crowed on the ferry.Visitors can travel around Sydney by public transport without a great deal of expense by using Multi fare tickets during the week, this ticket is valid for all adult member and one child, all must hold a valid ticket, other children under 16 are free .On Sundays there is a family fun day ticket for all members of the family with children under 3 free. The above are valid for all government services, Rail, Ferry, Buses and light rail on Sundays.Another good trip is sydney to Bondi by Bus, Watsons Bay by Bus, Circular Quay by Ferry across the Harbour, Bus , Train to your hotel or home
Great fun. Great fun and good value. We had a lovely day out in Manly. The ferries are a great way to travel. Have an icebreaker from the gelato stand in the ferry hall. Yummy
Nice long ride to Manly.. For an awesome view of the Circular Quay sit facing the quay even though you will travel in reverse direction but its worth for the view of the harbour.

The perfect ferry trip.. The Manly ferry is the perfect way to get to Manly from downtown Sydney--a scenic cruise in a charming old ferry that runs right on time and gets you into the thick of Manly harbor in just 30 minutes. No parking worries, reasonable price, runs often throughout the day (did I mention, Right On Time!), and sets you down on the edge of the Corso, just a few minutes walk from beautiful Manly Beach. And then it takes you back when you are ready. It's perfect!
Take the ferry on Sunday. If you go there on Sunday, the ferry is free of charge. On the way to and back, you will see the Opera House. Fun and economical sight seeing route!

Loved it, a must do! . A budget friendly alternative to an hour in the car! We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and loved it. Great views of Sydney and the harbour and it was nice to feel the ocean wind in your face. And, we didn't get wet or fall overboard, bonus!A tourist attraction we would do again and again just for the ride and the views!

A ferry ride to Manly a must in Sydney. One of the must do things when you come to Sydney.....ride the Manly Ferry....it us typical public transport bug the view of the harbour will wipe out the view of the ferry....it is just a means of transport
Another great Sydney ferry ride!. Like the other ferries this is fast, regular, convenient, efficient and well run! Recommended to get around the great bays and harbour areas around Sydney!
Take the ferry to Manly. A great way to travel and so easy to get to Manly. You will also get some good photo opportunities of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge.

what an excellent service and cheap way to see Sydney harbour views. We had a combined ticket for tube/bus/ferry - so the trip to Manly was really cheap considering the excellent views and then the loveliness of Manly itself with its beautiful beach.
Beautiful views. It is a great transport option between the Northern Beaches and the city. You enjoy great views on the way from a comfortable seat.

The cheapest and best way to see Sydney Harbour. The Manly ferry has great views of the bridge and opera house, and all of the features of Sydney harbour from Circular Quay to the Heads. Get a good view by getting on early and making your way upstairs. If leaving Circular Quay, the best views are from the back of the boat (note the boat has two front ends, and travels in the direction it is pointing at the quay). I travelled on a Sunday, with a Seniors Card, and it only cost $2.50 return!

Enjoy your beach envirment in Manly !. You can travel to Manly by car or by ferry . If you travel by ferry which you can travel from Circular Quay which is near the Opera House. If you are visitors I advice you to take a ferry . And you can enjoyed the Sydney Harbour scenery . It take approx. half an hour . After you arrive Manly ferry , you can walk through to the shopping centre and to the Manly Beach .Only take you 10 to 15 minutes to the beach . There are restaurants along the Manly Beach . Italians Restaurant ,Thai Restaurants , Aussie Fish and Chips , Pizza , Chinese Restaurants . You can find lovely T shirts or swim wears there in the shops . Lovely design !

See the best views of Sydney.. This is the ferry. The ferry takes about 30 minutes to go from Circular Quay to Manly. For the first ten minutes of the journey, individuals get amazing views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House day or night. You can get inside or outside seats.

Relaxing ride. Great view of the harbour bridge + opera house + the city skyline from the ferry. Recommended to catch the ferry close to sunset!Tip: if you are using an opal card, plan your itinerary such that your Manly beach trip is later in the week. Take >8 trips during the week and your ferry ride will be free of charge :)!
Budget River Cruise. Manly Ferry is good for budget traveller going to Manly and Manly Beach. You can view The Sydney Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Harbour Area, Royal Botanic Gardens and Sydney.

Views. It's all about the views.
Sit at the back on the way to Manly. Sit at the front on the back. You'll get some great photos, if it's not raining.

The Best and Still The Cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour. As my Title says! you simply cannot see more of the Harbour and its Icon's any cheaper or on a bigger ship than one of the many "Manly" ferries. They sell on board drinks and snacks-they have ample indoor and out door seating and lots of room for great Photo opportunities, and for $12. for a return trip! its such a bargain. you can get off at Manly? or Simply go back and forth

Great service with fabulous views of the bridge and Opera House. We used this service a couple of times it takes around 30 mins to get to Manly. We originally went to the wrong wharf as we thought the boat went from the same wharf where we bought the tickets the ferry goes from wharf 5. Tip sit either at the front or the back of the ferry to get the best views.
Manly. Great for a cruise in the harbour,grab a ferry to manly,and you can also stop at other stops and get on and off as you please to visit,or just sit and relax and enjoy the ride

Sydney harbour sight seeing. by travelling to manly you can see sydney harbour very cheaply. and return when suits you. we came back in the dark to view sydney and the opera house illuminated. By buying a opal travel card travel for the day never costs more than 15 bucks for adults and half that for kids. execellent day out.

A 35 minute Harbour tour with a gem at the end. The Manly ferry is a great way to see beautiful Sydney Harbour at a very reasonable price. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay. If it's a nice day, opt for a seat outside, at catch the stunning harbour views on this 35 minute ride. But it doesn't end there. When you arrive at Manly, exit the wharf and take a walk along the Corso, past great shops, to the surf beach. Don't forget to try Fish & Chips at the fish shop near the surf end of the Corso. The surf beach is patrolled from October though to April, or if you prefer things a little calmer, there is a swimming enclosure in the harbour, by the Ferry wharf.On the way back to Circular Quay, make sure you sit on the other side of the ferry to make sure you see all the views.Makes for a great day out !

Manly a great trip , and not costing a fortune. Great trip can go for a few hours or make a day of it, in the summer take your swimmers for a great experience at manly ,,the ferry drops you at the wharf , walk through the shopping centre to the Manly Beach , take a walk to Fairy Bower south of the beach fantastic views , you won't be disappointed
Beautiful Scenic trip. Via Ferry. Manly ferry really is a great quick trip across to the CBD Sydney. Beautiful scenery, food and amenities on board. Easy for those who need ramp assistance.
Beautiful Views. We used the Manly Ferry to get to Manly Beach and do the Manly to Spit bridge walk. Such a quick ride and funny way to get there.
Great service. A great service on the ferry to Manly. Very quick! Manly is well worth a visit. Easy to purchase tickets and the ferry is every half hour.

Ferry ride. A great way to see the Sydney Habour. The ride is inexpensive and you get great views of the Coast line. From Circular Quay there is much to do and you can catch a train or bus from the Quay.

Good basic transportation with a view. While it isn't actually a tourist destination, the ferries are a cheap and reliable way to get to where you want to go in the area. They are comfy but a bit slower than a taxi, but the cost savings can be huge.
Manley Ferries. Excellent ferry service to Manley - Clean and completely efficient service - The 40 minute trip is great and Manley is a real Victorian style treat. Go to The Pantry - it's good !

Great way to see the harbor and visit Manly. The ferry to Manly was easy, convenient, and a great way to catch stunning views of the Sydney Harbor. We opted to purchase Opal cards (highly recommended if you're trying to get around the city using public transport), and with the $15/day limit, we took two ferries and four busses for really cheap!

Loved It!. We were going to Manly for the day anyway, but it really is worth the trip alone as it is such a pleasant journey. The views of the Harbour are spectacular - we took loads of wonderful photos of the Bridge and the Opera House.

Convenient and Comfortable. Manly ferry is great, having firm schedule, very clean indoor atmosphere. We can buy snack, drink from the well service cafe. My family and I can really enjoy out trip to Manly - Manly Ferry always go for excellence. Cheers Budi Soegianto - Jakarta Indonesia

VALUE!. Imagine pay $ 5 and get a tour In front of Opera House by the sea, after enjoy an stunning view of Modern Sydney only 10 min after your departure from Circular Quey . You feel that everybody is happy in the ferry. You will tell yourself why ....

Do not skip doing this!. For about the price of 3 flat whites you get an excellent tour of the harbour, stunning views of the city line and free wifi!
Great photo opportunities of the Opera House and the Bridge.
Once in Manly I walked around and made my way to the beach. Lots of shops etc
Round trip takes 1 hr.

convenient way to get to Manly. The Manpy ferry is a great way to get to Manly. The scenery of the Sydney harbor and the heads is spectacular. On the day I went, the ferry slowed so we could see a whale.

Beautiful harbour at budget prices. Never mind expensive harbour cruises,the manly ferry from circular quay is a great trip at a great price,especially on your opal card on Sundays ,all day travel $2.50. Take in our beautiful harbour and sights,harbour bridge,opera house,fort Denison kirribilli house past sydney heads to manly and a short walk through the middle of manly to a beautiful beach and fine restaurants.
Manly Ferry. A must do for travellers, holidaymakers, and even locals. It is a bit of a institution, catching the Manly ferry for dinner or to visit the beach in summer. A great experience.

Ferry ride to Manly Beach. Great way to see Sydney. Take Sydney Ferries from Circular Quay across to Manly and enjoy the beautiful water views. Fabulous photo opportunities of our famous landmarks, Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Luna Park, Fort Denison, Sydney Harbour. Walk down the Corso with lots of souvenir shops to fabulous Manly Beach. Choose one of the waterfront restaurant and cafes or grab a subway, Hungry Jacks or Fish & Chips and sit by the beach to eat. Warning - don't feed the seagulls, you will have hundreds flocking around you and they can be cheeky! If you're on a budget buy grab some lunch and ice creams from Coles which you walk by on the way to the beach.

Awesome view... Going to manly wharf, you will feast your eyes with wonderful view of the opera house from the sea side. And also harbouring naval vessels..AWESOME.NOTE: bring your windbreaker on winter.

Not only for tourists. One of the better ways to travel the Sydney Habour. Everyone needs to do the trip to Manly. I live in Sydney and have a day outing often on the Manly ferry. Most definitely a must for every visitor to Sydney.

Easy, nice views, good price . Good way to get from A to B at a good price and have some great views along the way. Go at sunrise/ sunset - really nice. Staff are friendly and tickets easy to purchase. On board food and drinks for sale if wanted and I liked the fact you can sit inside or outside.

Motoring along. A perfect way to enjoy Sydney harbour and at a very reasonable cost. The ferry's can be busy at peak commuting times but overall you can always find a space. It's easy to navigate which ferry you need from the main terminal. They run late into the night so there is always an opportunity to use them.

Easy way to see the harbour and then have a walk on the beach and a coffee at the far end. Just a simple and cheap way to see the Harbour. We walked along the beach for a hour at the far end. Fluked seeing a humpback whale which was amazing but think is very rare.

wonderful view of habour. Fun bumpy ride in evening. If you have an opal card take the ferry on Sundays for all rides (bus, trains and ferry) at only $2.50 throughout the day. We took ferry to Manly, get real windy at times so make sure you hold on to your hats and caps cos mine flew off into the sea! Luckily able to retrieve it back when cap washed to shore :)Great relaxing way to see the habour and picture taking for everyone. Evening rides can get bumpy almost like a roller coaster ride with high waves. Great ride for the adventurous ones at front of ferry but not for the faint hearted! Be sure safety first and always grab on tight when high waves come! Will definitely take the ferry again.

Magnificent views of the Harbour and Bridge. A return Ferry ride to Manly is always a great trip. Not only do you get fantastic views of the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge but you get to see the waterfront from Sydney past the Sydney Heads (the opening of the Harbour to the Pacific Ocean) and then onto Manly. Only proviso is if you get seasick be careful if it is rough weather. Passing the Heads can sometimes be a bit rough. Generally however the water is smooth and it is a great trip.
Nostalgic. Great nostalgic trip to Manly via the old Manly Ferry. This is a must do for all, especially Australian Crawl fans!

well worth it. What a great way to go to Manly Beach. Saturday we went there was a market there too. Stand at the front of the ferry going there and back so you get a good view of the harbour and coming back a great view of opera house and bridge.

Spectacular simple inexpensive best Sydney attraction!. My title says it al !
Spectacular simple inexpensive best Sydney attraction!
Nothing more beautiful than experiencing the majesty of dawn on Sydney Harbour !

Fast Ferry - friendly service . Quick but enjoyable trip to Manly with magnificent views of Sydney Harbour. We took the fast ferry, it was our first trip to Manly however next time I would take the slow Ferry to take in the view. Only in Sydney for the weekend so a bit short in time.

Bit of excitement. Fabulous and inexpensive way to see the city, the harbour and Manly. It is a large ferry so there is an air of excitement about crossing the harbour on it, particularly when crossing the heads which can get a bit choppy. The views of the harbour, its activities and its foreshores are lovely and a stroll around Manly and its beaches relaxing. Make sure to walk around to Shelly Beach which is not only a lovely walk along the foreshore, but a gorgeous little beach cove with a great view back to Manly. Manly itself can a bit overcrowded in summer but if you head straight for the beach or one of its walks you can escape the crowds. It can all be done at leisure with easy access.
A great trip out. Manly is terrific and this was such a nice cruise - Manly is stylish and has a lovely foreshore and vista - the trip is part of the transport system, which is easy to use.

A Must Do Experience. If you are only in Sydney for a couple of days, put this on your list. There are fast ferries that will get you there if you're in a hurry, but the big, slow ferry is the best option, especially in the warmer months (Oct - May) when you can sit outside and take in the harbour. A return trip is less than $20 and a great way to get your bearings of the city. On the way to Manly, North Shore is on your left, the Eastern Suburbs (like Bondi) are on your right. There is a shop on board for refreshments and on weekends, this ferry is packed, so be there 15 mins before departure to be sure to get a good seat.
Worth the try. The 20minutes ferry travel from circular quay to manly itself is worth your time, magnificent view of the opera house and harbour bridge. A must when in Sydney.
Great trip.. Lovely way to visit Manly beach and town. Friendly and polite staff. Great views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.

Great ride with great harbor views.. A great way to explore across sydney. If you are not staying in the northern beaches then I HIGHLY recommend a trip on the Manly Ferry to get to the other side of the harbor. The Ferry itself is fairly cheap and provides great views of the harbor as you go through it. I even saw dolphins and another boat saw a whale on their journey across! It takes 20 minutes but is worth it. I prefer Manly to some of the other Sydney beaches such as Bondi as it has a more local feel and is way less tacky. The views are stunning and there are plenty of good restaurants to grab a meal or a drink as you wander around.

Easy, cheap and on time. A great way to spend a day. Jump on the ferry $7.50 each way sit back with a cup of coffee and watch as you travel across the most beautiful Harbour in Australia. Arrive at manly go for a swim, walk along the beach or the trails to North Head, grab lunch at a cafe all whilst being dry and safe. Superb!
Great harbour views! . Undoubtedly the best and cheapest way to see the harbour. Breathtaking views of the bridge, opera house and city skyline as well as Fort Denison and Garden island.

Great Ride!. A nice way to see the city and Manly, the ferry its a convenient and cheap way of enjoying the harbor and the bay. A great ride, its also a fresh way to relax after a heavy day in the city. We love Manly and part of that was the ride to it!

Great Harbour Trip. We took the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay on a busy Sunday. The ferry was filled but we were able to get seating which was comfortable. We used our prepurchased and loaded Opal Cards which are easy to use and great if you are planning to use public transit in Sydney. The ferry departures were punctual. Of course, a highlight was seeing the fabulously busy Sydney Harbour up close and personal! A great way to get to Manly!
Yay for ferries. I just love the ferries and the opal card makes it so much more fun being able to travel all over Sydney

Refreshing and fastest way to reach manly. fastest way to reach great Manly beach from Circular quay. Also this ferry may surprise you with a water shower if you are sitting at open front end and water is not calm.
Brilliant way to see Sydney. I had done this years ago and it disappoint now. Great views especially heading back from Manly. Great value for money as its public transport

Want a great view of the Harbour? Try this!. One of the many ways you'll get a view from the harbour, though the only way to get this close to the bridge (other than crossing it). I'd recommend taking the Ferry during the week, on a day that isn't windy. Strong winds combined with an overcrowded boat does not make a pleasant ride. Could be a little fairer with pricing but overall a decent experience.

A bucolic ride!. This is a must do! Even if you don't use other ferries, the famous manly ferry gives you an excellent taste of the Sydney huge and beautiful harbour, it's witness and sunlight. Get to Manly, step out and visit the site, and get back on board for a fantastic view of the city skyline, the bridge and the opera as you re enter the harbour.

Fantastic, and better than advertised. Told to take ferry to Manly as most convenient, easiest way to get there. Then as promised...had a perfectly scenic trip through the harbor and out towards the sea for the price of a ferry ticket. Awesome!Ride was very comfortable with great options for inside or outside seating based on your preference. Trip is a decent amount of time to really enjoy the ride and the scenery. But still a relatively quick trip that puts you at/returns you from Manly with no real loss of time.Highly enjoyed and even more so recommended.

Manly ferrys. From circular quay we took the Manly ferry which took around 35 min, the views from the ferry of the harbour, opera house and bridge were excellent. The town of Manly is lovely and well worth the visit.
Great day. We loved the whole experience and had a great meal at a hotel looking out to the sea. Would do it again anytime . Great shopping as well.

A trip to the Fish and chip shop. Whenever I am in Sydney I always take a trip on the Manly ferry as its one of the best trips in the world. If you choose late afternoon you get to Manly walk down the main street to the beach where you can turn right and walk up to the heads and look at the views out to sea or back to the city skyline.Once it goes dark you have have a drink in one of the local pubs then go and grab some freshly cooked Fish and chips sit by the sea and enjoy. Once your finished you can take the ride back on the Ferry with the city all lit up and enjoy evening in the harbour as you take the trip back to circular key.

Always worth the ride!. If you want to feel the joy of Sydney harbour just take the ferry to Manly.Its a leisurely 30 minutes,you see all the harbour and you go close to the Heads and then you can walk from the Manly ferry terminal to Manly beach in 5 minutes.On a sunny day its beautiful!!!!

Simple and pretty cheap way to experience this wonderfull city... Caught the Ferry out to Manly...lunch on the beach...and back in around 3 or 4 hours with spectacular harbour views to boot.Worth doing.

Great views on the trip - and Manly is pretty cool also. In Manly there are some great beaches, views, shopping and don't miss Shark Dive Extreme when you are there. Challenge yourself. On the way there, you get some great views of Sydney including the opera house, the bridge, and, especially at night, Luna park. Plus, it's pretty inexpensive.
A Sydney 'Must Do'. I was told I HAD to do this visit to Manly on the ferry by several people and so glad I did. Manly is lovely and the Ferry provides for great views of the Opera House and Bridge.

Quick trip to see the harbor.. By the time I got down to the harbor, it was too late to ride one of the two hour your boats. It was suggested that I take the ferry because it would cover at least some of the harbor. I got to see the bridge at sunset and after a ten minute walk, I saw the Manly Beach. It was a good side trip.

Try not to miss a trip on the Manly Ferry. Best self guided harbor tour to a magical destination. We traveled on a beautiful winter day and were rewarded with clear skies and calm seas. The trip is a perfect way to get those iconic photos of the Opera house and bridge.
Manly Visits and Warringah Mall. During our Sydney visits, we usually set aside an afternoon for a visit to Manly beach and its surroundings, and sometimes shopping at Warringah Mall.

Manly Ferries - Just Ok.. Manly Ferries are nothing special, still pretty outdated. Food and drinks on the ferries are still pretty expensive and not alot of variety compared to Uk and Europe Ferries.Nice going over to Manly on a nice summers day across the harbour.

Only 25 mins and very frequent. Went to Manly for an afternoon to see the beach and have a look around. The ferry runs every half hour and only takes 25 mins to get there. Good views both ways from the water. Arrive in time at the busy periods start and end of day as it gets full. As a tip the boat has 2 front ends so travels forwards and backwards, if you want to be at the front go the way it's facing.

Very Pretty. Its a very beautiful ride if you haven't been to Europe but for someone like me, who has taken boat rides in Zurich and Copenhagen...this was pretty average. There is not much space to thoroughly enjoy the view as most of the ferry is covered
Great at night. We took the family on the ferry at night. Great night with plenty to see. The trip is different at night . Got off at Manly and had a coffee and caught the next ferry back to Sydney
A nice way to spend a few hours in Manly. Nice to travel through the harbour and not expensive, Manly is nice but not expensive. A mix of cheap and expensive seaside shops.
Iconic!. No matter the weather a trip on the Manly Ferry is an absolute must when in Sydney! What a way to see the city and its beautiful surrounds!

Love this trip across the harbour no matter how many times I do it. I always try to get a ride on the ferry across the harbour whenever I am in Sydney. I don't succeed very often but it is permanently on my list. It is every changing because of the harbour traffic and the swells rolling in from the pacific ocean and up the harbour. I like the old ferries as they sway and roll in the sea. I recommend this as one of the cheapest short adventures in Sydney.
Great day trip. Left on time, plenty of seats, smooth ride. Kids loved it, adults loved it too. A great day out in Sydney.
Only way to Manly. Great way to get to Manly. The trip from Circular Quay is the only way to go with great views and landmarks on the way.
fast. The ferries are great, fast and very good priced. Fast and easy and good timetable. Staff friendly and helpfull

A Sydney Icon - You Must Do It !!. On a sunny day there is no better way to view Sydneys beautiful harbour and foreshores. Price is very reasonable for a return trip to Circular Quay. Make sure you go up the front and soak up the beautiful salt water smell and enjoy the iconic views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Sydney Opera House, Fort Denison and everything else that the harbour has to offer. Get off at Manly for lunch and a wander around. Its a great way to spend a day in Sydney.
Manly Ferries. Manly ferry offers a quick connection to Manly which is on the other side of the Sydney Harbour. They are the cheapest and the fastest way to reach Manly.

Our favourite Sydney Harbour journey. We have visited Sydney many times and the ferry trip to Manly from Circular Quay is one of our favourite trips. The harbor trip is magnificent and the photo opportunities from the bow or stern are plentiful and stunning..

Sunday, bloody Sunday. Get out into the harbor and pretend you're an Aussie! Wow--I have never seen so many tanned legs and flopflops, as the entire population of Sydney apparently decided to go to the Other Beach--or just shop for Manly's reputed bargains. If all the bodies on the mall had forced themselves onto the beach, there would have been two layers of people on the sand. I was not impressed by two restaurants along the beach street which snubbed the solo little old lady (me) who wanted a spot that might otherwise accommodate a couple or even a family, but I did find some enjoyment in the Maori art shop on the shopping concourse. I'd do it again--on a weekday.

A good leisurely way to spend a day out. A good 20+ min ferry ride from circular quay which takes you to a nice stretch of quiet and less loud, beach and not in-your-face and crowded like Bondi.Its a nice stretch to walk around with lots of options to grab a bite or spend a quiet afternoon. We saw a lot of serious surfers making the most of the waves in spite of the chilly weather. The facilities there are encouraging for having a good swim. We liked it compared to Kilda at Melbourne or the Bondi one.special mention of the Harbour hotel (cant remember what its called - adjoining the ferry stands. Has a good view and some interesting bites, friendly staff from all corners of the globe - try it out.A good leisurely way to spend a day out

Sunset perk. The best and inexpensive way to have the greatest view of Sydney! First you get to Manly beach (which is somptuous) then you come back just before the sun sets and you have the greateast place to experience the most beautiful Sunset in the world!
Relaxing on the Harbour. I always love the ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly it is a great way to sit back and relax and watch the view go by.

Clean, quick, and relaxing way to travel between Manly Beach and Sydney. The ferry is the only way that I want to travel between Manly and Sydney. It is a relaxing 30 minute ride with great views of the harbor. The ferry terminates at the Circular Quay in Sydney. From there, it is quick walk to the Opera House, the Rocks (historical area), the botanical gardens, and multiple harbor side restaurants and bars. Driving would take almost a good hour and parking is a nightmare. Best way to travel - hands down!

Scenic views of Sydney. Great ferry to Manly. There is an express as well though we just took the standard. You can also use the Opal Card on this which is really handy. Can get a little chilly on the water so take a jumper or jacket. Very punctual, unbelievable picture opportunity of Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge on the return journey. Manly itself is a lovely spot, reminded me of California - it's a different atmosphere from the hustle and bustle of Sydney, Definitely recommend this trip and ferry!

Great Views of the City. It's a really nice ride across to Manly, where you can easily while away the day on it's iconic beaches, or visit the Sea Life Sanctuary (with the noisy little penguins). On Sunday's the public transport fare drop significantly, so if you can wait until Sunday for a trip across you can save yourself a few dollars. Make the most of the stunning views by getting a seat 'on deck'!

Inexpensive way to see beautiful Sydney Harbor!. A cheap and beautiful way to see Sydney Harbor. The views are fantastic from the decks of the boat, including the Harbor Bridge. We were able to time the ride to coincide with sunset! Fantastic!

Beautiful views on the way over and back.. Great views as you travel to Manley. Get to the front of the boat on the outward and return journey for the best photos. There is an Aldi supermarket as you get off the ferry which makes for an inexpensive place to pick up picnic supplies. If you have a family go on a Sunday when you can use the Fun Saving tickets of $2.50 each person..

Go on Sunday to get a cheaper fare.. On Sundays the public transport company does its Sunday Fun Day special, meaning that all the public transport is cheaper on Sundays. Go then to get the biggest discount from the standard fare. A nice ride out to Manly and an even better trip back with the harbour, Opera house and bridge views.One of the top ten things to do in Sydney

a must for any tourist, get close to opera house and the bridge. A beautiful old ferry, see all the great sites, the ride is about 30 minutes, slow enough to get great photo's of the most beautiful harbour in Australia, get with 100 metres of the Opera House and a 200 metres of Sydney harbour bridge, ferry is comfortable, plenty of seating, toilets café, upstairs and downstairs.
Clean smooth ride. Great time on board the movie queens cliff, smooth crossing from circular quay to manly, with ferries running every half hour.

Fun and Fast travel to Manly. Have used Mnaly ferries a bunch of times, the staff are always helpful, love the onboard bar! and the veiws are always a winner- the ticket prices arent exactly a bargain but im sure fairly inline with the running costs etc -

Free with your My Multi 3 card!. A beautiful 30 minute ride from the Harbour to Manly. If you have a My Multi card 3 it's free, if not a return ticket is AU$15.20. Plenty of photo opportunities for the Bridge and the Opera House. Many itself is spotlessly clean and if you walk to the end of the main street (just a few minutes) you'll arrive at a huge stunning beach. Manly i well worth a visit.
Cheap and good views when getting around. Easy quick way to explore a bit more of the area at cheap prices. Cheaper than bus and good views as you travel

It's nice cheap cruise with great view. We usually took the the ferry from circular quay and use the opal card on Sunday..make it worth it..or family fun day $2.50 all day..It's guve you the view of opera house and harbour bridge when you passing by to manly beach..and its not a long ride..When weather is good..try to go to the top deck outside dancing the destination .lits awesome.

Manly the place to visit. only half an hour from Circular Quay and your in Manly, get off the ferry they run every quarter to the hour and quarter past the hour, no need to rush to catch a ferry theres always one coming soon, Shops shops and more shops, Felt so safe on a ferry, Using an "Opal" card to get anywhere and everywhere

Sydney Harbor by fast cat. Sydney Harbor is the largest natural harbor in the world and the best way to see the sights of the city and nearby locals is from the sea. We purchased the 24-hour pass and Taronga zoo pass, it was a excellent choice because we were able to visit so many sights at the lowest cost. The hop-on, hop-off ferry let us set our itinerary, see which sights we wanted and stay as long as we wanted. Service was punctual and ferry crew were informative and helpful. Less expensive than the competition, same service.

Good view of Sydney. A great way to see the city from the water. The ferry takes about 25 minutes and runs every 30 minutes from Circular Quay and return from Manly. It feels a bit 'cattle class' on weekends, but it does the job and there is always a seat available, ensuring a comfortable ride.

In sydney go for a ferry ride. The manly ferry is a fun ride. It is 30 minutes in total. It is relaxing and fun. When you arrive go for a walk along the corso at Manly. I would recommend this as a fun thing to do in Sydney.

Love it. I have always enjoyed the crossing on the Manly ferry provides some great views of Sydney harbour, the service on board is good, great pies served in the cafe on board. well worth a trip, I even have my favourite ferry, Freshwater but did not get this one this time, got Queenscliff this time but all are nice to travel on.

Fun way to see the city!. Taking the ferry is an inexpensive and fun way to get a great view of the city. Even on a chilly, windy day, it was beautiful. We got great pics of the bridge/Opera House, etc... And Manly Beach is lovely. About $15 for a day's worth of fun!

Circular Quay to Manly! Breathtaking views.. We Love our Sydney Ferries and whether you are a local or a visitor, the Manly Ferry trip from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf is a must! With so many stunning and iconic views, you won't know quite where to look! Harbour Bridge, Opera House, city skyline, harbour islands, naval base, Botanical Gardens, wooded headlands, harbour front mansions, a multitude of other water craft, Sydney Heads and the gorgeous suburb of Manly! Ocean Beaches, shopping mall, restaurants, walks!

Great value, like a tourist trip but really cheap!. Its considered public transport so is really cheap but has some great views of the bridge and opera house. Perfect at sunset. Have a look at the times and get there a bit early to get a good spot outside or near a window.
Pleasant trip!. Enjoyed our trip on the ferry to Manly. Staff were friendly, ferry was clean and we were able to freely move around to take in all of the view on offer during the trip.

Fast ferry to Manly. We took the fast ferry to Manly and it was like a scenic cruise! We went right past the Opera House, and Sydney Harbor Bridge. The scenery was beautiful, especially coming back at sunset. Manly Beach was very nice as well.

Great Fun. We took an afternoon trip and it was. So neat to see everyone coming out on the harbor with their sailboats. Had a nice dinner on the beach and beautiful night time vistas on the return trip. Highly recommended!

A wonderful ride. Why take a cruise when you can take a ferry and it is much cheaper at $7.50. The trip from Circular quay (city) to Manly (beach) takes about 35-40min and is a wonderful way to see the harbour. The ferry takes you past the opera house, shark island, many harbour beaches and best of all it passes in front of the cliff heads that open the harbour to the ocean. You can choose to sit inside or out. Chairs are basic but comfortable.Manly has a seaside holiday village feel. It has both a surf and harbour beach, a promenade between the beaches which has several bars and other standards for such a tourist area. My father loves the Manly Jazz festival which runs 25Sept to 5 October 2015 this year, its 38th year.

A cheap way to see Sydney Harbour. No need to pay big money to see Sydney Harbour from the water, a trip on the Manly Ferry is cheap and the view is great plus you gety the bonus of a visit to Manly Beach before returning.
You should go ... If you are a tourist here in Sydney, you should go to Manly by Ferry. Try to go on Sunday, it will cost just $2.50 using Opal card, this trip is very nice to take some pictures.
So much fun. Traveled across to Manly for lunch and then back, was a lovely day which made the ride awesome! Every time I visit Sydney I try to go on the Ferry.

Take the Manly Ferry Instead of a Tour. Several locals had recommended taking the Manly Ferry rather than the tour for the best view of Sydney Harbor. The view of the harbor, opera house and harbour bridge was fantastic. At Manly, had a burger and beer then made the return trip for even better views.

Can be a little choppy in bad weather. Went in winter and loved the views from boatside. Sail under the harbour bridge during day and saw the evening view of the skyline at night on the return. Boarding was smooth but in bad weather the water can get a little choppy but its usually over in a few minutes

Ferry trip. Magnificent Sydney harbour. Gets a git rough when crossing Sydney harbour heads but the views are wonderful. Sit outside at the back of the ferry for retreating views of the city. Best for photo opportunities, it is also sheltered on a windy day. Some days dolphins swim alongside. The captain of the ferry will always make an announcement if there are dolphins or whales in the harbour. Beautiful trip to the even nicer Manly village.

Another Scenic Harbour Ride. The trip from Manly to Circular Quay on the ferry is a relaxing and inexpensive way to enjoy the picturesque views of Sydney Harbour. The experience is different depending on the weather and time of day. Views of the bridge and Opera House and the many other highlights are best enjoyed from the decks in the fresh air. It doesn't matter how often this trip is taken it is always a top attraction during a visit to Sydney.

Gorgeous views.. A friend and I decided to take a trip to Manly Beach and getting there we took a ferry. I really recommend going on a Sunday since you only have to pay $2,50 (Opal card users) for all public transportation during the entire day, which in my opinion is quite unbelievable. A normal one-way trip to Manly with ferry on any other day would be $7,18. So it's definitely worth it doing touristy stuff where you have to travel a bit on Sundays, just a tip. Anyhow, the ferry was nice and clean. You passed the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, and if you're going there in the late afternoon like my friend and I did then you'll have a gorgeous view with the sunset as backdrop, it's really pretty. The only downside with the ride to manly was getting on and off the ferry, there weren't any real queueing systems which ment that everyone was basically standing on top of each other. So if you've got claustrophobia I would recommend staying in the back, but that could mean that you won't get a seat. Also the ferry could have a few more outdoor seats. I'm pretty sure the roof-deck wasn't open because it's off season though. All in all, the trip was nice.

Not an Attraction but a Great Way to Manly. It's a boat ride through the Harbour. It's nice and the boats are comfortable and it costs like $7 to get to Manly. The boat ride isn't a must do but Manly Beach is. This makes it easy to access Manly so make sure you head out that way. You'll get a nice view of things from the water of the area.

See all of Sydney Harbour from the ferry. Sydney Harbour is one of the best in e world and there's no better way to casually enjoy the sights than getting from Circular Quay to Manly than the Manly Ferry. You can see all the wealth of the Eastern Suburbs, the gum trees of the national parks and be gently rolled around as you cross the Heads. At the end are the gentle waters and the sights of Manly where you can saunter up the Corso to the ocean side for a swim. A very inexpensive way to enjoy a day.

A nice and relaxing journey with spectacular views. Took a bus to Manly and then returned using the ferry. Best to take in the late afternoon so you can experience day light as well as to witness the gorgeous sunset over the Sydney Harbour Bridge.
Always fantastic, easy access. Always fantastic, relaxing, enjoyable. Accessible for independent wheelchair users, A real must if you are in Sydney
Beautiful way to see the Harbor. convenient and inexpensive way to take in the sights of the harbor in Sydney and transport to beautiful Manly beach...lots of photo opportunities.

Good way to see habor. The ferries in Sydney are a fine of transport. As a bonus you get nice views of the city itself. So you have a good view of the harbor with of course the bridge and Opera House.

Never mind Manly, just go for the ride. I took my grandchildren,7&4, for a ride on the Manly ferry. The sun was shining although it was a little cold.Beautiful views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House as one departs the terminal. The ride was comfortable with a small cafe serving drinks and bites to eat. Being the winter months there was not too much for the grandchildren to do as it was too chilly for the beach, however after a nice lunch we took the ferry back and thoroughly enjoyed the retune trip. I was able to take pictures of,the children with the bridge and opera house behind themThey both loved the ferry ride and wanted to go again the next day. Opal crud works at the ferry turnstile.

Marvelous Views. We took the Ferry from Sydney Harbour to Manly to visit Manly Sealife Sanctuary. I recommend the trip into Manly, just to experience the views. The views of the bridge, Opera House and harbor were great but once you leave that area the views continue. It's a large green ferry that takes 30 minutes. We were using public transportation and had an opal card on hand. If you don't have a card, don't worry there are plenty of self serve stations to buy a ticket and an opal information booth with very friendly personnel. The cost 7.18 Australian Dollars.
Relaxing. Took the ferry the first time visiting Sydney. Lovely view and very comfortable seating. Staffs were friendly and the beverages are not bad for the price.

Glance on the Harbour bridge & Opera house from water. I think this is the longest ride available.Quite large ferry & leaves in every 30 minutes. Fantastic view on the bridge & Circular Quay. Must see.

Nice way to see the harbour. its a Nice way to see the harbour and the Opera house etc, good idea is catch it over during the day and come back on twilight that way you can get great views of the City at night.

Beautiful!. We were lucky to get seats on the top level of the ferry so we could enjoy the view. The Sunday family pass with $2.5 per person made the experience very very cost-effective. My daughter enjoyed walking around on the swaying boat (made her feel a bit adventurous, she was just learning to walk). The view was good and I was sorry we could not spend more time on the deck tasting the salty wind. The deck was crowded with people hence not very peaceful, however a good window seat inside is almost as good (maybe better) than being in the open and craning your neck to look over the shoulders of others. I am jealous of all those people who travel the ferry daily to get to work...though it is unlikely that they appreciate their good fortune.. :)
Old school. We just went on the Sydney to Manly round trip to have a taste of the harbour. For the price I would go on the cat ferries next time and see more of the harbour

See Sydney on the water. The manly ferries are part of Sydney's daily life. Clean and organized and a relaxing way to see the harbour. Sunday's you can get a family pass for $2.50 and travel all day if you want.

When I,m over Sydney I go for a ferry ride.. It is a must to take a ferry from The Quay to Manly on any trip here.
Views to die for, Just watch the swell on big days.
Manly is the better Bondi people miss.
On a good day first class on a bad business.
Get off ferry walk 10min down corso to surf beach.
Location location Location.

Now this is a great way to get to the other side !!!. If you love boats, or you're not in a rush, or even love beautiful views of the city you are going to love this. The Manly Ferry is such a lovely way to experience Sydney harbour as well as getting to Manly. For me, Manly is like a seaside village miles away from Sydney but with the advantage of only being a 40 mins boat ride. Well worth the trip... but if you want a bit of fun, then wait for inclement weather. The trip across the heads will be bumpy and exciting. With the right weather conditions, huge waves will splash across the bow and the bow & stern will dip and rise like a roller coaster. (Pray you don't get sea sick !!!) The madness is more fun some times than the sedate but beautiful summer trek you can make. But if you don't have the stomach for the storms and inclemency ... then stick to the sunny days. You really won't be disappointed.

Manly Ferry. This has to be one of the best and cheapest tours in the world. Where else can you see a harbour as beautiful as Sydney's, sit in the beautiful Australian sun and relax as you travel. One of the best times is a summer Sunday when all the sailing boats are out on the harbour.
This is a must do. Brilliant trip. Breathtaking views of the bridge and harbor.This is a must do on your Sydney calendar

My best commute. Because I live on the northern beaches, I often use the Manly ferry. It is delightful to watch visitors taking so many photos of my " back yard" & enjoying the beautiful harbour. Th ferries are very comfortable with good facilities.

One of Sydney's must do's. The views from this ferry ride are simply stunning and give you a whole different perspective of Sydney. The sight of the houses which are along the water's side make you appreciate what a wonderful place Sydney is to live (especially for the rich!) and if you do this journey on a Sunday it is only $2.50 (but be warned of long queues).

Great 30min cruise. We took the Manly ferry to Manly and back to Circular Quay. It was comfortable, beautiful and relaxing. There a small refreshment shop on board and toilets. Coffee was good and the eats available looked fresh and tasty. I suggest grabbing an outside seat for a good view.

The different view of the harbour. The ferries offer a lot of seating inside and some benches outside. The view of the harbour and of Sydneys skyline is beautiful from the ferry. The ride is especially cheap, when you go on Sundays because your Opal card will limit the daily expenses for public transportation to 2.5$.
My lucky day!. Took a ferry out the city to Whale Beach and you can see the city in a different view! Lucky us, we saw a double-ful rainbow when we alight at Manly Wharf!

Misery on misery. On a very wet day we were met by extreme rudeness from one member of staff because we had been given different instructions from different staff about what to do and where to go and according to him we were in the wrong place. I still don't understand why a barrier was placed between me and the young girl in front of me, causing me to stand and look at ticket machines with ticks on them for close to 5 minutes. Nor why he treated my partner with such contempt. This all followed the ticket lady having a long chat with the people in front of us in the queue, then spending ages examining my seniors pass because she found it 'interesting, its so pretty'. Hence we missed the ferry. No wonder we rarely go to Sydney.
Wonderful views en route to Manly. Well worth the trip, excellent views en route and if seated upstairs on ferry, free wi fi is available.,
Cool Beach. Short ride to a fantastic beach. A quick 5 minute walk to the beach and you pass by many shops along the way. Go early and have lunch along the beach street.

manly ferry /getting around. the quickest way to get to manly takes about 30 minutes nice views get an opus card and put money on in it with save you money getting around all the places you want to see you can use them on ferrys buses and light rail services (around sydney only) opus card are free i got mine from my hotel and you go to the seven /eleven shops to top them up

The best ferry trip in Sydney.. It may have hundreds of passengers, especially at weekends, but who cares? There is always a holiday mood on the Manly ferry and, it can be invigoratingly rough when crossing the heads when there is a big swell rolling into the harbour.

Slow boat to Manly . There ate two ferry choices to get from Circular Quay to Manly. The jetcat which takes 20 minutes or thiz ferrh which takes 30+ minutes. I've taken both and this is mg preferred option - the cultured way to travel!

A great cheap cruise on the Harbour. Make sure to sit upstairs at the front of the vessel for the trip back to the city from Manly. There is a surprise as the boat rounds the headlands. I can be very busy all year round so be prepared to miss one boat due to full capacity and wait for the next one

You dont have to be manly to love this ride!. The ferry ride offers inside and outside viewing. It is comfortable and the views of the harbour are breath taking. The crews are eficient and friendly. The wharf at Manly offers a variety of cuisines and it is a pleasant short stroll to the corso and the beautifukl Manly Beach. It is not uncommon to see Layne Beachley either on the beach or sharing time with her family or friends. A great day out!

Stunning transport option, best views at a great price. This is an iconic trip for me and all our overseas guests… especially if you take your first trip going into the city, as the whole of the harbour opens up before you… and then you round the corner … and there is the Opera House. Magical. Get a seat outside at the front of the ferry if you can, although views from every seat.

Great ride.. Nothing better than i ride on the Manly Ferry. Great scenic views of the Downtown and Opera House and Bridge. Some of the best photo opportunities are from out on the water. Nice ride across the harbor to Manly and back.

Great way to relax and see the views. Not a luxury trip by any means. Sydneysiders travel for work, people out for the day, tourists and everyone between travel on the Largest Ferry in the harbour service doing the Quay to Manly service. It is occassionally cancelled in bad weather because it goes out near the Head of the Harbour where the wind and waves could get stronger. A quick way back is by the jet boat link if you prefer but you miss much of the views in and up coves, along the houses and bush reserves, the small boats and passing ferries of other lines. Sit inside or around the outside walkway on wooden benches, as I said, not luxury but part of the history of Sydney if not an original Ferry they carry with them the charm.

Fast and free wifi. Had very little access to free wifi in Sydney so very much enjoyed my ferry ride. Very easy to get tickets and ride went quickly to cover the far distance as well as beautiful scenery. Tip the ferry's has two fronts so don't sit on the opposite side to see new sights. Sit on the same side as the ride to Manly.
Nice journey. the ferry is average. but the journey is enthralling with lots of sights. these guys did goof up with our combined tickets for the zoo.
A great day for a walk about.. A day in Manly a great change of pace from the CBD. Great walking mall with assorted shops, beaches and a stunning ferry ride; a great day but still close to Sydney.

See beautiful scenery in comfort. Travelling to and from Manly Beach from the city (or vice versa) on the Manly ferry is a wonderful way to see what is arguably one of the most beautiful harbours in the world. Get off the ferry in Manly, stroll down the Corso to Manly surf beach, take a right turn and head to Shelly Beach--a beautiful little cove that looks back on the surf beach.The ferry to Manly and return to Circular Quay is a good way to fill in that last hour or two before your cruise ship leaves from the nearby terminal. Check the timetables at the wharf.

Great view of city and harbour. Probably the easiest and maybe less expensive way of seeing the city skyline and harbour. One way trip take about 30-35 minutes. Snack food ( hot and cold is available) Manly is worth a look see . Beach is just a couple of minutes stroll through the mall. If adventurous a walk to North head ( or a bus right from Manly wharf ) is also worthwhile. A lot of history around the quarantine station and lovely bush walks

One of the best views of Sydney Harbour.. This is reasonably priced and runs frequently. The views are perfect. When it arrives at Manly the wharf is quite interesting. Manly beach is a few minutes walk and is really lovely.

A Ferry ride to remember!. This is the best way to cool off in summer and just enjoy a quick ferry ride. It is air driven and just an exhilerating exprerience. The price is right too. Take the family or just you and your spouse...........it is an easy way to check one more item from your to do list. love it!
Icon worth the visit. Absolutely beautiful views and trip over the prettiest harbour in the world! Fares are really cheap and worth the eturn ride to just stop and take in the scenery.

Best View.. Take the Ferry to Manly for fish and chips by the Beach. The View from the upper deck is fantastic, and Don't forget, if the weather's rough stay inside.The front deck gets waves over it,and in winter isn't much fun. A GR8 way to see the best half of The Harbour!!

RELAXING TRIP. The ferry was a lovely, relaxing trip from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. We were with a Year Six school group from inland WA, so being on the water was especially nice. The kids were so excited to see the Sydney Harbour Bridge up close! Staff on the ferry were very friendly and helpful. This trip is definitely recommended.

Love the Ferry Ride. We oftern go on the Sydney or Manly ferry when we are in Sydney. The staff are always accomodating and know what is a good to see and do. Nothing is a problem and no question is to Stupid either, the ferries are clean and the ride is always enjoyable. I think that it is something that everyone should do when in sydney. I also think that the staff should be respected more that what they are, as they really do work hard.

The view. The ferry to manly, is the one that you would take to obtain a great view (looking back as you leave Sydney Ferry station) to see an amazing view of the bridge and opera house. Apart from that Manly is an amazing place for a relaxing day out of the Sydney

A must to see Manly and the wider Sydney harbour. This is an absolute must if you are visiting Sydney. we have travelled to Manly on the ferry many times and every time the experience has been well worth it. The ferry is a great way to see the Harbour, opera house and residencies that surround the harbour from the comfort of the ferry.It is a regular shuttle from Sydney ferry terminal by the opera house to Manly, explore Manly, have a meal, go to the beach, shop and travel back.

It's COLD, but do not miss it. It refers to the ferry that takes you from Circular Quay in Sydney CBD to Manly Beach Pier.The ride is about 30 - 40 mins (from memory) and fare is cheap, you can pay by Opal Card (Sydney smart card payment system).The ferry is undercover seats and "out door" seats. Remember your jacket if you want the "out door" seats. The breeze can be very cold, I am serious.You will expect some scenic view so have your camera prepared.
As expected. Fastest way to get from circular quay to manly. Reasonably priced. Beautiful views and plenty of photo ops. On a cold windy day def stay inside!!!

A great ride on the way to Manly Sea Life Sanctuary. My grandchildren aged 4 and 6 loved the Manly Ferry ride on the way to Manly Sea Life Sanctuary. It enabled them to see other sydney icons via boat such as the Sydney Opera House, the Harbour Bridge, Luna Park, Darling Harbour, and general water scenery. There were toilets on the boat (which needed a clean but still handy to have with young children), and a small canteen to purchase snacks from.

Budget Cruise. Being a parent can prove to be an expensive exercise.. I have often jumped on the Manly ferry with my grandchildrren . The sea breeze can do wonders for both adult and child. We'd go to Manly have an icecream and swim all for under $20. Sunday is Fun Day and tickets are $2.50.. Give it go..

City and harbour views. This is the perfect way to see Sydney harbour. You get great views of the city. We returned at sunset and got the most amazing views of the city, the Harbour bridge and the Opera house with a lovely orange sky behind. Well worth doing.

The best way to see Sydney Harbour at low cost. Can't afford to hire a yacht? Just hop on the Manly ferry and you'll get a great ride through arguably (I may be biased..)the world's most beautiful harbour. Grab a fish and chips in Manly, walk along the beach and return to the city the same way. It's a great afternoon's worth of activities.
Manly Ferry.. I loved the trip on the ferry to Manly,it was fast and took next to no time to get there.It was clean the the Staff were efficient in getting the Public quickly on and off.
Learn as you ride. The people who run this ferry have tons of information about the surrounding area. They really made the trip fun.

Don't miss it!. Got to be one of the best rides on the Sydney ferry system. Fantastic views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge both ways.There are some lovely restaurants, great beaches and lovely coastal walks at your destination.And if you return after dark you get a wonderful view of the illuminated Opera House and the Sydney skyline. Get those camera out!
quick and easy. great to get to manly. Easy with stunning views of the harbour - if you are in a hurry take the fast ferry - but if you want to enjoy the ride this is an excellent option.

Time The Return Trip for Sunset. Time the trip back to Circular Quay from Manly with sunset if you can. The views from the ferry toward the Sydney Harbour Bridge are spectacular with the setting sun behind it. If you are headed toward Manly, it's worth spending a day, and maybe a night. The surf beach, shopping, restaurants, bars and nightlife are well worth the trip and time.
Perfect for sightseeing. It's a great way to see the harbour, the bridge, and the Opera House - no need to pay more for boat tours.
Quick and efficient. A great way to go to Manly island, it only takes 1/2 hour and there are plenty of ferries running all day.

Manly Is Good, Go Early. The most popular route. We took the ferry over to Manly a few times in the morning. Loved the fat pies and coffee for brekkie. Such a nice ride. Scenic and bumpy @ times in the brief open ocean part of the trip. Manly is good. Super vibe. Great beach, wonderful walk along the coast, either way, but the hike to the right is longer, more rural (green) w/more interesting sites including WWII military emplacements. Do it!

Good trip across the bay. Found this to be a nice excursion for a Sydney day trip. Catch the ferries at the waterfront and enjoy a scenic cruise across the bay to Manly. Explore the beach and shops there.

Long and beautiful!. This ferry ride is about a half hour long, so it's longer than some of the other ferries but the ride is quite nice with beautiful views including passing by Fort Denison. Manly Beach is a great place to visit, and this is a fantastic way to get there.

Showcasing beautiful Sydney Harbour. We love playing tourist in our own town and high on the ToDo list is the Manly Ferry. A great way to experience Sydney Harbour with minimal expense. Once you get to Manly there is always plenty to see and do. Walk down the promenade and along the beach. I love a beer at the pub overlooking the beach.
Cool way to spend the day. Leave from Circular Quay and land in Manly. The Ferry takes you across the harbour allowing you to soak in the views of this amazing city.

Lovely view. Great experience from Circular Quay to Manly and back via the ferry....suggest a trip during the day to enjoy the beauty of the beach and return by night to catch awesome views of the skyline in the evening.....Manly also has good options for shopping!

Fast or Slow Ferries from Circular Quay to Manly. There's a choice - fast ferry cuts the time almost by half, whilst the good old fashioned atmospheric old green and cream ferries steam back and forth every 30 minutes from early till late. There is a basic cafe on board the ferry. Choice of sitting inside, or braving the wind and the waves out on the deck. I go for the deck everytime. For the best views on the ferry, you need the starboard side so you are nearest the coast - remember these ferries are two-way, no reversing!

tour. the ferrie was great my son loved the ride from sydney quay to manly to see more sealife the seats were comfortable and it was a rather smooth ride my son had a great time watching as we passed other boats

Fantastic way to see skyline and harbor. Took the ferry to Manly to go drinking. Wow, what a great way to see the city's skyline, bridge, opera house, and harbor. Go in the afternoon, eat and drink in Manly, then return at night so you get to see the city in two different lighting perspectives.
SPeechless. I fell in love with Manly immediately. I was amazing, from the view to the people to the fresh seafood and everything. It was relaxing,
you have to do it. its a great trip, relaxing, great views of Sydney, takes around 30 minutes, order a coffee and enjoy, its fun
Nice way to see the Harbour. Taking the Manly ferry is a great way to get on the water to see the harbour. We found the ferry to be on time in both directions.

Manly Ferry ride. I travel out of peak times so I can get an outside seat if it is not too cold. There is nothing that I dislike, the trip on the harbour is very pretty and relaxing, plenty to see. Crossing between the heads may be a little rough at times but that just adds a little excitement to the journey.
Superb Views and the best way to travel to Manly. The best way to travel across to Manly from Sydney City Centre, with some fantastic views of the Harbour bridge and the Opera House
Enjoyable ride. We took the ferry to manly and it was sure a fun and scenic ride for our family. Taking a slow ferry definitely worth the price since you get to enjoy the view along the way.
Great experience . The manly ferry was a great experience, great views on the way to manly with great photo opportunities, the ferry was on time both ways and was clean and tidy.
Handy. Very handy service that allows quick travel to Manly from circular quay. From memory it is reasonably priced, and great to use for a day out at the beach.

Best views ever!. This is the perfect and cheap way to experience great views of the Sydney Harbor, the bridge and the opera house. Also, it is a short enough ferry ride to Manly where you can go to the beach or eat at one of the restaurants lining the ferry terminal.

A must-do on every visit to Sydney. It's not a trip to Sydney without getting out on the harbour and what better way to appreciate it's beauty than from the Manly Ferry. Travelling all the way from Circular Quay to Manly and the Heads, then walking across to the ocean. I love just sitting at the beach with a coffee/fish&chips/whatever and enjoying the sea and a little break from the hectic streets of Sydney central. I caught a bus on one trip up to the Quarantine Station and did the tour there. Very interesting. Then I caught a bus up to the cafe up the top. Really good.

Don't forget to take a Manly ferry ride at night.. A ferry ride from Manly takes in so many of the sights of Sydney. Apart from the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House there is an excellent view of Garden Island and all the naval boats. Fort Denison, the Tower, Luna Park, Kirribilli House just to name a few. Having taken all your snaps in daylight, take an after dark trip and enjoy all the lights of the bridge and the city. Just watching the seagulls flap alongside the ferry in the semi light is quite magical.

What a view!. This trip is a MUST. The best view you can possibly get of Sydney. Not to mention Manly is lovely! We went for a stroll along the beaches there and had dinner at the Wharf Bar.. which had the best Seafood Basket meal we've had in a long time. Highly recommend!

Must do. This is the one ferry that you should take if you are visiting Sydney. The view is great, the trip is only about 30min and Manly is strikingly different from the City, so the contrast adds up to the trip.
Perfect Day. As a Seniors Card holder I paid $2.50 for an all day Multi use ferry ticket. Great value and a most enjoyable trip to Manly with superb Sydney Harbour views.

One of the best ways to enjoy Sydney. Best way to enjoy the view of the city from the water. Fast way to get to manly off the roads and an excellent place for people to do as a first thing in Sydney, right from the heart in Circular Quay. Not too hot either.

A great way to see Sydney Harbour and Manly beach. Take the ferry to Manly, sit on the outside deck, soak up the sun. Then when you get to Manly, walk down the Corso th Manly beach and get some fish and chips and sit on the beach to eat them. Then go back for an icecream! A great way to spend an afternoon
Fancy a harbour cruise on the cheap....?. The manly ferry is a Sydney icon. I love the 30 minute commute, passing many landmarks. The views are spectacular. No trip to Sydney is complete without it!
lovely. it was so good , amazing way to see sydney harbour , the cafe was a little expensive , but other than that i would highly recommend the manly ferry .

Short trip but very enjoyable. Very enjoyable and safe trip from Sydney Circular Quay, an overall view of Sydney Harbour; Bridge and Opera House while travelling on ferry; also at regular intervals the ferry leaves there; I highly recommend this attraction especially on sunny days and buy a special ticket which allows you to hop on and off on ferry, bus and train

So Sydney. I tell any visitor to Sydney to get out on the harbour.
The Manly ferry allows this as well as a Viet to an amazing suburb that has both ocean and harbour beach.
Hard to beat!
A must do when in Sydney!. You cannot come to Sydney and not catch the iconic Sydney-Manly ferry! An absolute must do for anyone who visits Sydney..
Great day out. I often travel over to Manly just for leisure, its always a nice trip and even better when the seas are high!!!!
A Pleasant trip to Manly. A wonderful relaxing 30 minute ferry ride to Manly. The destination is why you go . It is like going to a seaside holiday town
early bird. Take the first ferry in the morning from Circular Quay to Manly and enjoy a peaceful but spectacular trip !

The cheapest way to see the harbour. I think this is a must for every traveller to Sydney. You must take the trip on the Manly ferry it is the most brilliant way to see the harbour. If travelling from the city spend time in Manly and walk to Shelley beach or to Queenscliff. Have fish and chips on the beach or a counter meal at one of the pubs or cafes. Relax and enjoy. There's is plenty to see and the trip is fabulous 100 out of 100.
Da's favourite day out.. My 86 year old Da loves this trip when he visits us from the country. There's always something happening in the Harbour, and great places to eat in Manly
All about the Harbour. Great way to see Sydney harbour, very inexpensive way to travel. Ideal for any tourists who want to experience the beauty of Sydney Harbour

Great trip to visit a great place. The weather was perfect for the middle of winter. The sun was shining and the trip over to Manly was great. We spent the whole afternoon exploring the shops and sites and enjoyed the trip back although it was a bit choppier than the trip over.
Easiest way to travel to Manly.. Great way to see the most of the region, just wish I had done the ferry back to see the bridge in the evening, but cant have everything.
Manly Ferry. It a nice ferry ride across Sydney Harbour, you get to see the Opera House on your way to Manly and once you get to Manly it is a short walk to the shops.
Good for scenery in sydney. If you want to see sydney scenery, this is the recommended way to do it. Buy a day pass, travel on train bus ferry, all day.
nicely manintained.. Took this ferry from circular query to reach Manly beach. timely schedules help with decent comfort. considerably outside seats are better to get the complete view and picture.
trip down memory lane. Loved the trip to Manly, it was a happy childhood memory recreated Easy to find our way around and a very pleasant trip

Great way to travel. Best way to travel to Manly from the city. Means you can stay for as long as you like without the hassle or cost of parking. Centrally located it's the perfect method of transport

Nice day trip to Manly beach. took the ferry from Sydney Harbor to Manly beach. Manly beach has plenty of benches and places to sit while you watch the surfers catch a wave. Plenty of places to have a drink or dine. Lovely town to walk around. We took the smaller ferry over. A much more pleasant ride. The other larger boat packs you in and is way too crowded. I sometimes have issues with seasickness. On the smaller vessel I was fine. We took the larger boat to the zoo the next day and I had issues with the wavy up and down feel of the boat and dock. The crowds of people and exhaust from the boat just made me feel more unsettled. The harbor is beautiful! You go past the Opera House. There are many sail boats out there. Very nice views of Sydney.

New Years on the beach. A great way to get from Sydney to Manly Beach, affording outstanding views of the harbour. The pier in Manly is within easy walking distance of the beach, and the ride is an enjoyable 45 minutes.
Convenient. Really nice journey on the Manly ferry easy to get on and off and very convenient. Highly recommend especially if it's your first visit to Sydney
Nice, big but slightly bumpy. It was very nice, my mum however was a little but queasy so if you get seasick go on a day when the harbour is flat

Take the ferry to Manly if you don't do anything else. What a good value in monetary terms as well as sightseeing terms. You won't get a better view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The price is quite reasonable...I think it was about $9.50 each way. Lovely, relaxing 30-40 minute sailing, ferry was super clean and coffee on board was not too bad :-) We were in Manly on business and our host drove us around and showed us some of the sights, but sailing back at night with everything lit up was a highlight. Do it.

Great Way To See the Skyline from the Water. The Ferry out to Manly is worth doing for the view of the harbor and the city skylineNot expensive at all and does not eat up much time for those on a budget for cash and time.The ride is highly recommended rode it several times while in the city and will say day or evening both times are great and if the day is clear it is even better
Great ride. The Manly ferry was a great way to cross the harbour. It was about half an hour and the views were wonderful. There is a place to buy food and washrooms but I didn't use either.

See my comments about the Ferry.. I have described my experiences, as in the the comment about the Sidney ferries, sorry my mistake. Great sevrice, very useful, and at a reasonable cost. Good to sit on the side of the ferry, especially when it was hot, with the coolin breeze in your hair.

Manly. A trip to Sydney doesn't feel completed until you have taken the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly.
