Once you get to manly, there are lots of coffee shops and pubs around you can go and get a bite to eat or during summer go straight to manly beach for a swim. The ferry is honestly the best way to get to Manly and as your leaving Circular Quay you go past the harbour bridge and the opera house.
Sydney trip. Take a trip to manly and you get views of the harbour for free the opera house and bridge it's a must

Straight forward use. Not much to do whilst waiting for the ferry late at night, but if you have the right company, you don't need anything else. I went during winter and the ferry was perfectly toasty for those cold late nights outside.

A must do whilst in Sydney. Take time out of your day and do this trip from Circular Quay to Manly enjoying the harbour and all its benefits for a small sum. Take a walk around Manly and even a swim. Lots of cafes/restaurants/bars at Manly and then take the trip back again to Circular Quay. Perfect for taking lots of great photos of Sydney and its skyline. If time permits do the trip again at night or time it so that one way you get daylight and on the way back you get evening. Gorgeous on a balmy evening and can be quite romantic.
Manly Ferry. What a fantastic ride out to Manly. It is so relaxing and spectacular. Use your Opal Card instead of worrying about buying tickets.

Something that you would can't afford to miss. I can't count how many times I have done this. This half an hour ferry ride is one of the top things that I like to do regardless of the weather. Take a seat outside the cabins and feel the wind on your face, enjoy the ocean ripples created by the ferry, and explore the city skyline as you move away from the wharf. Everything is just wow! I do this ride mostly on Sunday's to make use of the opal card special fares. The price is little but the enjoyment is maximum.

Manly Ferry. This is an excellent way to see the sights of Sydney and visit a suburb at the same time. The ferry ride takes thirty minutes and give a great view of the bridge, opera house and the surrounding area.

Superb way to view Sydney harbour inexpensively. By catching the regular ferry to Manly from Sydney wharf, as a tourist or commuter you share the same experience. Shortly after pushing off from Circular Quay you glide smoothly under Sydney's iconic "coathanger" Bridge, then sail past the Sydney Opera House and view its massive up-turned wedge-shaped roof segments clad in ivory tiles as they shimmer in the sunlight. Sydney's impressive skyline slips into the distance as you leave the harbour. Suddenly, you get up close and friendly with new structures, pretty homes perched on rocks, sail boats bobbing in the waves, and finally Manly beach and harbour come into view. It's one of the most relaxing 30 minute commutes you will take, so enjoy!

Great trip, Cheap and best way to enjoy the harbour. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly for a morning day out. Ferry is only $7 each way and takes 30 minutes. Sit on the front deck and enjoy the breeze through your hair and the stunning views of the harbour. Manly is a great place to visit. Some good shops including the biggest 'newsagency' I have ever seen!! Great walk to Cabbage Tree Bay and Shelly Beach. Best mode of transport!

Great way to get around. We decided to have trip over to Manly as we had not been for about 20 years . We got the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay . We have Opal cards which is a cheaper option than buying tickets and you just Tap on each way. The Ferry was on time , comfortable and efficient , very enjoyable.

Take The Ferry to Manly. Enjoy the Ferry ride to Manly, we did. Its about a half hour ride from the harbor to this delightful place, loaded with unique shops and restaurants. There is a beautiful beach for swimming and surfing, if that's your thing, but truly a short excursion worth taking, again use you Opel pass the fare is about $7 each way.

One of the cheapest ways to cruise around the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. I've taken the ferry to Manly twice, once in each of my trips to Sydney. Overall, I think that a half-day trip to Manly is great if you have enough time to spare in Sydney as it is a nice beach with beautiful coastal walks. The ferry to Manly itself is cool as well! It is a one hour ride where you will definitely get a very good view of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge, cheaper than any other cruise trips that you can find!
Nice. A very good and cheap way to get to lovely Manly, it takes about 15-20 mins all up, there are food & drink available on board if you choose and the toilets are very clean.
quick, cheap, easy. The ferry is good. just as I said in the title. Manly is a charming town that I enjoyed visiting for a day. the sea life sanctuary is a must-see there as well.

Excellent day out!. We did the excelllent day trip to Manly. It takrs around 30 minutes from Circular Quay.When arriving at the Manly Terminal beach and restaurants are only a short 10 minute walk away. You can walk to the beach via the Mall. You will find lots of great cafes pubs shopping at your disposal.Its a great day out.
Love the Manly Ferry.. Love the Manly Ferry. Quite reasonable. Lovely view of Sydney and surrounds whilst on it, especially of Harbour Bridge and Opera House.

The best way to have a trip. .... And you get to go to Manly. Not quite sure why anyone would pay for a harbour cruise when you can get on the Manly ferry, have a lovely boat ride, see the harbour, go to Manly, all for a good price. Have done the trip and few times when we were in Sydney and will do it again next time. No need to pre purchase, it's a commuter ferry and easy to buy tickets when you get there.
Live like a local!. Best way to discover the harbour! live like a local, travel to work and going home. don't forget there is a market in Manly on sunday as well.

A must do!! In Sydney. I was in Sydney on a 3 week business trip. The ferry is cheap and allows you to see things you couldn't otherwise. Take the ferry to Manly Beach..It's a great sightseeing ferry trip. It's only a 20 minute ride..so just do it..you won't regret it.

One of the worlds top harbour trips. The opera house, the harbour bridge, the Sydney city and urban skyline, along with all the scenic spots on the harbour as well as the yachts and other boats on the water make this one of the best trips on a harbour or waterway anywhere in the world. Then when the ferry has arrived at Manly there is the pleasure of walking along the Corso to take in the scenery along the beautiful Manly beach with the line of Norfolk pines.I definitely recommend making the return journey by ferry as well in order to take in all the scenery from a different perspective.

Ride The Ferry. A trip to Sydney always means a rude in the Manly Ferry - upstairs and outside, beautiful scenery, breeze blowing and the just before you enter Manly Harbour you cross the open sea. A great walk down the Corso. A bite to eat, perhaps a hot chocolate or gelato at the Ferry Terminal and back for the return journey - now you get to seeFort Denison, Sydney Opera Hoyse and the Bridge

The F ride.. It is such a wonderful experience being on sydney harbour on a sunny day with yachts dodging all round. Alls well untill you near the heads and on a day with ocean swell the rocking begins.It is a lovely calming experience with the rocking and splashing from the ocean swells. It is truely an experience that should be put on all tourists and locals diary. Check the surf report before undertaking it because it is better the larger the wve action is.

Decent ferry ride.... Theres a lot of room out the front and get the sea air in your face, see the sights around the coastline, the harbours, the small islands, the bridge and opera house.Also plenty of seating inside and a little kiosk to buy any drinks or snacks.The ride is smooth and isn't much of a cost, think it's about $5 if i remember correctly.. The port on the other side is pleasant and it's only a 5 minute walk the other side to the beach.

surf city feel. Perfect place to get the surfer feel, even in the winter with shops, hotels, and beautiful beaches. The aquarium is rather small but their penguin exhibit is worth a look. Take a walk along the Olympics walkway for a timeline of Manly Olympians.
As good as Sydney Ferries. Do not take the road if you are going to Manly beach from Sydney, try the ferry and you will love it. The 30 minutes ride itself is an experience you will cherish.

Nice Sightseeing. If you are travelling to Manly, sit on the outdoor area because you can catch the breathtaking view of Opera House and just the sea specially when you returned in the evening during the Vivid Sydney season! Wow!!
Ferry ride and excellent view of Sydney!. 45 minutes of relaxation while cruising on the shore of Sydney and appreciate it's beauty. Give it a try!

Sydney Harbour, good one day, great the next. Sydney harbour is a great way to see the city and shore line..A ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly is a great ride, got off at Many, do shopping have a bite to eat and ride the ferry back, You will have a great day. even on a bad day it is still great. Sometime is heavy weather the ride gets a bit rough, but just adds to the enjoyment.

Cheapest Way to Cruise the Harbour. This is an iconic journey passing the Opera House, crossing the heads and arriving in peaceful Manly Cove. The journey across the harbour offers many photo opportunities and you can walk around during the journey. Family friendly with snack bar and toilets on board. Walk through the Corso to Manly Beach lots of food options from fish and chips, pubs and boutique restaurants and bars. Recommend the walk from Manly Beach to Shelley Beach after lunch. Stroller friendly wide concrete path and pretty ocean views. Can be crowded in summer and on weekends so week days are best options to avoid crowds. If going swimming at Manly Beach swim in the patrolled areas. Rips (currents that take you out into the ocean) are a danger particularly to tourists who can be unaware of beach conditions. Stay safe and swim between the flags.

A nice 45 minute ferry experience. This short 45 minute ride from Circular Quay to Manly is a great experience. A must do stuff if you are visiting Sydney, not juts for the ride, but for the awesome manly beach too... not to forget, a portion of Fish and Chips and some lager!
MANLY Ferry ride with the sunset... simply BRILLIANT!. We took the ferry ride around 4.30PM, JUNE 2015 (Winter). Simply awesome to witness the sun set on the memorable ferry ride.

Great Views of Sydney Harbor. We took the ferry to Many Wharf and back. Do not purchase tickets from tourist sites. Buy your tickets right at Circular Quay. We had great views of the harbor (harbour :-)), and its many buildings, boats, etc. The journey takes about 30 minutes. We were pleasantly surprised by the affordable souvenirs in Manly when compared to the high prices we found in Sydney. I'm glad our Australian friends all recommended that we ride the ferry when in Syndey.

Forty Five Minutes to Relax. Very relaxing ferry ride. We had a beautiful day. Went to the Good Food And Wine festival on Manly. A good way to see Sydney Harbor with the Opera House and Sydney Harbor Bridge.
Superb Day Trip. I've been here a couple of times now and love the atmosphere of the place. It has a fabulous beach and there are plenty of places for good food and drink.

Great ferry trip with wonderful views of Iconic Sydney. This is a really nice little ferry trip from Sydney Harbour to Manly, and worth the ride even if you turned straight around for the return journey (although Manly is worth a visit, too). The views of Iconic Sydney are fantastic, and really spectacular if you return after dark. The ferries run about every 20 minutes, although after 9pm it is every 45 minutes until just before 1am. There is plenty of room outside and inside, and it is only about a 20 minute ride each way. At $15 return per person, it's a steal!

Great views on the Manly Ferry. Great and cheap way to get onto Manly Beach from Circular Quay. Only 30 mins, with a breathtaking view of the Sydney harbour, Opera House and the bridge. Offer coffee and ice cream on board, which was great. Very relaxing ride, and overall amazing trip!
Sydney to Manly. Excellent ferry service to Manly Beach and did not take long.I took it on a very busy summer Sunday, but well organized and equipped to handle the crowds.

Easy ride to Manly, great views. I love this trip. The views of the bridge and Opera house are spectacular. Just a short distance on a comfortable, inexpensive ferry brings you to the beautiful beaches of Manly
Nice views of sydney harbor. Nice scenic with a good ride, though it gets crowded sometimes the manly beach is a 10 min walk from the manly ferry terminal

Relaxing. A great way to while away a couple of hours, very relaxing. Grabbed a coffe on board and sat outside and took in the sights. Had a bit of walk around manly precinct for heading back to the city.
Must have Ride. Amazing ride from circular quay,it's cheap and very good. I enjoyed the ferry, and the view is cool.

Awesome views of the harbour and skyline. We travelled from Darling Harbor to Manly Bay - the views over the harbor and the skyline of Sydney were breathtaking! Sydney Harbor is so much bigger than we ever realized as we travelled through it on the ferry. This is a well worth the experience trip.

Never tire of the Manly Ferry. Every trip to Sydney we take a trip from Circular Quay to Manly.
The harbour always produces new experiences.From yacht racing to visiting vessels to Son et Lumiere for departing cruise ships and mirror seas to capping swells. It is a working harbour best seen from a Manly Ferry. Rock music to wifi hotspots are part of the standard offerings.

Quick easy and good for sightseeing. Manly Ferry was the idle way to travel and explore Manly.
Quick and easy to bored with friendly staff greeting us.
Hopped on board and went to the top to see the sun and look around the harbour.
Fast way to get to and from Sydney for a day in Manly.
Well worth it!. Highly recommend using a day in Sydney and taking the ferry to Manly. Great views from the ferry through the harbor and Manly is a great town to walk around and spend the day in.
A jolly good trip. The Manly ferry is always good value. I used to go to work from Manly to Sydney years ago and the ferry still captivates me years later!

Fantastic views. We travelled one evening after viewing Vivid from Sydney to Manly on the ferry and we had the most amazing views looking back over the harbour, bridge and Opera House. The weather was fine and warm and the seas were calm.
Fantastic trip.

Great day out. We took the ferry to Manly and it was the best! A great view of the harbour from many vantage points. Spent the day in Manly, walked to North Fort and enjoyed the view. Great outdoors adventure.
Lovely relaxing trip. If your prone to seasickness good idea to take 1/2 kwells before this trip can get a liittle rocky near the heads! But well worth it and lovely destination
The best view of Vivid Sydney, Circular Quay.. We bought a cruise to see Vivid Sydney that was disappointing for $49. We got a better viewing from the $7.60 Manly Ferry the next night.
What a view!. Amazing views when you approach Sydney Harbour! The view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge are just splendid!

Great little cruise. Boarded at 10 am for the 35 minute cruise to Manly well worth the price 15 dollars return plenty of room on this ferry and room inside if weather is bad .Luckily we had great weather don't miss this if your in Sydney.
Must do ferry ride. Sydney harbour is just beautiful and the views from the ferry are gorgeous. Excellent way to travel between the gorgeous Manly beach and Circular Quay.

A worthwhile excursion.. A beautiful way to see Sydney at a leisurely pace. We went Manly in daylight and returned after dark which was brilliant. You can sit in or outside and see the sights in comfort. Plenty of opportunities for great photos, or just relax in the café.You certainly notice when you pass the heads that lead to the open sea just before Manly. The boat is big enough to allow you to get some great views. Don't worry if you don't have sealegs: it isn't too rough and doesn't last too long.

A great way to see the skyline. This is a great way to see Sydney from the harbour without having to pay expensive tourist boats. You also get the advantage of going to Manly. Sit outside if weather permits and take your camera!
Great views. You can see the Opera House and bridge perfectly from here. Quite short but very smooth. Manly Beach is lovely too.

Cheap as chips for a day out. It's a nice way to see the harbour but the swarm of tourists can be pretty annoying. I found it better to take a standing spot on the side of the boat rather than follow the crowds to the seating areas at the front and back. Only costs $3-4.
Great way to see the harbour. Great way to see the harbour and end up in Manly where you can swim at the famous beach or just stroll along the Esplanade.

Cheapest way to see round the Harbour. This is the cheapest and best way to see the Harbour and surrounding areas, Manly Beach is lovely and also the Aquarium. It is a nice clean boat and shows you all the sights that you want to see and you have to just have your guide book with you and you will know what you are looking at.

Brilliant way to see Sydney Harbour. Not only do you get to see some of Sydney's best sights it will also get you to to the beachside suburb of Manly for a great day out. If you have the stomach for it try the trip when it is a stormy day.......it can leave the best roller coasters for dead!

Manly Ferry rocks. Wonderful ferry ride across the Sydney Harbour. Beautiful views and a great way to see everything Sydney has to offer. A must do if you're coming here. 30 minutes each way plus a bit of time in Manly. We had breakfast and then went to the beach, had an ice cream and enjoyed the great weather.
Great intro to Sydney. So much of Sydney's initial appeal for a visitor is the harbour, so why not see it the best way on a seven mile trip to Manly. You'll be a thousand miles from care. Enjoy.

" A Great Way To Have Restful Recreation!". Travelling to and from Manly from Circular Quay by Ferry is absolutely delightful. For one thing, these ferries start on time and arrive on time. In addition, the views are superb and it is a novel pleasure to sit back and relax without having to drive and find a car park and so on.

Love the Manly Ferry!!. The Manly Ferry is great... Lovely ice creams and beautiful coffee
available as soon as you leave Circular Quay.... Then sit back and click away with the beautiful pics you can get of the Sydney Harbour Bridge!! They even have free Wifi on board
The slow boat to the city.... The Colleroy Ferry has its charm as an old boat but it is the quintessential slow boat to the city...
Scenic. We took this ferry to the zoo. We were able to get some of the best photos of the Sydney skyline, bridge and Opera House from the ride. Highly recommend!

The best way to see Sydney Harbour. A trip by ferry from Circular Quay to Manly is my guarantee of the best way to see Sydney Harbour and relatively inexpensive. A cruise to Manly exposes you to great places to dine....things to see and do, like the Manly Aquarium......and of course a fabulous beach.You cannot come to Sydney without taking a day out to see the Harbour from the Harbour. You see the famous Sydney Harbour Bridge, the iconic Sydney Opera House and you see them from the Harbour........A great day out!
Loving Manly. I have travelled the Manly Ferry many of times, thru some really solid seas too. A great trip to & from Manly. A must do if you have some spare time in Sydney, plan for a whole day.

Cool ride with amazing views. I was lucky to have this ride as a daily commute to work for a while. It is fantastic when you take the ferry early in the morning to see the sun rising just over the ocean. You also have a nice view on the Opera House, Botanic Garden... So definitely worth going during your days in Sydney. The Ferry is just 2.50 on a Sunday with your Opal Card, but I would probably even more recommend to go during the week then it is not so busy, sit outside, chill and enjoy the view.

Step back in time. The Manly ferry is a Sydney treasure. Fares are subsidised by the taxpayer, a change to cross the Heads (not recommended for those prone to sea sickness), so much to see, and the ferries have priority at all time - bad luck for sailing boats in regattas that forget this deviation from the usual rules of the road applying to boats.

Cheap harbour trip and see Manly. Buy a return ticket to Manly and enjoy the 30 minute trip on the harbour - great scenery including the Opera House and the Bridge - probably the cheapest way to see the harbour. Manly has a lot to offer: wonderful surf beach and cosmopolitan cafe walk from the ferry to the surf. Turn right at the beach and head south to take a walk up through the bush to see the gun emplacements and the old School of Artillery at the top. Don't forget to cool off at the end in the surf! An interesting and cheap day out.
lovely trip. We went over to see Manly beach. Theres some great scenery to be photographed whilst on board. Great views of the opera house and the harbour bridge.

Wash away your JET LAG.. A ferry trip from beautiful Circular Quay to Manly is a wonderful way to start your Sydney holiday..Stroll up The Corso at Manly to it's famous beach and watch the board riders then browse the shops on the way back to the ferry -dont miss the fabulous ice cream or coffee shops and enjoy the unforgetable view of the Opera House as you return to the Quay.

Short Trip Must Experience. It's only a 30 minute trip but you will see and experience the best that Sydney Harbour has to offer. You will pass by the Harbour Bridge and Opera House with wonderful views, and don't forget your camera!At Manly destination you will see more beautiful sea side places to visit and to eat at and the walk around to Shelley Beach is wonderful and so enjoyable.
The Harbour. An easy, inexpensive way to see beautiful Sydney Harbour and you can get off for a walk if you like.If you are eligible for the pensioner discount it is ridiculously cheap

Cheapest way to have a trip on the water. This is definitely the easiest and cheapest way to take pictures in Sydney harbour. For just over AU$7 you get the most fantastic views. Use an Opal card to pay which can be picked up at most convenience stores (it's like the London Oyster card), and can also be used on the buses and the local trains.
Nice view during the trip. Love the view, we could see Sidney Opera along the way. However, the ferry was quite full, so it was difficult to get a picture without people's head covering the view

Convenient but Long Queue on weekends. We paid the visit to Manly on Sunday (in April). The crowd was too big and we spent almost an hour to get on board to ferry. Luckily the ferry service is good, and it it clean and fast. We truly recommend people to use ferry as 1 of the transport if they are in Sydney.

"Ordinary" commuting ferry, better than most "specialised" tourist rides. This is, seemingly, and ordinary commuting ferry. Sydnysiders use it every day to go to and from work. At the same time it is one of the most beautiful half an hour you will have spent on the water anywhere in the world. The spectacular, and changing views you will encounter will be worth a lot more than the price of the ticket. If you happen to go at peak hour, take to slow ferry, not the faster cats. They hare for busy and harried commuters to and from work. Once in Manly, make sure you walk to the beach, sit down at one of the many caffes, and take in the atmosphere at one of the worlds most famous beaches.
Manly Ferry is a must!. Great views, make sure no matter how cold it is outside that you get a seat outside for the views! Cafe on board!Cheap and efficient!

iconic thing to do. If you are in Sydney for any length of time a trip by ferry to Manly is a must. Seeing the harbour from our ferries is inexpensive and a great way to travel. Once at Manly, check out the cafes, beaches and ice creameries. Walk all the way to Shelley Beach. the views are gorgeous. Sydney is the best!!!

The best value ferry ride in Sydney. If you are visiting Sydney this is a must! It is the cheapest ride on Sydney waters - it takes half an hour and then you end up in Manly which is a lovely seaside suburb its uniqueness is that its a peninsula with harbour on one side and ocean on the other.So visitors take a trip on this ferry and don't forget to take lots of pictures of the bridge and opera house.

Cheapest way of seeing the harbour. Take the slow ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and enjoy the sail. You will not get a 'talk' but you will see the sights. The slow ferry is approx 30 minutes each way.
Day trip to Manly. A lovely day out..across the waters to Manly...wander around have lunch via the Entertainment book..good value re meals/snacks/ice creams!

Best way to see Sydney Harbour. Besides being an easy way to travel between the city and Manly, it's one of the best ways to see Sydney Harbour. It's a bit more exciting if there's a good ocean swell, as you pass the heads, but don't be put off by this - it only lasts for about 10 minutes. Most days it's like flat water. Of course, pick a Sunny day.All visitors to Sydney should do this trip. When you get tom Manly, make sure you walk down the street and around the corner to the surf - some people miss this (don't realise it's there).

Good service. Good service.We boarded at Manly and enjoyed to trip to Circular Keys, you're there in no time at all. Lovely views along the way. Ferries run regularly pick up a timetable so as to plan your stay in Sydney. The ferry terminal is equipped with cafes and shops. Worth a visit.
A great way to see the harbor. Manly beach was both touristy and beautiful. If you have a spare afternoon, it is worth the scenic ferry ride to check it out.

Great views of the harbour and Opera House.. Get your cameras ready-This is a great trip to do if you are a tourist to Sydney, come rail hail or shine..but hang on if the swell is up! These extremely large, safe ferries are very comfortable to travel on. There is a well stocked snack bar selling hot and cold snacks, toilets on board and every seat has a fantastic view of the opera house and harbor as you sail by. When you alight at Manly you will wander through a very interesting shopping strip which takes you straight down to the beach. Loads of cafes and beachy shops. Enjoy!!
Well worth the trip. Had a great time visitng Manly. The ferry trip gives you such great views of the harbour bridge and opera house.

Cheap & convenient way to see the city. The best way to see Sydney Harbour is from the water and the cheapest way to do that is on a Manly Ferry. The ferries leave regularly from Circular Quay and the view you'll get on the way there can't be beaten. Obviously you won't have any commentary on what your seeing on the way but the cost is a fraction of the price you'll pay with the private tour operators. I recommend heading over mid afternoon, having a swim or stroll along manly beach, grabbing some dinner and catching an evening ferry back in the dark. There are some fabulous photo opportunities from the water as you head back into the city at night with the bridge and opera house all beautifully lit up. Tickets can be purchased at Circular Quay or you can travel on your day ticket or Opal card if you have one. Some of the ferries have a kiosk on board which sell snacks and drinks as well.
Fantastic for a sunny day. Great little trip for locals and visitors alike. A brilliant way to see Sydney harbor, the heads and Manly
Enjoyable. Great way to see the harbor and explore Manly Beach. Comfortable, easy, fast. Enjoyed our afternoon.

Ahoy me hearties. Great trip. Really good price and affordable for all. Definitely recommended.
Character ferry - great for holiday pics too.

Must do when in Sydney. Great way to catch in all the views around Sydney Harbour.
If you go outside on deck you are able to take some wonderful photos

Blast from the past. Great way to travel to the city or to Manly. My daughter had not been on the Manly Ferry before so it was an excellent way to view the Harbour. I always love coming into Sydney Cove on a Ferry and to be dropped off minutes from the Rocks is such a bonus. This is just as much fun in winter as it is in summer

Definite to do. Okay, I knew little about the town of Manly. This ferry is not so cheap as US ferries - sorry can't recall the price but not just $2-$3. You could easily take this ferry and spend a few hours in Manly, checking out the surfing beaches and cute town. I had already had lunch but wished I had dined there. Cute place and interesting.

ATour of Sydney Harbour and Iconic Manly Beach for the Cost of a Public Transport Ticket. I'm a very lucky Sydneysider who enjoys the natural beauty of our Harbour and The Heads while commuting on public transport. The large and stable, Manly Ferry travels from the Ouay on the edge of downtown, past the Opera House, The Harbour Bridge, Botanic Gardens, the top end eastern suburbs waterfront homes, South and North Head where the harbour opens to the sea and ends the "tour" at Manly - a beautiful area of Sydney with lots to do and see. It runs back and forth all year from early to late. All this for a public transport ticket price!

Iconic. One of my favourite things to do in Sydney beautiful views. Make sure to go upstairs out to the front and enjoy the fresh air. Once you reach Manley you have great day wandering along the Corso and to the ocean views. There are lots of resturanta and walks

A good way to get to Manly. Comfortable ride in the ferry to Manly. From the ferry, we had a close up view of Sydney Opera House. We could also see a lighthouse in the distance as the ferry approached Manly. Beautiful views on either side of the ferry.

Had an amazing time while on school excursion, impressive how racist passenger was handled. I have made an account just to share this experience. I was on a class excursion, travelling from Manly when two of my Muslim classmates that wear a hijab experienced harassment and islamophobic behavior from a passenger. As they got up from the seat, a woman began calling them "muslim terrorists" and swearing at them, humiliating them and making one of them cry. The captain of the ferry was informed of what happened, and fortunately the woman was kicked off the ferry. I would just like to thank the staff for making it such an enjoyable experience and for not tolerating such behaviour. With this day and age where racism and islamophobia is very common, I was very impressed with the way the situation was handled.

Rose Bay to Circular Quay and to Manly. The Sydney Ferry Services were on time and the vessels were comfortable and in great condition. We departed the ferry in Manly and walked the harbour foreshore to the Spit Bridge.

If you have never done it - its a must. The old Manly ferry route has been carrying passengers for years but the iconic nature, beautiful view and destinations on both sides make it a must.Not only is the trip across a great way to have a water view of the Harbour and the iconic Opera House and Harbour Bridge, but both Circular Quay and Many ar beautfiul destinations and places to explore.I fully recommend to all.

Sydney family fun on the ferry. Sydney is big and brash and a shock to a bushie from country South Australia but time spent on the Harbour is magic. I just love it when the Pacific swells come through the Heads and I will never forget sharing the rockin' and the rollin' with my 12 year old grandson. Beautiful memory.

Just your run of the mill ferry service.. This is a good an inexpensive way to see some of the most picturesque views on Sydney Harbour. The ferry cruises between Manly and Circular Quay where you can shop or dine at either end.

Well worth it!. It takes 30 minutes but the journey and sights of the harbour and surrounds is actually breathtaking and makes me want to move to Sydney. The line up to get on is the most annoying thing. Get an Opal Card it's a must for public transport.

Great!. Excellent, used the ferry quite a lot. Reasonable cost. Manly is such a nice place to hang out. I know there were different ferrys one is much faster than the other but I missed out on that one.
nice way to see the harbor. great views of the sydney harbor on the way to manly. ferries depart every 30 minutes, so also pretty convenient.

Time it well, and get a good seat. If the weather is nice, and you are at the front deck, you will love the whole experience.. Beautiful views of Opera House, and Harbor Bridge are an added advantage...A perfect inclusion to your day trip to Manly!

"Best 30 min ride you will ever have". What better way to see one the worlds best cities than on the water !! Quite simply a great view of Sydney and the beautiful harbour. They say that the Staten Island ferry in NYC is the best $2 rides in the world - well ladies and gentlemen this ride and scenic view from the Manly ferry beats that !!!!

Reliable and amazing views. The half hour ride on the Manly ferry will take you along the Opera House and across Port Jackson. From there you will have a view on the city skyline and the Bridge. Arriving in Manly, you will discover lots of shops and restaurants along a street leading to the beach. It can be very busy on a Sunday afternoon and you will share space with families and surf boarders. Make sure you get to the ticket booth ahead of time and on board grab the first seat you can because they fill-up very quickly.
See the harbour. Great way to see the harbour and all the sights there - bridge, opera house, etc. Sydney is city based on its harbour and you get the sense of it crossing to Manly.

One of Sydney Harbour's traditions. Manly Ferries - the stately ladies of Sydney Harbour! They may be old but still provide a fantastic way to see the harbour in all its splendour, providing the best views of the Opera House, Bridge and Bradleys Head, The trip can be quite exciting if there's a good sea coming through the Heads causing the ferries roll - great fun! They also give the fastest way of commuting to and from ManlyA must for all visitors.
Manly ferry. We travelled 4 times on the ferry on this visit to Sydney. We enjoy the harbour scenery and it is a very cost effective way to see the harbour
Manly. Took another couple over to Manly ,Went for a walk to the beach ,had a lovely lunch of fish @ chips at a small cafe.Very enjoyable couple of hours before we boarded the ferry back to the Quay
Nice. Nice ferry ride on a sunny day. Approximately 30 minutes at a cost of $15 return. Very nice to walk on Manly beach.

can skip if you have full programm. its ok if you middle age traveller, not keen of active participant and have nothing to do.its rather boring and actually u see nothing.actually you can have better trip /cryuise by taking a normal ferry and go tru the river until the end (paramatta) i used to do that 15 years ago. i took public bus, ferry ,its cheaper and fun. u can see more
Day at Manly. Easy to get there my ferry. Walked around and enjoyed the shopping and beaches. Had lunch overlooking the water at Bavarian Beer Café. Caught the ferry back to the Quay. Lovely day....
Travel. Spent the day on Manly travelling by ferry, lovely trip with excellent views of the bridge and the opera house on route. Not much to dislike

Great sights on a commuter voyage. Sydney Harbour is gorgeous, the trip passes many interesting landmarks, the ferries have character and a range of seating inside and out, and the locals are mostly very friendly and helpful. Avoid commuter hours unless you like the hustle and bustle, and allow plenty of time to explore Manly, especially the seafront at the other end of the road from the terminal.
Great Ferry. Safe and easy way to get to Manly. We had rough water due to the weather and had no issues on the ferry. Excellent way to travel.

good way to get overview of harbor. purchased hop on, hop off ticket. if you plan to hop on and off a lot, start early in morning. Ride alone to orient first day there without hop on and off may be pleasant.
Great Day Out. Fantastic service, Great to go across the harbour to Manly. Ferry very clean and we had a smooth crossing. Staff helpful and friendly. A must do when visiting Sydney.

Worth ir. Second time I have travelled on the Ferry while in Sydney. At night it is a great way to see the harbour in lights. This time there was a decent swell when passing the 'heads' causing the ferry to rock and roll so lots of fun. Manly is an unique destination and the ferry is a great way to travel and see the scenery at the same time

Good way to get to Manly. Beautiful views as the ferry head out through the harbour. The ferry has a cafe and amenities. Get on first to sit outside and get the best views. Only downside 30 minute departures on Sunday.

Great ferry ride. The Manly Ferry is a must to do when visiting Sydney. The ferries are very comfortable and leave on a regular basis. Manly itself is a great place to visit with Shops, Cafes/Restaurants and beautiful beach not too far from the Ferry Terminal.

the cheapest 30 minute harbour cruise in Sydney. The commuter ferry from circular quay ferry terminal to manly is well worth the ticket price. Manly has a nice oceanfront with lots of restaurants, cafes, pubs and shopping opportunities to enjoy on arrival. The walk around to shelly beach along the pedestrian walkway has great views of the coastal scenery and luxury homes. The views of the city skyline, opera house and harbour bridge on the return trip to the city are wonderful especially at sunset. Sundays get very busy due to discounted travel on the opal electronic ticketing system. It is only $2.50 for all day travel on train bus ferry and light rail on a pre paid reloadable opal travel smartcard that must be pre purchased from an opal card retailer before travel. The cards are not sold by or able to be reloaded by any of Sydney's transport operators ticket agents which is pretty silly..
Iconic Sydney Ferry. Great way to see Sydney harbour, great views of Opera House & Sydney Harbour Bridge. Manly is a great day out, beautiful beaches & great food.
Great trip. Manly ferry was the way to travel over there for shopping and dining - return trip - met locals and international travellers -think we dined at Phat Thai - great food.
Manly Ferry. Very nice scenery, witness the Sydney harbour on the way between Circular Quay and Manly Ferry Point.

Must do. Ferry was nice. caught a early morning 7 am ferry to manly as had a flight to gold coast that day. Was worth the visit. Round trip was 1 hour 30mins. Must sit on the deck while coming from manly to sydney & njoy the view!

Beach day only a 30 min ride from Sydney. We took the ferry over to Manley. Easy as can be. We had the 7 day pass. A short walk from the ferry to the sand. We just followed everyone else. We rented 2 beach chairs and an umbrella for about $30. Sat on the beach for about 4 hours and soaked up the gorgeous sun. It was snowing back in Philly. There are shops and eateries all along the way, anything you want. A great day.

great way to visit Sydney's bay and to see local people's lifestyle. This is not a tourist ferry but a cheap public service. It is a great way to cross the bay from Sydney and see another town on the other side of the bay. It is of course a very nice way to see Sydney's skyline when you come back by the same ferry.The ferry start from Circular quay, close to the Sydney Opera.

First rate. We used the Mnaly ferry a couple of time from Circular Quay 7 found the trip to be reasonably priced and being able to use your Opal card was we think a bit of a bonus, the only thing I would suggest is that you get down to the ferry quite early as it has a tendency to get very crowded as it is so popular. The whole trip across takes about 20 minutes I think as I didn't time it as I was too busy taking in the views around Sydney Harbour from looking back to the Bridge & Opera House as well as all the other wonderful views. If visitors do nothing else the ferry trip if only once is a must. Manly itself is well worth the visit as the beach is beautiful even if it can get a bit crowded sometimes.

Frequently visit. Taking a trip to Manly by Ferry is a must when in Sydney. I live in Sydney and it is my favourite day out either with friends or with family and visit several times a year. Beautiful views along the way of the harbour. Many good restaurants and cafes along Many beach. Three beaches to choose from, one without waves. Also a rock pool if you have children. Stay all day and return on a late ferry to capture stunning sunsets over the city skyline.
good way to see sydney from the water. the ferry was full but manly is a pretty little suburb it has a nice beach, many shops and also a walking track which you can take

A great way to see the harbor. The ferry ride was very pleasant and inexpensive. Even though there was a good swell, it was very comfortable. And Manly was great for surfing and hiking. A great way to spend a day.

Fantastic way to see sydney harbour. Regardless of rain, hail or shine this is a wonderful way to experience the beautiful harbour and see the suburbs dotted along its shoreline. On some ferries you can sit outside as well as inside, there are toilets and a cafe for snacks on board. The trip to Manly is about 40 minutes and in good weather is very comfortable. Beware in rough weather as it can get a bit rocky. The ferries don't operate in extremely bad weather but this is a rare occasion.

Great day trip. We took the Sydney harbour ferry to Manly for a wonderful day visiting this beautiful area. The beach is one of the best, caters to all and has great beach facilities. Local restaurants offered a variety of choices. This ferry ride give you a great opportunity to view Sydney harbour.

Sydney highlight and then some. Let me confess right away,I am a big fan of boat and ferry trips,come to that train journeys too.The Manly ferry is right up there with the best of ferry trips - think Staten Island in New York and The Star in Hong Kong and you get the idea.It could not be more simply located at Circular Quay,which is also a hub for train and buses.If you have an Opal card you "tap-on" but on this service there is no need to "tap-off".the cost is 14$AUS for the return trip and it takes around 30 minutes or so each way. The views of the Harbour are truly exceptional on the trip outward.The Manly quay is right in the heart and upon disembarkation everything is right in front of you and an excellent day can be passed there with its beautiful beach and myriad offers of food and beverages to suit all tastes.If you plan your return to Circular Quay to coincide with sunset you will be assured of the majestic nighttime views of Sydney Harbour,and of course Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge.I would not have missed the Manly Ferry for all the tea in China!

This is how some people commute too work!!. Visitors to Sydney should definitely tick this off their list. Fantastic views of the world 's most gorgeous harbour and when you get there one of Sydney's best beaches in a city chocker block full of them. Excellent shopping precinct and a plethora of fantastic restaurants is an added bonus

Excellent link to City. Great way to travel from Manly to Sydney if holidaying or just going to work, excellent way to see inner harbour views of Sydney especially as you come round the Opera House, and its fun.

To see Sydney Harbour, take the Manly Ferry!. There really is a cheap and best way to view the magnificence of Sydney's huge, beautiful Harbor, and that is take a return trip on one of the green and yellow Manly Ferries from Circular Quay next to the ocean liner terminal. But pick a really nice day for this trip. And when you get to Manly- an 8 mile ride, disembark and walk around to the surf beach, enjoy a lunch at one of the many excellent restaurants there and then come back on the return trip on the opposite side so you get to view the "other" shore.This has to be one of cheapest and most enjoyable trips afloat anywhere in the world!
Late lunch & drinks on a Sunday. Beautiful cross over the bridge. Paci chulo for lunch few beers a Bavarian beer cafe markets, walk around stylish manly foreshore! This is sydney welcome hipsters☺️
Manly Ferry. Manly ferry is a great way to enter Sydney CBD, magnificent view of the bridge, Opera House and city for little cost.

Harbouring Memory - I couldn't resist the pun!. Did a half day trip - sunny outward and drizzly return. Manly needs some TLC, but is otherwise like most beach towns - touristy and quaint. The cost is reasonable and no way detracts, but what sold it was actually the drizzly return seeing the harbour bridge and opera house something I had never really thought would conjure such an image or had been of any appeal whatsoever. Total surprise and a pleasurable ride if not choppy but hey it was not a ferry in the North Sea by any ways; however, thoroughly memorable especially on an overcast wet day with few tourists.
check for dolphins!. If you are lucky you may see some of them around when taking this route. Skip bondy beach and go to manly, it is a really nice beach !!

7 miles from Sydney. 7 miles from Sydney on the ferry & you arrive in Manly which they say is a 100 miles from care. Stroll down the corso & see the wonderful beach (take your bathers) or at least have a paddle. Lots of lovely cafes or takeaways to satisfy all tastes, then finally back to the wharf for the return journey.

Easy to use and must do view of the harbour. Great experience and some memorable photo opportunities. Fair price which I paid on Opal card. I used the Opal travel app which gives live timings for all ferries so was able to just walk on without waiting.

A great day out. The Manly Ferry is a great way to view Sydney Harbour and to travel from one place to another. Whilst Manly isn't as good as I remember from my youth it is still a great place to experience Sydney beach culture without visiting the very busy and crowded Bondi. I love walking along the boulevard and there is always something to see! Be warned however that if there is a big swell it can be VERY rocky so make sure you sit outside in the cool air that can help anyone feeling a bit sick!

Come and try it. Great experience and fast ferry service to the most beautiful beach. The breeze is refreshing and the trip is short (not more than 30 minutes in worst case scenario). Just beware of the big crowds which are there to catch up the ferry so book it online or buy the tickets in off peak hours.

Fantastic day out!. We got a great seat up on top. Be careful to wear strong sunblock , I burned a little with 50!! Sydney Harbour is amazing & vast ! It's like a small sea. Well worth the money , super overview.
Fun ferry. This is a very fun ferry to be on. Takes you out to Manly Beach. Very busy beach, but fun at the same time. Go early as it gets crowded late morning.

Awesome views. You have to take this ferry to manly not only to visit but for the views of the harbour bridge!
Also there's free wifi which is nice.
Super efficient service with regular times!

Fantastic harbour trip. An hours trip across the harbour all the iconic views are something else...I would not have missed this trip. Manley is a fantastic superb and well worth making a day of this trip returning on the ferry after dark...the views of the city lights just knock your socks off...try it, I am sure you will agree.

Must do !. Manly is so much nicer than bondi so if you can only do one do Manly, the ferry is cheap and the views are fantastic. Manly and it surrounding area is fantastic, Great beach, nice shops and ace foody places

Best Ferry Trip in Sydney. Wonderful way to approach the city - by ferry from Manly, which takes 30 minutes. There's sometimes a bit of a swell running when the ferry goes across the mouth of the harbour and spray comes up over the sides, but this only lasts for about 5 minutes and can add a bit of excitement to the trip. The views of the foreshores on either side are beautiful. There's a cafe on board where they make good take away coffee.

This is an absolute must. You cannot visit Sydney and not take the ferry to Manly. From the moment you pull out you have the Sydney Harbour Bridge on your left and the Opera House on your right . What a sensational combination.The ferries have been running for as long as I can remember and I always take visitors to Manly for an Icecream and a walk to Manly beach. The restaurants near the pier are very good as well if you want some lunch.This is not to be missed. The Harbour is stunning all the way to Manly. This is the most visually beautiful 40 minutes you will spend.

Manly waves. Love riding on the Manly ferry. Its always on time and a lot of scenic views to see. You can choose the lower deck or upper deck. Its best to go in first so that you can have the best seats which is outside. When the weather is bad make sure to stay inside.

Sunset behind Harbour Bridge from the Manly Ferry. It's an old favorite and "must" for tourists (who needs an expensive cruise!) to take the ferry to Manly. We did it twice, on the afternoon of our arrival for the sunset on our way back to the city. The afterglow in the background of the Harbour Bridge with many photos being taken!

Choose Manly. If you are only going to take one ferry trip, choose Manly. Good view of harbour bridge and great trip. At Manly visit Aldis to stock up on German chocolate. Lots of eating places at Manly - in the harbour building as well as The Corso. The Corso has some arty shops and lots of benches to sit and watch the world go by.
Nice ferry ride. Take the ferry to Manly and enjoy the ride and the views. Ships are quick and clean. Tickets reasonably inexpensive.

Great ride. I caught the ferry back to the city after going on a bus tour to palm beach. It was nearly dark when we left the pier and the trip is only about 20 minutes. We came back into circular quay just on dark and it was magical to see the bridge, opera house and city all lite up
Nice trip. The ferry to Manly was nicer than what we took to the zoo. We took the fast ferry. We prefered Bondi Beach to Manly.
The trip back. The best part of the ferry is the trip back to Sydney. Wonderful views you can't get from Sydney itself. It is worth the trip to Manly. Don't miss it if you have the opportunity.

Public transport at its most elegant.. They write "Manly, 7 miles from Sydney, and million miles from care". The Manly ferry takes you those 7 miles between Circular Quay (right next to the Opera House) to Manly Wharf. In making that journey you get the best views of the Harbour Bridge, the Opera house, Government House in Kirribilli, all all the bays and reserves East of the Harbour Bridge. You also pass across the harbour heads, which depending upon the conditions in the open sea can be quite exciting, or slightly scary. But don't worry you are in safe hands.There is no commentary, though there are leaflets and you can easily find something to read or someone to ask, to inform yourself of the landmarks on your route.The journey takes about 35 minutes and at rush hour it can be crowded. In high seas you can get quite wet if you are out on deck. The cost is something like $8 each way. It does vary depending upon the ticket type you have. I used to get a 'Ferry Ten' where 10 single journeys cost $58, but now there are Opal cards you pay more per journey.
A fun day out. Pick a sunny day. Circular Quay to Manly takes half an hour. Walk from Manly wharf through the Corso to the beach. Plenty of restaurants and cafes. Back to Sydney. A good day out.

Nice trip but quiet rough. We jumped on a ferry from Circular Quay to Manly on a recent family trip. It was very comfortable & I think the best way to see the harbour. There was plenty of room & you could sit inside or out. Unfortunately on the day we went the sea was really rough & I mean ROUGH! Still fun though.

Manly is a must see when in sydney. Manly beach is a great place to go when in sydney. The beach is a must see and a stop at the Ben and Jerry's is also important! The public facilities aren't that nice but you'll manage. For your safety, it's imperative to wear sunscreen during your whole trip because there's a bad ozone hole over Australia so you'll burn immediately, it's free because they know this, ask the lifeguard or get your own!

Fun cruise to Manly. We had beautiful weather for our cruise to Manly. The ride provided us amazing views do the Opera House and the Quay, as well as the beautiful coastline. Pretty reasonable priced....met nice people each way. Enjoyed the ferry ride very much!

Great way to see Sydney Harbour area. The passengers could board and disembark quickly and easily. Good views of all the beaches and landmarks on the way to Manly. It would have been useful to have taken a map of the area for identification purposes.

Scenic. Lovely view of the opera house, harbour bridge and the Sydney coast line.A must do to get to Manly beach. Just a tip; buy an Opal travel card its a cheap way to travel Sydney and is valid on most public transport.

MANLY BEACH. The Ferry to manly beach is a lovely expereince. You can see lovely views of the opera house and the harbour bridge . Manly is very nice place to visit. The beach is very lovely and the walk around the beach is very nice and a lovely expereince.
Easy Access. Easy way to get to Manly Beach, the ferry was clean and the ride was interesting. Manly Beach and the surrounding area was very nice.

Relaxed cruise. . A trip to & from Manly is a most enjoyable experience. The views of the city, Kirribilli, the Heads & Manly is a great day trip. The views of the bridge & opera house are spectacular.
Very busy. Travelled to Manley on the ferry but was very crowded. Don't think we will visit again as prefer Bondi beach

My Fav Thing!!. Best way to get a feel for Sydney and it's people. Go to Manly and walk around.
I grew up here and it is the best thing to do after being away.

Old but the best way to travel to MANLY. Even though the ferry's are old they are kept well, always a buzz always busy and always very enjoyable to travel to the ferry destinations. When l am in Sydney l always take the trip to Manly its scenic and extremely calming.

Great way of maximizing a day in Sydney Australia. Manly Ferry offers a range of destinations as well as bundle packages allowing for fast crossings or site seeing through main touristic sites. A narrative of sites and history is given. All this can be done sitting outside or protected from the elements, we were amazed to note that the larger ferries even had bars, well used by our Ausie hosts! Destinations such as the Zoo and Manly Island provide lots to see and do. Service is frequent, fast and at value for money.
Great journey. About 20 minutes to half an hour and you see the sights. Plenty of photo opportunities. Be adventureous and get outside and take in the fresh air
manly ferry. the best ride for kids and grown ups who like a bit of a thrill while crossing Sydney heads and the reward is Manly for lunch or just a cuppa or an ice cream

Fabulous View of the Harbor Lights!. We got into Sydney late afternoon and decided to take the ferry to Manly Island. We got to the island and walked along the beach and walked the main street across the street. So many neat shops. We had a wonderful meal and headed back. It was dark ( A MUST) and the lights in Sydney Harbor made me vote Sydney Harbor the most beautiful city in the world. You have got to see the lights. The Sydney Harbor Bridge, Opera House and the farris wheel which has been there since the 30's where the solders would meet young girls....all added to the photo ops. No words can discribe this view. It was cold when we where there so take a jacket, mittens and a hat. We were freezing but the view was well worth it. You can go inside for warmth but it was worth the photos that I got. WOW....there is no words that can discribe this view. You must return after dark to take in this view of the lights in the harbor. Fabulous!!!
A lovely day trip. The Manly Ferry is a lovely day trip. The views from the ferry of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House are amazing.

Take the public ferry if you don't have time for a tour. We had a limited time in Sydney and missed the tour boats of the harbor due to our schedule. In the evening we took the Manly Ferry to Manly beech strolled around the manly area and along the Beech. Nice restaurants and a more casual pace in Manly. The ferry runs very late so it can fit the schedule of travelers with limited time at a fraction of the price of a harbor tour.
Take in the views of Sydney's Harbour. A great way to see Sydney from the water and if you go on Sunday the family ticket is really good value
Easy Ferry ride to a lovely destination. Quick, clean and easy ferry ride with great views of Sydney Harbour Bridge on the way. Worth the trip.

A great scenic cruise across Sydney Harbour.. A great scenic cruise across Sydney Harbour with a great beach at the end of it. If you are a Senior you can use your card and the cost is only $2.50 return.
Day trip with mates. You just can't beat the view coming back into Sydney harbour on the ferry from manly it is just awesome. Great way to travel and see the harbour.
run to new world. ride ferry so good seeing life surround you views are great short 30 minute ride best in world on beautiful Sydney harbour

How do you give a Ferry a Rating?. The Manly ferry is a larger craft than the others. Punctual. Food and drink offerings are ho hum, but the view is spectacular. Wirth the trip even if you just go and return.

Cross the opening to Sydney Harbour. The Manly Ferry is a must on any Sydney visit, it is a half hour ride from Circular Quai. The ferry leaves every half hour, on the hour and on the half hour. It is a fantastic ride. In Manly visit the Corso, the beach, and if you feel up to it walk over to Shelley Cove, it is equally beautiful and there is a nice café/restaurant on Shelley Beach.

Ferry View offers unique view. The manly ferries run like clockwork on a regular basis, and take you out of the relative hub-bub of a busy city to a lovely quiet part of Sydney. Manly is effectively on the edge of the natural harbour that Sydney finds itself in, so it is has seas on one side and the vast harbour on the other. The journey takes about 25 mins, but is an experience in itself. Manly has lots of tourist shops and eateries so great for any time of the day.

What a view ..... On the ferry over to Manly, I could not believe the view looking back to Sydney. When we arrived in Manly it was amazing . So many surfers and a fabulous cafe on the beach to sit and watch the surfers. Really nice walks along the beech. Great restaurants. So many activities.
Do it. Great trip to get spectacular views of the opera house and the Sydney bridge and a feel for the scope of the harbour.

Loved it!!!!. Was alone during the trip and I really enjoyed it! The scenic spots from the ferry are very beautiful. You will have a close up look a the opera house, the bridge, some villages and ofcourse the harbour. It's one of the best ferry rides ever! Be sure to not miss this out when you are in Sydney!

Quick and Easy with a View. Not only was the ferry easy to manage (buying tickets, boarding), but it was quick, getting to Manly in about 25-30 minutes. Along the ride you'll see tons of breathtaking scenery. You can get there quicker, but this is the way to go, take it all in at a slower pace.

Great way travel. Not only a great way to get to Manly, but also a fantastic way to view the City and get a coffee or soft drink. Remember that the ferry has two bows so if you want to get the best photos make sure you choose the right end to sit!
Cheap tours with a million dollar view. The ride to Manly beach only cost you a few dollars but a million dollars view. a must do when you visit Sydney

What a Ride. Caught the Manly Ferry from the Quay Beautiful harbour and shore views as you pass the Opera House and Fort Denison , lots of sailing activity. Then a bit of a swell as you cross the Heads and into Manly. Great restaurants on the pier at Manly and a walk to the ocean beach at Manly for Fish and Chips on the beach A great day

Loved it. A brilliant start to a day in Manley. This ferry ride made the whole day out a real treat. I liked the mix of commuters and holiday makers on board and the 10 minutes we crossed the heads was choppy but quite exciting

Great way to see Sydney Harbour on the cheap. Join the locals crossing the harbour to various points. Inexpensive. Fantastic views coming back into Sydney Harbour. Recommend day and night (great for lights!)

Great experience in Sydney. Ferry to Manly Wharf is an interesting experience must not miss when visiting Sydney. You can take a fast one like Jetcat which takes a half of travelling time in comparison to the normal ferry. However, taking a ferry during rough sea is a scary experience too, you can see yourself almost get of of your seat unexpectedly, you can feel you facing down toward the water etc. It is also a nice relaxing ride on a calm day where you will pass by a huge open gate to the sea and strong wind.

Ferry Nice. What a great way to see Sydney Harbour. These ferries still have charm (although not as good as the old South Steyne on a winters day with motor exposed) and its a cheap relaxing way to see the harbour, a quick walk to Mnaly Beach have a coffee and head back. Great way to spend the morning.

Get the fast ferry!. Slow, crowded and no bar. Definitely better off getting a Fast Ferry card and using that for only a bit more money.
Also they serve wine which makes the quick trip a pleasure!

Ferry across The Harbour. There isn't too much one can say about a ferry trip (unless it is a very rough one!!), but the Manly Ferry service is excellent - a wonderful way of seeing the backdrop of Sydney's high-rise buildings not to mention the iconic landmarks of the Bridge and Opera House. Manly is a great place to visit away from the business of Sydney - lovely beach and great fish 'n chips (or - being New Zealander's fush 'n chups' !!!!!!)
Fun when not raining!. I went on a rainy day and almost got sea sick! The waves were so big! It was pretty slow to get out there but Manly was well worth it!

Manly Beach & Corso Are A Must When Visiting Sydney. It would be one of Sydney's main attractions as you board at Circular Quay to ManlyIf the sea is a little rough its even more fun but if calm and serene and the sun is out there is no better experience than the ferry to Manly

Cheaper than arriving by liner... The Manly ferry is a great quick way to get that "seen the harbour" feeling. Manly itself is also a reward. All cheaper than one of those round the harbour trips where you get a running commentary, too. And yes, on the way back, you can pretend you are arriving on a great ocean liner!

Best way to see the Harbour. By far the best way to see the harbour, can be very busy so get to the queue early, there will almost always be a space so dont be worried by a big crowd, free wifi on board too.

Good way to get around. Very inexpensive way to get over to Manly from Sydney and spend a day. It arrived and left on time and was clean. Just be sure you are in the correct line at the dock as there are several ferries coming and going next to one another.
Perfect way to see the city. When I use to travel, I always use to get the ferry to get to work in the city. Used to love crusing past the Opera House every morning.Great and cost effective
Professional and Fun. Loved the Ferry. Bring a coat and hat as it gets cold on the water. Loved all the views being on the Ocean. On time and very professional.

Fun cheap entertainment. It was suggested to take this ferry before venturing onto one of the tourist tour boats. It is a good suggestion. About a half hour trip across, you get a few nice views of Sidney harbor, sailboats and few military ships. Take a walk around Manley, get a coffee or ice cream while you take in the surfers and return. About $15.00 with return trip.

Ferry ride to Manly a must. If you enjoy a boat ride this is the most economical ways of doing a tour of Sydney shores. Buy a ticket from kiosk no. 3 . The boats run regularly all day and late into the evening.

Great value for a harbour trip to a beautiful spot. I loved the ferry ride it is value for money. I left to see Manley at around 3.30pm I enjoyed the views of the Opera house and harbour bridge and the ride was pleasant Manley is filled with restaurants, cafés, a beautiful beach and shopping is great On return it was dusk so I had a treat coming back to Sydney at night in awe of all of what the harbour had to offer Worth going when you come to Sydney ( a day out for sure)
nice view of Sydney Harbour. Our favourite family trip to Manly. You can enjoy the view and children like the ocean waves. Lots of photo opportunities.

Best way to see the harbour!. Ferries every 30 mins for the 30 min trip to Manly. Fabulous views as you pull away from the wharf. We didn't have much time so spent just half an hour at one of the bars on the wharf in Manly before hopping on the next ferry back. Efficient and cheap, perfect!
Well worth doing. Run every 30 minutes from Circular Quay and Manly. Really good views of the harbour. Reasonable price and Manly well worth a visit
queued for more than 30 mins for nothing. waited for 30 mins and even the second boat was full. had to run to another terminal to catch something 30 mins later.

Best way if travel. Best way to travel into Sydney from the Northern Beaches. Ferries every half an hour. Clean and comfortable and you have the advantage of the amazing views of Sydney Harbour Bridge as you come into Circular Quay. A half an hour of pure pleasure.
fast ferry. Took the fast ferry to Manley. Took about 20 minutes. Manley has a beautiful beach and is well worth a visit.

Great way to get to Manly - Fantastic Sights. We travelled by this vessel to Manly. Make sure you take your camera as there are some great views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Oh.... And Manly is amazing! My favourite Sydney beach, it tops Bondi (too busy) and Coogee

The Best way to get in and out of the city. Ill start by saying that i really really don't like public transport....one of the few rides that passes is the Manly ferry. I always love taking a seat out the back so i can watch either manly or the city until it disappears. Even in winter time you're protected enough that you can enjoy the view without freezing to death. Its a half an hour trip and for all the sites you get to see along the way it has to be one of the cheapest tourist sight seeing options.... on sunday its super cheap going from the qua to manly and then FREE coming back!
Great views. Great ferry and amazing views. Can be overcrowded at times, especially on the weekends. Expect long queues.
Great way to get to Manly!. Wonderful way to cross Sydney Harbor over to Manly, and Manly beaches. Timely and reasonably priced!

A different perspective. A great day out and lovely views from the ferry. Inexpensive, especially with an Opal card. Ferries run regularly and fill up fast in summer months. Probably good to allow a minimum of half a day for this trip so that you can have a good look around Manly and the attractions and beach.

The Manly Ferry and our Harbour. The ferry is a great and cheap way to see the beautiful Sydney Harbour, the Bridge, the Opera House and all the sites along the way.The beautiful homes on the harbour, the historic Fort Dennison. Then when you reach the other side the view of the heads, the the lovely town of Manly, were you can walk around , see the sites, great dinning places.

Great views. This is really a commuter trip, but what a trip. The views of Sydney Harbour, the Opera House and the Bridge are amazing and I never tire of this trip. The boats are functional with their iconic green and yellow colour scheme, but very punctual and comfortable.
Manly Ferry. Ideal mode of transport to Manly,runs every 30 mins....like a mini cruise.......Manly is a great place to visit.....beautiful beach and great shops to wander around

A relaxing way to travel. We live on the northern beaches and when time permits we take the bus to Manly and catch the ferry to the City. It is a very relaxing way to go and of course there is always something different to see on the great Sydney Harbour. The ferries run to schedule , are clean and provide a most useful service to business people as well as tourist. A very pleasant experience

Manly ferriy. Great trip to manly lots of restaurants and pubs at the end. Small shopping mall. Lovely beaches. If you have a seniors card get a day ticket for the trains costs $2.50 and includes the ferry for the whole day. very good value. Plus you get to see the harbour views.

Great thing to do. Catching the ferry to manly is great way to get out on the harbour.Can be rough even on what look like calm days. Great views of beaches, sites, houses and other vessels.Walk to beach enjoy fish and chips, keeping eye on seagulls which will swoop and take chips out of hand!Then to pub and have drink on balcony with million $ views.

Not to be missed. This 30 minute ferry ride is Sydney's equivalent to the Staten Island Ferry in New York, with the important difference that when you get to Manly there are lots of things to do and see. Walk a few minutes to the famous ocean beach, enjoy lunch at any of dozens of cafes and pubs (but the cafes on the Corso - main pedestrian walk between the wharf and the beach - are very touristy and ordinary). The walk from the southern end of the ocean beach around to Fairy Bower and Shelly Beach (less than 1km) is well worth doing.

Good efficient service. For $7 this is an excellent value trip & affords superb views of Sydney Harbour, and the Opera House & CBD on the return leg.If you were to take one of the Harbour Cruises it will cost you an awful lot more, but the views are still the same.Another bonus is that if you use public transport, and buy an "Opal Card", and top it up with $25, that will cover all your transport fees for a whole week. In other words the max you can spend is $25, thereafter all your journeys are at zero cost.Additionally that max fare on a Sunday is $2.50, once you have spent that amount all other journeys on buses. trains or ferries are free! Truly excellent.

A must-do if you've never done it. The best way to see Sydney on the cheap. It's public transport for commuters but heaps of tourists too - Manly is a great day trip. My favourite is a walk to Shelley Beach and then up onto North Head

Long queue on weekend. On sunday you can get a family pass for $2,5 per family (2 adults and 2 children), so we take a ferry to manly, overall its a great transportation to manly. But there will be a long queue when you go back to city around 6-8 pm.

Best and Cheapest Way to See Sydney Harbour, Opera House, Sydney Heads and Harbour Bridge. My first recommendation for out of towners is to catch the Ferry to Manly, have a swim in the Pacific Ocean, grab something to eat and come back to the city at Sunset. No better way to see the city, harbour. Hopefully you get a bit of swell as you near the heads to give you a rocking experience!!

The best commute in the world. The ferries are a bit dated, but ultimately the view is fantastic. Spend your time looking out of the window, taking in the sites around Manly, North Head, the numerous inlets and headlands through the harbour, then finally the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and city skyline. If going in winter, be sure to take a coat with you as the cold is biting!

The best Ferry ride. I always have loved to travel in a ferry and a ride on the Manly ferry was one of the best.The weather held on and we had a brat smooth ride.We sat on the upper de k and ventured to sit out on front of the ferry braving the cold breeze.I wish the ride would've little longer as we enjoyed it immensely.

Nice journey in the sunshine. A great way to get close up to the iconic structures the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The price is quite reasonable and Manly was a very pleasant surprise having a very nice pedestrian area and als having a beach on the ocean that had nice sized breakers for beginners and more experienced surfers.
Great crossing good way to view harbour. This was a cheap way to get fantastic views of Sydney harbour without going on a costly "harbour cruise" and you get to visit Manly a lovely place to visit.

Great day trip. I love taking the Manly ferry from Circular Quay. The views of the Harbour are amazing, and it's a very relaxing ride (if the water isn't too choppy or stormy). Enjoy some hot chocolate when you get off the boat, hit up some shops, and enjoy the beach. I also love the little walk to Shelly Beach!
Sunday Funday $2.50 Return. Where else do you get to see the sights for $2.50. Great experience for the whole family. Great food shops at the Manly end including an Aldi store.
Good services.. Reliable service and it runs frequently. Alkso it is the best way to see the harbour as you travel from one end to the other. Very cheap too.

Great Views of Sydney Harbor!!. My husband and I had the pleasure of taking this ferry to Manly Beach on a bright, sunny day. The views of the Harbor were incredible - we must have taken 100 photos during the trip. Passengers are treated to a great audio "tour" with information about the Sydney Bridge, Opera House, Luna Park and other landmarks. This is a definite must for visitors to Sydney!The added bonus at the end of the trip is Manly Beach - a great beach and town with nice restaurants and shops.

What great value - a must do boat trip...... A bargin boat travel experience with a delightful trip on the famous Manly ferry from Circular Quay to Manly (and return)Less than $16 return for the 30 minute trip (each way)Cruising at 13 knots, it was an enjoyable trip, with the open deck at the front of the boat a treat.A great trip - stunning value - a genuine must do.....

Must Do!. See Sydney Harbour up close and personal. Wonderful views of big ships, sailing boats, the Sydney Opera House, and Harbour Bridge. There can be a few rolling swells as you cross the Sydney Harbour Heads, all adds to the excitement. Go for fish and chips at Manly, or just walk in the Corso.

A lovely place to visit. A ferry ride over to Manley is a must do when visiting Sydney, once you arrive after crossing the heads to get to Manley you can take a walk along to see the shops the beach. Make sure it's a lovely sunny day though.

best way of seeing Sydney. the ferry is a heritage piece and the views and experience is always wonderful - this is also an historical trip through the harbour and trying to imagine how empty it all was once before European settlement is an interesting feature.
Relatively cheap way to enjoy the harbour. A 30 minute travel time from Circular Quay. You can enjoy and appreciate the harbour during the journey.

Best view of the opera house and bridge. Spent a great day at the Manly beach and the ferry ride coming back was even better than the ride over. The view angle was fabulous. Tip is to board at the second level and queue up about 15 minutes in advance. Walk in immediately to the left and sit outside (weather permitting) and enjoy the great view and snap a few photos.
nice ride to Manly. It is a nice scenic ride from Sydney to Manly. Fare was reasonable. The seats were comfortable. The embark and disembark was very organized. The ferries ran on time.
nice trip. Good views of Sydney. Manly has a lovely beach, fish restaurants, bars fresh air and ocean views. Well worth having a go.

Worthwhile. Great trip to Manly, 30 minutes or so of fabulous views of Sydney Harbour and entrance. Ferry docks in centre of Manly and a five minute walk through a very attractive parade lined with shops, bars and restaurants brings you to the fabulous Manly Beach. A great half day excursion at low cost.

Manly Ferry offers a fabulous day trip. In February 2015 I joined a friend to travel on Manly Ferry for a fantastic day of relaxing in the seaside village of Manly. On arrival at Manly we walked through the mall and past the markets to enjoy a wine overlooking the Manly surf beach. Manly Wines by Gazebo is a great spot for afternoon drinks by the sea. Manly Ferry certainly offers a fabulous trip for either half a day or a full day.

A good way to get different perspectives. We wanted to take a look at Manly (so the right ferry to get), and it gives different views of Sydney Harbour than you might get if you stay on land.Worth the visit
a SYDNEY / MANLY FERRY RIDE IS A MUST DO IN SYDNEY. Ride the Sydney Manly Ferry - especially in rough weather across the Sydney Heads is a must do in Sydney...a thrilling ride...
Manley Ferry. Travelling from Parramatta to Sydney by the Water Bus was really a grea way to travel to the Centre of Sydney

Manly Ferry. Get yourself to Circular Quay & take Manly Ferry (to Manly of course) sit outside & get great views of the harbour, at Manly stroll the Corso for food options (best seafood at Ocean end imho) eat around esplanade (beach, grass, seats) with views over beach & ocean.

10/10. I didn't realize how crowded the inlet was until on the ferry, Cruised past two 1800's tall ships under sail, passed a bunch of hydro foil sail boats and almost crashed into a 10m sailboat race. Bonus saw the sunset on the ferry ride back.
the best to get to manly. the best to get to manlyfrom the dock to the beach it is only a small strolllots of restaurants and shops on the way

Cheaper than a harbour cruise. This is a great ride either or both ways. It was a lovely sunny day and the harbour did nkt disappoint. I thoroughly enjoyed the trip at a fraction of the cost of a tourist boat. If you are on a budget this is an ideal way to see the beauty of the most wonderful harbour in the world.

Great way to see the harbour. If you have time and would like to see Sydney Harbor this is the easiest and cheapest way to do it. Catch the ferry to Manly, have a walk to the beach which is through the town and on the way, there or back, you have a great choice of eating places for any type of meal, and then catch the ferry back. The ferry itself leaves from Circular Quay which is on the Circular Quay Station for the City Circle Line so getting there couldn't be any easier. It gives you a different view of the city and a great and inexpensive experience on the harbor

Best and cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour. Some cruises cost $20 to $50 for a few hours on the Harbour, but you've seen about all you can see in about half an hour or less. At roughly $6 one way the Manly ferry it's definitely the best way to do it. It's quite peaceful sitting out on the deck on a sunny day. It's nice walking around Manly as well with lots of shops and eateries, and the beach is a nice swim on a hot day.While it can cost around $6 for a single trip, if you're here for a week then definitely consider getting an Opal card for free. $15 for unlimited travel in a day all around the city, and 8 trips in a week means unlimited travel until Sunday. Most bus or train trips around the city cost less than $3 and can add up quickly.
