Great food in Manly along is worth the effort. A beautiful ride and beautiful destination. We loved this ride right by the Opera House, great view of the harbor and the bridge. The destination is charming, has good food, good hikes.
Very fun. The ride from darling harbour to manly was so much fun the kids loved riding on a ferry and all the information they learnt about the harbour

Pleasant and Beautiful Ride. If you are going to Manly from Sydney I highly recommend the Manly ferry. There are actually two, both of which I've ridden. There's the Manly Fast Ferry (about a 20 minute ride) and the Manly Ferry (takes about 35 minutes). Both were good and both got you to Manly but I quite enjoyed the slower ride. There are lots of tourists on board trying to get photos especially on the trip back when you have a spectacular view of Sydney Harbor Bridge and the Sydney Opera House. You may have scoped out a perfect location up front from where you can take photos and just enjoy the peaceful ride over. Be prepared because your entire ride people aren't going to care you have the perfect seat. They want their photos and will stand directly in fron of you. Very poor manners but It doesn't take away from the beautiful ferry ride. Just be prepared for rudeness from tourists who believe they have a right to interrupt your view for theirs. We all have to get along.
Excellent Service. We traveled back and forth twice - Manly to Sydney. The ferry is a nice ride and easy transportation

Best harbour experience. This is a must-do activity when in Sydney. The trip on the ferry is unique and very reasonable. Such a lovely outlook as you cross the harbour and lots of activity with other boats. When you get to Manly, there are a lot of cafes and excellent walks.
great view of sydney harbour. be careful when its windy , my glasses flew off never to be seen again that aside Manly is a great place to visit

Fast and efficient!. This was a great way to get to Manly. We only had a few hours so this was the quickest way to get to Manly. I think this boat is used a lot by the locals and we were the only tourists on board but would recommend. It only took 15 mins to get to Manly Quay and we purchased a return ticket so no queueing on our return!

it is worth the trip. sailing next to Sydney´s icons (bridge, opera), and then the stunning rocky shores outside the bay, enjoy the skyline and all sailboats, and speed boats. All this to see the lovely town of Manly. It is worth a whole day- certainly the trip alone is allready a highlight for Sydney

Iconic ferry ride. One of Sydney's unique visitor experiences, a cheap and easy way to experience the beauty of Sydney Harbour and combine with a variety of lunch/meal opportunities at Manly. See the Bridge, Opera House and bay vistas at close quarters.

Great trip. Great views on the trip of bridge and opera house.
good value trip round trip 1 hr 20 mins
loved Manly what a lovely place for a day out
we went on Saturday and there was a flea market.

Every visitor to Sydney needs to take this ride. Sydney Harbor is truly gorgeous. The bays, the inlets, the rocky outcrops, the islands — everything is so beautiful. The Manly ferry ride is a particularly good way to experience the best that Sydney Harbor has to offer.

Awesome beach. Manley has the most beautiful beaches
Loads of surfers
The atmosphere is so laid back and warm
Sand is powdery white .....just awsome

Great trip to Manly. I have always wanted to visit Manly as I have relatives who used to live there, one is sadly no longer with us, the rest moved to the centre of Sydney. The ferries travel back and forward and they can hold a lot of people, very busy, we did not wait too long. Once there my relative who lives in Sydney took us to a waterside eating place. We sat outside in the glorious sunshine and had our lunch. Although there were eight of us we found a table and the food was very varied and of good quality, given the location my fish dish was very reasonable. On the ferry journey you get a great view of Sydney Harbour, it is really picturesque. The only complaint that I have is with a lady who was at the turnstile where you pay to get on the ferry. Our prepaid Opal card, which we had just purchased would not go into the machine. Bearing in mind we had been in Sydney a matter of a couple of hours, we travelled there from Melbourne. She was totally nasty and unhelpful. Five of our family had gone through and we were stranded, luckily my cousin who lives there ran and bought us another ticket.
Pretty neat. It was always a beautiful ferry ride each day in Sydney! Manly Beach ferry, no exception!!! A little rougher when you go out to open water for a minute, made for quite an adventure!!

Nice Ride and Interesting Destination. Took the ride mainly to get on the ferry. Turns out that Manly itself is also an interesting destination as well, and it is a good idea to schedule some time there, for a walk around the city, or possibly a dip at one of the beaches.The one complaint would be the low number of outside seats. On a sunnny day like the one I visited they are quickly filled up, so if you are taking the ride for the views make sure to que up 10 minutes or something before the ride, and go straight to the seats.

Regular, reliable and relaxing. What a gentle trip from circular quay to many and a visit to the many markets and beach. The ferry arrives and departs religiously on time. The conditions r clean. Do be careful of wanting to watch on the upper and outer deck as it can get wet and windy otherwise the trip was magnificent with great views of landscape and many sail boat in the harbour. A must do

Best cheap ferry ride in the world. Catching the ferry to Circular Quay is a favourite of mine. I have done it every year for over 30 years. The idea is to get on the ferry quickly and go upstairs and to the very back and grab a seat. First come best dressed. As you go down the harbour you have world class views of both the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Sydney Opera House and then you get to enjoy the views on a 40 minute ride right down the harbour past Sydney Heads to Manly. If you come to Sydney it is a must, forget the private tourist cruises this is the way to do it.
What a lovely ferry ride.. What a lovely ferry ride. See the various bays around Sydney from the water. A smooth and relaxing 25 minutes ride!
Fab views from North Fort. Take the bus from Manly pier to North Fort (stop J) and see the fantastic views of Sydney and the ocean.
Great Ferry Service. Brilliant for a trip around the Harbour and other stop offs. Opal ticket system is great. Even better on Sundays when you can use the services free.

A MUST SEE for all tourists. The Manly Ferry is the best & cheapest way to see the harbour, opera house, bridge & surrounding sights.A return fare costs only $15 but if you a pensioner or concession holder it is $2.50 ALL DAY.We recently took the trip & it was great .... Manly is HUGELY under rated & i would spend a week there in a heartbeat.Definately something to do if you want to see the sights of Sydney & Manly (take your swimmers)
Great experience. It's the best way to reach Manly. For sure it is an enjoyable half an hour to have a view of the harbor and a moment of freedom.

great trip. It's the best way to travel to Manly. The best view of the city from the water, it takes only 30 minutes and is not to expensive. But be careful if you have a weak stomach, the last part of the way can be hard for you if the waves are high.

breathtakingly scenic. if you intend to spend the day at manly, then this might not be a good option. but if your plan is only to enjoy the ferry ride and catch a glimpse of manly beach, then make sure that you take the ferry at sunset time..the views of the opera house and the harbor bridge in the sky of dusk can be a real treat to watch. the good thing about this time also is that the ferry is relatively empty .there are a series of ferry services, the fast ferry is a tad bit expensive when compared to the bigger boat but you should get the fast ferry at least on one side so you can enjoy your glass of wine on the deck
It's ok. Manly wasn't my favorite. It's extremely busy with tourists. Other beaches are better options, not so overrun.

Good value for money. Have a 1/2 - 1 day to spend on the Harbour? The Manly Ferry return trip should tick the boxes if you are looking for some time viewing Sydney from the water, some sort of snack, take-away meal or sit down meal, a walk along one of Sydney's famous beaches, and a chance to see Sydney suburbia. The ferry trip is about 20-25 minutes and leaves Circular Quay regularly. It takes you all the way out to the Heads, which is the entrance to the harbour, and then swings into Manly Ferry Wharf. From there a walk through an outside mall with locals and tourists milling around ice-cream shops, surf and gift shops and local pubs, leads you to the beach. Along the beachfront are more shops and restaurants, but head down to the sand and a dip in the water or a walk. A few blocks back from the busy mall and shopping areas are streets and streets of Sydney suburbia. It's worth taking a stroll around to check out the everyday action of local people doing their thing. Manly has some other activities as well so you could make a very long day of the visit if you wished. Ferries leave for the city regularly so nothing is too stressy in Manly.

Get there early for a good seat. We did a Saturday trip and the ferry eas bang on schedule. Nice views on the way from Sydney to Manly but the best photo op s are on tthe way back. Manly is a really pretty place. Go to the far left side of the beach for a view through the rocks. We rented bikes but itveas si busy we never really got the advantage from having them.
went to manly beach... went to manly beach to surf with my cousin and dad. amazing place loved it!! big waves and waiting a lot but so worth the wait

Great place to visit. Loved the beach, the food, the walks along the beach and to the national park. Just a nice place to spend an afternoon, spending a lot or spending a little while seeing the sights.

Regular as clockwork. This was a lovely twenty five minute ferry ride over to Manly. We sat outside as was lovely and sunny but lots of setas inside and a cafe and toilets. Very good service and not too expensive. Can use it if you have an Opal card- about 7 dollars single to Manly.

Rain and Bondi aren't good companions. One of the many places I was looking forward to visiting on a recent trip to Australia was Bondi Beach. If anything exemplified the image of this young country, this was surely it. It was much smaller than I had imagined but, worse, it was cold and raining. Like a normanl Bank Holiday in Britain really. I expected to see men and women flaunting their six-packs; instead all I saw was men and women sporting their pack-a-macs! Just my bad luck especially as the weather improved greatly only a few hours later. I imagine on a hot, sunny day, it's a great place to spend time although I doubt if I would venture into the water. Sorry, Sydney, would love to give Bondi Beach a glowing review but, on my visit, it was as bright as a Toc H lamp!

Top Ferry Experience. Still a must do on Sydney Harbour and a beautiful harbour cruise experience to Manly and return. Easy ticketing options, tickets, Opal Card etc. Caters very well for passengers with disabilities and associated equipment.

Reliable and Iconic. Always exactly on time. Trip takes 30 mins.. Ferry is always clean and staff are super efficient. It can be a bit of roll when crossing The Heads but plenty of warning given and it is only for a short while

Good half-hour of harbour sight-seeing and lovely destination!. It's great to be able to use your Opal Card (must have in Sydney, for hopping on-and-off buses, trains and ferries) and sit up on the top deck of this half-hourly ferry, which turns right past the Opera House and chugs for half-an hour towards the ocean. Manley is the last cove before that and the restaurants and attractions around the wharf are worth travelling for, let alone the walk to the main (ocean) beach.
Good day sunshine. Highly recommend a trip to Manly Beach. Nice ride and nice town. Spent the day there walking around, exploring the sites.

Worth it. It was relatively cheap (around $10 I think?). Manly is a cool place to begin with, and taking the ferry there is such a great way to see Sydney in all its glory. You'll get a great view of the harbor, bridge, etc. and everything in between. It's a pretty smooth ride. Sometimes I get seasick but had no issues here. 30-45 minute journey.
Aussie beach. We took ferry to see an Aussie beach. This beach was pretty much like our beaches on Long Island except it was in he city. I expected to see giant waves.

Take the Fast Ferry. Twenty minute ride with amazing views. Must do on a trip to sydney. The fast ferry is no where as crowded as the normal ferry which takes about an hour which makes the ride more comfortable and enjoyable.

A must way to get to Manly. Manly ferry is a fabulous way to travel from the city to the north side. It takes about 35 min, the views are spectacular of the city, the harbour. There is a kiosk offering tea, coffee ,soft drinks and snacks. Service is very slow though. There are seats outside as well as inside.. Well worth a trip..

Fantastic views. By going from Circular Quay to Manly just before sundown, and returning after dark, we got fabulous views of the harbour both in daylight and all lit up at night. It was magical, with shearwaters flying alongside the boat like ghostly shapes in the dark. And it was very cheap compared to the cost of the harbour cruises.

Good value. Just as good as one of the harbour cruises for the views - by chance we were there on a Sunday where if you buy an Opal card you can travel round all day in the ferries, buses and trains all day for $2.50!! It's a bit of a crush getting on but apart from that well recommended
An easy way to get to Manly.. Touristy and crowded at times, but it's a nice way to meet people and see some of the harbor and coastal areas.

A MUST for visitors to Sydney. This is a very affordable and enjoyable way of seeing Sydney from the water and also getting to the beautiful Manly beach which is worth at least a day. We had a very smooth journey, great views of the bridge and the opera house, and plenty to see and do when you get to Manly! Highly recommended!

circular quay to manly. it was an easy enough trip. no fuss. the wait was about 15 minutes untill the ferry ready. however on that day, it wasnt so clean up to my standart. and i would say this is way faster than taking the train n the bus to manly.

A Worthwhile Trip. When you get into Sydney early in the morning and the check-in time at your hotel is 2 pm, this is a great trip to spend the morning. Take the ride to Manly, and get to see the sights along the route, have a walk and a lunch in Manly then back in time to check-in to your hotel.

Beats the expensive cruise. Ferry is efficient and great photo opportunity of the Sydney Opera House.
There is a reasonably price cafe onboard serving coffee and burger. Good value for a cruise for budget travellers! Ease to board on and off the ferry even with strollers! Thumbs up!
Lovely journey. Great way to travel to Manly as you can see the city skyline from the boat and also passing all the little bays on the way.
Great views of the harbour. Go on this ferry even if you don't want to go to Manly just for the lovely views. Manly is ok bit cliche tourist mecca but the ferry ride is the best bit.
Fun Trip. A nice long ferry ride that not only takes you to lovely Manly Beach but it is a great (and inexpensive) way to see the harbour and the views of the Sydney skyline.

The Manley ferry is a good and interesting going over to manley. The Manley ferry is a good way of getting to Manley, so much to look at all the views of houses, boats, Fort Denison the Australian navy ships and if you are lucky like we were you will see the cruise ships in at circular quay where you first board the ferry. Its about a 25 minute ride to Manley, cost us $3o return.

Big ferry to popular beach. This ferry used to be in the public transport ticket we used to buy for 7 days travel but has since been taken off of that ticket and an extra fee is now charged for this service. When at Manley we always have lunch at the kabab shop which is nearest the beach front. Manley is very busy on the weekends so week days are preferable days to go.

Good way to see the harbour. Take your camera along for good views all the way. The ferries are comfortable with inside and outside seating. Be prepared to get wet if you are outside as you pass The Heads. The trip to Manly takes about 30 minutes and you can use your all day travel tickets.
Ferry cruise. We took the cruise for photo opportunities and we were not disappointed. The views were fabulous. Manly beach was an added bonus. We walked the mall and had a picnic lunch at the beach.
lovely trip. enjoyed our trip on the ferry, lovely way to visit Manly. Very nice staff and ferries kept very clean.

great views of sydney. I visited manly during my trip to Sydney and took the ferry. the weather was great and i enjoyed the trip. I would recommend getting a later ferry back as the views as you come into Sydney harbor are stunning
Leisurely way to see the harbour. Return fare was cheap at $15. Nice relaxing way to see the harbour if you can get an outside seat on a clear day. Cafe facilities on board.

Fast and efficient. For 17 Aus$ the return on the fast ferry to Malny took about 20 minutes and gave good views of the harbour area with the bridge and opera house in the background. It ran to the minute as scheduled.

Bondi.....just a beach!!!. I have to admit to not being a beach type person but my brother and I thought we should visit not wanting to miss anything. It's a nice beach with lots of beautiful young women on it but that is it. The shopping front is tacky, nothing worth seeing, and I couldn't see what the hype was about. My cousin lives in Australia and he warned us it would probably disappoint and it did. However, it was only the price of a bus ride from the Sydney Centre and we only spent a couple of hours there so no big deal.If you are a beach person, you may enjoy visiting and lying all day on the beach but it wasn't for me or my brother.

Very convenient and not too expensive.. Easy to find and use especially if you have an Opal travel card (like the London Oyster card). About £3.50 each way and 30 minutes with great views of Sydney and surrounding areas. On board cafe and toilet facilities if you need them. Inside and outdoor seating. I hate boats but have used the service several times and not suffered motion sickness at any time. There is also a fast ferry (more expensive) but w e have not seen the need to use that.

An easy trip with a view. It's not only easy to get to Manly but the ferry ride is half the fun. The ride give your nice views of areas that you might not otherwise see of Sydney. Try to grab a seat outside if you can but they are very limited. You can, however, still see pretty good from inside.

Day Trip to Manly. Great way to see Sydney Harbour on the way to Manly. Lots of room onboard the ferry. Refreshments available onboard too. I just love Manly, the beach, the walk to Shelly Bay Beach and the cafes. Great day out. Aprox $15.00 return trip (adult).

A pleasant way to get to Manly. This is the most convenient and pleasant method to get to Manly. You will get a great view of the bridge and opera house on the way. But be aware of the hoards of other tourists (some not so polite) flooding the boat as well. For the best view and photo opportunity, the lower deck facing the pier, when departing Circular Quay is the best.
Cheap way to see the harbour. Well the slow manly ferry is by far the best way to see Sydney Harbour.. And the bonus is when you get to manly you have that fabulous beach .. Top little spot
Best way to get to Manly. Only $14.60 return trip. Forget the expensive fast ferry and take the 1/2 hour ride and enjoy Sydney Harbour

Worth taking the trip. I loved catching the Manly ferry. My trip led to the most unexpected discovery of the beautiful Manly Beach and Sydney Harbour National Park - which I'd highly recommend hiking.

Manly Fast Ferry. Choppy crossing courtesy of bad weather easily absorbed by catamaran boat. A quick 20 minute crossing and at a very reasonable price. By accounts of others using the government boat, this was by far a more comfortable trip. Wharf 6 and every 30 minute departures.

Worthwhile day trip in Sydney. We had a lovely day visiting Manly Beach. One of the best beaches we have seen. The ferry ride is scenic and quick. We only had half a day before a flight, and the trip to Manly filled in time nicely.
Great view of Sydney Harbor. Nice and inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbor. In Manly be sure to see the beach and walk along the walkway. great place to sit on wall alongside beach and people watch.

Great trip. Highly recommend this for any Sydney Visitor. It is a great trip, on a sunny day you have great views and it is a very relaxing ride.
Staff was friendly and we all enjoyed it very much.

See Sydney. Take the ferry in the evening hours - it is one of the grandest views when you return to Sydney harbour!! Absolutely worth seeing - or actually breathtaking. And you don't have to be a person with inclinations to romantic views - it works even on rather "cool" people.
You need to get off the ferry and follow the crowds to Manly beach!. Better than Bondi. The Manly Ferry is no different to the other ferries. The joy is the beach that it takes you to.
Must go. The ferry trip to Manly is well worth it just for the views of the Harbour Bridge, the harbour and the Opera House. Manly is lovely and you should pay it a visit.
Excellent views. Good views, excellent photo opportunities and a smooth ride. A good choice for a Harbour tour but actually going somewhere!

A 'must do' activity if you visit Sydney!. If you are spending any time in Sydney, you must do this very journey. Not only is Manley a great place to visit, but the views around the harbour & the views of The Opera House on the way back is truly magical!

The best ride. Going to Manly is not only a great trip but the ferry makes it even better. It takes about 45 minutes and on a clear day such as the one we had you have magnificent views all the way. Great experience.

Your cruisey mini overseas trip. I always love the Manly Ferry. The staff work extremely efficiently to get the vessel unloaded, loaded and departing on time. The seats are old but with the views on the journey ..... who cares about the seats. A great 30 minutes of relaxation and total enjoyment of the scenery of yachts, shorelines and ocean.
A must. Brilliant views to a beautiful place. You get the best views best views of the Opera House from this ferry

Australian Crawl. Go with Australian Crawl on the headphones!!
"As the Manly ferry,... worked its way down Circular Quay"
Wonderful way to see the Opera House, Bridge and Harbour on a sunny day.

Excellent. Staying in Manly and often needing to go to the city the Manly ferries are truly fantastic! They give you an easy...and mostly very interesting ferry ride to and from the city. They run frequently throughout the day and are very cheap. A lovely way to commute between the city and Manly.
Great trip. Great trip on the ferry to see the other side of the Opera House by water. Ferry gets very busy. You get better views from the back of the ferry. Free wifi too!

Nice trip to cute town. Really easy and affordable way to explore another part of Sydney. The costal suburbs are worth a look and the ferry was a great way to access them. Nice trip, easy to find the docks and appropriate ferry, well signed and pleasant staff. Overall nice experience and easy for anybody
manley ferry. enjoy the ride. its lovely on the harbour and then go to "Ribs and Rump" for an upstairs table and a great meal!

Great way to get to Manyly. Took a high speed ferry. Each way costed AUD 9.50. Trip just takes 15 minutes from Sydney Harbour bridge port/Operate House.
Clean Ferry, operates every one hour. Food and drinks available on ferry.
So easy. Took ferry ride from Sydney Harbour to Manly Beach.So easy and only a few minutes accross the water.The ferries run back and forth all day.
Lovely way to see the harbour. great ferry service with excellent views of the harbourThe seats are comfortable and the service is very regular

Cheap Thrill...;). A lovely evening out, a Meal in Manly, a walk around taking in the sights or shopping. Back to the wharf for romantic cruise back to the city, if u have to wait 30 min for the next one there's nice bars on the wharf .. 😌
Nice views from the ferry!. Awesome views can be enjoyed from the ferry from Circular Quay in Sydney to Manley! The ferry takes about 30 minutes for the crossing, but is comfortable.

IN SYDNEY THIS IS A MUST DO. You do not have to speak a word of English , You do not even have to know where you are heading . But every visitor to Sydney must go to Circular key and catch the MANLY FERRY. If you have all day . Go to Manly on the Ferry and return to central Sydney by bus . The trip is worth a MILLION Dollars and if your a senior citizen it will cost you $2.50.It is safe and clean .The people are so friendly they go out of their way to assist . So do not be afraid. Just go for it.

Holiday from big-town. Going from Sydney CBD to Manly , along with your swimming gear will give you a holiday from a city visit. Well wort if you want to have a boating tour and an additional feeling of holiday while beeing in the bustle of Sydney

Excellent - Efficient, Beautiful Morning, Easy, Clean, Reasonable - Why Not?. We were headed to Manly for breakfast and to walk the beach until about 1PM. We took the 8:40 am ferry on Sunday morning. It was not to busy at that time. The trip went quick. We spent the entire time on deck, taking in the fresh air and in conversation. On the return trip the ferries coming in were packed and the ferry heading back to Sydney was busier than the morning. We will do this again. The restaurants along the beach were perfect, food excellent and overall the ferry a worthwhile experience.

Take a Harbour Trip without the Tourist Price. Travel on the ferry to Manly and you get a great view of the Harbour around Circular Quay, the Bridge and the Opera House. It takes about 20 minutes to get to Manly, with a great beach...as good as Bondi?!The view on the return journey is stunning. Make sure you're at the front of the ferry for great photo opportunities. The ferry is a good low cost option to a fancy "tourist" harbour tour.

Started in the rain and returned with the sun. Lovely trip even in the rain lovely views and the staff on the ferry are right on top of their game - I landed with the sun breaking thru but on my return the weather was glorious , spectacular views if Sydney skyline and the 2 old favorited the opera house and the bridge - and it only costs just over 7 Aussie dollars each way.

Better than a guided harbor tour!. To view Sydney Harbor, one could of course take a guided harbor tour. For your first time in Sydney, this may be the better ( if more expensive) option because of the background information you will be getting. But if you have that information already, take the return trip to Manly by ferry. It takes you almost all the way out to the North Head and lets you enjoy the views along the way. Moreover, you can spend a leisurely time in Manly, walking the boulevard or the beach and resting at one of the many bars and restaurants. Nothing really exquisite, but a way to enjoy Sydney as the Australians do.

Relaxing. As a tourist, the novelty of catching a ferry never fades. Something so relaxing about the harbour waters. Love catching the ferries to Manly and the zoo. Reasonably priced form of transport even with a large family.

Well worth a trip on the Manly Ferry. I travel on the Manly Ferry regularly and love it. The slow ferry is a 30 minutes trip and there also a fast ferry which takes approximately 15 minutes but is more expensive.The ferry departs every 30 minutes and is a great way to see Sydney Harbour. At night on board security is provided.There is an on-board café that serves snacks from early morning until early evening.

Nice ride across harbour. $15 return is a little expensive in my opinion, however, it is a lovely ride across the harbour. Great for viewing and taking photos of the Opera House. Seniors concession ticket is excellent value. Gives a senior access to all public transport on the day for less than $3.
Cannot be missed. A great trip. Start with a coffee and raisin toast and choose the wild Ocean beach, the quiet harbour beach or the sublime scenic walk. Fantastic lunch at the Manly Beach Hotel.

Quick, cheap and fun. We took the advice of other trip advisor writers and took the ferry to Manly - it was so easy to buy tickets and the ferry runs very frequently. We were easily able to sit outside on the way back and it was a perfect day. We ended up buying our lunch in Manly at a nice cafe and spent a few minutes watching the locals (and some tourists too I guess) lying on the beach in the full sun under a banner for a melanoma fundraising walk scheduled for the weekend. And here we were with our sunscreen and hats! Funny how many great hats are for sale and none of the locals like to wear them- only the tourists I guess. There were some walks you could take as well- an enjoyable few hours (although for us that was enough).

A Must Do. The Manly ferry is one of those iconic tourist adventures that a Sydney visitor must do--like the Staten Island ferry in New York. This is a commuter ferry that takes riders from the Circular Quay to Manly and back. The bonus for the traveler is that the views of Sydney are first rate and beach that you can explore in Manly is a short walk from the ferry landing. You go from Sydney hubbub to Jones Beach, complete with a short boardwalk with beach stores Australian style, in 30 minutes. Don't miss the Movenpick ice cream store on the Curso-pedestrian mall to the beach. If you are an ice cream lover, this ice cream is heavenly and not available in USA. Super rich and yummy! Expensive, but worth it! Loved Swiss Chocolate. Also, we didn't have the time, but there is a lovely walk from Manly beach that I would have liked to have taken.
Great views. We went with our travel companions to Manly with the ferry. No big problem getting a seat outdoors and the weather was good.
Great view!. We spent the whole day at Manly. It is well worth the visit. And the Manly ferry was a nice way to come and go. As many have said, the view is worth the ferry ride alone.

Worth it for the view alone!. We travelled as a family on a Sunday and it was really busy. The tickets are cheap for family travel on Sundays and only cost us something like $2.60 each to get around but a bargain way of seeing the Opera House and Bridge from the water. It was a pleasant way to spend 30 minutes although there didn't seem to be a great deal in Manly, just a lovely beach and a variety of food places. Great that the tourist shops sell sweatshirts for $10 because it turned really chilly and poured with rain and that ferry ride can be a little chilly too so we bought a couple of sweatshirts for the way back and grabbed a coffee in a great place called Ground Zero whilst we waited for the rain to stop. Worth the trip for the views from the water and maybe a bit of lunch out.

Excellent views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House on the cheap!. We bought an unlimited day pass for 24 AD each and went to Watson's Bay for lunch at Doyle's and then to Manly Beach. The locals advised us to skip Bondi and go to Manly. The ferries are quick and efficient, and the views are to die for! I would skip the express ferry--I think it's about a 10 minute difference.

Take the fast one. Traveled to Manly Beach while in Sydney. Manly is a ways away so you need to take the ferry. There are two options, the regular Sydney operated ferry and the "Manly Fast Ferry" operated by a private company. A little more $ but quite a bit faster. Recommend a visit to Manly. Nice little beach town, yes very touristy but worth a visit. Very nice beach here, I would say nicer than Bondi.

$7.60 each way is WELL worth it. This is probably the best way to see the Sydney skyline. You get an unobstructed view of the opera house from three different angles. The best part is that you end up at Manly Beach! Even if you don't plan on going to the beach, it's worth it just to take the ride. It's $7.60 each way.I saw another yelp review of a nighttime ferry ride, which hadn't even occurred to me. Not that we had time to do that but next time I'm in Sydney, I will definitely make sure I do that.Tip - Free WiFi on board!
A must do while in Sydney. This is an iconic trip that should be done by all visitors to Sydney. On the way out of the harbour you get great views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.

Wonderful Ride with Fabulous Views of Sydney Harbour. Aside from being an obvious way to get to and from Manly Beach, the ferry offers fantastic views of the harbour which are well worth the price one pays for the ferry ride. It's relatively quick taking exactly 30 minutes dock to dock--there is an express ferry for more money that cuts the time by 1/3-but what's the hurry when there is so much to see.

Excellent was to get around.. we took the ferry to mainly on a recent trip to the city on our 3 moth holiday. The sun was out and it just seemed a pearl was to travel away for the hassle and bustle of the city. The ships are a little strange having to stress and no aft. The ship was clean and we sat outside in the sun just take the different view of every thing around us. The operation was slick and punctual. At the other end every thing was. In place for a great day on the beach which is what the had and on the way back the breeze took some of the heat of the sun out of us as we sat up the front and took the small spray which was blowing from the sea onto us. Great trip on a great day.

Very scenic.. Can't think of a better nor cheaper way to see Sydney and the harbour than from this ferry ride. 45 minutes of great views and a beaut journey. Then arriving at Manly is first prize at the vend.
Amazing views. Quick and efficient service - stunning views of Sydney, the opera house and bridge. Very relaxing and good value for money.

Stunning Views of a Stunning City and Harbour. I love the trip to Manly on a fine day. There really is nothing as beautiful as Sydney Harbour when she is basked in sun with a slight breeze blowing. Sadly my issue with the trip is the lack of consideration by some of the other ferry goers. I understand that everyone needs that photo with the Opera House and Harbour Bridge in the background but when it's done move away so that everyone else can see as well. There's always the rush of herded cattle to just get that best spot but people need to be aware of those around them and it's not uncommon for a bit of pushing and manoeuvring to put a dampener on the ride. Nevertheless whether you're a local or a visitor a ferry trip on the harbour is simply a must.

A thrilling and incredibly cheap way to get to Manly. $2.50 for pensioners - return to Manly from Circular Quay, Very handy quay at Manly for shops and the surfing/ volley ball, sunbathing beach. We walked up to the head with spectacular views out into the ocean and towards the city across the harbour. The start of the journey back from Sydney was briefly rougher than any of the waves we had experienced on the Queen Mary2 on the month long voyage from Singapore to Sydney. All of us outside at the front got drenched - but everyone took it in good spirits!
Wonderful views of the Harbour. Well organised travel. Frequent boats. There is a live commentary which is interesting. A fast service. Can get a bit bumpy.
GREAT RIDE!. Why pay big bucks for a boat ride when you can take the ferry to manly and see it all and then some. Beautiful!

Spectacular views. The Manly Ferry takes around half an hour to go up stream towards the open sea to the town of Manly. The scenery all around, both on and off the water, is wonderful. You pass so many coves and inlets on this wonderful stretch of water and on the water itself you see an incredible variety of boats, big and small. Worth taking the ferry ride, even if you are only taking it to come straight back again. Brilliant views of the Opera House on the way back to Circular Quay.
Efficient and fast.. We took this ferry on two separate days and have no complaints. It operated on schedule and had comfortable seating. Manly terminal is big and good signs.
Beautiful on a Nice Day. Quick and direct but also a beautiful trip and best of all CHEAP! Have taken the ferry several times (return), peaceful and relaxing.

The best way to get to Manly.. What a fantastic way to get to Manly.The single adult fare to Manly was A$7.60 and payment can be paid by either cash or by credit. There are plenty of seats on board the Manly ferry, both inside and outside which I strongly suggest.Have your camera ready as one will get plenty of good pictures as you travel past some of the most famous landmarks in Sydney. As you get out a little further the city skyline looks fantastic and as you head towards Manly the view of the heads is amazing.Note as you get close to the open heads it can at times get a little rough.If you need a coffee / tea / water or a snack there is a cafe on board.
Nice tour of Sydney Harbour enroute. The beach where the surfing is done is on the other side of the town from the ferry terminal...walk there to see the beach.

Excellent short trip for photographers . The short trip to Manly is a lovely ride across the main area of Sydney allowing for excellent photos of the opera house, the bridge and other iconic buildings. A must see for everyone and at only $18 dollars a real bargain. Manly itself isn't all that exciting but you have a lovely national park area and a well used beach. You can easily make a day of it.

Sail the Harbor and see the Beach. A great way to spend a few hours by taking the ferry to Manly and then going for a hike in that quaint town. Who needs a Harbor Tour when you have the ferry? And who needs Bondi when you have Manly? Definitely a Must do!!
A lovely trip. We went on the older ferry to get a longer ride. It is wonderful for viewing the harbour coastline, and ver good value.
Great Ride. This is one of the longest rides you can go on a Sydney Ferry and the largest Ferries. I find it best to sit out side and enjoy the ride, great views of the city
Great Trip!. Great service, ferry very clean and staff friendly, lots of seats. We did this trip twice. We visited in the not so busy season so we felt like we had Manly to ourselves. :-)

Excellent views. This is the best way to see Sydney Harbor, the Opera House, the Harbor Bridge, sailboats everywhere.... This was the best way to get your photos and see the beautiful Manley beach. It was clean, the bathrooms were clean, they had wifi and a little cafe.

Good trip. Decided to go on this ferry to see Sydney Harbour and view Sydney from the water. Although the day was overcast and rainy, it was a great trip and gave us a different perspective. We only did one way as our son drove to Manley to meet us for lunch and he brought us home.
Wonderful. A ride to manly on the ferry is not to be missed, we stayed on board & travelled back to Sydney as we were short of time. The staff friendly.
Best way to see Sydney harbour. Lovely views and easy to get tickets only $15.20 per person. Well priced compared to the sight seeing tours at over $60 per person
YOU HAVE TO TAKE THE RIDE. You will definetly enjoy the amazing view of sailboats everywhere, the beautiful blue water and Opera Sydney. I took amazing photos on my boat ride to Manly Beach.
Manley Ferry. Value for money.Manley is picturesque and definately worth spending a day there.Many nice eateries on main concourse.
Day trip to Manly. Always on time and great way to see Sydney harbour area, check the weekend schedule for sailing times and if you are in a rush the high speed saves you 12 minutes

Great trip. Worth the ride across & walk to Manly beach. Plenty of eating places to choose from. The entrance to Sydney Harbour is awesome. Just knowing that is where all the boats & cruise ships come in.

Great way to See Sydney Harbour. The Manly ferry which takes 30 minutes to travel each way between Sydney Circular Quay and Manly is a fantastic way to experience the views of Sydney Harbour from the Sydney Harbour bridge to the heads that guard the ocean entrance, You can see the most magnificent harbour in the world. The ferry cruise also provides an opportunity to check out the seaside suburb of Manly. It's an inexpensive way to see the harbour and your ticket can also be used for unlimited travel on Sydney ferries, trains and buses during the same day.

ALWAYS WORTH A TRIP, BUT BEWARE.. This is one of the larger ferries plying its trade Cossack the Harbour from Circular Quay to Manley and its fabulous beach.Generally a very scenic ride, but beware! the route does go across the Head of the Harbour and is subject to quite large swells at times. If you are a bad sailor best check the water conditions before taking the trip.

Relaxing way to get to Manly. I took the fast ferry there and the slow ferry back and enjoyed both trips. Good views, fun to watch the other tourists (soccer team on my return boat) and the commuters who take the ferries every work day. Also, kids use the ferries to get to school.
Take the ferry. loved Manly & the ferry ride is easy but very busy on Sunday's. However it's only $2.50 to get there on a Sunday hence it's busy!

Regular ferry to Manly - recommended. This is the bog standard ferry (not cruise or fast ferry) to Manly. It takes around 35 minutes each way. For each journey - there and back - you just turn up with your ticket - no bookings for a particular time. Does what it says on the tin and didn't see any point in paying for a faster service.

A nice Cruise. We caught the ferry 5 times over the weekend. It is prompt and provides spectacular views of Sydney Harbour without the cost of a full Cruise. We did that as well and enjoyed it, the ferry is still enjoyable every time and the Manly Beach and Corso are great.
Landing here after a short trip. Amazing water voyage. Beautiful at sunset with the wind in our face and the growing view of downtown Sydney in the background. Fantastic!

Fast and reliable. This ferry operates from Circular Quay and is NOT a tourist cruise boat (although it is used as such either side of the morning and evening commuters).Sydney to Manly is about 35 minutes and the ferry runs perfectly to schedule. It is a big boat with lots of seats indoors but only very limted outdoor seating for anyone wanting to sight see or get a tan.A couple of cruise companies also operate from Circular Quay and go to Manly. Their boats tend to be smaller, have panoramic views and also have an informative commentary
manly ferry. took the ferry to manly from sydney. Enjoyable ride and breezy. Took many photos and memorable, Exciting and thrilling. would recommend anyone to enjoy the ride

Ferry trip. This was a lovely trip across the harbour. We returned at dusk and so saw the opera house, the bridge and the city all lit up - wonderfulWe hired bikes from Manly and cycled up to the national park overlooking the entrance to Sydney harbour. Finished up at Shelly beach.Check the return times for the ferry as they are less frequent after dark.

An affordable harbor cruise!. It costs only $15 or so to ride to Manly Beach and back from Sydney's Circular Quay, and though I wouldn't call it a luxury ride, it's plenty comfortable and affords spectacular views for a fraction of what you'll pay for most harbor cruises. We took fabulous pictures of the Opera House and the bridge on our rides (went more than once) and then just relaxed for the half hour it takes to get to Manly (well worth seeing, by the way--gorgeous beach). Sit outside if you can--you need to be at the front of the line at boarding to get one of these coveted seats. You'll love the fresh air and you'll see a lot more than if you sit inside. Inside seats do not afford the same views, but they're very comfortable. Seasoned riders sit here and use their phones (yes, they offer wifi) or read a book. As first-timers, though, we definitely wanted to soak in the outside views. Ferries run regularly, every half hour or so all day, so there's no set schedule; you can come and go as you please. Manly Beach is very interesting to visit. You can spend time on the beach itself or poke around through the many little shops and restaurants or coffee houses. Be sure to do this at least once when you visit Sydney! I should also mention that of all the ferry rides available, the one to Manly Beach is among the longest, so you get more time on the waves than you would going to other destinations.

Good when found!. There was a surfing competition on in Manly and a high demand for ferry services. Having bought a ticket well in advance, we had a wander round the harbour area and joined a queue next to the ticket kiosk. When we arrived at the gate some 15 minutes later, we were told that the tickets were for another Manly Ferry and to go to a different dock. Same story, although a shorter queue and after a third failed attempt we were directed to another jetty some 200m from the ticket kiosk. Needless to say our ferry had long gone and we had to wait another 40 minutes for the next one. In retrospect all the Manly ferries had slightly different names but all including the words Manly and Ferry. The ferry journey itself was excellent, slightly quicker than the regular service and provided a good trip around the harbour. We did make sure that we went to the right jetty for the return journey to Darling Harbour and we ended up being pleased that we had made the journey to Manly!

Beats driving any day. Brilliant, sit outside at the front, and enjoy passing some iconic Sydney sights such as Fort Denison, Kirribilli House, the old Quarantine station, Garden Island naval facility and of course enjoying the sights of the national parks, yachts on the water and multi million dollar real estate. A must do activity while in Sydney. Then there's the obligatory paddle at Manly Beach when you get there.

Must do in Sydney. This trip has become a regular on our itinerary when we visit Sydney - a short ferry trip that gives up close and personal views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and other landmarks along the way. When in Manly, there are lots of shops, the beach, a walk along to Shelly Beach and around the headland, or just coffee and a meal. Efficient and friendly ferry service.
Manly to sydney. This is a great way to get to circular quay from manly. The views of the harbour bridge and opera house are awesome

cheap transportation. The ferry takes you over to Manly Beach, where you can spend the day shopping, surfing, or just swimming. Takes less than an hour to get there and you go by both the bridge and opera house, so bring your camera.
Great staff. The ferry was great and the staff was so very friendly and fun to talk to. Everyone was all smiles and nice and forthcoming. No grumpy faces at all.

The best view of the Opera house. If you're looking to get some iconic photos of the Opera house, this is the way to go. Its a short 25-30 minute ride on the ferry which takes you right through the harbor.
MANLY FERRY. How good is the ferry trip to Manly? When you reach Manly its like a holiday location with lots of shops, food outlets and a spectacular beach.

Water views. The trip from Circular quay to Manly is excellent, you follow the Eastern suburbs beaches. If you have only a short time in Sydney, make sure you take this trip, it only takes 30 mins to go to Manly but it's well worth it as the views are amazing, you will pass the Opera house, what a view from the water, then after the numerous beaches you will see the entrance of Sydney Harbour. Beautiful!
Must do. Every time I am here I take the ferry to Manly and spend the day there.Fantastic views form the ferry of all that Sydney has to offer. The trip takes 30 mins and is worth it.

stunning view at sunset. Make sure you get an outdoor seat - there are not a lot of them. If you time it right (we took the 6:30 ferry from Manly), it is even more wonderful, as you get to see the Harbour with the sun setting behind it!

Man(ly) or Not... Try This Trip. Its available in the Sydney Harbour @ the Quays. I suggest taking the old workhorse ferries rather than the new fast ferries. What's not to like about a leisurely trip on an "experience" boat with a mix of commuters & tourists. Noticed that several of the commuters bring a beer on board for the trip for afterwork drinks.
Ferry travel in Sydney. Brilliant service this was our Golden Wedding Anniversary holiday in Sydney we had a fabulous time on the Ferry's.
Manly must!. I overheard the hotel concierge tell another visitor this was probably the easiest ,cheapest and best way to see the Sydney harbour.He was right!
Great trip to do!. Give this a try! Get to Manly Ferry at Wharf #3 in the Circular Quay using the city's water ferry/taxi service.

About A Half Hour One Way. We took the ferry from Sydney to Manly. It took us about a half hour one way. It's a beautiful ride with gorgeous views in every direction. You can sit inside or out. Manly was AWESOME! One of our favorite parts of our visit to Sydney!

Great activity for a Sunday. We used the ferry to get into Sydney from our accommodation in Manly. The ferry was always on time and there was ample seating. If you travel on a Sunday with an Opal card the most you will be charged for the ferry and all subsequent public transport is $2.50! A bargain! If we'd had a free Sunday we'd have done an island hop on the ferry and it would only have cost us $2.50!

Cheap and direct Ferry. After talking to a lot of tourists and researching the tourist booths and the ferry fares, I decided to take the regular Manly Beach Ferry. It is $7.5 one-way. Some tourists took a speedy boat for $20 - 15min ride. But this regular ferry also goes direct to manly beach, no stops at all. So avoid the tourists catch from the booths and just take a regular ferry to Manly beach from Circular Quay. It runs every 30mins I think.
Excellent people movers. Great value and perfect for getting around Sydney and its beaches. Multi fare ticket a real bonus. Operates like clockwork.
Safe, Reliable, & Clean Enough. With WiFi, concessions, & a cabin to hide from the weather (if needed), what more do you need? (About 20 -25 minutes from Sydney to Manly)

Go for lunch. Even if you aren't a beach person, the Manly Ferry is a great way to see the entire Harbor. It's the furthest ferry ride and about 30 mins long. The pier is just a short flat walk from Manly Beach and there are a lot of nice options for lunch along the walk. There are even a couple of nice places right on the warf.A day well spent no matter the season. It's a lot less crowded during the week if you don't like crowds.

fast or slow ferry - allways nice to be on the water. we took the fast ferry to mainly - more expensive than the classic one but next time we take the classic one because the time on the water was so nice and the views excellentmainly is worth a visit, just to relax between all the other visits of splendid Sydney

best day out in Sydney. The trip across the harbour and a walk down Manly Corso is a must do for everyone. Every time I get back to Sydney I include at least one trip and I have been doing that for 50 years . Fish and chips by Manly Beach is a definite requirement .
Love the Manly Ferry. Go over to Manly for a couple of hours, there are some lovely walk paths around here, especially the 20 minute easy walk to Shelly Beach, worth a stroll.

Scenic way to travel. The view is sydney harbour can't be beaten. It don't bother with the cafe on board. Mediocre and expensive. Save your money for one of the coffee shops at manly or circular quay.
The ferry with the views. The ferry is the platform from which to photograph The Opera House, The Harbour Bridge and the Sydney skyline. What more could you ask for?
Good reliable transportation. We took the Manly Ferry and it was clean, on time and very reliable. The scenery is excellent while making our way across the Bay.
Great way to see harbor. This runs every 30 minutes and is a great way to see the harbor and get to Manly. Better to take the slow cruise. More time to take in the sights.
"Lunch at Manly". Beautiful place to have lunch. We took the ferry from the city just to have lunch on the Ferry Jetty at Manly. A must do when visiting Sydney.
Lovely harbour views. An easy trip to Manly on the ferry. Although was very busy as it was a Saturday that I went. Lovely little market on every Saturday.
Great way to get to Manly Beach. Beautiful ride from Manly to Circular Quay. Avoid the traffic and enjoy the sights. Great for photographs.

Ferry Highly Recommended. Buy an OPAL card. This gives you great rates on trains, buses and the ferries. On a Sunday there's a $2.50 cap. So no matter how far you travel, no matter how many modes of transport, it'll only cost you $2.50.The Manly Ferry gives you great views and a lovely day out to Manly, where you can be pummelled by waves, laze on the beach, have fish and chips or cocktails on the jetty.In the Circular Quay ferry terminal, there is a good sushi bar for a picnic on the boat.Recommended.
Manly manly. The best way to get to manly is on this ferry it's such an awesome sail into the harbour. It's a Sydney must do.
A good transport. This is a good easy way to get to Manly and back. IT leaves about every 30 minutes from Sydney. The ferries are quite big and smooth for a ferry.

Great way to get 1st time overview of Sydney. Friends suggested we take the ferry to Manly as a way to get a good overview of Sydney Harbor and the downtown skyline; they were right. This was an inexpensive, fun way to see the city for the first time...especially if one's visit to Sydney was brief, as was ours. We sat outdoors. Highly recommend.

Great way to get around. Sydney has a great ferry service and it was a nice ride with fantastic views of Sydney. I will say the ferry looking over the side is starting to look dated and perhaps the fleet is in need of replacements in the years to come.

Great value but packed in summer!. If you want to sit on the deck to enjoy the view of the city or the harbour as you sail on to Manly, be prepared for lots of people egging for a seat or just standing in front of those in a seat. Sadly, some of these people can be fairly rude and inconsiderate. This is my only criticism of this particular ferry. If you just want to get from Sydney to Manly, then this is the way to go. Lots of time options and a very reasonable fee.

Great way to see the harbor. Buy a day bus pass and it includes the ferry. Great views of the Bridge and Opera House and a pleasant ride through the harbor. Manly has a "retro" feel of a by-gone era, good shopping, and a lovely beach. Crowded on weekends, Use the bus pass to see more of Sydney when you return.
Quick trip. Very informative commentary. It's a great ferry to take when you just want to get from A to B and not have put up with lots of stops.
Good Views. Great trip to Manly, excellent views of Sydney. Ferry was clean and tidy with loads of seating inside with some seating outside which is great for some photos!

It's a ferry. Some of the sights are interesting. Don't get carried away. This is a ferry. Ive been on ferries all over the world. New York, Dover, Gibralter ---- all much more interesting The ferry takes you to Manly. A place in itself is OK Not overly exciting
Great service. Frequent service. Enjoyed going to Manly, eat lunch with friends, some shopping on the way back to the ferry.

If you like beaches this is the way to access one. I can't personally get very excited about beaches but I do understand why people love the ones around the greater sydney area. The Manly ferry must make for one of the nicest approaches of them all....very leisurely and plenty of photo ops at a fraction of the general harbour trip prices!
A must. the 30 minute boat trip from Circular Quay to ManlyThe view of the city and of the harbour are just teriffic, it is a must,

Go To The Beach. Enjoy the beach, take time on a day your slow to ride out to Manly and stroll to the beach. Very relaxing and great restaurants to eat at. You also get great views of everything in the harbor area. You can take some great shots of the Opera House.

best way to see Sydney Harbour. How amazing is the Manly Ferry ? For a couple of dollars you get to see the most spectacular harbour and all or it and then at the other end are a great selection of amazing restaurants! J

Do it on a warm day!. I've wanted to do this for awhile and did it last year. We did it as it was sunset, the view is really nice of the city and nice photos along the way :)We arrived at Manly by now it was dark and for us there was not so much to do, basically we walked along the beach and then back into the ferry terminal.In the Manly ferry terminal there was a great sweet shop bang in the middle you can't miss it which was nice :)Returning there was not so much to see until you got closer to Sydney and then it's the city of lights!When we did it, it was not summer. My idea was to sit on the outside at the very front of the ferry and see the view from there along the way. However it just got way to windy and cold and we went inside. The view from there is not as good.I would love to try this again on a hot day in summer, possibly go early in the day and spend more time in the beach.For the day I went, I would give it 6/10!

A slow & relaxing trip to Manly. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly 8 March & loved every minute of it, especially the senior's price of $2.50 return, almost makes you feel good for getting to 65+. We were staying at the Rock's end of George Street, so not having to drive after a drink or two & to be ferried virtually to home made this a memorable day for the wife & I.

Sydney visitors MUSt do this!!!. Fantastic Harbour cruise for the price of commuter transport. Go to manly, grab some delicious seafood and eat it at one of Sydney's most famous beaches. Miles of waterfront pathways to stroll and enjoy.

If you only have one day in Sydney.... With all our friends recommending it, Manly was the place we headed since we only had one day in SYD before heading west to Perth. Great recommendation. Easy access from the CBD and a great harbour tour as a bonus. Add a nice beach town and fine beaches and you have a perfect few hours of fun.
Lovely ferry trip!. Ferry drops you off near the information point, so you can be assured of guidance to whatever part of Manly you want to visit.Lovely beaches, shopping, restaurants.

Slick and Easy. The ferries to Manly are regular. The boats hold 1000 passengers each trip. It is easier to travel using an Opal card which only needs swiping when you enter the ferry. I recommend sitting outside for the 30 minute trip. I saw Dolphins swimming in the sea on the ferry too. Refreshments are available on the ferry if you want.

The best way to see the harbour sights. Manley is a great place to visit and stay and the Manley Ferry is a good way to get there. Its good value and you can take in all of the sights that Sydney Harbour has to offer. When you arrive you must try the pizzas at Hugo's on Manley Wharf.

Day trip to Manly. This day trip is very good value for money and Manly is very nice place to visit. I think it is better than Bondii Beach.Ferry trip is through lovely looking scenery and all ages can enjoy the fun.

So handy and great views. We went on the ferry using our Opal cards and it only seemed to cost a few dollars return so great value. Obviously, the best seats go fast so I would have given 5 stars if there had been a large number of prime seats! The ferry turned on the way back and we finally got some great views and we loved the Manly Beach area itself. Lovely day out if you get tne weather.

Relax and enjoy the Manly Ferry ride. See attached photo, you only have to tap your Opal card ones at the point of entry.
The short stretch between Manly Wharf and Manly Beach has enough specialty shops to keep you occupied. Less expensive souvenir shops can be found here. Lots of places to eat, plus Coles supermarket, too.

Great cost effective way to see the sights from the water. Manly is worth a visit when in Sydney. The ferry is around $18 return and well worth it. Choose a side to stand on outside, and stick to it there and back. You'll see both sides of the bay on the two way journey, including the Opera House, bridge, Double Bay (in the distance), fort etc. Manly itself has a stunning beach (just up the street - the Corso - from where you dock, and there is a great pizza restaurant on the pier (Hugos) as well as a great Bavarian bier bar. Great for a day out of the city.
Cruise to Manly, take in Sydney Harbour. This is, in my opinion, the most inexpensive way to see Sydney harbour from Circular Quay up to Manly, and this includes North and South Head.

Good sail. The whole 'Manly' experience was fantastic - really loved the town (one of the few places in the world I would trade for my beloved home town) getting there on this ferry was a joy - a great day

Nice and slow ferry ride. Two way ticket costs 15.20 as of March 2015 per adult which can be bought from wharf 3 at circular quay wharf. Ferries are approximately every 30 minutes per way. Most customers enjoy the seat front of the ferry in the open. There are plenty to of seats by the side as well. It is a 2 level storey ferry. Cruising time is just nice for visitors to enjoy the view. Opal card can be used for this ferry trip.

Great Views. We took the ferry to Manly in order to see Sydney Harbour, and were not disappointed. The views of the various landmarks are really excellent from the water, and the ferry represents excellent value.

Nice if you have the time to. Manly Ferry takes you from Circular Quay to Manly, one of the beach places outside of Sydney Harbour. It is a nice 30 minnutes ferry ride that gives you a very good impression of how big Sydney Harbour really is. Manly is a cute beach suburb totally worth visiting for a day :)
Great way to see the harbour. Great way to see the harbour and inexpensive as well.Very enjoyable trip with great views, perfest photograph of the Opera House anf the harbour bridge!

See the Surf. This ferry takes you to Manly beach, the site of many surf championships. It is a beautiful beach. We grew up in California and rivals any they have to offer. The town of Manly is full of cute shops and restaurants. It's a great change of pace from from the hustle and bustle of Sydney

VERY EFFICIENT SERVICE. Sydney Ferries continue to offer a very efficient service between Circular Quay and Manly and at a pretty reasonable price. The journey itself is also very pleasant in good weather.

Busy. Great value way to see the harbour. It was very busy when we travelled on a Saturday so try and arrive early to bag the best seats especially if you want to photograph the Opera House and bridge. Well worth the trip as Manly beach is lovely and the atmosphere was fun. Great place to people watch.

lovely trip. They advertise Manly as X miles from Sydney but a thousand miles from care.. how true. A lovely relaxing trip which allows you to see one of the world's great harbours. And at the end a visit to Manly beach and the chance to eat at a variety of restaurants and cafes.

Go on the Ferry and don't bother with an expensive harbour cruise. The manly ferry is classic Sydney - a great commuter run and you can sail the harbour for the fraction of a harbour cruise (although yo you don't get a narrative). My preference to an expensive dinner cruise is take the afternoon Manly Ferry to Many (from Circular Quay) stop off a the local pub there at the South Steyne and have a cocktail or walk along the pier and beach and have dinner earlyish while watching the sun go down over sydney from the harbour at the fabulous restaurant Papi Chulo. It's a stunning restaurant and not too expensive.

best way to see the harbour. If you don't want to take hours on a harbour tour then get the manly ferry return and you can take in all the best sites for the price of a ferry ticket. No commentary but loads of photo opportunities along the way. Breast way to see the harbour on a nice day.
Fast Ferry. Used Fast ferry rather than slower busier public transport ferry. was twice as quick and nice open decks to enjoy view and sun
Boat lover again!. Like all the ferries in and around Sydney Harbour,the big green and yellow Manly Ferries are extremely well run.Indeed a pleasure to travel with them!
Fun Trip. Fun way to pass some time. You can take the ferry over from Sydney harbor and then back from Manly. Relatively inexpensive. Also lots to do once you get to Manly.

Only way is Manly. If you want to go to Mamly from the City, this is the way. 30 minutes on the normal ferry or 18 minutes on the fast service. Worth the ride just to experience views of Sydney a Harbour.

A unique transportation in Sydney. Taking the Manly Ferry is so much better than driving to Manly from the city. It is very basic, but friendly, gets you there on time and takes you past some of the most beautiful parts of Sydney. It can be quite exciting in inclement weather!

We had a lovely day. We took the ferry as it was a nice day and we had a great trip across on the ferry about 30 min each way I guess if it was not so good on the waters u could catch the train across

Beautiful way to see Sydney Harbor. This is a very beautiful way to see the Sydney harbor, while going to a very nice beach. The trip took about 25 minutes (the "fast ferry" wasn't worth the additional expense).

Afternoon ferry and lunch stop. After walking through central Sydney we took the ferry to Manly for lunch on the quayside. It was a hot but breezy day so we stayed on the outside deck both ways to take in the views. The service was efficient and punctual and the return trip especially was a great way to view Sydney Harbour without doing a more expensive harbour cruise. Sadly not enough time to do a coastal walk but had a great pizza in a quayside restaurant.

nice experience. The trip to manly would nearly take 30 minutes from circular quay.The ferry is not luxurious but the experience is tremendous.The view of the city and the iconic harbor bridge and opera house is breath taking
Manly Ferry. A relaxing "cruise" over to Manly with lots to see on the way. It is a nice walk to Manly Beach from the dock.Lots of eating places and shops.
Great scenic trip. Great Beach, great Ferry ride on a wonderful sunny day. TThe sailboats were out in full swing. Wifi on the boat. Took a book to read on the beach. Heaven

Fast, nice views. We took the fast ferry, about 20 minutes or so to Circular Quay downtown Sydney. Nice facilities, vessel was clean, staff helpful. Get tickets at the kiosk in the station beforehand.

Great Touring Opportunity. An inexpensive way to get to see many sights in the Sydney Harbor is to take this ferry. They leave from Circular Quay, and run frequently. Good way to stretch your touring money.

Great way to see Sydney.. We ride the ferries every time we visit Sydney, they are a great relaxing way to travel around and see the harbour and her treasures.This time we traveled to Watsons Bay for lunch at a seafood restaurant.Good value for money.

A great way to see the sights of the Harbour. Loved the experience. There is a kiosk on board for drinks, chips and ice cream. The Harbour is absolutely beautiful from the water, you get a unique view of the Opera House and The Sydney Harbour Bridge.
Experience the Harbour. A great way to experience the harbor and when you visit Manly, enjoy the beach and have breakfast at the Pantry over looking the ocean, just love it
Harbor Tour. The Manly ferry not only takes you to your destination of beautiful Manly Beach but also you see the entire harbor with the 45 min ride. We so enjoyed it.

A nice way to see the harbour. I traveled to Manly on the ferry with my 7 year old son. He had never been on a ferry before and we had a ball. The ferry was clean and tidy. There was a small canteen on-board although buying from there is a little expensive. The seating was comfortable. The view from the ferry was fantastic, the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Fort Dennison, Botanical Gardens, and Garden Island Naval Base. The journey takes about 40 minutes to get from Circular Quay to Manly. We purchased a return ticket and just stayed on the ferry for the return trip.I would highly recommend it. I would also recommend getting on the right side (starboard side) of the ferry leaving Circular Quay. This will give you a good view when passing Sydney Heads. I would also get on the right side (starboard side) heading back from Manly as you will get a good view of the harbor shore line.
Quick and easy. Better than land transfer. You also traverse the beautiful harbour. At Manly a five minute walk gets you through the main shopping area to the famous beach.

An essential Sydney must. It's like doing Star Ferry's in Hong Kong or Staten Island Ferry in New York, the Manly Ferry is one of those synonymous ferry journeys offering stunning views at a cheap price and to a location which features on most tourist lists!

Great service. Bus, metro, train, and the boats in sydney and surrounding. It made our trip to sydney complete.Schedules were clear, also the announcements. The staff were friendly and helpfull.We had an combi ticket and found it great! Also the views are great from the boats.

LOVED LOVED LOVED the Manly Ferry!. This is an absolute MUST-DO whilst visiting Sydney! Highly recommended to do the sunset cruise from Sydney and back. Absolutely FABULOUS! Heading back into Sydney with the amazing lights of the harbour and Opera House was just awesome!

Thumbs up for Sydney Ferry services. I made three trips on the Manly Ferry itself, but I also had a very positive impression of the whole Sydney ferry service. Well organized, and great value with the Opal cashless ticket system.Especially if you are there on a Sunday, when there is a daily $2.50 cap on total charges so it's virtually free. Check out the info on the web for NSW travel.The Manly ferry trip itself is 30 minutes each way and there are great views all the way. Of course if you want to visit Manly Beach then the ferry is a great way to get there (it's very high capacity although I assume it gets very busy at peak times). But it's also a good option to simply take the trip over, have a quick stroll and a drink, and come back. There are good viewing seats on the outside decks, although you will want to be early in the queue to bag those spots at busy times.
Million Dollar Views. Manly ferry journey has best scenic views with harbour bridge on one side, luna park on the other side, high rise building on either side of the journey.

Very scenic way to see the Harbor. Not a bad way to spend a 1/2 day. Being out on the water and seeing Sydney's skyline is a pleasure. Manly is a beach town with the requisite shops, stores and eateries. Nice beach

Great Way to get across Sydney. After a long day of touring with Kit and Terrific Tours in Sydney we were told the quickest way back to The Rocks from Manly Wharf was the ferry. It was a great experience and self explanatory. They took credit cards, we bought a couple of tickets, and were on our way with 200 or our closest new friends. Great way to see the city from the harbor and great way to get back to the ship.

Busy but very good. It is worth taking the ferry to Manly just to get such a good view of the harbour. It takes between 30 and 40 minutes, depending on which ferry you take. The ferry is very efficiently run and although it was windy the day we went, very smooth. The views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House are also worth seeing from the water. The ferry leaves from between them.

Great way to get to Manly. Went on a Sunday and the ferry was full. Nice to see a bit more of the harbour and very inexpensive especially if you are a senior. On a Sunday the ticket allowed you to ride trains and buses as well as the ferry.

A definite must do. The trip to Manly was definitely worthwhile - the ferry provides fantastic views of the harbour bridge and opera house and takes just 30 minutes with ferries running every 30 minutes. Manly is a quaint town and the beach is lovely and worth the trip.

So much fun!. What a joy to ride this ferry! Some of the best pictures of my vacation were taken from this ferry, especially of the Opera House. It's a scenic ride and is well worth the price. The waters were a little choppy on the return trip, so we were driven inside. But if it's calm, a seat outside on the bow is super!

Not Expensive. If you use the ferry boats its not very expensive and the journey is very interesting with great sightseeing. Manley itself is pleasant and the beach / town in my view is better than its more famous neighbour at Bondi.

Fast car . . .err Ferry. If you have been on the Harbour to Paramatta ferry, then be on this ferry, that they call the fast ferry just for the contrast. It cost a fair bit through ( about AUD 20 per head if I remember). The manly beach is Sydney's other main beach at the end of the ride.
Awesome Ride. Brilliant ride I have ever seen in my entire life. If you are a visitor or local resident please jump in to Manly ferry once. It's gives you a awesome experience.

This is the best "value cruise" ever!. Don't waste your time with those big mutli-day cruises, take the Manly Ferry. There are great things at both ends. Manly is a super spot and Sydney has...well everything. Looking for a day trip, this is the one, or alternatively, take the Paramatta ferry for and inner-harbour cruie.

If you only take 1 trip by water take this one.. Whilst not directly on the topic Manly beach beats Bondi any day of the week in my opinion so don't miss this trip!The good news is that by taking this trip you:1. Get to travel on one of the distinct Yellow & Green ferries,2. Get great views of a significant part of the harbour leading to the sea &3. Enjoy great views of the Opera House, Bridge & city skyline (just go to take photos if nothing else).

Lovely trip on the harbour. A great way to escape the traffic and get from Many to the City or vice versa. We're visitors so don't have an Opal card; it cost us $30.40 for 2 return tickets. But a pleasant 30 minute trip. Many people chose to sit outside, but we found a nice seat near the front next to a window and had a great view of the harbour - sit facing the front leaving Manly or towards the back if leaving Circular Quay for the harbour view. The ferry has a cafe on board and toilets. At the Manly end there's a great market atmosphere with a few little shops. The only downside is finding somewhere to park at the Manly end. There is parking under the ferry terminal but it's limited and expensive, nearly $60 for 4 hrs.

Excellent Trip. Brilliant way to see the harbour sights without expensive trips. Great views of the Opera House. Ferry trip is about 30 minutes. Choice of sitting inside or out. Refreshments available. Runs regularly. Manley well worth a visit.

Inexpensive way to see the harbour. For an inexpensive, unguided tour of Sydney Harbour, you can't beat the Manly ferry. It is inexpensive way to spend the afternoon, get some sun, see the harbor and, time permitting, have lunch at one of the many restaurants on Many beach, before heading back to the CBD. Don't miss this trip!

Manly better than Bondi. The beach is beautiful and busy with watersports enthusiasts. Secondly Manly area is clean, offers great selection of places to eat, art galleries and shops. I much preferred this to over touristy Bondi.

A great way to see Sydney Harbour.. For a cost efficient way of seeing Sydney Harbour hop on the Manly ferry. You will have great views of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge as you cruise towards the Heads. I have seen many harbours but nothing comes close to Sydney from the water. The ferry has open deck seating so that your views are not obstructed. Consider purchasing a day pass if you are looking at other public transport on the day or another ferry. Ask an attendant at the Circular Quay ticket sales for the best option. Getting on and off the Manly ferry should be no issue for wheelchair users. Open deck access may not be possible. Manly wharf has a selection of food options which should suit everyone..

good for first visit. I like traveling by taking ferry to Manly. Safe trip. So many outdoor activities around Manly Ferry. Take a coastal walk. Visit local aquarium nearby, enjoy the famous Manly seafood. oh I love the place.

Disapointing. Selected the more expensive "hop on/off" ticket so we could visit the quarantine station (which was rather disappointing). However, we waited for the next ferry to Manly so that we could have lunch there - unfortunately the Ferry decided not to stop at the quarantine station on the way to Manly, so we had the choice of catching the next ferry to Circular Quay, or waiting another hour, for the last ferry to Manly - in the hope that it would stop at the Quarantine Station - we decided that the return was the least risk - a wasted few hours!

Manly Plus.. Our visitors from Brazil took some fabulous photos of Sydney harbour, warning them to come inside as we approached the choppy infamous Sydney Heads. Before we visited the Aboriginal Dreamtime Fine Art Gallery Manly located on The Corso, we visited the not to be missed, "Ned Kelly" Pie shop on Manly's Corso for a huge $12 Bacon, Beef, Gravy and Boiled Egg Pie. The boiled egg was cooked in a hole in the actual pastry with the pastry lid on top of the pie, so Yum. We ventured over to the "Braintree Hemp" environmental clothing shop and snapped up a few bamboo clothing bargains before heading on down to the beach stopping in at the New Brighton Hotels roof top garden that gave is uninterrupted views over Manly Corso, Manly Beach and all the way to Shelly Beach.

Sunday $2.50 Opal Card. We enjoyed the Manly Ferry on Sunday for only $2.50 using our Opal Card (including all other transportation that day). Manly Beach and surrounding area was spectacular. Loved the Fish & Chips at Ocean Foods. Lots of surfers with big waves due to recent cyclone in Queensland. Hint: Make sure that you sit in the right end of the ferry (facing the harbor) to see the sights best during the journey through the harbor.
Fabulous view and great comfort. Beautiful views across the harbour, North and South Sydney and, of course, the ocean - depending on which deck you chose to sit in. Should be in your bucket list ;)

Cheap Tour. Take a quick tour of Sydney's lovely Harbour for a fraction of the cost that a charter company would charge, and spend your savings on a meal at one of the many good restaurants at Manly instead. In the one journey you can tick off four of Sydney's iconic attractions in one go - Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Sydney Harbour and Manly Beach - and glimpse Kirribilli House and many other enviable homes along the way.
