Manly ferries are safe, clean, comfortable and fairly inexpensive, and run regularly.

Bucket list deduction x 1. If you want to see the harbour with cracking bridge and opera house views hop on the ferry and sit back. Had an outdoor seat with views over back of the ferry going out which allowed for the best views and photo opportunities. Interesting return journey and when you hit the water flowing through the gap at the headland bit of a roller coaster. In summary, it's a must!

Fast efficient and reasonably priced. A great way to travel if you are pressed for time. It really travels quickly.You can sit on the open upper deck, or in a comfortable enclosed lounge below, which is probably the better option unless you want the wind and spray in your hair! The ferry takes you to the small beaches of Manly & then you have to walk a few hundred meters through a shopping arcade to get to the wide, spacious, surfing beach of Manly. Lovely sands, great rollers for having fun in the sea, and surfing competitions at the far end of the beach. Worth a visit.

Ferry ride: see almost all of the harbour. See almost all of the harbour diring your ferry ride to Manly Beach (40 minutes). Pass by the Opera House (during day or night) and see it all. For just a few dollars, you will have an unforgettable ferry ride.
Choppy waters. Loved the journey especially the bit where you nearly reach the open sea and the waves throw you about a bit! Reasonable price and very efficient.

Beautiful Seaside Town. A visit to Sydney Harbor requires some time to take the Manly Ferry from the Quay to Manly. The ferry runs about every 2 hours. The trip is about 1 hour each way and is very scenic of the different harbors. Manly is so quaint and you can walk on a sidewalk which follows the bay from town to the east and west for about 4 miles. Many shops, restaurants, etc. of all price points in town. Don't stay in the town walk street mall area but venture out and walk. Bike rentals and tours available. Take a day and do Manly.

Great and affordable way to get out into the harbour. The Manly ferry not only provides great views of the harbour, the Opera House, etc, but its probably the most affordable way to do so compared to going on a cruise or something of the sort.

A great way to see Sydney Harbour. An inexpensive and fun way to see Sydney Harbour. The ferries themselves are an iconic part of Sydney Harbour and rightly so. They are easy to use, spacious and inexpensive. There is food on board for purchase and free wifi. The best part is the view and its a fantastic way to spend a couple of lazy hours. Recommend.

Cross harbour the long way. One of the best ways to travel to Manly. A beaut way to see a lot of the harbour.You board this one at Circular Quay. A larger ferry than others on the harbour as you cross between the harbour and the opening to the ocean. Lots of room inside and out. Some perfect photo opportunities as you cross the harbour. No other ferry stops just straight to Manly Wharf and then a short walk to the surf beach.

it's the journey, not the destination. The Manly Ferry remains one of the best ways to traverse Sydney Harbour on a budget. Last year I had a couple of days at North Head Station with my partner and a friend from England. We drove down from the Blue Mountains, spent some time looking around Manly and the Northern Beaches, then my partner drove the car home again and my friend and I took the ferry to Circular Quay on a magic, sunlit and blue-sparkled day. Perfect. It was January 2014, btw, not 2015, although I don't think much has changed on the harbour. It just takes me a while to write these things up.

Good way to fill in time. I jumped on this ferry just to have a look around and fill in a bit of spare time after dinner - I really enjoyed the old ferry and as I have never been on it before it was extra pleasurable for me

Easy-to-use with a great destination.. Incredible views, plenty of flexibility on time and brings you to an easy place to start your fun filled day in Manly. Be sure to get your Opal pass before you travel anywhere in Sydney. The auto top-off system is sweet!

Awesome cheap way to enjoy the harbour and enjoy Sydney local style.. This ferry is ace. It cuts across the harbour and gives you amazing photo shots of the bridge, the opera house and also out towards to the pacific ocean and the heads. Cheap effective family friendly and simply friendly transport to get from one side of sydney to the other. Regular service so you don't have to worry about leaving Manly late. Highly recommend using this ferry when in Sydney.

Frequent,clean,fast,picture of bridge and opera house together and even I wasn't sea sick. Unpresidented view of bridge and opera house together in one picture as a bonus to the wonderful Manly boulevard with good pubs n restaurants and the sandy soft beach.. it's a must for every visitor to Sydney
Fab trip.. What a great way to see the harbour than a trip on the Manly Ferry. A pretty comfortable trip either inside or out. Well organised and not expensive. Ok for prams.Definitely do it!

Want the best view of Sydney take a sunset ride on this ferry. A inexpensive but very nice ferry ride to Manly, about 35-40 minutes. Bondi beach awaits. But the ride back to Sydney is fantastic, great picture potential coming into the docks past the Opera House and Sydney Bridge.

A Great Way to See One of the Most Beautiful Harbours in the World. Ferries from Sydney's Circular Quay to the beautiful seaside beaches of Manly have been running for more than 100 years.Today the trip takes about 30 minutes and gives you panoramic views of Sydney Harbour, the foreshores and out to the Pacific Ocean as you cross North and South Head.It is one of the cheapest ways to see this great harbor. Tickets cost $6.20 single or concession $3.10. You will have to ask if you are eligible for a concession.Tickets are available at Circular Quay or at Manly Wharf if you are doing the trip the other way round.But buy a return ticket from Circular Quay and spend a day at Manly. Your return ticket is good all day.

Nice Trip. Lovely introductory trip to see the sites of the Harbour and beyond. Manly is the farthest destination from the Circular Quay and reminded me very much of the the Lido in Venice. Get off the Ferry and walk a few hundred meters to the Beach on the far side where the bathing and Surfing takes place.

Great Ferry to another great beach. The Manly Ferry is on time and a quick and inexpensive way to get to an outstanding beach. The day we were there, it happened to be an international surf competition. However, we were able to secure a seat on the ferry. The ferry was quite comfortable.

Great trip across Sydney Harbour. The Manly Ferry provides a cheap convenient way for the visitor to see Sydney Harbour. Manly Beach is also a great place to spend a few hours. Enjoy a swim in the warm Pacific on the mile long stretch of sand which is Manly Beach. Or stroll along the Prom which reminds you of a English seaside resort, with lots of cafes and restaurants.
Trip to Another World. When you visit Sydney, be sure to take a ferry ride to one of the many destinations around Sydney Harbour. Manley is a bustling seaside resort plucked from an earlier era.

Manly is beautiful, and the ride is spectacular.. This is a win-win! Go to Manly for half a day, swim in the warm water, watch the surfers, lay on the beach.The ferry is spectacular! Amazing views of the harbour all the way out almost to the open ocean! The photos you'll get will be way better than anything you took from land of the opera house or bridge!!

Relaxing and great views. Lovely way to get to Manly and the views of the harbour are excellent. Large boat with plenty of seats although limited at the front you will be able to get good shots if you sit on the sides.

a relaxing way to travel from city centre to Manly. this is a relaxing way to travel from the centre of Sydney to Manly, as long as the sea is not too rough. it takes about 40 or 45 mins and the scenery is lovely. there is a fast ferry if you want but if you have the time then why rush!! if you can plan your crossing for a return to Sydney when its dark, you will also get the breath taking views of the Sydney skyline, the Harbour Bridge and the Opera house light up, so don't forget to take a camera. its just over $15 for a return and if you have an opal card you can tap on with that.

Best way to see the harbour. Nothing better than the breeze from the harbour and the breathtaking view of Sydney that you get on the way to Manly...photo opportunities aplenty. The walk from the ferry wharf to the beach is crowded beachy barefoot bikini bare chested people, fish and chips , gulls ...then wa walk around the beach to the next beach ...just a very necessary trip you MUST do

Manly Icon. No better way to get to and from Manly than on one of our iconic ferries. The ride across the harbour is spectacular and very comfortable. A must do for any tourist coming to our beautiful city. I live in Manly and one of my favourite things to do is take a ride on the ferry to Circular Quay. You can even buy a coffee and something to eat on board. It's breathtaking when the harbour bridge first comes in to view and going past the Opera House is spectacular.....sometimes there will be a big ocean liner docked at the international terminal and that just adds to the amazing experience.
Great low cost way of seeing Sydney from the sea.. Loved the trip from Sydney to Manley beach. You see so much more from the water, as you glide along. Good value trip.

Manly ferry. On my visit to sidney I used this ferry a few times. Great ride quick smooth and comfortable. That about sums up the trip.good for sightseeing the opera house bridge and harbour. 30min trip. No worries as they say in oz.
Very Relaxing. Quite relaxing way to get to and from Manly/circular quay. Good schedule generally not too crowded, weekend late afternoons excepted. Free wifi!
Lovely way to travel to Manly. The ferry is very easy to use, its ideal for exploring the harbour and seeing all the sights along the way to Manly?
Manly Ferry. It was a great ride nice seats, mostly all had window views. Smooth ride, clean. greats views of the Opera House and Harbor.

Slow Route to A Great Place. A must do for every visitor to SYD. (Check ticket prices; there are discounts for families on weekends in combo with other transpo). Commuters and tourists, bikes, grown-ups and families - this is just a great way to get a feel for SYD Harbour. Best seats are upstairs, outside - choose port or starboard, depending on what you want to see: the northern suburbs or southern, both are excellent. The ferry leaves you within walking distance of lots of beaches, etc., and buses to the Quarantine Station and points beyond. Worth every penny.

A lifetimes experience!. Travel to the furthest end of Sydney Harbour on these clean, efficient and well manned ferries. A real treat at any time but especially at dusk with the sun setting over the adjacent hill and city.Magic!

Excellent value for money. Excellent little cruise across the harbour to Manly. All the famous sights and excellent photo opportunities. Manly Beach is lovely with plenty of nice shops and restaurants. Well worth a visit.

Very pleasant indulgence. This is something I love to do on a day off. It takes about half an hour to 45 mins if you take the slow ferry rather than the fast one. You can sit on deck and enjoy the salty air and sunshine or around the sides and get s good dose of sea spray when the water is choppy or else on comfortable seats inside, protected from the elements. Nice views for the whole trip and love it when you pass the heads and its gets a bit rocky.
Manly Ferry. The rougher the swell, the greater the ride. Very scenic at any time. Recommended for all ages to partake in the experience.

Must Do. A great way to see Sydney Harbour and end up at one it's iconic beaches. Both the harbour side and the ocean side which is reached by walking through the bustling Corso have plenty of great views and lots of fabulous eateries. Once on the ocean side, if you don't want to experience the surf, take the ocean walk around to Shelly Beach. Look out for the water dragons sunning themselves along the walk and the delightful little sculptures as you reach Shelly Beach. If you're in luck it could be a windy day with a good swell which makes of high seas funs as the ferry passes past the heads.

When in Sydney..... ...take a ferry. Wonderful views, lovely experience. No need to spend heaps on a Harbour cruise - this is a lovely and affordable trip for everyone. No extras and no frills - great mode of transport though - fantastic sightseeing inclusive.
The best value in Sydney. Take a ride for half an hour to Manly. It's costs about AUD$7.50 and is well worth it. a great day trip with Manly offering both harbour and ocean beaches.

Cheap harbour cruise. One of the best ways to see Sydney harbour and all for the price of a commuters ticket. Sit on the back on the way to manly and at the front on the way back. Make sure you bring a camera- its one of the most beautiful ferry voyages you will ever make

manly. very efficient and what a wonderful destination harbor and surf.best trip on the harbor Plenty of lovely walks if you have time, full information at tourist information just of the wharf. beside the bus stops and don't forget to walk strait up the Corso .

A true Ferry ride..... Do y remember when ypu were a kid & the mere thought of going on a ferry was soo exciting you almost wet yourself ?Well the Manly ferry is totally awesome, just the fact that' it's abput 40mins to get there, you get to see parts of Sydney you never knew existed, on a sunny day it's a magnificent site& then once you arrive at manly the fantastic stores on the earth will surprise you, great pizza, drinks, ice cream......all soo yummy....then you get to ride back, does it get any better ?

Great way to see the Harbour. This is the best and most economical way to get a good insight in to one of the world's great natural harbours. And the Manly ferry is probably the most iconic. The trip from Circular Quay to Many takes around 30 minutes, plenty of seating inside and some outside as well as standing room. Lots of window space so good views from inside and upper and lower decks. Ferries can get crowded at peak times (public holidays, Christmas, N Year) but boarding/disembarking is well organised and runs smoothly. Plenty to see on the Harbour (fortress and naval) and of course the Bridge and Opera House so bring your camera. Can get a bit windy. The Harbour really is the jewel in Sydney's crown so if you went to Manly mid/late afternoon and returned after dark you would get the best of both worlds. Numerous fares available but one way is around $8 and purchased from a booth a short distance from actual departure point so don't go directly to where the ferry leaves from or you will have to back track.
Great way to get to Manly. The ferry ride takes 30 minutes to get to Manly. It is a very comfortable and relaxing ride. This ferry is very popular.
Lovely cheap harbour tour. This boat trip takes you over the length of the harbour and ends at Manly which is a lovely beachside suburb

LOSE TRACK OF TIME AND ESCAPE THE BUZZ OF THE CITY. The advertising poster used to say "10 miles from Sydney, 1000 miles from care". Probably could be better translated today into "after walking around hot pavements all day it is good to sit and relax on a ferry for 30-40 minutes then have a leisurely stroll down The Corso to Manly Beach. Fish and Chips for dinner if the wind isn't blowing too hard or something in one of the many excellent restaurants along the beachfront. I was born and grew up in the Manly area and it never fails to delight me whenever I go there. Once at Manly Beach, if you have half an hour or so, a walk around to Cabbage Tree Bay is worth the trouble. This is a trip worth doing solo, with friends or family, teens or young children.
Sydney gem. For locals or visitors alike a great way to soak in the essence of the Harbour and take you to manly. Add the walk to Shelly Beach and you have a great and cheap half day adventure

ferry ride. this is a peaceful way to get to Manly,no parking , no traffic, when you arrive have an icecream. there is coffee & food if you want on the ferry, the view is a great way to see the harbour,there is always plenty of room & comfy seas on the ferry.

We love the Manly Ferry!. Even as locals we love a day trip to Manly taking the ferry. We went last Thursday to have lunch with friends. Nothing can be a better than go by ferry on a sunny day to Manly - glorious! If possible go during the week when things are not so crowded. Though if you can only go on a weekend that is good too. Things to do in Manly -walk along the beach front, have a swim either in the ocean or the harbour, have a meal or go for drinks

Nice way to travel. Great way to travel from Manly to Circular Quay. Takes 30 minutes but you get to see some nice water and when it turns the corner and you get that beautiful view of the harbour bridge and opera house its well worth the trip. You can get some great pictures from the ferry.

Excellent ride.. Loved this trip. Views of Sydney from the water were great, especially passing cruise ships just arriving or leaving - so huge!It's quite a long trip but a great view of the bridge on the way back - an angle you can't get from anywhere else.

Fabulous Half Day. The regular Manly commuter ferry from Wharf 3 at Circular Quay offers the very best view of Sydney Harbour. From the starboard (right) side, see the magnificent waterfront homes, the coves and beaches. Yachts of all sizes racing one another, particularly on Wednesdays and weekends. On the way back, experience the beauty of the unspoilt bush and rocky headlands.On arrival at Manly, it's an easy 15 minute walk east to the famous ocean surf beach. There are many fine eating places on the Manly pier. My wife and I adore the share plates of guacamole, empanades and smoky pork, lamb and beef platters at Papi Chulo (book ahead) while taking in the view of the water and passers by. Use the Tripview app for all ferry, bus and train times. You wont forget your trip to Manly.

Manly Ferry Sydney Harbour. No trip to Sydney is complete unless you ride the ferry to Manly and back. Sydney Harbor is a majestic place and there is no better way to see it than by this thirty minute trip to Manly. I would advise however to avoid AM and PM peak hours for a less crowded and more relaxing trip. A night trip is also worth while as the city lights sparkle behind the illuminated Opera House and Harbour Bridge. For those who like a little excitement take the trip on a day when the sea swell is rolling in between the Sydney Heads..."it rocks"

Always a pleasant day out. Taking a ride to Manly on the ferry is always a fun day. You get see all the beauty of Sydney Harbour then when you arrive there are plenty of places to eat and drink on the lovely short walk to the beach. The walk around the headland is an easy stroll with spectacular views. We never get tired of visiting Manly on the ferry when we are in Sydney. Sit outside and enjoy the breeze and fresh air.

Lucky me. I have been living in Manly all my life - catching the Manly Ferry on school holidays going to the city and then in the later years to get to work each day. and now I am retired I catch the ferry a lot over to the city and for pleasure trips. Nowadays there are plenty of tourists catching the ferry and I am able to point out places of interest and on certain days watch the yacht races - It is such a laid back way to travel and what a lovely destination to arrive at - Manly Beach. You can't beat it.

Harbour views!. You cannot beat this for a really great view of Sydney harbour. Take the ferry from the harbour and take in the sites to manly. Have some lunch, enjoy Manly beach and then the return trip back to the harbour. Enjoy spectacular views of the bridge and opera house. Swap sides on the way back to enjoy this wonderful view.
See the best harbour in the world. Hop on the ferry and go across to Manly for food, sun and surf. See the harbour on the way. Cheap and relaxing - takes about 45 minutes
relaxing ferry ride. great views of harbour, nice food and shopping in Manly , great swim at Manly and a relaxing ferry ride back
Great way to see the harbour. Get on board early to get a outside seat. A nice cheap way to see a stunning harbour. Heaps to see in manly. Make sure you check out the great cafes in manly

Don't miss it. You haven't seen Sydney if you haven't caught the ferry to Manly. This 30 minute trip offers the opportunity to view almost the entire harbour in all its beauty, and ends at beautiful Manly with its stunning beaches and cafes. The ferry is rarely rough except for a few minutes as it passes the headlands leading out to the sea when if you're sitting outside you may get hit by spray.

Bridge climb - great experience. i took an family member from overseas on the Bridge Climb. It was a great experience. from moment we started our 'training' to the end of the climb, i felt safe and learned new things about my home town that i never knew.Would definitely do it again.

Must do in Sydney. This is the best way to see Sydney Harbour and three of the cities most popular beaches.- Manly, North Steyne and Queenscliff.
The ferry trip takes half an hour and takes you past all the beautiful harbour shoreline and landmarks. Very relaxing and you can even buy a coffee and snack on board.
Sea trip. Great for a short trip and some great waves as you pass the harbour entrance, a good view of Sydney harbour suburbs and headlands.

Cheap and gorgeous. Beautiful old ferries at public transport prices. the trip to manly and back is fantastic. the views are superb and there is a playfulness from the other (smaller) boats/yachts sailing the harbour. The journey and the destination are both worth it here. Go and enjoy!

A must for every visitor. Get your gear together and hop on the Manly FerryEither leaving from Sydney or Manly you will not be disappointedYou can sit outside although if the sea is rolling you can get sprayed (but you dry off quickly)Or just sit in a comfy seat and take in the views on either sideIt is a beautiful 30 minutesThe little cafe provides coffee and treats Rest your weary legs before getting off to enjoy a roam around either the historic Rocks or Manly... You are in for a great experience

Take the ride. You will not be disappointed.. This is the cheapest way to see one of the most beautiful harbours in the world that finishes in one of the most beautiful beaches in Sydney,Manly.You would not believe that you are in a Internationally renowned cosmopolitan city. The beauty of the harbour is made more enjoyable by the serenity of the low hum of the ferry motors and the large windows and outside decks allow for those amazing photos that can only come from being on the water. Anyone who comes to Sydney and does not do this trip have not seen Sydney at its best.

Manly ferry. WE have taken overseas visitors on the trip from Sydney to Manly and return on the Manly Ferry and we enjoy it as much as they do. It really showcase the harbour and is a very relaxing journey. A walk along the beach with fish and chips on the boardwalk is a worldclass experience and we'd do it even without the visitors over and over again.
Excellent Ferry. Harbour views are Million dollar from this Ferry. Don't forget to face the way you are going both TO Manley and TO Circular Quay as the Ferry does not turn around

Manly Ferry Trip. This is just such an awesome thing to do and always makes our 'top ten' list whenever we have friends and family from overseas visiting. It's just like a harbour cruise only a whole lot cheaper. Spend a summer's day in Manly, swim and snorkel at Shelly Beach, grab a beer and lunch on the water at the 16ft Skiff club. Just a perfect day out.

A Must Do. The Manly Ferry is a must do for any visitor to Sydney. A relatively cheap way to view one of the best harbours in the world. Then you have can explore Manly and enjoy what it has to offer.

The ONLY way to travel between CBD and Manly!. There's no better - or more relaxing - way to take in the many spectacular sights of Sydney than viewing it from on the Harbour! The Circular Quay to Manly ferry (or return) is a must for any visitor to Sydney. It's also the perfect way to travel to one of Australia's mist iconic beaches.
So much fun. You cant miss out on a ferry ride from Manly as it just so much fun especially on a sunny day, its definitely one of Sydney's best attractions.

A scenic trip hiding as commuter transport. Thousands of people travel via these ferries to get to work and home each day. After a few weeks they become immune to the beauty of what surrounds them and they probably spend most of their time looking at their phones.Stay away from the commuter peak periods and you'll be amazed at the sight of the harbour. Enormous mansions and unspoilt shoreline bushland sit side by side. This is the cheapest sightseeing trip you'll make in Sydney.Once in Manly take a walk along the esplanade as far as you want and chill out with Fish and Chips on the beach.A great day (or half day) out.
work. been travelling to work 5 to 6 days a week for 5 years on the ferry, never get tired of the views or the different people on it every day.

Experiemce the ride.. How wonderful to be able to sit down and relax while sailing along Sydney Harbour on our way to Manly. It was a calm evening so it was not rough crossing the heads... rats! I would have loved the ponding of the sea oh well...

Swap sides on the return trip. There is nothing quite like the Manly ferry - good views of the harbour, some rocking as it crosses the heads, a nice walk in Manly thought to the ocean side (and lunch, coffee or an icecream if you want). Lovely to sit outside on the side, but swap sides on the way back as the ferry doesn't turn around (unlike most other Sydney ferries).

Great ride. We took the long Manly Ferry ride to get a great feel for Sydney Harbor (there are also fast ferries) and really take time for pictures. I believe the ride took about 45 mins. Unfortunately as far as picture taking, we went about an hour before sunset, and so the sun was in the worst spot possible for getting pics back at the Opera House and Bridge. (so infidelity account for the sun if you are wanting great pics of the iconic Harbor).The ride itself was quite nice, allowing a different perspective of the Harbor. It was also quite pretty (but windy) on the way back at night). There are places to sit inside and out and washrooms on board as well.

Clean and reasonably priced. We took the ferry in the evening. It was extremely windy and the ferry was rocking back and forth when it met the ocean, but it was only for 5 minutes! Reasonably priced and clean.

A nice trip across the harbour. A good trip for seeing the harbour and Manly is a nice place to explore after you arrive. Great views of the opera house and harbour bridge particularly.There is a basic food and drink facility onboard, but it's good for snacks only.

Great views. The ferry ride has fantastic views of the harbor and is an exciting trip for the younger kids. While waiting the kids spotted fish near the wharf which kept them entertained. The ferry was very full so we had to stand but didn't mind as we liked to look out at the view and water.

Great view of the harbour. The ferry was a lovely trip and took around 30 minutes. If you want pictures, head to the top deck and the front for an outside seat.Manly is nice, but I think I missed something as lots of other reviews seem to suggest more?

Really helpful staff. We used the ferry several times. It must be one of the cheapest scenic ferry trips in the world.We were really well treated by Rob Hill team leader & Paul who looks after gate 3 .Paul went out of his way & then organised Opal cards for us. We had not heard about this card.It made our journeys a lot easier & cheaper.Many thanks to the kind staff from Manly Ferries!

Crowded but interesting.. Don't use this ferry on a weekend when the weather is baking hot. It is full. Outwith the weekends its an amazing experience and gives you a wonderful view of Sydney Harbour. The system for embarking and disembarking is fast and efficient. Would recommend a round trip. Manly Beach is worth looking at too.
Its a quick trip to a surfers paradise. Once you step off the boat you know you are in a seaside village. Its quaint and exciting and peopled and fun. Walk to the beach and learn how to surf!
Great to get around. Frequent and good value form of getting around places of interest in Sydney at a reasonable price departing from Circular Quay
Australian discovery trip. Wow this is a well run operation an is a good trip. Ship was clean. Nice an good ride. Easy to maneuver buying ticket. Good trip. Don't miss

Manly Ferry. What a great trip from Circular Quay to Manly, especially if one takes into account the "Senior Citizens" $2.5 Dollar tickets which gives access to Train, Ferry, Bus and Light Rail all overSydney for a Day! Thoroughly enjoyed our 2 trips to Manly from Circular Quay, very quick and comfortable.
Pleasant trip to Manly. Pricey for $15 return ticket considering it is only half hour trip.The views are nice and it was good to be able to open and close the windows.

Great value boat trip. The Manley Ferry trip is a classic. A budget Harbour Cruise with a very pleasant destination. You can just rejoin the boat on disembarking but I would recommend strolling down the Corsa to the beachfront for a walk, a bit of people watching & a cuppa or a pint. Ferries are regular & have snack bar & toilets
Best Harbour cruise ever.. Lovely journey, go across to Manly for a swim, come back in the evening for an amazing experience of the city lights

Perfect way to cruise from harbour into Manly...... It only takes 10 to 15mins to get to Manly or vise versa. Spend a day in Manly and enjoy the day eating and drinking on the Manly side. Plenty to watch and see and go for a long walk on Manly beach.

Great service... Best way to get in to town if you are staying in Manly. Very well organised and reasonably cheap for Australia. manly is well worth a visit if you are not staying there like we were. Great beach and pier eateries.

Best views of the Bridge and Opera House. Cheap tour on route to one of Sydney's best loved beach? YES PLEASE!!!! Camera's at the ready! When you arrive at Manly... make sure you walk around to little Manly, Shelly Beach.

Great views from ferry. This ferry ride is a winner. First of all you got fantastic views going and coming back to the Sydney Harbour area. Secondly you visit Manly which is a very cool and under-rated area. I did a big walk there which got me even better views of the surrounding area.
On a nice weather day it's beautiful
Manly Ferry. Something you have to do if you visit Sydney. Thirty minutes each way and views you have seen but only in pictures. A must do.
Took the Fast Manly Ferry and loved it!!. Great way to see the harbour and can get off anywhere around the harbour and get back on! Great day out!

Beautiful Harbour. Take advantage of the ferry to Manly rather than your car. Not that expensive, no parking required. A beautiful calm ride on a glorious day for our trip to Manly. Weekends very busy & the que can be 'big'. The day we travelled not all ticket windows were open which proved confusing for a lot of people. Even though we missed the first ferry due to the amount of people wanting to board, another one arrived in 7 minutes so no big deal.

Well worth the trip.. This ride was suggested by several friends when they heard we were having a short visit to Sydney and my response was that this was a city break and there would be no time to go to the beach. However, we were in need of a rest and could sit down on the ferry and continue to sightsee. With an Opal card the maximum fare on public transport over the course of a day is $15 so we decided to take advantage of what was in effect a free ride. The Manly ferry a great way to see the lower reaches of Sydney Harbour and the destination is a nice seaside town with a sandy beach. The journey gets a bit choppy as the ferry crosses the mouth of the harbour; you will know when to expect it by watching a ferry coming in the opposite direction.

One of the best ways to see Sydney from the water. Catch a ferry in the afternoon to Manly and enjoy the daylight views on the way over. And then time your return after dark so you can enjoy the Sydney lights on the way back.
Better than taking the bus!. What can I say? Get on the ferry, sit back, enjoy the open air and sunshine, and take it all in. Much better experience than getting to Manly by road.

Nice Views. While on the ferry you get some really nice views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. There is a small section where the ferry gets a little bit rocky, but it's only for 5 min when it's closest to the open sea.

Classic Sydney experience.. Hectic, crowded commuter service weekdays, jammed with tourists weekends. Very popular for screaming toddlers and loud tourists talking about their home cities. The views are stunning but the vessel is slow. Ferry has capacity of 1100 so be prepared for congestion. Manly Ferry is a must do, once. The prices, crowds and poor customer service at destination manly make it a frustrating experience. Males find standing at the on board loo hilarious while the ferry roles.
What a great way to spend a day! Great view of opera house from ferry.. Beautiful beaches and great restaurants. As well get the cheapest water view of the opera house and bridge.
Trip not to be missed. No trip to Sydney can be complete without a trip across the harbour to Manly. Spectacular views both leaving and coming into Central Quay

The cheapest and best harbour tour of all.. This is mainly a commuter ferry for those lucky people who live on the north side of the harbour and work in or near the city. It is regular and efficient, a great 'ride' in inclement weather and a relaxing ride the rest of the time. Why bother paying a fortune for a fancy harbour tour, for a few dollars you can get the best tour of the harbour and on public transport. You can catch the ferry from Circular Quay, ride starboard to Manly and return on the portside and you'll get the best possible views of the Harbour Bridge, the CBD, Taronga Zoo, the Eastern suburbs, Fort Denison, Garden Island, the Sydney Heads and of course Manly. Stay on the ferry and it will take you back to the Quay or hop off at Manly, check out the shopping, the beach and the headland and catch the next ferry back. I've lived away from Sydney for decades and when I return this is always the best way to reacquaint oneself with how beautiful Sydney really is.

Great way to see the Harbour. Took Family to Manly on the Ferry as a different way to experience the harbour. I would motivate all people who visit Sydney the ferry to Manly is the only way to get to Manly. On the recent trip the swell was pretty big which the kids thoughts was exciting on the run back to Circular Quay.

Scenic view of Sydney. The ferry going to Manly is awesome! It offers a different perspective of Sydney. The ride was comfortable. Its reasonable at 7AUD. Its quick, takes around 25mins.You get to see the other activities in Sydney especially the water activities.

A great way to see Sydney harbour. This option provides an inexpensive way of seeing Sydney harbour. There is no commentary, so take your guide book to understand what you are looking at - or just enjoy the view. The trip takes 30 minutes and you could return on the same boat - or wander down Manly Corso and stop for fish and chips overlooking the ocean beach. For a longer walk, get a map from the information booth and consider a stroll out to Fairy Bower. On a nice day, it's glorious!The ferry ride can be rough as it passes "the Heads" (entrance to Sydney Harbour) but most of the ride is in sheltered water and usually quite pleasant.All up an inexpensive and memorable outing!
Worth the trip. We went for an afternoon trip to have a look around in manly and were pleasantly surprise. What a lovely spot, just a shame it rained and we couldn't spend more time wandering around.
Nice Ferry. Enjoyed our ferry ride to Manly Beach and back to Sidney Harbour. Lovely views and comfortable seats.

Took a water taxi over and the ferry back. Must say, I give the Ferry the biggest points. It was a beautiful day, lots of people on board, but no-nonsense crew got us safely back from Manly efficiently and easily. In terms of costs, water taxi fast but pricey (about $170 USD). The ferry was much less, maybe about $13 USA (can't remember). Anyway, I highly recommend it.
Nice ride. Beautiful ferry ride to Manly. Manly itself is a very nice place, if you want to just get out of the city for a bit. Great beach with big waves.
A good thing to try while visiting Sidney. It was my first visit to Sidney. It was nice to view the city from the harbour. The price is good for the orverall experience.

Life on the ocean wave. I could spend all day going back and forth on this ferry,where else can you catch a commuter ferry and experience all the sights of Sydney Harbour and the north heads, wish I was sitting on deck now instead of freezing them off in London.

The Manly Ferry adventure. Travelling on the Manly ferry was quite an experience. Crossing the Sydney Harbour by ferry watching out at the passing leisure craft scenic harbour foreshores and Fort Denison. Wow what a great trip.

A great way to see the harbour. This trip gives 3 experiences:
The boat ride on the harbour
The harbour part of Manly
Manly ocean beach
All for less than $10
A bargain!

Another Sydney Icon. The Manly ferry is another Sydney Icon. Well worth catching the Manly ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and return. Got to get on the Harbour somehow and this is a great inexpensive way to do it.There will be good views of the Sydney Harbour foreshores, and also North and South Heads as you cross the Harbour opening. You could stay on the Ferry and return to Circular Quay, or get off and have a look around Manly ... walking across to Manly Beach for a look see.Most of the time there will be an easy swell and most people won't even notice it.[But you may have seen images of the Manly Ferry crossing the Harbour in very bad weather. A sight to behold! Just like being on the open ocean .... this is very rare!]

Fantastic Ride!. The trip over to Manly from Sydney harbor is so nice. Even if you don't like being on a boat...I can guarantee you will forget all of your hesitation once you lay your eyes on the city from the Manly Ferry.
Fun on a windy day. Always fun in a storm. Best entertainment who could complain just look at the views there's no place like home
Great views. Haven't been on the ferry for about 20 years. Great weather, the opera house and bridge looked fantastic. We took the old ferry across ane the fast ferry back.

A wonderful boat ride. This boat trip was really fantastic, Sydney harbour was full of sail boats and a spectacular sight to see, when we arrived we enjoyed breakfast at a lovely little restaurant, the trip back was just as and I would certainly recommend anyone visiting Sydney to take this trip..

What Views-Fantastic. A super inexpensive way to tour the Sydney Harbor is taking the Manly Ferry. Circular Quay is the ticket starting spot and an outside seat is the best choice for views of an amazing water way. The large two front ended ferries are amazing and relatively smooth and fast. A second benefit is arrival in Manly where a short walk will bring the tourist to super restaurants and beaches across the way. Highly recommended for half day outings or longer. It can be a full day easily of fun and beaches action. Food shops from cheap and easy to white linen table clothes are all within easy walking and most have amazing views. We went multiple times and saw new things each time.

Quick ferry ride, cranky service. We took this ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach. It got us from point A to point B, so that was good. The staff was rude to just about everyone though, which was disappointing. They sighed loudly when asked questions and hollered at people to move fast when loading and unloading from the boat. It didn't bother me too much because we got to our location, but people seemed pretty miffed and there didn't seem to be any reason for the rudeness.

Quick and comfortable. They journey over to Manly from Sydney didn't take long. Plenty of fairly comfortable seating. Easy to access, train tickets are also ferry tickets which is good, only have to pay once.
Relaxing.. Great day out.. Lovely day on the beach with good swimming and plenty of great restaurant and pubs for eating.Was enjoyable sightseeing on the ferry.

Nice day trip!. Large, spacious and clean! We got to see lots of new areas during our ride. It helped to have some locals pointing out all the cool stuff. Otherwise, you have no idea what you're looking at! Lovely day trip out to Manly!

must do..... Took some friends from Germany over to Manly on the ferry on the weekend...I'd forgotten how good this trip is.What an amazing way to view the iconic landmarks of Syney..and the ferry is very comfortable too.An absolute must do for anyone visiting Sydney..!!! Manly is a wonderful place to spend some time..just beautiful.

Cheapest Harbour Cruise Ever. The cheapest cruise I've ever been on @ $2.50 return for Seniors!On time, iconic and really enjoyable sitting on the deck in the sunshine, as the ferry cut across the sparkling harbour. Great views of the Opera House and Bridge.Recommend.

Great way to travel.. The view of the harbour was absolutely amazing . The harbour bridge and opera house were stunning. This is a great way to get some lovely pictures of the opera house and harbour bridge. Manly did not disappoint either . The ferry ride was just over $15 for a return trip the bay was smooth , it was a little choppy at the heads loved the trip can't wait to do it again .
spectacular. A great view of the city coming and going. Only takes about 30 minutes to get back across. Terminal is just a short walk from all the places you want to be.

The best cheap thrill in Sydney. If you do one thing in Sydney, take the Manly Ferry. It leaves from Circular Key, under the shadow of the Harbour Bridge, every half hour. You sail out towards the Heads past the Opera House and see all the bay's along the way. The boat begins to roll as you get towards the Heads, and then you arrive at buzzy Manly Wharf with its bars, restaurants, shops and cafes, ready to schmooze with the natives. A great introduction to Sydney life.

A must do. The cheapest way to get onto Sydney Harbour. Around $15 return for a less than 30 minute ferry ride that takes you non-stop to Manly. Make sure you are in pole position to get the coveted outside seats - take note though if it is rough passing the heads you may cop quite a decent amount of spray :)The ferry ride back into the harbour has magnificent views of the opera house and bridge.

Probably the best and cheapest tourist attraction. I would absolutely recommend getting on a ferry to Manly and back. Great value. An easy way to see the harbour bridge, SOH, etc. Great pics. It can get a bit choppy when you almost enter open sea. Manly is a very nice place to visit as well.

Got to be done!. A trip to manly is a must - it is very less cosmopolitan or sophisticated than Sydney but has a charm of its own The ferry is efficient and part of the experience of going to Australia.

More stunning views!. While there were lots of tour boats doing trips around Sydney harbour it was suggested to us that we might get all we wanted by just using the regular Manly ferry. The crossing was 30 mins each way and cost just over $15 each. The views on the way over and back of the harbour, the bridge the Opera House and Sydney skyline were excellent. Manly is also well worth the trip. Fabulous beach! The boats dont turn so pick your seat with that in mind. Really great experience!

Who doesn't love the Manly Ferry?. Whilst there are a few ways of heading out to Manly and returning to the city, the Manly Ferry is definitely the most enjoyable. Watching Sydney go by as you gently rock along is a wonderful way to travel. The swell by the heads can cause a few people to worry but it's perfectly safe.

Very Pleasant. We had a very pleasant journey to and from Manly on the Ferry on 24th January. Weather was great and lovely breeze on a warm day. Postcard day for the Harbour City. This is a must do journey for anyone visiting Sydney and even if you live in Sydney this is an ideal trip to take to fall in love with the City again.

Relaxing.. A great little trip. It was relaxing to just be out on the water and also to see the views around the harbour as we headed to Manly. The ferry was clean and the ride was comfortable. It was a pleasant way to go from A to B. Would do it again.
Part of our 3 week Honeymoon in Australia. Good value for money took the ferry from Sydney harbour to Manly and back lots to view on the way. Manly beach is good :-)
Best way to see Sydney harbour. If you want to enjoy Sydney harbour, take a ferry, and Manly ferry is the best because it brings you to Manly, its shops restaurants and beaches.
Brilliant service. Fast frequent with great views what else could you ask for?Very friendly staff helped so many people when a ferry was full on return to Sydney quay. Loved it thank you :)

great trip. Loved the ferry ride with views of the Bridge, Opera House and harbour.
Manly Corso is busy with lots of young people but it is a vibrant and exciting place to visit

Fast Ferry. We took the fast ferry (15 min) to Manly Beach. It was quick, left and arrived on time and was clean. Round trip for adults is $19.50 - a bit steep but once you get to Manly you have a fun city to walk through with plenty of shops, restaurants and a beautiful beach.

Value for money. Excellent value for money is at hand if you catch the ferry to Manly. If you have an Opal card it is $2.50 (It states this online) for the standard 38 minute journey or you can pay $9.50 for SFF (Sydney Fast Ferry) which takes around 20 minutes and has much more space and seating.The views are spectacular, sialing through the Sydney Harbour, passing the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and the Prime Ministers residnence. You'll be paying a hell of a lot more through a tour company to see these sites up close.The dock in Manly is perfect as well with shops and restaurants within the walk through and Manly beach being opposite.

Excellent way to travel. The Sydney Ferries are a wonderful and cheap way to trave. The Manly Ferry is particularly popular but so many are operated that there's no problem getting on. It is an excellent way to see the harbour and the trip up to Manly is delightful.
Cheap and cheerful. Great value to see the harbour area but was very busy as we did it on a very warm Sunday and Manley beach was packed but a great day out and well worth it
Fast Ferry and save time. We paid a bit extra and caught the fast ferry over and back. We only had one day to explore, swim and eat fish & chips in Manly and wanted to make the most of it.

Ferry to my home. This really is an example of public transport at its best! The boat has all facilities, from a cold or hot drink and toilets. There is seating outside at both points of the boat. If you are traveling from Circular Quay to Manly then rush to the front of the queue, head upstairs and go to the outdoor seating area that is facing the city. This way when the boat leaves you will have front row seats that stare out at the whole city and harbour as it slowly becomes a distant memory.

Manly Ferry and Sydney Harbour. This is a wonderful way to see part of the harbour and also visit the famous Manly beach. It is a very reasonable way to see this area. There is a special ticket on Sunday that gives you unlimited rides on the bus/ferry and train. There are many nice eating places at Manly or just get some fish and chips and sit on the beachfront. Another great thing to do at Manly is to take the walk to Shelley Beach from the southern end of Manly beach the walkway will take you all the way to this beach. An idle place for a swim and a picnic. Suitable for everyone especially families as the water is more calm as it is protected from the weather.

Just ride it. Last time we were stopped in the middle of the harbor by a whale. It is the best way to see Sydney's beautiful harbor and the opera house. Just relax and enjoy the view. Get off at Manly and grab a cake or fish and chips for the ride home.

The Way to Go!. This is a really great deal - you get a Harbour tour and the trip to Manly rolled into one. Get an early ferry - the later ones fill up and there can be a queue - especially if there is a cruise ship in. We loved our day in Manly: shops, cafés, place to change, showers, and the fantastic (crowded) beach!

An attraction in itself.... We caught the ferry to Manly whilst en-route to Palm Beach (the Home & Away beach) further north. We loved the ferry and the views of the harbour along the way. We also met an actress from Star Trek on the ferry which certainly added to the experience! Certainly worth catching the ferry even if you don't intend to hang around Manly Beach for a prolonged period of time.

Iconic ferry trip to a great destination. The Manly Ferry is a 'must do' trip if you have a few days in Sydney. At the start and end of the day it is full of commuters taking their daily ride to the city, but the rest of the time it is very popular taking tourists and locals to and from the trendy and releasing suburb of Manly. The views on the way are amazing and Manly is a great place to wander and enjoy the cafes and beach.

Cheap way to see the Harbour. Best way to get out on the harbour if you are on a shoestring budget. If you have an opal card, and its a Sunday, you wont spend more than $2.50 all day for unlimited rides (bus/train/ferry).

Manly ferry and beach. An inexpensive way to see the Sydney sights from the water and get great photos.Manly beach is a 5/10 min walk from where the boat docks.A nice beach with plenty of little cafes which we preferred to Bondi which also needs to be visited but it has a smaller beach and is busier and more touristy.
What a great way to commute. The ferries are fabulousGreat way to get about from place to place. Practical but fun tooGreat views
Pleasant surprise. So relaxing and so much to see on the way to Manly from the Prime Ministers residence, Waterfront homes, Navel base to beaches tucked away and light houses on the coastline.

Great way to view the harbour. I had a nostalgic trip on the Australia Day weekend back to the area I grew up in - Manly. I hadn't been back for years and the definite highlight for me was riding the Manly ferry. It brought back wonderful and nostalgic, childhood memories. The day was very hot but on the water the breeze kept things at a much more comfortable level. The ferry was clean and well maintained and of course the scenery could not be surpassed. What a beautiful harbour with such iconic landmarks as the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Fort Denison etc. If you have an Opal Card the trip on a Sunday is capped at $2.50 (and that includes Sydney ferries, buses, trains, light rail etc). If you have children you can get Family Fun Day tickets on Sundays if you don't have Opal for the same pricing. Kids love the ferry!

gotta do. Was easy to sort which ferry to board, easy to purchase tix and well worth the visit. Ferry passes between the Sydney harbour bridge and the opera house and is a pleasent 1/2hr ride to Manle beach. Quite touristy and a lot of activities on the beachfront
Nice view on the harbor. Not only you get to have a nice view on the whole harbor but Manly is fun!And the walk to the beach is good to buy souvenirs!

Absolutely best view of Sydney. This ferry that goes to Manly is probably the most expensive of the whole harbour. However, it is totally worth it. Just get ready with your camera and enjoy the journey.

Excellent ferry across the harbour. Who needs to pay for an expensive Sydney harbour cruise when so many local ferries offer a similar but genuine experience. The Manley ferry ride gives great opportunity for views of the Opera House, the Sydney Harbour Bridge and much more.Avoid busy weekends. We went on Friday and then thought about going back to Manley on holiday Sunday. The queues for the ferry were huge: we decided not to go!
Large. The ferry to Manly beach is large with plenty of room for everyone. The boat is clean and the trip is very enjoyable.
Cheapest way to see the harbour. Great way to get to manly from the city and see the sights of the harbour. Much cheaper than a tour boat.
Manly beach. Went over to manly beach on the ferry was a pleasant trip scenery was amazing hope to do it again some day

The best views of Sydney whilst enjoying a calm escape from the world. There is a wonderful timelessness about the Sydney ferries which calmly, every half hour, set sail across our magnificent harbour. For 30 minutes you can escape from the world and sitting outdoors on the side of the ferry is a lovely way to see both sides of the harbour. From the hush around Chiwder bay to the working harbour hit boats coming in through the heads there is always something to se.For tourists this is where you get your killer shot of you with the opera house and harbour bridge behind you. Sit upstairs out the front in the front row to ensure your moment.For the rest of the trio just enjoy the beauty.If you need food very basic tasty junk food is available - lurid coloured doughnuts, toasted sandwiches and pies and sausage rolls. The coffee is afoul so grab a juice.Free wifi so a good time to send your photos home or catchup on social media.Opal cards can be used and you don't need to tap off.

Well organized and prompt. This is a holiday weekend...so the ferry's were crowded, but there was enough capacity that you never waited long to get onto a ferry. It was hot...but the breeze once we got going made it fairly comfortable. Reasonably priced and a nice ride to Manly
Fantastic. Cannot beat the Manly ferry. Manly is a lovely place and you are treated to a great harbour cruise en route to get there.

Changed $15.20 knowing that the ferry was full and not taking anymore passengers!. Asked if I would get on this ferry, which they said yes. I paid my $15.20 to be told that the ferry is full and would not give a refund.Lived here for fifteen year and the service is slowly gotten worse.Which is a real shame.
Harbour views. Great way to see all the main harbour sitesUsing opal card cheap way to use the ferries. Do not be put off by the number of people sit outside for a great ride
Very Good. I got a ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and we spent a day at manly. The boat was fast and efficient and it even had free onboard wifi and a place to charge your phone.

Efficient, pleasant, nice views. I do not understand why one would pay for the 'fast ferry' to Manly when the public ferry is fine. You can save all of 15 minutes on the fast at more than twice the price.
The ferry was on time, steady and comfortable except for some people who do not know what soap in a shower is for.

Easy to do.. Loved the Corso at Manly, which ends at the wharf. Manly Ferry was easy to find and was exactly on time as per schedule. We had a great day and I would recommend the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly, lunch on the Corso, a walk to the Ocean side and back to the Manly Ferry.
Excellent way to see Sydney. Fast, efficient and such a gorgeous way to travel when it is hot and sunny. How gorgeous is this city...

Gret ferry to manly. We got a day rail ticket from Padstow which covered ferries and buses so the whole day was very reasonable and we enjoyed the ferry ride to Manley and drinks at the terminal and the walk through the town and along to Shelley beach, great day.

We are off to MANLY. The Ferry takes you to a lovely area called Manly, which has some beautiful beaches away from all the major Bondi Beach tourists.
A natural part of Sydney Greater Area that you can enjoy getting to via this Ferry. The trip itself is quick and very visually beautiful.

Ferry to north beaches. The ferries around Sydney are fantastic, free wifi, clean, safe, punctual... if you have an all day pass you can ride all the ferries for good value, if its just a one trip or return it will seem expensive

They look old but they work and get you there. Pleasent trip to/from Manly . You get great views of the Opera House , Sydney bridge , the harbour and the harbour mouth. If you are lucky you might even see a Cruise liner entering / leaving. Dont use the toilet to the right on exiting Manly terminal . its grim.

Ferry to one of the best beaches. This has to be one of the best trips to one of the best beaches in Sydney. The views of the harbour and the business of the place full of yachts, small and large cruisers and pleasure boats makes it a fun ferry ride. You've got to do it.

great connection. It is in my opinion the best connection between Sydney Harbour and Manly, to avoid the traffic and have a different experience. With a wonderful sightseeing from Opera House, Harbour Bridge, passing the little island prison (now restaurant), a big military ship, a nice scenery along the cliffs and their beautiful houses towards the manly harbour. Manly itself is worth it to visit, with its beach, shopping street and cafes along the Esplanade. Good to get out of the busy CBD.

A Scenic Cruise at a Public Transport Price. On New Years Day we wanted to see the harbour from the water having watched the fireworks from the Botanic Gardens. The ferry across to Manly was sensibly priced, had a useful buffet and got us to and from in comfort.We were able to walk around Manly, have lunch and get back for the evening.

Nice trip to the beach. Definitely worth getting a water taxi to Manly Beach. The best views of the opera house and bridge are from the water so its great to tick this off on the way to a trendy beach

Best way to reach Manly. If you are staying in Sydney CBD like most tourists do, your trip to Manly may start at Circular Quay. But you you have the chance, try to reach one of the ferries stops at the suburbs and start the trip from there. You'll have the chance to experience the sydney transportation system and enjoy the landscape on both sides of the river that takes to the Sydney Cove.When leaving Circular Quay, don't forget to look back and take a selfie with the Sydney CBD skyline as a background. If you are planning to use buses or trains the same day, maybe the best option will be the Day-Pass (about 25 dollars), which allows you to travel around unlimited in a day.
Excelent service. Manly well worth a visit, smashing beach/area. Ferry very spacious, run on time and free Wi-Fi. Well worth a visit.

A bit of a scrum. Lovely views of the harbour and an easy crossing.Embarking is a scramble everyone rushing to get the outside seats, there is no order to the queuing and that meant those with children or older people didn't stand a chance.

Great way to get about. I really enjoyed the ferry (again) and make sure I go on one each time I visit Sydney. A very civilised way to travel to Manly and the views are spectacular. Being up the front, undercover and on a seat is a lovely way to go, but sometimes you have to jostle for position. No matter how many times you travel it is always breathtaking and interesting.
A Sydney must do. We love Manly, and the only way to get there is on the iconic Sydney harbour ferry.. A great 30 minute journey with fantastic views of the opera house and harbour bridge
excellent. a great and fairly cheap way of seeing the harbour and manly. Plenty of things to do when you arrive in Manly. Like going for a swim in manly beach

An iconic "must do" in Sydney. Best value "harbour cruise" in Sydney. Only downside is that it can be VERY crowded. If you can make the trip midweek it's not quite so busy. Lots of options once you hit Manly - a swim or surf, a walk along the front. Heaps of places to refresh with food and drink, to suit every wallet.

Always worth a ride..... This ferry trip is always worth doing as one gets to see the wonderful sights of Sydney Harbour.Stay a while there, as there are plenty of food choices ,plus the beach is great if you have brought your bathers

Easy way to Manly. Not sure what the exact fee is as I have an Opal card and my journey was free but it can't be all that expensive. Around 30 minutes to Manly on the Ferry. The boat was late both ways so give yourself a few extra minutes to get to and from if you have follow on transportation arrangements. Also, it is packed and everyone crowds in to get the outdoor seating so get in line early to secure a good starting slot for the mad dash.

Great views. A great and fairly cheap way to get some fantastic views of Sydney.
We caught the early afternoon ferry over to Manly, had a few drinks on the promenade etc then caught the sunset ferry back - breathtaking views of the bridge and opera house at sunset.
Highly recommended

Worth a Visit. The ferry was fine, just Manly was a bit crappy. The only place in Australia I could actually smell cigarettes! Just a bit tacky, the beach looked good but personally I wouldn’t stay over at Manly too long.

A useful overview of the harbour.. If you are in Sydney only for a short time, this gives a useful overview of the harbour, and the destination a n idea of the beach culture which is an important part of Sydney's life.

easy and cheap. The ferry system from Sydney is excellent. Manly ferry goes direct between Manly and Circular Quay in Sydney CBD.
Manly is deffo worth a visit, great beach and great shopping.

Fabulous. We spend a very happy afternoon on the ferry to Manly, had a good walk along the beach and over to the secluded Shelly Beach, over the head to the great views, and took the ferry back to Sydney again. It's part of the public transport, so your train, bus, metro ticket (tap on tap off) will get you there for a very reasonable price. We loved it.

Best way to get to Manly. It is so fast and convenient! There is air con inside or you can just enjoy the breeze and the views in the outdoor areas. The schedule is also very convenient with frequent ferries coming and going.

Ideal. As we stayed in Manly this was an excellent service which we used frequently. It was the perfect way to see the harbour every day and reasonably priced. The staff were friendly and the boat always left on time.

a ferry is a ferry, is a ferry. but beautiful views of the Opera House...great photo opportunity. The trip to Manly is about 30 minutes. I wouldn't waste my money on the Express ferry, which takes around 18 minutes. It's a relaxing ride to a pretty nice little town.

Economical way to view Sydney Harbour. A relaxing cruise to Manly which is well worth a visit in its own right.As the ferries run frequently until late at night we went over in the afternoon and returned at night to view the harbour side lights.
Cheap way to see harbor. It costs $6 for a one way ticket and is fantastic. It takes about one hour and is beautiful. Manly is a lovely spot with great cafes and a nice beach.
Cheap and easy way to see the harbour. Lovely boat trip to Manley, takes about 30 minutes and goes right across the harbour. A cheap outing and Manley is a lovely place to visit.

great sights. well worth the time and especially the price.great way to see the harbor and get out of crowded Sydney for a while. found a fantastic fish and chips place at the riverfront and shopping was better too. Went on gate 1 travel tour of Australia and new Zealand and the trip just kept on getting better each day by their organization and information about travel. wish I was still there
To Manly!. Cheap travel to Manly from Sydney. Go on the ferry rather than pay for sight seeing cruise as the ferry goes right past the opera house

Rugby scrum. We Took the ferry at night time back to circular quays, if you can get a front seat it's a wonderful sight of the city , everybody seems to want the view so be prepared to be suddenly surrounded by flashing cameras, it's well worth the journey, great photo to be had

Public transport but what a trip. There are few better value public transport tours in the world (maybe the #11 bus in London) for a few dollars you cruise along an iconic harbour , outside if you wish, for half an hour. It is a must do. But remember this is a public transit system so seating, bathrooms, facilities are basic, providing for jaded commuters more than tourists.
A must for Sydney visitors. This is a wonderful trip. Just takes a couple of hours for the trip over and back and a good walk at Manly. Recommended.
Rocky. The waters were a bit rough, but it was such an easy option from getting from the harbor to manly, manly is such a nice spot to. The ferry service is very efficient worth the few dollars

Easy to use. Very easy way to get around. Return to Manly was $15 and tickets can be bought from Circular Key kiosks. Boats leave every 20-30 mins. Great views of the Opera House and Bridge as you leave the dock.

Nice Ride. We went to Manly via ferry twice whilst we were in Sydney. The ferry network around the harbour is a good way of getting around and seeing the place generally - great views all round.It was pouring with rain when we went on Chtistmas Day but hot and sunny on the second occasion. Manly is worth visiting but it does get very crowded in the holidays.

Good Way to see the Harbour. If you want to see Sydney Harbour, one of the world's most beautiful, see it from the harbour itself. And one of the least expensive ways to do so is to take the ferry over to Manly and back to Circular Quay.It's inexpensive. It's comfortable. It's fun. And the view is terrific!And...there are a lot of nice restaurants in Manly!
The best ferry trip of the lot!. I love Manly but the ferry trip is the best bit, good seats and snacks and brilliant views all the way, so glad my son lives nearby now.
Spectacular . Had a ride over in the afternoon and a sunst cruise back. Fantastic. It was a busy day but seats are plentiful and the views really are spectacular.

Great and cheap way to see the Harbour. On my holiday in Sydney I took this ferry many times as I was meeting up with friends. This is a very cost effective way of getting amazing views of the opera house and the bridge, but also the general scenery as well. Tip - may sure you have an Opal card (like Oyster in London) that is already loaded up and you don't have to faff about with tickets....

Harbour photos on the cheap!. The ferry system is Sydney is very good. We used our Opal card to hop on and off the ferries and in particular the Manly Ferry gave us some amazing photo opportunities. Manly Beach is also worth a visit. Don't be put off by the queue, the staff are very good at getting lots of people on and off quickly and the ferry does not feel crowded. You'd be unlucky to have to wait for more than one ferry (they're every 20 mins).

Senior's Scenic Voyage. What fantastic value. Travel to circukar Quay by train , ride the ferry to Manly and return all on one low price day-trip ticket.The Ferry service crew do a great jpb loading/unloading 950 passengers in less than 10 minute turn-around.The ferry trip to Manly covers so many of the Harbour sights and with a kiosk you can get snacks and beverages too. The crossing (about 30 mins) on a calm day is really relaxing and highly recommended as a real value trip for cost and content. There are also cheaper family tickets available too. A good option is to pay the extra ($9.00) for the "Fast-Ferry" service back to Manly.

A Good Way To See The Harbour. The ferry is old but it gets you to Manly and does provide an excellent way to see a large section of the harbour. Try for a seat at the front in the open air on a nice day or at the rear and watch the city and bridge and opera house.
Water Travel. Great inexpensive way to get to Manly beach and many other places via the many water taxi's/boats. Clean vessels and felt safe and frequent departures
Harbour cruise. I would recommend the Manly Ferry as an alternative to any of the harbour cruises. Get a spot at the back as you leave Circular Quay at sunset and it's a beautiful view all the way.

Opal Card Rules. Took the Manly ferry in the evening after a full day using trains and buses to see Bondi beach, coastal walk to Coogee. Using tap on tap off Opal card with the $15.00 daily cap meant it was effectively free. Don't bother with day pass for Ferry or busses just grab one of these cars from Circular Quay information centre and preload some money into it. Awesome boats with good seating and plenty to eat/drink at Manly when you get there.
Cheap Harbour Cruise. Don't waste your money on a cruise - take the Manly ferry and you get a fabulous view of the harbour

A great way to view sydney Harbour. Charge that Camera because you wont stop taking pictures of Sydney Harbour.
The 20+ minutes over to Manly is a beautiful trip EVEN on a busy summer sunday.
A must on any trip to Sydney.
Enjoy the view. Wonderful way to enjoy Sydney Harbour. And a day at Manly is always great, beautiful beach and lovely restaurants, one is spoilt for choice

Nice trip across Sydney harbour to Manly. Manly is tourist heaven - and probably best to avoid on the week-end. Too many cheap chain stores. Food and coffee not necessarily the best. But the ferry ride is lovely. And walking along the beach is great.
great value. great (relatively cheap) ferry ride...great view of the harbour from the ferry is worth it alone....

The best value tour of Sydney Harbour. I live in Sydney. The Manly Ferry is the cheapest and best value tour of Sydney Harbour. The other must-dos are: the Cliff Walk between Bondi Beach and Bronte (or a bit further), the Blue Mountains - Three Sisters and Scenic Railway, dropping in at the Hydro Majestic Hotel, the Bridge Climb and a night-time concert at the Opera House. If you are interested in food, have a dinner at one of our restaurants that have three "Hats" (the Australian version of the Michelin stars).Then get out of Sydney and go to the Barrier Reef, Ayer's Rock (Uluru), Freycinet or Dove Lake in Tasmania and Flinders Ranges - Australia is not the cities.

2 seniors go to manly. what a great trip by ferry to Manly recently ".using our seniors card only cost us $2.50 each ..great way to spend a day walking around Manly and enjoying the food and great sights ..must do it again before we depart this great country..

Amazingly Picturesque. I'd like a dollar for every visiting friend and relative I've taken on the iconic Manly Ferry. It never ceases to amaze and the views are always different depending on the seasons and the weather. You can see lots of natural scenery; famous landmarks, like the Opera House and the Bridge; perhaps an interesting ocean going liner or exciting yacht races plus, near Manly, there is the ocean. It's an inexpensive relaxing journey with a great destination: MANNLY!

Awesome scenary for a fraction of the price of a harbor cruise. The ferry ride from Circular Quey to Manly is arguably the best value for money way of seeing a sizable part of Sydney harbour for a fraction of the porice of doing this on a harbor cruise. This trip takes in a lot of the magnificent Sydney harbor scenery and is a most enjoyable way to see the great scenery and once there to have a look at the selection of Restaurants in Manly before going back to Circular Quay. I strongly recommend this if you haven't done it yet.

A THOUSAND MILES FROM CARE. The above title is part of an original title for the old Manly Ferries, "Seven Miles from Sydney & a Thousand Miles from Care". This was definitely a special day out to the golden sands of Manly, riding the half hour journey on any one of the Manly Ferries & hoping there would be a swell on as you crossed the open Heads of Sydney Harbour. It just made the trip that much more exciting, but for the every day traveller, the Manly Ferry trip meant a half hour to snooze, watch the harbour slip by, catch up on some work, read a book, talk to a fellow traveller or even espy a whale exploring Sydney Harbour. If you are lucky enough to be in Sydney, do NOT miss a trip to Manly on the slow Manly Ferry & relax for half an hour.

The best of Sydney. I have been riding the Manly Ferry for over 60 years and it still fascinates. There was a time shortly after WW2 when the navy was berthed in Athol Blight , the Baracoola still ran steam and the big ferries like the South Steyne battled the swells across the heads. Still it is my idea of a great day. Always an old Manly boy.

Only way to travel (on a good day). I've been catching the Manly Ferry since the early 60's with my grandma. The ferries haven't changed much since then but I guess that is part of their charm. It is such a beautiful way to get to the city and even when I started work, after a relaxing 30 mins on the ferry I was ready for anything. The weather can be a bit challenging but mostly only as they travel past Sydney Heads. They do however get cancelled occasionally due to bad weather which can be a slight hiccup. Love them and they are an iconic part of the fabric of Sydney Harbour life not to be missed.

Best Views of Sydney Harbour. If you want great pictures of Circular key, the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge, then a trip on the Manly ferry will give you the bast results. The trip to Manly on the high speed ferry only takes about 20 minutes and Manly beach is worth a visit too. The trip is across the harbour so you don't have to worry about big waves, but it an get a bit of a swell as you pass the heads. The ferries run all day and are less packed in the week between rush hours.

Best way to see Sydney Harbour. Without a doubt the cheapest and best way to see Sydney's great harbour and foreshores. Simply catch a ferry to Manly from Circular Quay, the wharf right in the centre of Sydney. The trip is breathtakingly beautiful and you see every detail of Sydney Harbour starting with the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Government House and cruising past some of the best real estate en route to Manly.Manly is one of Sydney best beaches. Hop off and do a stroll along the waterfront of the harbour and then through The Corso (the promenade street right at the ferry) to the surf beach side. It's the best and quickest way to see one of Sydney's most famous surf beaches. Don't forget your swimwear and sunscreen!Then when you're ready enjoy the return trip. The ferry has open decks so enjoy the salt spray and have your camera poised.

Best kept secret. You can pay for an expensive Harbour Cruise, but why bother when you can catch the Many ferry and enjoy an authentic Sydney-sider way to commute and see the sights to boot?Tip: get there early to grab the best seats: starboard deck or bow to view the heads and maybe even catch a splash or two

Manly Ferry. Iconic way to connect Manly with the rest of the city, the Manly ferry is an institution. 30mins of relaxed sailing hardly feels like a commute to work for many on the peninsula. With a cafe, free wifi, toilets and inside or outside seating, it is a tremendous way to travel and see Sydney at its best - from the water

Bargain price to view the harbour. Every traveller to Sydney should take the Manly ferry at least one way it's the best value Harbour tour that takes 35 minutes cruising past all the key points in the main harbour back to Circular Quay. Why not first take a bus from the City to the Spit Bridge as we did, then take the Coastal walk to Manly. Cool off in the Pacific waves or the more gentle Harbour then take the ferry back to the city.
Must Do. Harbour views to die for and a stop in Manly for lunch/dinner or just drinks. Such a cheap and perfect way to see the harbour

Harbour cruise. Enjoy the thrill of a cruise on Sydney Harbour for the price of a ferry ticket. This must be the greatest value travel experience in Australia. Unforgettable views in either direction. The Heads, Manly Cove, Port Jackson, Opera House and Hatbour Bridge are all part if the panorama.
Manly Ferry Rocks - sometimes literally!. The only way to travel to Manly, the ferry is an awesome experience and totally encapsulates what Sydney is all about.

Day Out. After going on a train for an hour it was really nice to sit and enjoy the Harbour and it's sights for a leisurely 30 minutes there and the same on return. The ferry was nostalgic and very enjoyable, harbour was calm and the day beautiful. The crew were helpful with all questions asked.

Manly ferry sevices. Great tourist trip and helpful staff. Go in off peak times so you can get a good vantage point on the boat. Can get crowded early morning and late afternoon week days and weekends. Can get a little bumpy near the harbour heads but that's part of the fun. Go on the port side one way and the starboard side the other way so you get to see both sides of the harbour.

Summer loving. The Circular Quay (Sydney CBD) to Manly ferry is a fun and inexpensive way to see some of the sights and landmarks of Sydney. Sydney is well known for its world class harbour, and a Manly ferry ride will take you near the harbour bridge, the Opera House and Fort Dennison. Pick a day that has a smallish swell, and hopefully a bit of sun to enjoy. If there has recently been a strong storm front, the swell can get big near the heads so unless you want extra motion in your crossing, avoid heavy swells.Check out beachsafe.org.au to check the weather and conditions. On the Manly side you can explore the Corso shops and walk to Manly beach. If that is too touristy or busy for you, try Little Manly Cove that is only 1 km from the wharf. Make a day of it for some good fun memories.

Who needs a harbour tour if you can ride on the Manly Ferry.... What a great way to discover Sydney Harbour. Just book a return ticket, take your beach stuff and spend the day in Manly at the beach, enjoy some drinks and food at the many places there and when you're ready hop back on the Manly Ferry and enjoy the ride back to Circular Quay.Have a great day!

A must do when visiting Sydney!. This is one of the most spectacular things you could do whilst in Sydney, and for the cost of a ferry ticket (currently less than $8 each way) it's affordable on anyone's budget.The trip takes about 30-mins each way, with some of the most spectacular views of the Sydney Harbour, including the Sydney Harbour Bridge, The Opera House, Fort Denison and the plethora of multi-million dollar properties along the harbour foreshore. When you arrive in Manly make sure you take the walk through the mall to the beach side, and even take a surf lesson! If you're more about nice food and wine then there are some lovely bars and restaurants on the wharf where the ferry pulls in. You can definitely make a full day out of this trip.

Great and cheap. This is the best way to see Sydney Harbour on a budget. Try to get on early and get one of the seats with a view - upstairs inside is great in windy weather. Otherwise get an outside seat on a sunny day and remember your sunblock.
Family day out. Great friendly spot, you can do as much or as little as you want, great locations for cheap lunch meals,
