The Manly ferry, although a commuter ferry, is also a great way to see the city from the water, especially the bridge and opera house ( absolute postcard views).If it's a sunny day, Manly is also a great tourist destination. The ferry terminal has some good restaurants/bars. The corso (mall connecting the terminal to the surf beach) while busy with locals and local tourists is interesting as is the street at the beach (south Steyne) with good options for freshly cooked seafood. Manly beach, while not as well known as Bondi, is also a great beach with safe swimming at the southern end. There is also a walkway around to Fairy Bower, a pretty little beach that faces west looking back at Manly Beach. Overall a good day out if staying in the Sydney CBD.

A MUST WHILE IN SYDNEY. day trip to Manly on the ferry is a must!
Great day out
Only 40 minute ride from Circular Quay to Manly.
Only approx. $20 return trip

Very busy on weekends summer and winter. Lovely beaches worth the trip great fish and chips on the beach yummy ice cream kids could have played for hours.
Very central from the city
On Sundays I think it's a dollar or free to catch the ferries buses and trains so check this out as it is really worth it.

A must do for any visitor to Sydney. Taking a trip on the Manly ferry is a must do for any visitor to Sydney and for locals alike. It is a perfect way to have a cruise, from Circular Quay on the most beautiful harbour in the world, with great views of the Harbour Bridge, Luna Park, the Opera House, all the little bays and all the suburbs that line the water's edge. Once you get to Manly you can do a walk along the foreshore to the left of the jetty for views around the harbour side of Manly and out the heads, or stroll straight ahead along the Corso to the ocean beach side. There are plenty of places to eat. The iconic thing to do is buy fish and chips and eat it at one of the tables lining the promenade, followed by an icecream. It is very pleasant to take a walk along the promenade. Walking to the left takes you along the norfolk pine lined beachfront to Queenscliff. The walk to the right as you face the sea is lovely taking you to Fairy Bower Beach and beyond to Shelley Beach. If you walk up to the headland you will get a good view of the coastline.

Manly ....... 7 miles form Sydney .... a thousand miles from care!. One of the " to do" experiences in Australia.Take the half hour Manly Ferry trip across one of the most beautiful harbours in the world to buzzing Manly.Great value for money!A tip! Try to get on the ferry towards the front of the queue and on boarding go straight to the stairs to gain access to the outer decks at the front and the rear of the ferry. Sit in the open air and just drink in the scenery

Must do. An absolute must do experience of Sydney and a perfect (and cheap) way, on a bright sunny Sydney day, to appreciate the magnificent harbour and enjoy breakfast or lunch in Manly. Avoid the peak commuter times to ensure you get the best spots to take it all in

Ferry trip to Manly. A good alternative to the moire expensive cruises around Sydney harbour is to take the ferry to Manly. You will see plenty of the harbour, and Manly has a great beach, good restaurants, etc. Another option would be the ferry to Watson's bay, then lunch at the Watson's Bay Hotel or Doyles Seafood on the beach

CHEAPEST CRUISE ON SYDNEY HARBOUR. Catching the Manly Ferry is one of the highlights of travelling in Sydney.....cruising on Sydney Harbour, with the beautiful amazing forshore as you travel to the best beach in Sydney MANLY BEACH

A pleasant day out. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly for a lunchtime outing. The weather was pretty good and the views from the ferry of the harbour are spectacular. Why would you pay for a tour at that price of $14:80 return. It is a leisurely walk to the beach from the ferry station with plenty of shops and restaurants. Fish and chips are a plenty just watch out for seagulls and pidgeons.

A pleasant way to spend a day in Sydney. What can I sat this has it all--- a boat trip, good atmosphere, sea smells and fresh air and it is not expensiveEvery trip to Sydney we go over to manly on the ferry. The vougage is enjoyable and you get to see one of the most beautiful harbours in the world for a few dollars.The scenery is fantastic, the opera house, the bridge, the nude beaches, Kiribbilly house, the heads, the naval yards and the list goes on. The trip lasts about 1/2 hour and at the end is a delightful seaside city with open and friendly shops & some fabulous restaurants.Well worth the time and money well spent

Harbor cruise. The Sydney ferries have been around forever. I always recommend to any one visiting Sydney to catch the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. Costs about $6.00 one way, The trip takes you past the iconic Opera House and provides plenty of time for photos of the Sydney harbor bridge and takes you across our scenic harbor to Manly. There you can take a short walk and stop into many souvenir and surf shops, banks, and pubs, and make your way to the beautiful surf beach of Manly. Before taking your return trip to Circular quay you can stop off at Manly Wharf bar and have a cold beverage before heading back. The ferry has a snack bar on board, and you can sit back, inside or outside and enjoy your trip back.

Great way to see the harbour and Manly. This is a great way to see the harbour, the Sydney Opera House and Manly.. very convenient, just go to Circular Key and away you go.... get the return ticket.. bit expensive but not bad for a days entertainment. And after you can do the walk around the Opera House into the Botanic Gardens and collapse at your hotel and relax.

Best way to see Sydney the Harbour. Avoid the tourists and get lost in the travel of Sydney area locals. Grab an outside seat and enjoy the 30 or so minutes each way for just $ 7.50. No lengthy droning tourist presentation droning over a loudspeaker, instead get lost in the realism of being a part of Sydney Harbour as a local does it.When you get to Manly, walk across the road and along Wentworth Street to enjoy the waves at Manly Beach . . . . way better than Bondi!

Excellent & good value trip. From Sydney, the Manly Ferry is a must-do during your stay. Cheap as chips, a good cruise out of the harbour whilst seeing all the sights - and some good photo opportunities - plus the bonus of an amazing beach when you get to Manly plus the other attractions there.Wifi on the boat is very slow but then why would you need to use it - enjoy the view!

An easy way to get to a great beach. We walked from our hotel to the subway station where we found it quite easy to navigate our way to Circular Quay. Once at the Quay it didnt take long to buy our ticket and find the correct Pier for the Manly Ferry. Our only complaint: we were excited that there was wifi on the Ferry- but it was SO slow we never could get anything synched to Trip Advisor!

Bargain Trip. My sister and I were told by various friends not to miss this trip, and we're very glad we didn't. Ferries arrive very regularly, tickets were about $15 each for a return trip. The views are stunning be sure to sit outside on same side both trips to see all the views, also watch out for dolphins as I spotted four. Manly was lovely to walk around, easy to find your way and also well provided for with cafes and shops. The beach was beautiful. Oh and at the ferry station in Manlky there is an Aldi supermarket, great place to stock up either for picnics or for taking back to hotel on way home.

Best ferry crew.. Had a very pleasant trip from Circular Quay to Manly. On our return I left my camera behind. The ferry staff located it and brought it to me on the next ferry. What s great friendly, helpful crew.

Must do when in Sydney. Taking the ferry from Circular Quay Harbor to Manly while visiting Sydney was definitely a highlight of the trip. The ferry, while somewhat pricey, was well worth the money. It took 30 minutes to make the trip from Circular Quay to Manly and the ferry passed by the Sydney Opera house going and coming and afforded an opportunity for some excellent picture taking of not only the Opera House but also the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the skyline of Sydney. The weather was warm and sunny when I took the ferry. Had the weather been poor, this may have been a different experience. The one negative about the ferry boat was that it did not have very much on-deck seating. Most of the seating was indoors. A must do activity when in Sydney.

Cheaper than a Boat Tour...Same View. We paid around $7 each way for the Manly Ferry. Got great pictures from the boat. Rented Bikes from Bonza bikes and took them on the Ferry. Great decision. Manly is a great place to ride around. Very bike friendly. The Ferry ride was enjoyable. Lot's of places to sit outside and great views.

Great views of Sydney Harbour, nice visit to quaint Manly. We really enjoyed the ferry ride and visit to Manly beach. It's about $15 for the ferry per person round-trip ($18 on the fast ferry). We took the ferry over to Manly in the late afternoon, watched the sunset in Manly harbour while enjoying food from the market, and took in the stunning views of downtown Sydney at dusk on the ride back. Overall, very enjoyable and a nice way to spend a few hours in Sydney.

Even better on a Sunday!. If you are travelling with family then profit from the stunning 'Family Funday Sunday' ticket. A ridiculously-cheap $2.50 for (almost) anywhere unlimited travel on the public transport system means you can even do the Manly Ferry for this price. Wonderful.The Ferry ride itself provides fantastic views of the Harbour Bridge/Opera House etc - but also just day-to-day life in Sydney Harbour. Quite a bustling place.Manly has a great beach - but you could even just grab a coffee and catch the next ferry back.The ferries run often and are a well organised operation.I would seriously say a 'must-do' activity if you're in Sydney.

Is the best boat journey in the world? What a way to commute to your office!. For the princely sum of about six English pounds you get a return journey by boat from Sydney Harbour across to Manly which takes about 30 minutes each way. This allows you to get some super photographs from angles not possible if land-based. Perhaps less known is that you can buy an all-day pass which allows you to spend all day taking in the different routes that ply their trade across the harbour. Some folk commute to work by this route which is far better than sitting for over an hour on a crowded train to get to work in London!

The easiest way to get to Manly and back while enjoying scenic views. A quick and not too expensive way to get from Circular Quay to Manly and/or back. Only this (except perhaps a helicopter view) makes you realize and understand the varied coastline of the Sydney Harbour, with all the bays and capes. Make sure you choose a nice day and also think about where the sun will be if you're after some nice photos. Also, the ferry can be quite packed with people and not everyone gets the best view...

A great walk. The ferry to Manly is really great and relaxing. Manly is really beautiful and is not far from the ferry wharf. The walk from Shelly beach to North Head is really a great walk. The walk is about 8 km and is totally worth it. The view is fantastic and you get a great view of Watsons bay and the city. From North you can take bus 135 back to Manly wharf unless you prefer to walk another 8km to it.

This is what Sydney is all about... Easy access at both manly and circular quay. We had a fine summers day with spectacular weather and views. 30 minutes to manly. Such a pleasant scenic ride both ways. Well worth and a must do for anyone visiting Sydney.

A very enjoyable trip around Sydney Harbour.. I do not usually do boat trips but was very glad that I decided to do this trip. The views from the water of Sydney harbour, Opera Hour & Harbour bridge were unforgettable. The whole trip took 2 hours in total & was very enjoyable.

What a day to be had by simply catching a ferry. Hop on at circular Quay, the ride is a supremely enjoyable feast of harbour vistas,which takes 20 minutes,each way. You are in the viewing hot seat as the magic of the foreshores slips by with beaches ,headlands and suburbs ringing the harbour. The Opera House,the bridge,luna park and the pristine harbour sparkles for you alone.

Great Boats to a Great Place. The Manley Ferries operate out of the Central Quay to take you to Many Island - which is a must to visit.The green and cream push me pull me designed boats are clean, look well maintained and do a fantastic job ferrying the local and holiday makers too and fro.On arriving at Manley Island cross the main road and a walk down the shopping precinct where you come across a fantastic beach complete with surfers etc. just sit and take in the view.

Iconic Sydney experience. Celebrated in song and verse, the mighty Manly Ferry is a must do trip in Sydney. You leave from Circular Quay and arrive about 30 minutes later in Manly, having seen plenty of the harbour on the way. Swap sides for the return trip. Manly itself has good eateries, especially away from the ferry terminal.

Great way to experience Sydney. Do this if visiting Sydney. We were only there for 48 hours & this was a day and 16 dollars well spent. Took ferry to Manly Beach, enjoyed all Manly has to offer, then returned to Sidney Circular Quay to experience amazing views of Opera House, Harbour Bridge & circular Quay skyline.

Perfect Harbor Views Anytime of the Day. While taking in all the sites of Sydney harbor before we boarded our cruise ship to head for New Zealand, we hopped on the Manly Ferry. Nice 30 minute trip over to Manly with great views.Enjoyed the Manly visit and checked out the surfer beach. Would be a great spot for watching the surf when "surfs Up".

Must do when in Sydney. Went to Manly a couple of times whilst staying in Sydney. The ferry is a great way to get the best views of the bridge and opera house as well as the rest of Sydney harbour. Tip - best to go up to first deck front or back outside area for best view.

Harbor View on the cheap. The 30 minute trip to Manly allows for beautiful views of the bridge, Opera House and the Harbour in general. Its does get crowded on the weekend, holidays and during daily commute times. Spend some time in Manly--great little beach town!

Cheap cruise, great views. I liked the idea to take a boat and escape the heat of the city. For a reasonable price you get yourself a nice cruise over to e.g. Manly. You'll pass the Opera house, see the Harbour Bridge and get some fresh air. The trip takes about 30 minutes and you'll feel energized once you arrive.
Ferry. Easy frequent and cheap very impressed & it's so relaxing. Don't forget they do children's prices . Also excellent German bar right next to ferry port.
Views and ease of use. Great views of the harbour. Well managed even with large crowds on a Sunday. Manly has many great shops and places to eat. Went swimming and had a great time.

One of the nicer views of the harbour. I think the manly ferry is one of the better ferry rides of the harbour and takes you right into manly. It's a very popular route and there's lots of things to do once you get to manly. I think it would be a nice place to stay for a night or two.

Wonderful but go early to avoid the crowds. I've based this review on how wonderful the Manly ferry can be when empty early morning at the weekends or going in the opposite direction to the commuters during the week. At these time you often get a whole row of outdoor benches to yourself and can put your feet up in the sunshine and enjoy the glorious views in peace. It is a whole other beast on a weekend afternoon however when it is rammed full of tourists, buggies, kids, people eating and pushing to take photos when it gets anywhere remotely close to the opera house.

Harbor View..... Take great pictures. I took the best pictures of the Harbor and Opera House on the Ferry..... This is a must do on your trip to Sydney.... The ferry was very convienant to my hotel... I was staying in Darling Harbor and the ferry was at the Maritime Museum which was a very short walk. There are so many places to visit from the ferry which includes Manly Beach, Taronza Zoo, Opera House and many more. This is a cheap way to see Sydney... Do IT!!!!

Best way too experience Sydney Harbor. The tickets are not much expensive and the best part is that it covers almost every place on this one ticket and they cover the opera house, Harbor Bridge and all other places worth watching in this single trip and because of which it is also very popular and usually sees a huge queue. Our ferry took about half and an hour and after which the ferry dropped as all at the Manley beach which is another of the beautiful places to be worth visiting around here and the beaches also have a lots of cafes and shops around its vicinity and gives you one of the best experiences around the harbor. The ferry is efficient covers the places nicely and gives you good insights into all these places being visited and all of these come at a good and affordable price.

A great ride. Get off the ferry and walk around Manly, dine at one of the many good restaurants, or go for a swim at the famous Many beach..then back on the ferry to the city. Great way to spend a sunny day.
Loads of FUun. This is probably the best ferry ride in Sydney. It takes you right round the harbor and past the heads. Best views!

We took the ferry to Manly to experience the beach town. What we didn't expect were the amazing views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge from the ferry. It was worth the ferry fare just for the views!

The perfect way to get to Manly. If you're visiting Sydney, the easiest way to get to Manly is not by car or taxi but by ferry. It's quick, inexpensive and stress-free. If you're staying in Manly you can also use the ferry to pop back to the Opera House if you're seeing a concert - check the timetable on the day but the last ferry from Circular Quay to Manly doesn't leave until sometime after 11pm. If you're an Australian of my vintage, you'll probably find yourself daydreaming and singing to yourself, "Meet me down by the jetty landing / Where the pontoons bump and spray / All the others reading standing / As the Manly ferry cuts its way to Circular Quay"...

Excellent value for money. This is a great way to see Sydney harbour, opera house anbd the bridge. You see what you would for a fraction of the price on the boat tours. I would recommend going on a Sunday as its much cheaper and parking in Sydney harbour is more affordable. It gets quite busy but you'd be surprised how many they fit on the boat. Manky is worth a visit. The boat can get a bit wet but its great fun.

great way to spend a couple of hours on a nice day. Manly ferry runs from pier number 6 at Circular Quay' cost for a return ticket is $14.95, available right at the pier. Since I was pushed for time, I decided to take the return trip without getting off the ferry. Of course, depending on weather, the best place for the trip is outside at either end, upstairs or downstairs. The upstairs outside area has convenient seating and that's where I chose to be. Don't think downstairs outside had seating, but I'm not sure. If you're at the front of the boat on the way over, you'll be at the back on the return trip as they don't turn around. The trip is about 1/2 an hour each way and can get a little rough as you pass the area open to the sea. It's a nice way to spend an hour or so and gives you good views of the city, bridge and opera house etc. The ferry also has a snack bar/

Best way to see the harbour. Travelling to Manly by ferrt is the best way to see the harbour. Once at Manly spend the day at the beach or lunching at great cafes and restaurants. Than enjoy the wonderful trip back across the harbour

A must-do best-value scenic experience. Sydney Harbour can rightly claim iconic status with some instantly recognisable landmarks, including the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The Manly Ferry is one low-cost attraction that can be repeated to maximise the appreciation of the harbour in all its glory. Escaping the hustle and bustle of the city, appreciating the navigation of the harbour, and spending how ever long you desire at Manly, is a best value experience. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes to indulge in a variety of foods, and those with water views and position certainly extend the experience. There is plenty of activity to keep anyone at any age entertained. Highly recommended.

Best view of the Harbour . Without doubt the best way to see the Harbour, and great value. Manly is a great suburb to spend the day in, with lots of cafes, bars and restaurants, as well as a superb beach. The ferry takes you right past the Opera House and if you go to Manly at Sunset, the sun is right behind the Harbour Bridge, providing superb photo opportunities. You might even get lucky and see whales near the heads.

Ideal Way to View Sydney Harbour. One of the best ways to see the sights of Sydney Harbour is to take a ferry ride to Manly. Ferries run regularly from Circular Quay to Manly. Try to pick a sunny day to appreciate the harbour at its best. A bonus for the trip is the delightful suburb of Manly, with its surf beach and harbour baths. Or stroll through the streets of manly, and perhaps enjoy some fish and chips from one of the many shops in the area.

trip to Manly. Everyone knows about Bondi being the best beach but it is a must for visitors to visit Manly.The ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly is very picturesque and takes about 30minutes andmany beautiful photos can be taken from the ferry including Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and the foreshore of Sydney. Once in Manly, an easy stroll up the Corso will take you to the ocean side which is also beautiful. From Manly you can catch a bus to Palm Beach which follows the coast line and from Palm Beach you can make your way back to Sydney via the Harbour Bridge by bus. This is my pick between the two beaches. Maybe not for young children if you intend to do the whole trip, but if you are only going to Manly they will enjoy the beach.

Best way to see sydney harbor. If you want to see the harbor, but not climb the bridge, this is a good solution. My ticket was 14.40 round trip and the ferry runs every 30 minutes. Once there, you can enjoy the beach and shops. My purpose was to see the harbor, not manly so I stayed on the ferry and rode it back to circular quay. They do have a fast ferry, but take the slow one so you can enjoy the breathtaking views. This is a must do in Sydney.

A great Way to spend a day. Pick a nice sunny day not to much wind and hop on board one the OLD Large Manly ferry! forget the quick ones indulge in old time ferry sailing.What a wonderful trip it is to Manly . One sees so much of the harbour and the sites that make Sydney the envy of the worldYou also realise how much more could be done around our great Harbour.So many places that could be users for our enjoyment and to promote SydneyHowever enjoy this trip and remember how this ferry made its own way out to SydneyI from The UK.Manly itself is great so a nice seafood lunch then back to the quay on a similar ferry.It always looks different on the way backA very pleasant way to spend a day. Try to avoid ROUGH weather Crossing the heads is no fun in a bis swell!

Sydney Circular Quay to Manly (by ferry). This is definitely a great way to enjoy the Sydney Harbour. You must catch the ferry on a sunny day (which will likely happen anyway) and enjoy the trip while sitting outside.When in Manly check out some cafe's and if time and weather permits (assuming you like to walk) a must see is the North Head Lookout. Enjoy.

Go To Manly!. A great day out. You get off the Manly Ferry on the Harbour side. Stroll down the Mall to the surf side. Take the Coastal walk to Shelley's beach, right path looking at the beach, then back along the beach from South Steyne to Queenscliff where there is also an ocean pool. Surf at North Steyne on the way to Queenscliff but between the FLAGS AT EVERY BEACH.Lots of eateries on the way. Have a great time!

Never, ever tire of this trip!. Trying not to sound biased, having lived in this wonderful city my whole life (and having been lucky enough to visit many others), I not only enjoy taking this trip as a commuter, but to show off our wonderful harbour to guests, particularly first time visitors to Sydney. Even on a lousy day (don't go if you are prone to sea-sickness), the harbour is ever-changing and it gives me great pride, and thankfulness, that we live in such a great place. Now that's NOT biased, is it?

All the views for a fraction of the cost. When recommending a Sydney itinerary for friends, this always makes the cut. This ferry ride has all the iconic harbor views for holiday snapping and is a great way to see Sydney from the water. A must and a fraction of the cost of a Harbour scenic ride.

A great way to visit or to come home to the delights of Manly and the Northern beaches.. I have used the normal ferry for eons. My only suggestion is to avoid the peak hours during the week, and the early and late ferries on the Weekend, so you do not need to queue so much. The fares are on the expensive side, but if you are a senior or pensioner it only costs $2.50, and on Sundays, the excursion fare is very reasonable, as is a family fare as long as you have a child travelling with you as it includes all other public transport within a fair distance. I love the ambience of the ferry, and how the tourists are all entranced with the views. It makes us locals try to appreciate how wonderful the whole journey really is.

A must for visitors. Although I live in sydney we often have a day out on the manly ferry. In you have only a few days in sydney you must do this as it gives you a great trip on our lovely harbour. There are the best photograph opportunities of the harbour bridge and the opera house. On arriving at the wharf make sure you walk down the corso to the ocean then turn right to walk around to fairy bower and up to the headland for great views. There are many fish and chip places to get your lunch and sit by the beach. With this this trip you get to sail on the harbour then walk to the beach and have a paddle in the water.

great way to experience Sydney Harbour. This is a regular ferry service takes around 45 minutes passes the Sydney" heads" , only entrance to Sydney Harbour . Obtain return ticket before leaving Circular Quay Once at Manly it is only a short walk down the main street to Manly surfing beach.  Local shopping

One of the best and cheapest ways to see the harbour. A great trip on the harbour from Circular Quay to Manly. Manly is a lovely seaside town with plenty to see, eat and do while you are there. It has a great beach if you like to surf. Manly caters to the tourists big time these days so you can get your souvenirs there for sure.Buy an ice cream and sit on the beach or near the wharf, buy some seafood for lunch or just chill out with a drink or two for a lovely day out. Travel during the week in off peak periods. Weekdays will be less busy than the weekdays. Bathroom facilities are at the wharf. I have been taking the ferry to Manly since I was a child and never get tired of the trip over and back.

Trip to Manly. Six friends were staying in the city,so we decided to get ferry to Manly.
Ferries are large comfortable and modern.
Great trip if you want to get on the harbour. Wonderful as you come back to the city of Harbour Bridge & Opera House chance to get great photos

most interesting harbour trip in the world.... Have a spare hour to relax? just step on the Sydney harbour ferry for a fantastic 25 minute ride to Manly, the ferry is 2 stories high and spacious with comfortable padded bench seats. You can sit inside or outside. there are light refreshments available onboard, and generally a good relaxing atmosphere.. of course it is weather dependent... some rides can be quiet moving if the waves are 'choppy', but the harbour views are most interesting and sometimes just unforgettable. Do spend some time at Manly, there is plenty to do and see. Just don't forget to bring some cash, sunscreen and camera.... have a great time!!!.........(greg&jill-sydney)

Manly and the Manly ferry not to be missed. A great way to see much of Sydney's famous Harbour - catch the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. You can buy a day pass for $22 (children half price) that allows you travel on any bus, train or ferry all day with the one ticket or you can buy a one-off ticket for around $15 return. Not advisable to take the ferry on a day when the water is rough though as you have to cross the Heads and it can get quite scary. Even a large swell can upset you if you're not a particularly good sailor. Plenty to see and do when you arrive. Highly recommended for all visitors to Sydney.

Manly Ferry. The ferry provides an excellent means of seeing and experiencing Sydney's beautiful harbour. The ferry goes from Circular Quay to Manly. At Manly take a short stroll to Manly Beach and the promenade. Take a walk to North Head for fabulous views of the harbour and city sky line.

Cheap & easy way to view the finest harbour in the World. A trip on the Manly ferry from Circular Quay in Sydney or vice versa is a fantastic way to see Sydney Harbour. It's cheap and takes around 45 minutes. For the adventurous the Ferry steams across the opening to the Tasman Sea or The heads of the north and south openings to the harbour. There are faster options to make the crossing on the water but the leisurely Manly Ferry is an old time Sydney favourite. Catch the ferry to Manly in the mid morning, have lunch in Manly stroll along the beach, paddle or go for a surf and return to the City by Ferry in the afternoon. A great day out for the whole family or for those by themselves. Plenty of friendly locals will help you - just ask.

Iconic Experience. A trip on the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly is one of the best ways o experience Sydney Harbour. Many of the harbour's iconic sights are best seen from the water, and the ferries are a low cost way to get there ($6, or nothing if you have a public transport Day Pass). You get a different perspective of the Opera House, The Rocks and the Harbour Bridge from the ferry. When you get to Many, you can stroll down the Corso (pedestrian mall) to Manly ocean beach for a swim, or stop at one of the many cafes and restaurants

A great ride with a lots at the end. If you only visit one beach in Sydney, make it Manly not Bondi and do it by ferry.Unlike Bondi, which is essentially a huge car park with a beach, Manly is a classic Australian beach with a panoramic sweep and tall Norfolk Island Pines.Best, getting to Manly is a treat enjoyed over and over again by Sydneysiders. Both the ocean and harbour beaches are worth a visit but my favourite is to walk around to Shelly Beach which is always calm and, because it is a marine sanctuary, a great place for snorkelling. The walk up to North Head is great if you have time and energy. It starts at the end of Shelly Beach and leads through Sydney coastal heath that puts on a beautiful spread in spring with wild flowers. You might also see whales from the cliffs during their migration (June and July).
Manly Ferry. Great way to get to Manly, goes every half an hour and such a pleasant way to travel, spacious cabins, toilets and cafe on board

Best way to see Sydney harbour. Forget a tourist cruise boat when you can catch a ferry for several dollars. Cafe on board. If you are planning a one way, go from Manly as there are often big crowds waiting to get on at the Circular Quay (CBD) terminal during school and public holidays.Why not consider a harbour side walk as well - there's several, all free and fairly level. (I have written about these on the 'Sydhey Harbour' attraction page)

A 40 minute delightful experience. I've travelled across Sydney harbour by the manly ferries many times and always enjoy the voyage, safe in a marvellous sea going vessels of 1100 passenger capacity and even mildly rough passages to Manly Wharf are enjoyable in their variation from normal. (Trips cease on really rough weather mainly as the swell at Manly Wharf gets too much for the mooring lines) There's usually coffee and snacks available and crew willing to explain the many points of interest around the harbour, but do not distract them whilst mooring (Tying up) and unmooring. My first experiences were as a ferry deckhand in 1996 and later as Sydney retiree tourist on visits from my rural home.

Public transport for us. An excellent and cheap way of having a ride on the beautiful Sydney harbour and excellent way of getting to Manly or from place to place whether it be Luna Park, the Zoo or suburban venues.

A must do for Sydney Harbour. I am a life long resident of Sydney. The first thing we do when we have friends or associates visit us from overseas or interstate is take them on cruise on the Manly Ferry.On a beautiful sunny day in Sydney the Harbour is spectacular and there is no better way of seeing it than on the water from a ferry. The beauty of the Manly Ferry is you get to see most of the Harbour and at the end of your trip you can walk to Manly Beach which is about 450 metres from the wharf. Make sure you get an ice cream or fish and chips on your stroll to the beach where you can sit on the sea wall or on the sand and enjoy the surf and people watch. If you are up to it turn right and follow the sea wall around to Shelly Beach, about 1 kilometre. The walk is spectacular. This beach is sheltered from the surf and if you have young children they will be able to have a swim. After all this you get to do it all in reverse on your journey back to Circular Quay. A truly great day out.

Best way to see the harbour. If you are considering a harbour tour, this is a great economical option. You don't have someone pointing out the suburbs for you, but if you're mostly in it for the view and experience this is a lot cheaper and you basically cover the same territory. Plus you can stop into Manly for lunch half way. Definitely a highlight if visiting Sydney for a few days.
the locals use it. be part of a daily commute across to and from Manly...gorgeous on a sunny day.....exhilerating on a rainy and windy day....the sturdy old ferries are icons on the harbour city

Still fun for the family even for a local. Took my family with 3yo daughter for a ferry ride. $2.50 per adult with children on Sunday Family Day, otherwise i beleive its $5.40 each way for adults. Takes about 35mins each direction. I grew up here, so have been plenty of times and it is still a nice experience. We started in Manly with brunch at the wharf. The trip to the city in the morning is much more pleasant than return trip with hordes of tourists. Going between North and South Head can be fun or sickening depending on how you stomach the swell (the ferry does close in big swell and/or bad weather). Beautiful vistas coming into the city and past the Opera House, Fort Denison and The Bridge, keep your camera out. All in all, a nice family morning out.
fabulas. 35 minutes each way taking in the breathtaking views of a wonderful harbour & foreshores a lazy walk around manly and lunch at a restaurant at the beach on a sunny day - very relaxing

See Sydney Harbour via Manly Ferry. As others have written, this is a great way to see Sydney Harbor, so it is worth the time/money without having to pay for a tour. Unfortunately, on our day there, the winds came up to 40 knots (!) and it was not a good day to walk along what is a beautiful beach and esplanade. In many ways a typical beach town with trinket stores and places to eat.

Great day trip to Manly. Took the ferry to Manly for a pleasant day trip away from the city - lots to see\do\eat\drink and a lovely beach to walk along & paddle. Stopped at the Rubber Duckie to sample a few of the 20 beers on tap & some amazing olive-chorizo dish - yum!

Such a lovely beach!. Love manly & the ferry to get there. Cheap! Fast & easy. Great swimming on the right hand side next to the manly aquarium. Shark nets in place & could see my feet all the way out.

Great Value. If you want to travel from Manly in to the heart of Sydney then this is a fantastic way of doing it, great views of Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera House and the harbour, quicker than the bus and cheaper than the car, don't forget the camera though

Only 30 Minutes from Sydney to Beautiful Manly. The best way to see Sydney from the water is from the back of the Manly ferry as it pulls away from Circular Quay. To the left is the Opera House and to the right is the Harbour Bridge. 30 minutes later the ferry arrives at the beautiful, laid back seaside village of Manly.

Relax After A Tiring Day. spent a day walking around the Sydney CBD and was on the ferry around 430pm. the fee is definitely worth it, besides experiencing the ferry like the locals, you get the best view of the harbour itself, so close to the opera house, the harbour bridge and lots of other goodness :)a tip, please sit outside and enjoy the sunshine and the view, dun sit inside pls haha!

Great view of the harbour. Ferry to Manly offers amazing view of Sydney harbour. The Ferry leaves Circular Quay with stunning views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House, and CBD. Eventually the city fades and your view turns to wonderful landscapes. The added bonus of this great ride you is the entire thing is repeated in reverse order on the way back.
Great views. We took the manly ferry trip over to the zoo,it was a nice trip out and we enjoyed the zoo as well,not really a fan of zoo`s,but it was ok

A must do!. Manly is a treat and getting there with this ferry is the way to go..... Great views of the sydney Opera and the Bridge. Runs often enough - just pay attention the the schedule. When you get off the ferry pretty much walk straight ahead and you'll hit Manly beach..... Worth the trip!

Very Efficient Ferry. We took the Manley Ferry from Circular Quay. The ride is great. Wonderful views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and Headlands. The ferry leaves you a short walk through Manley to the beach. The ferry runs frequently and is on time. If you travel on Sunday, the cost is less than $3.00 for a ticket that allows you to ride all the ferries that day. Quite a bargain.
Manly ferry. We had a great trip to Manly on one of the ferries, spectacular scenery and Manly was very interesting, the restaurant right at the Manly Wharf is great.

Always a must do when in Sydney. I used to catch the Manly Ferry 50 years ago,when I was a young girl working 5 days a week in Sydney, I loved it ,each day was different from tranquil and calm to windy and a huge swell.The smell of the salt air was always good to experience. The views of the Headlands,Beaches, Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge are outstanding.I still visit Sydney at least twice a year so see friends and family and always make sure I catch the ferry to Manly which is a wonderful beachside suburb.Just walking along the beach is relaxing ,stop for fish and chips or a coffee or a beer you will never be disappointed.

Great way to see some of Sydney harbour. An inexpensive way of seeing many of the landmarks in Sydney Harbour. The ferry ride takes about 30 minutes and the destination of Manly is definitely worth a visit. Such a different vibe to Sydney has a beautiful beach and interesting walks to go on.

A cheap way to see a lovely harbour.. Travels from circular quay wharf to Manly on the northern beaches [abt.7 miles] and offers fantastic views of Sydney harbour and foreshores,Operates from early am to late pm every halfhour and is a cheap way to see a lot of Sydney,When arriving at Manly,get off and walk around a very pretty part of Sydney with a long beach facing the Pacific Ocean,Stacks of eating places and souvenier shops..

Manly Ferry Harbour Views. Want to take a trip on Sydney Harbour " on the cheap"? Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. As you pull out from Circular Quay, you get a close up view of The Sydney Harbour Bridge, The Opera House, then travel past Garden Island, as you make your way to Manly. Put on your hat and coat in winter, sit outside and enjoy harbour views. It's public transport, but it's cheap.

A beautiful day on the harbour. We took a leisurely cruise on a warm March day. Had a gentle walk around Manly, stopped for a coffee, then ferried back to Circular Quay. On the way we got up close to a yacht race that was taking place. It was a great way to spend a few hours. The ferry ride was good too.

Love the Manly Ferry. Such a relaxing way of travel. If you want to visit Manly you cant beat the ferry or the fast ferry.You will see so many different sites on Sydney harbour. If the weather is warm sit outside and smell the salty air and have the opportunity to take some great photos of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.
love the ferry ride. this is a must do while in the city,jump on the ferry and go anywhere around the harbour,not expensive at all and beautiful and relaxing

See the beautiful harbour.. A day trip to Manly is well worth the trip. The comfortable ferry takes passengers across beautiful Sydney Harbour. Manly has many attractions one of which is the Art Gallery. A fascinating place to visit.

A great way to view the harbour. We took the ferry in the holidays and loved it. As it wa school holidays, we only had to pay for two adults and one child. The rest of the children were free. You ge magnificent views of the harbour bridge and the opera house from this vantage and Manly is such a great way to spend the day, with the Sea Life Centre and the pubs and cafes offering cheap meals, and don't forget the popular Manly beach. We found the ferry clean if not a bit dated, but was fit for our purposes.

Day out on the Manly Ferry. This is the best way to see Sydney Harbour as it takes you down the harbour and compared to the tours available it is the cheapest way to see the harbour. Best time to use the service is outside peak time 7.00am to 9.30am and 3.00pm to 6.30pm that way you will be able to either get an outside view or a good seat inside.On a good day it is a good trip or if the swell is running from the heads you get a roller coaster ride.

Sydney Ferry. This is a great way to see the harbour and easy way to get to Manly to see the beautiful beach. There is a day ticket you can get which includes the ferry train and bus I would recommend this to spend the day around Sydney!

Awesome outing. A must do for any one wanting an awesome experience. Catch the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay, if in the CBD, or the return from Manly. It is about a half hour trip across Sydney Harbour. The day we went was awesome. Blue skies, gentle swell. This ferry is very comfortable for public transport, and provides one of the best views of the Opera House, as you pass by it quite close. You get a feel of adventure as you cross The Heads just before arriving at he Manly Jetty. There are a number of cafes and restaurants at Manly, but you must check out Hugos for the best pizzas! We found a quaint market was running on the Sunday we went. Manly has a holiday feel about it, yet just a short trip from the city. Next time we might stay at Manly to enjoy the relaxed feel of the place. Ferries run each half hour for most of the day, so you can take as long or short a time to explore as you like.

Manly a must do! Sorry for the Nsw government over priced rip off on fares!!. Manly is a beautiful very stunning inner too outer harbour trip, it takes only 30 mins on the beautiful Sydney harbour too Manly a deification must do for every tourist unfortunately the NSW government andPrivate enterprise always hike up the price of fairs even with the introduction of the ill fated "opal card" only useful on a Sunday where it's $2.50 unlimited network wide, if you don't have opal be prepared to pay $22 plus RIPOFF. Manly is beautiful though!

Manley Ferry. This was the best way to see the harbour, the opera house and bridge. Easy to get on, easy to get off and lovely views of the harbourside houses and suburbs along the way to cosmopoliton Manly. I went on it with visitors from UK, they loved it so much we went on it more than once just for the ride.

fun way to see Sydney Harbour. Board early for a seat at the front of the ferry and rug up. You'll join all the international tourists, many of whom will be defeated by the cold or the spray when that happens. Hardier souls are in the box seat for magnificent views. If you go to Manly during the day and return at night, the city looks magnificent as you return to Circular Quay.Manly itself has that real holiday feel with surf clubs to change in if you go for a swim and lots of choice in restaurants and cafes or fish and chips by the beach on a park bench. We try to go over every time we're in Sydney
Worth the trip. Reasonably priced trip with lovely views of the bridge and opera house. Manly is worth a visit and a good starring point for further trips eg. Palm beach etc.

Really great trip, a must for any visitor. We quite often take the train to Sydney, and hop over to Manly for lunch. The ferry trip takes 30 mins, and leaves at regular times from Circular Quay and Manly, so it is reliable. Great view of the CBD, Opera house and bridge on the return trip to Circular Quay. The ferry seats are comfortable, and the view is really good of the harbour.
A great way to see the shoreside. An inexpensive round Sydney harbour trip.the boat takes you from Darling Harbour / Circular Quays out to Manley past the opera house and the Heads.
Manly Ferry. This was a quick and great way to see the Sydney Shoreline and puts you where you want to be in Manly. I found the crew informative and concerned.

Great!. one of the best ways to see Opera House. Whether staying in Manly or visiting for the dayyou'll enjoy an easy and fast way into the city and one of the best close-up views of the Opera House that you simply canot get outside of being on a private boat/yacht. It's also a comfortable ferry. And don't worry if you miss one. Another one will be along shortly an they finish late in the day

Crowded dated ferry with extremely rude staff. Yes it is a lovely harbour and we did it on a lovely day. Unfortunately the experience was marred a little by how extremely crowded it was. We came during school holidays so maybe out of season is better. Worst of all was the attitude of one of the crew, a hairy young man who did nothing but show disdain for the passengers. As I say it was crowded and it was difficult for us to move. The crew member gave no clear direction rather than grunt and curse how we were in his way both on departing and arrival. We chose to return to the city by bus where the staff were polite and friendly.

Perfect way to see the harbour views. A very reasonable way to see the harbour. I believe a return fare was $14 and the ride was comfortable. There is quite a bit of seating outside and masses inside. A big bonus for me was the free wi fi! Manley was also worth the visit, with a bracing walk along the promenade.

Great way to see the Harbour. A great way to see the Harbour. We caught the ferry over at about 3pm, spent a couple of hours exploring Manly and watching the locals surfing before catching the ferry back at dusk which meant we had a spectacular view of the illuminated city skyline on our return. Sit outside to enjoy the best views.

Great day trip. Sydney is the quintessential Harbor city, so you have to take a ferry to get the full effect. manly Ferry is a great choice because it's a wonderful old boat, you get the perfect view of the Opera House from the water, and you get to go to Manly and then walk to the beach.
Highly recommended

Worth an afternoon trip. We took the ferry to Manly in the afternoon, and I recommend it as a great, affordable way to see Sydney Harbor and visit a beach community. When you get to Manly, there are shops and restaurants within easy walking distance near the beach (just exit the ferry terminal and walk straight ahead a few blocks to reach the beach). We had a lovely dinner at a restaurant facing the beach. Then, we took the ferry back to Sydney while being treated to a wonderful sunset over the Harbor Bridge and Sydney Opera House!

Our favouraite thing to do when visiting Sydney. From Circular Quay to Manly non stop the ferry takes about 15 minutes and is a fabulous trip. You can move around freely and take heaps of photos of Sydney Harbour. Hop off at Manly and walk down the Corso to the beach, enjoy fish and chips, grab a coffee. If you are short of time the return fery trip alone is worth it.
Used it al,ost everyday. Was staying in manly for study, and always looked forward to my ferry trip! Loved it! Quiet and relaxing..

Convenient. Very convenient. It departs every 30 minutes, I believe, and it's a quick ride. No need to take anything for sea sickness or anything since it's such a short/smooth ride. We enjoyed walking around Manly and taking in the views.
Nice little ride!. When you go to Sydney you must take the boat to Manly. It's stress free, inexpensive, fun and manly is a great place to visit! A must on your to do list - I prefer Manly to Sydney

A great day out. The Manly Feery is a fantasic ride to beautiful Manly. Sydney harbour is a magical place and for the 30 min ride you can sit and relax and soak it all in.It can get a bit rough when going past the Heads but not for too long. Manly itself is worth the ride. Tickets were $7.40 single trip. The wharfe itself is full of eateries and bars or take time to wander Manly itself. A great day out.

Do this on a sunny day (careful with seasickness). If you don't want to go to Bondi which is always crowded and full of backpackers from Europe, you can go to Manly, which is a larger area, slightly slower pace, and you can do the trip with this 45 minute ferry ride.It takes you from the Sydney Harbour out to the ocean, then back into Manly Cove. Think of this as a ship cruise.You won't need any other public transport transfer (e.g bus) when you arrive in Manly. Everything is walking distance in Manly.

Great Sightseeing. The Manly Ferry is a must-do when visiting Sydney. So relaxing and spectacular views. Way more exciting than a bus or train and the ferry docks right next to the Manly Wharf Hotel which has a great atmosphere and yummy food.

Enjoyed the Ride. The Manly Ferry is a nice pleasant ride to the island. It is clean, comfortable and very relaxing. We went early evening and stayed on the island for dinner. The ride back at night was great, being able to see all the lights in the harbor. A must do when in Sydney.

30 minutes harbour cruise. Instead of booking a harbour cruise we just travelled to Manly by Ferry. Worthwhile doing as Manly centre is close and easy to walk to the other side and sit on the beach of in one of the many restaurants and coffee shops. And if you are an Aldi fan, there is just one located exactly at the wharfs entrance

Amazing views on the manly ferry. The manly ferry was such a nice trip, great views and the perfect length of time to take in all of the surrounding views. Great value also, easy to do on a backpackers budget.

Trip to the edge. The Manly Ferry whisks you rapidly across the huge Sydney harbor and just as quickly into another realm. You notice the surfboards as soon as you disembark and a short walk to the beach shows them in "full flight". Take a late afternoon ferry and enjoy a lazy twilight dinner, before returning to the spectacular, lit up city skyline.

Really Nice Place. Ferry to Manly was a good trip. Manly itself was really nice, with some lovely shops and a very nice beach. Also a nice walk round the harbour. Don't forget to have fish & chips by the side of the sea. Somehow they taste so much better that way. Also had my first fresh oyster.
great value!. Plenty of room to move about, take photos and see the views. Manly itself is also very lively with plenty to see
A lovely trip. We enjoyed a trip out to Manly on the ferry . The ride is pleasant and the town lovely when you get there. We walked through the nature reserve which was a good experience.

Very good except the price. Nothing to complain about the ferry, the price is very expensive for 30 min trip ($14 one way return) if you use it every day like me! The ride to Manly is good and give you the chance to take a lot of pictures on your way!
Great way to see the Harbor. We enjoyed our trip on the ferry over to Manly Beach. It was comfortable and a nice way to relax and view the sites.

Good day trip out. Catch the ferry from Circular quay and it takes about 30 mins to Manly Cove. Make sure you get a good seat in the front/bow (it reverses on the way back so the stern becomes the bow!) From there is a short walk to Manly beach. Plenty of places to hire surf boards. On the way back we spotted a Humpback whale in the harbour! So it was good value for a whale spotting cruise!

Fun - a "must do" in Sydney. The ride to Manly was gorgeous and a great way to see parts of Sydney you might not see if you don't leave the city any other way. Gives you an opportunity to see the Opera House from all sides. If you are in Sydney, you HAVE to take the Manly Ferry!

This is the way to see the Harbour and Opera House. What superb value! A 30 minute trip each way for about $14 per person from Circular Quay to Manly offers stunning views of the harbour, the Bridge, the Opera House, the Botanic Gardens, the impressive Heads, and it's so much cheaper than a tour boat. Also you get time in Manly - a lovely seaside resort. Recommended.

Why is it so expensive?. The manly ferry has just jumped up in price again? I dont understand it. Nothing has changed. Still the old ferries. My advice is get the fast ferry. Im sure more people will be doing the same
Go to Manly. Took the ferry across to Manly to experience another lovely part of Sydney. Journey was fun and had a lovely day out for not much cost.

Great alternative to a pricey harbor cruise. The ride over to Manly gives you lovely views of central Sydney, the Opera House and Harbour Bridge (plus other areas). It's not super cheap (about $14 return) but definitely cheaper than a tourist boat cruise. Manly has a nice pedestrian street you can stroll when you arrive, and it ends at a nice beach.
Great Value. Good Value at less than $8 though million dollar views. Cheap way to enjoy the sights of the harbour.

Best way to view Sydney harbour. The trip over to Manly on the ferry is the very best way to see Sydney harbour in all it's glory. For less than 15 dollars return, you get a great 30 minute boat ride out of the harbour and the best views of the opera house and the bridge. Then there's the bonus of Manly itself. A lovely little town, full of shops, restaurants and of course it's magnificent beach.

A great trip to Manly. We sat on the deck of the Manly Ferry and thoroughly enjoyed the 30 minute ride. Do bring a jacket or something warm to put on as it can get very cold and windy, the messy hair at the end of the ride really is worth the experience however.

Scenic ride to Manly Beach!. This ferry ride was fun, because you were able get a water view of the the harbor, the Sydney Opera House, and everything else that you can't see from the land. Manly is a great little beach town, we would we could have spent more time there! Also, our transportation card (for the bus, train, etc.) included this ferry ride, which was an added bonus...especially not having to wait in the long lines at the wharf to buy tickets.
Manly. The ferry to Manly is really worth the trip. The only one draw back if that the toilets at the ferry terminal in Manly were disgusting very dirty.

One of the best things to do while in Sydney. Sydney is an amazingly beautiful harbour and a cruise from Circular Quay to Manly is a superb way to appreciate this amazing waterway. On clear sunny days the harbour sparkles but wild windy weather can provide an exciting harbour crossing. So in any weather the trip is worth while.Of course avoid peak commuter hours. On week days the harbour is fairly relaxed while at weekends the harbour can be overrun with pleasure craft and racing yachts. I know I raced yachts on Sydney Harbour for years.Return fares are reasonable but Senior Cards should provide pleasant ticket discounts.
One day dropped over to Manly Beach. If you want to take a time off from sightseeing you might go to Manly Beach to relax at the sea. You can go surfing or swimming whatever you want.

Great view of the Opera House.. For about 15 dollars, you get a round trip ticket to Manly and back. A leisurely cruise with fantastic views of the harbor. You pass right in front of the Sydney Opera house and it presents a fantastic photo opportunity.

Must do Day Trip. Centrally located and accessible. Regular running times and ran to time. Great day trip, 30 minutes on the harbour both ways. Panoramic view of the Oprah House. Cheap, this is the best value for money cruise I have had anywhere.

Definitely come back on sunset. Come back from Manly on sunset. The views of the opera house and the ride in general is awesome!! If you are going on the outside deck of the boat, check out the waves! At the front part you might get wet! (very funny if you are willing to accept that. It cought me by surprise, but we enjoyed it! Lots of people went running inside. not my case

A must do. Take a trip on the ferry - a must do Australian experience and cheaper than a tour. You can join the local folks on their way to work, along with other tourists, and local kids going to school. A great mix.

A nice one day trip to Manly beach. This is a good attraction if you have a spare day in Sydney and the weather is nice.The Ferry leaves from Circular Quay (close to The Rocks area) and it is an enjoyable cruise to Manly.Manly itself is a nice little place and the beach is fine, clean and spacious.

Manly Ferry. Great way and inexpensive way to travel. Well worth the trip from Circular Quey to Manley. Great views all the way. Just watch the section across the open headland it can get a bit rough!
Worth the trip. Great way to see Sydney.. The slow ferry takes about 30 minutes each way. That gives you lots of time to sight see. You go right past the Opera House and near the bridge.

Great value. You can get a great view of Sydney Harbor without paying harbor cruise prices. The ferry leaves every 20 minutes and was 7.20 AUD for 1 way. We went from Manly to Circular Quay and had a nice walk around.

Nice afternoon out. Hopping on the ferry to Manly is a bit of a must do for an afternoon's fun in the sun. The views from the ferry are very pretty and the coastline when you reach Manly is worth a walk in the sunshine and cool harbour breeze.
Good value for money. This is one of the cheapest things you can do to see amazing views. Well worht the money. Manly is worth the walk as well. Street markets on weekends

Fab way to see the city!. Super efficient service and amazing way to get around in the city and see the sights. Take advantage of Sunday bargain price tickets, think it was around $6 for family ticket as opposed to $35 mid week.

A great way to get around. The best way to get to Manly, Watsons Bay, Rose Bay and a whole host of other places. Regular services and a great way to view the bridge and the Opera House from the water.

Fun On The Water. The Manly ferry leaves from Circular Quay. Queuing up is a pain and not enough seats, the waiting area is crowded and dreary, not very clean. The ferry itself is not wildly comfortable but adequate. We preferred not to sit inside but to take one of the outside seats so that we could take in the view. The trip to Manly takes about half an hour. Most of the trip was very calm, but crossing Sydney Heads just before reaching Manly was quite rocky. It was a fascinating trip. Limited refreshments were available on board. Booking clerks and other staff on board were not particularly friendly but it is one of the top things to do in Sydney - I will definitely go back, and have no hesitation in recommending it.
Manly Ferry..great day trip. A great way to travel on beautiful Sydney HarbourFerries leave every half hour on this beautiful harbour.Went to Many for lunch and a strollDon't miss it

A must while in Sydney. How to spend a lovely sunny day in Sydney? Just take the ferry and head to Manly. Walk down the corso to enjoy the sand. Take a lovely scenic walk up to Shelly Beach and you'll fell spoiled. Walking shoes or bare foot. Don't spend on the fast ferry on Sunday and just enjoy a beer on the way back.

Wonderful Way to see Sydney Harbor. The tickets are about $5-8 AUD and it takes you on a 30 minute ride to Manly Wharf. You pass close to the Sydney Opera House and proceed into the harbor, even with a view of the mouth of the harbor where you can see the open ocean. It is a very scenic ride and you pass other sailboats and pull into Manly. We arrived at sunset when the sky was a blazing orange color and the docked sailboats with the oceanfront homes was a picturesque view. I was as if you were placed in a painting canvas at an art museum. (see the attached photos) You can disembark and walk the beachfront shops and have great seafood and gelato. We returned to Circular Quay at night and it was a whole new experience. The brightly lit up Sydney skyline was the backdrop to a black ocean. The ambient sound of the bow tearing through the waves is a very calming effect. As you near Circular Quay, you can see the Opera House lit up in all its glory from a unique vantage point different from that on the ground. The magnificently lit up Sydney Harbor Bridge can also be seen as a backdrop to the Sydney Opera House. Be sure to sit at the bow of the ship for a perfect view. It does get pretty windy so bundle up, especially on a chilly day/night. Another tip to keep in mind is that the demand for this ferry is quite high so there may be long lines to board the vessel. Don't miss this experience and it was definitely one of the highlights of my trip. If I lived here, I would do this every weekend

Alpha travel. Enjoyed the views of the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, the Royal Botanic Gardens, and the view back to Circular Quay, and wondering at the sights that met the early settlers. Slightly bumpy as the ferry passes the entrance from the sea. Good to find the 4 pines brewery close to the ferry terminal. Explored the Corso, then off to see Many Warringah Wolves, to learn about Aussie Rules.

unforgettable ferry ride. Manly ferry will take you from Circular Quay to Manly. $14 for adult and $7 for child return trip. Journey will take around 30mins. Not only you will have great angle of your photo from the ferry with background of Opera House, Harbour Bridge and Fort Denison but the journey itself will give you great views along the Sydney Harbour. There is a cafe onboard ferry for you to indulge yourself with coffee and snack. Board the ferry as soon as you can to get the best spot onboard the ferry for your background pictures of Sydney's.icons. Manly is a seaside town famous for its beaches. Access to the Manly beach is by walking through Torso (hightstreet full of shops and cafes).

number one touristmsut do in Sydney. The scenery is set before you as the grand old ferry steams towards Manly. When you alight in Manly walk across the road and down the Corso to view one of Australia's iconic beaches with 2-3 kilometres of golden sand.

Manly Ferry - a must do when in Sydney. We recently spent a lovely day at Manly. Caught the Ferry and took in all the sights of the harbour and surrounds on the way there and back. Nice ride on a beautiful day! We did the walk around to Shelly Beach - loads of interesting cafes and giftshops on the way. Overall a lovely day! Great way to spend it!

Fun and cheap. Quick to get to with an easy to use railway system. A lovely trip with fabulous views of the Opera House. Manly is fun, I went on a sunny winter's day and had a super walk along the promenade.

A must-do harbour voyage. This ferry runs out of Circular Quay every 20 minutes and provides Sydney's residents with some of the best harbour views as its sails across to the ubiqitous town of Manly. The 40 minutes crossing takes you over this wide and safe harbour, past the opening at the Heads which flows out to the Pacific Ocean where this huge anchorage was originally discovered, although there is a faster catamaran. Returning in the evening, with the sunsetting behind the Harbour Bridge, is a wonderful,not to be missed experience
Best Ferry in th World. Great way to waste a few hours going back and forth on the ferry. Great in a huge swell, even better on a hot day out on deck

Great Sydney Activity. If you are visiting Sydney a trip to Manly on the Manly ferry is a must. You have an opportunity to see the Opera House up close as well as the iconic Harbourview Bridge. Once you, get to Manly there are a myriad of places to eat, enjoy coffee or an ice cream before enjoying Manly beach. What a great why to spend several enjoyable hours!

A great day trip!. Stayin back in Sydney before the trip home, we decided to take the ferry to Manly Beach. A great town to walk through on the way to the beach (we wore our suits), the trip was one of the highlights of the visit. Walked the shore walk to Shelly Beach - where we watched a class of what looked like 4-to6-year olds being instructed in the art of surfboarding! Water crystal clear, and the town very interesting and tourist-friendly (just like EVERYWHERE we went in AU!)
Manly great place to see. Ferry to Manly beech was great, taking in the views on the way whils relaxing. Manly definately did not disappoint , stunning beach, crystal clear water . Fabulous
Fab views. Great views across Sydney, including Bridge and Opera House. Manly very laid back with great beach and plenty of shops and restaurants.

Trip to Many. We loved our little trip to Manly for lunch. The ferry was absolutely pack as the British Lions were playing the weekend we were there. Everything ran smoothly getting on and off and it was a great, cheap way to get up close to the bridge and the opera house. Had a great lunch in Manly then popped back on the ferry and 1/2 later back in Sydney

A must do!. Everyone told us that we had to "do the Manly Ferry" when we were in Sydney, so we did.We took it one evening to go to Manly for a meal. The ferry runs regularly and is efficiently loaded and unloaded of pasengers. It is low cost, clean, comfortable and has free wifi access. We could see the bridge and opera house lit up, and we could get outside on the front of the ferry to see the views. It certainly is a great way to get around and to see the sights from the water!
Great Ferry Ride to a Great Location. Value for money return trip. Great way to get a real feel for Sydney Harbour. A must do activity when in twon

A must do. A great way to see the Opera House and harbor from the water. The ferries are an iconic part of Sydney and a must do. The day time trips are better as you can see more. Take the ferry over and have dinner in Manly and then come back at sunset and you will get the best of both worlds.

A great way to see Sydney Harbour. This is a very beautiful way to see Sydney Harbour and Manly is a wonderful spot to go and explore. Lots of restaurants and sights to see. Sitting outside on the front of the ferry gives the best view, try and go at sunset.
lovely ride. Stunning views of the bridge and opera house, great ferry and such a great way to get about. Buy a pass to get the most out of the ferries, it works out cheaper.
Great trip. This was a stunning way to see the Harbour. Great time. Nice stroll to the beach. Had coffee and cake at the Chocolate Shop on the way back.

Beautiful view. We went to Manly from Circular Key at around 1pm, so as we went out it was light. We got to have a unique view of both the Bridge and the Opera House plus the rest of Sydney, it really is the way to see the city.Manly is a lovely place. Very laid back with a lot of nice restaurants and shops. The beach is fantastic and the surf looked amazing.The best thing was coming back at night because in my opinion Sydney looks best at night. With all the lights it looked fantastic! I would definitely recommend timing it right so you get the experience day and night.The ferry was on time and well priced. There was enough seats for everyone, however it got a bit chilly and blowly coming back.A Sydney must.

Manly ferry crossing. Punctual, easy to get to, ample seating inside and out, decent cost. A great way to get from Sydney city to the beach at Manly. Ferries run every half hour and take near bang on 30 mins. Manly itself was chilled, even for a tourist location with the British Lions supporters there. Nice coffee places and clean beaches.

A must do whilst in sydney....... I love the bluish water by the harbour. I am very please that I went to visit manly, I love the small shops heading to the beach and i love the fact that the beach is just a ferry ride for more than half an hour from circular quay.You can also buy a pass for train, ferry and bus for 5 days and it is a lot cheaper than buying a ticket every day.
harbour trip. We had a multi ticket which included the local ferries,so the trip to manly was great value.The commentary was most interesting and gave great enjoyment
Great trip. Went on this and stopped at the zoo. Great ferry nice beach and manly a lot quieter than bondi. All ferries are easy to get to and plenty of them. Kids loved it
Cheaper for group. Seating at the front deck, watching the view especially during sunset toward Sydney opera house and Sydney Bridge
Fun place. Good place to people watch and the view of the beach and ocean are not bad. Nice place to sit and relax and take it all in. Highly recommend

Loved the trip to Manly. The Manly ferry is quite an experience. You are taken all the way across the bay of Sydney, and you can see some islands, much of the shorline, and the harbor mouth. We also saw some interesting boats. If your budget is limited, I recommend this ferry instead of the more touristy harbor tour.

Good views, and a cute town. Fabby views of the Opera House and the Bridge, good way to see the sights of the harbour at a good price. Weekend prices seem very reasonable.
Walk along the beach is very pleasant, and lots of good food choices on the main drag.
Good view of the harbour. A must do attraction for anyone visiting Sydney. Take the late evening ferry to catch the setting sun as the ferry cruises pass the Opera House.
How to see Sydney Harbour on a budget. This ferry is basically a 30-minute tour of Sydney Harbour, without commentary. Very reasonable price.

Must do!. We took the ferry over to Manly for one day. I would definitely recommend it! The ferry ride alone is fun because you get great views of the harbor. Its a nice 30 minute ride to Manly. and Manly itself is a very cute town with a walkway along the water. Also went to 4 pines brewery for lunch and beer sampler which was very fun!

This is Sydney!. It is not expensive, and you get a fantastic view of the city. We were befriended by a chatty pensioner who was a great tour guide on the journey. One of the highlights of our day. The weather was sunny and perfect, that helped too.
A regular Passenger. Would often take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly for the day. A lovely trip, a great public service, this ferry has a small 'cafe' for drinks etc. WiFi available
A quick look at Sydney from the water!. A great way to see Sydney icons from the water- passed The Opera House, the Bridge, Point Piper etc. A quick trip to beautiful Manley.

Great for sightseeing. Worth doing, not just for Manly but for seeing the sights on the way.
Plenty of seating, easy boarding/disembarking

A wise way to catch a view of the Harbor Bridge. If you feel that the dinner cruise or scenic cruise is too expensive, try using your MyMulti or MyFerry passes to cruise from Circular Quay to Manly. It's a 30-minute scenic cruise. You will see the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House as seen in postcards!

Ferry, not pleasure cruise, with great views. It's a ferry, not a pleasure cruise of the harbour. But it is one of the nicest ways to get from Circular Quay to Manly or vice versa. Wonderful way of seeing the harbour from a different angle. Internal and external seating. Food on board. Bathrooms on board. Can get a bit choppy between the heads, but it can do this on any craft travelling between the heads.

Good service - be prepared to fight for a view!. Good ferry service and very efficient and on time. Ferry itself well looked after and everything went very smoothly. Very frequent even on a Sunday but seemed to be busy all the time.Outside packed with tourists (including us!) and if you sit down expecting a view you will be disappointed. We had people standing all around us constantly jostling and bumping us as they all tried to get the best photo opportunity.On the return trip we abandoned the idea of an outside seat and just stood at the side to admire the views - sitting inside when it got too windy. Much better.

Get the best sightseeing in Sydney. Hop on the Manly Ferry and enjoy the longest, most enjoyable sights along the Harbour.After warming yourself in the winters sun, get your fish and chips at Manly and enjoy the ride back to Circular Quay.

Amazing sun set view. Great value for money and super romantic. Strongly recommended. The cruise alone is well worth it. Both the sunset view and evening view were amazing. Be prepare to take lots of photos of the Opera house and cityscape.

A ride with a view!. Beautiful boat ride. Take a jacket and take pictures--it's chilly, but the views are worth it! There are snacks to purchase on the boat as well. Take a picnic to the beach. The Manly boat terminal has loads of food for purchase as well.

Good way to get to Manly. Easy and cheap way to get to manly. It's a ferry, so not setup for site seeing, but best views are from the bow or stern. Note that the ferry has 2 helms, so if you want to be on the front get on the side towards the outside of the dock.

Sunny Day Perfect Trip. The Manly ferry is a great way to travel to and from the beach front. Beware leaves on time and you should have your travel tickets ready gates close 2 minutes prior to departure.
Very pleasant ride. Great way to see the harbor. And it was fun to explore Manly. Very comfortable seating. Left right on time.
free wifi!. The 30 min ride to Manly beach was great! the views are amazing and I was able to face time with my family in the states with their wifi service!
Get on the ferry for the Jazz Festival. I have been taking the ferry during the October Jazz Festival for a few years' now. My daughter is now 10 and still enjoys it.
Iconic view!. Take the ferry and enjoy the wonderful view of Sydney Harbour (Opera house, buildings, the bridge...) and Manly Beach! The best sightseeing tour.

Have to experience it.. Went on a Ferry ride from Manly back to Circular Quay, Has the best view of Sydney from the Ferry, on a nice sunny day you will be able to experience the Sydney Sun & possibly the best view of the harbor Bridge. Your lil ones will always love this .

Magnificent views of Sydney Harbour Bridge and The Opera House.. In my opinion you will have the best views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House from this ferry. We didn't have enough time to explore Manly but really enjoyed the ride there and back - it was worth it!

Great views of Sydney harbour. A cheap way to great views of the harbour and a wonderful outing ot manly cove. You travel with locals so get a glimpse of what life for commuters are like. There is ample space and options to sit outside ( limited) and inside. The trip allows a comoftable outing to manly cove and lunch by the bay..

The quintessential tourist trip. This must surely be one of the best ferry rides for any tourist to take while visiting Sydney. The starting point is the beautiful and bustling Circular Quay. The trip on the harbour has magnificent views. The destination (Manly) has a beautiful beach and eateries. Highly recommended for all international and local tourists!

Other attractions at Manly. Additional to the harbour attractions and the beach at the end of the Corso are the great views and history at North Head and the Quarantine Station. Well worth the uphill walk or bus ride.
Great views!. Great way to see the harbour bridge, and opera house from a different angle. Free wifi too which was a bonus!

Fantastic trip across the Harbour. Went early Saturday morning across to Mainly, very quite and straightforward. Amazing ferry trip, not too long for little children, good views of Sydney. After brunch and a play on the beach the return trip was busy, but again delightful trip back across the harbour.

Great View of the Harbour. Sydney's iconic Manly Ferry is a must do for all tourists. Manly for those who don't know is one of the northern beaches of Sydney and one of the prettiest, better in my opinion than Bondi but others may dispute that.Catch the Ferry from Circular Quay situated in between the Harbour bridge and the Opera House, best buy a return ticket unless you intend staying in Manly.The Ferry offers great and different views of several key Sydney attractions, namely the Harbour Bridge, Opera House, little Fort Denison ( you will see this in the first 5 minutes of travel so don't miss it ), travelling on towards Manly you get a great view of the best Harbour in the World.Once you arrive at Manly pier, walk across the road and down the "Corso" to the beach, everywhere you will find many good restaurants and coffee shops.All best done on a sunny day and night time can be a bit rowdy in Manly so head back to your hotel before dark.

Fun, Fun Fun. You can't go to Sydney without taking one of their ferries to a beach. We happened to take the Manly Ferry and it took us right by the Opera House and a scenic view of the Harbour and the city of Sydney all the way to Manly. It was fun to run around Manly too. Another must do when visiting Sydney.
Great trip. What a perfect way to get to Manly, especially at night when you see all the beautiful lights of Sydney

Taronga Zoo combined ticket. The only criticism really is the frequency eg while waiting for the last boat from Taronga Zoo swarms of people would descend every time a Sydney Ferry arrived about every 10 mins but Manly was hourly. The last boat was a whale watching boat but the guys were wearing the same coloured uniforms so we knew it was themWe thought we were getting a good deal by buying a combined Zoo ticket also, but Taronga do a discount for families anyway (2 adults + 1 child) so I don't think the saving was that great in the end

A great few hours spent to and fro Manly. Buy yourself a tourist unlimited public transportation called MyMulti and hop on the Manly ferry at Wharf 3 of Circular Quay. (MyMulti 1 doesn't include ferries from 1 September 2013). The manly ferry ride is about 30 minutes and you can walk to Manly beach from the Manly Wharf!

Spend some time on Sydney Harbour. the Manly Ferry is always a lovely way to spend time, especially on a sunny day. We were lucky enough to also see a pod of dolphins on our last visit.Make sure you walk over to the ocean side of Manly and along to Shelly Beach where you will find a lovely little cafe and a great giftware shop. The Manly pub has great meals.
