Like Being In an Australian Crawl Song!. A must if you have a few hours to kill on a nice day. A great way to see Sydney harbour. Take the time to walk down to the beach at the Manly end and see how good life can really be!

manly ferry from circular quay. a lovely leisurely trip to Manly to see the shops and beaches, a good place to eat is Hugo's. this is directly in front of you when you get off the ferry in Manly.A good tip on the way back is to check the "fast ferry" as we did. for some reason on occasions, the fast ferry is quite a lot cheaper than the normal one as well as having free hot drinks as you are waiting to board. Also don't forget to take your camera as it sails right past the opera house for some great shots.

Ferry good!. A great day out for all ages. A trip to Manly on the Manly ferry shows off the best of Sydney Harbour. Whether it is a sparkling sunny day with a harbour filled with yachts or stormy and wild crossing the Heads, the ferry ride is essential Sydney. There is a small cafe on board so it is a harbour cruise on a budget. Take some time to explore Manly as there are attractions, lovely beaches, parks and great food on the Harbour side or a short walk up the Corso to the famous Manly Beach.
Manley ferry. Lovely relaxing ride from Circular Quay and only a short walk after arriving at Manley to the beautiful beach there.

Catch the ferry to Manly for lunch overlooking the beach.. Sit up the top deck of the ferry for great photo opportunities of the harbour bridge and opera house.
Lots of cafes to chose from all looking over Manly beach.
A trip to manly. A trip on the Manly Ferry is a wonderful and thoroughly enjoyable way to spend a few hours taking in the sights of Sydney .

Can't leave Sydney without a trip to Manly on the ferry!. Being born and bred in Sydney, and having travelled abroad, I find it very difficult not to be biased about my review of Manly. I just love the trip to Manly on the Manly ferry. It's just a fantastic way to see our harbour landmarks and beautiful surrounds. If you want to save some money on transport you may want to consider purchasing an all day pass which includes bus, train and ferry rides. The ferry trip takes about a half an hour from Circular Quay to Manly. They are frequent but mostly crowded on the weekends, but you can normally manage to get a seat inside or out. Make sure you bring your camera as you will inevitably get some great shots of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera House, garden Island and Fort Dennison.Once at Manly take a stroll past the shops down to the beach, lots of coffee shops and eateries all reasonably priced. If you have purchased an all day fare excursion maybe consider jumping on a bus (they leave from a bustop near the jetty) and take a trip to the northern beaches.I promise you that you will have a terrific day...so much fun and lots of fun too. Pubs sell boutique beers if you are game :)
Great way to see the harbour. Take the Manly ferry to see the Sydney Bridge and Opera House. It is fairly cheap and frequent and Manly Beach is a great side trip from Sydney.

Lovely trip. Going to Manly on the ferry is a good and happy experience. The trip enables one to look at Sydney Harbour all the way to Manly and at Manly one can have something to eat at a café or restaurant, look at the beach or do some shopping before one takes the ferry trip back to the city of Sydney - if one desires to return to the point of embarkation. The ferry itself is fairly basic - but comfortable and, of course allows one to either sit outside or inside, depending on one's choice.
Good way to get to Manly. This is such an easy way to get across to Manly. And it is a good price too, $14.40 return. Nice way to spend a day!

Sydney Harbour Experience. The iconic ferry is a must do for all visitors to Sydney, it allows you to see Sydney Harbour and its icons at their best, especially on a glorious sunny day. The Sydney Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge (AKA as the Coat hanger) are majestic looking over the harbour. The public ferry system will take you to Manly and Parramatta, to Taronga Zoo and even Luna Park.. There are options to have lunch or dinner cruises, even morning or afternoon trips around the harbour. Circular Quay has several coffee shops and eateries close by as well as the obvious souvenirs for sale.You can purchase single or return trip fares as well as discounts for pensioners and seniors.The only downside it can be quite rough near the heads on the way to mainly and sometimes can be a little scary.These trips are for all ages. People travel from all over to visit Sydney and this is one jewel that must not be missed.

Quick trip around Sydney. The best way to see Sydney is from the harbour and for a few dollars, one can sit on a ferry and be taken around the harbour. Its quaint and relaxing and an excellent way to view the city, This was always my number one recommendation to visitors. The central business district is relatively small and can be walked around in a couple of hours. The Queen Victoria Building containing boutique shops and a couple of department stores are about all that is available. Otherwise Sydney is much the same as any other city. A trip to the zoo by ferry is worthwhile and there are two art galleries, a natural history museum and the Powerhouse museum are worthwhile visiting. The train service offers a trip to Katoomba in the Blue Mountains and to Kiama on the south coast. Both take a couple of hours and are a good way to see Australia. Chinatown for Asian food, Norton Street Leichhardt for Italian. Hope this helps.

You have to try it!. Fun half hour ferry ride through Sydney harbor with magnificent views of the opera house and the bridge. Manly beach is fun with plenty of bars and restaurants. The ferry leaves from Wharf 3 and costs about $7.

Great Views. Make sure you get a seat outside on the ferry and also make sure that you have your camera charged as you will be needing it, stunning views of Sydney Harbor, the Opera House and Sydney City Skyline, even if you don't need to go to Manly (which is a gorgeous place anyway) just take a spin on these ferries, reasonably priced and well worth it for the views.

Worth every minute of the journey.. This is one of Australia's iconic public transport journeys.For $2.50 for a pensioner you can sit on it all day and every time you travel on it there is something else that you notice and enjoy.Nice little cafe on board.I dont think there is anything negative about this trip.Dont leave Sydney without trying it - especially on a nice day.

A Ferry Fun Day Out. Manly ferry, is a must for overseas visitors visiting Sydney. The trip on the water really highlights the beautiful clean city Sydney is. Whilst in Manly, check out the beaches and Sydney's Taronga Zoo. If you feel like a shopping spree, Manly is the home of cute trinkets and boutique stores with one off peices. My most memorable experience is walking into a shop and looking at the tiles on the floor. I had noticed them as they were purchased from our shop, Tile Factory Outlet in Smithfield. I was really pleased to see that the owner of the store had travelled the distance to visit us. from Manly, Smithfield is about a 45km drive. It just comes to show that people drive form all over Sydney to save thousands.

nice experience. Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly is quite good. I really enjoy this journey everytime I did. When you are on this ferry route, you are actually going through some distinguish icon of Australia. First of all, you will cross Sydney Opera house then if you look left you can see Harbour bridge, another icon of Australia. Later you will notice some of the amusement structure of Luna Park. After a while you will find yourself nearing to a fantastic beach of Manly. Also the ferry itself is very good with proper facilities. So, the journey will be a good experience.
Very Good experience. The Manly ferry was easy to locate and fairly cheap. The port is right near the Opera House and the trip to manly beach was enjoyable.

A must for any visitor to Sydney. As a Sydneysider, it is a must to take a trip to Manly on the Ferry. The ferries are clean and beautiful old ladies who glide through the waters on Sydney Harbour. The trip will take 30 mins and gives you plenty of time to enjoy our habour. Forget Bondi, and go to Manly and have a swim there. This is suitable for anyone.

Let's Go Gliding on the Harbour. "Forget your troubles,c'mon get happy, you're gonna scare all your cares away". This old song epitomises all that's good about a trip on the Manly Ferry.Whether you are simply gliding along on a beautiful Sydney day or getting bounced around when the seas are rough the experience is fantastic.The ferries themselves are magnificent old style boats capable of carrying hundreds of passengers and for a very low price you will have the privilege of seeing what many describe as the world's best harbour. C'mon, don't miss it.

Manly ferry from Circular Quay. Cheap and amazing trip across Sydney Harbour to one Sydneys favourite beaches Manly.Ferry leaves Circular Quay nearly every 30mins and takes approx. 30mins. There is a faster option but the ferry ride is more scenic.
nice little trip. its good on a calm day to go from Manly to the City. you can see the Harbour and the Naval base pass the zoo, sometimes it can be a bit rough depending on the weather

Solo Traveller. A must for any overseas visitors to see the size and beauty of the Sydney Harbour it's residences and locations of the attractions to visit scattered along the coastline and the north and south heads which are the entry for all shipping and cruse ships coming to Australia. The sailing boats passing by on Wednesday afternoons and to arrive at Manly where all the northern surfing beaches commence up the coastline to Palm Beach. The trip takes 30 minutes one way and gives great photo opportunities to take photos of the Sydney Harbour Bridge,Opera House and Circular Quay where all ferries arrive from various points on the northern side of the Harbour. If time is limited do a return trip taking a bit more than 1 hour.

Fab day out. Choose a nice, calm day and it's a great day out to Manly - get the Ferry at Circular Quay, catch some sun and sea breezes on the approx 45 min ride; arrive at the Manly Jetty; resist the gelatos, chocolate etcetc for the moment and wander through the Corso and down to the beach. Fabulous on a sunny day. If you are traveling on a Sunday with family - minimum 1 adult and 1 child 4yo-15yo - grab $2.50 Family Funday tickets for huge savings. These tickets allow all day travel for 1 flat fare. Google Family Funday for more details.

Prompt and with free wifi!. The ferry has free wifi! Such a bonus when travelling in the city. The ferry was always on time, not too expensive and lots of times available to travel between manly. It was always clean and never too full of people.

Manly ferry trip between Manly and Sydney City.. You could take an organised trip of Sydney Harbour but the ferry ride between Manly and the City on a traditional ferry (hope they never modernise this service!!) is well worth doing. It is always a half hour trip that leaves on time - both ways- crossing the heads and passing most harbourside beaches. You will see Goat and Clarke islands, Pinchgut (Fort Denison) Kirribilli House, and enjoy a close-up view of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Do this on a sunny day or in the late afternoon when the sun is setting and you will see the best part of the harbour and you will not be disappointed. Some lucky people have been priviliged to see whales during the migration season which is an absolute bonus. Sydney Harbour is well worth seeing - one of the best harbours in the world.

One of the Worlds Perfect Ferry Rides. Manly is a Sydney suburb located on the North Side of the Harbour. Visitors generally stay in the city which is on the South side. One of the most inexpensive ways of seeing the Harbour without the expense of a cruise is to take the ferry to Manly. You can take a fast boat or a slow boat and I suggest the slow ferry and sit outside and just absorb the beauty of the harbour.Even if you didn't do anything in Manly except turn around and come back to the city, it is worth it! Of course if you want to go to the beach or hang out at a nice restaurant in Manly that's good too!
manly ferry ride. reasonably priced &most of the time a reasonably smooth ride but can encounter large swells crossing harbour totally safe but restrooms would only give 90 out of 100

Manly Ferry. Take the ferry to Manly and walk straight across the road down the Corso to the Beach. In summer you can have a swim or just get some fish and chips and sit down on the steps or a table and have some lunch. Beware of the seagulls don't offer them a chip or they was swarm all over to get more.
City Break. A pleasant trip by Ferry to Manly and a walk around the beach area and cafes. Plenty more to do we only had a short time.

Get on the Manly Ferry. As a resident of Sydney, I ride the Manly Ferry regularly. For a visitor, it is an easy and affordable way to get the best of Sydney. It departs from Circular Quay at least half hourly, takes 35 minutes to get to Manly, and is efficient and safe. I suggest taking it to Manly, photographing the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and North and South Heads, before getting off in Manly for awhile. You can easily walk to shops, restaurant, Manly Beach and various walking tracks from here. Then board the ferry for a leisurely trip back to Sydney. Great trip for all ages, single or solo.
One thousand miles. As the blurb says 7 miles from Sydney , a thousand miles from care.You can't visit Sydney without catching the Manly Ferry.
Always on time. It was great travelling on Ferries to Manly, Watson's Bay, Luna Park....The ferries were always on time, clean, and the sights were fantastic

Relax and go to Mainly. Walk on the sidewalk coast, enjoy the small tends, go to the front to feel the wind blowing and to get the best pictures from Opera House.If it is possible, spend the night. And enjoy the ride ;)

Great Trip. The manly ferry takes the most scenic route through the harbour. Great views of the opera house, the bridge, and the city in general. Much cheaper than a cruise! Plus you get to see some great views of the CBD Make sure your camera is at hand to get some greet shots.

Go on a bright sunny day with sunscreen. A lovely way to experience the harbour at a reasonable cost. When you arrive at Manly walk down The Corso (a bit tacky) to the surf beach and even turn right and walk around to Shelley Beach if you want a long day's walk.Apply the sunscreen before you leave and wear a hat as the sun in Australia is fierce (unlike Europe).Of course, sit on one side of the ferry (outside) on the way there and see the other shore on the way back. Keep in mind that the westerly sun hits you all the way back in the afternoon if you sit on the right hand side. You can of course change position when travelling if you want.If you go when there is a big swell (big waves) when the ferry crosses the harbour entrance it is quite fun when the ferry goes up and down over that short stretch.

Revisited by chance- magnificent!. A must do in Sydney!!!This is an aquatic city, and the harbour weather looked at, sailed on or immersed in is its life blood.The ferry is inexpensive, you can brave the bow in fresh air (highly recommended) or sit in comfort on several decks.Manly is well worth a visit ( 'five miles from Sydney and a million miles from care') take a walk catch a later ferry back, have something to eat, hire roller skates or bicycles, dive into the ocean.On the boat trip back to Sydney, you are seeing what the first explorers saw (add a building or two) well you can imagine !Not to be missed in any weather
nice surprise. although bondi beach ranks higher in popularity, taking a ferry to manly and walking your way around can be a very good surprise.
Great views of the Opera House and harbour. Worth taking as it will give you some great photo opportunities. Manly Beach is also stunning and great for a day out. Recommended.

What a great way to travel. The slow pace allowing me to view the homes and the bush the boats and the harbor traffic .The tourist rushing to the front to catch that happy snap of the opera house or the Bridge in the background.

Great views for small price. The Manly Ferry is not only a commuter ferry but also a favourite for visitors to Sydney. It is a lovely trip across the harbour, past the Opera House and the world famous Sydney Harbour Bridge.
Great boat trip. The manly ferry takes the most scenic route through the harbour. Great views of the opera house, the bridge, and the city in general. Much cheaper than a cruise!

Manly Ferry. A must do for newcomers to Sydney. Catch the ferry and make sure your camera is fully charged. A fantastic way to see the Sydney CBD from the harbour. Catch a ferry to Toranga zoo and see the animals.

Ferry Ride to rival any Cruise. The ferry from Circular Quay over to Manly is huge so although you might think there is no way everyone will get on, they do, with room to spare (maybe not during the rush-hour, I don;t know about that!) The trip across the harbour is very pleasant and such an easy way to access Manly, which is a popular spot for tourists.

A must for visitors. This is a must for visitors. See some of Sydney harbors most scenic views. Travel past Sydney opera house, harbor bridge, the governors house, fort Denison, the entrance to Sydney harbor and manly. Manly is a great destination with harbor on one side and with a short walk through shops and restaurants to manly beach. After many years of catching the manly ferry I still enjoy the journey. My tip is to go to the back section of the top deck. Less people to the front, protected from the wind and longer opportunity to get some good photos.

Wonderful way to see Sydney Harbour. Catching the Manly Ferry is the best thing to do on a sunny day - it's a beautiful harbour and it's wonderful sitting on the ferry enjoying the view of the suburbs parks and bush that surround this stunning harbour - on the weekends lots of sailing boats give great activity to the water. In Manly there is a lot to see and do, Manly art gallery, Manly aquarium. There are some expensive restaurants around, especially if you want one with a water view, but walk around and you can find well priced places. The shops in the corso are a little disappointing being mainly take away food places and shops with cheap tourist 'stuff', but look around and there is some quality places. There is a great market in a lane way each Saturday which is worth visiting

cheap ride to Manly. On a sunny day in Sydney there is no better value than the manly ferry. For just a few dollars you can see all the sights of the harbour, spend an hour or two with an ice-cream or fish and chips at Manly walking on the beach and get back before the rush hour. Simple and quintessentially Sydney

Best short cruise in Sydney. Catch the Green and Gold Ferry to Manly for whatever reason you have for example the beach, exploring a café or restaurant, having a few beers at one of the pubs or visiting fiends. The ferry is cheap enough and there is usually a café on board for a coffee while checking the views along the way. Sit inside or outside if weather permits.

Don't miss the ride to Manly on this ferry.. This is how I commuted to work and it was fantastic twice a day let alone once in a lifetime!Some days you will even see wildlife, whales or dolphins, and the views are wonderful. If it is very windy be prepared for a bouncy ride through the Harbour Heads. When you get to Manly try to take time to walk around to North Head for great views too, or at least the headland at Shelley Beach. Yes, Manly beach is wonderful but there is so much more to Manly. tip - don't eat food on the Corso. Go one street back on either side for better options.

great way to see the harbour. This is a great way to see the harbour and relatively inexpensive compared to a harbour Cruise. You can sit inside or outside on the Ferry and see all the harbour has to offer, Fort Denison, Taronga Zoo, Bradleys Head as well as all the bays and inlets. It is a great trip and takes about 50mins from memory. Once at Manly you can check out the beach, shops and get something to eat and then get a return ferry. It is a great day out and as we live in Sydney it is a regulary family outing.

cheapest harbour cruise. I love the Manly Ferry!! It's cheap, it's genuine, you get to see far more than any of the expensive harbour cruises. City to Manly and you'll cruise past Fort Denison, see the monied in their yachts, get glimpses of bush interspersed with ocean front properties. You can stay inside away from the elements and enjoy a coffee or Aussie Billabong icecream or you can go outside and bathe in the sunshine. It's the best way to enjoy the harbour and get to the best beach in Sydney - Manly. You may even see whales if you time your visit right.

Boat slowly or Hydrofoil quickly. By boat and i mean a large boat you can see all the different parts of the harbour on the way to Manly . I f you are in a hurry then take the Hydrofoil ,Many shops and restaurants at Manly from pizza to thai etc you name it theyve got it. Easy walk to the beach

So relaxing. This is one of the most relaxing ways to getting to the city from Manly. Enjoy a coffee and a bite to eat on board. As a tourist and a worker I have always enjoyed the ferry. Just be careful on rough days - it does and rock and roll a bit.

Stunning Sydney Harbour Views at a fraction of the cost. Being able to travel on the world's most scenic harbour is a real treat on the Manly Ferry. Seats are comfortable and provide you with some of the most stunning views of Sydney from the water for such a small price in comparison to Harbour Cruise costs. Food and drinks can also be purchased from the onboard kiosk. Manly township and the beach are definitely worth a visit. Seniors discount makes this trip excellent value for money for that special day out.

Manly Ferry - no Sydney visit is complete without it.. The Manly Ferry is the finest way to see Sydney harbour. It is both cheap and comfortable. There is a cafe onboard and plenty of seating inside and outside.From Circular Quay you go past the Opera House, Past Fort Denison and all the beaches of the harbour until you cross the heads and then moor at Manly Wharf. All smooth and safe.Journey costs about AUD$7 each way (cheaper if you buy multiple tickets), takes about 35 minutes each way.Note, no alcohol is permitted.

A Half Hour Harbour Trip. I love the Manly Ferry, especially the older boats. A ride to Manly is a must for any visitor to Sydney. I actually take interstate visitors on that ride because it is an easy and inexpensive way to see the Harbour.On weekends and holidays there is an open snack bar on the ferry where you can get coffee, tea, soft drinks, pies and cakes.On the older ferries you can sit indoors or outdoors; so if you like the fresh sea wind in your face you won't be disappointed.When you reach Manly you are only a short walk along the plaza to Manly beach.You must try the famous Manly Fish and Chips.Ferries run from Circular Quay regularly. It will be a trip to remember.

better than world class. The Manly ferry trip is on board reasonably big ferries where you can move around if you wish. The views of Sydney Harbour and all its attractions pass by you one by one. When you arrive at Manly you can walk to the Ocean Beach or just have a drink or a meal, then return in comfort on the ferry.It has to be one of the most relaxing and enjoyable trips anywhere in the world.

One of the top 5 things to do in Sydney. This is my daily commute so I am biased, but this is one of the world's great ferry rides. If you are visiting Sydney, and even if you've only got 24 hours - this is a must on your itinerary. Best views are from the upstairs outdoor areas either at the front or back. That way you can see left and right (port and starboard). A great photo opportunity is as the ferry turns around the Opera House, but it happens early in the trip so be ready. It can get cold in winter, but rug up and be brave. It can also get bumpy between the heads, but that's all part of the fun.

A must for any visitor or local. Catching the ferry to Manly from Circular Quay on a nice Sunday afternoon is a must. The ride is on 30 mins each way and you get a great view of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and of Sydney city. Once you arrive at Manly the options are endless depending on what you want to do. Beach, surf, dine, drink, standup paddle boarding, walk...the list goes on.

A delightful journey on the harbour that we tend to take a bit for granted.. Having spent a large part of my early life on the northern beaches, I have found myself travelling on the Manly Ferry many times. There have been poems written about the ferry ride (5 Bells) and there have been a range of different types of ferry over the years. I especially liked the old steamers that used to plough the water in the 50s, 60s and 70s until they were decommissioned. These hulking ships hailed from Scotland and were made of sturdy stuff. The best part of any journey would be traversing 'the Heads'. If it was rough then the water would break over the boughs and people on the lower decks would have to lift up their feet to avoid all the water slushing around. Today the ferries are more sleek and modern. They are also faster. This is a good feature for commuters who are in a hurry but it does detract from the 35 to 40 minute journeys of past years, when travellers could take in the view of the harbour at a leisurely pace. The journey though, is just as wonderful and over the years the secret came out that this is a wonderful trip to take if you are a tourist, as well as a local. Manly Wharf is an interesting place to visit as is Manly Beach. All the ferries on the harbour are a wonderful way to spend some time without spending a great deal of money. The Manly Ferry is the best.

Trip to Manly - essential on your visit to Sydney. This can be a calm crossing but beware I have had a few hairy moments. The ferry itself allow syou to see some of th ehistoric waterfront properties, coves beaches as you travel along.Visit the Manly aquarium an dthe usual beachside cafes and bars.

Fish & chips by the ocean. The Manly ferry is a must for first time visitors to Sydney and on a clear blue day it is a fabulous experience. Your heart will rise with the beauty of the trip and with the ocean swell as the little ferry passes across the passage through the heads. You take the ferry from Circular Quay. Easy to find where to go from and most people will be helpful. It costs a few dollars and is vastly cheaper and better than the commercial alternatives. When you get there head down to the ocean side and walk south on the beach side of South Styene. You can head all the way round to Shelly beach which is a delightful stop for coffee or a swim. On you way back stop at Wentworth Street just a few shops up from South Styene and you can buy freshly grilled fish with chips in a take-away container to eat on the tables by the foreshore. A splendid way to have a meal and not at all expensive; well not by the usual Sydney standards anyway. If you come to Sydney don't miss the Manly ferry!

A relaxing way to see Sydney Harbour. The trip to Manly by ferry has always been one of my personal favourites ever since I was a child. There is so much to see on this trip and so many great photo opportunities. Pulling out from Circular Quay you have the Sydney Harbour Bridge on one side and the Sydney Opera House on the other. You pass the historical buildings of Admiralty House and Fort Denison. Glide pass Sydney's Taronga Park Zoo & Bradleys Head where you can see the mast of the HMAS Sydney. Look through the Heads at the Pacific Ocean and then arrive at beautiful Manly where you can catch a wave or grab a bargain. The return trip is equally as breathtaking as you head towards the Sydney Harbour Bridge.This trip only takes 40 minutes and is well worth it to see the beautiful sights that Sydney Harbour has to offer. There is a snack bar on board that sells light refreshments. If you are visiting Sydney you should put this on your "Must do" list. You won't be disappointed.

Great Way to Take In The Sights. jump on board the Manly Ferry for a wonderful trip from Circular Quay to Manly and on the way take in the shoreline sights as you cruise up Sydney Harbour ..especially on a warm day with the sun beating down and the breeze in your face ... Once arriving Manly stroll down the Esplanade to the beach ...grab some hot fish and chips ..can of coke and sit on the beach for lunch and then catch the ferry back to Circular Quay ..that way to spend the day

Wonderful way to see Sydney Harbour. A couple of friends and I found ourselves with a couple of hours to spare in Sydney recently and decided to catch the Manly ferry from Circular Quay and have lunch at Manly. Although we are all Sydney residents and I worked on the harbour for many years, we had forgotten what a pleasurable experience the ferry trip is. We sat out on the open deck watching the numerous other boats and yachts going by and refreshed our memories of just how spectacular the harbour is and what a great trip it is travelling across the harbour entrance to Manly. After a wonderful relaxed lunch, we made the return journey and actually complimented each other on what a great idea it had been. A must if you are visiting Sydney.

Harbour views without the price. This ferry trip has always been a favourite. We took my in-laws when they visited from Scotland in October 2012. They were amazed at the views of popular landmarks from the water and the price of the tickets.Can be a bumpy ride if the weather is a little rough, but that can make it more fun - depending on your mind set.If you travel in off peak times it is a very comfortable trip, with room for all. With free wi-fi even the tech obsessed can enjoy the trip - also makes it easier to tag photos!Manly is a good place to spend a sunny afternoon before heading back to the Quay and the sights of central Sydney.

Manly Ferry Fabulous. An inexpensive way to cruise across the harbor to Manly...take your camera as you get the best photos of the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge from the ferry...for a few dollars you will have a really good relaxing time on your way to Manly where they have some of the best fish and chips available right there on Manly Wharf.

Magical experience on Sydney Harbour. Even if you do not need to get from the city to Manly, just do it as an outing in itself. It is truly a lovely thing to do. Then stop for a coffee or lunch before the return journey.

Best, cheapest way to see the opera house & harbour bridge. Board @ circular quay, get a return ticket, eat at the Mexican opposite manly beach & if its warm enough have a swim... Great way to spend the day (or 1/2 a day if you are time poor) in Sydney.

Lots of splash for little cash. One of the best and cheapest ways to view our wonderful harbour is to take the old ferry from the Quay to Manly. Sit outside and enjoy the spray against your skin. Manly still has lots of charm. Buy some fish & chips and eat them while watching the surfers.
Ferry cross the Harbour. The best way to see the Harbour. Cheap and beautiful. Take time to wander around Manly before lunch, dine at the ferry wharf and catch a fast ferry back.

Best Ferry Ride in the World. This has got to be the most worth it ferry rides in the world. The public ferry takes you from Sydney's The Quay Wharf (Circular Quay in the heart of Sydney's foreshore) to Manly (one of Sydney's most famous and loved beach). The ferry is cheap, has conveniences as well as snack food and drinks available on board. Recommend you find a seating position outside to capture the beautiful views of the harbour. The 40 minutes trip to Many is leisurely and offers the most beautiful views of all of Sydney Harbour, which includes Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Luna Park, Botanical Gardens, Taronga Zoo and much much more. You will go also past North and South Head the opening to Sydney Harbour from the sea. Sydney's waterway is a popular spot for boating enthusiasts, so you will see many sail and motor boats on the water. The water trip can be done by all visitors, as access on and off board is easy. Once in Manly, you can walk direct to the beach (takes 5 minutes) and enjoy a day on the beach, visit shops go to the Manly Acquarium, eat at great restaurants and return with the ferry back to Sydney. Take the public ferry trip from "Manly Wharf' at Circular Quay and you won't regret it.

Be Allured by the Azure of the sea and the sky. Although the Sydney ferries a little past their prime, this is still a fabulous way of giving visitor's an over view of what must be the most beautiful harbour in the world! We buy an all day ticket which enables you to hop on and off at the many various stops.Be sure to get off at Watson's Bay for a seafood lunch at Doyles.

Cheapest Harbour Cruise in Sydney. This is the best way to see Sydney Harbour and the cheapest. It takes about 40 minutes and the old ferries are great. Make sure you get on early and go upstairs and sit outside up the front.I always take my overseas visitors on this trip and when you arrive in Manly you can walk through the corso to the famous Manly surf beach or choose a great place to eat along the way.

Superb harbour journey. Although I live near Sydney I never tire taking the ferry across from Circular Quay (Sydney) to Manly with its fabulous beaches and interesting shops and eating places, You will first sail pass Sydney's famous Opera House and Harbour bridge and then its just marvellous views across the water to little inlets and bays until you pass the "heads" which allows craft to exit the harbour and proceed out to the open sea. The approach to Manly, just so beautiful and the ride takes around 30 minutes. They have a cafe on board as well. If you like walking there are so many beautiful reasonably short walks radiating from the town area of Manly to little bays and massive cliffs facing the ocean. You will need a whole day in Manly to take in the sights.

The best way to view the harbour!. They say the best way to see a country is to get amongst its people, taking the Manly ferry is not only that but its a beautiful way to see our harbour, how big it actually is and get transportation to the lovely Manly Beach!

Wonderful 30 minute trip with breathtaking views. Taking the Manly ferry will take 30 minutes to get to Manly Wharf. Along the way is scenic and wonderful. Upon arrival, one can walk along the beach which is less than a five minute walk from the Wharf. There is an entire block of shopping along the way, including a coup,e of very nice Aborigines art galleries. Definitely another worthwhile trip.

A lovely way to see the harbour. A sunny day, a few hours to spare, a trip to Manly. Beautiful views of Sydney from the water followed by a wander around iconic Manly with it's rather tacky atmosphere (now definitely heading upmarket) and great beaches. Then return to Circular Quay. Go on the weekend for the Manly markets or during the week when it's quieter. Make sure you sit outside on the ferry - even if it's cold!

Things to do in Sydney. The Manly ferry is a great economical way to get a quick overview of Sydney & its world class harbour. Sail straight past the Sydney Opera House down the harbour to Manly, with its harbour beach on one side & surf beach on the other & heaps of restaurants & cafes in between.

Day out in Sydney. The ferry leaves circular quay (the train station if right at the quay) and crosses to Manly the trip is around 30 minutes and you get the most amazing views of the harbour, fantastic for taking photos and a good cheap day out. We usually go for a walk over to the beach and then around the headland back down to the harbour side and have lunch in the sailing club very nice food and million dollar view. Then back to the quay and straight up to the train no hassle, you can buy a ticket that includes both train and ferry at any railway station.
Day out on the harbour. Great way to get up lose and personal with Sydney harbour...worth a look ..a a fine day you will see all Sydney has to offer.

Manly Ferry Trip. What better way to spend a morning/afternoon than a terrific ferry ride across beautiful Sydney Harbour, once you reach Manly, there is plenty to do, the Corso has lots of exciting shops and eateries and when you reach the other side of the Corso, you have the Ocean beaches.The ride back to Circular Quay is breathtaking, once you leave Manly Wharf, you have the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge infront of you. Wonderful iconic sights to snap with your camera.

Manly Ferry, Sydney Harbour. Forget about the expensive commercial harbour cruises, join the locals and take the ferry to Manly. You get to see the harbour foreshore with sites like Fort Dennison, Taronga Zoo , expensive real estate and you get to pass the opening to the harbour . Once you're in Manly, walk through The Corso to the Pacific Ocean. Lots of good eateries along the way. Amble along the promenade, walk along the sand or watch the beach volley. A great day out. Ideal for wheelchairs as well.

Great Fun!. Boarding the Manly Ferry is like taking an amusement ride only better value! Get a seat/s outside to be able to appreciate the views & if your feeling adventurous make sure you ride it on a day when the wind is blowing for maximum fun.

Very enjoyable. This was a great way to get to Manly beach, which is beautiful and a wonder in itself. It was a cool and slightly windy day but the ferry has seating inside and outside. Outside seating is beautiful when the sun is out and the breeze is breathtaking, very relaxing and calming. The view is also fantastic, almost like a mini cruise. The ferry is also quite large so good for people who get sea/motion sickness. You can't visit Sydney and not get on a ferry to Manly!

Don't waste time going to Bondi, jump on a ferry and go to Manly instead!. The trip to Manly aboard the ferry takes in the best parts of Sydney harbour. Cruise past the Opera House and Fort Denison and get a photo of the bridge from its best side. As you near Manly you pass the Heads which on a day with a big swell can be quite a thrill! See the beautiful old buildings of the Quarantine Station then you come into Manly. Ignore the pretty ugly wharf area and meander down the Corso towards the surf beach, along the way you will find unique boutiques, shops and plenty of cafes. Once your time is up in Manly, time the trip back on the ferry with the sunset, truly the very best Sydney has to offer!

great way to see harbour. this a good way to see sydney harbour at a cheap price if you can not afford a dinner cruise. You get to see the harbour bridge, opera house and go see manly which you can have a lovelly walk along the courso and the beach

A marvellous link between the City and beach. Wonderful trip on the ferry, giving you amazing vistas as you look back on the city. Wonderful photo opportunities. Then you turn round and Manly is ahead, you arrive at the Harbour side, with excellent eateries to refresh you, but do make sure you walk the short walk to Manly Beach and simply take in and enjoy!

Many Ferry a must on a fine day. A trip on the Manly ferry is virtually a 'must do' on a sunny day if you have the time. Take the slow ferry in non peak hour and it is a great 45 minute trip each way and you get the best sights of the city suburbs, Harbour bridge and Opera house as well as seeing the normal activity on the harbour.The cost is a fraction of the cost of a dedicated harbour cruise and all you really miss out on is the generic recorded tour commentary and closer look of some of the suburbs.Once in Manly, before taking the return trip, take a short walk through the pedestrian mall (plenty of reasonable places to eat) and you can then see Manly Beach which is a beach open to the ocean with surf.So all cheap thrills. We live in Sydney and we take every one of our out of town visitors on this trip, mas a result have done it many times and never get sick of it.

Still special after years. I still remember my first ride on the Manly Ferry, less than a week after arriving in Sydney, almost 4 years ago. Have done this many, many times now, but even now I feel excited whenever taking the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. Like going on a holiday, with the breeze on your head and the stunning scenery of Sydney Harbour. Best views on the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. At the end of the trip there is Manly, with lovely restaurants and the beautiful beach. I think if you are in Sydney for more than one day, you should definitely take this ferry trip. You won't regret!

Beat way to see Sydney Harbour. Jump on a local ferry at Circular Quay for a cheap picturesque journey to Manly. Spend the day on Manly beach , at the aquarium and lunching in this vibrant beachside city suburb.

7 miles from the city and a million miles from anywhere. Whichever mode of ferry you take, it is a great triop. Going across the heads opening can be a bit rough, but arriving at your destination, either Manly or Circular Quay is well worth it! I prefer the regular ferry over the fast ferry.

A great way to see Sydney Harbour.... The Manly Ferry is a great way to see Sydney Harbour - and cheap too. From Circular Quay to Manly Wharf, and back again, gives you a great overview of this magnificent harbour. Don't forget to look around at Manly wharf itself. Great food, restaurants and cafe's, pubs and nightclubs.The ferry itself is an icon, and perhaps not the most luxurious way to travel, but when you're on the water, you don't really care...A must do whilst in Sydney...

A great day out to Manly!. When in Sydney always hop on the Manly ferry to go out to Manly. It glides along the beautiful Sydney Harbour & takes you to Manly beach. A great day out for all who visit Sydney.

One of the best ways of traveling from city to Manly. Purchase a day tripper ticket $22 for adults and use to see all the city sights. Ferry rides to scenic Manly with great restruants, ice creams, fish and chips swims/walks along the beach. Exhausted then catch a bus to Palm Beach using the same ticket .... Valid till 2am the next day!
Ferry to Manly Regional Art Gallery. On arrival at Manly wharf, a short walk along the Harbour beach brings you to this fine gallery, compact and finely curated exhibitions - highly recommended!

ENJOY THE WORLD'S BEST HARBOUR. Take the ferry from Sydney's Circular Quay to Manly and enjoy a relaxing ferry ride on the world's most scenic harbour. Take in the yachts, power boats, other ferries and multi-million dollar harbour-side homes.Take in the views of the city's skyline, the Opera House and harbour bridge when departing then returning to Circular Quay. Sydney-siders never tire of the magnificent panorama, especially on a sunny day, and so should you when you visit Sydney.Then there's Manly, Harbour on one side, Tasman Sea (no, not the Pacific Ocean) on the other. The view of Manly Cove and the harbour from the Manly quay is awesome too. Spend a couple of hours browsing this water wonderland suburb and its myriad cafes and restaurants before returning by ferry to Circular Quay.Just do it.

Always a great way to see the harbour. So simple really. The manky ferry takes people to and from work. At least that is what is was designed for. But I think the people who get the best value out of it are the tourists. It is such a lovely way to see Sydney harbour and it will take you to Manly so you can have a nice swim at a surf beach and an icecream in The Corso.

Cheapest way to sail the Harbour. Jump aboard the old Manly Ferries for an half hour trip to Manly great views of the bridge Opera House and the Harbour in GeneralThen have a stroll along the Promenade beside the beautiful Norfolk Pines and,just People watch .Lots of cafes and Restaurants All this for I think a $8 dollar ferry ticket minus the food of course

Best Sydney Harbour Cruise at little cost.. Best way to cruise Sydney Harbour. Wharf 3 Circular Quay buy a ticket, for a small cost and once on the ferry select a seat in the open, preferably on the right side, buT at first sit on left side as ferry backs out then changes direction and you will be on right side. You will reach Manly in about 30 minutes. Enjoy views of opera house etc, but don't catch ferry on windy or rough sea days. When at Manly exit and walk the car free Corso to the ocean. Have a swim in the surf or enjoy a walk to Shelly Beach and back, about 1.4 km all up. When back enjoy a meal at Whitewater, just a few paces to your right on exiting The Corso. Catch the fast ferry back to the Quay if you want a quicker return. Enjoy

The only way to visit Manly and its Pacific beach. Every visitor to Sydney should regard Manly and Bondi Beaches as essential to visit and, in the case of Many, a ferry from Circular Quay really is the only way to do it. There are two possibilities, the old Manly Ferry takes 30 minutes and you get to see both the northern and southern banks of the eastern side of the harbour at a leisurely pace. The other option is the fast catamarans which take less than half the time. Why not go out on one and return on the other. Manly is worth a full day visit to take in the harbour beaches, the ocean beaches, the Corso that links the two, a trip up to North Head and, of course the local food and drink.

The Manly Ferry. As I have many overseas visitors in Sydney, I have found that a day trip on the Manly Ferry is always much enjoyed. We usually go late morning from Circular Quay, walk from the Manly wharf to the beach where one can swim or just have lunch at one of the many beach-side cafes and then return to Circular Quay by either the Ferry or the Jetcat. I find it is one of the best and cheapest ways to enjoy Sydney Harbour!
A must boat trip !. Sydney to ManlyThe best crossing in the world !Stop at Doyles for the fish & chips.Do the walk to Shelly Beach.

The ferry to Manly- a regular rite of passage for every Sydneysider. Manly is not Sydney but its only thirty minutes by ferry from Circular Quay, Sydney. The Manly ferry is iconic. A calm casual cruise through the week and a crowded noisy voyage on weekends with adults and babies in prams and surfboards and picnic baskets vying for a spot on the ferry.You get a trip to Manly and a free harbour tour past harbour islands, magnificent harbour side houses, little coves, historic old architecture and most importantly the hunting and meeting grounds of Sydney's indigenous past. People canoed round here once. Now there's the green and gold Manly ferry.
Great way to spend a couple. Hours. Take the ferry to manly walk along the beach and have some great gelato. Feel like a kid again. Even bette if you take the kids.

see Sydney by water. For a very cheap way of getting a look at the houses on the Sydney Harbour , without paying for the tour guides prices .
Take a ride up the Spit and out to the Heads
Only the cost of a normal very ticket
you get to take pictures of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera house from different angles

Great experience. Using the ferries to get around is a great experience. They are clean, most have free wifi and they run on time. Spend a few hours in Manly as its a lovely place, small shops, beach etc. Top tip, pay for a travel card. One weeks travel card allows you to use the ferries and city trains/buses so you can really explore Sydney and surrounding areas. The travel card gives substantial savings.

RELAXING. I loved this ferry ride as it was so peaceful and went quickly because it was so enjoyable. There is no better way to view Sydney's Harbour Bridge and Opera House than to go on this ferry.A MUST DO FOR ANYONE COMING TO SYDNEY!

great ride. you can catch the manly ferry from circular quay on sydney harbour and go across the harbour to the wharf at manly. it runs nearly everday of the year. it is a great ride across the harbour which allows you to see the boats and the ocean liners which move through the harbour during the day and night.

Cruisy. Used the manly ferry to get to a Manly NRL game - the weather was perfect giving a great view of the harbour both ways. The ferry was on time with easy access both ways - cost was excellent only $10 return for the family of 4x on a Sunday

Are there any better views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge than from the ferry?!. We took the ferry to Manly to experience the beach town. What we didn't expect were the amazing views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge from the ferry. It was worth the ferry fare just for the views!
Great way to travel. Smooth ride, free internet and great views. Takes about 25 minutes to manly but worth the trip. Not too expensive either and worth it as Manly is cheaper than the Rocks

What a great way to see the harbour and suburbs of Sydney. A Sydney institution and well worth it even if you don't want to see much of Manly as the ferry trip alone s excellent. It cost us $14 return for a half hour trip so is quite reasonable. There are 2 decks and most of the seats are inside - get there early if you want one of the few outdoor seats - although during the Winter even on the lovely day when we went you will need to wrap up.It's only a short walk to the beach at the other end.

One of the Best Bargains in Town. We had the City Multi Pass which includes trains, buses, and ferries. We took the ferry from Darling harbor over to circular quay. There we boarded the Manly Ferry. It is about 30 minutes one way. A very pleasant trip. You can get coffee and tea and snacks on board.

It is about the journey, not the destination. Well worth the effort. Not only do you get to experience the harbour and all its delights you get the opportunity to get up close and personal with the wind in your hair and the sun in your face. It is what Sydney is all about.
The view is amazing. The ferry takes u o Manly island in less than 30minutes. The panorama of Sydney is amazing and also the coastal scenery (cliffs, etc.) is just beautiful. Highly recommended.

Excellent experience. I'm so glad we chose to take the ferry to Manly rather than the faster one as we got great views of the harbour, bridge and opera house. Well worth doing as a day trip to Manly- we walked along the beach and around the point.

Great way to see the harbour. Everytime I visit Sydney (at least once a year) I travel on the ferry to Manly. It is a great way to get views of Sydney Harbour and is a good way to rest your feet while still seeing the sites.
Average. Ferry could have been better...dated! Trip to Manly...great view. Manly is nice. Definitely worth going over to Manly.
Fun ride. Great trip to Manly on the ferry. Get to see all the harbour and out to the heads. Would recommend this trip because you can get off at Manly and there is a lot to do and see there.
Slow boat to China. We should have taken the Fast Ferry option and could have spent more time at the waterfront hotel... lovely meal.
Manly ferry is inexpensive. There are a lot of cruise excursions offered for Sydney but the Manly ferry is a great inexpensive way to see if you want to see or spend more time or money on the harbor.
Reversals. The ferry from Taronga return was on the private wharf side and the private company had to come in the ferry side or all the signage and queues were in the wrong place.
great views of opera house. Nice way to see the harbor. Manly is a fun place to walk around. We took a very scenic walk along the water.
Manly ferry. Excellent, scenic and inexpensive way to get to Manly from Circular Quay. The ferry terminal at Manly is great to explore as well and has great eating facilities and clean toilets.

Excellent value. Took the ferry to Manly on the spur of the moment, so glad we did - could not fault anything about the ferry except that it was over too quickly - if you go to Sydney make sure this ride is included.
Must do. Catch the ferry to Manly, get some fish and chips and walk from the harbor beach to the ocean beach, along The Corso. On your way back get an ice cream. Your day is complete!

The best day out. Sydney siders love their Harbour. There is something wonderful about getting on the Ferry at Cicular Quay and takeing the Ferry Trip across to Manly to have lunch, and see the wonderful beach, and to do the walk around to Fairy Bower, I have lived in Manly, it is a place that you always want to go back and visit. Regards, Marion.
To manly for fish'n'chips!!. A must do when visiting Sydney. The ferries are a terrific rom of public transport and also a great Aussie Icon.

Good views, slightly overpriced. Good views of the harbour, good way to see a lot of sydney you otherwise wouldn't see and best way to get from manly to the city and back. However, can get rough in big seas.

Seaside on your doorstep. A twenty minute ferry ride from downtown Sydney and you are in Manly. The ferry across the bay, with its great views of the opera house and bridge are reason enough to go on the ferry, but then you get the bonus of Manly itself, with its bars, restaurants, shops and beautiful beach.

Great way to see the Harbour. A trip to Manly on the Ferry is a great way to see the Harbour and it main sights very cheaply, and Manly is lovely too. There are loads of nice bars, restaurants and shops as well as the beaches.

Worth the ride. If you will to go to work or as a tourist it does not matter: everytime you will look around to enjoy the view. Its a cheap and fun way to reach Manly and the other beaches... do not use the bus from CBD.

Beautiful Ferry Ride. Both in the sun (really bright in Sydney even in winter) and at sunset. Great way to experience the Harbour and get a taste of the ocean. Pedestrian mall from ferry terminal to beach is a bit tacky/touristy but no big deal if your expectations are realistic.

Must do when in Sydney. The manly ferry is a must do experience. you get to see most of the harbour before the bridge and then you get to Manly. Great fun walking down the Corso and onto the famous Beach. Great cafes and bars when you are there too!
Best view of the city. Definitely the best view of the city, Opera House and Bridge! Manly is a nice town with some shops, I personally preferred the beaches in Sydney.
Harbour cruise. As ggod as most cruises and a fraction of the price.Regular services to Manly and its beautiful beaches.Recommended.

Nice trip - every expensive. We went to Manly for a look around and to go to Ocean world. Nice trip - very calm - easy enough to buy tickets and find where to go to board. Found it super expensive $36 for a family of 2 adults and 2 kids return. Ferries don't seem to have family passes that you can buy as a tourist, so ferry travel over a few days can prove costly. Would be good if they could do tourist pass for unlimited travel for a fixed rate. Nice trip, ferry clean and smooth sailing

Awesome way to see the harbour. What a pleasant way to see Sydney harbour. This inexpensive ferry -around AUS$14 is a fabulous leisurely ride across the harbour. Try to sit up the front, outside, but dress warmly the wind can be chilly
the only way to travel. iconic trip - never tired of it - certainly recommend staying in Manly and commuting in/out of the city centre on it.

Great day out - a beautiful beach.. Take the ferry to Manly and walk from the wharf beach to the main beach (5min), grab a bite to eat in the fantastic selection of restaurants, or walk along the beach, swim or surf.

Not to be missed. A cheap and fun way to experience Sydney Harbour. The ferry leaves every thirty minutes from Circular Quay. You get awesome views of the Bridge, Opera House and the stunning buildings and houses linn the Harbour. When you get into Many, go for a stroll across to Manly beach, and consider renting a bike from one if the bike hire shops. This s a great and easy way to experience Manly..

Must Do When in Sydney. Rain,or shine....this is a perfect way to experience the beauty of Sydney Harbour. It's not expensive - $7.20 one way for an adult. You can buy snacks on board and we found it very relaxing. Good to travel with luggage as we did. Very spacious but I would expect that it would get crowded at peak hours. It was a lovely 30 minute trip for us!
A Must Do. Whether you travel to or from Manly, this is a must, the sights are spectacular (the Opera House and bridge ) are great from the ferry.

Loved it!. I loved the ferries in Sydney, and this particular one is nice and long with great views! It's a great value for the money, and I really enjoyed it! The view of the harbor on this ferry is very nice, and if you had to choose one ferry in Sydney, this is probably it!

Quick, Pretty, Efficient. The Manly Ferry is a great alternative to the buses in and out of the city. It runs regularly and on time. It is clean. There is free wi-if but we could never connect to it in the 20 minute ride. The view of the Harbor Bridge and Opera House is incredible....reminds me of the Staten Island Ferry view of the Statue of Liberty and Manhattan! A must for tourists!

Fun!. The ferries are a great way to get around the Sydney area and a good way to get different views/photos of the Opera House and Harbor Bridge - along with all the other scenery! It is about a 30 minute ride.
A must do if you're in Sydney. If you're in Sydney you simply must take the trip on the ferry to this beautiful and relaxing area of the city.

Fantastic trip but it can get bumpy!. Always take this ferry when we are in Sydney - love the ride and the destination. On this occasion the wind was up and there was a fair swell going on by the entrance to the harbour. Crew came on the PA to warn passengers to stay seated and that those outside could get wet. It sure got bumpy - one woman ignored (or didn't understand) the advice and got thrown violently against the seats when trying to come in from the outdoor area. She was badly bruised but ok. Others got drenched! So be warned! Cafe and facilities on board - love the free wifi Sydney ferries now give you.
Great Views Throughout. An excellent way to get views of Sydney harbour and all the way down the bay. Manly is an excellent beach suburb too
On time and very easy. Ferry was pretty much always on fine, and simple way to get to Manly.Fleet getting a bit old and tired, but they still do their job, and journey was comfy enough.

A lovely way to see the Harbour. A sunset ride on the Manly Ferry back to Circular Quay is a great way to finish a day of site-seeing. The ferry takes 30 minutes and if there is a strong breeze or a swell, the lower section at the front of the ferry can get quite wet - so don't stand there if you don't want to get soaked!There is an upper deck which has an open area at the front too - as it is one level above, it doesn't get as wet (though the odd passenger did get soaked out there by a wave the last time I was on board). If you want to stay dry, sit in one of the many seats and enjoy the views.Take a wind-proof sweater if you plan to ride this ferry standing outside, especially in Winter or on a chilly night.
Over to Manly. Love the old ferry's that ply their trade on the Harbour.Always enjoy the trip to Manly. Staff are always courteous and helpful.

Cheapest harbour tour available. The Manly ferry is a great way to get a cheap (and good) trip around Sydney harbor and to visit the seaside town of Manly to boot. It leaves from Circular Quay and takes about 30 minutes to get to Manly using a large ferry. Two tips - on the return leg, try and leave Manly towards dusk so that you get amazing views of the Opera House and Bridge as you come back into Sydney - and consider departing from Darling Harbour via Sydney Ferries, connecting at Circular Quay (move between wharf 5 and 3). This costs a few dollars more but you get to enjoy a cruise under the bridge.

Trick. It's very good, 30 minutes for go to Manly from Sydney. The landscape is very good, but it's VERY EXPENSIVE!! The trick is buy the "pensioner ticket", 2.5$ for walk around Sydney all zones with all types of public transport ;)

One of the Best Ferry Rides in the World. The only thing to dislike is that you cannot go onto the top deck of the boat. Everything else about the ride is fantastic, coming out of and into Sydney And Manly Harbours, the views, the smell of the sea and Manly itself when you get there. Far better than the 20 minutes in a car.

Worthwhile. The ferry ride is covered with a basic multi card so the family popped over after a day at the zoo. Good views of Sydney and dinner at the beach side of the mall was a nice way to end the day. Teens got in some last minute shopping as well. The ferry was crowded but as always never a problem getting seats and free wifi on board.
Great!!!. 30 minutes to heaven!GOTO the Manley Beach.go surfing or swimming in the winter.Great ocean walksGreat to get out of Sydney!

Manly, and the Ferry. This is a very nice and well worthwhile trip. It is very cheap, lives from the harbour right between the bridge and the Opera House. You have great views all the way, the city, the Opera House, the bridge, and Manly as you arrive. Considering the price, it is a better deal than most water tours around the area. Manly itself is also a beautiful area and well worth a day trip. Manly Beach is a lot nicer than the more famous Bondi beach.

Great way to see the harbor. We took the ferry to Manley instead of paying a lot of money for a dinner "cruise" in Sydney Harbor that I suspected would have so-so food. The ferry was cheap and we enjoyed the beautiful weather and lovely views. Manley was a nice place to stroll, people watch and shop.

Great way to see the harbour. We enjoyed our trips accross the harbour when we stayed in Mosman for 5 days. HOwever, I hear the prices are going up for the ferry which will make it an expensive tourist attraction. Its a great way to get around the harbour area.
perfect afternoon trip. Very inexpensive and just what I was looking for! One half hour there and back, wonderful views of the bridge and the Opera House and the entire Sydney Harbor.

A must when in Sydney. We love the ferries in Sydney. This particular trip is worth it simply for the view of the opening to the ocean but to top it off many itself was beautiful. We went early and took along walk around the streets and ended up having lunch and dinner in Manly. Worth a visit.

morning ferry ride. Beautiful trip on the commuter ferry. Took the slower one. Lovely views all the way. At Manly, walked to the National Park - very pretty views, and also enjoyed the beach area and pedestrian streets. A great diversion from the city.

Beach day. Took the ferry to Manly. Then went to the beach. Really nice beach, very clean. There was a promenade from the ferry to the beach so no traffic worries. A lot of small shop and food outlets.

BestValue for Money in Sydney.... Costs around $15 return from Circular Quay... no commentary , however Sydney Harbour is so visual you don't need to be told ... it's spectacular all the way there , and back again !

Great ferry ride. We took this ferry out to Manly based on some locals recommendations. It was a beautiful ride among sailboats. The walkway was nice and the surfer beach had more locals. Hit the chocolate stand for gourmet hot chocolate for the ferry ride back if it it's a cooler day.

Be careful. I wanted to spend some time on the island, but was duped into a round trip ferry that didn't stop at the island. Book the fast ferry if you want to spend
D time on the beaches of Manley Island.

Great ferry ride. The Manly ferry offers a great 30 minute ride across Sydney harbour to the popular seaside area of Manly. My ideal way is to take the Manly ferry one way from Circular Quay to Manly and the fast ferry back.
The crossing at Sydney heads can get a little rough for a few minutes during bad weather.

Late sat night returns are an experience!. Looking back at the quay and across over the water to the bridge and opera house is an absolute delight. Travelling back with very drunk revellers at the end of the evening is less fun

Great views. Want to enjoy pretty hard to beat, upfront views of the Sydney harbour?
Convenient cheap transport to beautiful Manly?
Can't go wrong with the Manly ferry.

Historic Ferry Ride!!. The 'Original' way to travel from Sydney Harbour to Manly Wharf, this is a must do. As we were boarding the Ferry, a Big sign greeted us ' Sydney's Famous Manly Ferry'! It was a kind of prelude of things to come ! The journey to Manly itself is only 25-30 minutes but the receding Sydney Harbour and the beautiful waterway make quite a sight!

The best way to see the harbour. When I was in Sydney last i was staying with family in Mount Tarcoola and driving to manly to catch the ferry into the city. It is a massive boat that makes you feel safe in the water. I recommend getting a spot on the front deck to get some amazing photo opportunities.

harbour cruise. The ferry trip to Manly is great and once you get there the things to do are many. We walked,ate and drank and had a lovely day.Walk around to Fairy Bower beach - it is well worth the walk.

must do. i stayed in manly for a week and caught the ferry reglarily , always on time , approx $16 to circular quay where u can then go wherever u want , free wifi on board and also can charge up your phone

Best way to see Sydney's harbour. The Many ferry is an inexpensive way to view all of the major attractions on Sydney's beautiful harbour. The Bridge; the Opera House; harbourside suburbs; The Heads; and beautiful Manly.

Cheap but thrilling trip!. So much fun, even at night! Great option for the over 60's, because you can use the $2.50 ticket on the ferries. Such a great deal.
The ferries are clean and safe, brings back happy childhood memories; still fun for the whole family.

Must do for Sydney. We do the Manly Ferry quite often, I would recommend it to any visitors (or locals) just to get out on the Harbour. If you're travelling on Sunday you can buy a family funday ticket which is train bus ferry unlimited all day.

Amazing views and travel to a cool destination. Manly's ferry is a cheap way to enjoy a ride out to the famous Manly beaches. Along the way you get amazing views between the heads, sights of large ships, and possibly even dolphins if you're lucky. Plus, great views of the bridge and skyline as you leave CBD. Completely different and beautiful again at night as you approach the city.

Dolphins a bonus. A great way to see the bridge and the opera house from a different angle. Manly is well worth a visit, nicer than Bondi with better shops and restaurants close to the promenade. Seeing dolphins in the harbour was the icing on the cake!

Cheaper Option than Driving!. Given the speed of the Manly Ferries, the option to not drive from the Northside to the city is a no brainer given the cost and availability of parking. From the south- stop at a railway station where parking is available and disembark at Circular Quay. The ferries are great and a family pass is more reasobable that the $60 parking fee. An oldie but a goodie(the service)!

A must do, family visit to Manly on a Sunday. Wow, as an out of towner, I really rate the Sydney ferries and especially the Manly ferry. Travel on a Sunday and it is $2 for the whole day on as many ferries as you like....WHAT a bargain!!!! A nice long ride over to Manly, free wifi, free mobile phone charging. little add-ons like this are such a great bonus, especially when you are like me and need to catch up on facebook or trip advisor and forgot your phone charger. Manly beach is lovely and especially Shelley beach. Great selection of shops and restaurants. Spend the day on the beach or just shopping, especially as you have only spent $2 getting there. A must do. Our kids loved it.

Pleasant Boat Trip across Sydney Harbour. We used the Manly ferry to cross to the north shore of Sydney Harbour. The route took us along the coastline towards the entrance of Sydney Harbour before heading north to Manly. It was a good alternative to the more expensive tourist boats.

The service runs like clockwork. The service runs like clockwork, is relatively inexpensive and provides some great views of the opera house, the harbour bridge and the financial district. Go in daylight and at night to get some very different views/photos of the opera house

Excellent trip to Manly. The famous Manly ferry is a great trip. Takes 20-30mins each way out to Manly. We only went for a few hours in Manly and enjoyed the trip. Felt that $14 return is reasonably priced also. The ferries are quite large and look quite old but handle well, even in the large swells in the harbour entrance. Great trip would do it again!!
Don't miss Manly. The Ferry to Manly is very easy to get along and also quick, not that expensive and in 30 minutes you'll find yourself in Miami's Sobe but in Australia.

Fast way to Manly. Great way to get from Sydney to Manly and back. Trip one way takes about 30 mins-40 mins (depending on the waves). Very convenient as a ferry leaves every 35 minutes or so. Nice view of the harbour and of course, the opera house.

Great way to get to Manly. Quick ferry with outside seating that passes the harbour bridge, opera house and circular quay, so a cheap way to see the sights from the water. Manly is definitely worth a visit... Less touristy and more chilled than Bondi.

The views are nice. Go for the views of the harbour, but don't expect too much of the ferries themselves. They are utilitarian means of transport, not pleasure cruisers, but on a nice day it's a trip well worth while and Manly is an interesting and, given its fame, surprising mix of old and modern.

The best ferry trip ever. Don´t miss the trip to Manly by ferry - it´s the best trip you can have through Port Jackson, passing all the bays, having the view on The Gap, finally visiting Manly with ist splendid beaches and restaurants.What a joy to spend a day in Sydney like this.
Convenient and Quick. Convenient and quick service across to Manly Beach from Circular Quay - Excellent beach and nice ferry ride with good views from the top deck.

Great outing and way to see the harbour. Peak hours can be crowded and best avoided but great way to see the harbour and spend a few hours in Manly. If the weather is warm-hot, the Manly beaches are worth spending time on.
Ferry Ride. Great siteseeing on the Manly Ferry, pass one of the many bays & beaches on the way, very comfortable ride.

A great way to see Sydney Harbour & commute. Always an enjoyable trip. If you are short on time, get the next ferry back. Runs every 30 minutes or if you are really in a hurry there is a faster service. Costs a bit more

So relaxing on board the Ferry. This is the best way to get to Manly for sightseeing, or go toTaronga zoo to spend the day. The service starts at Circular Quay, where you purchase your round trip ticket.The prices is very affordable, and service is good, and the fresh air esp in the morning is so refreshing. You will really appreciate the beauty of the Sydney harbour.

See the Harbour & More- GREAT VALUE!. When visiting Sydney there is no cheaper way to get out on the water than to use the Manly Ferry commuter passenger ferry. Departing frequently from Circular Quay, this ferry route takes you all the way to Manly which is a fair distance from your departure point. The cost (return) is around $12, however it might be worth looking into one of the many 'day-pass' options that affords you the convenience of riding all ferry's, trains and buses anywhere in the Sydney system (around $30-40) Be sure to not try and do this trip during the morning or afternoon rush hour as you will find yourself waiting, often for a three or four sailing delay while commuters make their way into the city for work. Go mid day, sit outside on the top, bow area and take in the great views. You will get good photo opportunities during the approximately 30 minute voyage. Firstly, as you depart, the iconic Harbour Bridge towers above on the left, then the Opera House on the right. As you make your way towards Manly wharf, you will have a chance to see all of the other boats & sailing traffic which is exciting and can be dramatic as the others will pass by very closely. Upon arrival in Manly, make your way to the walking plaza, which leads towards the beach. Depending on the weather, take in the multitude of shops and food/beverage options or enjoy the sands of Manly beach. For an historical beer at an infamous Sydney haunt, make your way to The Steyne Hotel, an Aussie hotel/pub perfectly located in the heart of Manly. Spend a couple of hours exploring and taking in this toni neighbourhood that is the destination of millions of visitors every year. The best part of this trip, to me is the inexpensive cost of the ticket to board a boat and take a very scenic ride through the world famous Harbour. Highly Recommend!

Inexpensive way to see the harbour. The ferry provided an inexpensive way to see the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, and the Harbour itself. The ferry takes about a half hour each way, and it is just a few blocks from the ferry terminal to the beach itself (with shops, restaurants, and at least one grocery store along the way).Highly recommended

Lovely day traveling to Manly. We spent the first of our 5 days in Sydney taking the Manly Ferry out to Manly. The commentary along the way was very informative. We had taken a harbor cruise 8 weeks previously and very glad to see the harbor sights in greater depth with this ferry. Arrived in Manly in time for a walk along the beaches, shopping and lunch. Thought about returning to Sydney by land but the ferry ride was so pleasant, we opted to catch the later afternoon ferry. You can never get enough of the sites of the harbor, The Opera House and Bridge.

Excellent value. you can take the ferry from circular quay, metro station and every 30 min you have a connection to gorgeous manly beach ! boats a little bit dated but friendly crew and sometimes even wifi working:) fantastic views of harbor and opera house on the trip!
Great scenic trip. Bit rough out by the heads but lovely scenic trip from Circular Quay to Manly, definitely worth it. Would recommend.
Great way to see the harbour sights and Manly beach is beautiful.. Excellent value in monetary and scenic terms. Great views of the bridge the opera house the harbour and the Heads.

harbour cruise and getting there and back. Probably one of the best ways to get to Manly and a bonus is that you see the harbour entrance and cop some ocean swells if lucky! In wild weather can get quite exciting close to the heads. A good way of seeing the eastern end and swankier suburbs from the briny.
GOOD. The best way to shoot the bridge, the sydney opera house for small bucks !! And you get to see one of the trendiest and niciest beaches of Sydney.The must do attraction if you are on visit.

Fun and relaxing - an easy way to see Sydney. No matter how many times you take this ferry, it is always fun. You see what makes Sydney so special - wonderful harbour, great to see the Heads and Manly itself is always special. Amazing that the boats which look so old can travel so quickly.
Wonderful way to see Sydney Harbour. This is probably the cheapest way to get a look at the harbour, fun and entertaining as you see the sail boats on the harbour
Harbour Crossing. Icon of sydney harbour and worth doing the trip just for the ride and ease of getting to Manley from sydney

Easy as pie to take, doesn't rock a bunch.. Get out to Manly, what a beautiful area. If you time it right, you come back into Sydney harbor as the sun is setting behind the bridge and the opera house....what a sight.

Nostalgia every trip. Going to Manly as a child was just so special and now whenever I ride the ferry it brings back so many happy memories. Not only do you see the beautiful harbour then a little rocking as you pass the heads but you arrive into a lovely bay and instantly enjoy a more relaxed atmosphereThen a pleasant stroll up the mall to the beachA most enjoyable ride with ease of embarking and disembarking
Great trip. It is very relaxing to go in this ferry and the scenery is amazing. It is very good option to go to Manly beach an other good stores and restaurants in that area

Quick ride to a completely different destination. From Big city to beach-life, this ferry will whisk you away touring you by some of the iconic structures in Sydney (Botanic Gardens, Opera House, Harbour Bridge)...and deliver you over to a sandy beach. You'll love the shopping, food there and the getaway.

A great trip!. Lovely views from the decks, clean seats, plenty of space, around $14 for a return trip but we bought a weekly 'my multi 1' transport ticket which is unlimited travel on buses, ferries and most trains. Only 44 bucks.Takes around 25 mins to get to Manly from Circular Quay and its well worth the ride :)

Great Way to see Sydney harbour. The ferry over to Manley is a great way to see the harbour and experience, once you get to Manley, a great beach. We arrived on a cruise ship into the Overseas Passenger Terminal and it was a short walk to the ferry. The ferry heads across the harbour to Manley, about a 30 minute trip, providing great views of the Sydney harbour. Although I arrived by cruise ship the view of the harbour is much better on the ferry as you are closer to the action of the harbour and you get a feeling of what the port is really about. This is a wonderful way to get in touch with Sydney and its waterfront, and, as a bonus, there is the welcoming town and beach of Manley at the end of the ride.

Another must do in Sydney. The ferry ride is great, with spectacular views of the city. But even better, the ferry drops you off at Manly. I loved this area. It felt a little like South Beach without the pretense and decadence. I would definitely do this again next time I go to Sydney and hopefully be able to stay longer.
Use mymulti card - unlimited ferry trips. Make sure you try this ferry, half an hour trip to Manly. We used mymulti card and it gave us unlimited ferry trip from circular quay. Great scenery.
Great afternoon trip on the Manley Ferry. A great way to see the Opera House and Bridge and on the way back the Light Projection show was on - incredible!
Great trip. Pleasant trip on the Harbour- very comfortable and clean seats and common areas. Easy to buy the tickets and good way to travel in Sydney

This is a must ride. The Manly ferry is included in your transit pass. I always buy a transit pass for the entire time I am in Sydney and never rent a car. The Train is faster than a cab from the airport to the CBD. So having a pass is already a must, but the whip cream on top is the Manly ferry. A 30 min. cruise which goes past all the best sights in Sydney harbour. Then you arrive at Manly. A jewel of a community. Walk through Manly to the beach. This is a real day trip, if you do not plan a full day you will wish you had. This is a great trip. Bonus free wifi on the ferry.

Best value for money ferry!. If you're in Sydney definitely do the Manly ferry trip. It's worth it to see Manly but aside from that, you get lovely views looking back at Sydney, so it feels like you're on a cruise. Sunset is recommended!
