Good for a tourist or a commuter. Ticket booth can be tricky, but you can buy tickets on board. Watch for wave spray if sitting outside on the bow, but it's a smashing view and the cheapest harbour tour around!

Interesting trip.. Do take the Manly Ferry, this is a very interesting little town and good beaches. We went over in the rain and had a lovely lunch and toured all the shops. Very interesting local art and artifacts.

Lovely day out. First of all we loved the ferry ride to Manly. It was lovely to see the extent of Sydney harbor, and when we returned it opened out in front of us. Such a pretty sight. In Manly we went for a very long walk. It was really pretty, but sooooo hot.

Bring your camera!. The views from the ferry are amazing! If you get the multi day pass the price is quite cheap! I only had one issue and that was because the ferry I was on was packed there was little room to move. However we got on board early enough to get a bow seat.
A Sydney icon..... NO better way to spend a few hours on the water and have a swim at Manly. Different feel from the beaches on the eastern side...

You will have the best views of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour. This ferry ride had the best views of the boats sailing on the water as well as the Opera House at all angles that we took it again on another day. I agree that sitting outside on the front deck gives you the best views on a nice day. Manly Beach has small shops for souvenirs, ice cream parlors and restaurants to have a bite.

Great. A great way to see the harbour from a boat.
Spend a couple o hours in Manly enjoying the beach and bar culture!

A cheap way to view the harbour. Take the manly ferry fom the dock near the bridge and the opera house. It only costs a few dollers as it's classed as public transport.The views of the bay,bridge and opera house are fantastic . Plus you also get to visit manly beach which is a really nice place to have some lunch and a few drinks.

inexpensive harbour cruise. No need to take an expensive boat cruise just to see the harbour.The Manly Ferry will give you an excellent view of the harbour, plus you get to go to a very nice place called Manly.You can stoll the streets of Manly to shop or get a bite to eat, plus Manly Beach is a large beautiful beach to visit and go for a swim if you want. After spending as much time as you like in Manly you take the Ferry back to Sydney and get a slighty differnt view of the city at a different time of the day. Very enjoyable!
Take the slow boat. The very best way to see the harbour. Sit outside at the front is you can. The boats may be a little older than the fast ferry, but oh so much more character and fun!

Awesome ferry ride. Took the manly ferry from circular quay to manly...took the to journey in the afternoon and return journey in the night....liked the day view a lot...one of the must-do in Sydney is ferry travel and manly ferry gives you a full view of the Sydney buildings along with the harbor bridge and opera house...make sure you take one of the outer ferry seats and then you see a beautiful view of Sydney from closeup to an overview as the ferry goes away and away. Surely, it is an awesome ride.
Boat with a view. The ferry is just like any other but the unfolding vista of the harbour and its various special places that is revealed as you travel makes this one a must for any visitor.
Commuterland. Avery popular , crowded ferry - best to go out of season . And Manly was crowded and noisy ..we came straight back

Spectacular. If you're in Sydney on a sunny day, you can't go past a ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly. It is absolutely spectacular. While you are in Manly, have some fish and chips by the water.
Iconic. Have to do, take the slowest one, sit outside and take plenty of pictures. Manly is just so so but the ferry ride if spectacular to say the least, wish was my daily commute !!

Cheapest Harbour Cruise!. If you want to do a cruise of the Harbour this is the best way - for the price of a good cup of coffee you can see the whole harbour from Circular Quay to Manly and back. No need to pay for expensive tourist cruises. Get off and walk around Manly and visit one of Sydney's best known beaches - walk across to the ocean beach and along the walkway all the way to Fairy Bower and Shelley Beach (where there's a fabulous French restaurant and a pricey but awesome fish and chip take away shop). Then come back and board the ferry for the cruise back to the Quay.

Wonderful value, terrific time!. Sooooo easy to navigate, and so special to see Sydney Harbour from the water. Loved, loved, loved our journey over to Manly and our long walk over there. For $14, it is the best deal in town!

Sydney's cheapest harbour cruise. Catching a ferry from Circular Quay to Manly, doing some sightseeing and getting the ferry back is an ideal way to see Sydney's city, harbour and beaches on a budget.
Manly by the ferry.. A must-do when you are in Sydney. It was a perfect day and we had a some a wonderful time at the beach and back. Sunset from the ferry was awesome.

Day trip to Manly. This is a great way to see our wonderful Harbour and avoid the usual tourist traps. The Ferry is a commuter service used by locals - At Manly you can walk around the seafront both North and South and is a pleasant trip

Great value. It's worth to take the public ferry to Manly (A$14.40 return fare). It comes every hour at the Sydney Harbour (Circular Quay). It's the cheapest ay to get a view of the Sydney Opera House from the front angle. When you board go to the front of the ferry (the side facing the pier) so that when it leaves the pier you will be able to take photos of the Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge from the ferry. Spectacular views.
Dont miss this one!. Loved this 30 minute ferry and loved Manly beach. coming home we left "near" sunset so that we could see the sun go down and the lights of Sydney come on. spell binding

A very cheap way to tour Sydney Harbour. For around $10 a trip its a terrific sight seeing tour for about an 1hr to 1.5 hr journey past the Sydney heads to Manly refreshments on board very reasonable. Other non government ferry's can be up from $35+ a head for similar trip.A pub in Main st Mall Manly has $10 steak meals all day every day highly recommend.

This is the was to see the Harbour. We had only a couple of days to see Sydney and realised that a boat trip was necessary to see the Bridge and Opera House to best advantage. Rather than pay handsomely for a tourist trip, we decided to take the ferry to Manly and so take in another of the 'sights' - Manly Beach. We are so pleased that we did.It was a very pleasant Autumn day, which of course helps, and the views from the boat were splendid - all the tourist shots of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House you could want. The rest of the scenery is not at all bad either; what a wonderful area it is.The ferry itself was efficient, clean and tidy and just the perfect way to travel to Manly.
Beats the bus. What a great way to cross the harbour. They run on time and are fairly quick. The views are stunning.

Manly at last. Manly was lovely. Have been to Sydney three times now and tried each time to get to Manly. Two previous times it was torrential rain. Finally on the third try we got there. It was worth the wait. The ferry ride was great. Manly teriffic.

Sydney to Manly. we took the ferry and it was approximately 1/2 hour ride..beautiful scenery the whole trip..once in Manly, we shopped til we dropped, then off to the beautiful beach, about a 10 minute walk from ferry terminal..back to ferry terminal and had the best fish & chip of our lives at the restaurant at the terminal..
Scenic as can be. no visit to Sydney would be complete without this crossing of the harbour to end up in Manly for a great day of shopping, cafe culture and beach/walk

Go for the beach and lovely ferry ride. One of the must-dos in a Sydney trip, whether you are a beach fan or not. It just takes a ferry ride to get into a more laid-back, and relax vibe away from the city centre. And the ride offers a panoramic view of the surrounding islands (look out for the Governor-General of Australia's seafront home)Shopping and food on Manly island can be quite the let-down (had a very forgettable fish and chips), but really just go there for the beach. It feels more liberating than Bondi, as the latter is way too crowded

Brilliant View. In my opinion, the Manly Ferry serves 2 purposes: get to Manly Beach and get one of the best views of Sydney Harbour. It may not seem like the cheapest trip, but it is worth every penny to see the Opera House and Harbour Bridge together to get that perfect postcard picture.

Best way for a scenic view of the Sydney Harbour. Taking the ferry in Circular Quay is like taking the metro in other cities: this is usual.So let's go for it: grab a ticket and enjoy one of the close destinations, like Manly, Watson Bay, etcYou will have a great view of the bridge, opera and the CBD.And even have the luck to cross ways with some majestic boats.

Crushing. They could really do with organising this most popular of ferry trips so it's not so much of a crush! ...sooo many people all wanting to move at once. I felt sorry for those with children in pushchairs. Sunny weekends it's packed. avoid if you have little ones!

No need for an expensive harbor tour!. Just jump on the Manly ferry and enjoy the views!! Make sure to book a round trip ticket. On the way to Manly, we had a spot at the front of the boat. This was great for photos and sightseeing. On the way back, the weather was not as nice. We opted for an inside seat. Many who had braved the front of the boat were soaked!!

beautiful, fast, fantastic. if you are in sydney, no trip is complete without visitng manly. the ferry is fantastic, not too expensive and doesnt take a while and is an experience in itself. not to be missed.

A little underwhelmed. I was really looking forward to this trip to Manly, but honestly, I was somewhat underwhelmed. The ferry ride itself was fine (about 30 minutes), and is a great way to catch some amazing views of Sydney. However, Manly beach itself was not really what I had expected. It may have been due to the fact that we were there Easter weekends, but the crowds were horrendous. It didn't feel relaxing at all. We ended up cutting our time there short, but if we returned, I would give it a second chance. I think we maybe would have enjoyed it more if we would have ventured further away from all of the activity and taken a walk or bike ride.

great way to see the bay. Great way to get to Manly Beach for day trip. We left in the morning and came back at night. Coming into Sydney and seeing the skyline and opera house at night is something special and well worth it. Going to Manly was our best day in Sydney.
great views of sydney skyline. good value, 14 dollar return ticket. good views of sydney from a distance. manley has a great beach and fun feel to the place.
Affordable way to travel. We go out to Manly often to shop, eat and swim. The ferry can be crowded on weekends. Try and get on as early as possible to avoid large crowds.

cheapest harbour cruise in town. If your a Sydney Visitor you must take the trip on the Manly Ferry & you will be delighted to walk around Manly which is one of the nicest sea side villages in the world. Manly has many great restaurants from simple take aways to fine dinning, If its warm bring your swimmers for a dip at either the Harbour beach or a body surf at the surf beach. There are great pubs & night life spots also .. Its a must do day when you visit Sydney & its also the cheapest harbour cruise in town

Beautiful views of the harbour at night. After a busy day sightseeing in Sydney we decided to do something a bit more leisurely so we chose the ferry trip from Circular Quay across to Manly. On a pleasant evening (as it was for us) you get fantastic views of the harbour all lit up with the bridge as the centrepiece. It is a pleasant trip and if you stand or sit on the open decks you may get to see the flocks of gulls which fly alongside the moving boat, wheeling and diving in the air currents. Manly itself seemed quite a lively place but we really only went there for the ferry trip so we just had a little wander around before getting on the boat back.

A good alternative to expensive night cruise. To admire the night scencery around the circular quay, I took a ferry from the circular quay to Manly. The ride enables you to enjoy the beautiful view of sydney harbour from afar. It is definitely a good alternative to expensive night cruises. As I have purchased the multi-3 transportation pass, no additional cost is required as it is included in the transportation pass.As Sydney can be quiet at night, do plan this as 1 of your night activities while in Sydney.

Quick transit to Manly. There are two choices here - the regular commuter ferry, or a high speed option which leaves from pier 6 and does Circular Quay to Manly in 18mins. Nice harbour views en route, and lots of open deck space if you want to view from the open. Also a nice indoor cabin area to get out of the cool wind if needed. Prices are good value.

Iconic. A must do when in Sydney is to travel on the ferry's. It would have been better if there was some commentary on board, but I guess it is to get people to and from Manly and Sydney does have harbour cruises whereby you are informed about the bays etc.

Amazing views of the Opera House. Awesome views of the Sydney Opera House as you depart Circular Quay Ferry station towards Manly and then back from Manly. When leaving Circular Quay get a seat on the front or the right hand side of the Ferry to get the best views and photos of the Opera House from the Harbour. On the way back from Manly get on the left hand side of the ferry.

Rated the best ferry ride in Sydney Harbor. Easy, reasonable comfortable cruise the length of th eharbor. The village of Manly is touristy but fun. The beach surfing easily seen. Some tourists politely tip toed into the water, others plunged in and looked to be having fun. A beer at the wharf while waiting for the ferry capped a fun day trip.

Views of Sydney you'll never see from land!. It's a 30 minute ride to Manly (which has a number of great restaurants at the "wharf") and well worth the time. You'll see the Opera House from a totally different point of view and the skyline of Sydney (we returned after dark) was just beautiful from the ferry. Take advantage of the all inclusive public transport pass (bus-train-ferry) while in town, it saves you tons of money and is valid for all forms of transportation (including the Manly Ferry).
Great Afternoon Trip. Taking in the views from the ferry, walking along Manly Beach, having a beer at one of their bars and ferry back to the harbor; what a great way to spend part of the day.
Over crowded. The ferry itself was okay but being cooked up in the waiting area with 500 other passengers ruined the experience and they need to look at this very closely, it was most unpleasant!

Fun. We had a fantastic trip on the Ferry to Manly. The ride was beautiful and allowed you to see the harbor from the water which was amazing. Ferry was fun, fast and we truly loved every minute of it.
Wonderful ride. This was great as you get to see the scenic sights whilst traveling to Manly. Cheaper than going for the expensive cruise. The kids love it.

GREAT way to see the harbour. If you want to have a good look at the harbour without the cost of a tourist ticket on a charter just get the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and back. Or get one all the way to Paramatta. There is no commentary but the trip is great. If you are over 60 then you can get a pensioner ticket for $2-50 that covers all trips, all day!
Great trip. All the ferry trips are nice but this one is longer and quite scenic, very worth it, great views of the harbour, opera and sydney bridge

Fun Day Excursion From Sydney. The Manly Ferry handles their daily crowds with precision. The scenic views to Manly alone is worth the trip. Enjoyed visiting Manly for the day. Surfing lessons were taking place on Manly Beach for girls ranging in ages of what looked like to me 6 to 12 years old. It was amazing to watch.

Photo opportunities galore!. If you want a cheap way to get some amazing photos of Sydney Harbor, then take the ferry to Manly. As you exit Circular Quay and pass the Opera House, you see the entire harbor and bridge directly in front of you - with lots of time to take those amazing shots. Once in Manly, you walk directly up the main street where you can spend a few hours shopping and people watching (don't forget to go to the end of the street where the surf beach is found!).

A great inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbor.. There are a lot of cruise excursions offered for Sydney but the Manly ferry is a great inexpensive way to see if you want to see or spend more time or money on the harbor. We took it to Manly and were totally satisfied and we did not have to do any other boat excursions.
Relaxing Ride. For a leisurely ride up the bay and back this is ideal. We did not even get off in Manly. Great views all round – bridge, opera house etc.

SYDNEY HARBOUR TOUR. During a recent trip "down under" we wanted to take a tour of Sydney harbour, most trips cost around $75 but our receptionist at the hotel suggested we took the regular ferry to Manly Island which costs just $15. There are several advantages apart from the obvious financial saving, you travel on a larger boat, you see more of the harbour, you have a longer trip and the views are stunning and as a huge bonus you get a day on Manly which is a gem of a sea-side resort, then as the sun sets you get the return trip to see the sights all over again. What a winner, we saved $60 each and had a fabulous day out over and above the spectacular views of the harbour. ,

fun day on a ferry. have a fun day travelling to Manly on a ferry. plenty to see there. Have a beer at The Steyne or an icecream on the Corso. Better fun if there is a swell as the ferry passes by the heads!!!!

Great way to get to Manly!. This service was very prompt and reasonably priced. The safety briefing was reasuring and adequate. The views we got of the harbour were great and a smooth ride both ways was enjoyed by both of us.

Inexpensive harbor cruise. While there were crowds lined up for the ferry, everyone got on and got a seat. The ferry company handles crowds well, with several loading/unloading alternatives available based on the crowds. We got to see a quite a bit of the harbor and for a fraction of the cost of a harbor-specific cruise. The pedestrian walkway from the ferry terminal to the beach in Manly was exactly what you would expect from a beach culture--restaurants, shops, street musicians, ice cream stands, etc.--in a relaxed, low-key environment.
Different way to see sydney. If you are planning the perfect weekend in Sydney, this is a great activity. Catch the Manly ferry to Manly beach and grab lunch and a beer overlooking the ocean.
Fast and effective and a great way to hit Sydney. On time, fast, better than being in traffic. But bumpy through the heads - was unexpected and a little unnerving for a first time user!

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. Cheap, easy, very scenic and the best way to travel to Manly. Easy to find on circular quay with great access, and the enclosed harbour makes the trip very gentle. Only about 5 mins of the travel is near the heads where the swell can get up.

easy way of getting to Manly. The times I have used the ferry to do some sightseeing and some R & R I have thoroughly enjoyed the trip.Inside kept clean, good seating, and above all great views of opera house and the bridge from a different aspect. I do however think that the arrangement for letting people on or off the ferry should be a bit more user-friendly as now you seem to bump into people going in the opposite direction

Pleasant but cheap harbour cruise. The 30 minute trip to Manly is an excellent way to see Sydney from the water with the bonus of a visit Manly with its beach so getting some of the contrasts of Sydney and its surroundings.
Its a Sydney icon. Wonderful views of the harbour and the Sydney skyline and when you think of Sydney you think of the Manly ferry

A must do when in Sydney. Went to Manly on the regular ferry and the views on the way to Manly are excellent! The ferries are busy so make sure you get a good spot on the deck to get the best pictures.

Scenic harbour. 1/2 hour ride through Sydney Harbour to Manly - lots of boats and craft to look at on the water - nice restful way to see the city. Plenty of shops, bars etc when you get there. AUD$15 return
Manly Ferry. Public transport which runs smoothly, on time, and everyone is respectful and smiling - I like that! A beautiful way to see part of Sydney Harbour in the fresh air

must do!. Don't go to Sydney without doing a trip to Manly. Lovely experience, good atmosphere, european feel. Very enjoyable. On Sundays, cheap $2.50 ferry tickets all day, everywhere with one ticket.

Cheap way to get a Harbor Cruise. Skip paying for Captain Cook cruises and just take public transport. If you get a multi pass you can go on all the ferries and explore the entire harbor.Manly Ferry is hit or miss, you may need patience if the ferry fills up with people. My first day was some holiday and I had to wait 30-45 minutes for a second ferry to come (the first ferry was there, but filled up).The second time I went to Manly, we got on with no problem (a bunch of seats to spare).The Ferry system gives you two sessions of free Wifi a day (up to 45 minutes or 30mb) do not try on a full boat because chances are Wifi is probably overwhelmed already.Manly ferry does have a snack bar on board but you must spend $20 before you can use a credit card.

Great views of harbour and opera house. Go to Manly, lovely beach and boardwalk and the shops and restaurants all looked very good. Ferry was a lovely way to travel, very relaxing and great views across the harbour.

Nothing fancy!. $15USD round trip from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf. Spectacular views of the Opera House and bridge and harbour. An easy 30 min ride. Supposed to have free wifi on the boat, but it never worked.

A camera clicker. If you have some extra time, in Sydney , take a day and visit Manly. Manly ferry from circular Quay . It's a excellent way to see a totally different angle of the opera House and habour bridge. Try and come back to Circular in the early evening to catch the sunset and capture beautiful shot of the opera house. Manly is a quint and beautiful, please visit the beach and have a picnic, it's slight windy but beautiful . Beware of some vicious pigeons , who will fly off with your Lunch. The places to eat are plentiful , take time to stroll and enjoy Manly, the pace there is easy and much tone down after Sydney . There is also a museum small , but worth the visit.

Forget Bondi, go to Manly. As a first time visitor to Australia you read in all the tourist books about Bondi Beach, but once speaking to locals, they all advise to go to Manly. From the Sydney Harbour the Manly Ferry goes every 30 minutes and is very convenient. Manly beach is definitely worth to visit, after the freezing Europe felt like heaven.
Great photo opportunities. This is a great ferry service, wifi on board and a snack bar. This service beats some of harbour tours and Manly beach is wonderful.

Smooth waters. A terrific way to see the harbour, bridge and Opera house on a trip to Manly. The beach there was smooth and appealing, shops were interesting and eating places around were inviting, I would certainly make the trip again given the chance.

Don't sit outside at the front if its windy!. The ferry to many is really enjoyable as you get to see a lot of Sydney Harbour for not much money. If its really windy though, please be aware that as the ferry passes the gap to the open sea a sizeable sea swell comes in and the ferry ploughs straight into it. The people sat at the front outside got soaked as huge curtains of spray come over the bow. Some people panicked to try and get away and it was very close to a couple of elderly women falling over. On days like that sit at the back.
Great cheap way to see the harbour. Great way to see the harbour and the city. Manly itself is well worth a visit too. Lovely beach and lots of places to eat. Highly recommended
Always a treat. Always a great trip - fantastic views, sea air, little swell, always excellent crew and no fuss. A Sydney icon followed by fish and chips on Manly beach!
Day trippers. Busy busy busy but well worth the trip out to Manley beach on a good day we went twice first day was cold but second was well worth it.

An old Favourite. Great trip across to Manly and a very reasonable way to do it. We enjoyed the trip across and the whole process was very efficient. I would say that if you do want to sit outside then you have to get near the front of the queue when embarking otherwise you are restricted to staying inside. The views are great and the 30 minute trip gives you a great sense of the harbour and all the other little bays enroute to Manly. Worth the trip

It's just a ferry. Manley Ferry is the one we all hear about. We went to Manley for the day. The ferry takes about half an hour and is one of the larger ferries operating from The Rocks. It is busy so you need to be quick if you want an outside seat. It runs every half an hour. We went during the school holidays so the beach became very full by midday. The Ferry takes you to the rocky side of Manley. It is then a 10 minute walk through the town to get to the Manley beach. Nice beach but nothing epic.

great way to relax while your bed is being made. sit back and soak up the harbour, good price, great view and wonderful destinations at both ends. Big ferry so it is a nice stable ride across the harbour and Sydney Heads

Worth a visit. Great views from the ferry going to Manly. Takes about 40 minutes with the scenic route or 25 going direct. Nice shops and beach. Nice coffee shops to pop into and then sit on the promenade people watching.

best way to get to the beach. A harbour cruise from one end to the other and when you arrive you are at the beach. Lots of places to eat but the best one is takeaway looking at the beach or the harbour.

Best way to enjoy a day out in Sydney. Everyone should take a Manly Ferry when visiting Sydney. For the small ticket cost the experience is fantastic. You go right past the Opera House and Harbour Bridge, passing waterfront homes and yachts, Taronga Zoo in the distance, etc. Then have lunch somewhere on the Manly waterfront before returning back to Sydney.

Relaxing half day trip. Hopping on the Manly ferry provides a relaxed afternoon of browsing touristy Manly with its shops, bars, ice cream shops and eateries. We enjoyed Hemingway's just off the main drag, facing the surfing beach. Have a beer and watch the surfers -- a nice lazy afternoon. The ferry is a great way to see the harbor and offers some singular photo opportunities of the bridge, the opera house, the Circular Quay and the skyline. The cost is reasonable and it really does beat a tour boat. Recommended.

Better value than a harbour cruise. If you are visiting Sydney this is a great way yo see the harbour. Hop off for lunch in Manly then return to the city by bus or ferry. With each trip only taking 1/2hr it is also a great way to see Sydney harbour if your time is limited.
Great day trip. Manly is for the most part a tourist trap sort of place, lots of places to eat, stores for souvenirs, and artsy fartsy places with handmade objects.
Great way to see the Harbour. Taking the ferry to manly is the best way to see the harbour bridge and the sydney opera house. Amazing views of the bay all along the half an hour ride to manly.

Brilliant Views. We always enjoy going on the Manly Ferry when we visit Sydney as we have friends who live in Manly it's an easy way to go and see them. If you can go when it's not so busy and can get an outside seat then it is a really great trip. Why pay to go on an expensive harbour trip....There is lot's to see and do in Manly too. Coming back on a late ferry in the dark you also get a great view and often fireworks over the Opera House. Don't forget your camera.
No Better Way to get to Manly. If you're travelling to Manly, you must travel by the Sydney Ferries Manly Ferry. Its a fantastic experience and cheap.

Great Half-Day Trip. In addition to a great ferry ride, Manly is a delightful destination with a two block pedestrian plaza that leads to Manly Beach – a great surfing beach. We enjoyed the stroll through the shops and then just sat and watched the ocean with several after school groups learning sailing and surfing.

Best way to see the Habor Bridge and Opera house. Don't have to pay a fortune like on the harbor tours. Cheap and the Manly is also quite beautiful. The best is to sit on the back of the ferry so can see the magnificent view.
Best cheap trip. best way to see the harbour and you can stop off for a meal at 1/2 time. The ferry is a lazy way to view the harbour.

Cheapest and best way to see Sydney Harbour. I'm an expat Sydneysider, have lived elsewhere for the past 11 years, but I always enjoy a ride on the Manly Ferry. The last time I travelled I bought a MyMulti day pass for $22 which allowed me unlimited travel on public transport throughout the Sydney metropolitan area. The only transport that attracts an extra fee is the Fast Ferry service and the airport railway stations,, where you must pay a surcharge at the gate. It represents great value for money; I travelled from the western suburbs by bus, train to my hotel, to and from Manly on the ferry and then to the airport by train.The Manly Ferry evokes wonderful childhood memories for me, and I still consider it to be the cheapest and best way to see the Harbour.

What a ride. The afternoon we took the ferry was gorgeous but at night when we came back it was quite windy and the waves were very high. Obviously you can sit inside if you want but we prefered staying out on the deck we got tossed on every side possible we got soaking wet and we laughed our heads off. It was quite an expérience as we were catching the different views of Sydney harbour.
Lovely trip. Loved the trip. Manly has a 2 great beaches plus a scenic walk around Federation point. Fish restaurant a bit disappointing

Great Ferry journeys of the World. You know how they talk about the great rail journeys; Orient Express; the Ghan, etc. After taking the ferry to Manly I reckon their should be a list for the Great Ferry Boat Journeys of the World. This would be on it. The harbour is clear, clean, beautiful and breathtaking. I found out they have a citizen's group call Friends of Sydney Harbour who keep an eagle eye on the maintenance of the beauty of this Harbour. Guys, job really well done.
Great water service. easy to catch, on time a fun ride with amazing views of the harbour and to view the shore line from the boat fantastic.
Great Ferry Ride. We took the ferry to spend some time at Manly Beach and it was convenient, clean, and a nice afternoon ride and the return evening ride was very relaxing.

Quick access to Manley Beach. Esay access and average price to get around from Sydney to Manley Beach and the surrounding town of Manley. Worth a trip on the ferry many sailboats out in the harbour to watch and enjoy. When returning to Sydney from Manley via the ferry there are many opportunities to take photos of the Opera House and Sydney Bridge and other areas surrounding Sydney.

Brill. Spent a wonderful few hours in Manly, walked on the beach and did a bit of shopping, the ferry was a great way to travel, frequent crossings, really good value using the Sydney travel card system, a must !!
Great way tovwaste an hour. Scenic, great views of the bridge and the opera house, beautiful surf beach at Manlly, nice eateries in Manley and in the ferry arcade.

Enjoy the Ride. Taking the Manly Ferry is something I love to do each time I visit Sydney. It is a fun way to get to Manly Beach for a swim. Get there early so you can get a good seat for photos. There is some good shopping at Manly Beach.
Fast and clean. Had wonderful rides on the Manley ferry. It was clean and fast and even had Wi-Fi on board. Great way to travel to the beach.

See the harbour, see the sea. The best and cheapest way to see Sydney harbour is to jump on a ferry. For AU$7 you get an amazing view of the Opera House, the bridge, Fort Denison and the wonderful array of coves and bays that one passes you make your way past the heads to Manly.

Manly Ferry. The views were awesome and its a good way to get a feel for where things are along the harbour. Manly itself - not a great deal to do. Had fish and chips on the beach and watched the Manly Surf Club crew do their ski training. Not much else.

Great Value for the Tourist. The Ferry runs between Circular Quay and Manly - 30 min trip - runs every 30 mins - used by the locals as a way to get to and from work - by tourists to see the harbor and the city lights.The tourists gather at the 2 ends of the ferry - the locals take the comfortable seats in the middle - without the views - when u have seen it a hundred times !.Manly beach - 2 mins from Ferry terminal - is a surfing / volley ball zone - with a pleasant promenade for the slow walk, Poirot style.Visiting Sydney - put the Manly Ferry on your list. $14 return per person.

A lovely trip. Manly is a lovely place to visit - nice shops, a sheltered beach and a windier one for surfing. There are lots of backpackers here. The ferry trip is relaxing and takes 30 minutes. The ferries run from Circular Quay every half hour and you get good views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House from on board.

A must. Every visitor to Sydney should take the Manly ferry. Cheap and some of the best views in the world. Sit back and relax and when you get to Manly wander down the corso and enjoy fish and chips on the beach.

Manly Ferry. Manly beach was great. Definitely a surfing spot. I tasted the water and it was not very salty, which surprised me. I've traveled other places on the Pacific Ocean/Atlantic Ocean that were pretty salty. I guess being close to the Antartica makes a difference with the ice melt.
Very nice beach and village to walk. We did this beach via the very from Circular Quai in a direct connection. Very nice beach with surfers. Nice reastaurants for lunch and a lot of shops to see.

Sat up front.. got WET!. Yes, they did announce that you will get wet if you sit outside, facing the oncoming waves. Truth - more like totally soaked! Luckily it was warm and added to the adventure. I was by myself killing time on a layover to NZ... took the ferry on recommendation from someone in the harbor. The ferry was very easy to access, time table was clear, process was effortless and it drops you off right in front of a tourist info booth that gave me plenty of advice for short and long term visits. I will gladly take the ferry again when the weather is nicer and spend the day at Manly. The beach was closed due to currents/waves the day I visited. It took me a little over two hours to take the ferry, walk to Manly Beach, do a little shopping, grab a refreshment and return the the harbor. Perfect!

Cheap Harbour Cruise. For a fraction of the cost of a private cruise, you get to see most of the big sights on the harbour (Opera House, Bridge, Islands etc.) but of course without the commentary. In addition you get to spend time in Manly to dine in one of the many eateries, visit the shops or Sunday market, or take in the beaches.

lovely trip. the trip was a bit pricey but a lovely trip over to manly, it was nice to be able to buy food and drink on the boat and to be able to sit on the outside or inside but if you want an outside seat make sure you get there early
Nothing much. Take a ferry to Manly beach ,it is about 45 minutes,you can see nice coast line,and I feel nothing special except for coast line.

Cheapest cruise of the Harbour.. I'm a local to Manly so I don't get too excited by the ferry as it is used as a form of public transport. However if I was a visitor to Sydney and it was a great day this would be on my to do list. Find the cafe called Barefoot and have a coffee and waffle...both the best in Sydney!!

Great views to a wonderful beach. Take this ferry to Manly for great views of the Opera House, Bridge and the beauty of Sydney Harbour. The ferry takes about 30 minutes. Try to get a seat at the front or back to appreciate the harbour at its best

Must do while in Sydney !. Money well spent! Took the ferry to Manly mid afternoon to visit Manly beach. Great ferry ride but the best part is taking it back at sundown to get spectacular views of Sydney harbour. What a view ! The sun sets behind harbour bridge, the lights are on, sky was red it was simply magical. Highly recommend, even if just for the ferry ride alone.
Free wi-fi. Wifi was appreciated during the 30 min ferry ride. We got the all week bus pass and ferry rides are covered too.

Sit outside and soak up life!. Fantastic way to see Sydney Harbour and head over to Manly. Get there early during the busy times to make sure you can get a spot outside. Great way to soak up the lifestyles on the harbour! Of corse Manly was a delight....lots of people watching to do.

Great way to tour the Harbour. This ferry ride gives you great views of tSydney and the heads leading into the Harbour.Great views of the CBD on the way back.We combined this return trip with a second ferry to Watson's bay and lunch at Doyles.

Manly Ferry Ride. Took the fast ferry to Manly from Circular Quay and the old-style ferry on the return trip. Must say I prefer the old one. So much more character, and not that slow. Good, economical way to see the beautiful harbour and Opera House. Walked to the Manly shops (not far) and then down the the main beach, which was lovely. Liked the cosmopolitan feel of the Manly shopping strip on our walk to the surf beach. A trip well worth doing if you wish to see a bit of the Harbour and Sydney.
Easy day out!!. Great ferry ride at reasonable price, to pleasant town and wonderful beach -- lots of good restaurants. What more could want on a sunny day.
a nice ride to Manly. Its a nice 20 min ride to Manly with some beautiful views of Opera house and Harbor Bridge as well as the Sydney Cbd. Worth the money.
Nice ride. Was not as fast as the "fast ferry", but a pleasant trip. Manly was fun to walk around. Good little shops and less touristy.
Reliable transport. The ferries are so regular and reliable a great way to travel and spend time on Manly beach and if you are lucky like we were see dolphins.

Beautiful. Taking only 30 minutes to get to Manly, this boat trip it worth it! One of the times I took this trip we saw dolphins swimming beside the boat. I would recommend taking the boat trip back from Manly back to Circular Quay at sunset to see the beautiful colours of the sky behind a breathtaking view of Sydney's skyline.
Take a day trip to manly. A very pleasant trip to do. Wander round manly Corso and to the beach. have lunch at the pup on the pier. Good food. Family friendly

Convenient and nice boat trip. We took the ferry to go to Manly beach from Sydney and it is a nice boat trip in the bay which is not very expensive. Also we never waited for the ferry so it is quite easy and quick!
View of the Harbour. Everyone should take a trip to Manly on the Ferry, a stunning trip and a fun destination which doesn't take too long.

Best ferry in Sydney. For Aus $14.40 return from Circular Quay this is the best sightseeing "cruise" you can do. Very good value for money, clean and efficient. Even has free WiFi for the locals who have grown tired of the views!

Cheap transport on one of the worlds best harbours.. This is a greatway to see the harbours well as a cheap and quick way to get to Manly. There is a snack bar on board and now the ferries have free wi-fi. Brilliant!
Great way to see sydney. The ferry is a great way to see the sights of Sydney and check out Manly which has a beautiful beach or 2. I recommend it to everyone that goesto Sydney

Good trip. This is a fairly standard ferry service well run and punctual. The facilities are pretty standard for a journey of this type and in many ways is exactly what you want from this type of ferry a reasonably comfortable seat and a safe arrival.

Lovely evening in Manley. Took the ferry to Manley at tea time after spending the day at Tarango Zoo. Lovely views on the ferry over. Walked along the beach and then round shops in Manley then had delicious fish and chips. Took the ferry back late evening and had wonderful views of the Opera House and the Bridge and Sydney skyline. Definitely worth a visit.

Nice day out!. It's a lovely day out to Manly including getting the ferry, you have great views of sydney opera house and the bridge on the ferry. Also great views of the eastern beaches , rose bay, camp cove and watsons bay!

$14,40 for a return ticket to Manly: what a cruise!. Business trip in Sydney. What to do for a short free time? Take the ferry to Manly (departure every 30 minutes or so). Thanks to this short cruise, you get a fantastic view on the harbour, the Opera house, the bridge and the bay. You can't ask for a better value for money for time spend to discover the nice spots of Sydney. Sit on the right side when you leave Sydney harbour so you have a premium view on the opera. Then in Manly, I suggest you rent a bike!

Easy commute. Manly Ferry is very scenic! If not raining, sit out front. Once in Manly, there are a number of coastal and National Park walks if you're interested in working off your breakfast/lunch at one of the many great places in Manly

Excellent harbour views. I got some fantastic photos of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House from the Manly ferry. The ferry itself was clean, efficient, on time and reasonably priced. The lady in the tourist information office told us how to get to the beach and we enjoyed a good day out. The beach is very clean. We had a great fish and chips lunch, freshly cooked to order.

A Great Experience. A Ride on the Manly Ferry is one of Sydney's most affordable and most enjoyable day trips. The scenery along the water fron suburbs is spectacular. There are two chouices in ferries, the traditional old style ferries and the more modern high speed catamarans. Opt for the older, large ferries which were sailed to Sydney from the UK in what must have been a truly remarkable voyage. Our most recent experience was on a sunny but blustery day which provided some thrills as the ferru tackled the high swells rolling in through the heads. Quite exciting!Manly is both a desireable residential area and a very popular tourist detination. A walk through the Corso, the outdoor shopping strip that links the harbour to the Pacific Ocean beaches, is most enjoyable. There is ample shopping and a great variety of food choices, including excellent fish and chipos which just seem to to taste better when eaten on a bench facing the ocean.

A must do. Really enjoyed my trip to Manly on the ferry. The views of the harbour including the bridge and opera house were out of this world. Really makes you realise you are actually the other side of the world.Once in Manly walk straight to the beach and take a stroll left. On your way back stop off in one of the bars looking over the beach
Pumpy scenic ride. Travelled to Manly with a sunday funday family ticket, cheaply. Weather was windy and in the middle of the route it was rather wavy but views were beautiful.

Cheap harbour cruise. $9.80 for a 25 minute harbour cruise, brilliant value, sit on the outside deck and swap sides for the return trip ( the ferries are double ended) you can even get a coffee and snacks on board, a must do

A great way to see Sydney Heads. I love this ferry ride, it takes about 45 minutes and goes past the Sydney Heads which can be a bit rough but lots of fun, Manly is pretty and has a walk around the foreshore. There is also a longer walk which takes you to the old Quarantine Station and takes about 3 hours.
Cheap seats to the best ride in the World. They don't have anything like this in Rio! Public transport at its best. may not be comfortable but what a view.
Great beach. Took the fast ferry which leaves Circular Quay and goes direct to Manly. Neat little beach town with good beach for the kids.

Ferry ride to Manly. As advertised, this ferry ride is an excellent way to tour the harbor and we enjoyed the half-day in Manly as well: very nice beach, lots of fish-and-chips and ice cream options along the concourse on the walk from the ferry terminal to the beach as well.

Beautiful Boat Ride. A great trip to see the harbor and to have lunch at Manly. There really isn't much to do a Manly Beach, but the boat trip and lunch are really worth while. A must do for your itinerary. Def make sure it's a sunny day
Just Fun. If getting there is half the fun, the Manly Ferry fits the bill. Clean, efficient and on time. And Manly is worth the trip. The beach and the town are fun in a tourisy kind of way.
Best way to see the harbour. Always a great part of going to Sydney. A good trip although Manly is really only worth a quick look and some lunch.
And Timeless Icon. Whilst a timeless icon they do not miss you on the price. Certainly no Hong Kong. A must do in Sydney and enjoyable nonetheless.

A must. Okay its a ferry, so? If you don't do this and go Manley when you visit Sydney, then it's your loss. Firstly it travels through part of the harbour and the alternative views of the Opera House, and the sun setting over the Bridge on your return ...... Manley is always worth a visit for it beach, coffee shops etc. Don't forget your hat and sunscreen though.
Easy transportation. Quick way to get to Manly. Best to buy round trip tickets. Usually run about every 30 to 40 minutes. Fine as ferries go- nothing special other than basic transportation.

A life on the ocean wave!. Lovely relaxing boat trip of about 1/2 hours duration out from Circular Quay in Sydney Harbour to the lovely Manly beach which offers great bathing and relaxtion and a good range of shops as well as some eating places.
Most ferries have free wifi connectivity.
manly ferry. ferry was good.bit old and rusty but sea worthy,ran on time and came regular,got passagners on and off quickly an dsafely

Good trip. The ferry takes around 30 minutes to get from Sydney to Manly, HINT if you sit at the rear as you leave you get some stunning pictures of the Opera House and bridge on the way back everyone try's to sit at the front for the same picture opportunity.Manly beach is huge, sandy and there are a variety of shops, worth a visit.Ferry runs every half hour
Great service. Fantastic service to get to the beach, better to get a return journey ticket, the ferry goes all the time. took about 20mins.

The iconic Manly Ferry is a must do when in Sydney. If you are in Sydney for only a few days then do try and take the ferry over to Manly The Manly ferries go from jetty three at Circular Quay - you can easily identify them as they are considerably larger than the others. There are four of them that trundle over to Manly every day - Narrabeen, Collaroy, Freshwater and Queenscliff - all named after well known Northern Sydney beaches.Each can take up to 1100 passengers and if you are observant you can see the passenger counters by the ticket check machines at Circular Quay and Manly and they indicate how many spaces are left on the vessel -quite intriguing watching them click over. The ferries predictably can be very busy at weekends during the Christmas holidays/January. In the main they run every half hour and the crossing takes about half an hour.On occasions it can get a bit 'choppy' as the ferry crosses the Gap - an area of open sea away to the right as you start to approach Manly wharf. The boat can toss a bit if it is rough but this part of the journey is only say three minutes.If you are in Sydney for a few days and propose to use public transport do consider getting a My Multi weekly ticket which are $44 for Zone 1 - this covers all the local trains, ferries and buses but NOT the trains out to the airport. It is so much easier having the one ticket without having to buy one each time.The Manly Ferry is one of the iconic 'things to do' in Sydney and offers great views there and back.

Great day trip. Yes what a day out!! Word of advice find out the time of the ferry which suits you best and get there early for a good position on the quay so when boarding youre at the front of the queue that way you'll get the best seats especially if you want to take loads of pictures of all the scenes on the way there and back.Also this ferry boards on 2 levels when leaving Manly so be on the upper level if you want a good seat on the upper deck. You boards from lower deck on the way out.

worth the trip. We took the ferry to Manly. They have some nice beaches. We rented bikes and had a great time. Go to the south lookout for a fantastic view of the harbor. Lunch at the brewpub was very good.

Have to do it. We took the ferry one sunny afternoon over to Manly and i got all my best pictures this day. You ride right past the opera house and harbour bridge and with the sun in the sky and the beautiful blue waters below, the photos i got were absolutely outstanding. Manly is a really cool place and we chilled on the beach watching the surfers. So cool.

Saturday in Manly. The ferry ride is great in nice weather with views of the unbeatable Sydney Harbor. Manly was packed, but walking along the beach and around the town were both pleasant and relaxing.
Wonderful views on Sydney!. I didn't spend too much time at Manly itself, but really enjoyed the ferry ride back and forth. Wonderful views of Sydney and it's surrounding areas!
Packed, great value. Was there on a public holiday. Manly is always busy, and the nicest way to get there is by ferry. Good views of the City, bridge and Opera House, all for little money.
A beautiful way to get about. Commuters might take the ferry trip for granted, but if you go for a day out from Manly to the city and back on a lovely sunny day and balmy night, it is gorgeous.

Round trip by ferry. An inexpensive round Sydney harbour trip.the boat takes you from Darling Harbour / Circular Quays out to Manley past the opera house and the Heads. A great way to see the shoreside.

A great way to see the sights!. I am sure the Manly ferry needs no introduction as every guide book will tell you to do this... However they are right to do so! It is a great little tour - reasonably priced with regular departures. Going in & out of Circular Quay offers some great photo opportunities of the iconic Sydney landmarks. Manly itself is a lovely little suburb with fabulous beaches & great coastal walks. The tourist information centre just outside the terminal was very helpful with maps of the area & suggested itineraries. We had too much to cram in our holiday but I wish there had been more time to spend in Manly.

practical and centrally located. gorgeous views of a great city !. you can take the ferry from circular quay, metro station and every 30 min you have a conncetion to gorgeous manly beach ! boats a little bit dated but friendly crew and sometimes even wifi working:)fantastic views of harbour and opera house on the trip !get a tourist pass for 12 us a day and all ferries and buses etc are include. i guess a simple return ticket is already 18 us !!! so get the pass !
Must Do. If you are in Sydney for 7 days buy a "Multi Pass" was $A42.and covers all buses and ferries.We did the trip at least 8 times saving a fortune
Lovely crossing. Slow but steady crossing to a beautiful beach, see all the sights on the way. Why pay more for private tours? Staff were wonderful.thank you.
Took this all over. What can you say about a ferry service except it worked as expected and gets you where you want to go.

A Sydney must do. The Manly ferry is a great way to experience Sydney harbour and get some good photos of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Try and get an outside seat on the upper deck and sit at the Circular Quay end. The ferry is symmetrical so there is no need to worry that you'll sit at at one end and suddenly find the boat's swung 180 degrees and you miss all the sights. Sit back, relax and enjoy!

Superb way to see the harbour and get to Manly too. This takes about 30 minutes each way and offers unbeatable views all around Sydney Harbour including the Bridge and the Opera House. It runs half hourly from Circular Quay and is not at all bad value at AUS$14.40 return. On a sunny day, with the breeze off the water, just being on the boat itself is a delight, never mind the views and where you're going. This is a "must-do" for the visitor to Sydney.

Great ride!. Just get a ticket down at the quay and off we went. The trip to Manly was great the views of the houses on the harbor are amazing and when we arrived at Manly we had a great time the rest of the day and then had a nice early evening trip back to the quay
great way to view the harbour. would def recommend taking the ferry from sydney to manly for a day - really enjoyed the trip and amazing photo opps

Great service as always!. Once again the Manly ferry service proved to be both reliable and great value for money! We brought a day travel ticket which is $22 and you can use it an unlimited amount of times during that day. It is well worth buying if your thinking of doing more than one trip. The ferry also offers some of the best views of the city and its surrounding areas there are some awesome photograph oppourtunities. We enjoyed our trip over to Manly so much in the day we went back on the evening ferry, what amazing views the city at night really did look amazing. Forget paying for sightseeing tours of the habour this ferry gives you just as good views of Sydney.

Relaxed way to get to Manly. Only negative of the ferry is the cost. Otherwise a lovely journey to Manly where we walked to the beach and around the headland to a cafe. We spotted 3 large waterdragons on the way!

Take the trip. The Manly ferry is a Sydney institution, it serves daily commuters and tourists alike, great value and a wonderful way to see Sydney Harbor, The Heads and Manly, great views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, the trip takes about 30 minutes each way.

Relaxing trip. Sit back and enjoy the short half hour or so to Manly to see another quieter side of Sydney. Excellent views of the opera house and the bridge. Take in views to shark bay and others coastal sites. All the usual services on board. Quick and efficient.

If your in Sydney go to Manly!. We took a trip to manly by ferry on our first day in Sydney and would highly recommend it! The ferry ride over gives you great views especially on the ride back in the evening when the skyline is lit up. Lots of shops and restaurants to visit on the beach front. We stopped in Manly Bar and Grill an had a lovely meal there whilst watching the sunset!

Forget Expensive Boat Trips. The ferry to Manly leaves regularly from Circular Quay, its definately the best way to see the Harbour passing the Opera House on the way.Its great value for money, with the added bonus of a visit to Manly too which I would definately recommend

Manly. Best value ferry from Circular Quay. Time your trip to return at sunset to get excellent views off the bridge. Reasonable Cafe service on board. Great scenery throughout the trip including The Heads.
Excellent. What a great way to take a trip on the Harbour. Friendly staff, ticketing easy and well organized. Beautiful walk along the beach front. What a very pleasant way to spend an afternoon.

The only way to Travel. The manly Ferry is one of the best ferry trips in the world. Starting from Manly you are aiming for the Heads with the chance of seeing Dolphins; then you head towards Sydney proper and the Bridge, the Opera House and thenCBD all come into view! Magnificent. Some get to do this as a daily commute; envious!
A Must!. Don't leave Sydney without taking the Manly Ferry - especially on a good day. Fish n chips on the beach (watch out for the hungry seagulls).

Local Showing overseas visitors. First day of entertaining our overseas family. Showed them how to catch a train to Circular Quay and how east it was to find and board the Manly ferry. On the trip we were able to show them where Taronga Zoo was, Watsons bay and other significant spots on the harbour. The ferry runs regularly and at a leisurely pace. It is easy to get on and off with family or disabled.Everyone knows about walking to the ocean beach at Manly which I think,(as a local) a must see.The Manly ferry is clean comfortable and spacious so, go for it ! Maurice B
Well Worth Doing. Great trip through the harbor, however Manly a little over ratedStill worth doing much better than wasting time at Bondi

Take the ferry to Manly. 30 minutes from Circular Quay by ferry to Manly, walk down the Corso to the beach and enjoy the surfers.Well worth it and for the ferry ride from the Heads to the Harbour Bridge.

Fun and relaxing for all!. Staff have ways been friendly and helpful especailly when we've had a pram with us or needed extra assistance.A ferry ride is great for the young and young at heart!! You dont need a reason or anywhere in particular to go, just jump on, sit back and relax!

Cheap Cruise. We love this ferry ride as it is like an ocean cruise for a fraction of the price. Get to the wharf early so you get an outside sea and the views as you travel really are second to none.

Beautiful Beach. Fantastic beach - rental of chairs/umbrellas/water sports equipment available - nice restaurants/shops - benches, changing rooms. Great hiking trail up to old fort, very informative folks at the fort, be sure to stop at the center. Info center at pier is great, good maps, friendly staff, bus stop next to it - bicycle rental also available. Great day or half day trip from Sydney.

Nice day out. Taking the Manly Ferry out to Manly and spending a day there is a great day out. Spend some time on the Manly Beach, have lunch in one of the outside cafes, a bit of shopping maybe...Manly is a lively area, well worth visiting when in Sydney.

Taking a ferry to Toronga Zoo at the Manly Ferry is real neat.. The Manly Ferry provides travelers the comfort of easy travel from one point to another. The ferry is clean, spacious and one can hear instructions from inside the ferry telling you of the sights you're passing by. We were even able to see some dolphins. We took the ferry bound for Toronga Zoo.
Must do. Manly is pretty close, and this Ferry is great. You get a great trip over there, and Manly will not disappoint. I would definitely take this Ferry and recommend it to anyone.
Great way to get to Many. But there are nicer ferries IMHO. Smaller ones are preferred, But if one is going to Manly a great ride.

Classic half hour trip from Circular Quay to Manly. This is another "must do" if hosting guests from out of town. For those visiting Manly for the first time, remember: Manly Beach is NOT the beach that you see immediately as you exit the ferry wharf, you'll need to walk along the pavement for about 5 mins before you get there! Just follow the throng of people. :)

A must do for everyone.. There is the legendary Star Ferry in Hong Kong and the equally fantastic Manly Ferry. Manly ferry costs more but is a longer trip, with better facilities. Plus at one end you have some of the best beaches in the world and inbetween the best harbour and views in the world. This is the best and cheapest way to see the best side of Sydney. When you get back to Circular Quay, jump on the Parramatta or homebush ferry for another great view of the western end of the harbour. There is not a better way to spend the day in Sydney, than cruising the harbour on cheap public transport. Maybe get a day pass even.Pack your camera.

Get your cameras ready. The Manly Ferry is a good way to get some nice pics of the city. You get a great angle on the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Also, if you're on the Manly Ferry, it means you're heading to Manly, and that is only a good thing.Ferries come about every 20 mins or so during the day and towards the evening they come about every hour with the last one after midnight. The tickets are $14.40 for a return. If you're going to be travelling a lot it works out well yo get a "my multi" ticket for $44 for the week. That'll get you unlimited bus, train and ferry around the city.

Superb!. All I can say about the Manly Ferry is, if you are a visitor 'just do it'! Don't be put off if the sea is a little rough, just don't sit outside or you'll get wet. On second thoughts, isn't that half the fun?

Cheap seat in Sydney Harbor. Sure, you won't get wine and a running audio commentary, but in an expensive city like Sydney, it's a great way to see the harbor on a budget.The ride is short (25-minutes) and the beach is charming. Leave on an 830-930AM ferry, beat the crowd (and the heat) to the beach, have lunch in downtown Manly and take the ferry back after lunch. A perfect half-day excursion.
Beautiful scenic trip. It was a lovely way to spend 40 mins, beautiful scenery, try and get a seat outside, breezy but worth it for the photographs alone

Great trip over to Manly. The ferry was really good value - very busy on the Sunday we travelled but everything was really well organised. Great mix of visitors and Sydneysiders onthe ferries adding to the atmosphere. Enjoyed strolling through Manly. Took in the scenic walk around North Head via a few cold drinks in the bars before heading back arounf to Manly for an evening meal. Caught a later ferry back so that we could arrive back in Sydney harbour with the bridge and Opera house all lit up. A truly relaxing day.

Nice relaxing way to see part of Sydney Harbour. Ferry was clean and a nice way to see the harbour. Ferries run frequently so you did not have a long wait. Comfortable seats but could not get the free wifi to work.
Ferry from Darling Harbour to Manly. We purchased a day ticket for $22.00 and this allowed us to travel on the Ferries, Buses and Trains for the day. Great Value

Its public transport and harbour cruise all in one. I've always loved the Manly ferry. Sure, it takes it time chugging across the harbour, but on most days it also offers fantastic views of the finest harbour in the world. It is definately up there in my top ten ferry rides of the world!

No need to book a separate Sydney harbor tour.... I've done paid "touristy" tours of the harbor, but you can enjoy most of the same views on the ferry, while also actually going somewhere! Manly is a great place to visit anyway, so why not save yourself some cash and time by using the ferry as your scenic harbor tour!

If you don't need a running commentary. You want the harbour views - Harbour Bridge, Sydney Opera House, Fort Denison and all - but at a reasonable price. Forget the cruises if you have a good guide book with you. These ferries cost a fraction of the prices for cruises. They also leave much more often than the cruises. Only problem is outdoor seating - it's limited and you have to rush for it. There is plenty of indoor seating but you clearly don't see as much then.The ferries leave on the dot and it's all very efficient. You don't have to stay at Manly unless you like the beach.

Best Way to See the Harbour on a budget. Don't get a tour of the harbour - get the Manly ferry instead and get outstanding views of the bridge, opera house, harbour, north head and more. Get off the Ferry and enjoy Manly for the day and then get the ferry home. Its a 30 min ride and you won't be disappointed! Its about $7 each way. The Manly ferry is a northern beaches institution and the best way to travel there.

UK or Australia??. For those of you who watch the TV programme in the UK the trip to Manly gives you an insight to life in Australia as opposed to the UK.Travelled on a sunny Sunday morning on a very busy but not too crowded ferry with lots of out of city Australians together with overseas visitors. Nice weekend atmosphere.On arriving at the terminal walked through food areas and wide open shopping mall. Again a festive atmosphere prevailed.When arriving at the beach after a 5 minute walk met up with young expats who have just moved from UK dressed in their wet suits and carrying their surf boards. This is the way to spend a weekend.UK or Austalia in November ?Visit and make your choice.

A Sydney Harbour experience. This is an iconic Sydney experience which you never tire of.. You leave Circular Quay with the Harbour Bridge on one side and the Sydney Opera House on the other. You see many of the landmarks around the Harbour including Admiralty House (Sydney residence of the Australian Governor General), Kirribilli House (Sydney residence of the Australian Prime Minister), Fort Denison (also known as Pinchgut Island), the beautiful National Parks which surround the Harbour and you cross the Heads.The shops at Manley are enjoyable to browse and it's not too far to swim at the Manly surf beach.It's a great experience for a very modest price.

Great Little Trip Across the Harbour. I've never been in a place with so many ferries! It's a great way to see the various coves and communities around Sydney, and the Manly Ferry is one of the best. Right on schedule and offering great views as well as free Internet on the upper level. I strongly encourage purchasing a one-week transit ticket. It'll get you on all the ferries, trains and public buses, and will pay for itself even if you're not in Sydney for a full week.
Lovely trip. Great way to see around the Sydney harbour area and to take in the beaches and sights of Manly. Really quite good value for money especially if you purchase an all day ticket.

A thousand miles from care. This has to be one of the best value tourist things to do in Sydney, for the cost of a return ticket a trip on the Harbour and someplace a bit different to explore at the other end.
Rough ride. Absolutely loved the ferry ride to manly and fell in love with manly what a cute little seaside town!

Definitely a must do thing!!!!. As well as viewing the Opera House or climbing the Harbour Bridge one of the other must do things is to take the ferry to Manly as it affords you the best views of both (and the CBD) as well as a trip to one of the best beaches. As previously mentioned it is a bit hectic at weekends (as can be expected) so get your tickets prior to lining up.Plenty of great photo opportunities so make sure you're up top to capture the sights of Sydney.
MANLY FERRY. Gives one a wonderful opportunity to enjoy our magnificent harbour on the ride from Circular Quay to Manly.

Lovely way to spend 75 mins. I always try to find the time to go on the round trip to Manly . Such a great way to have a little rest form racing around the shops etc.When you get off after 75 mins you are ready to hit the trail again!If you have time take the opportunitty to get off and wander down to the corso/beach and explore shops,coffee shops or the beach

Don't Miss It.. On a recent visit to Australia our family stayed in Manly Beach and rode this scenic ferry many times to Sydney and the Circular Quay and back. The Manly Ferry runs approximately every 25 minutes and I highly recommend it as a relaxing and inexpensive way to see some of Australia’s most spectacular scenery as well as some of the world famous icons of Sydney; the Harbour, the Opera House, the world’s fifth longest spanning-arch bridge, and the Tasman Sea. Once in the picturesque village of Manly, there are some excellent restaurants, book shops, and outstanding beaches. The Manly Ferry was one of the highlights of our 2 month visit to Australia.

A Harbour Trip. Manly is a good destination but the journey there on the ferry is worth doing in its own right. While on the ferry there are very good views of the Bridge and Opera House. We were also able to watch dinghies racing while we crossed the water. We had to return late afternoon but apparently if you leave it till dusk there you benefit from seeing Sydney all lit up.

Bit of a human zoo on weekends, so be prepared!. The Manly ferry holds 900 passengers - midday through early evening it runs at capacity. Buy your tickets in advance to be assured of getting through the turnstiles!

A trip on the Manly Ferry, a family heritage. My parents took me as a child, I took my parents well into their 80's and now I've taken all my 5 grandchildren. A family tradition not to be missed, time and time again.
A great day at he beach. Only a 30 minute ferry ride to another world. Beautiful beach with lots of beach front restaurants and walks along the coastline

Great Views of Sydney. Most of the ferries I have been on in Sydney go the other way...this one heads north to manly giving you a different view of the harbour. Well worth a trip and manly beach is beautiful. Had the weather been better the day we went we would have spent more time on the beach. Lots of shops and you certainly won't starve!

A better trip than one to Bondi. The trip to Manly is by Ferry, you get to see the beautiful Sydney Harbour and Manly has plenty to offer - the beach, the Corso, somme great restaurants, the walk to Cabbage Tree Bay Headland and lookout. Whereas the trip to Bondi is by bus along boring roads and in reality the beach is the only thing on offer when you get there; yes it's a stunning beach, but as a day out the trip to Manly is a much better option if you had to pick only one.

Fun in the surf and sun. .. Don't miss a fun ferry ride to Manly. .. see the amazing surf roll in and stroll along the boardwalk and quaint shops. It is a nice break from big city- Sydney. . it's laid back, friendly and the lunch we had there was delicious. . .perfect day trip. .. don't miss it.

Scenic sidetrip with great views. For a half-day visit, the Manly Ferry offers a spectacular harbor view and short, half hour ride to the lovely coastal nieghborhood of Manly. Once there you can stroll along the Corso, full of local shops and restaurants, or hang out on a long, warm sandy beach. Regural ferry departues mean you can take this trip at almost any time of day, but ferries also function as commuter service, so mind the early and later departures...

Didn't know what to expect. We didn't know what to expect during the ferry ride and when we got to the other side. Manly was definitely more than we set our sites for. The sites were amazing and the beaches pristine. We took the trek over to Shelly Beach and took lots of photos. This was by far one of the major highlights during our trip. Totally unexpected.

Save some money!. We took a Harbor Tour last time in Sydney and it cost close to $50 each. This time we took the Manly Ferry for only $2.50 round trip (Senior rate). It's a great way to see the city from the water. There's no narrative, so if you want that, you'll have to take a Harbor Tour. We had a superb lunch in one of the local pubs. Manly Beach is a very nice place, especially for the younger set.

Manly Ferry. It's the best way to view the Opera House in my opinion, and the view in both directions is great. Maybe go to Manly for the sun in the afternoon & the beaches, and travel back later to see the city lit up. There is a good restaurant right by the Ferry port (Manly Wharf Hotel) - some food is typical Sydney price (i.e. high but not unusually so) but their daily specials are good value (e.g. Monday is Fish & Chips with a beer or wine for $16).The Ferry itself is punctual & well organised also has free wifi so you can post all those pictures straight onto Facebook!It is, well, a ferry, but the boat itself is not important it's the view.If you live in NSW and have kids then do it on a Sunday and use City Rail Family Funday tickets - then it's 2.50 each instead of a lot more full price.

Best way to see the city. This ferry only costs $14 round-trip & is a wonderful way to see Sydney. 30 minutes ride each way, great views all along Sydney harbor. Manly is a great seaside town & well worth the visit.

Great views and more. This 30-minute trip to Manly is well-worth taking. Besides the incredible views from the boat, once there you can stroll the beach, eat at lovely restaurants, shop, walk and in general, have a great day. Don't miss it.
Manly Ferry. Fantastic and reasonable way to travel. Catch the sun . Takes 30 minutes from Sydney Harbour and runs every 30 minutes.

Nice Views. Great views from the ferry of the entire city and the Sydney Harbour. Pretty reasonable price considering the high costs of everything else in the city. If you want to see the city from a different angle and like to take lots of pictures, I'd definitely recommend this.

Enjoyable Experience. What a way to travel to work everyday - there are some lucky people in sydney!!
Lovely views of all the bays as you pass and Manly Beach was good and very pretty walks.

Stunning views of Opera House and Harbour bridge. A trip with the Manly Ferry is the ideal way to see the main attractions from the water if you have limited time to spend. Only had a couple of hours after arrival in Sydney before the work meetings. At least this was a refreshing way to see the bridge and the opera house. Manly has ample options for a light snack to a full meal.
relax. it is the fastest way to get to Manly :) so why not enjoy the great views sydney has to offer & plus the ferry terminal at manly drops you just next to the amazing restaurants.

Beautiful ferry ride. Instead of booking an expensive boat trip, go with the affordable ferry to Manly island and you will have gorgeous views from the Harbour bridge and the Opera house for a fraction of the price!

Worth a day of your time. this is for the ferry and the experience in Manly---was a wonderful trip and reasonably price. Manly is a touristy jam packed beach town--if you want beach, fine--it's great. There's a fantastic walk all the way to North Head (that's not the name, but you'll know what I mean when you get there) and back----very long--but absolutely fantastic experience

Sydney to Manly during the day - return after dark - Wow. Wonderful old authentic ferries - brilliant frequent service which goes on through to very late at night with vibrant bars and restaurants within easy reach both in Sydney harbour and at Manly.

Ferry To Manly World Class. The ferry from Circular Quay to Manly (including of course Manly Beach), is world class. You buy a ticket before trying to get on, and then board for about a 30 minute easy and safe ride to Manly. This is all inner harbour, though there is a point near the end where the ferry touches the outlet to the ocean and so the waves are a little more vigorous there for about two or three minutes. I considered that the "thrill ride" aspect of the ride, but it was in no way threatening or dangerous. It felt good and the waves were no threat whatsoever.When visiting Sydney, you need to see Manly Beach at least once and to get there, in my opinion, the best way is to get to Circular Quay and then ride a ferry boat to Manly (and return the same way).Once you get to Manly and alight from the ferry, then in walking out of the ferry building, consider some candy (lollies) from the candy stand in the middle or eat at one of the many places to get a meal or a smoothie. The licorice ropes were wonderful. Not cheap, but wonderful. From there, the Corso opens up. The Corso leads to Manly Beach and is lined on both sides with shops and places to get a meal. There is a lot of great fun to be had there. Yes, plenty of souvenir tee shirts and the like and shops at all price ranges. I will say more about the Corso and Manly Beach in a later post.In any event, when visiting Sydney, you owe it to yourself to use the ferries. The most famous seems to be the one to and from Manly, from Circular Quay. Take take the ride. Live a little.Also, the ferries are a great and easy way to get to the sites around the harbour, including Watson's Bay, Taronga Zoo and Darling Harbour. Every one of those is worth an extended visit ir two.
Manly Ferry. Very efficient, but dont expect any frills, these run every 30 minutes during peak times, and get surprisingly busy
Great views of Sydney. Good reliable ferry to Manly at a reasonable price. Great views of Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Botanical Gardens and much more.Loved visits to Manly.
worth every dollar. great day out manly was lovely and the ferry cheap and reliable,well worth the trip just to see opera house and bridge from the water

Value to go to Maily beach. Lovely fairy with funny pics of non-smoking on public transports. Lovely view behind the opera house which you only get it when you are sitting on fairy to mainly beach. 30mins to seating and let your souls be away from your body.
LOVE A FERRY RIDE ON SYDNEY HARBOUR. They are fairly reasonable and the ride gives you a good look at the beautiful Sydney Harbour. You can sit inside or outside, depending on the weather.

From the water is the best view of Sydney. An excellent way to view the sky scape of this amazing city. The ride takes you across the bay to a delightful small town of Manly. Well worth the small cost to get there.

A ferry, nothing more and nothing less. This is a ferry, folks. It is not a spectacular hotel or grand restaurant. It serves its purpose. The ferry was large, so there were lots of options for seating. And it was very clean. My biggest problem was the fact that there were several small children running around disturbing the lower deck while their parents were somewhere out of site. Staff did not seem to care.
Well worth the trip.. The price was very cheap, even for Sydney. The ride gave us a great view of the harbour and it was so nice to escape crazy dirty Sydney and get to a clean beach.
the veiws. relaxling trip to a great place Manley, gets a bit rough crossing the heads, and veiws never to be forgotten looking back the bridge and opera house

Paradise. A Trip to Manlay is what many said to us you must do. Visiting cousins not far from Manley gave us an opportunity for this 20 min boat trip. It gives excellent views of the Opera and Bridge, take photos going out, as it gets misty as the afternoons get hotter.

Manly Beach and Ferry. Was told my my Australian brother to skip tours of the harbor and take the Ferry to Manly Beach. Good recommendation as you see both the harbor and the beach which is 85% surfing. Takes several hours depending on how much time you want to spend on the beach.Cheap aboriginal design T-shirts in one of the shops, on the right walking from ferry to beach.

quick and easy escape. Feel the need to put your toes in the water? Hop the ferry to Manly for a quick 30 minute ride to the beach. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay (frequent service) and walk to the beach from Manly's dock. Fun atmosphere, especially on weekends in the summer. Not expensive and a nice way to spend the day - or half day. No need for reservations on the ferry.

Value for Money. For around $14 dollars you can have a return ticket to Manly fantastic views of Sydney harbor with a great destination. You even get a bit of commentary, the view coming into Manly is wonderful it also passes the entrance to the harbor, on the return journey great views of the harbor and opera house Best bit after walking around Sydney you can sit down and catch the breeze.

Must do/see. Great views of the harbour, bridge and opera house - especially lovely on a sunny day. Child friendly.
