The best way to get to Manly by far!

"Great Service". Great way to see the Harbour while you head over to the city. Loved the views of the harbour as you come round the heads into the city. It makes you appreciate how fantastic the harbour is when you see the Harbour Bridge & the Opera House.
Worth doing. An outing that gives you a different perspective on Sydney. Manly is lovely! Take the Ferry and spend the day there...

Something everyone can do. What a great way to see Sydney Harbour ! Good value if you want to do a cruise of the harbour and not pay the price of a private cruise.
And of course you get to see the iconic Manly beach. A great day out

Very nice ferry since it's larger for longer ride. It's about a 25 minute or so ride to Manly. There are multiple levels, outside viewing fore and aft, and a snack bar. It was rough seas on our trip and we had to come in. They warned us a couple of times we'd get wet if we didn't come inside. They were right! Other than the day I'd have given it 5 stars. Not super fancy but part of the multi-pass ticket option. Good value.

Nice Harbor View. Good way to see the harbor and Manly is a neat place to visit. If it is windy, be careful not to get caught outside or standing up when you pass through the center part of the channel where there is direct exposure to the Tasman Sea--it can be a bit rough!

Must-do stuff in Sydney. In Sydney there are a lot of must-do stuff, one of them are to take the ferry to Manly. It is a great opportunity to see the beautiful harbor and the surrounding small beaches. It is an amazing view you will see, depends obviously of the weather condition ;)And afterwards walk around in Manly and then go to the beach.Have a good time in Sydney, and I recommend you to do the Manly ferry trip.

Best and cheapest way to get a good look at the harbour.. We caught the ferry for return trips to Manly twice. The Manly Ferry Harbour itself is nice to for a look around. I got my first glimpse of that famous Sydney skyline and Harbour from the ferry. It is a great way to understand the scale and size of the harbour and take some iconic photos. Pulling into Circular Quay from the water is pretty unbeatable.

An attraction on it's own. I live in the city but commute to Manly on a daily basis. The Manly ferry is a great way to see the Harbour Bridge, North Head, the Sydney Opera House, and manly other iconic sights. The ride is often very smooth, unless there happens to be a storm or high wind or swell. There is wifi on the ferries, although it tends to cut out about half way through the ride. The outdoor seating at the bow and stern are a great way to get some sun and really breath the fresh ocean air.

A MUST. This is probably the best bang for the buck you can get in Australia. And on top of that, you get breathtaking views of Sydney , the harbour, the bridge. There is not much in Manly itself, but the ferry trip itself is the best part. Do it.

Nice ride on sydney harbour. what a beautiful boat ride to manly on manly ferry and its a must to do for anyone coming to sydney. sydney harbour is magestic and going to manly shows you the harbours beauty
Excellent service. Cheap way to get around without breaking the bank (note no concessions for uk pensioners) Very reliable with polite crew
worth a visit. Manly a lovely short ferry ride from Sydney,very cheap fare.nice beach,cafes are nice but like all of Austalia not cheap.
Sunset delight. Relaxing. Wi-fi free on the ferry. Go during the late afternoon, so you get the ferry back at sunset. Get a beautiful view of the city lights coming back.

Great way to see the harbor!. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly round trip for a great way to see the major Sydney icons (Opera, Bridge, Fort Denison) etc. I paid a very reasonable $11.60 AUD for round trip tickets. Each way the ride is about 30 minutes. Try to get on early for a seat on one of the outer decks (weather permitting), or you might choose to stand outside like I did one way. I recommend taking the outbound trip in the afternoon and returning after sunset to experience the views in two different settings. Though there is no official tour, I chatted up a local and she was more than happy to point out some sites along the way. The experience is relaxing and appropriate for children.

Great views!. Took a day trip to manly; was great to escape the hustle and bustle of Sydney and enjoy a slower pace for a while! Food and drink were slightly cheaper in manly, which was certainly a breath of fresh air! The views as the ferry leaves are spectacular in their own right; make sure you have your camera ready for the awesome panorama of the entire city centre!

A great ferry ride to enjoy Manley. You could never get tired of taking the Manley ferry from Circular Quay over to Manley. A great scenic ferry ride with photo opportunities galore. Manley is great to wander down the Corso, checking out the shops or having a coffee or beer. A great beach to enjoy at the end of the Corso

Wonderful, loved the fast one better!. We travelled on both ferries ( old and the fast) one. I liked the fast one but my husband preferred the old one. It is a great trip from Manly. Lots to see and very relaxing.

It's a ferry to a tourist town, and it's fun!. This is something I hear everyone has to do, so I did it. It's a nice boat ride through the Sydney Harbor and it's worth the trip. There are great restaurants in Manly like the Manly Fish Cafe, and some good brewpubs. All in all the boat ride is nice and it's a great destination.
Great day trip out of Sydney. Manly beach is great and alaid back scene. The ferry less the $20 and its a nice break from the big city, plus the trip over is great to see the harbor.
perfect. Lovely way to see the city, especially at night. Took about an hour and a half round trip. Loved the bouncing as we hit the ocean currents!

Lovely Ferry ride. Gret views from the ferry and Manly is a much cheaper place to shop and have lunch. A great beach and popular with the locals. Turn right when you get off the ferry and head for the front. Watch the water activities as you have great fish and chips!

Great ferry ride!. The ferry ride to/from Manly is spectacular. So much to see if you sit on the outer decks. It can get a bit rough while passing by the channel that goes out to open ocean but you will certainly get to see some awesome sites!

The boat with two fronts!. Do go to Manly when in Sydney, its a lovely resort. Calm waters one side then walk through the shopping street to the surf beach. The ferry is unusual due to a bow at each end, there is no rear! Nice journey with great views of the harbour.

Great views of Sydney Bridge and the Opera House. Clean and comfortable, very efficient loading and unloading passengers. Great views of Sydney Harbour, the bridge and the Opera House day and night time

A different way to see the bay. Wow what a ride. Just after the storm so the wave were a liitle high.
If it is choppy don't sit on the bow. You will get wet. Another way to get around the city.
Wish they would offer foreign seniors a discount.

Add this to your list. It is a short trip over to Manly passing many scenic bays, spectacular housing and watercraft. You can either travel on the slower ferry or take the 'Cat'. Recommend the slower ferry as you can sit outside and enjoy it all.

Great Views. We went on the ferry to Manly on New Years Day and although it was very busy we got a seat inside no problem. The views from outside were obviously better and we managed to get some great photos on the way back. This is the cheapest and most convenient way to get to Manly from the city centre and the wharfs are well located at both ends. The ferry also comes with 30 mins of free wifi which was great. Even if you don't want to visit Manly this is a cheap way to see the harbour and bridge.

Nothing to do for the day?. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. Even with no agenda or "must see" things, the Sunday morning ride provided options for lunch, conversations, and ultimately, people-watching that became a highlight of two weeks in Sydney.

Ferry good. Fast way to get across Sydney Harbour and explore another part of the area. Many people prefer Manly to Bondi but they both of great walks near by. Ferry every 30 mins. If you sit outside not only beware of the sun but also the waves which can give you a good soaking if you are not careful.

Smooth ride to Manly. We were in Sydney back in 2010 and the ferry was reasonably priced and simple way to get to Manly. The views were nice and the trip was smooth til we got to a portion of the harbor that was open to the Tasman Sea. The ferry rocked a little bit as we crossed this portion, but not enough to cause seasickness...or at least no one in my immediate area at the fore section of the top deck was affected.

Best and cheapest tour in Sydney. What is not to say about travelling on one of the world best harbours with fantastic scenery - all for $6.50.Simply a must do for every traveller.And fantastic Manly is at the end- how good is that !!

What a deal,. We took the ferry to Manley a couple of times on our recent visit to Sydney. Great way to see Sydney harbor and shops in Manley. Very cost effective. The beach and restaurants there a very nice. Take a change of clothes.In nice weather try to board early and go to top level and sit outside facing your designation. Great views.
great siteseeing trip. a quick and easy way to get from Sydney Harbour to sightsee the surrounding area and all the interesting sites along the way..a must for kids of all ages
Its a must when visiting Sydney. Lovely views going out and coming in to the harbour. The best photographic opportunity in the world. Everyone who visits Sydney should do this.
Scenic view. sit outside to catch a very good view of the harbour. sit at the top front as the view leaving circular quay is tremendous

Andrew of new zealand. highly recommend this trip you get a great tour of the harbour for a very low price.sundays if you have small chidren is cheaper again manly beach is fantastic lovely walk thro shopping centre.

One of many ferries available from Sydney.. We used the ferry services from Sydney on a few occasions. We especially enjoyed the trip to Manly, not that the ferry was any different to the others but the destination, Manly, is worth a visit.We spent a day in Manly, and in our opinion the beach is better than its more well known neighbour, Bondi.As you leave the Ferry Berth at Manly, walk across the road and go down The Corso, the beach is on the opposite end of the Corso.As you arrive at the beach if you turn right and walk along the Marine Parade to Shelley Beach. This is worth a look. We are not beach people but the walk and views are terrific. Towards Shelley Beach you will spot many steel statues and models set in the rocks.You will find lots of eating places fronting the beach, the prices are reasonable and choice is varied.with lots of sea food and the usual fish and chips (Barramundi). We even found one offering deep fried mars bars. This to us is a Scottish 'delicacy', don't know how it found its way to Manly

Quick Transportation for Tourists. We stayed in Collaroy, up the beach from Manly, but drove to Manly a lot to use the ferry. If you get on the right one that is quick, you can get to Sydney in 18 minutes. There are several that leave throughout the day but latest one we could find left Sydney (for return) around 7:40 p.m. So we had to plan our dinners either early in the evening or back in Manly. The seats were comfortable and spacious although it was known to get crowded during rush hour so boarding at the front of the line was important then.
Great Scenic Ride to Manly. Ferry is an enjoyable ride over to Manly, with convenient departures and returns. Highly recommend it!

Manly Ferry. The manly ferry is a Sydney icon and the best and cheapest way to get a harbour cruise. I suggest that visitors buy a return ferry ticket from Circular Quay to Manly. Admire the harbour on the way and once there enjoy Manly. A great day out for all.

Trip to Manly by Ferry. The ferry trip was good. Great views of Sydney. Sit outside if you can but you have to be quick to get a seat as it fills up fast. Manly has a great beach and it was a nice walk.

The best commuter journey in the world!. The ferry journey between Sydney's Circular Quay and Manly is not only a tourist trip, but it's also a commuter run, as well. School kids and business people do this journey twice a day, passing Sydney's two great landmark icons - the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House - each time. I hope they realise how fortunate they are!The journey takes around half an hour, and never ceases to thrill - not only because of the sights, of course, but also when the ferry crosses The Heads - the point where Sydney Harbour ends and the open Pacific Ocean begins. Here, even on a calm day, you can feel the swell of the sea.The ferries themselves are real workhorses - functional, solid ships that ply back and forth dozens of times a day. For me, a trip on this route is an absolute 'must'; one of the essentials on a visit to Sydney. Try it yourself, and see if you agree!
Great value. This has to be one of the best things to do whilst in Sydney, the trip across the harbour is brilliant and in my opinion Manly knocks Bondi into a cocked hat. Its far better.

Great way to see the harbour!. Its all good! If you want a great trip to and from the CBD & Manly then this is a no brainer. Take the slow ferry and enjoy the trip! Get out front and do a Titanic pose!

Manly is amazing!. Manly is really cool, has great bars and restaurants and beautiful little beaches. It's also less packed than mainland Sydney. The ferry has nice views of the bridge and Opera House, the best views are on the return trip from Manly. The ferry ride itself is nice enough, takes about half an hour. Grab a seat on the outside edge of the boat for good views, expect it to be crowded before around maybe 5 or 6pm.

Wow. The trip across to Manly is always a great trip. Over the years only had one really rough trip but this one to Manly and back was very comfortable with magnificent views of the harbour.Sit outside hwnever you can as it is very refreshing to watch the world go by.Seemed like thousands of yachts out on the harbour which just added to the trip.Getting on and off was a breeze even though the ferry was full both times

The Manly ferry is a must do activity. It's cheap and it's got the best views of Sydney Harbour. The return ticket is only $15 and you get a tour of Sydney Harbour with excellent views of the opera house and the bridge.

Fast, comfortable and not too expensive. Fast, comfortable and not too expensive. If you are in the other part of the city, just grab a ticket and go check the other side out. You will like it. The crew was very friendly

Finally made the grade - private jet cats. Being a Manly local for years, I always thought the ferry service was OK. However over the past few years they sacked the government run jet cats and allowed private operators. What a sea change! Pleasant and smiling service, a bar that serves alcohol, comfy seats and TV screens with subtitles, a quick trip and some of the seats even have tables. All for about the same as price (50 cents less) than for the public ferry that takes almost twice as long.
great trip. quite cheap trip to manly. bit choppy on our crossing. good food and good deal in resturant at ferry port on manly. cracking little beach as well.

Well Worth the Cost. The ferry to Manly is a wonderful way to see much of the Sydney Harbour. It is about 1 1/2 hours round trip from the Sydney Quay. Some of the tourists got off in Manly for lunch prior to returning to downtown. The price of the ferry is very reasonable.

Marvelous Manly. Bought tickets for the ferry at Circular Quay and enjoyed a wonderful 30 minute ride through Sydney Harbour. Get yourself to the front of the entrance gates and elbow your way up to the outside area as there are few seats up there.

just take the Ferry. Even if you can go by bus or by drive just take this ferry to enjoy the magistical views of opera house, harbour bridge from water and just to relax, sitback and watch the ocean and the adjoining land while the sea breeze gushes on your face ..enjoyyy

Lovely Manly!. My second time in Sydney and as i only had a few days made the choice to swerve Bondi in favour of Manly for a day at the beach. You could book an expensive harbour cruise or you could take the Manly ferry and pass the icons of the bridge and opera house and end up at a great town/ beach in less than an hour, perfect!

Manly's worth a visit - if just to walk the promenade!. Sydneysiders will say Manly is better than Bondi - and I have to agree! It has a classier feel to it. I just went there to have a look. The ferry ride is quite cool! That boat pitches and rolls nicely (if you like that sort of thing) and the trip itself offers a great way to see Sydney and its surrounds via the water.
nice experience on the water. Nice experience on the water on the way to manly Beach area.Very pleasant and relaxing with great view of the Sydney water front area- dont miss!
Nice Ferry Ride to Cool Little Place. Ferry ride was worth the trip, not expensive and were every 30 minutes or so. Manly is a chilled place & the beach was really nice.

sea dogs!. took the trip with friends to manly.gave a good view of harbour and surounding attractions.a good day out .Manly offered good beach but be careful if taking children as surf can be rough suit surfers.plenty of things to do.

Visit the beach at Manly. A great day or afternoon. The ferry and short walk take you to Manly beach. It doesn't feel as commercial there a Sydney city centre - made us feel we were really on holiday.

A classic experience. This is a classic experience and one of the top things to do on a trip to Sydney. Sit back, enjoy the view and wonder at such a lovely place.
Walk the Corso in Manly, have a beer, watch the swimmers and surfers and pray for reincarnation to come back.
Enjoy life is too short!
Must Do. If you are coming to sydney you MUST MUST MUST get the ferry over to the city or the city ferry to manly. You will get the most amazing views of the harbord. Its also very cheap!!

Sixty years on .... Whether I was a child, teenager, adult, with friends, on my own, with grandchildren I have never failed to enjoy the ferry, the thirty min. trip to Manly, have an icecream, walk the Corso, then back thirty min. to Circular Quay. The price is affordable, the experience, the scenery, priceless, whether by day, night, in rain or sunshine.
Great trip. Great way to travel over to Manly, although it can get a litle bit bumpy as you near Manly. it also gets very busy so allow extra time to be near the front.

The way to see the harbour.. Don't pay for expensive tours. Take the Manly ferry, sit outside and enjoy public transport! Manly itself has a plenty to do IOU have a spare afternoon if not just go straight back on the return ferry!
Awesome Views at Night Upon Return. Manly is a fun way to spend the day on the pedestrian walkway or either the ocean or harbour beaches. Go back at night for harbour lights display.
Great trip.. Loved the trip to Manly from Sydney Harbour. Took around 35 minutes. Lots of room, toilets and refreshments if required. Reasonable price. Easy to book.

Million dollar ride. For a few dollars you can see the sweep of the harbour, spend half an hour on the water and arrive at a suburb beach ("minutes from the city but a thousand miles from care"). Cool off with a swim then go for fish and chips with gelato to finish off. Walk the length of the surf beach (quite a long walk) and sample the water as you go. Do swim between the flags (safer conditions) and don't forget the sunscreen and the hat!

Cheap way to see Bridge and Opera House from the water.. Wonderful experience by water and not costly. Around 45 minutes around the shores of the river and up to Manly. There is a good short walk around the bay, plenty of places for refreshments and good beach. Trip back also allows look at housing along the way and other water users.
A wonderful way to view the harbour. Fantastic views of the Sydney Opera House from the ferry and a lovely wander along Manly Beach on arrival. Well worth the trip.

Good way to get around. We stayed in Manly for 4 days...so used the ferry as a way of means to get to Sydney harbour and do sightseeing....the fast ferry was efficient and clean...we were so impressed at the speed of loading and unloading passengers....staff were polite funny and a pleasure to meet....The ordinary ferry which took a good half an hour to cross was a bit of a scrum for the outdoor seating....but ''hey'' first come first seated......good crossings but much busier.....staff great attitude towards customers.....

Fun Trip to Manly Beach. The trip was pretty much as much what I expected from reviews. Economical and fun, I would recommend to try :) Manly beach is very relaxing and beautiful, too. Only one recommendation would be to buy the ticket early. A long line to buy the ticket!
A fun way to see the harbour. We enjoyed the ferry to Manley, the views of the harbour are fabulous, and Manley beach is a must see

Beautiful trip and very relaxing!. We took the ferry to Manly a few times during our trip. The ride was beautiful and relaxing. It goes right by the Opera House, so we got some great photos of the landmark. One tip, buy a MyMulti pass when in Sydney. It will allow you to ride the busses, ferries, trains and light rail all for one low price.
Economical and convenient. This is always an enjoyable and scenic trip. The ferries themselves are quite historic and the view you get of the harbour is pretty spectacular.

Nice photo opportunity. We went out to see Manly Beach and catch a glimpse of Sydney on the water. It was a lovely view of the city. Manly Beach is nice, but we arrived at 4:00 p.m. and did not take advantage of the beach. We had a lovely dinner at one of the restaurants along the beach front.

Well worth the trip.. All the ferries are good value, but the one to Manly is especially popular. Manly has some lovely beaches and some excellent restaurants and shops. It is busy at the weekends, but the ferries are regular and the views form Circular Quay are worth the price of the ticket alone.

Great way to see Opera House!. What a best way to see the Opera House for just A$10! We were pleasantly surprised to discover this by chance and indeed, you can get the best views without having to pay for the expensive cruises.

The only way to travel from Manly to Sydney. Went on the Manly Ferry several times as have family in Manly it is a lovely way to travel and the views on the way into Circular Quay are magicial. What a lovely way to travel, so relaxing.
spacious and clean ferry to Manly.. Nice, spacious and clean ferry to and return from Manly. Nice view of Manly and Sydney city from ferry.
A cheap option to see Sydney's top attractions. Very well organised and fantastic views of Sydney Opera House, Sydney Bridge and The Harbour. Excellent for a half-day trip to Manly Beach.
great trip. manly is nice, worth a visit. ferry ride is great. take a right at the main beach and do the small trip through the bushland on top of the little hill.
A cheap way to see the harbor. A cheap way to see the harbor, be sure to buy a 'return" ticket. The German restaurant at the pier is a good place to have lunch.
Fun, easy. A fabulous twenty minute ride gives you a fire of the harbor, ending up on this lovely beach. Stroll around and done miss the coves on the right.
Nice cruise. We took the ferry to Manly and back to circular quay just for the ride. Great views of the harbour, plenty of room on the ferry, nice trip.

Great day trip to Manly. Bought a week Mymulti to travel on ferry, train and bus for convenience, for the 5 days we were there. Manly ferry runs every 1/2 hr or so from Circular Quay. Trip takes approx 3 minutes.Try to get up the front outside on the top deck on the trip over to Manly, fantastic views. Very easy getting off and on, information ctre just outside ferry terminal. Walk through shops and cafes in the Corso to get to the beach, change rooms at the Surf Life Saving up the other end of the beach, on the right. Free showers. Plenty of fancy seafood restaurants near beach front, also good fish and chip take aways at reasonable prices. Take water bottle with you, can fill up at free filtered taps on beach front. Listen to life guard announcements, tell you if stinging jellyfish coming in. Some people ignored their warnings where to swim and got stung.If you pack your own lunch like some families did, can be a cheap day out, great atmosphere.
Beaching on New Year's Eve. Great ferry ride about a 1/2 hour to Manly. Very comfortable and great views from the front outdoor seats
Very pleasant trip. Have been on the ferry to Manly many times of the years,can't get enough of it, magical. Manly itself is nice too, well worth visiting,

Great way to see the harbour. Another must do when visiting Sydney, lovely and cheap way to see the harbour. Try and get a seat outside if you can. In Manly take a wander down The Corso to the surf beach, Sydneysiders are lucky to have such beautiful beaches.

Frequent, even weekends. Good view of skyline. Get a 7 day pass for the public transport system. Even if you're only there 3 days. $22/d or $44 for week. public transport in Sydney is a lot more confusing than Melbourne. The Ferry to Manly is timely, has a cafe, and frequent enough, even on weekends.

Best way to see the Bridge and Opera House.. Circular Quay is situated between the opera house and the bridge so you get great views from the ferry. Great boat trip to Manley with so much to see on the way.

Australia Day. Travelled to and from Manly on Australia day. Every passenger was in great spirits. Lots of chatting & laughter. Delightful to see all the other ferry's & tall ships getting ready for the races.

Cool January day. Have also previously taken ferry to Manly - lovely way to see harbour from a different perspective and beach at Manly great too. Nice mix of local shops and there was a small street market on the day we visited (Sunday). Nice, laid back atmosphere
Another ferry in Sydney. Yes it's a ferry and yes it will take you to Manly. Not too sure why this one has a special place here. But we enjoyed this trip as always.
Great way to get around.... good to see the boats still going strong. and still the best way to get to manly from the city, love it when you get passed the heads and start to feel the swell..
Side trip. Great idea I got from TripAdvisor. $14.40 AUD for round trip. Great view of the Bridge and Opera house
quick and easy. The manly ferry was really easy to use and if you catch a late ferry back to circular quay you cn get great views of the opera house at night.

Nice way to head out to Manly. We used the Manly ferry mainly for the transportation purpose. I think it's the nicest way to reach Manly. (we used car to get there, once.) I really enjoyed the scenery, you can see the opera house from close as the ship leaves Circular Quay and on the way back the skyline of Sydney just grows bigger as you approach.On board the toilets were clean and there's a free wifi upstairs.For us, having our accommodation further in the Western suburbs, it made sense to get a MyMulti Daypass when we headed to Manly. It was around AU$22, and cheaper than the return tickets together.A word of warning though: there might be surf that makes the boat sway.

Fun experience. We always take the Manly ferry when visiting Sydney. It is a great way to relax on the the harbour see the sights and end up in a great beach location. Yes you feel like sheep herded onto a boat, but if you manage an outside seat, you get to enjoy a relaxing ferry ride amongst the other boats on the harbour. One of our trips was on Australia Day so it was packed, but it was a great way to occupy a few hours and observe the harbour events of the day. ( and if your mobile phone is getting flat you can charge it at the mobile phone charge station located on board!) A must when visiting Sydney!

A must for all visits to Sydney. The Manly Ferry is a brilliant (and reasonably priced) way of getting on to the Harbour and finding yourself at fantastic Manly. Its about a 30 minute trip. You leave Circular Quay, go past the Opera House, past Fort Denison, past many of Sydneys luxury harbourside residences, see the Harbour Bridge in all its glory for great photo opportunites and then cross the heads. The Heads are North Head and South Head, the two peninsulas that seperate north from south and lead Sydney into the Pacific Ocean. Past the heads you will soon be in Manly - where you have brilliant still harbour swims on one side and a world famous surf beach on the other. Manly is famous for its restaurants and beach culture. Well worth spending a day there, especially if you have kids. A day out at Manly, arriving on the Ferry is a very authentic Australian outing.

Fab way to see the harbour. Great way to see the harbour. Be prepared for people to queue and to rush to get those seats outside!
Great photo opportunities and a good day out from Sydney

Great fish and chips. We got the ferry across to Manly - slow ferry across and fast ferry back - both trips were very enjoyable. Had a wander around Manly and then had fish and chips on the wharf - nicest fish we had had in a long time.

Many is Lovely. We took the ferry form the Harbour over to Manly for a few hours on New Years Eve before the celebreations started. The ferry itself is fab- its so nice to have a trip through the harbour seeing the city in the distance. Manly is lovely, the beach is beautiful and fish and chips is a must have.Well worth a visit.

A good day trip. If you want a day away from the crowds of Sydney, take the ferry over to Manly. Bypass the shops on the promanade and go straight over to the ocean beach. Find a restaurant with a balcony view of the beach and enjoy the view. There is something for everybody.

Sunny or cloudy, it's a beautiful ride.... Riding the ferry to Manly gives you views of the Opera house, Harbour Bridge and the entire city that you don't get from the shore. It's always a wonderful outing.

nice ride & lovely afternoon. This is an inexpensive ferry to Manly & a pretty nature reserve, beach & town once you arrive. We didn't eat here so I can't evaluate restaurants & we're not shoppers. Do enjoy the tiny metal nature sculptures as you walk past the beach to the nature preserve.

Most fun all day!!!. We took the Manly Ferry on a day when the waves were rough. It made it even more fun! Half way to Manly the waves were crashing over the bow. Of course the locals were all inside staying dry but all us Tourists were enjoying the view and dodging the water.

Stunning views of Sydney Harbour. I sat on the front of the Manly ferry for my trip from Circular quay to Manly. The trip takes about 30minutes. The ride was smooth and comfortable. there were plenty of seats inside and out The views along the way were fantastic travelling under the bridge and past the opera house.

minitrip and great value. The ferries are frequent, clean and affordable, As family of 4 we only paid for 3 - great! There are also convenient loading docks for mobiles near the exit.The trip itself offers iconic views of Sydneys top attractions and a bit of a harbour cruise. It's very relaxing - highly recommended!

Paradise in 30 minutes. The ferry trip was a wonderful experience! Filled with people excited to get to the wonderful beach at Manly Bay. Thirty relaxing minutes on a journey that allowed you to see Sydney and its surrounding bays from the sea. Whether you plan to spend a day or a few hours in Manly, this is the way to embrace the atmosphere of all Sydney has to offer.

Great for families. During our visit to Sydney we decided to take a trip on the Manly Ferry. With costs so high when trying to do anything with children, this was an inexpensive outing and the kids loved it.
Day trip. Great day out, hadn't been to Manly for a long time. Its a vibrant area with lots to do and see with the family.

RELAXATION. once off the busy, noisy,crowded Cirsular Quay and onto the Manly Ferry, you can swithxc off and relax. Sea breeze rufling your hair , the occassional squak from the sea gulls and the sent of sal permeates. The ferry passes some realy nice are but as there was no guid I just took in th escenery. Sydney sider must be just so lucky to live like on the shore of the harbout, but i can imaginge you must be multi millionairs to live like that.You get to go pass the harbour entrance where you can feel the great pacific ocean try to get into the harbour. Hold tight!!!.Wave action!!! The view of the cliftst are dramatic and great for some photos.At the end is Manly a rather facinating area but that is the feature of another review. Also worht doing

perfect dayout. Loved our day out the family enjoy the treat after having pancakes on the rocks. The view is excellent and cheap as we always use SUNDAY/FUNDAY. Great value for money and beautiful city to look back at from Circular Quay to Manly.

A trip to Sydney is not complete without the Manly Ferry!. Taking the ferry to Manly from Circular Quay is a must do when visiting Sydney or just a great way to enjoy Sydney Harbour. The Manly Ferry goes regularly and deposits you on the Harbour side of the suburb of Manly, as the old saying goes, "seven miles from Sydney, 1,000 miles from care". A short walk up "The Corso" and you arrive at the beautiful Manly ocean beach. The ferry is calm until it goes "between the Heads" or the entrance to the Harbour itself. It can get a little bumpy then, which adds to the fun. Sit on the wharf side to get the best views of the Opera House and the expensive Sydney real estate.
A nice and quick way to get to Manly. This ferry is a nice and quick way to get to Manly. It was slightly overpriced, crammed, with minimal seating. However, it was a nice and quick way to get there.

Hottest day in 80 years. We took the Ferry to Manly on the hottest day in *0 years to escape the heat. We enjoyed our round trip ride and found the vessel to be very clean. You will see the harbor and have many photo opportunities. A Must do!

Iconic ferry journey!. I lived in Manly for a while, and for a time this was the best commute I've ever had in my life. The ferry is $7 and passes the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge, Fort Denison, Kiribilli (PMs home), Bradley's Head, Maquarie Point, the wharfs of woolloomooloo and the beaches up until Manly in around 30 mins. Manly itself will be packed on a summer weekend but make your way to Shelly Beach (turn right at the end of the Corso) for a really quaint beach with Cafe, BBQs and great snorkelling. The fast ferry back can often be only $5 on weekdays and has a fully licenced bar (takes only 20 mins).
Quick journey. 30 minute journey to Manley beach. Buy the weekly pass to go on any train, bus and ferry anytime - buy from rail hub at airport or any newsagent.

The way to travel. Best way to travel from Sydney to Manly without doubt. The journey is scenic, with many interesting views of Sydney including the bridge and opera house; it is reasonably quick ( 30 mins ) and very slick. The ferries are getting on a bit but still efficient and well run

Never got tired of the views!. This ferry chugs across the open water from Manly Wharf to Circular Quay about every 40 minutes. The ferries run on time and provide an absolutely gorgeous view of Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, and lovely coastline in between. The photo ops are endless! You can sit outside on benches, enjoying the fresh breeze and the sunshine, or you can work inside or get a cup of coffee from the little cafe...we looked forward to every trip we got to take on the Manly Ferry. One word of warning - parking in the underground garage at the Wharf is very expensive for over 3 hours: $55 AUD for a day.

Good decision. We decided to have a boat trip out from Circular Quay and this was a great way of seeing different aspects of the harbour on your way out to Manly. We ended up going on Melbourne Cup day so there was a lot of excitement around as there was in the pub in Manly when we watched the event unfold and were able to rip up our modest and ignorant choices on our slips! Great day - Manly was heaving, sandy beach impressive but not the best area of Sydney to spend time but that is just a personal comment - fish luch was however fantastic. Ferry trip really gives you a great sense of the way Sydney have embraced the whole issue of ferry crossings and you even got to see where the Prime Minister can put her feet up and the exit channel out into the vast oceans for the massive liners that come and go into the harbour. Perhaps try some of the ferries that go up the Paramatta as a contrast?

Well worth taking the fast ride to Manly. They held the ferry back while my wife and I made a run to catch it ... followed by much banter with the crew when we made it aboard. Buying my ticket on board, at the same time as buying a beer was great. The ferry was fast, taking only 20 minutes to get to Manly, but it gave us the opportunity to see Sydney from a completely different angle.

A great get-away. Excellent, in town on business the Manly ferry offered a mini cruise to get away from the city and down to the beach. The free wi if also made it an opportunity to check those e-mails while out and about.
Got us there. Although the ferry was slightly crowded, it got us to manly alright! Easy to find the ticketing office, etc. I love the efficiency.

Worth a look. Took the ferry, went down to the beach, set for a while looking at the view, walked around the town and got the ferry back. It was very hot that day so even though you were going to a beach it was just too hot to enjoy it...

A 'must-do' in Sydney. Graet fun on the ferry from Syndey to Manly, but even better coming back. Make sure you have your camera at the ready for the great pictur opportunities of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge!

Overhyped. Took a packed ferry over to arrive to the packed beach. There were not good restaurants either. I didn't understand the draw. The coastal walk was okay, but not anything amazing. With so much to do in Sydney, it's possible to skip this.

Very efficient service with great views of the opera house. The service runs like clockwork, is relatively inexpensive and provides some great views of the opera house, the harbour bridge and the financial district. Go in daylight and at night to get some very different views/photos of the opera house

A really lovely trip with some great photo opportunities!. On the way there we sat on one side of the ferry on the outside decking and were able to get some lovely pictures of the harbour bridge, and on the way back we sat on the opposite side where you get a great view of the Sydney skyline, opera house and bridge! It takes about 30 minutes to get from Sydney Harbour to Manley, and is definitely a trip worth doing as the beaches at Manly are fab! The ferry costs about $7 each, and is no cheaper to buy a return or 2 singles. You can get the ferry anytime, they come every 30 mins or so, but I recommend leaving Manley after 7pm, as the sun is just setting behind the opera house when you get back!!
great views. Really lovely experience, very calming. Make sure you smile at all the deck hands as my family and i got to go and meet the captin on the journey over.

Best value. Forget the tatty "harbour cruises": take a ferry ride instead. The ferries are double-ended, so what is the bows going one way is the stern going back. People can find the bows (front) on the upper deck windy. For good shots of the harbour bridge, opera house etc., I recommend the stern in the Sydney-Manly trip, just after sunset.I'm biased: I live in Manly, and twice in my life, changed jobs so I could travel to work by ferry.Best fun: wearing full rain gear, riding the bows, upper deck, in a southerly gale after two days of storm and getting splashed as the bows thump down off a wave, crossing the heads. Try to catch the last ferry before they are shut down for safety reasons.
Best Ferry in the World. Grat service, best view in the world, you must be very lucky to travel on Manly Ferry every day for work. Love it

Great way to see Sydney Harbour. We took the berry over to Manly Beach and it turned out to be a great way to tour Sydney Harbour and see the sights along the way. It was a hot summer day, so the ferry was crowded with people heading for the beach. But we were able to sit outside and enjoy the view on a clear day. Highly recommend this if you do not have time to take a harbour tour.

Sunday arvo adventure. Make your trip on a Sunday as the discounts to travel on ferries then are excellent. We as a family of 3 paid $7.50 return Circular Quay to Manly return. Excellent value, great to get onto the water on a hot day and go to the beach for lunch. Manly is busy Sunday's with street markets and restaraunts absolutely choka blocka with people.Good for a look.

well worth a trip. This ride takes a little over half an hour and is well worth it. Excellent views of the bridge and Opera House and a really good view of the outer harbour. Sit on the right hand side for the City-Manly trip and also for the Manly-City trip. The first gives you a closer look at the luxurious eastern suburbs and the latter at the parks and reserve land on the northern side.
Best non-tour. Inexpensive way to see the harbor from a different perspective - can be a little crowded but well worth the cost
Well Organise. Very well organise Ferry, un expensive and worted. Well train staff make us feel save and very enjoyed

Ferry Ride great/Staff terrible.. Well, the ferry ride was great and very picturesque..the staff were rude, condescending and not at all helpful.I think they forget tha tthe tourists who are NOT familiar with the service and dare ask questions, help PAY their wages. Perhaps training in "Customer Service" is in order!!!

a great way to see the views. This was a fantastic way to see the views that you pay for on the captain cook official tours. My advise is to sit at the side closest to the harbour when leaving Sydney and the one furthest away when leaving Manly, that way you will get the best views of Sydney Harbour and its sights.

Simple and inexpensive way to get to Manly. Manly is worth visiting. Lots of fish and chip shops there and a beautiful beach.
The ferry runs quite frequently and it is a relatively short and expensive trip. Definitely visit Manly Beach while in Sydney.

goes straight to Manly. it's the quickest way to get to Manly. no other stops and it takes approx 30 min to get there. there is a bar on board and free wi fi. ticket cost is average so enquire before you buy.

Useful & convenient. We used this service on New Years day & uit was 100% on time and reliable.
Perfect way to get around.

Quick and efficient, great way to see the harbour.... Not only does it get you to your destination, it's a great way to take in the views and get other angles of the Opera House... On our way back from Manly, I managed to film the Opera House at night - perfect way to do this in motion!

best way to see the harbor. the old Manly Ferries are an excellent way to view Sydney's foreshores and see the majestic entrance to the harbour North Head especially. Cheap, clean, regular and reliable ... a visitors must try attraction.

Manly Ferry. I have travelled on this crossing on all the different Ferries over 60 years I think every time I go there is something new to see on the harbour I love to watch the tourist taking photos of our beautiful city a must for any one of any age best 30 mins plus you could ever hope for

its not so much the ferry as getting a Manly meal. the ferry is a ferry (and not expensive), the harbour is the harbour with all its bays and houses, but Manly is all about eating and drinking, and it is deliciously cool with the breeze off the sea. We really enjoyed our first evening in Sydney there.

Manley Ferry review. Great service frequent and doesnt take that long to get to the beach. Best to get a MyTrain/Bus/Ferry card that lasts for longer than a day to travel back and forth to the beach as it works out much cheaper in the long run.

A great day trip!. Manly is the perfect day trip from Sydney. The ferry ride takes about 30 minutes. The ferry is large, comfortable and easy to navigate. I would highly reccomend a day trip if you have the time.

To the Beach. Excellent service to the Beach, ferries do a Sunday Family day where everyone travels for 2.50 dollars each so be warned the ferry is packed so leave it late to travel and come back early. Freee wi fi too

A must do, one of our best days in Sydney. Manly is a great day out. The ferry trip is fun with good views of the key Sydney iconic buildings plus you go past some wonderful millionaire homes. The best bit is Manly its self. The sand is smooth, watching the surfers and fishermen is cool and hiring a tandem to go exploring beyond the beach was excellent

Great Ferry Ride to Wonderful Manly. We took an early morning ferry to Manly and enjoyed the views with few other passengers. The ferry was much more crowded for the trip back to Sydney. It's a short ferry trip, but gives you the opporunity to see a bit of hte surrounding coastline in the area. Well worth your time!
Great view of the Harbour. I went to Many numerous times and always enjoy the ferry ride. It's relaxing (about 30 minutes) and gives you a great view of the harbour for pictures.

just do it. I LOVE Manly Beach and the ferry is the only way I will use to get there. The half hour ferry ride is a great way to see the Harbour. Two things to remember though, get to the wharf early (especially during busy periods) and sit outside. Also, if you plan to use the ferries and buses for a few days, invest in a Mymulti pass for the week, a better deal than paying by trip.

Manly Ferry always for the win. Every time I go to Sydney I catch the ferry across to Manly. If you have got a public transport weekly pass - which I highly recommend if you're going to catch any public transport - then the trip to Manly is included in that so don't buy another ticket or go with a private company.The views are spectacular there and back and you can go down and relax on the beach or kick back at a beach side cafe. Well worth it.

take the jet. We thought we were getting on the jet, but ended up on the slow boat. It took longer than we expected. Also recommend buying tickets at a line other than the manly line, as that was the longest and you can get tickets in any line.

Best Way to See the Harbour on a Budget. A great way to see the harbour sights and travel from the lower north shore to Sydney CBD - we had MyMulti 1 tickets for a week - they paid for themselves just on the ferry. (Watch out for the toilets though - a bit too stinky, after all this is a boat!!)
Love it. Taking the fairy is a great way to get to manly. For shopping and the beach. When you on it make sure to have a camera. Lots of get views. Also of the bridge and opera house.

Good Way of Seeing the Sydney Skyline from the water. Quick and reasonable way of visiting Manly which if you like surfing has the ideal beach for this. Nice town itself and some nice walks around the head. We did a nice long walk around the Head and back which is really scenic but there is nowhere on route to get a drink so take some with you.

A must. All the fellows tripadvisors tell you to take the ferry, and they are right! Enjoy the lovely views, have a lunch in one of the restaurants (we went to Hugos, right in the wharf), walk to the "Corso" and get to the beach! Walk to Shelly Beach and feel the scene...
Manly. The ferry is the easiest way to get to Manly and experience its lovely beach and shopping strip. I also recommend taking a fairly easy walk to North Head.

Great view of the harbour. This is a must. It's a nice ferry ride from the Quay to Manly. A great way to see the harbour and all the boats operating in Sydney Harbour. Once off the ferry it's just a 10 minute walk over to Manly beach. Have a lunch or snack, then catch the ferry back.

Views of Tourist Sites. This is a great way to see some of the tourist sites of Sydney whilst heading to a gorgeous location. On a nice day it is super relaxing, especially if you are lucky enough to get a seat outside.

Oh wow. This was probably the highlight of our holiday. Get the ferry from circular quay. There Re two but I would prefer the one which takes 30 mins as you can you can enjoy the view. Manly is amazing. You can visit the aquarium which I think Is a must. The baby penguins are sooooooo cute. Also the sharks and the ray fish at feeding time. There are several beaches but my favourite is the one to the left when you get off the ferry. Magical

Worth the Extra Cost?. If you are staying in Sydney proper, and wish to visit Manly (not sure why you would, other than "because everyone does"), the ferry ride will cost you more than other destinations. Reason: Manly is farther away (30 minutes by ferry). There is also something called the express ferry, but it will still take nearly 20 minutes one way. The regular ferries are run by the New South Wales government. The express ferry is a privately run venture and is more expensive. If you are planning to take the ferry to various destinations, look into a MyMulti Day Pass. This will get you unlimited access on all ferries, buses, and trains that are run by the New South Wales government.

Love the Many Ferry. Caught the ferry from Manly to the city. You will have two options a faster sleek hydrofoil type boat or a cute old school style ferry. If you are in no hurry catch the ferry. It's a world class boat ride for a pittance ($7) so go slow and enjoy it. Have your camera ready, the city, Opera House and the Harbor Bridge from the ocean is incredible. I also enjoy taking photo's of Luna Park. If you can go one way during day light hours and return of a night it's the best of both worlds. Manly is a fun place to visit as well. A little touristy but worth a visit. The beach is amazing, just head up the Corso.

Like floating on water.... The Manly Ferry trip was breathtaking, yet relaxing. I was able to take in the sights and sounds of the Harbour Bridge, Luna Park, and Manly Beach, all whilst crossing the beautiful majestic ocean that is in Sydney.Staff were lovely and professional, the atmosphere is simply stunning. You ought to try it at least once in your life5 stars from me :)

Super Trip. I had an hour to kill so I went on a random ferry. It went to Manly. I stayed on the boat, returned, grabbed my two other travelers and whizzed back to a most enjoyable afternoon on the beach. A warm afternoon and a gentle ferry out to Manly. A most memorable journey. A few days later heavy seas made this journey another excursion all together. Skip the bespoke harbour tours, just hop on the ferries.

Must do -- better than an expensive Cruise. Superb view of the city. 25 mins a way, Runs 2-3x per hour, ca 14.40$ an adult Return ticket -- this 2-4 times cheaper than a tourist trap cruise. Can highly recommend.

Will do again - Daytime Activity. I planned to do a twilight ferry ride, but unfortunately our departure was delayed by a cruise ship that was turning around in the Harbour. This meant that most of the ferry ride was in darkness, with only the twinkling lights of homes on the shoreline were visible. It was beautiful but I will definitely take the ferry again in daylight, and don't recommend a ferry ride past 8 p.m.When you board the ferry, head straight upstairs to the top floor and then right to the front of the boat. Here you'll find a small amount of outdoor seating that provides an unobstructed view for your ride. Be warned that it can be very windy and cool in the outdoor area, so you may want to bring a light jacket or hoodie. Because the seating was limited it filled up quickly, but then seats freed up as people headed inside to take a break from the wind. If there aren’t any seats available at first, stay close and some may open up part way through the ride.Also, there is a cafe on-board but it was closed when I took the evening ferry. If I had known I would have bought a cup of tea to keep me warm on the ride before boarding.

Cruising the harbour. Sit back, relax and take in the surroundings as you cruise from Circular Quay to Manly. Best with a pair of binoculars if you want to get a closer look at how the other half live in some of the harbourside properties! Go early and have lunch on Manly Corso before returning to the quay.
manley. fatastic day out ferries good value fantastic beach area good walks ,Plenty of places to eat try a bucket of prawns yum

Great on a sunny calm day. We took the ferry from Manly to Circular Quay on a gloriously hot and sunny day. It was a very smooth journey and we were lucky enough to be able to sit outside and enjoy the breeze. However, outside seating is very limited and if you don't want to be stuck inside, then it's essential to make sure you are at the front of the queue when boarding begins. If you haven't seen the sights before then aim for a seat at the front of the boat. It'll be windy, but the views are well worth it. If you simply want to enjoy the fresh air, then the small area at the stern is just fine.

Sunny afternnon on Sydney Harbour. An excellent quick version of a harbour cruise - a shortcut across without commentary and perhaps enough seating on the ferry with a good view, but still very enjoyable. Time along the shops of the Corso and on the beach at our leisure with a walk along the scenic walkway to lovely Shelley Beach for a swim.

Manly Ferry. This was a highlight of my time in Sydney. I always enjoy travelling on local public transport, but this was something else. Imagine coming to work this way every day. I had a swim followed by a great lunch in a fish restaurant. A perfect day!

Beautiful blue water, warm sun, sightseeing extravaganza. Caught the ferry to Manly. Not cheap at $14.40 each but reasonable value for money. Great views, relaxing and very enjoyable. Takes about 25 minutes from the no. 3 wharf at Circular Quay to Manly wharf. Lots of shops on the wharf and a wonderful walk down the esplanade to Manly beach.
very good. Ferry To Manly Beach,cost AUD13.50 each, but if you travel on Sunday and with child only cost AUD2.50 each . Its very worth and a must!
Cheap and useful. Took this from Manly back to Circular Quay. Sit at the front of the boat for great views heading back towards Sydney.

Fun Afternoon. We took the Ferry to Manly just to enjoy a boat ride and have some beers near a beach. This did just the trick. We enjoyed delicious beers at a little club right on the water and had a great time taking pictures on the ferry ride.
splash!. What a great way to travel into Sydney, loved it!!(Bought a pass for a week for $43 - brilliant value, could use it as many times as you wanted everday on any ferry, buses, trains).

Amazing. 1000 people and you wouldn't know it, what a great ride, so many people and still the ferry had heaps os seats and room to move. I get sea sick witht he smallest of swells but it was the smoothest ride ever.
Great view. Love this trip, it's like taking a cruise for a fraction of the price. And Manly is amazing - remember to get there early to get in the cue for tickets and then for the boat...
Excellent. Great way to see the habour and Opera house great ride easy acess Ferry leave every 1/2hr great day out

Very Crowded. Did the trip on Sunday so very busy. They were loading 1000 people onto Ferry at a time. Once on we managed to get an outside spot which was okay. very hot day and the walk to the Manly beach was very uninspiring, touristy shops in the mall. Beach beautiful but very crowded. Did the walk to Shelly beach which was more pleasant . Couldn't wait to leave.
The only way to travel!. What a way to see the harbour! And getting there is just the start. Manly is a wonderful and exciting spot. Definitely do the walk around the headland to Shelley Beach!
Best Value harbour Cruise around.... Worth the trip to Stunning Manly.... The Manly Ferry is the cheapest easiest way to see Sydney Harbour from the water, and at the end, you get Manly! Awesome...

Manly Ferry to Manly Beach. Short boat ride. @15 dollars! Short walk to a Beautiful beach! There is a Cole's supermarket on the way to the beach and that is the perfect place to stock up on lunch picnic items. No need to carry food all the way. Great scenery from the boat too.

Step off and you're in both sides of our choice. Hugo's on one end, the Opera House on the other. Nothing joins the traffic better than the Manly ferries. Hop on, take in the scenic journey while you are being funnelled to the next eating, shopping, chilling, drinking spots in between taking in the hoards of commuters. Blend in, be like a Sydney-sider for a day minus the baggages!

Beautiful way to see Sydney. The ferry across to Manly is a great way to see the various different locations and areas of Sydney. In many respects it is your own personal cruise of the Sydney harbour where you will see many of the best sites from the water... the Bridge, the harbour, the boats, the opera house and the heads.

What a Way to travel to work. When we first arrived from the UK in January 2011 we stayed in Manly for 2 months and my husband had to attend a training course for his new job in the city. He therefore took the Manly Ferry to work every day. He was blown away with such a tranquil and stress free way to go to work and back. He now works near the Olympic Park and has an hours journey to work and back every day. He certainly misses his lovely Ferry journey, I can gell you.

Sydney at its best. Best way to see beautiful Sydney especially if you have a bus/train/ferry pass.... See it all! This is Sydney's history, these beautiful old ferries! Get to Luna park, Manly beach,Balmain, Darling Harbour and must more.
Great views from the Ferry. Must-do experience, Manly atmosphere different to that of Sydney CBD and ferry trip affords the best views of the Bridge and opera House

Cheapest Harbour Cruise in the World. People complain that it's too much to pay for a ferry ride, but for about $6 (one way), you get a 40-odd minute trip on the most beautiful harbour in the world. And there's a bar.
Packed but pleasurable. We caught the ferry on New Years day and the weather was beautiful so the ferry was packed to capacity but the ferries are so efficent.
Relaxing. certainly worth the trip if only for the view alone. This is always worth doing while in Sydney to gain a very cost effective Harbour cruise

Look carefully when buying tickets. Be careful where you board! If you board at Darling Harbor you are ok, but if you board from the other location you need to buy an extra ticket. And you wont know that until you try to return from Manly and the ticket wont open the gate. The guys are nice though, so they let you through.

What a fun ride. I love boating and being on the water- so even though we took this as a means to get to the beach-- the ride itself is an event. great views of the coastline and beach houses, and city
Nice ride to Manly. Clean ferries.. It was a nice short ride to Manly. Clean Ferries. Nice little shop on board. Cell phone charging place. lots of room. Recommend it.
Great Harbor Ride. Easy to buy tickets. Easy to load on and off and find a place to sit. Surrounded by sailboats on our return in the late afternoon...beautiful.

the best way to see much of a beautiful harbour. The Manly ferries enable one to see almost all the harbour east of the harbour bridge, relatively cheaply and easily. The slow ferries provide the best tourist viewing while the fast ferries are intended more as a commuter service. Since it is one of the world's most beautiful harbours, it is fortunate to have such a convenient viewing method available.

must do as avalue trip across the harbour. the ferry trip is very cheap, and you get to cross the harbour. Get on board quickly to get the best views. The ferry ha screws in both directions so does not turn once it leaves the harbour. Manly beach and main street, seaside.
great way to see the entire outer harbor. nice peaceful ride... to a great town and beach great for shopping , beach and seafood ... a great day out

A worth and cheap cruise tour. Ferry ran from Sydney Harbour and on the way stopped at various piers and return. It gave tourists a very good and cheap tour of the Sydney Harbour and the neigbouring islands.

Brilliant. Great cheap way to see the whole of Sydney Harbour while getting to one of Sydney's premier beaches. Much less of a hassle than getting to Bondi if you're staying downtown, and much better waves too!

Great Day Trip. My husband and I took the Manly Ferry for a day-trip to Manly Beach. It was very clean, prompt, and a fun way to get to Manly. We thought the value was excellent. Highly recommend if you want to take a quick day trip.

Beautiful views of the harbor. Amazing views of the harbor. Clean. Quick. And on a day with clear skies you couldnt ask for anything more. I would suggest manly ferry over any dinner cruise or harbor cruise. It's cheaper and you get to visit the tow.
The view. The view looking back at the Opera House and Bridge is priceless. Plus Manly is a great suburb for beach, bars, food, surf, people.

Cheap way to see the Harbour. At only $14AUD return, the Manly ferry is by far the cheapest way to see part of Sydney Harbour. You don't go under the bridge, but the ferry takes you past the opera house and you get great views of the bridge and opera house as you power off towards Manly beach.The trip takes about 35 mins each way, and the ferries run every 20 minutes. They close the admission gates 2mins before departure, so don't be late! Your ticket is for any trip, however, so if you miss one, just take the next sailing.You can choose to be outside or inside. There are plenty of seats all over the ferry. Everyone tends to cram onto the parts that offer the views of the bridge, so be prepared to wrestle for photo positions!Once you get over to Manly, you can get off and have a look over there. My friend and I simply stayed on and came straight back, but if you have time, I think you could spend a lovely couple of hours over in Manly at the beach.There is a cafeteria of sorts on the ferry, but it wasn't the cleanest, so I wouldn't like to buy anything that could give me food poisoning! Take your own snacks if you can't wait the 35 mins to get to Manly.There is no smoking anywhere on the ferry, in case you were tempted... Ferry officials prowl the boat looking out for anything troublesome, so make sure you behave!Price-wide, best value for Harbour views hands down. A good, no-nonsense way to see some of this beautiful Harbour.
Superb trip with all the views thrown in.... A holiday in itself and the day spent at Manly was a fabulous day out, good food and beer at the Angry ? Report to follow..

awesome way to see the opera house. get a day pass and ride the ferries back and forth. the manly ferry takes you around the back of sydney opera house. wifi is free also, although I had a hard time connecting to it.

We saw dolphins from the ferry. Good trip over - not too long. We even saw dolphins in the bay as we pulled up to Manly!
If you have a sweet tooth buy some candy from the fantastic store as you walk through the terminal
Nice way to see Harbour. Manly ferry is great way to see the harbour on a budget. Great places on Manly wharf for lunch. Dont forget your swimmers

Efficient. On time and great views from right hand side of boat. Very. Comfortable. Queuing system works well and when we got off on return there were so many people that gates were opened and the trip was free

Worth it Even if You Don't Disembark!. Even if you decide to just ride to Manly and back, the ferry is worth it. We had bought MyMulti passes for our entire family, so busses, trains, and ferries were all paid for during our time in Sydney. Worth every penny since you buy once and then use over and over. The views leaving Circular Quay and heading toward Manly are wonderful. Lots of photo ops. Being on the water with a great breeze and feeling the waves was the perfect accompaniment to the breathtaking scenery. We had no idea that there was so much waterfront property in Sydney. Even though you could just go straight back to Circular Quay, do get off the boat and explore Manly. The beach is wonderful and you can watch surfers and volleyball games and people from all over the world.

Manly Ferry.. Great value. It was so good that we went there for two days during our five day visit. If you are over 60 a seniors card which covers all forms of public transport for $2.50 is great value.

A trip you must take. What a fabulous ferry trip!! The Opera House to your right and Sydney Harbour Bridge to your left. The thought sends shivers down my spine still. Manly was a super place. The beach was a good spot for people watching and the beautiful vista. If you are in Sydney, you really must take the Manly Ferry. It should be in the list of things to do before you die.

A very pleasant ferry trip with good views. As ferry trips go this was one of the better ones. This is not a luxury cruise ship but nonetheless a functional and efficient ferry service which brings with it great views. It takes just over half an hour to cross from Sydney to Manly.
beautiful view. take a ferry sail around the harbour and see the beautiful city of sydney from the water.stop by the restaurant by the harbour and enjoy the seafood.
Relaxing. A great way to have a day out & have a swim or just relax with family & stay to see the penguins at dusk.

Great Ride. The trip to and from Manly via the ferry is a lovely ride. The cost was around $15 return but well worth it for anyone visiting the area. The Manly Corso is a nice area to walk around once over there and Manly Beach is a popular spot. Sit back, relax, and enjoy the ride
We took the Manly Ferry on a windy day. The ferry was nice - it gives you a good view of the harbor. We had lunch in Manly and took a walk along the beach.
Great way to see the city.. We loved Manly Beach and wished we could have spent more time. I would considering staying there on my next trip to Sydney.

Lull into the magical world of ferry travel. There is something quite magical about travelling on a ferry. Watching this gigantic machine, gently manoeuvering against the wharft and gentle bump when it touched the side of the wharft never fail to take me back into my childhood of travelling to Penang on a ferry with my parents a long long time ago.One can never compared the well maintained Manly Ferry to Penang Ferry, but all the same, both carry a certain magic.The ever changing scenery, and how the city the gently emerged, making it self known, as we travel closer and closer.It is lovely way to discover Sydney and Manly is a beautiful part of Sydney
Easy access to a nice beach. Catch the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay and in about 1/2 hour, you can be eating fish 'n chips at a nice beach. The views of the harbour can't be beat!

Great Day Trip. The ferry is quick (30 minutes or so from the Quay to Manly) and easy. Once again, like most of Australia, not cheap. We caught a ferry around noon, and were able to get into Manly in time for some lunch of fish and chips (cannot miss this). Took a stroll on the beaches and took in the views. Beautiful place. We were on the boat by 4:00/4:30 and back in Sydney in time to explore other things.

Iconic trip. Circular Quay to Manly Harbour and back after some sun, a few beers and a meal. A really cheap way of getting the iconic view of the bridge, Opera House and harbour from the water. Much better than the expensive tours.Just be aware of the ignorant Jobs-worth at the Manly Harbour entrance gate who needs a course in customer management

Great way to see the harbour. An excellent way to get to Manly and also have some time on one of the most beautiful harbours in the world. Manly Mall area seems to be unedrgoing some revitalisation at present but the beach is always worth a visit even if it is just to paddle your feet and watch the surfies. The outside seats on the ferry are great if you want to get some fresh salty air.
Great views of Sydney Harbour. Great way to see Sydney Harbour and Manly beach is a nice place to go an visit anyway. Also much better value than some of the other harbour cruises on offer

Great way to see the city from the water!. These darling little ferries are clean and run very, very frequently. Prices are rock bottom. Take the ferry to Manly Beach, enjoy the beach and lunch, and return. Great day!

Take the this ferry so you can catch it at sunset. I loved this experience! We arrived to watch the sunset on Manly beach and had a beer at one of the pubs on the beach. Then we took the ferry back at night and wow were we glad we did! The photos turned out to be incredible!

See Sydney Harbour. A 30 minute trip across Sydney Harbour to Manly Ocean and Harbour beaches. You get the see a lot of the harbour and pass the heads of the harbour and get a bit of a roll on the ferry. Always full of local and overseas tourists enjoying the view. Plus a beach at the end and lots of restaurants and pubs and wlaks at Manly.
The best way to see the Harbour. The Manly ferry is really comfortable and convenient. Manly itself is a great destination for a day trip and not to be missed.
Best in rough weather !. Best ride in Sydney...the a beer at the Sth Steyne...brilliant.On a calm day enjoy the view, on a stormy crossing, hang on tight !

What a view. If you want a great harbour view of the Opera House and the Sydney harbour bridge then it's a must. The ferry departs every 22 minutes or so but the boarding closes two minutes prior to departure to ensure that it leaves on time. The actual ferry itself is not the newest but it is nice enough with all the basics you expect to find in a ferry. When arriving in Manly it's a nice place to have a drink or just relax on the beach.
Nice side trip. Manly has some awesome beaches and beautiful walks. The ferry ride is a great way to see the Opera House & Harbour Bridge
What a trip!!. The manly ferry is one trip that shouldn't be missed.....from the hustle and bustle of Circular Quay to Gods own country in 30 minutes..
Easy to Maneuver. Easy system, reasonably priced and efficient. The trip over to Manly was pretty and the ride comfortable. Getting off and on the boat felt a little like moving cattle...
Standard ferry service. A ferry service that gets you to a decent beach, which is easier than getting to Bondi from Circular Quay.
Nice ride. Nice trip to manly from circular quay. Lovely view of Opera House at night with great view of city lights.

Beautiful scenery. We took a ferry to Manly on Sunday, and it was really cheap due to family day, only $2.50/adult. The ferry ride to Manly offers beautiful view of Sydney, and it was much better than the bus. We had 2 big luggages, but it's not a problem at all, we found seats where we could put our luggages next to.

Don't miss this classic tourist icon. The Manly Ferry is the best value way to see the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and enjoy all the other sights of Sydney Harbour. There is even free wifi so you can email or Facebook your experiences to everyone at home straight away! Catch the ferry over to Manly in the afternoon, spend some time there and then catch it back at dusk. Amazing sunset and view of the lights on the return trip.

Cheapest trip in Sydney. When you visit Sydey, the first thing you shoud do, to get your bearings, is jump on the Ferry and enjoy the cheapest tour of Sydney, with all the best views available for no extra.

Great views on way out and beautiful place when there!. The ferry runs well and I loved being able to sit outside and enjoyed the wonderful waterside views of the city. Once in Manly loved the coastal walk and the shopping area and the choice of restaurants.

Best part of Sydney. Riding the ferry is the best ! You sit on these really cool boats and stare out at this beautiful harbor while listening to someone tell you about the history of the harbor. The best part is the ferry is always on time and very clean.

The ferry to Manly, what else can I say?. If you have to go Manly from the city, take the Manly ferry. About 25min ride. You get wonderful views of the Harbour and Opera house, as well as the suburbs of Sydney on your way to Manly. Lovely ride!

Good views of Sydney Harbour. The Manly ferry is a relatively inexpensive way of getting a good look at Sydney Harbour. Pick it up at Circular Quay and enjoy the ride out to the entrance to the Harbour which is where Manly is located. It takes around 40 minutes and runs the full length of the harbour. Manly is worth a couple of hours before taking the ride back.

Great day out!. If you're looking for a great day out and about then the ferry trip to Manly is fantastic, they run very frequently and are reasonably priced, The ferries themselves have both indoor and outdoor seating, so depending on the weather and how many photo's you wish to take there's an option that'll suit.Manly itself is great beach area, with plenty to do and see, some great food and drinks can be had from many number of places, there's a great German biergarden on the very waterfront, which I would highly recommend, from your pale ales, and pilsners, to a decent glass of wine.

You get there. It's a ferry - and you get to where you are going. Nothing amazing, nothing poor. Great way to see a little of the harbor of Sydney which is cheaper than some of the tours by far. At the end of the day it's a ferry. Not amazingly flash, not grotty either.
Fair Ferry. Nie views, comfortable journey, huge ferry, well organized and offers good views of the Sydney harborside and national parks

Great Scenic Ride. The Manly Ferry gives you a fish's eye view of Sydney Harbour, including the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and the gateway to the Pacific. It's a fun ride, not particularly expensive, and the best way to get to Manly.
Worth the trip.. Great ferry trip across the harbour and enjoyable visit to Manly. Typical beachside shops but odd bits here and there. Good market.

Cheap and pleasant. Something we always love doing when in Sydney - cheap, pleasant with some of the most spectacular views - I highly recommend this to anyone but part. those on a budget - don't miss!

Easy and fun. This was an inexpensive and very enjoyable way to see Sydney Harbor and visit Manly. The ride took about 20-25 minutes and was a breeze with lots of places to sit. You have to be early and move fast if you want a choice seat outside at the bow.

$14 Return. A great way to see the harbour for cheap. The Manly ferry is only $14 return trip and runs often between Sydney and Manly Beach.
The view from the harbour ferry offer much better photo opportunities of the harbour bridge and the Opera House.
Many beach is a nice change of scenery after a few days in Sydney.
Manly beach and shops. Like another village and great coastal walk. The ferry is longer than I had remembered but worth the trip for views along the harbour.

A tourist attraction in itself.. I felt like I was experiencing the real livelihood of Sydney in Manly so well worth the visit. The Manly Ferry journey itself was also stunning and a perfect way to orient yourself in this great city.

Great value Harbour Tour at public transport prices. The manly ferry is a very economical way to see the harbour and visit the start of Australia's famous Northern beaches. Exceptioanal value and will do it again

Postcard view of the opera house. Probably the cheapest way to get out into the water, 30min ride. AUD7/one way trip. If you time it right around the sunset, you can get yourself a postcard look a like view of the Sydney Opera House + the bridge all in one.
(you will need to endure the cold breeze to get this photo shot right)
A ferry ride to manly. It was a nice way to spend an afternoon. Ferry service is very efficient. It's a great way to get a different view of Sydney...
Manly Ferry. Very fun and reasonable- kindly recommended to me by Jason after day trip to Hunter Valley with wine tours with Jason

Noone should visit Sydney without doing. The trip to Manly on a ferry is for me something every visitor should do, showing the breadth of Sydney (manly is known as 7 miles from care). Going back the view is even better.

Sea and Air. This is one of the treasures of Sydney that we try and do every time we visit. It is just so relaxing and a great way to see the harbour and the heads. Manly is always fun too, especially on the weekend!
Great way to see the Opera House and Bridge. Had an excellent trip. Only about 1 hour round trip and very cheap. Highly recommended if you want to see things from a leisurely paced ferry

Addictive. Whenever I visit Sydney I take a trip on the Manley Ferry.This is a great way to experience the harbour. Today there are views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Plus there are usually a range of water craft from ocean going liners to small yachts. the harbour is so lively - all the time.The ferry is usually pretty crowded and there are some interesting people around. On one ferry trip I sat next to three girls using the ferry time to paint their toenails! The manly ferry is such fun.Sometimes I spend an hour in Manley but often I just get right back on and return to Circular Quay- inexpensive entertainment.
Great fun for small dollars.. The green and gold ferries are the best way to see Sydney Harbour. Pensioner rate $2.50pp for a days travel on ferries, rail and bus.

Cost-effective Harbour cruise. Got to be the best way to see Sydney Harbour when you are visiting our wonderful city. Best views, toilets on board, and you get to Manly so that you can see one of the best beaches in Sydney too. Take care in the suna s you can burn very quickly with our sunshine. Take water in summer too.Just perfect way to see our city from the harbour.

It's a very manly ferry. The ferry ride to manly is one of the most picturesque I've ever been on and I've done a lot in my time. With excellent views of the opera house, the bridge and Sydney itself, it will pay for itself in the "neener, neener" factor of the pictures alone. Also, you can get to Manly as well.The ferries are quite large so getting a seat will likely not be an issue unless you are restricted to be a certain distance away from kids. The best seats in the house are located outside on the upper deck, whichever direction you prefer to face. The ferries are a great trip in of themselves and Manly is the icing on the cake.

It's a ferry, but the destination rocks. The ferry itself is pretty nice... They run several kinds of boats so they're not all the same style. Some of them even have WIFI. The Manly town and beach are a great destination.

Takes me to the best part of Sydney. Really enjoy the Manly ferry.There is plenty of views to photograph from either side of the ferry.Ferry is smooth sailing but can become abit up and down as it passes the river/sea outlet.Overall great way and cheap way to get to Manly
A Cheap Ferry Ride. A great way to see the harbour at a minimal price. A bonus is getting off the ferry and enjoying Manly before heading back on the ferry
