One of the Gems of Sydney. Every 30 minutes...and promptly...the Manly Ferry departs from the Wharf at Circular Quay for Manly...the beach resort close to Sydney, $14 AUD round trip. Best value and best scenery in town.Ride itself is 30 minutes. Sit inside for the comfortable seats, or ride outdoors on limited number of bench seats and take in the salt air.Take the ferry round trip (1 hour) even if you don't have time for a day in Manly.Tip: Allow extra time for ticketing from the ticket machines. Lines form around a few machines, and tourist are unfamiliar how to use. Cash or credit card.Tip II: Also available, same wharf area, is a private operator of Manly Fast Ferries. Save 13 minutes out of 30 for premium price. But why rush the trip if you are a tourist?
A great day out. Manly is a lovely town well worth a visit. The beach is worth a visit. The ferry is good value and efficient. Views of Sydney harbour re great.
manly ferry -- great day trip. The trip to manly is a great way to see the harbor and a fantastic way to spend the day. Manly is awesome and highly recommend to anyone travelling through Sydney.

Nice trip across Sydney Harbour. This was a pleasant trip across Sydney harbour and much cheaper than a harbour tour. Plan to come back at night; the views of Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House lit up are spectacular.

At Least Hundreds of People on Board. The waiting time and the ride was fantastic. The ferry can hold up to a least a few hundreds of passenger and yet the waiting time to board and alight the ferry was not long at all.

A Fabulous Day Out From Sydney. With the sky clearing as we arrived at Circular Quay, the scene was set for a very enjoyable and picturesque half hour crossing to. Manley.An out door seat at the back of the ferry gives you great views of the bridge, the opera house and the city sky line. Passing close to Fort Dennison you also get great views of the harbour beaches and the headlands.Manly wharf offers a great selection of restaurants with fabulous views, a great place for a late lunch before the return ferry.A real highlight of our visit to Sydney.

The best and cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour. Its a great ride and Manly is one of the best must see destinations in Sydney. The Beach from North Steyne to Queenscliff is a great walk and if your lucky you might see a few 'white pointers' near Queenscliff beach...

Inexpensive way to take a "harbour cruise". Great way to view some of Sydney's harbour side landmarks... Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Luna Park, etc. for a reasonable price.Buy and return ticket from Circular Quay, find a seat on the outside of the ferry and enjoy the ride and the view.
Enjoy Manly. Best and cheapest way to go across to Manly, good trip to see the Harbour & enjoy the shops, the beach and fabulous eating places.

If you can only choose one ferry ride this is it!. The trip takes about 30 mins and gives a lovely view of the opera house and the bridge. Stops at Luna Park, which is also visual! Once you hit Manly it's very busy but there is plenty of room to wander
Excellent. WiFi access FREE, excellent trip running on a regular basis. You can even use the same ticket as the train and bus system.
Regular Service. The Ferry runs on a regular basis, the boat itself is huge with plenty of seating available which is handy as this ferry seems to be very popular, lovely views on the way over.

A fun ride but safety is an issue. We took the fairy several times between Sydney and Manly. The boats were clean and the trip was fun. There are many sites to see in the harbor. There is a lack of security on these boats. My friend set his camera bag down for a second to put on his backpack. A lady grabbed it and ran off the boat with $2,500.00 in equipment. There was no security of police at the terminal to assist or stop the thief. In fact, no police anywhere in site for this large port facility!

One of the best ferry rides, with great views of harbour.. The ferry is the best ways to get to Manly, and also have spectacular views of the most memorable harbour in the world.Once at Manly, it is only a short stroll to one of Sydney's most impressive beachs, with a great walk along the Promenade.If you want one of the best views of the city, get up to North Head, for a breathtaking view up the harbour, to the city.Never to be forgotten!
Best way to get into the city. Gorgeous trip into/out of the city! Great bars/restaurants/cafes at Manly wharf with great views too... so why not have a bevvy or two?
Ferry. Nothing much to like or dislike. It is a ferry... That goes to Manly... The Manly Ferry.takes about 20 minutes each way.
30 mins is all it takes. Took a return ferry ride from Sydney Harbour to Manly, all it took was 30 mins. Manly beach is amazing.... lots of choices to eat around in Manly..
Good Service. The ferry service to and from Manly is regular the vessels are well maintained, clean and offer a great view. No Negatives.

A must do trip. Take the slow boat and enjoy the 30 mins trip along Sydney Harbour. Free WiFi now in some areas onboard. As a Senior I paid $2.50 for a Day Excursion ticket at the terminal and used it for all my travel that day. Walk through to Manly and buy lunch, have an ice cream at the beach, and hop on the ferry back to Circular Quay.
Great Views. Probably the most affordable way to unintentionally view the opera house and harbour bridge and it is especially nice to take a ferry when the sun is going down!!!

Well worth doing!. It is well worth taking time to go across the harbour to Manly. The ferries are quite large and if you want to be at the front they are the "push me pull me" type so unlike the ferries for instance to Watsons Bay which turn round before leaving they go straight out. Coming back after dark the view ofSydney by night is spectacular.
a must. a must if your visiting sydney.get great views of the harbour,bridge and opera house as well as being able to get free internet and charge your phone while on the ferry.

Really fun. Do visit Manly, the ferry trip is great and its a lovely little town. You see a lot of the surrounding scenery from the boat. The service is very regular and until quite late in the evening.

It does what it says on the tin. There's no better short sea journey anywhere in the world than Circular Quay to Manly on the ordinary, cheap and frequent ferries. Take a return trip and eat at Hugos on the ferry wharf. A great trip out on Sydney's incomparable Harbour. Cheap too. Don't bother paying extra for the fast ferry. The half hour slow boat gets there quite quick enough.

Nice boat ride to Manly. It's best to get a seat on the top deck-outside, which offers views over 180 degrees. You get to see both sides ,and each offers different views- suburbia, different beaches, rocks,and even a glimpse of the open sea.It takes good 20 min-depending on which craft you hop on. Manly itself is an interesting place-well worth a day visit.

Best way to view Sydney Harbor. We purchased a 5 day pass and got more than our money's worth. Ferry ride from Manly to Circular Quay is by far the nicest but we road all the ferries and took in as much of the harbor as we could. Having the pass allowed us the freedom to hop on and off any time we wanted without the worry of purchasing tickets each trip. Plus we got our monies worth the first afternoon there when we were jet lagged with no energy and just spent the afternoon riding all the ferries and getting the lay of the land. Free wifi on the upper deck was also very helpful for us.
Cheap way to take in the views. Was a very cheap price to get a family ticket over to Manly from Circular Quay and was a good way to see the sites from the harbour out on the water.
Great service. Left on time, only $7 per adult - best views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Forget about paying for a cruise, take the ferry to Manly and back.
great idea for hot day. Cheap way to have a harbour cruise, lots of interesting shops at Manly and good places to have lunch, check out the Mexican

Nice scenic tour of the harbor.. Why go on a scenic cruise around the harbour when you can take the ferry to Manly and see much of the same and visit a spectacular place called Manly. They have advertised it with a slogan 'Seven miles from Sydney, thousand miles from worries' or something and I think they got it right with it.

Gives you a good view of the harbour. Went to Manly beach for the day and the ferry was really good. It takes approx 45 minutes to go to Many and you get to se the opera house and harbour bridge from a great angle. Much cheaper than the hop-on-hop-off ferry and much cheaper
This is a must do to travel with the Sydney commuters. We spent the day on Manly Beach and this is a great way to travel with great harbour and city views for the camera

Spectacular views. had to great day taking the Manly Ferry from the Quay. Enjoyed a walk about the shops, up to the beach front and glance through the Markets, lunch and the ferry back to the Quay. Love the lolly shop where you catch the ferry. Munchies for the return trip. The views along the way are great. A recommended must do!
Views were great!. The ferry itself is standard-issue but the views were awesome! Make sure to bring your wide-angle as well as your telephoto camera lenses!
crowded but certainly worth the trip. Noone likes the crowds, but you can try and time it a little bit better than (mornings are especially good).
Legendary. One of the must do's in Sydney! Buy a day rover ticket to ride lots of ferrries - it's the best way to see the city from the water.
Nice. nice ferry ride available at various times throughout the day. A great way to experience and see the Sydney skyline at night

Must Do in Sydney. If you are in Sydney, the ferry trip to Manly is a must. The view as you pass through the Opera House is simply breathaking. The trip is around 40 minutes but you would pass through an amazing feature as you reach to the open sea. It is simply an amazing boat ride which I would definitely recommend.
On the Ferry. Lovely views of harbourside suburbs. Even on a cloudy day the view is still great. It was good to be able to show our visitors the wonderful harbour.
Cheap way to take a cruise on the Sydney Harbour. This is a must for everyone who visit Sydney. We took the ferry to the manly beach. The journey was pleasant & enjoyable!
Great value. We had a weekly ticket for all ferries, buses and trains. What great value to travel on the Manly Ferry. A cafe on board for snacks keeps the kids happy and Manly is such a lovely place.

See the Opera House and Harbour Bridge from a different view. Cheap, relaxing and comfortable way to get to another attraction in Sydney. The Manly Ferry take approx. 30 mins to get to Manly. Along the journey, you get to see beautiful sights and just enjoy the smooth but sometimes rocky ride. Getting back from Manly to Circular Quay using the ferry gives you a great view point for the Opera House. Why pay more for other modes of transportation when you have the best in offer for less?

FAST, EFFICIENT and the BEST views of SYDNEY OPERA HOUSE. This is an awesome ferry to take. ($14 round trip) There is a lot going on at Circular Quay before and after you embark on this great little trip. Manly is also a great place to rent bikes and get lunch.
A must-do on a hot sydney day. A 30 minute ferry ride across the beautiful harbour to lovely Manly. Crowded on a summer weekend, but still worth the sea breezes and views.

A must in Sydney. When in Sydney a ferry ride is a must, this is great way to see Sydney's harbour just like Captain Cook would have seen the beaches,cliff faces and landscape. Don't just take one ride try them all.

Leave Sydney for a day, and take the Ferry to Manly. We had been told that when in Sydney we must do Manly. So a short ferry ride for the overseas port on the regular ferry service took us there on hot spring day in November. We loved the place, with its great little shopping area leading from one beautiful quite beach, to another surfing, more popular beach.Manly is a place I would visit again if in Sydney.

Great wee boat trip, and just as good, you end up in Manly. That was surprisingly good value and Manly was a surprisingly nice place. A typical wee seaside place, bit posh, bit tacky, bit of everything. The ferry doesn't spin around - it has a bow at each end - so you can choose to sit outside and get the view you want (eg at circular Quay, the east side of the ferry for the opera house, west side for the harbour bridge). $14 return, cheaper for concessions.
See the whole of the bay. This is the best way to see the whole of the bay right to the Heads. Then walk through to the Ocean and sit or surf. A good contrast to Sydney itself.

Great value for money.. Taking the Manly ferry from Circular Quay to Manly wharf is a very nice cruise. You’ll see wonderful views of the Sydney harbor including the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Hornby Lighthouse and lots more.At the end you reach to the most beautiful area in Sydney, Manly. You can just walk through The Corso have a nice walk between Manly beach to Shelly beach. Enjoy the sandy beach and the osean waves.Eat a seafood dish in a restaurant or takeaway but be careful of the seagulls they are pretty bold and aggressive when you have food in hand.

:). was a good way to see the opera house from a different angle and of course the free wifi was handy as their is not many places that have free wifi in sydney!just another way to see parts of sydney and the surrounding area.
Must Do. A great way to see the harbour, after fish and chips at Manly to travel back up the harbour at sunset is quite something.
Great views. You get great views from the Manly Ferry but it is very busy, especially over the weekend, so you don't always get a good seat.

Slow and easy with free Wi-Fi!. Who could ask for anything else, 25 minutes on the water at about 8 to 10 knots and free wireless Internet access? Reminds me of a modern day "African Queen". The Sydney to Manly Ferry is an experience not to be missed. Departing from Circular Quay to Manly to the North of Sydney, the view of the Sydney Opera House on the port side is not to be missed and so is the view of the Sydney Bridge from the stern - have those cameras ready! Of course there is the other high speed ferry to Manly but I highly recommend this slow but steady as she goes old vessel reminiscent of years gone by befitting so much of Sydney's past history. Go early and spend your entire day around Manly with many available walks and time your return to catch the sunset just behind the old "Coat Hanger" for the perfect day away from Sydney.
Great day out. The ferry trip is just the start! Manly is a glorious place. There are fantastic walks away from the beach area where nobody seems to stray.
Very nice ferry ride to Manly.. The ride was quick and the views along the way were very interesting. View of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Sydney Opera House were really good from the ferry.

Things to do..... Always a nice little day trip on a fine day ~ for a walk through Manly's shopping mall (prettiful) and along the beach/esplanade. Getting the ferry one way and catching a bus back to the city gives you more views, as an optional add on.

Best way to see the Harbour. I had heard it before, but yes it was the best way to see the Harbour in its entirety. Unfortunately, the day we went it was overcast, but it was still a wonderful sight both ways as we left the Harbour for Manly and on the way back as we entered the Harbour. Best place on the ferry is the forward top open deck.
seniors. Visiting seniors card holders to Sydney need to put this on the list$2.50 each, Circular Quay to Manly, have a walk around, back to Circular Quay and hop on the bus back to the hotel!

A trip to enjoy. The ferry to Manly provides a fantastic view of the Sydney Harbour including the Sydney Bridge, Opera House, the high rise buildings of the CBD and the surrounding area on either side of the shoreline. The ferry approaches Manly from the point where ships enter the harbour through a narrow opening in the land where one tends to enjoy the waves and the rolling of the ferry as it cross the waves perpendicularly.
Best view in Sydney. Big old ferries with lots of outside seating allowing you to take in all of Sydney Harbour from the best vantage point possible.
free wifi!!. Good way to get to Manly (which is also awesome!). You get free wifi on the ferry which is great and the ride is not too long. If it's a good day, go up top and go outside!

A must do for everyone. Great way to see our beautiful harbour. Plan a day trip, and stay at Manly for lunch. If you walk through The Corso and turn right, there is a wonderful walk to Fairy Bower, the little beach tucked away at end of Manly Beach. This way you have a great walk and wonderful view of Manly, most don't see. Plenty of cheap great cafes for lunch or evening meals

Ice cream, perfect waves, quaint village...it doesn't get much better. Perfect beach getaway for any age. Hike over to Shelly beach while you are there. Enjoy the waves, watching the surfers and eating delicious ice cream cones! Also, the take-away food (clam strips and chips) was great.

Manly Ferry - Must do. The best part of this is the spectacular views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge as you leave or enter Circular Quay. Exceptional photo opportunity in a prime location for approx $10- Excellent value for money! It also serves a purpose. - Getting to Manly! Nuce little mall area, great Icecreams!!!! Cool place to sit and watch the world go by with a latte or wine.... And I personally could spend hours sitting on the beach steps - watching waves & people. If you want to be more entertained.. find out where you are going! Read up on it, get a flyer, talk to locals - anything really! It's easy - and teh area and history are fantasticFirst - you have to be aware of where you are going! Read up on it, get a flyer, talk to locals - anything really! It's easy - and teh area and history are fantastic
nice trip. The ferry left on time and was great to take in the sites along the way. The food was pretty well priced and had a good selection :)
Great way to see the harbour. It is truely a cheap great way to see the harbour. The added bonus is Manly is also a great place to walk around for a couple of hours!

not very ointresting. The Mamley ferry is an icon of SydneyHarbour.The ferry goes every half hour and seemed to be always full.Sorry but I found it to be boring, little to intrest me ,and the ferry was not that clean.It did its job discription and took people between point a and b.

Great journey. All the ferries are efficient - they are so used to quick stops etc as they're travelling around the different harbours all the time. The Manly ferry takes about half an hour and takes you on a scenic journey to Manly (definitely recommend a visit there). Get a day's pass and do as many journeys as you can - that's the cheapest.

Ferry to Manly? Mad not to!. Why would you take any of the Harbour Cruises on offer from Circular Quay when you can take the cheaper, more enjoyable ferry across to Manly - where, once there, you can wander up to North Head or just around to Shelley Beach; or along the promenade up to Queenscliff; take a drink on North Steyne beach or overlooking the wharf, have a surf - or just stay on the ferry and head back again. It is clean, efficient and affordable - toilets on board, usually a kiosk to buy drinks from, with inside and outside seating. The ferry offers all the best views from the harbour of the iconic sights plus the extras: Kirribilli House; Farm Cove; Rose Bay sea planes; Watson's Bay light house; the Heads; Middle Harbour. Coming back to the Quay in the evening, drawing past the Opera House to the left and Bridge to the right,is one of the world's most spectacular and affordable sights. Be warned though, as summer approaches, tourist influxes may make for quite crowded ferries - especially on the weekends. I've sat outside at the front and not seen a thing because of 2 rows of tourists standing in front of me taking photos! Asking them to occasionally move though does make a great opener to meeting new people. Just enjoy - everyone else is.
Great day out. Great day out to head over to Manly, good for food and people watching! Easy to get to and boats go every half hour..

A must do on a visit to Sydney. The trip was a little choppy but what a cheap way to go on a harbour boat trip. The only down side was that the crew were no where to be seen during the trip - all holed behind the doors marked crew only - it would have been nice to have seen one or two of them during the crossing. The crew also seemed very bored with the whole process of docking and did not engage with anyone - come on guys it may be a repetitive job but look where you are working - you could be stuck in a factory!

A sailing we will go!. Well not quite sailing, but what a great way to get to the city from Manly. And to think that this tourist attraction is the regular means of transport for thousands that work in the city on a daily basis. How great is that!.

Best short ferry ride in the world!. I have taken this ferry ride a number of times over the years, and it remains just about the most scenic. This trip we also passed some migrating humpback whales, and got to see the penguins that live under Manly pier
Great Trip. We found the ferry clean and well kept. It was a delight to take from Circular Quay to Manly Beach for a day trip. Worth the time and effort
Fast Ferry. What a way to leave Sydney and head to the delight that is Manly...arrive at the Wharf, quick beer and then down the Corso..!!! Happy Days

Brilliant.. Manly beach is beautiful - make sure you wander around to neighbouring beaches if you can, as you can climb the coast rocks (seeing spiders and water dragons on your way) and get a stunning view of the Tasman sea.And make sure you have fish and chips on the beach; it's a bit of a thing to do I understand!
Great experience. Our family loved the ferry trip from Quay to Manly. Nice experience for family outing in Sydney. Luckly we had a quite sea
Take a trip. Great the ferries come regualrly easy to get on and off great views on the harbour - we went across to the zoo a fun trip.
Sydney Icon. Peer at the multi millionaires lifestyle for a couple of bucks. A pleasant journey with the opportunity of lunch or some beach time in Manly
It's a ferry to Manly. It is a ferry to Manly Beach. That's all. A nice ferry with nice views, but come on, in this case it is the destination not the journey that is 5 star.

Great way to see the harbour. Always good value travelling on the Manly ferry, the best pictures are on the return journey back to Circular Quay if you are lucky enough to iget the sunset, ice cream at the Manly wharf is a lovely finish after a dip in the ocean before heading back to the city.
Manly Ferry. This is a great trip to go back and forth to Manly Beach. It is nice to get in line early so you can get chairs outside on the top.

Best Travel Deal in Sydney. This has to be the best deal in Sydney, for the price of a bus ticket you get a scenic cruise to the harbour entrance and dropped of at Manly. Theres a good food court at the Manly pier and a pub over the water as well. Main attraction at Manly is the beach and national park.

Pleasant trip great views, worth the trip. The manly ferry crossing is a great trip to view the harbour, the brigde the opera house, fort denison and views of the heads and many surroundng features.
I would recommend this trip to anyone on a sunny day well worth it

One of the world's best ferry rides. This is such a great trip - you get to see all the iconic sites. Enjoy! But sit outside to get the best views. Take your camera! Take ferry from Circular Quay - takes about 30 mins. Facilities on board. Oct 2012 fare return is about AUD 10 but you might be better to take advantage of the My Sydney Multi Day pass at AUD 21 if you are coming into the city from outside

A great ferry trip to a great place!. The half hour ferry trip to Manly is excellent and great way to see the view of Sydney from a different perspective. Manly itself is also worth visiting. A beautiful town.

Busy but a lovely way to see the harbour. Went over in the afternoon, had a pizza and came back at night, a breat way to see the Opera House and bridge at night. The ferry was very full but comfortable, the fares very reasonable. A must do in Sydney.
Great trip. You just have to take the ferry across to Manly. Great views across the harbour and Manly is great and the beach fantastic.
good signts of Sydney ferry. goes every half hour, see most of Sydney Harbour, and good beach at Manly for relaxing when you get there

Cheapest way to see the harbour. We are locals to Manly (live 1.5 kms away) and I would always recommend any tourist to our beautiful city to take the ferry and come over to the North, it is the cheapest harbour cruise you will get and the North side of Sydney is gorgeous. We never get sick of seeing our beautiful harbour this way and catch the ferry all the time into the CBD. If you are active and have a few hours then I highly recommend the scenic walk, you can do all or part of it. If you want to walk all the way to the Spit bridge it is 10kms one way, some parts are difficult but it is worth doing if you have no mobility issues. When you get off the ferry keep to the left side and you will pass Nando's, turn left and walk along the harbour towards the Manly Aquarium and go past it. You will see a set of steps, once you are up there you are on the walking path, enjoy! It really is worth it, I run along here all the time and never tire of it :-) It might be worth downloading a map or asking the tourist info office for one before setting off but there should always be people to ask if you need any help. If you aren't up for that much walking then keep going straight ahead from the ferry and walk down the Corso towards the surf beach. At the beach if you turn right and head South there is a very pleasant walk to Shelley Beach, the walk to Shelley from the beach is only 1km one way. For a nice cocktail I highly recommend Sugar Lounge as a lovely place to relax. There are also markets on every weekend in the Corso and Manly is well worth a visit (even though I am biased, hehehe).

Great views and cheap! A Must do!. The ferry to Manly is a great way to experience the natural beauty of Sydney's natural harbour. Best pictures of the Opera house form the ferry! $14 AUS round trip!If you're taking the ferry, try to take the seats outside, and most of the views would be to the right hand side (if you're traveling in the direction of Manly). I'd think the best seats to take are the ones on the rear, to your left since you can look back at the city when the ferry travels to Manly. On the way back sit on the opposite side to get another view.There is a cafe onboard in case you want to get a drink or some nibbles.Manly id a fun place ! Walk the beach to the right and follow he path. You will see sea birds and even water dragons!No you wont get sea sick the ferry is large and very stable.Have fun!
Great views for little cost. This isn't a guided tour, rather it is low cost transportation to a beautiful beach area with restaurants and shops. And the views along the way are incredible.

A must-do tour. Loved the ride across the harbour to Manly, seeing the Opera House from the sea-ward side. Manly clean and pleasant with excellent beach. Variety of cafes and reastaurants along the front, with seafood a speciality. Sheltered nature of harbour means that even the most fait-hearted sailor should be fine.
Gorgeous. Caught the ferry to Manly and spent the day here walking and sunbathing on the beaches. Excellent views and think we may have seen a whale from one of the viewing areas!

Cheap and amazing. Just get a ticket form CQ to Manly for only $6 and enjoy the view past the opera house and the harbour bridge. It takes about 30 minutes to get to Manly. Then enjoy a day at the beach!

A fun way to see Sydney. This is a really good way to see Sydney from the water as it is quite different for seeing it from the land The visitor places eg Opera house, Admiralty House,Prime Minister's house,etc could all be seen easily are recognized .There were a lot of private boats sailing & fishing as we went past .

Best & inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbour (short of someone taking you on their own boat). It may not have commentary, but it's beautiful and on a glorious day, spectacular. Best part, pretty inexpensive. You can sit inside or if your quick and early on board, you can sit outside.

Beautiful view from the water. We purchased a day ticket which allows us to travel on all the ferries on the harbour. The manly ferry was great because it takes around 30 minutes to get around to manly and you can see the Opera House and the Bridge close up from the water, naval ships and the best houses on the harbour as you work your way around to Manly. On the way back make sure your at the front of the boat to get the best photos of the bridge, opera house and of course Sydney. It does get a bit windy but that`s all part of the fun.
Manly ferry. we took the manly ferry trip over to the zoo,it was a nice trip out and we enjoyed the zoo as well,not really a fan of zoo`s,but it was ok
the manly ferry. great trip lots to see a must to do for any visiting Sydney even just for the trip it's self . there is an aquarium in manly too if you want to visit that while you are there.

A "must do" for visitors to Sydney. This is a really pleasant boat trip which goes from Circular Quay past the Opera House and down the centre of the magnificent Sydney Harbour. On a windy day its can be a bit rocky when the boat passes the opening to the harbour known to Sydneysiders as "the Heads". Cheap, fun and takes you to the very pleasant suburb of Manly which is worth a walk around and a swim or surf if the time of year is right.

Fun for the family. A great little adventure on the harbour for families, couples and singles a like. Lots to do at both sides of the harbour. Only really a problem if you sit next to someone 'weird' who spoils your trip babbling on about random stuff!

Great Transportation with a free cruise. If you have an extra day in SYD the ferry to Manly is an excellent value. First it takes you to Manly beach where you can visit a cafe or restaurant, Go to a beautiful beach, walk in a nature preseve or shop is a boutique.It provides an awesome opportunity to view the harbour and take pictures of many of the awesome back drops.

Fantastic views. loved the ferry trip from Sydney Harbor. We took the ferry on a Sunday afternoon and the restaurantsin Manly were full of people having a great time. The views were outstanding and an overall great afternoon trip.
A cheap way to see the sights. If you want to see the other parts of Sydney then take a ferry ride or two especially on a cold and blustery day, they will give you a good experience.

White knuckle ride. Not the fault of the operators, but the day we did the Manly Ferry, there was a massive swell and the boat was pitching everywhere. Luckily we don't suffer from seasickness so made it across the harbour in one piece! On the good side, it was a excellent value, reliable and very comfortable, despite the conditions. Thoroughly recommended to tourists wanting a cheap way to see the city from the water.

A Must to do when visiting Sydney. We lived in Manly for a year and we really suggest anyone who comes to visit Sydney to take the ferry to Manly from Circular Quay on a sunny day and relax on your half an hour ride.look around and take pictures of the Opera house and the bridge ,you'll never be able to take better pictures.If it is a Saturday or Sunday you will enjoy all the sailing boats that race in the wonderful Sydney harbour.when in Manly take a walk ,have a coffee,relax on the many beaches and make your way back to Sydney late as possible when all the city lights up.

Ferry Trip. Lovely staff and was very easy to buy tickets, we didn't have to wait long for the boat and the journey was very pleasant - great way to spend a sunny day. Fantastic way to take in the view of the bridge and opera house.

Quick trip to a great town. We took the Manly Ferry to explore the beaches around Sydney. While it was a bit too cold to go in the water there was lots to see walking around the town. Nice laid-back atmosphere with some beautiful homes to look at. The ferry was quick and cheap...just the way we like it.

Best tourist trip in Sydney. This trip shows you a lot of Sydney Harbour and its beauty. Pinchgut or Fort Denison is passed at close quarters, lighthouses and if you are lucky the waves will give you a thrill crossing the beautiful heads. Then there is Manly! Wow!
Love Manly Ferry. The ferry services in Sydney are reliable, cheap and good fun. The trip to Manly for lunch and a walk around was a nice way to spend an afternoon.

Great way to get into the city. The Manly Ferry is perfect for getting into the city if you're staying in Manly. You also get a spectacular view of the Sydney Opera House and Story Bridge. Take a jersey with as it can get a little chilly if you sit outside. We took the ferry back to Manly at night and really enjoyed the beautiful view of the bridge and Opera House lit up at night.The ferry is very reliable and safe.

Trip to Manly a must. Took the ferry to Manly. Around $9 a ticket I believe and well worth it. Bought tickets right out front in Circular Quay. Can't miss it. Great views of harbor there and back. Now we know why it's such a recommended trip!

Jump on the boat early. Be sure to get a front row seat outside on the ferry so you can capture the many sailboats, the harbour bridge, the opera house, the island, downtown sydney, the homes and manly wharf... be sure to wear a jacket and watch out for the waves coming at ya!
A way to see the harbour. Having crossed the harbour 3 times over 10 years we are still smitten with the views as you cross to Manley. Just spot the millionaires houses.

Okay. We heard that this was a must to do when in Sydney. So, one afternoon we took the ferry. The ride to Manly had some good scenery, but after seeing some really beautiful places in AU, this was not outstanding. Manly itself is a "tourist town" with lots of souvenir shops. Walked around for a little while and visited a few shops. Near the end of our stay, discovered the beach on the other side of town and that was pretty good to see. That is where all the surfers are and they train the future life savers. somehow we missed that part when people were telling us about the ferry, and that turned out to be the best part of the trip. If you take the ferry, be sure to go to the right beach in town!

Brilliant for the price!. If you want a Harbour Cruise and don't want lunch, you could do a whole lot worse than just catching the Ferry to Manly. It's cheap, frequent and quite fast and you can get a fair sun tan on the way over to what I consider the best beach in Sydney...

Not a trip to Sydney without it. I usually stay in Many when visiting Sydney, and why not when it is so easy to travel the habour in such a wonderful way. You just have to make sure you sit outside and sit on opposite sides each way. Yes it's chilly at this time of the year, but what the hell!!
What Organisation. It shifts thousands every day.The Organisation runs like clockwork, it must do because of the hundreds loading and off-loading. Its comfortable, fast and a great experience. Do it

Ferry across the waters.. Crossing to Manly in the daytime is nice enough but the thrill is taking the late night ferry back from Manly. Get on deck and soak in the fresh air and the lights of Sydney harbour, Sydney bridge and Opera House.

Whoops!. The Manly ferry takes you almost out to the headland and so hits choppy water. If you get seasick be mindful of this. It's a stunning trip, where you get to see the Opera House and bridge in all their glory and of course you get to see the most beautiful Manly beach when you get there. Definitely a ferry ride worth doing.
Manly. A ferry ride across to Manly and it`s great beaches.Also a good shopping area and restaurants and pubs.

One of the great ferry rides. Over to Manly, walked along the foreshore, had lunch at a great little restaurant, looked in the shops and walked around to Shelly Beach and the headland. We spent most of the day there.

Manly Ferry - Wonderful Cheap Cruise of the Harbour. This is a must in Sydney. I have done it many times over the years with visitors to Sydney and also if I just want to get to Manly from the City - it is always wonderful on a sunny day and a cheap cruise.

Fun trip for a day at Manly. Well worth the fare. Jump on at Circular Quay spend the day in Manly, head back the same way in the afternoon. Especially fun when crossing the entrance to the harbour and the waves rock the boat :-)

best harbour views!. commuting between the city and Manly by a half hour ferry is a great day out. circular quay was pretty busy at rush hour but the ferry was big enough to find some space outside and get some good if-touristy shots of the harbour at sunset
what a way to spend the morning. This is cheapest way to see all of this beautiful harbour. Have a morning coffee in Manly and a swim.

An absolute must when in Sydney. You could not visit Sydney and not take a return trip on the Manly Ferry. Starting out at Circular Quay, it is a brilliant way to see the spectacular harbour and once you arrive at Manly it is just a short stroll to the Beach where you can extend your stroll to Fairy Bower. If you take this trip on the weekend you can also witness the recreational activity that takes place on the harbour e.g. yacht races or just a leisurely sail. However, Manly does get rather crowded on the weekend, especially in summer.
best way to see the Harbour. so much fun , the kids love it its not short but you get to see all the great things the harbour has to offer and Manly is a treat in itself
sailing to manly. it was a lovely sailing over and the weather was class, the beach omg it was far nicer then bondi, it was a lovely wee place to walk along the beach and town was so nice as well.

Cruise the beautiful sydney harbour. See sydney from the water by taking a trip on the manly ferry. You will see fort Denison, garden island and taronga zoo on the way to manly. Get off the ferry and visit the iconic manly beach. On the return trip see the harbour bridge and the opera house from a different perspective. Well worth it.

one day pass took every ferry ride. one day pass took every ferry ride. Some rides looked liked they were set up for a few people who live in "exclusive" wealthy communities. Many rides went empty. How does this system get financed?
Great sightseeing. A walk through the Corso to sea and beaches was delightful, we had lunch. and a beer at the hotel, and of course a Copenhagen waffle-cone before heading back to Circular Quay

What a lovely surprise. The ferry was great - we were there for half term so very busy with teenagers but that didnt matter and it was a lovely trip and the highlight was arriving in beautiful Manly so close to sydney and so different - worth the trip do no miss it!
Great. One of the to dos in Sydney. One of the to dos in Sydney. You have a great view to Sydney Downtown, Habour brigde and Opera house. Also the arrival at Manly is very pretty.
The best view!. Excelent to take pictures of the Opera, 30 minutes trip, totally worth it. Free Wifi Acces. Try to get in first, so you can sit outside...its gets full and the sits are few!!

choppy weather. We went across to Manly from Circular Quay. As we went over the water was starting to get a bit choppy. When we went to go back the weather had really packed it in and our Ferry was cancelled. They put on free buses for us to get back to Circular Quay. The buses were packed but everybody accepted the fact it was the only way to get back and were quite happy. Besides we were able to see more of Sydney. Good on you Manly Ferries!

great way to see the harbour. much cheaper than one of the river cruises, nice little journey over to manley for a walk around a bite to eat and a few drinks then back on the ferry to sydney.good day out!!
Great value. This as a real bargain you get to see the sites and also taking a trip to Manly. We really enjoyed the whole trip I am sure that this is the best value for money trip around the harbour.

Don't need a harbour cruise!. Just take the ferry to Manly and you see the harbour in all its glory. Walk down the main street in Manly and have fish and chips for lunch and then see the beach and Pacific Ocean.Best tip if you are coming from outside central Sydney is to buy a My Multi ticket as that takes you on buses, trains, and ferries all day. $21 is a real bargain especially if you're going a long way on the train.

great way to get to the beach!. easy way to get over to manly, every 20 minutes or so. highly recommend the manly scenic walkway. a flight attendant recommended it and i wish i could find him and thank him! awesome.

best value in sydney. The manly ferry is the best value in sydney for the price of a ferry trip you get a spectacular water view of the opera house, bridge and city skyline then the harbour foreshore and finially manly. A walk around the world famous surf beaches some fish and chips and then a sunset return to the city.

Great way to see the harbour. We used the ferry to get to and from manly but if you are visiting Sydney it is a great way to view the bridge and Opera House from a unique angle. Plus Manly is beautiful and worth the trip.

Good service. We took the ferry from Sydney harbour to Manly beach.You can buy your tickets at the quay side.The service runs half hourly and takes a half hour too.You can sit outside on the ride over and enjoy the spectacular views of the harbour.

Really enjoyable day. Lovely ferry trip across the harbour to Manly ,its definitly worth the trip.There are frequent crossings during the day and again you have great views of the opera house and bridge.

Better remedy for jet lag than sleep!. Hop aboard the Manly Ferry for a day trip to Manly Harbor and the beach. Sail past the Opera House. Follow the beach crowd to the wonderful walking trail along the ocean. Lots of cafes in town. Cute art deco beach houses along the streets. Take a swimsuit if the weather is warm.

What a hoot. We took the ferry over to Manly on the first warm/hot day Sydney has seen this year and it was teeming with folks. Great people watching. Grabbed takeaway fish and chips and picnicked . Perfect

Good way to get to Manly. We took a return ferry that run frequently to Manly for the day in December 2011. It was a great way to get to Manly with lovely views of the harbour and coastline on the way. Manly is then as a short walk from the promenade through a shopping precinct. It’s also worth visiting Shelly Beach if you go to Manly as its only a short walk from Manly and well worth the visit.
Relaxing. This was a great way to get to Many Beach -relaxing and a reasonable price. The town of Manly is quite pretty - not your typical tourist spot.

Amazing views. This is just the best way to see Sydney from the water. The views of Harbour Bridge and the Opera House are amazing. The ferry itself is nothing special, kind of worn down and dirty - but you won't have time to be bothered by that. Make sure to be among the first to get on so you can sit outside.

Great way to spend a day. This iconic ferry is just great if you have a few hours to fill in. Take the slow ferry to Manly, you will have a great peek at the wonderful inner harbour beaches of this very special city,and see the yachts in full sail and arrive at Manly feeling as though you have already had a holiday.

Manly Ferry. This trip is longer than the other ferries on offer, you pass the gap to where the sea meets the harbour. The Opera House, Bridge and the surrounding areas are all visible. Beautiful views!!

Beautiful at night. While we found Manly to be commercial and filthy the ferry ride makes the trip worthwhile. My advice would be to take the ferry over, don't bother with the beach, have a drink at one of the outdoor cares and then take the ferry back after dark.
Best Way To See the Harbour. Buy a ticket that covers all public transport and make good use of it! Harbour views from the ferry are the best!

A nice ferry ride. We took the ferry to Manly and, on the way over, it was announced that there were whales on the side of the ferry. We were able to watch these whales as the ferry continued to dock.

Crowded but convenient. A bit like a cattle car, at least on a sunny weekend -- jammed with passengers heading for the sand and surf, not especially clean, and hard to find a good seat. But it's quick and efficient and takes you right to the Corso promenade and a short walk to the fabulous Manly Beach. The ferry is not much fun, but the view is great if you can get outside or sit near a window, and it's probably the best way to go if you're starting out anywhere near the Circular Quay.

great. great way to experience the harbour and also get to visit manly which is a lovely place too. the ferry leaves regularly and takes you out into the bay affording great views of the city and the opera house.
day trip to Manly Beach. Great efficient and scenic way to reach this particular beach. Cheap and offers free WiFi. Very good for photo ops and lots of room to stretch out.

Manly Ferry. It takes you to Manly! what more could you want? But wait there is more, you are cruising the Sydney Harbour, Look Left theres the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Look Right and theres the Sydney Opera House, take a photo or sixty. Look over there its Kirribilli House, that is cool too. look at all the coastline isn't it great, takes some more photos. Now you are at Manly stroll to the beach, isn't it awesome. Look in some shops, get a gelato yum. now guess what, you can get the ferry back. Yay!
Sydney must do. To get out on Sydney harbour is a must for any visitor or local. For an inexpensive view of the greatest harbour in the world take a ride on a ferry from Circular Quay to Manly.

One of the best rides!. The ferrys are the great way to get about and the Manly Ferry gives you one of the best rides, taking you past Government House, old estates, new estates, a prison island, squadrons of sailboats and, eventually, to Manly -- a must-visit. If it's sunny, sit in the bow, otherwise cower away from the wind inside. Avoid commuter times.

Magical way to travel. Crossing from Sydney to Manly for the day was very much worth the time.... especially on the Ferry... what a timeless way to travel... gentle rocking, relaxing, gorgeous views of the city and Manly... definitely recommend it!

Ferry Ride to Manly. This is a very pretty ferry ride. It takes about half an hour to get from downtown Sydney to Manly but on a nice day it can be a delightful ride. The cost is only about $7.00 per person each way. I believe if you go on Sunday the cost will only be $2.50.The walk to the beach from the ferry is a few blocks. This area is a little tacky, typical tourist area, but the beach is pretty.

Half an hour each way of sunny delight. You pay the equivalent of £10 return for the Manley which is money well spent for the excellent views. Manley itself is a victim of its success and I find it crowded and not particularly enticing. It's fun to watch the surfers but the Corso is a bit like Hastings on a hot day. I just go for the ride and then come back. But it's well worth doing.

Sunday- jammed packed with people. Took the Manly ferry to Manly and unfortunately for us, it was a Sunday. The whole ferry were jammed packed with people. Although we managed to get a seat, somehow it would have been better if there were less people so that we can enjoy a better view of the scenery. Advice to all travellers. Avoid weekends where possible.

A must do in Sydney. If you do nothing else on a visit to Sydney make sure you take the half-hour ferry ride to Manly beach. If you have time go in the morning, have a walk around Manly Corso and walk from Manly Beach to Shelly Beach (maybe 30mins walk). It's just beautiful. have a drink in the late afternoon in the bars near the ferry and ride the ferry back to the CBD in the setting sun. It's the best $12 value ever... (Beats the hell out of Bondi Beach).

A lovely outing - ferry and lunch. If you are visitig Sydney let me strongly recommed a return trip on the Manly ferry from Circular Quay and lunch at the Manly terminal. Chinese, Turkish, all tastes catered for at good prices. We do it every time we visit Sdney and have never been disappointed. This trip is as good as any commercial harbour cruise and at half the price.

Trip across the Bay. Excellent service at regular intervals, fantastic scenery on the journey. You get probably the best photo opportunity of bothe Opera House and the Bridge. Even if you don't get off at Manley it is worth a ride.
A Must-Do. By far the best day-trip I've ever done in Sydney. An impressive look at Sydney Harbour, and a good place to get ice cream at the end.

There's no better way to see Sydney. The original ferries steamed out from Scotland under their own power decades ago. They are an essential part of the Sydney experience not just for the romance of being on one of the best harbours in the world - if not THE best harbour in the world! - but because Manly itself is interesting once you walk the few hundred metres to the Pacific Ocean beach immediately in front of where the ferry docks. On weekends it gets extremely crowded, but everyone's in a happy, carefree mood by the time they reach Manly.
Fantastic day trip. A wonderful, inexpensive way to see the greater harbor. A walk down the Corso to the beach was fun for the kids..All in all, a high point..

Shelly Beach to North Head Walk. Take the ferry to Manly and cross over to the ocean side. Shelly beach will be on your far right. It is a gentle beach, away from the surf, and the start of a several hour walk to North Head. Much of it is away from water.
Your basic ferry ride. However, I loved the Manly area and wished I'd had more time to spend there. The ferry ride was just your basic ride. Nothing spectacular.

Worth the trip. Took the Manly Ferry and was not disappointed. You get nice views of the Sydney skyline and of course the Opera House. In Manly you can walk to the beach and take some fish & chips with you on the way. Watch out for the Sea Gulls!

Best Value Cruise in Sydney. A great day out for the whole family. Take the ferry for a "harbour cruise", have lunch at one of the myriad eateries or take a picnic or get takeaway to eat in the beachside park. Go for a swim and a walk, have an icecream then cruise back to the CBD.

Feels like a real seaside holiday spot!. Take the ferry, with the usual 30 minute ride for $7 each way, or the fast ferry taking half the time for $9 each way. Once you step off, walk across the road and you'll find yourself on the other shore, with surfers galore. Decent shops, restaurants are available for every budget. Well worth a visit!
The definitive harbour experience.. A boat. With a pie shop on it. What more could you want. Do it before you die. And do it before you diet!
Great and regular service. Good value for money to get around and see sydney. Regular service so not too long to wait for next ferry
Sydney Harbour at its best. Unless you travel in really bad weather, there are no turn offs. Make sure you have a camera handy. Some of the vistas experienced en route are absolutely fantastic!
Great Ride on beautiful Sydney Harbour. A fantastic view of Downtown Sydney from the water, a very enjoyable 30 minute ferry ride out to the beautiful beaches of Manly.

Very scenic. The ferry from Circular Quay to Manly is perfect any time of year, but especially on a warm sunny day when you can sit upstairs outside and enjoy the view. Certainly half an hour well spent
An evening of fun. The trip across to Manly from Circular Quay is so relaxing. The views along the way are varied, but the journey back into Circular Quay with the lights twinkling was amazing!

Manly a popular beach destination. The best way to get to Manly is on the Ferry which costs about 16$ return. Get up front if you want some good pictures. The trip takes about half an hour from Circular Quay. If you buy a 3, 5 or 7 day travel pass depending on how long you are staying in Sydney, the Manly ferry is included in the travel pass.
Scenic ride. Best way to go sightseeing in the Sydney Harbour, not only means to get to Manly. Good value with day pass. Free Wi-Fi.
cheapest way to do a harbour cruise. it was so cheap - takes you to Manly past the harbour bridge and past the opera house (we did the opera house tour for $30 and reccommend that too)

Easy!. The Manly ferry is the best way to see the harbour from the water on a budget! The boat goes straight past the Opera house for excellant photo opportunity and same with the Harbour Bridge. Plenty of standing and seating and the staff is efficent and helpful.

Breathtaking views!. Don't miss the opportunity to view the Opera House and the Bridge from the deck of the Manly Ferry. It is a fabulous trip out of the harbour with stunning views of Sydney and Manly is well worth a visit.

Manly Ferry. The Manly ferry is a great way to see the harbour. There is always lots of room and if is a good 30 minute journey. We always go on a Sunday only because usually it is the day before we are moving on to our next destination. There is a ticket that you can purchase as well at the train station which entitles you to free travel on buses and trains.The ferry is clean and runs on time and you can always tell which ferries they are because they are the biggest. You catch the ferry from Circular Quay.One tip if you are a walker get on the Manly ferry, turn left when you get out of the terminal and keep walking, 10kms later you get to the Spit Bridge. On the way the views are phenomenal, not to be missed. Then get a bus back to Manly and get back on the ferry.

Great way to see the harbour. Had a great day out at Manly. The highlight is the trip there from Circular Quay on the ferry though! Brilliant service and gives you a good 40mins to spend on the water crossing the harbour, so some nice photos from a different vantage point than on land.

A great ride just to get out on the harbour. Terrific to be on the water in Sydney harbour and a great way to get toManly. Great feel to Manly, get to go to the beach and great places to eat and then return on the Manly ferry to Sydney CBD. Frequency of service is pretty ood too.

To Manly on the Ferry. As a first timer on a Sydney Ferry we were delighted with the service it was quick and efficient. A fantastic way to see Sydney Harbour, the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House from the water.
Very convenient with great views. Extremely convenient connection from Sydney harbor, great views of the waterfront and of Manley. The ferry is clean and beverages are sold on board.

A Pleasurable Ride!. The Manly Ferry has been given lots of names, especially in bad weather, but as a tourist visiting Sydney it gives you the perfect way to see the Harbour and get to Manly on the cheaper side, rather than a lengthy bus ride or insane taxi fare.

Great way to see the harbour. We took our 3 year old on a round trip from Manly across to the city and back. It's a great way to see the harbour, easy to get on and off and just the right length trip to hold the attention of a little one. It's a great way to get across town too, in order to take in the various attractions at Manly Beach.
Pleasant trip. Nice 30 minute crossing sea was calm and plenty of scenery to look at on the way also some boats have free wifi

You don't need to be a sailor. Manly ferries have been part of Sydney Harbour for nearly a century. The crossing of the Harbour,on a day of big swells, is exciting for most sea loving people. There are still some of the original ferry boats that come from the UK in the early 20th century stillin operation.

What a way to see Sydney Harbour. Great trip, Manly is a fantastic place to see. The ferry ride is something else great views of Sydney Harbour, Opera House, CBD Well worth doing. We did it as part of our Mymulti1 bus train ticket. $42 for 7 days

Nice ride to see the Harbour. Nice ride to see the Harbour if you plan to go to Manly but does take 1/2 hour. There's a faster ferry but it's privately owned and not included in your multi-ride ticket.

Great Inexpensive Way to View Spectacular Sydney Harbour. The ferry trip takes approximately 30 minutes each way to and from Manly. Cost of each ticket is around $18.00 return. It is a very cheap way to see some of spectacular Sydney Harbour. Great views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Fort Denison and Sydney Heads are offered. Strongly reccommended - you will not be dissapointed!

Why take a boat tour?. The Manly ferry is a fantastic way to see different views of the city. On your way back you will have a great opportunity to shoot a picture with both the opera house and harbour bridge in the background so position yourself to do so when choosing your seats.

Picturesque. This is the only way to travel to Manly. The view along the harbour is so very beautiful and Manly is worth a visit. If your heading to the city there's nothing like watching the sunset over the Harbour Bridge

Photo ops included. My friends took me to Manly Beach on the ferry, and were generous enough to allow me to shoot photos all along the way. The ferry goes by the Opera House from Circular Quay and The Heads.

A great way to see the Harbour. For $21 each we bought day passes which also enabled us to use trains and buses in addition to the ferries. This is a really cheap way to travel around the harbour and see the sights. We took several ferry rides, including a long one out to Manly. The boats look quite old but are comfortable and run to the timetable like clockwork.

Cheap way to see the harbour. Great way to see one of the most beautiful harbours in the world. Take the slower / older ferry's so you can sit outside and enjoy the salt spray and the view.. A must do on a trip to Sydney - make sure you get off the ferry to have a tour around Manley. Can't beat fish and chips on Manley Beach.

Good trip. The views from the ferry are very good and you get a good look at most of the harbour. the best place to be on the boat is up front in the bow, you might get a bit wet at times but the veiws are great.

How to become an Aussie!. Each time we visit Sydney, I just have to go on this ferry to visit Manly Beach, It makes me feel Australian. Lovely pubs, families enjoying an early heat wave, salt and peeper squid at teh Belgain Pub, is there a more perfect short brak?
johnno15. Packed with people going to Manly. School Holidays!!!Poor ventalation as most of the windows were shut and hard to open especially as the day was warm.

Oh how I love these Ferries!. I've been travelling to Manly for over 55 years on the Manly ferry and my grandparents before me used to pack up a picnic and head across to Manly every couple of weeks for a cheap, relaxing day out, it is still just as wonderful, doesn't cost the earth, when you get over to Manly you can get a coffee and cake, fish and chips on the beach, go for a wonderful walk around the northern beaches and return again to the Quay later in the day, a wonderful day out for very little outlay!

Always a Great Trip to Take!. Taking the ferry to Manly is a great way to spend the day. You get the best view of the entire harbour. You can see the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge, the Botanical Gardens and so much more. The ride costs under $6 one way. When you get to Manly you can walk along the mall, which has many shops and there are various outlets for food including takeaway shops, cafes & restaurants. If you walk through the mall to the end there is a beautiful beach to see. Have fun!

Well maintained ferry with an easy smooth ride. Very well maintained with a food bar, clean toilets and clean tidy seats. The journey was also smooth and I hardly felt like I was on the sea. It was a very comfortable 30min ferry trip to Manly Beach
Wonderful trip. What a great way to spend a few hour little cost, sit back and enjoy the harbour, don't go if the weather is rough unless you like a bumpy ride across the heads on way to manly.

A fun trip. A great day trip - catch the ferry to/from Circular Quay and travel through the Harbour, briefly into the ocean around the heads, and back into safe harbour. Manly has lots to offer the day tourist or someone who wants to stay a day or two. Visit the Art Gallery, swim with the sharks at the acquarium.

Lovely harbor journey.. After our rocks area visit we hopped on the ferry to manly. A lovely seaside area with nice beach and shopping mall.Found a good seafood restaurant for lunch then 45 minutes on the ferry back to the city.Ferry is very cheap too.
does its job. staff are all very friendly but the boat could do with a bit of makeover. used the ferry quite a lot. it is def the quickest and most fun way to get to manly

Great day trip for everyone. See a different side of Sydney. Taking a trip to Manly is great, also good food in the ferry terminal but mainly, the place is really friendly, beautiful and good for a swim or a walk. Also do not go to Oceanworld, It is really not good.

Travel and a view. This was a great cheep way to see a lot of Sydney Harbour. I was staying in Manly while visiting Sydney and it was very easy to buy a return ticket, swipe to get in, and the ferry was there. They run very frequently all day, and you get a fantastic view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House as you arrive and leave. It was a huge ferry with more then enough seats on it for everyone. The ride is short, only about 25 minutes or so, and from Manly it drops you off right in Circular Quay.

Cool ride - Excellent Views. This is a relaxing ride to a busy little seaside town, whose beach happened to be closed the day we went due to shark sightings! But the ferry ride was great, plenty of seats, a gorgeous view!

Great day out with the harbour thrown in. A group of us travelled form the eastern suburbs of sydney to circular quay to travel by ferry to manly for lunch, it was the Monday labour day holiday thus large crowds, everything ran smoothly and without a hitch. The cost was $14.00 AUS return great value and the best view of Sydney from the harbour, for O/S travellers try the circular quay to Watson bay ferry as well.

Amazing panorama views of Sydney. A ferry trip is really worth the effort. Ferries leave on a regular basis. They're relatively inexpensive and although usually busy is well organized, with plenty of information for tourists. We met a friendly elderly man who travels the ferries almost every day to various locations and its easy to see why. The views of Sydney as you head towards Manley are stunning whether viewed from the outside deck or inside from one of the large windows. If you want amazing photos of Sydney this is where you'll get them!

Great Experience. The ferry to Manly is a great way to experience the natural beauty of Sydney's natural harbor. its half an hour ferry drive. If you're taking the ferry, try to take the seats outside, and most of the views would be to the right hand side (if you're traveling in the direction of Manly). I'd think the best seats to take are the ones on the rear, since you can look back at the city when the ferry travels to Manly. There is a cafe onboard in case you want to get a coffee/tea :)

Great Harbour Views. I took the ferry to Manly having been recommended to go there by the tourist office. I purchased the 21 dollar day ticket that allows access to buses, trains and the ferry to manly. The day return boat trip to Manly cost 14 dollars. Great photo opportunities of the harbour and a tour of the harbour. Manly a nice place to visit and have lunch.

Good inexpensive way to see the harbor. We took the ferry from Sydney to Manly and back. It is an inexpensive way to see the harbor sights, but I would opt for a cruise with narration if I ever visit again. The ferry was packed with people headed for the beach on the way over and as a result, we could not see much. On the way back we were in the open in the bow of the ferry and got lots of good pictures.

Great value for Australian seniors. Wow finally found value as self funded retiree who gets nought from the government.Buy a $2.50 daily seniors ticket which allows you unlimited travel on Sydney ferries,bus and train.What better way to take in the harbour than a trip to Manly on the Manly Ferry. Then take a walk to Shelley beach. One of the best locations in the world - fantastic beach,good restaurants and what a view. We saw dolphins playing just off the beach at Fairy Bower.A MUST DO

Nice Jaunt. We enjoyed the ferry ride and just walking around Manly. This is an easy side trip from Sydney and sitting at the bar on the wharf we enjoyed watching the people coming and going on the various ferries.
Harbor View. Nice trip on the ferry but Manly itself wasn't any big deal - pleasant beach time, nice art museum but I'm not sure it was worth taking the time out for this particular excursion
Great way to get to Manly. GReat way to transport from sydney city to Manly a great way to relax while you look at the sites of sydney and also the wonderful houses along the coast line.
Quintissential Sydney. It's $7.00 for a 30 minute ride through the heart of one of the world's most beautiful harbours - what's not to like!

Great Cruise. If you want to get to Manly from Central Sydney this is the way to do it. The MAnly ferry offers spectacular views of the Opera House and The Harbour Bridge. It has free wifi which is handy and gets you to a great destination.
Nice transport mode. A nice and relaxing way to get to Manly from Circular Quay.The ferries are clean and comfortable. Snacks and drinks are available.

Great value for Seniors!. We took the trip to Manly on a Saturday.Being Seniors, we were pleasantly surprised to find that while the regular price is $12.50 rtn; we only had to pay $2.50.Don't forget to take your seniors passes! And yes! They accept interstate/international ones.

Great day at Manly. Although the ferries are getting old, they are kept in tip top condition and very clean. For the amount of people that get on and off each trip, the staff ensure that all goes smoothly.
Lovely views. Excellent trip from Circular Quay to Manly on the Manly Ferry. Beautiful views as you cross Sydney Harbour. A stunning way to see Sydney Harbour.

Ferry Good. Great scenery, not expensive and plenty of room, food on board if you get hungry, clean toilets, slow trip, you see plenty.
Clean seats and floors. On time and comfortable
Relaxing boat ride. Ferries are on time and it's always refreshing to be on a boat with nice views of the opera house. The recommended mode of transport to get from CBD to Manly.

Better atmoshphere than Bondi. I think overall what makes this a great daytrip is the ferry ride from the pier to Manly Beach as opposed to taking the bus to Bondi.
There are many restaurants in the area and it seemed to be the prices were generally lower. The beach is also great for spotting surfers.

Day out in Manly Australia. The ferry crossing from Sidney harbour to Manly is worth while it takes around half an hour, from the ferry terminal it is a 15 minute walk through the main thoroughfare with all of the restaurants and cafes to the sea front and Manly beach, it is a nice little town to spend a day whilst in the area lots of good restaurants cheaper then Sidney

Value for money. The Sydney ferries are a cheap and regular service - why pay $80 for a harbour cruise when you can buy a MyMulti Day Pass for $21 which gets you on all the ferries, buses, trains. Stunning views of Opera House and the Bridge when you set out to Manly.

Manly Ferry. a must do sydney ferries are fun but this one is my favourite one to do. You go out past the heads and it can get rough which is what makes it fun and getting to manly is the next best thing.

Great Family Fun. Riding the Manly Ferry is a great family activity. The journey can be an adventure particularly if the weather isnt great!. You have a good view of the workings of the harbour and all the foreshore mansions. We love it!

Trip across the Harbour. It was a nice calm although cool day when we crossed on the Ferry. We went with two seniors who traveled relatively cheaply. We disembarked at Manly Wharf and went for a walk around the town and then caught the ferry back.
a must do in Sydney. A great way to see the harbour in all its glory. I much prefer Manly as a place to visit than Bondi and you can go by ferry which is easy and relaxing.

Fantastic views of the Harbour. Fantastic views of the Harbour for a return price of $14. Pensioners can travel for $2.50. We took this trip with my parents and inlaws who hadn't been to Sydney for years. The service is effecient, clean and has amazing views of the Harbour. The trip takes half an hour one way.The only down side is there needs to be chairs available for elderly people waiting to board from the Circular Quay side.

Bueatiful for a summer activity!. Ive been on this trip numerous times, and it seems everytime it gets better. If you are in Sydney on holiday it is a must. There is a cafe (at least on the ferry i have been on) and areas you can sit and eat. There is a large clean toilet incase you suddenly need to go, (if you have kids its handy as well). The scenery is wonderful, and you pass an old jail out in the houbour as well. It must be done on a summery day or otherwise you may not enjoy it fully.
Great!. Great way to get from Sydney to manly for day of beaches, walks, and food! Several shops for gifts, clothes on your way to beach!
Fun run. This is a nice way to see the harbor area and visit a family beach. The trip out and back gives you great views of the inner harbor and there are good walks in Manly
nice walk. lovely walk - unfortunately the clouds were rolling in that day and it subsequently rained...still, a pleasant ferry ride over
Must do in Sydney. Definitely a must do in Sydney. Best time to go there is around noon and back during sunset. Then you have a chance to see how the city in lights: Amazing!
Great way to travel. Very easy to buy tickets and the service is excellent. Went to visit family in Manly so this was the only way to travel. Very punctual and reliable.

A must for tourists visiting Sydney. The Manly ferry is easy to catch from Circular Quay, located on the airport side on the river between the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. It is easy to catch a train there from the airport (each way about $25 per person and a 20 minute journey) The ferry costs about $20 round trip and tickets are easy to book from the kiosk at the Quay. There is a fast ferry, but you will miss a lot of the magnificent scenery. The normal ferry is about a 30 minute trip each way and the fast ferry a little under 20 minutes each way. Allow at least an hour (preferably longer) so you can enjoy the sites and surrounds of Manly.From the ferry you will get great view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, Garden Island, and then out to Manly where you can do some shopping or enjoy some time on the beach front Cafes, Restaurants and Bars.Highly recommended.

Great way to reach Manly Beach. Just jump on the Manly ferry to get a great view of the Harbor! We didnt know about it until we got on it. We bought this 1 week 'Multipass' for about AUD43.00 to explore Sydney during our stay. This 'Multipass' gives you access to unlimited public bus/train/ferry trip. It is a great value for money if you are wishing to explore Sydney on your own using the public transport. We jumped on Manly ferry with not much expectation just to experience the ferry ride to Manly Beach. It takes a little over 30 mins to reach and a beautiful view of the Harbor is guaranteed!

Good way to experience Sydney Harbour. While a ticket seems a bit expensive, the payment is worthwhile for a ferry ride on a clear sunny day. Sit outside eating fish and chips bought at Circular Quay. Worth getting off at Manly and walking to, and along, Manly Beach. For atmosphere, take the ferry on a dark and stormy day, or take the ferry on a moonlit night.

A must for first timers. Everyone who lives in Sydney should jump on the Manly ferry for a cheap day out - You get a harbour cruise and then can do a coastal walk along the beach. It is also great for tourists that do not have so much time but would love to see the harbour by boat.

Perfect Budget Tour. So if you want to see the Harbor, but can't spring the $80 for a harbor taxi or tour boat, jump on the ferry. It's big, its beautiful, and Manly beach area is a great stroll or shopping stop anyway.
wonderful experience. we went to manly beach by manly ferry. on the way you can see the opera house, harbour bridge & other beautiful views. It took u 30 minutes to reach manly by the ferry.

Best way to take beautiful photos of the harbour. The Manly Ferry gives budding photographers the best opportunity to take beautiful photos of the harbour, Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Also bask in the sun as you sit on the open deck. Lovely experience for all!

Best way to reach manly beach. Very good deals for transport to Manly from Circular Quay.Nice view and enjoy the current as you pass the Watson Bay in meeting point to the Tasman Sea.Avoid rush hours for better seating and experience.Sit outside to enjoy the cool sea air

A cheap way to see the harbour.. The ferry is the best way to travel between Circular Quay and Manly. Its a slower pace and the view of the harbour is undisturbed. This is a commuter link so don't travel just before or after work times unless you really need to. Take a light jacket as the breeze can be cool if you choose to be my favourite place, outside as close to the bow as possible.

Phone chargers a plus. Take the fast ferry, 15 mins, may cost more but if your visiting more than once, the trip gets tedious at 30 min each way. I was put off living here for the travel but the place itself is amazing. I believe best beach life atmosphere in Sydney

Picturesque Ferry ride.. We took the Manly ferry to go to the Manly beach. The Ferry is quite big , 2 levels and it was quite packed. The view of the ride is breathtaking. Prepare to take a lot of pictures.

Cheap way to see the harbour. This is a great way to see Sydney harbour. Great views of the bridge and the opera house. Once you get to manly there are many beaches, walks, restaurants and bars to keep you occupied before the scenic trip back to Sydney.
A great trip across Sydney Harbour. We took the ferry to get from Manly to Circular Quay. It is the best way to go, very relaxing & the have free wifi on board. The scenery is beautiful also.
Well Worth the excursion. Spent a half a day in Manly and road the ferry. Get way to see the harbour and watch all of the sail boats. It was cold but we sat inside and had hot chocolate.

Manly Ferry - Public Transport. Dont be confused, many of the ferries are double ended. just because it is the nose/front at the quay it may be the back for the trip.
$7 or $14 return, great for the Manly to the Spit walk.

A relaxing time out from the rat race, with spectacular views too. Gtting Ur on the river is must do while in Sydney. Choose the right day and you can get picture perfect postcard pics of the harbour bridge, opera house, and enjoy the tranquility of being Ur on the water. We got fish n chips at manly and watched the surfers for a while, went for a walk, and browsed some shops before returning.
Manley Ferry, The Only Way To Go.. I had better make myself more presentable ,....and become stronger a swimmer. Say hi to all. I5 can't hurt.......inj most cercumstancs.

A must. This is a great trip if you want to see the opera house, harbour bridge and the Sydney harbour. Manly on the weekends have a lovely corso to walk on and a beautiful beach for swimming or a long walk. Take the trip back and walk through the Rocks for another experience
awesome. I really enjoyed my visit to Manly beach, took a long walk there, enjoyed watching the surfers. went to northead to take beautiful pictures.

A must-do for all visitors to Sydney!. Manly ferry has always been the best way to see the Harbour. Now that the route has charging stations, commuters travel happier and more conveniently. I would live in Manly if only to necessitate this ferry ride every day!

Cheap way to see the Harbour. The ferry to Manly is cheap, about $8, it takes about 40 minutes and passes close to the highlights of the harbour, sit to the rear of the ferry from Circular quay for best views that last longer, it gets a bit wavy when you pass by the heads but on a clear day there is nothing better.

Fantastic Views and very Relaxing. Although a lengthy ferry ride (about one hour), the views along the way (the lovely houses along the water, the Opera House, the Harbor Bridge, the luxurious boats and more) and not the mention, the destination all make the trip worth while!An ideal way to travel from the CDB to Manly Beach

Relaxing :). lovely ride from circular quay to manly. free wifi and for an international traveller this was a huge bonus! Lovely half hour ride and the ferry was exceptionally clean, bathroom facilities were brilliant and the view was awesome!

A Good Start and Finish to our Favourite Sydney Beach. A great "harbour cruise" at a cheap price. Great views of the of the bridge and opera house coming and going. And the best thing of all is it takes you to Manly!

Mid week perfect. We took visitors from the UK on the green/yellow slow ferry to Manly last Wednesday a.m. It was perfect in that being mid week there were no crowds. It is a reasonable price to pay for such a lovely trip being able to see the sights of Sydney as the ferry heads towards Manly. Stunning sunny day, so wonderful!

a ferrytrip well worth while. a day in manly on the beach & in the shopping area was a day well spent,though the weather helps make the trip worthwhile.manly as a seaside suburb and the beach i would prefer to bondi.magnificent appartments are built along the sea shore & there is a great variety of eating establishments available

Lovely way to see the harbour. A great ride. Get off the ferry and walk around Manly, dine at one of the many good restaurants, or go for a swim at the famous Many beach..then back on the ferry to the city. Great way to spend a sunny day.
Worth the trip. The ferry over to Manly is well worth the trip. Its a great suburb of Sydney. There are multiple eateries, bars and cafe's and the surf beach is sublime.
A little expensive, but what the heck!. Enjoyed the frequency and the views and the ability to get off, walk around, the return. Friendly staff on board. So many sites to see.
Delightful way to cross the harbour. Whether traveling from Manly to the city or the city to Manly there is just no more pleasant a way to cross Sydney harbour.

Great Public Transport. We bought a week pass for the subway, bus, and ferrys. 43Aud well spent! The ferry to Manly provides great views of the Bridge and the Opera House. And like all of the ferrys, they're spot on schedule. Of course, visiting Manly Beach and taking a bike ride (see my previous review) or bus ride out to the Norht Head is a must see.
