Great tour !. By far the better option than buying expensive tickets for a harbour tour! Get your ticket, hop on the boat and enjoy the great view of Sydney's most iconic sights: Opera House, Harbour Bridge and the skyline. Tipp: Make sure you start your return trip shortly before sunset. Then you'll have two different impressions of the city.
Good. Nice ferry and FREE wifi!! The view is incredible and you can see that the ferry is clean and well taken care of.
Have to take trip on this.. Everyone that goes to Sydney just has to take a trip on this over to Manly,well worth it I must say.

Just a shabby boat commute for some, but a pleasant boat ride for others. The boat itself isn't very nice looking or particularly comfortable. Doing the trip isn't anything very special so I wouldn't recommend going far out of your way for it, but it can be very pleasant to get out on the water and if you are in the city on foot it is a nicer way to get to Manly than going by bus.
Harbour Cruise. Took the ferry to Manly from Circular Quay and back on a Sunday, harbour views were great, relaxing ride albeit crowded and limited seating.
Nice ride.. A large ferry compaired to most of the Sydney Ferrys. Free Wifi was a bonus (only 45 minutes twice daily though).
Always fun. A real authentic Sydney adventure and a great way to see the sights. A perfect way to relax and the only way to get to Manly. Not to be missed.
Ferries. Have many a memory of the Manly Ferries from my childhood, I loved the trip across rocking past the heads. They seem to have lost a bit of their luster though over the years

Great way to travel. This popular ferry ride offers a unique view of Sydney Harbor. Manly Beach is often crowded, which makes it less a spot to spend an afternoon sunning and more of a place to people-watch.
A must do to get the best photos. It's worth the ride just to take in the views and get great photos. Also worth taking a ferry trip to Darling Harbour which is beautiful.
Convenient and cheap. I think Manly ferry is the best option to get to the city or Manly easily and cheap.Good way to enjoy the trip and see the Opera form the sea.

Great way to spend the day. We enjoyed the ferry ride to Manly and the short walk to the beach. It's certainly one of those things that provides the flexibility of being able to take your own picnic or to dine out on take aways or at the variety of cafe/restaurants available. If you don't want to take your food with you, there is a supermarket there to pick up supplies to make a picnic over there. Another must see icon of Sydney.

Great Views!. The best ferry ride in Sydney from Circular Quay to Manly. Awesome views and great weather. Enjoyed our ride to Manly Sea Life Sanctuary throughout. Do take the Fast Ferries as the Slow ones are really quite slow.
Great view of city. Great way to see the city, recommend taking a jumper though. This was my first time seeing Sydney and it was a great experience.

Pretty touristy. Even though it is pretty touristy, I would still recommend taking the ferry to Manly. The views I had from the ferry were amazing. I bought a MyMulti pass, which covered all of the regular ferries so you can visit other areas as well.
great daytrip. The ferries were clean, reasonbly priced, and efficient. They docked at a convenient location in Manly and followed their schedule exactly.
Expect a rough ride!. If you enjoy rough ferry crossings, go for it! The boat was rocking when we went and both of us felt seasick! Manly is lovely but the trip wasn't pleasant!

Say Hello to Sydney's AWESOMENESS!. The breezy wind in your hair, scenic Sydney all around you - in a very affordable ferry ride to the sweetest little Manly Beach! While you are on the ferry, heading to Manly, you see the wonderful Harbor Bridge, Opera House and Sydney Suburbs. More the the ride to Manly, the ride from Manly is just PERFECT! Make sure you travel back just before sunset to have a wonderful time.Walk down to Circular Quay, max15 mins from CBD [depending on where you are staying], pick up your round trip tickets and head to Manly Beach. There are loads of places to eat in, a lovely beach and a nice aquarium there.This is definitely one of the "To Do" things in Sydney! Have a happy ride :)

The Best way to Travel. If you are a visitor to Sydney or even a local who doesn't get around much, do yourself a favour and take a day trip to Manly on one of the famous Manly Ferries. They depart on the hour and half hour from Sydney. The views are fantastic. Stroll around Manly for as long as you like then take the return journey. If you are lucky there will be a swell coming through the Heads and you will get five minutes or so rock and roll. The view of the bridge, the Opera House and the Sydney skyline as you round Bradleys Head is something you never tire of even if you have seen it many times. If you are over 60 and have a Seniors Card your trip is included in your $2.50 excursion ticket. A cheap and fantastic day out.

A Great Day Out. Travel like the locals and enjoy a leasurely trip accross the harbour to Manly. The Manly Corso is nothing special but head for the magnificant beach of if you feel more energetic the Manly Scenic Walk is lovely

awesome way to see sydney. this is a great inexpensive way to see the harbour, it takes maybe 35 minutes but is one of the best views of teh city, manly has great shops and a nice beach for sitting on or for the kids to run great 1/2 day trip
Nice trip over the bay. We liked the fact that they are regular not too expensive, perhaps we were jet lagged, but found the signage a bit confusing getting aboard to return to the city!
Off to the Beach. Good efficient service, pleasant travelling. Enabled us to have a relaxing day at Manly enjoyinmg the beach, shops and restaurants.

Go To The Beach. The Manly Ferry is a great, short boat ride from Circular Quay to Manly Beach, where you can visit the pacific, and get a coffee or ice cream, depending on the weather. The views on the round trip are wonderful.
ferry across the harbour. take a trip to manly on the ferry, its great' then catch a bus to the manly leages club for lunch. you won't be disapointed.

Ferry Good. What can I say, it's a boat, it goes from Sydney to Manly lots of times each day and providing it doesn't sink that's all it needs to do.
Manly is a lovely suburb and I think the beach is far better than Bondi.
Day excursion to manly. Great day trip, lots of nice restaurants to enjoy good food and beach. Walk to the end of beach is recommended

Cheap alternative to the formal boat tour. The locals all told us to skip the pricey formal harbour boat tour and catch a ride on the Manly Ferry and back to see the sights. This was a great suggestion and saved us about $30 AUD each. Drinks can be purchased on the ferry, but we waited until we got to Manly and had some drinks at the lovely open bar on the pier before catching a return ferry back to Sydney Harbour. There were also restaurant options in Manly if you want to grab a meal. I'd definitely do this again, and also might spend a bit more time in Manly.

Good craic!. A group of friends and I done this for a day trip to Manly - it is a must do! The ferry is a great way of getting about and is very quick, plus a fab way of seeing the coast and a few sights from a different view!

Picture moments. Stayed at near by Balgowlah Heights so taking the ferry to Sydney CBD was an easy and hassle free way to go, especially on weekends when the bus / train / ferries have discounted price for families. Remember to ask the driver! Also, the route allows for great picture taking approaching the Sydney Bridge and the Opera House! If not too cold and windy, try to sit outside and enjoy the air.

Good value to see the harbor. We really enjoyed spending a day in Manly. I recommend taking the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. We rented bikes at a shop about 1 block of the ferry dock.They provided maps and we biked to manly beach as well as a national park a little north of there. It was a very nice day. The coastline was very scenic. Biking up the hills was not easy. Although this was a very short portion. Most biking was on the street but not too dangerous.The ride to manly is about 20-30 minutes and gives you nice views of the city and surrounding area.

Have always loved this trip. Since I was a child growing up in bayside Sydney a trip on the Manly Ferry was somthing I really enjoyed and no less today. What a way to see beautiful Sydney Harbour and to visit Manly Beach as well. Grea day out.

A Sydney must. We travelled to Manly twice during our stay. The Sunday trip was a very busy trip compared to the one we did on Monday. We loved travelling on the open deck on the dusk trip back into Sydney. The Harbour Bridge and Opera House looked stunning.

A fun way to travel. We caught the ferry to Manly as this is a different mode of transport to what we have in our town. It was a great way to see the sights of the harbour and would recommend putting this on the list of things to do while in Sydney.

Ferry filled in time. And we saw parts of the harbour that we had not yet experienced.
Great to sit back and watch the wold go by with little cost.

Sunset Ferry Ride. If you are looking for some dynamite photos of both the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, take a sunset cruise on the ferry out to Manly, or plan your day to come back at sunset. Manley is a great beach area with a less frenetic vibe than Bondi Beach.

A wonderful way to see Sydney Harbour. A day at Manly is a very common touristy thing to do and is enjoyed by many locals as well. It is much less expensive than going on a harbour cruise and make sure you check out the discounted family fares. You see the harbour in all it's glory and then you can spend a bit of time at Manly beach. The Corso has heaps of souvenir shops. You can grab some fish and chips and eat them on the beach or visit one of the many restaurants or pubs for a feed. Grab an ice cream at Ben and Gerry's before another nice ride on the harbour back to the Quay.

Spectacular fery crossing on magnificent harbour.. This is by far the best way to see the famous Sydney landmarks from the Quay then 25 mins later be in Manly, the beginning of 21 superb northern beaches. Off the ferry, directly across the road and along the pedestrian Corso, within 15 minutes you have left the harbour and are standing on the sands of the Southern Paci fic Ocean. Restaurants abound- especially fresh seafood, which suit all budgets. A truly wonderful day trip, especially for families. A return adult fare Is A$14.00. Having returned to my hometown after twenty five years, this was my first "must do" and it didn't disappoint as the perfect way to reconnect with the most beautiful harbour in the world (Auckland and Hong Kong are close!).
A Must Do!!. Take the best photo of the Opera House and Harbour bridge sailing away on the ferry. Really nice transportation to Manly beach! Ticket booth and operators are organized. Worth the money!
Classic Sydney Harbour. Take a ferry ride to Manly and see Sydney harbour in its glory, it is a great day out and fun as well. Well worth a trip, we went to Manly for lunch.

Wonderful way to see Sydney harbour. I have travelled often on the manly ferry. It is a great way to see and experience Sydney . It is good for visitors to sydney, as well as for a family outing. At Manly there are many things that one can do, go to the beach, walk up and down the corso, grab some lunch or dinner or an icecream, walk around to Shelley Beach, go up to North Head, go to the aquarium. All in all, a good day out.
Ferry to Manly. Nice ferry ride and Manly beach is very pretty. I was able to take some great pictures from the ferry of the Bridge and Opera House.

Delightful. Many is great--and the ferry ride is a treat. If you're headed to Sydney buy one of the MyTicket passes. We purchased one for a week about $43 that gave us access to much of the train and ALL buses and ALL ferries throughout Sydney. You can buy them at most bus and train stations. We enjoyed Hugo's which is where you land at Manly's that we went back twice for their pizzas. Amazing and beautiful restaurant.

I live in Sydney etc. The fact that the trip from Circular Quay to Manly is wonderful and you see so much of the harbour and the bluest of blue water and you end up at a fantastic beach.. and then you can walk around "THE CORSO" and buy decent quality food, and do a little shopping plus on saturdays there is a cute market.

So disappointed.... I was so excited to take the ferry ride over to Manly - but was disappointed that do to repair work the ferry wasn't operating. So instead we had to take a hot bus to get over to Manly. The plus side was that they offered the bus for free for the inconvenience, but for us that was moot because we had a my multi 3 pass that had unlimited transportation for the week we were there. At least they tried!

A Great Way to Travel. A must do trip especially from Manly to Sydney....as you turn that headland and see the opera house and bridge it is breathtaking and as you get closer it is the ideal photo opportunity
A real fun experience. We really loved taking our three year old on this ferry ride. It was not expensive the views were beautiful and it was great fun
Great. Worth the ride. The day we went it was pouring rain and a bumpy ride but worth going over to Manly and back.

Always a great experience. We always take the Ferry whilst in Sydney and apart a great way to get around you also get a great feel for the harbour. For a minimal price you can get an all day ticket which is great
charming ride. Enjoyed the ride out to manly, had coffee on the corso and took the ferry back. Great way to spend an hour or two and see the harbour.

Best way to see Sydney Harbour. Its the longest ferry ride and is the best way to see Sydney Harbour up close and personal. Pity that there's nothing on board to keep the passengers entertained. And its not a cheap ride if you just want to see the harbour.

Best views of Sydney Harbour. If you come to SYDNEY - YOU HAVE TO DO THIS TRIP!! It is the best vantage point for all the major sights of our wonderful harbour. Your photographs will turn out amazing as there is not a bad scene anywhere. Once at Manly, you can then walk through the mall to the beach. Plenty of restaurants to visit, and also walk around the cliff top to Fairy Bower for some more spectacular sights.

Great family outing. We had Multipasses for public transport so made the most of it by jumping on the Ferry for a spur of the moment trip. It was well worth it. The kids had a ball and loved moving to different sections of the ferry to make the most of the views. We went over late afternoon and came back in the dark. I'd recommend doing this as you make the most of the views.

A great little journey. A highly relaxing ride across a wonderful harbour with great scenery, coming and going. Visit some great restaurants in Many or just stroll around the beach, and then a tranquil ride back to the city.

Riding on the world's finest harbour. 'Seven miles from Sydney and a thousand miles from care' -- a trip on the Manly ferry is one of the world best-value rides. Sunny Sydney days are best, of course.
Great Trip. For Seven dollars it was a great trip across the Harbour...just don't go on a windy day!The views looking down towards the heads and out to the Pacific Ocean are magnificent!

Great views on a classic ferry. The trip by majestic green ferry to Manly Beach should not be missed. Sydney Harbour is incredibly beautiful, and being on the water rather than just on the quay gives you a wonderful perspective. And then you can go to the Manly Fish Market on Steyne Street and get the best fish and chips EVAH!

Family Funday Sunday pass great value. We went on Sunday and bought the Family Funday Sunday passes for only $2.50 each - gives you unlimited transport all day on Sunday.Takes half hour each way and you can eat/drink on board so bring snacks for the kids or buy from the onboard cafe. Toilets on board are also handy for families.

At Manly. The ferry ride gives you a view of the sydney harbour bridge, the opera house. + good weather.Just love every single little details, and places at Manly :)Upon arrival, head to the information centre near the jetty, they are friendly people who gives good spots to hang out and a view of everything :)

The boat ride makes it special!. The boat ride makes it worth it. I enjoyed the view of Sydney harbor bridge combined with the sailing boats. Unfortunately when we arrived at Manly it was raining which made the beach not a lot of fun. We found a nice restaurant instead.

I love the feeling.. To Take the Ferry to Manly is very special. I sit outside in the front and let the ocean breeze play with me. When you arrive Manly you have entered another place only 25 min away from Sydney on a Ferry.
Nicer than Kiel. I lived in Kiel a lot of years whre you cross the Kieler Foerde by ferry. nearly the same in Sydney but even nicer

The world's best commute, and a great toruist trip. Although I use it to get to and from work, it is well worth it for tourists to take the ferry over to Manly, getting there is a big part of the fun. Tip: make sure you stand outside to appreicate the views, and if you're lucky, spot a dolphin, a seal, a penguin or even a whale (very occasionally).
a Sydney "must do". The ticketing can be a bit confusing for travellers, but just ask someone and they'll steer you in the right direction.

cheap way to see the habour front. nothing to dislike about it - its does what it does - it takes you to Manly which is a nice place anyway but you get a habour trip thrown in a lot cheaper than the tourist boats..

A Little Bit Of Excitement. Pick a rough day! It's more fun than a Luna Park ride, we went back and forth as much as time would allow just for the passage across the Heads. So much fun but hang on tight.

fun to take the ferry. We loved walking around Manly!! just beautiful - we walked to lookout point and it was beautiful. The ferry couldn't be easier. It's 30 minutes and is very promt. The people couldn't be nicer, the ferry is so clean, it's so easy to get around by ferry!

Great service with lovely photo opportunity. Lovely wee boat ride across the harbour up to Manly. Quick, reliable service. Nice to sit outside on the top deck and take pictures when the sun is setting.

A great way to start and finish the day. I travel to and from Manly every day that I'm in town via the water so I have a heap of experience. The ferry is on time every time and takes in some of Sydney's best views (Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Mosman, Eastern Suburbs, Balmoral Beach, Sydney Heads and of course Manly). The trip takes 30 minutes door to door. Sit upstairs out the back in Spring, Summer and Autumn and take a camera for some great pics.Enjoy

Great Views. Id rate this as 'must do' in Sydney. A bit like he Staton Island ferry in NYC. You get a great view of the North Sydney bays on the way there and fantastic views of the City, Opera House and Bridge on the way home. Excellent for photo's

Majestic Ferries. I took the ferry from Circular Quay and although I don't have the stomach for boats and sailing, the views of the city, the bridge and the opera house was enough to keep me from being sea-sick. Great to take the ferry on a nice hot sunny day with the wind blowing in your face and sunlit rays beaming over the city skyline is satisfying to the senses!

Great way to see Sydney harbour. Manly ferry is a great way to see the harbour and visit Manly which is such a beautiful town, the aquarium there is worth a look gorgeous sea turtles there, and the beach is beautiful.

Enjoyable relaxing. Catch the Manly Ferry straight from Circular Quay and within about half an hour you are in beautiful Manly, grab something to eat walk along the beach and see the sites then Make your way back to Manly Wharf to get the Ferry straight back to Circular Quay enjoy going through Sydney heads seeing the sites a bit further out in the harbour.

Hands-Down Best Ride to the Beach, Ever. Great, great ferry ride with lovely views. Getting a seat on the deck is difficult unless you're pretty much in the very front of the line. Upper deck offers a great view. There is lots to see in the harbour; lots of sailboats and old forts and such. The ocean smells amazing and the breeze feels so great. A must-do and the best way to get to Manly.
Really nice. Amazing view to the Opera and the bridge. You see beautiful beaches. 30 min of ferry and Manly is one of the mist beautiful beach in Sydney

the way to travel. The ferry gives you views of the harbour not seen from the road, some fantastic homes surround the foreshore with scattered beaches, its worth the trip which is quicker than driving the Sydney traffic

Great ferries at cheap rates. the service is excellent connecting circular quay and manly. Its a nice 1 hour ride. The views are excellent. If you dont wanna pay more for a cruise, then, this is it. Costs less, and gives more fun:)
See Manly. A fun little jaunt to the busy beachy suburb has a lovely ecletic mix of visitors and a really nice ambience, lovely views on the ferry and affordable

A Must do for any tourist. Why pay top $$ for a boat full of tourists, when you can catch the Sydneysiders ferry. This trip covers Opera House / Harbour Bridge and the best the harbour has to offer. Also, Manly is a great place for lunch and has a world class beach.

Must Do. We were in Sydney for 24 hours and looking to fill in an afternoon, so we chose a trip to Manly via the Ferry. This was stunning and it made me wish we could do it all the time! There was quite a swell around the Heads on the way over, but this was just part of the fun of being on the water!I also loved Manly. We found a nice little spot for a few drinks across from the beach and could have settled in for the rest of the night. We returned to Sydney at dusk and scored some amazing photos of the Opera House. Will definitely do this again when I am next in Sydney.
Nice ferry ride. Good view of the harbor and Manly is nice to walk around, you can do the Manly visit short or long, depends on you.Can be skipped if you are short on time

Relaxing.. Visited on a sunny day.
Going along the harbour, taking in all the views was relaxing, especially with the sun shining down.
It was an inexpensive ride and destination was beautiful.
Will do again.
Manly Ferry - Best journey in Sydney. Trip to Manly from Circular Quay. Wonderful cruise along Syndey Harbour. Excellent, organised and reliable. Worth a visit
Great trip. A must do - an enjoyable 1/2 hour trip to a lovely place. Weekend market, beautiful beach, nice pubs and cafes.

A classic Sydney experience. Once you arrive at Circular quay buy a multi ticket and simply enjoy the harbour. In one day I travelled by ferry to and from Parramatta, Milson's point for a superb photo opportunity of the Opera House beneath the Bridge, and a return trip to Manly. See the beach and the Corso all from a ferry whose image is readily identifiable with Sydney. The view of the Opera House as you pas close by is wonderful as is the glimpse of the sea in the distance...enjoy

Essential part of a Sydney visit. This is quite simple: the ferry goes from Circular Quay to Manly, and both of these places are lovely for tourists (and even for long term residents, I've been living in Sydney for almost 10 years, and Manly is still one of my favourite beaches). The ferry is nothing special, but the Sydney Harbour Basin is, so make sure you take your camera with you. You'll get amazing views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, of Kirribilli House, all the suburbs along the Harbour Basin, and you'll even go past the Harbour entrance, so you'll get some nice views out onto the ocean. It lands right in the middle of Manly, and from there, a lazy 5 minute walk will get you to Manly Beach. If you're in Sydney for a few days, and you really want to soak up the atmosphere, you should definitely do a trip!

Yo Ho Ho!. One of the best things to do even if you're a sydneysider! There's always a seat outside so get your camera ready for the highlights of our beautiful harbour!If you don't have sea legs take some motion sickness pills with you for a sometimes bumpy ride near the Heads.Lots to do at Manly when you get there! Bon Voyage!

Cheap way to see Sydney Harbour. This commuter service to manly is also iconic for tourists as it give a good outing from Circular Quay and en route Manly one gets a very good view of the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge, the dockyards as well as the smaller bays around the Sydney waterfront. It is also very cheap return ticket.

Best Opera House Photo. All visitors eventually learn that the worst place to take a picture of the Opera House is on the front steps. The entire beauty of the building can not be captured. One of the best places is on the ferry to Manly. However, you will have to jockey for the coveted seat up front to the far right by the railing. Otherwise, you will have a stranger squinting in your picture like I did.Once on Manly there is a distracting tourist shop and eat area straight ahead. However, if you walk through to the beach and head to the left there is a fantastic coastal walk. I will warn you that there are HUGE spiders and webs along the trail. That didn't sit well with me, but the locals don't even bother to look up. If you can overlook the spiders the opportunities for beautiful photos are endless.For an adult evening, I recommend visiting The Pony Room. The place is cool! Finding it is a bit of a challenge. Facing the ocean, it is to the far left of the shopping/restaurant area just south of the tennis courts heading towards the ocean. There is a small patch of fake grass in front. The outside is unimpressive, but the inside is really eclectic and tasteful. This is a lounge bar for sitting back and unwinding. I learned of this place will passing through the duty free shopping coming in from New Zealand.

on the road to Man(dl)y. the cheapest/ well run and organised public transport i have ever used with the most incredible views of sydney bridge, harbour opera house and when it arrives at Manly head straight up turn right and you will be at a far better beach than Bondi
A Sydney "must do". No question about it. every visitor must take the Manly Ferry. Simply the best view of Sydney and its harbour

Offers great views of the Opera House. We took the Manly Ferry to Manly Beach. There isn't a ton to do in Manly Beach. It is less touristy and gives you more of a local feel. We got great fish & chips and sat by the beach and people-watched which was a very relaxing afternoon! The ferry was super-easy to figure out and was the most direct, convenient way to get to Manly Beach from Circular Quay. Plus, the ferry offered great views of the Opera House - an angle you cannot get from any other location. If you go in late afternoon, and take the ferry back to Circular Quay around sunset, it's gives a chance for some really great pictures!

One of the best ways to see Sydney Habour!. The trip from Manly to Circular Quay takes thirty minutes and the famous slogan from the 1940s, 'Manly, 7 Miles from Sydney and 1000 miles from care', still holds well today. The ferries are roomy and clean and you can choose to sit outside for the full freshair experience or inside where the seats are padded and you can still see the views of the magnificent Sydney Harbour foreshore and the many yachts and othe craft out sailing on the harbour. Places of interest to be seen from the ferry as it leaves Circular Quay for Manly include the Museum Contemporary Art on the left, the Opera House on the right, Harbour Bridge and then as it heads east up the Harbour it passes Admiralty House and Kirribilli House on the left, then Fort Denison , the Botanical Gardens and Mrs Macquarie's Chair, Garden Island, on past Taronga Park Zoo, Rose Bay, Watson Bay etc , Clifton Gardens, Balmoral, the Heads to the Harbour and then into Manly. Near Manly there is still a large area of park and bushland right on the Harbour forshore. This is certainly a must for visitors to Sydney!

A great way to get on the water. This is a confortable and beautiful ferry ride. Bring a snack and enjoy great scenery. Make sure you catch a ride around sunset time on your way back to Circular Quay.

Pleasent trip & great harbour view.. A worth while trip for the harbour views alone. We went 0930ish on a Monday morning in July, not busy at all. Manly was v nice for a stroll around the gorgeous beech and a coffee.

Best thing about Sydney. So my first impression of Sydney was "this is it?"... the city itself is bland and lacks character, and many of the "charming" neighborhoods look run down and could use a good landscaper. When you get on the Manly Ferry, however, you realize what it is about Sydney that makes it memorable: the water. This 30-minute ferry ride is worth the trip to Manly in itself. You get to see the vast harbor and all the little villages facing the water. It's the perfect getaway from the concrete blandness that is Sydney. Manly is a cute seaside town where you can walk from the harbor side of the town to the lovely beach on the ocean side in 15 minutes. This walk is full of shops and restaurants and cafes--an easy way to spend a day before catching the ferry back to Circular Quay.This little trip on the Manly Ferry should not be missed by any visitor. It's the perfect peek into what makes Sydney special, and it feels like a little vacation. It does get crowded on the weekends though, so a trip during the week might be more enjoyable.
I always do this trip.. Every visit to Sydney has to include the Manly ferry ride! I love the views from the ferry, and then having fish and chips somewhere along the beach in Manly is a pleasure.

Spoilt by the crowds. Good day out but the queue waiting for the ferry was way too crowded with tourists especially on the way back to Sydney. Had to push and shove your way through the people just to get on. Manly beach was very nice though, with plenty of sand and local shops to buy lunch at.
Cheap harbour tour. Well operated. Very busy on public holidays and weekends. The rush onto the ferry is to be avoided if possible. There are plenty of seats on board.

Great way to spend the day. Would definitely recommend heading over to Manly on the ferry. Especially on a nice sunny day, it's a great experience for those new to Sydney. Good for a bit of sightseeing too.
Best way to get across to Manly. A bit expensive ,but not too crowded and less of a queue unless rush hour.Takes 15 minutes and you can buy a beer!
relax at manly beach. Acutally we wanted to have lunch at manly beach and ended up with fast but very nice food at the impressive city-type beach. We liked this relaxing place a lot.
Low cost, great excursion. the ferry ride gives a great low cost tour of the harbor and the community of Manly is very pleasant to visit and walk along the extensive beaches and gardens.

Its iconic cheap and efficient. We took the ferry to the ZOO on a Sunday and were really pleased how often they went, we had no waiting time and they are fun. We nearly took a private company ferry to the ZOO but are glad we didn't they only go every 45 minutes verse 15 for the local ferry. Have a go they are fun
Pleasant journey. The trip across the harbour was excellent and staff on board were very knowledgeable when questions were asked. Ferry was clean and tidy.
ferry to manly. great ferry service, regular and cheap from Sydney harbour, beautiful manly not to be missed
A must do!. Had a great trip to Manly on the ferry and it takes no time until you are at one of the loveliest beacheds you will find

what a way to explore the Harbour. If you want to explore and don't need a running commentary this is the best way to get a view of the Harbour. Get off at Manly eat and ice cream and get back on again to see it all again from a different angle.
The best (and cheapest) way to see the Harbour. Manly is a day-trip in itself, and the views from the ferry en route and second to none.

Always enjoy visiting Manly. ferry trip very relaxing takes about a 1/2 hours & good opportunity to see some of the coast of Sydney Harbour. Manley fun to walk around & check out the shops & try out the fish & chips.

and they call this public transport?!. i still cant believe this is how some people travel each day to work. i am very jealous. this trip is quick chea and transfers you from busy bustling sydney cbd to the lovel little town of manly which has a great beach and nice restarants. superb.
The best ferry ride.... Must do ride....take the slow ferry and enjoy the lovely sea and the natural beauty all around..
Nice and Easy. The Ferry to Manly was a pleasant 30-45 minute ride. Relatively smooth boat ride that gives you great views from the harbour all the way to Manly. A big plus--Free wi-fi!

A trip to Sydney in incomplete without a ride on the Manly ferry. We are fortunate tohave traveled all over the world, but never tire of taking a trip on the Manly ferry - even though we take a local ferry to the CBD from a wharf on our doorstep.
A trip to Sydney should include a ride on the Manly ferry - even when its rough ploughing through the Sydney Heads swell.

Nothing beats being on Sydney Harbour. Guess I am biased as I love been on the Sydney ferry irrespective of the weather, the harbour is a constant source of interest. My favourite time is coming back on a hot balmy night after being out in the city and sitting out on the bow - just magical. It can also be fun when there is a bit of a swell coming through the heads. I have always felt safe on the ferry at night as there is staff on board walking around checking on passengers.
Sydney's best Ferry ride. Want to see Sydney Harbour at its best and visit Sydney's best beach at the same time?, then his is the winner
Easy excursion out of the city. A refreshing adventure after an early morning arrival in Sydney. Great coffee/breakfast shops in Manly and beautiful walk along the beach.

Dont miss out on a trip to Manly!. What is better than fab restaurants, weekend markets, a ferry ride and a stunning beach? I recommend coming on a weekend for the full atmosphere. Take a walk along the beach there is a path that runs the full length and is well worth exploring.
Lovely Voyage. Quick and efficient service over to Manley with scenic views

Go to Manly for a good day out in Sydney. 30 minute trip to Manly is a great afternoon out. The ferry is large and has toilets and a snack bar. Beautiful scenery on the way plus sailing by The Heads, the entrance to Sydney Harbour. Manly is a great place to chill out and enjoy the huge beach and coastal walks, the relax in a bar or restaurant.

A perfect way for visitors to enjoy Sydney Harbour from the water. Jump on a Circular Quay and cruise across to Manly, hop off, have a wander around, grab an ice cream or some fish and chips on the beach then hop the ferry back over. You'll get to see the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and all the wonderful sights of Sydney Harbour from the water.

Manly over Bondi. A much more accessible and much more beautiful beach, I'd take Manly over Bondi. the beaches are both nice, but Manly is easier to get to and has a better neighboorhood vibe. Shops are cleaner, and there are more and better restuarants

A beautiful Beach and a very enjoyable journey. You simply cannot arrive there any better, its a stunner of a beach and better than Bondi, the ferries go regulary and the views of the city are superb,
Disabled access. The ferry has good disabled access including a toilet on board, and is a frequent service, we always use it when going to visit manly.
Go to Manly. Great views of the city, the bridge and the Opera House. When you get to Manly you will be in heaven. Just go.
Nice trip. A good ferry and quick to come to a nice beach. On the ferry there is a shop and also a watertank to fill your own bottle.
Perfect!. Great for pictures from another angle of Opera House and Harbour Bridge.

Fun way to get to Manly!. This is the cheapest option to be on the harbour. It takes about 30 mins to get to Manly, which is great for swimming and eating. The ferry has nice views of the harbour and islands.
Slow and easy. Great ride on beautiful day. If you skip the fast ferry and take this instead you will enjoy. Not about speed but about environment.
Great Trip. A fantastic way to see the bridge and opera house for a cheaper price than the tour boats and a great place to spend the afternoon at Manly Beach- highly recommended

Always take the ferry. The views across and on the harbour are spectacular. From the close up of the Opera House at Circular Quay wharf to the multi million dollar waterfront mansions along both sides of the harbour and past all the other people and watercraft on the harbour, this trip is 45 minutes of pure pleasure. Cheap,safe and enjoyable transport to Manly with photo worthy views from all sides. Relax on an outside seat on a sunny or wintry day and watch one of the prettiest and busiest harbours at work and play. Watch the seagulls fly and hover in the ferry slipstream all the way to Manly and back. Get off at Manly and take a stroll along the Corso, grab some fish and chips or a gelato and then head down to the main beach. For those wanting to stretch their legs, walk out to lovely Shelley beach along the coast walk. breathe in the sea air and experience some of the best of Sydney's beach culture. Warning: don't catch the ferry at peak hour as this is a commuter service that is very well patronised and it gets crowded quickly.
Worth a trip out to Manly. Great view of the city, the bridge and the opera house from the ferry. Manly is well worth a visit - nice beach and lovely walk.

An oldie but a goodie. The Manly Ferry ride from the downtown Sydney to Manly is an economical way to see the sights of Sydney harbour out to the heads round the corner and a great lunch at the Manly wharf. The ferry even had Wifi.
You gotta do it. Manly is relatively small, but you fall in love with the place quite quickly. The ferry service is every half hour and you get some of the best views of the landmarks from them.

Manly Ferry - a great way to see Sydney Harbour. This ferry goes from Circular Quay and will take you right down the Harbour to the Heads and to Manly Quay. A really interesting trip with wonderful opportunities for photos. Best way to get an idea of the scale and beauty of the Harbour. When you get there Manly has several very good beaches, both Pacific coast and the Harbour, some of which have shark netted areas for safe swimming. Stroll down The Corso to the main beach. There are lots of very good places to eat or just to sit and people-watch. Or just get back on the ferry and go back to Circular Quay - it's a very cheap sight-seeing trip.
Don't forget to be on time!. I used to travel from Manly to Sydney everymorning. The fee was a good deal, (back in 1977) and was on time; far cheaper than the hydrofoils!
save money. Save money on the more expensive cruises and go to manly and watson bay on the ferry it is a wonderful experience
Afternoon Ferry trip to Manly. Interesting beach town, watched the surfers, had a great lunch. A nice afternoon from Sydney by Ferry.
dolphins alert !!. Best way to see Sydney on the cheap. The captain alerted the passengers about nearby pod of dolphins having fun. It was complete magic
Great for summer night!. Friendly crew ( in the cafeteria) . Comfortable seat and great view at night.
Well worth the trip. Just a beautiful trip through the harbor - worth doing even if you don't want to go to Manly.
If in Sydney take this ride.. We loved it. Even though it was quite cool. Seeing the harbour for real was quite a suprise as we both didnt really understand how beautiful it all is.
fast way to get to the beach. Great trip across the harbour in rattley old boat- the crew works hard and the trip is stunnnig
Bike, beer, beach. How much fun, hired bikes on the other side to get around, had a beer near the beach and a great lunch.

Cheap and great way to see lots of the harbour. Took the ferry to Manly and then did a walk up to North Head to look at the entrance to Sydney Harbour. Very interesting military complex that has been decommissioned recently.

A classic Sydney experience. The ferry gives classic views of the Sydney Harbour, the Opera House and The Harbour Bridge before heading across the bay and giving a different impression of how this beautiful city has been laid out along the coastline.
Upon arrival at Manly, there is an attractive resort, beautiful beach and good hiking possibilities down to the original quarantine station.

Be sure to take this ferry. Took the Manly ferry to Manly abd had breakfast in town.
Quaint town to walk and lots of restaurants to eat at.

A must do when in sydney. I go to sydney at least once a year and do the Manly ferry run every time.Catch the ferry from Circular Quay and enjoy your trip on the harbour and across the heads to manly.Manly is a lovely place to have a stroll, swim and have fish and chips on the beach front.Then catch the ferry back to Circular Quay.
Quite Relaxing. Excellent way to experience Sydney. The trip is relaxing and beautiful.
Best way to see the Harbour. Have been doing this trip on visits to Sydney since I was a baby (I'm now 43) and this is THE best way to see the sights of the harbour without the cruise price tag!

Slow ferry to Manly. It's an iconic journey from Circular Quay to Manly but the fast ferry is quicker and has a better bar. For commuters this is the only way to sail but if you're a tourist then enjoy the big 'ol ferry. Toot, toot!
Manly from Circular Quay. Good regular service from Circular Quay to Many passing by the "Bridge" and the Opera House.Clean Ferries with comfortable seating
Love the ferry. Not only is Manly a great place and beach to visit the veiw of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House are amazing from the ferry.

Economic and rewarding. No really, don't waste your money on cruises. Spend a third of the price of a cruise instead on this ferry which gives you a great view of the Opera House and brings you to Manly beach.

The most pleasant way to access beautiful Manly Beach.. Don't miss the superb hiking trail at Manly; it provides breath-taking coastal views, easy walks through bush full of colorful lorakeets, and surprises like old war bunkers, a pristine swamp, and spectacular views of the Sydney skyline across the bay.
What views!. Runs to time and probably represents one of the most spectacular commutes in the world! Why would you spend up on a harbour tour?

Touring the Harbour on you way to Manly. We really enjoyed this ferry because it gives you a tour of the harbour on your way over to Manly Beach. They talked about the history of Sydney and its early immigrants while pointing out a few famous landmarks. It also gives you an excellent 180 degree view of the Opera House which it great for taking pictures. It’s a gentle cruise through the harbor and there is plenty to look at along the way. Make sure you take sunglasses and sunscreen.
Unusual views. We loved how you see Sydney from a different angle on the ferry and took loads of pics. The ferry itself was quick and cheap and a great way to get to Manly.

Go even in the winter rain!. There were huge seas and it was dark and cold by the time I came back from Manly to Circular Quay but the view of the city lights and the illuminated bridge and Opera House was fantastic. The pricing is terrible though, there is no information and I was shocked that, as I arrived at Circular Quay by the Balmain Ferry, the cheapest ticket for the return journey was $21. I could do four laps of Paris or get across Tokyo and back five times for that price. Why are Sydney ferries (and other public transport) so expensive?

Great view and about the right length. The Manly Ferry has been listed as one of the "must do" in many a guidebook, and rightly so. The trip takes about 25 mins each way, and allows you to survey the Sydney harbor, from Circular Quay out into the Eastern harbor. Along the way, you get to view the Sydney Opera House up close and if you time it right, you can also view the bridge with the sunset as a backdrop.We took the night ferry back from Manly and it provided a very beautiful lit-up skyline of Sydney.

A "must do". This would have to be one of the treks that every visitor should do and its avai;able at very low public transport rates.The transit out of Manly across the entrance then past the suburbs on one side and forested parklands (ex Military Reserves) on the other shows an interesting part of Sydney. You then turn a corner and have the CBD, Opera House & Harbour Bridge as the view until you arrive at Circular Quay at the top end of town.

Beautiful Harbor Trip. Taking the ferry to Manly is a must do in Sydney! Sitting out on the open deck provides gorgeous views of the city and suburban areas, boats and coastline...We used Sunday Funday family rates to make this an economical and FUN way to explore the harbor and surrounds. Manly was a great locale, as well.

Worth the trip.. Great view of Sydney Harbour, trip takes about 45 mins, you get to see so much of the harbour which is very beautiful, Ferry is large and well appointed, returned in the evening and was worth it to see all the lights! can be cold in winter so stay inside. A fun ride.
Cheapest Harbour Cruise. Take the ferry during the day out of peak times and see the harbour like a local.
Best way to get to Manly!. Best way to get to Manly! Nice, relaxing ride to Manly. Best way to see Sydney Habour! About a 45 minute ride.

Pick a nice weather day and make a great day out of it!. Ride the Manly ferry from Circular Quay and enjoy the gorgeous views of Sydney and the harbor. The ferry takes about 25 minutes and takes you to the "North Head" area - North Head is the northern peninsula at the opening of Sydney Harbour. Beyond North Head and South Head is the open Pacific Ocean. If you like chocolate, stop in at Max Brenner on the Manly ferry dock on the right as you exit. Fabulous hot chocolates of various flavors, chocolate fondue, etc. Then walk out the dock area and across the street and walk straight ahead and then slightly to the right and down the "corso" to the ocean. The concourse ("corso") is an area of shops and restaurants lining a street which becomes pedestrian-only as it approaches the ocean. Street musicians and water spouts coming up through the sidewalk, sculpture and coffee shops fill the pedestrian walkway. Manly Beach is at the end of the walk. A stunning beach with a wide walkway with trees on one side of the road, and on the other side shops and restaurants. For a gorgeous day go to the beach and then turn RIGHT. Follow the side walk and you will come to a walkway that will take you around the shore to the next sheltered little beach (Shelly Beach) which is beautiful. There is a cafe there if you want to stop and have something to eat. Or keep going along the path up the hill for a bushwalk along the cliff top and out to North Head (it's supposed to be about a 2.5 to 3 hour total walk). We walked for about 30 minutes up into the bush and then turned back after we got to a sweet little pond filled with frogs singing. We then walked back down, past Shelly beach again, and found a restaurant across from Manly Beach and had a delicious late lunch. Then we strolled through the shops on our way back to the Ferry. The sun set early and the moon rose as we took the ferry back to Sydney. It was a magical day. Fresh air and gorgeous views. A very affordable and wonderful day out.
Convenient and CHEAP!. Weekend ferry family pass is $10 return - or something like that

A fab way to see Sydney harbour and the city from the waterway and laidback Manly. This is a great way to spend a day, a trip on the Manly Ferry. A simply fab way to see the main sights from the perspective of the waterway and also spend some time in laidback and lowrise Manly and the very popular beach there.

Great trip. We had a great trip on the ferry going over to Manly with views of the bridge, opera house and you could also see the ocean. Manly has a great beach, which is much bigger than Bondi and some lovely restaurants.

A Great way to see Sydney Harbour.. A great way to enjoy the views of Sydney Harbour,Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. Great regular service clean and tidy. Manly a lovely area to visit and explore.

A good day out. Easy to catch the ferry from Circular Key to Manly, which takes about 30 - 40 minutes. Very nice town with lovely walk along a tree lined promenade. Plenty of shops for those wanting to buy more goodies.
Manly Ferry. It was a gorgeous day, the trip was very smooth. The ferry was clean, and the staff handled a lot of people well and efficiently.
Good fun. Quick efficient fun way to get over to Manly, do it for the experience when you are in Sydney.

Best way to Manly. I made the mistake of driving to Manly, rather than taking the ferry, as I did last trip. Definitely don't repeat my mistake.
As you leave the city, sit up the back of the ferry for the best views of the harbour, as you make your way to Manly. Spectacular views.

Great veiw of the Sydney harbour. Love the trip simple and refreshing, great photos of Opera House on the right side when depart from Circular Quay; the boat seems a bit old not as modern as the other inner harbor carriers.
Great views not to be missed. Opera house Harbour Bridge & Manly, Top trip for all
Great Idea. I suggest that one takes the ferry over to Manly. It is nice to experience the Sydney skyline from the water. And Manly is really nice, albeit busy.

A great way to see the harbour. Although it was a little bumpy as you approached the end of the Harbour, this was an easy and fun way to visit Manly and experience Sydney Harbour. Great views of the city, Opera House, and Harbour Bridge.

Do this instead of an expensive harbour cruise!. I used to get the ferry to work every day, and it has to be one of the most beautiful commutes in the world! The harbour is beautiful, especially first thing in the morning and early evening, and sometimes you see dolphins swimming alongside the boat. The ferry currently costs $7 one way - much cheaper than the big harbour cruises, and you can sit outside at the front or back and then either enjoy Manly or get a ferry back again!
IT'S A FERRY WHAT DO YOU SAY. Trip across the water to Manly. good service well organised and time table accurate. clean and spacious
A nice afternoon. This is a fun way to spend an afternoon; it sails directly in front of the Opera House and out to say to Manly Beach, where you can have a nice lunch or early dinner/drinks.
Manly. Excellent place to visit, beautiful beach, restaurants, pubs and shopping easy access to and from the ferry to Circular Quey, highly reccommended

Not as fantastic. Having done the botanic gardens to opera house walk, the Manly Ferry ride offers more or less the same view. we took the 4pm ferry to Manly. Perhaps the view would be more beautiful if you timed the return at 4.30pm, as sunset is around 4.50pm
$14 for return journey
Nice beach, not too busy compare to Bondi. Easy access to ferry from the Rock. Nice family beach, not not so busy.

Ditch the expense of a tourist harbour cruise and ride the Ferries. One of the best and cheapest ways to experience the harbour, the ferries on Sydney harbour will take you to/ or passed most places you want to see for a fraction of the cost of a tourist boat trip. The main hub is Circular Quay. Taking Ferry to Manly takes you right up the harbour passed the opening known as 'The Heads' and provides great opportunities for photos and just taking in the sheer size of the harbour. Other Ferries can take you to Watson's Bay (home of Doyles), to Taronga Zoo, or heading west up the Parramatta River for a totally different view and where there are a number of great restaurants close to the ferry stops for a stop and refresh before returning to the city.

Sailing away. Sailing away from Sydney harbour, a great opportunity to get some great pictures of the Bridge and Opera house.Journy about 40 minutes and i guess you see the headland as Cook would of seen on his arrival into the natural harbour.It can be choppy so not for the sea sick.

Far out! Loved it!. The ferry to Manly was a great way to experience the beauty of Sydney's natural harbor. The ride itself is beautiful with gorgeous views, especially of all the islands and bays and as you approach the city.

A nice boatride..... For a few dollars this roundtrip boat trip was delightful. We enjoyed looking at the opera house, the quay, and the cityscapes without a huge crowd. We pitstopped over to Manly Beach for a short time but couldnt really give any insight as we were in a hurry to get back to Sydney!
free wi fi!. what can I say, its a ferry and if you want to pop over to Manly your options are limited!. Free wifi and a relaxing boat trip, what more do you want?
Great way of travel and wonderful views. everything we liked the Island was nice and the food wonderful
A must do for locals and visitors alike!. the best $7 you will spend on a 30 mins cruise down the most beautiful harbour in the world to Manly!

Don't go in big seas. My friend and I travelled on the Manly ferry to Manly Beach, the ride was pretty rough due to big surf but it was still well worth the trip there and back to the Opera House. Manly was another beautiful Beach but we couldn't swim due to the massive surf, maybe next time.
Easy ride to Manly. Inexpensive, runs often, and provide spectacular views of the city.

It's a ferry. What to say... It is a ferry. We loved Manly though. Just outside Sydney you seem to be in a small seaside town. Beautiful beach for the kids to play on and a very nce aquarium. Not as big as e sydney One perhaps. But a lot of personal attention as the amount of visitors is small. Staff takes all the time to explain and interact with bth adults and children.
Great Transport. A lovely, reliable and fast way to get to Manly. Time it right coming back and you get a beautiful sunset over the city centre to enjoy during the trip.

Don't miss Manly. The ferry to Manly was extremely interesting, the seas had been very rough and the ferry went past the entrance to the harbour very smoothly in spite of the rough sea. The ferry terminal at Manly is great, you can disembark from upstairs and there are shops within the building as well. Well situated, just cross the road and walk up the main shopping area. Lovely place.

Great experience. This is a wonderful experience that you should go. You can sit on the deck outside which might be cold and a bit wet or sit in the warmth inside. Manly is best visited on a warm sunny dayWe went back from Manly to Circular Quay at around sunset which was beautiful and gave us some great shots of Syndey's skylineJust be aware that gates close 2 minutes before the ferry's departure

A splendid experience. If you visit Sydney harbour, and you don't take the ferry to Manly, you are gonna miss half the fun. It's a beautiful ride, sometimes the waves are high, making it even more adventurous. Manly itself is very beautiful and a lots of exploring can be done on the far side of the peninsula. It was the most memorable experience I had in Sydney. Highly recommended for all !
Take time out to sit and watch Sydney Harbour go by!. I never visit Sydney without taking the Ferry to Manly. Can't miss that special treat of visiting Max Brenner's Chocolate by the Bald Man! Yum!

A true way to see Sydney harbour.. Seating comfortable especially if seated outside. Enjoying the view - the cost reasonable. Enjoy a family day or each others company.Solo travelers do not miss out on anything - there is too much to absorb
excellent. it was good and time was accurate. It is a comfortable way to visit Manly beach.

Take the Family on Sunday. We purchased the Family Funday Sunday ticket ($2.50 per person) which gave us unlimited travel on Sydney buses, trains and the Manly Ferry. We had a wonderful day out and would highly recommened to all families.

An iconic trip.. This is a must do whilst in Sydney,
It is a great way to savour the harbour and then see the wonderful Manly beach.
To get a atmospheric view of the bridge get a return ferry just as the sun is setting, got some great pictuures

Great way to see Sydney skyline. Another must do trip in Sydney. We only had 2 days but this was on our to do list. Went from Opera House tour to Manly Ferry, 5minutes walk, cheap way to see Sydney from the water, great views of Harbour Bridge. Manly well worth exploring, lots cafes and eateries, beach ok

One of the most impressive ferry trips in the world. Said to be one of the most impresse ferry trips in the world. For a fairly priced ferry ticket get a close view (photo) of the Sydney Opera House and have your camera reading when you get back around sunset. Manly visitor center to right after exiting the ferry terminal. We walked from Manly Beach to Shelly Beach and saw many dolphins. In fine weather definitely worth the trip.
Great value and efficient. A great way to get around whilst in Sydney, well run and prompt!

Yea, ya gotta.....no doubt. It's never a bad trip. It's short, relaxing and if the weathers right absolute bliss in the morning, midday, afternoon, evening and night. My wife and I love Manly (where we had our first day, and where we were engaged) so it's a bit special to us. Theres so much to do there so taking the ferry is well worth the trip rather than taking the train and bus to get there. Good times indeed!

Great way to see the city from the water. If you want an inexpensive way to see the city from the water, take a ferry to Manly. You can wander around Manly and catch the ferry back. Cheapest harbour cruise you can get!

Lovely Place. Manly is an one hour away from Sydney. It has a long stretch sandy beach that pack of people who wants to get sun bathing and also swim. There also a hidden small sandy beach for people who want a more quite environment

gorgeous. ferry from sydney harbor had free wifi and an awesome view the entire trip. ferry was spacious and clean. manley beach was gorgeous and we took a great walk along the water. got the best and prettiest macchiato I ever had at a local cafe on the walk towards the sea water swimming pool. stop at manley longboard on the walk from the ferry to the beach to visit an original family owned business that still is more about their products than making a buck.

Bargain Harbour Cruise. When you take the ferry to Manly you get great views of Sydney Harbour for the price of public transport. If you are on a budget this is a good replacement for a more expensive Harbour Cruise. We paid $12 per person return.Because the ferries run so often you never have too long to wait and the timetables are well published. They are huge and take an immense number of people. They have lots of outside space so tourists can line up and take their photos of Sydney Harbour. I got my best pictures of Sydney on this ferry journey. The crossing itself was smooth and you can tell this is a well practiced and slick operation.
Give you a nice breeze. If the weather is good, it would be great to take a ferry ride to Manly!

Buy a MultiPass that includes the ferry. Comfortable, organized, quiet, clean. Great way to see the harbour. Once we got to Manly there was an awesome bar right across from ocean called Hotel Steyne. Humungous booths for people watching, fireplace, several bars in one building.
Packed. Admittedly it was the first sunny day in a long spate. But SRO, cramped. Views were nice and I'd do it again but not on a weekend!
Crisp Clear Air and friendly people. We loved all the ferries, they were clean, easy to use, Manly ferry was very punctual.
Beautiful cruise to Manly. Great views of downtown Sydney and the opera house. The free WiFi is a rare perk in Sydney.

The Best Way to see Sydney Harbour. Each 30 minutes or so the ferry leaves Circular Quay to travel to Manly. You need to buy your ticket at the kiosk befiore getting onto the wharf. On a sunny day, you travel past the Harbour Bridge, Opera Huse and Fort Dennison, seeing the Governor-General's and Prime Minister's Sydney Homes on your left and the Botanic Gardens on your right. All kinds of water craft can be on the water, so wave and smile. people will like it. Off to your right you see the rich people's houses along the waterfront, rising up the cliffs. You go past the Heads (the place where the bay of Sydney meets the open ocean), so if there's a swell, there may be a bit of rocking. Then on to Manly with teh sunn in your face (sit outside), and the smell fo salt water in the air. A great way to meet the Harbour.

Don't forget to get off... Manly Ferry is famous, so famous I got on and stayed on forgetting to get off and explore Manly. It's a great way to see the Harbour and has a quick turnabout time. Do take time to explore Manly the ferry stops near a great shopping area and at the end of the shopping area is Manly beach.
Best Harbour trip!. This is a great way of seeing the Harbour - frequent ferries and great value

super views both ways. Would highly recommend taking the Manly ferry. We took it out to Manly in the morning, and back in the evening after sunset. This way we got stunning views of Sydney by day and night. And a great way to visit Manly too of course.

Great way to see the Harbour. The ferry ride is terrific, and the Corsi to beach walk in Manly is a lot of fun. Decent places to eat and shop, and Manly Beach is worth the trip. Bring your cameras for the ferry - the views of the harbour, Opera House and skyline are fantastic.

Probably one of the best attractions in Sydney. Take the ferry on a Sunday afternoon and enjoy the best view of the city. The iconic ride from Manly to the City offers arguable the best views the city has to offer.
Best commute journey in the world possibly!. I love going on the manly ferry, so worth it, even if you don't have time to get out and manly, the journey the and back is fanatstic
great way to visit Manly. we took the Manly Ferry from the City and had great day in manly .Nice trip both way
Nice ride to Manly. Old ferry to Manly beach with indoor and outdoor seating. Sit outside if you manage to grab a spot--the view of the Sydney Opera House is worth the piercing heat!
May 2012. Great ferry to Manly Beach.....it's awesome because it has FREE internet while you take the relatively short (30 minutes or so) trip from Sydney Harbour to Manly Beach.

Great ride. A ride on the Manly Ferry, a fantastic ride on a good day with no swell when you go across the heads, but not a place I would like to be on a stormey day, the waves and swell are huge and the ferry goes across very rough water, pray that you get a fine day on your visit there, its worth the visit to Manley as there are some lovely sites on that side of the bay

Fantastic way to see the harbour!. Amazing harbour views, best (and cheapest!) way to see the harbour sights. Best value as part of a multi transport ticket, daily or weekly depending on how long you are staying and whether you also need train/bus etc...Great views of North and South head (it is at its most choppy when passing here) and all the harbour from Watsons Bay, Vaucluse, Rose Bay, Double Bay etc.. You can see Taronga Zoo, Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Botanical Gardens and many more sights.Really enjoyed spending time around both Circular Quay and also Manly! The Manly ferry is a must do!

A great trip. Just jump on a Manly ferry at Circular Quay and sit out the front and soak up the amazing views - you will love it. If you do not want to take one of those harbour cruises you can still enjoy the harbour

Wow, great views of the Harbor, Opera House and Harbor Bridge. If you will be in Sydney for several days, buy a Multi ticket which will give you access to ferries, trains and buses. Ferry to Manly was a great way to see the Sydney Harbor from the water and go to one of the most wonderful places I have ever seen - Manly! Allow for lots of time to spend in Manly to enjoy the walkways along the water, the restaurants, etc.
Best Value Harbour Cruise in the World. Cheap as chips. It is the best harbour in the world especially if you travel on Wednesdays or Saturdays when the sail boats are on the harbour
A great trip. Virtually a 30 minute harbour cruise from Circular Quay to Manly. A great trip to a fantastic beach suburb.Regular services from early morning to late night.

Must-do trip with great views. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly for a great day or half-day trip. Great views from the boat and Manly itself has a great beach, promenade, shops and restaurants, and great walk round the headland. Recommended.
Rain day but lovely way to see other parts of Sydney. I had a great time on the ferry and the sites pointed out. Would try to do it again when the weather is much better ie not pouring with rain!

Take a Trip from Circular Quay Sydney to Manly. There is a Fast Ferry....but take one on the older Ferries.Get a Return ticket...or you can catch a Bus back to the City.When you arrive at Manly Wharf....straight ahead is a short walk past many shops,to Manly Beach.There are food shops and a range of outdoor eateries.You can walk around to a sheltered bay called Fairy Bower...popular in summer,where Diving Courses are run.Head up the Hill...past Manly Hospital....you pass the Entrance to North Head ....a National Park.A nice walk will take you to one of the best vistas of Sydney Harbour...looking down the Harbour you will see The Harbour Bridge and City Building Skyline and moreThe Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race on Boxing Day...26th December ...passes the Harbour Entrance...at North Head...the yachts turn South and under Sail race to Hobart.

Nice ride and more. This was a fast, efficient and scenic way to Manly Beach. It was included in our week long transportation pass. What surprised us was that they allowed 30 minutes of free wi-fi time on the ride. Wow! Even Starbucks doesn't give out free wi-fi in Sydney. When on an extended vacation, sometimes there are things you need to do. But spend some of the time just enjoying the ride and views.

Must do in Sydney. It is a super scenic trip to Manly I would say among my top 3 to do in town. You should almost make a day trip out of it to really enjoy it, don't rush. Rent a bike in Manly or stroll around and relax on the beach. Both thumbs up!
Must Do. You need to do this once or more in your life. Great trip over the Harbour (hopefully there is no swell) fantastic to be on the Harbour and Manly has always got something to offer everyone.

SECOND HOME. If you have a multitrip ticket, you can on this as often as you like. It is the largest of all the harbour ferries and runs between Circular Quay and Manly. What makes it different to the others is that it crosses the harbour heads where stormy weather can make it a very interesting trip !Apart from that it is the ideal antidote to traipsing round Sydney, so that, when your feet can take no more, just hop on the ferry for half an hour and rest them and go and sit on the seafront in Manly. If you time your return trip right (ie at sunset, you get the most amazing red skies over the harbour from the boat as it leaves Manly, Half an hour later you return refreshed to Sydney.
Cool. I prefer Manly over Bondi (many shops in the area) though it more of a family beach for activities than you wanting to surf
Classic ferry!. The manly ferry connects sydney to manly. It runs every half an hour and it takes 30 min to reach the destination.

Great way to see Sydney harbour. The Manly ferry is a wonderful way to see Sydney harbour. You leave the dock and immediately pass the opera house and the harbour bridge. This gives you a great opportunity to take lots of pictures of some of the iconic parts of Sydney.Biggest bonus is that this is a very cheap alternative to some of the pricey harbour tours.
Great way to see the Sydney from the water. This trip was an inexpensive way to see the city from the water and gave a fabulous view of the Opera House. Nice walk to beach once to disembark
No need to book cruises. If u get the multi-pass there is no need to book separate harbor cruises. Just hop on any ferry as much as you like and see the harbor and attractions for free.
Reliable, clean, excellent value for money. Gives great views of the harbour. Clean and reliable. It can get choppy further out!

impossible to miss !. this was great ! we stayed 2 weeks in Manly & caught the ferry almost every day - it was so frequent we never had to wait for it , & the views it provides of the Sydney area are the best you can get - on a windy day with added seaspray !

Great way to spend the day. The ferries are very punctual and efficient. We got a seat up front and got a great photo op of both the opera house and the Sydney Harbor bridge. Spent half a day at Manly and that was a lot of fun
Nice & Cheap. Good condition ferry, clean, easily accessible and cheap. I'd probably take the ferry every day from manly beach to work if I lived here. Very nice ride.

Don't miss this ride!. The ferry was very clean, the crew helpful and friendly and the views of the Harbour, the Bridge, Opera House, etc. were really great. At AU$7.00, you can't beat it. The ferry was on time both ways and the ride was smooth and comfortable.
easy access to Manly. You can drive or take the bus to Manly, but you'll lose too much time getting there. The ferry is more expensive, but certainly not prohibitive.

Lovely ferry ride. Lovely ferry ride over to manly. Sea was a bit choppy when we went but not unpleasant. We also purchased snacks on the boat, very reasonable.Was a lovely day to go to manly beach. Lots of shops around this area such as o'neill,billabong etc.hope this helps :)

Time traveler's Special. Are you wondering what you should do with what little time you have on your trip? Only here for a business trip or you're tight on time? Forget the fancy dinner cruises in the harbour, just jump on the Manly Ferry, which gives you the same view of the harbour and you get to visit the quaint surfer town of Manly. Yummy food there, great shops, great walks, and surfers galore!

Great Afternoon. Took the ferry to Manly Beach for the afternoon. Fantastic view of the harbour, Opera House and other areas along the way. Spent the afternoon having lunch, walking along the beach and relaxing. We bought the 24 hr combo metro ticket for $21 - gave us return ferry trip as well as unlimited bus, subway, metro train travel for 24hrs. Great value considering the ferry is $14 return.

Nice way to see more of Sydney area. The ferry was a nice way to see a little more of the area and to get to some of the famous surfing beaches. The views were great on the ferry, especially on the way back from Manly late in the morning. It was a bit pricey though, especially for a commuter ferry. There wasn't a whole lot to do on Manly Beach once you were there though at the time of year I was there. It was pretty to walk along the beach, but too cold to do much else.
Friday fish and chips and a great trip back on the ferry. Such a lovely time going over about 4.30pm and walk around Manly Fish and Chips and an excellent night views on the way back

DON'T PAY FOR A HARBOUR CRUISE. For much less money, you can get the same spectacular views of the harbour and harbour bridge as you make you way to Manly. There is a small kiosk on board. Consider travelling early or late in the day and make the most of the low light for photographs.Also consider catching other ferries than go under the harbour bridge or to Watsons Bay. Check out travelpass type tickets for multiple journeys.
Only way to travel. The Manly Ferry is the best, stress free way of getting from Sydney to beautiful Manly. Always an enjoyable experience.
All in one. You can probably see more of Sydney in this 30 minute ride than any other mode of transport in the city. The fare is fair and the destinations are amazing.

Return at sunset. The trip to Manly was fine and the walk around Manly was so-so. Definitely a touristy, beach town feel. But we timed our return trip to arrive in Sydney Harbor at sunset and the view was spectacular. Red skies behind the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House lit for the night.
great way to get to and from. The ferry is awesome for getting to and from Sydney to Manly. They are safe, affordable, clean, offer a terrific view and the ferry even has WIFI!
Great trip with a fantastic view.. Great quick trip, very comfy and has a fantastic view all the way.

A bit of nostalgia!. I simply love these old bangers. The option exists to take the fast ferries but the old Manly Ferries are so much more endearing. I have had my heart in my mouth as well on occasions when the swell has been roaring in between North and South Heads. The nose of the vessel dips into the swell and the spray comes right up over the bow. The Captain has to take a direct path in towards the North Head to get into the lee of the land before deviating towards Manly. A trip to Sydney would not be complete without a ride on a Manly Ferry.
on time, plenty of options for seating. What a gr4at trip, just do it for the fun and try to have a meal over at Manly if time. On time, easy to negotialte and in/outdoors seats. clean and friendly
Cruise the harbour and enjoy the view. Take the ferry to Manly for dinner; leave Circular Quay around sunset and enjoy the harbour - priceless! :)

Fast with an impressive view. Ferry in Sydney is a fast and reliable way to visit most of the touristic points. Also is cheap and comfortable. If you plan your tour in advance you can buy combined tickets for trains, bus, and metro for a single or multiple days. There are plenty of information about the routes and timetables. Enjoy it.
A nice journey. Very pleasant journey with a nice location to visit, walk along the beach walk and through the protected woodlands, nice for pictures.

A cheap and nice way to see Sydney Harbour. We went on a day trip to Manly with our children aged 3 and 4, and chose the Manly Ferry. At Circular Key we had a snack before departure, and the ferry was on time, as usual :-)Onboard it was a nice atmosphere, and they also had wifi for those who have the time to enjoy that... We were so delighted by the great view of the Opera House, you get very close to it from this ferry!From the upper deck we enjoyed the harbour and city view, and also the totally different and more relaxing feeling as we approached the pier at Manly. It was a very nice trip, and we would have love to return a bit later than we did, to see the city from Manly ferry by night...
Iconic ride. One of the longest ferry taxi rides with Iconic views of the Bridge, Opera House and Syndey. Manly Beach itself is picture perfect.

A great way to see the Sydney waterfront. One of the most pleasent forms of public transport I have travelled on.Manly is a really nice area to visit, a beautiful long beech and plenty of cafes and shops to look around.

time out, great views great destination. great way to see the harbour and Manly is great destination for some different sydney time. we did twilight trip so bak just as sun setting behind city....very beautiful...clean boat and experienced ferry service...just great

Gorgeous!!!. Pick a nice day and take the ferry to Manly. I loved it and so did the kids. You get a unbelievable view of the Sydney Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, and all the harbour has to offer, for a very reasonable price of just a ferry ticket.

Cheap excursion, great views!. From Circular Key this ferry takes you through much of Sydney Harbour. Worth it at Manly to take #135 city bus toward North Head which is the ocean entrance to Sydney Harbour. Stunning views and an old military establishment there are worth the trek.

Always Reliable. Not a bad thing to say about the Sydney ferries.However, DON'T BE LATE!They close the pier gates at 2 min. prior to departure.If you come running up and the gate is closed. Just go get a coffee of pie and catch the next ferry. Don't argue with the attendant, they're just doing their job.The reliability of the ferry system is based on them meeting schedule. When it's time to go they close the gate and pull the ramps. The attendants can't open up and allow a person out on the pier while they're getting the ferry ready to depart.

Make your return trip at sunset. We took the ferry to Manly and enjoyed a walk around and a meal. There is a small beach there for those who want to put their feet in the ocean. Make sure your return trip concides with sunset. You will see the bridge and the Opera House in a gorgeous light.
Reliable, Clean, Free WiFi. The Manly ferry is a perfect way to travel to the northern beaches. They are reliable, leave on time and friendly service.

Easy, timely schedule. We got off the bus from Bondi Beach @ Circular Quay, purchased ticket for the Manly Ferry and waited in line about a minute before boarding. Accessibly friendly. Weather permitting, the outside is the best place to sit, especially toward the rear for fantastic views of downtown Sydney as you depart. Departing the ferry was easy and fantastic help @ information center.Several restaurants, services and kiosks within the Manly terminal.Easy departure from terminal as well, even in a downpour!!

The best views of Sydney Harbour. We stayed in Manly itself so our first sight of the iconic harbour was via the Manly ferry and what a view it was... It was almost unbelievable! The best way to experience the harbour is from the water and there is no cheaper way to do it (other than falling in!).The ferry is reliable, cheap and clean. At night it comes alive with lights and seagulls who ride the wind alongside you.For those visitors staying in Sydney the Manly Ferry takes them to the beautiful seaside town on the other side of the harbour. I can't recommend Manly enough - I miss it now I'm home! Laid back, full of personality, great beach and lovely atmosphere.

A must do Sydney experience. The Manly ferry trip is one of the great things to do when visiting Sydney. The service is reasonably prced and runs to a convenient schedule from early in the morning well into the evening. The big bonus is that Manly is a beautful ocean side town with a lovely beach and lots of nice places to enjoy a meal or a drink. It's flat too so easy to get around with children or people who have mobility problems.
Great trip. Great view of the harbour and a relaxing ride to get to Manly. See the Opera house from a different angle. Cheapest way to get to Manly and the I think the most spectacular views.

Great harbor ride and beautiful beach.. The ferry ride itself is worth the cost of the ticket. The lovely beach is a bonus. I highly recommend the walk from the beach to Shelly Beach Park and the cliffs beyond. Very nice cafe at the beach for lunch.

Boat can drive both directions. Very scenic ferry ride. On the way back we were first on the ferry and had our pick of seats. Unfortunately we ended up choosing seats at the back end of the ferry thinking it turned around. Missed out on the best of the views the journey has to offer as a result! Ferry was very busy on the weekend so you will need to line up early if you want prime seats. Manly is also a cool place worth visiting independent of a desire to go for a scenic boat ride.
