Has to be done. The Manly ferry is a great way to get some sea air, and get over to a surfer's beach if you're not in Sydney for long and walk to get the sand between your toes.
Great escape from the city. Escape from the city and enjoy amazing views on the way - well worth the 30 minute trip on the boat and lots of things to explore in Manly
Great ride on an old-skool ferry. Amazing views of the city. 30 mins journey time. Free wifi. Very comfortable. Cheap tickets.

Cheap but with the best views of Sydney. So simple to use and very cheap to hop across to Manly. Don't forget to look back to see an impressive view of Circular Quay, SOH and the Harbour Bridge. Breathtaking at day or night

So efficient. This is the second time in 10 months I have been to Sydney and visited Manly. The ferry service is so efficient, easy and cheap to use. Always on time and the trips go quickly as you soak in the views. The ferry is very clean and good seating is provided. Just an awesome facility and service.
The best way to see Sydney. We took a day pass and enjoying traveling to Manley with the public transportation

See most of the harbour. Going to Manly by ferry is a pleasant 1/2 hr ride on which you get too see the larger portion of Port Jackson. it offers great views from the water on Harbour Bridge & Opere House, Rose Bay, balmoral beach, nth & sth head... the lot! Also a convenient & quick way to get to manly iot enjoy the beach & the walks there.
local tip. Go in, rush past everyone - turn left as you go in, up the stairs and outside (regardless of which way its going) - the best views in Sydney - postcard material

Cheap and quick. A cheap way to get to Manly for a day out of the city and you get some great views of the sydney skyline too. Much cheaper than a tourist boat! Can get really full so if you want a decent seat make sure you get there about 15mins before it departs.

Good views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. A great ferry ride to Manly, go over in the afternoon to Manly Beach, eat in Manly and return to Sydney during the evening for nightime views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House.Well worth the ferry fare and don't forget your camera!

Great way to see Sydney at its best. Recently I decided to visit friends in Manly, and rather than drive, I took the Manly ferry.It had been many years since I have been on the ferry, and was delighted with the experience again after all these years.For a visitor to sydney, this is a great inexpensive way to see Sydney and its beautiful harbour, and to visit Manly.
Must Do Ferry Trip. Fairly pricey i thought tho very tidy, easy to fit in with your schedule and extremely well managed ferries - wish all ferries were this good!
Great Harbour Views. Lovely and inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbour from the the water. We took the Ferry to see the Manly Aquarium and were very pleased with the ride!
Great views!. I love getting the ferry to Manly, it's easy, the ques for tickets are never bad (I've also visited at Christmas) and you get fantastic views along the way!

Best and cheap way to go to Manly. It is the best trip to Manly, with traffic jams and parking prices. And also , you appreciated the great and wonderful view from Sydney bay, bridge. sit outside if possible.
scenic travelling. great way to get from circular key around to MANLY and its beaches and eating places $ 7.00 one way good value

a must. It is a lovely ferry ride from Sydney Harbor to Manly Beach. Great ferry that weaves through the water traffic and provides great views of the Opera House, the Bridge, and lots of the little islands and inlets along the way.

Trip to Manly. Even though the waves were rough and the ferry was bouncing nothing could detract from the beautiful views of Sydney Harbour Bridge, The Opera House Fort Dennison and Pinchgut Rock on the way to Manly Beach.Show your student or Senior's Card for a discount.Have fish and chips on the beach once you get to Manly or stroll along the foreshore.

A must do!. If you are in Sydney for a few days, make a trip across to Manly via the ferry! Be aware that the weather can make or break a trip if you suffer from motion sickness as it can get very rolly out near the heads, however it is well worth the time and money if you enjoy being on the water and want to see the Sydney Harbour from this perspective.Once in Manly there are so many fantastic places to eat, drink and shop before heading back to the city!

Excellent Trip. I recommend the trip to Manly for 2 reasons 1 to go to Manly's excellent beach for the day and 2nd you get to see the Harbour on your way there as opposed to paying for an organised Harbour Tour

Best way to see the Harbour.. "7 miles from Sydney and a thousand miles from care" is Manly's catchcry.On a sunny day there can be few ways to spend an hour or two than to catch the ferry over to Manly from historic Circular Quay. It's a big ferry with comfortable seats inside or you can sit outside and watch the activities on the Harbour, such as yacht races, cruise ships entering or leaving and see tourist essentials like the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Best seen from the water.The trip only takes about 20 minutes each way and is moderately priced.

Great Way to see the Harbour. If it is a nice sunny day and you are near Circular Quay then it is definitely worth having a trip on the Manly ferry. You get a wonderful view of the harbor and some of the icons of Sydney.
Nice experience. A nice experience for any visitor to Sydney.take the manly ferry and visit beautiful and charming manly
regular comfortable ferry ride. great views and photo opportunities, was a little rocky for a few minutes but calmed down again and a smooth ride.
Nice Ferry. The ride is about 30min but very comfortable. Also, Manly is well worth visiting.

Every visitor to Sydney should do this.. Cheap, fun, timely and the cheapest system to see the harbour because itis ferry travel, plus manly is so n.ice.the aquarium is so worth visiting. Love manly, but we all ate their footy team!,!!

Great day out. the ferry was really easy to get and frequent, only $7 each way, clean and comfortable. The only problem was the last return ferry on the Saturday was about 3pm, and we would have liked to stay in Manly longer.

The best way to see the harbour. Half an hour each way, starting in Circular Quay, passing a stone's throw from the Opera House on the way out. This is absolutely the easiest way to see the magnificent harbour. Jumping off at Manly, it's a quick walk through the Corso to the magnificent Manly Beach...

Manly Ferry. This is a lovely trip, whether or not you intend to get off and walk around Manly or not. I have taken this ferry and just sat on it each way to take in the wonderful views. Its cheap and accommodates all weathers.
Great way to see the harbour. Do yourself a favour and have lunch or dinner at Hugo's at Manly Wharf. Best.Pizza.Ever. The views aren't bad either!
Harbour experience. Great trip across the harbour, views of Opera House and bridge and the coves round the harbour on the way to Manly.

quick and cheap. the ferry takes about 15 mins from sydney harbour to manly and is only $14 for a return ticket! the boats are very regular and have free wifi! we were also lucky enough to spot some dolphins swimming alongside the boat!!

Take A Ferry! Forget The Cruise!. The Manly Ferry is as reliable as a German train and you can pretty much set your watch by it. We took the ferry later in the day, and the views of Sydney Harbor were spectacular! You pass very close by the Opera House both directions. The ferrys are very crowded, so try to get a good seat. I recommend sitting on the side of the ferry as the seats in the front outside are very limited. The ferry ride is about 45 minutes, and is very enjoyable. We came back in the evening so we had a chance to see the Opera House as they lights came on. Stunning. Oh...and did I mention it's only a few dollars? Great value!
A lovely trip. I love going on the Manly Ferry, it's an icon & makes for a reasonable day out. Food & beverages onboard leave a lot to be desired - pack your own!
GOOD VALUE. Nice trip on a sunny day - takes about half and hour each way - well worth the trip, gives you a good feel of the harbour and then once in Manly you can easily spend 2 - 3 hours here.

Totally worth it. Really nice ride, about 30 minutes long. Amazing view of Sydney along the way. Free wifi on board (just in case). Seats inside and out, so plenty of choice. Fee can be paid separately or with a bus pass as well.

'just lovely'. What a beautiful way to spend time in Sydney. Reasonably family friendly (with toddlers), good price and a great destination for a wander around the shops and a play on the beach. Definantly recommended.

Fantastic views. Took the 5pm ferry from Circular Quay and had the most amazing view of sunset over the harbour bridge. Closer to Manly, we were lucky enough to have a big bright full moon just over the horizon. Upon arrival we immediately boarded the next ferry back and although each leg was half an hour, making it a lengthy, touristy ride, it was well worth it.

The best trip on the Harbour.. If you only take one trip on the Sydney Ferries - make it this one. It takes you round the Harbour, past the Harbour entrance and the Tasman Sea to Manly with its two beaches, great walks, shops and restaurants. It is as good as most of the tourist Harbour cruises and its cheaper. All you will miss is the commentary.

wonderful trip. It was a touristy trip, but what the hell, we are tourists! The ferry leaves the Circular quay and then you have the best view possible of the Harbour Bridge as well as the Sydney Opera House. The entore harbour is available for you to photgraph and the entrance to the harbour is especially beautiful. We had brilliant sunshine and a thus a superb view all around. Loved it
Lovely way to view the harbour.. on a fine day, nothing beats taking a ferry accross to Manly. You can see all the old buildings, the harbour bridge etc and just relax.

Great way to see the city!. Manly is a great beach, definitely worth a visit, different from most Sydney beaches. The ferry is quite nice, you see nearly all you would on a harbour cruise and it is far cheaper.

Fun!. This is a fun way to visit Manly. The trip affords some amazing views looking back towards the city, Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Botanical Gardens and the big homes that sit on the edge of the harbour. It takes about 20 mins and when you get to Manly Wharf it's a nice, casual stroll up the mall to the beach and some really good places to eat and drink. The pub on the corner serves a really tasty lunch..
Cheap harbour cruise. Great way to see the harbour without paying for an expensive cruise. Many is a great place for lunch too

A Pleasant Sail to Manly Beach. This was one of our most pleasant fery rides when in the Sydney area. On time service, great wheater and simple access to Manly Beach after the Ferry made us relaxed before and after our surfing day in Manly.
worth a trip. took the ferry to manly one afternoon. it was very nice to see manly and the people surfing.
Just a Ferry...nothing special. The Ferry had dirty windows which made photographs terrible. Got you from point A to B.

Great way to see the harbour. If you want to get to Manly from Circular Quay, this is the best way to travel. Soak up the sights of beautiful Sydney Harbour during the 30 minute voyage to Manly. Download the 'next manly ferry' app from iTunes for up to date departure times. It's brilliant. Once in Manly, head to the corso and have fish and chips on the beachfront. You'll enjoy!

Fun side trip. The views of the opera house going and coming and all the water activity make the trip fun. Walking the Corso and the beach in either direction made a good Sunday occupation with lots of choices for lunch.

Excellent and cheap way to tour the harbour. As we were boarding the ferry a thunderstorm struck right above us with a heavy downpour, but the terminal was covered, as well as the ferry, and by the time we were out from the pier the rain had passed and we were able to enjoy the view of the bridge, harbor, and opera house.Once arriving in Manly, take the easy walk to Manly Spit along the water's edge. A great way to spend the afternoon!As we rode the late afternoon ferry back to Sydney, we were treated to the sight of the bridge lit up by a great sunset.The ferry is large and the seats are very comfortable. It was a smooth ride and very pleasant.
A great ride. We enjoyed visiting this beach and the ride over on the ferry.

A highlight of our trip to Sydney. We loved Manly. The ferry from Circular Quay to Manly is only a few $. Great views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and Sydney Bay as you cruise through the harbour. Such great value. They leave every 30 min.

A cheap way to see the harbour. It's a large, comfortable boat with a small cafe and clean toilets on board. An inexpensive way to see a good stretch of the harbour, it's a 30 minute trip from the Quay to Manly.
Awesome Views. What a great way to spend the day on the cheap in Sydney. Visit the beach and relax. The boat ride has amazing views of Sydney
Ahoy rough seas lol. Good views if the waves are not to big. Free internet on board also for doing some work during the 30 min journey. Plenty of good eating spots at the end of the journey.

Best value Sydney Harbour cruise. Forget about expensive harbour cruises. Head to Circular Quay and hop on the ferry to Manly. Go get a great trip though the harbour and out to the Heads, before getting to the older seaside suburb of Mnaly where you can look around, get your feet wet, have an ice cream or maybe lunch, before heading back for a spectacular ride back into the harbour with the iconic Harbour Bridge and Opera House to welcome you.

Manly Ferry. This is an iconic, old fashioned ferry. We had a beautiful day, which helped, with yachts sailing on the harbour, and a cruise ship passing. The wharf at Manly had an amazing lolly shop, and an Aldi, which we don't have access to at home, so that was interesting. If we had been there in summer, we could have stayed for a swim at the beach, which is just a short walk from the ferry.

A trip on the water. Take the ferry to Manly, walk along Corso to the Pacific Ocean, buy a Ben & Jerry's ice cream & watch the world go by. Make sure you check the ferry timetable before you leave the wharf so you don't miss the return ferry by a couple of minutes.
Manly Ferry. One half-hour of relaxation and world-class scenery. Cheap as chips for over-60s with Seniors Cards. $2.50 all day, all ferries! Bargain!

Great views of some fancy houses. Manly itself is definitely worth going to and the ferry is great as it takes you through the harbor where you can see a large number of high rent houses lining the water. Some are pretty darn impressive, as are the views of downtown from the water.
Great way to see the city!. Great views for pictures especially at sunset and night time - Manly is a cool area to hang out for a while as well!

Cheaper way to see the Harbour. The ferry was about $14ppn and was a nice day trip. Unfortunately the weather wasn't great but it was lovely to visit Manly and see the Opera House & Bridge from the water without paying for an expensive cruise.
Definitely worth a trip.
Excellent view of the harbour.. Make sure you are on the right side of the boat for the views...

must do once. Manly ferry travel to Manly beach and returning to sydney is a very good way and reasonably priced way of experiencing the arrival in Sydney by a ship.It can get a bit choppy and some times as the ferry approach the heads it can get quite stormy and ferry does move from side to side (not good with people who get car sick or sea sick). But it seldom happens and it's worth the risk for such a rewarding experience.
see the harbour like a local. purchase pass for unlimited rides....ferry passes other islands in harbour with great views....relaxing ride....
Great trip to lovely beaches. The ferries run regularly from Central Quay and the routeis included in your weeks pass. It takes you right past the Opera House to trip to get up front if you can.

Sydney's Star Ferry. In more ways than one! This is the busiest of the iconic Sydney ferries and is reminiscent of Hong Kong's Star Ferries, with similar views. It is equally busy, though the journey is longer and the ships on the route are bigger than their HK counterparts.It can get busy - especially around commuter time or busy weekends towards the end of the day. The service is regular though, so you should have no problems.Manly has plenty to see and do with a lot of eateries and bars. There is a beach about three hundred yards through the town - maaybe tht is the better option than the one beside the pier.

A Sydney Harbour trip with great views. A lovely way to see the Sydney harbour bridge and Opera house from the water. Great value for money ( especially with the MyMulti travel card). Manly has an air of 'faded glory', but a nice place. Getting the ferry back at sunset gives some fantastic views.Must be the best commute in the world if you take the ferry every day!
Excellent. We just enjoyed our ride on the ferry. It was quite busy but we still got a seat.

Great views from the ferry. Very nice trip on the Ferry to Manly Beach. You see expectacullar views of the harbor and the Opera House. They also have free wi-fi on board for those that need to do some work on the internet.

Manly Ferry Fantastic!. Catch this ferry from Manly Wharf to Circular Quay in the Sydney Harbour and you won't regret it! What scenery - watching Manly as you pull away from the wharf, the shoreline and the boats on the water. Make sure you make your way to the front of the ferry after you leave Manly Wharf and fight your way into the crowds of photographers. The approach to Sydney Harbour and Circular Quay is breathtaking.

If it's pictures you need, stay on the ferry for the best seats.. Sounds excessive but it's probably the only way. Unless you're freakishly fast or born lucky, you're not going to get the greatest seat for uninterrupted scenic views. We talked about it, then we did it. We stayed on the ferry after the first trip, then grabbed the best seats at the front when everyone got off. We got some rotten looks from the freakishly fast photographers in the next batch who thought they were first on! But we got some great footage on the way back, from the comfort of our well earned scenic seats.

Cruise with a View!. A little bit of History....runs every half- hour! We loved the hustle- bustle of Circular Quay with tourists mingling with commuters......to climb aboard the legendary gold and green ferry! We soon arrived at Manly Wharf where we explored "OceanWorld" and then headed up "The Curso" to enjoy the beach. After a very pleasant day we re-embarked and stood right at the bow of the ferry for our return trip. The view rounding the headland of Sydney Harbour and the Bridge was so spectacular..........it was a "Leonardo + Kate Titanic moment"....well almost......I like to dream!!
A classic Aus trip.... ....just like the song :) Was fun to walk around the shops near the beach, as well.
Nice way to see some of the coast. Great chance to see the surfing capital of Manly.Beautiful scenery and nice walks and eateries.
Sites up close and personal. See the Opera house from this great ferry, the Sidney Bridge and visit the beach areas while passing along by fabulous sail boats big and small so exciting and lovely
Great way to see Sydney. The ferry runs every hour and only cost us $4 so it's a cheap way to get a fish eye view of a beautiful city.
One of Sydney's best trips. Cheap and higly scenic, the ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly is a must-do for any visitor to Sydney.

best 2 for one deal around!. A fabulous view of the Sydney Harbour, the Bridge, the war memorial to the Sydney, and of course the Opera House, plus a visit to Manly Beach - all for around ten dollars! And when at Manly, take the Coastal Walk. You can go right up to the Artillery training centre ( now a visitor information centre, watch the video and see displays) and then out to the headland of the north side entrance to Sydney Harbour. Continue following the trail back to manly - It will take a couple of hours depending on your speed, stamina and number of photos you take! The walk however can be very rough in places - wear solid shoes and take lots of water. The walk is well worth it!
Best Ride. Very nice ferry and worth just the roundtrip. But get off and walk the 5 minutes to Manly Beach to enjoy the view.
Quick and free wifi. Pretty smooth quick journey, free wifi included. What a bliss! It cost $7 per way.
North Beach, place to see. 1/2 hour to go to thé North Beach by ferry to Mainly. Beautiful stores

Sunset ride!. A must do! It had been raining all day and we took the ferry just as the sun was going down. The day had finally cleared. It was beautiful- fabulous photos as we left the city and again returning to the city lights! ( the bBridge and the Opera House)

Take the ferry around sunset - great photos!. If you buy an all day train pass, you can use it on the ferries and buses as well. We took the Manly Ferry to Manly, spent about an hour walking around looking at the beautiful views and the lovely beaches, did a bit of shopping, and then took the ferry back. Being on the ferry while the sun is setting is amazing, and I have photos to prove it. You can see the sun set over the Harbor Bridge which is spectacular. The ride is about 30 minutes, relatively smooth and worth it.
Great way to see the harbor!. Very easy, very quick and pretty inexpensive way to get around. The harbor is absolutely beautiful.

Great trip across the harbour. Extremely regular service from Circular Quay to Manly. The ferry takes around 30 minutes each way. The return trip gives magnificent views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Reasonably priced (about $14 return).

The cheapest way to see Sydney Harbour. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly.Cost is approx $15 return (20min each way)On a warm & sunny day the harbour is spectacular.Once you reach Manly, follow the crowd down the Corso to the Beach.There are lots of Restaurants, priced to suit all budgets.On weekends, at the beach end of the Corso (to the leftside) there are market stalls for those looking to buy unique souvenirs.At beach front, you can book yourself into a surf school, hire rollerblades, bikes or a surfboard. I love to walk up and down the beach taking in the activities that are happening around me.

Beautiful!. It was a great change from walking around the city. On the ferry you get great views of the Opera House and the Sydney Harbor Bridge. Manly is a beautiful beach and the city has tons of little shops. I would highly recommend it.

ideal traveller day trip. This is an ideal day trip with a harbour cruise across to Manly, then there are shops and markets to enjoy, and then have lunch in a restaurant facing the beach. Just sit back and enjoy. then when you are ready head back again to sydney harbour

See the sights, for cheap!. Took the Manly Ferry on Easter Sunday. It is a really nice trip and has beautiful views of the Sydney suburbs. Manly is a cool place to go and hang out, rent some bikes, sightsee, shop, and have a couple drinks. The Manly Ferry is the largest ferry that leaves the Circular Quay and a bonus it has free WiFi!
Harbour Trip. Lovely veiw from the water to look back and see all the land attractions

always a great trip across to Manly. Living in the country I never grow tired of travelling on the harbour and taking it all in its just amazing and the ferry allows you to sit back chill out and take it slowly in and the staff are always friendly take the time to ask how your going

Good ferry trip. Very good and prompt ferry trip to Manly. Didn't like the choppiness when it turned out onto the Tasman sea, but the boat sits and rocks for a few minutes until it settles. Otherwise - a great trip to do and Manly is nice to walk around.
Easy trip to make. Hopped on the regular Manly ferry from Circular Quay. Pity it was raining, but it was all part of the experience. Great photos from all the decks.

Iconic Sydney. When you visit Sydney - the Manly Ferry is a must! It is a cheap way to view the harbour and surrounding areas, and to get an appreciation of the geography. Even in torrential rain, we enjoyed our journey!

The best value cruise in the world?. Breath-taking scenic views of the harbour, headlands and the city - sit up front on the upper level for best views - no-nonsense frequent commuter service worth every cent - not to be missed
Wow!. Where else could you take a beautiful half hour boat ride for $7!
You have to do it. Easy to use, but get to the front of the queue of you want to sit outside.
To Manly Beach. I think this is the best way to get to Manly Beach , which is also one of the places nobody should miss.

A good place to go. We loved the ferry and Manly itself. The day was so restful and we needed to relax after thre busy days trailing around the city. Har to believe that such a beautiful natural environment was so close.

Picture perfect.. This is a very nice 30 minute cruise from the city cbd to manly via a bhuge ferry , usually 2 level with plenty of outside seating for that typical sydney summers day or night , and plenty of indoor seating for the not so perfect days. . on a nice sunny day , it is seriously worth the few dollars for the retrurn trip. the fare is comparible to that of a bus trip. there are toilets on board , and there is also a food shop on board selling coffee and hot food.good to spend a day on manly beach and then head back to the city for a great night out.
Iconic trip. Ram packed at the weekends - however, still a great way to see the harbour and get to Manly. Watch out thought, that sun is hot, especially during the middle of the day

Relaxing day at the beach. We thought the area was nicer than the famous Bondi beach. Less touristy and commercialised. Nice wee market on the day we visited. Ferry was quick and comfortable but there were restrictions to sitting on the top deck and not enough seating outside downstairs for the numbers of travellers.Good day out watching all the sailing boats.Nice beach.

Good ride!!!. It was fantastic experience to ride between manly - circular quay - manly. This is one of the largest ferries in Sydney ferries. If you want to tour around Sydney then don't forget to include travel in Many ferry. Mostly weekdays office peak hours are fully crowded and weekends also.

Manly Ferry. Nothing out of the ordinary. A 30 minute trip from Circular Quay. the Ferry chugged along well but being a tourist route one would have expected a bit more help to be available for people wanting to get tickets and with TV monitors on board maybe they could be used to let you know what to expect or things to do whilst in Manly. Nice spot to visit.

great view of the opera house. for $14 round trip it's a great way to see the front on the Opera House and get to see a great beach, Manly. Plan to stay at least the afternoon. It's a great beach to hang out.

Great view of the Opera House. We went to Manly for surfing (but the beach was closed, boo) and took the ferry. The ride over is what everyone says. Not expensive, and a great way to see Sydney (including a great view of the Opera House). It was a rainy day, so the swells were high and it was a bit bumpy at times. I like the feel, but my motion sickness prone daughter was a bit on edge (she made it though). Nothing to do in Manly without the beach, so we headed straight back, but I would say this is worth the money and worth the time even if all you do is go over and back. On a nice day this would be a fabulous trip.

Amazing views at Sunset!. This is a super affordable way to see Sydney from another vantage point! Take the ferry which leaves just before sunset; you'll get the most amazing postcard-worthy views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. This was definitely a highlight of our trip to Sydney!
Did the ferry. Manley is a great place to go for a trip. The beach is unbelievable. Also ravelling by boat there was also an experience, and a great way to see the area, without testing lost!

Great views but not much to do in Manly. We had been advised by friends to get on this ferry rather than do a Harbour Tour.You need to get on as quickly as you can and get to the top fron or back as there are plenty of Tourists how do the same thing!The Views are spectacular of the Opera House and the Harbour bridge with plenty of opportunities for photo's. The Ferry trip takes about 20 Minutes but when you get to Manly there is nothing there. a small highstreet and a nice sandy beach is all so we quickly came back for more photo's
Fun day out for the family. Fantastic views of the harbour on this 30 minute trip from Sydney to Manly.

Cheap way to experience Sydney Harbour. A must-do when visiting Sydney. Catching a ferry from Circular Quay (near The Rocks) across Sydney Harbour to Manly is an inexpensive way to experience the stunning Sydney Harbour. The Jet-Cat is a high speed option, although a little more expensive, but in my opinion - why rush? Catching an older, historic ferry is delightful and I would strongly recommend sitting outside, up the front - unless its raining of course!! Once in Manly, take some time to wander around the Esplanade and take a dip in the beach!
Travel. We were advised at the terminal to purchase a multi pass which can be used on the ferry, bus & train, excellent value for money. The ferries were very clean and well managed.
Magnificent Sydney Harbour. A great way to see the magnificent Sydney Harbour is a ride on the Manly ferry. It's even better fun if there is a big swell running as you cross the heads.
Love the Manly Ferry. Why would you pay for a cruise of Sydney Harbour when you can get the Ferry? Love the Ferry. Do a round trip to Manly - it's the best.
City Lights. Did the trip from Manly to Circular Quay at night - what a beautiful sight coming in to the city towards all the lights.
Beautiful Sydney Harbour. A simply great way to see the gorgeous Sydney Harbour...not to be missed.

On time. Very calm ride. Great Views.. This ferry is very efficient and always leaves on time. It is a huge boat so there is plenty of room for everyone to get a seat. Whilst most of the space is inside the openesss of the boat and the windows means that everyone can still get a view. The ferry departs from the central location of CIrcular Quay in Sydney and right in the heart of Manly. The trip is wonderful with great views of Sydney Harbour.
Highly recommended. Great view of Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House as you come back to Circular Quay.

Great way to see the harbour. So easy to just jump on a ferry to Manly and what a great way to see the Harbour, Bridge and Opera House.Yes it can get very busy at times, remember some people are commuting between Manly and the city.
See the Manly Beach. The front of the ferry is the other end away from the dock! You can get good photos of the Opera House and the Bridge.
Excellent. Enjoyable way to get to Manly. Go on a Sunday - public transport very cheap :-)
Great harbour views. Really enjoyed this half hour ferry to Manly. Great views of the harbour. Manly Beach was really worth visiting. excellent value for money.

Take the ferry to Manly Beach. Wonderful ferry ride, great views of the Harbour, Bridge and Opera House, try and get a seat at the back of the ferry outside so you can enjoy the experience and catch some rays!

VERY EFFICIENT. This is certainly the best way to get to Manly from Sydney CBD. The ferries provide a regular, quick, service that leaves and arrives on time and docks at a convenient location in Manly for the beach and shops. The cost of the return trip is very reasonable.

Lovely half hour ferry trip. This is a must on any visit to Sydney. We do it every time and still love it. Running every half hour from Circular Quay it is a lovely relaxing sea trip. Board early & sit out on the open decks at the top. The ferries are double ended so they don't actually turn around coming out of Circular Quay or Manley so make sure you sit at the front for the best views of the bridge and opera house when you do the return trip to Sydney from Manley.

What a way to see the Harbour. Who wants to travel by bus when you can travel by water and Manly is a lovely destination. The views on the way across the harbour are definitely worth a look when you are in Sydney

INEXPENSIVE, BEAUTIFUL TRIP. Manly Beach is an un-touristy upscale gorgeous little place for a day trip. Beach is a 5-minute walk from the ferrry, or find a bench looking back into Sydney Harbor and watch the ships parade by as they enter and leave the harbor into the ocean. And then say "Pinch me, I can't believe I ever got to see this."

Great way to visit Manly. Very efficient if a little chaotic getting on and off. We went on a Saturday and the ferries were really full, but there were seats for all. The walk along the Corso was interesting and the beach at the end lovely with lots of places to sit and enjoy all the activities.

Love it every time. If I am ever at a loose end for a day in Sydney, I like to take a trip on a harbour on the wonderful harbour. Going to Manly is one of my favourites. A leisurely journey bobbing across the dynamic harbour watching the cruise liners make their way, the sail boats zipping around, the fisherman coming and going and the pleasure craft having fun.There used to be a old handpanted sign on the wharf at Manly which sums it up nicely "Seven miles from Sydney and a million miles from care"

Prefer going to Manly than Bondi. The ferry trip is a good way to see the harbour, Manly itself is a neat town worth a stroll around. The beach and surf is fantastic. Walk out to the point and see the dragons!

Picturesque ferry trip. Efficient ferry service which runs every half hour from Circular Quay over to Manly. Great views of Sydney Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. Took about half an hour to travel to Manly.

The cheapest way to Sydney from the water.. This is inexpensive and efficient. Manly was beautiful in the sunshine and the return journey saw us come back to Sydney just as the sun was setting - incredible to turn the corner to the bay and see the city lit like that against a glowing sky. The only downfall was the free wireless they advertise on the trips wasn't working.
Twinkling Lights. Go at night - have dinner at one of the pubs & take the ferry back! Like wonderland!

What a view. Excellent value - forget about the expensive harbour cruises. A trip to manly is all you need - great views, relaxing trip, good food along the road to the ocean (which you must walk down and see before you take the return trip to Circular Quay)
Stress free travel. Loved travelling by ferry especially to Manly with such expectations of a safe, reliable service with added views of the hotspots
Quick and easy. Just a quick and easy way to get to Manly! Not too crowded and good price.

Value harbour cruise. Taking the ferry from Circular Quay across to Manly offers a relaxing opportunity to view the Sydney Harbour and take in some of the many restaurants at manly - a great value day out.

Great way to sea the harbour at a reasonable cost. The ferry is an experience in itself, carrying you across Sydney harbour through the traffic lanes of both pleasure and sea going craft. We had the luck to see very large ocean liners as well as yachtsmen practising their crafts.
great service. used the ferry a number of times. Great service, economical and very dependable

Great views of harbor lead to great beach fun. Amazing views of the Sydney Opera house from the dockside of the boat on the out bound; great views of the bridge from the upper deck on the return. Try to get a seat outside in the front upper deck to really get a good look. The beach and Oceanworld Manly were also fun - it's not just a cheap tour of the harbor.
Ferry ride. We went by ferry to manly which was great the ferry ride gives you great views of the bay and Sydney

Good way to see the harbour. Well worth getting the ferry across to Manly as the trip is one of the best ways to see the harbour/bay. Then spend the day at Manly, perhaps hire a bike or walk to Shelly bay
Cheap Harbour cruise. We did a trip to Manly just for the boat ride, if you get a train/bus/ferry pass you can go on them all unlimited times. Ferry was clean and runs regularly, good trip.
Fun scenic boat ride. It is a cheap way to see the harbour and get to Manly Beach....go for a beach day or just to see a different side of Sydney.
It's a ferry.. It was pretty cheap and got me to Manly without sinking. Can hardly fault it based on that!
Sydney's best value. Simple and inexpensive way to see Sydney's great attraction -- the brilliant Harbour. No frill, but with these views, who needs them?

Can be expensive and overrated. If you must take the Manly ferry, I suggest you get a travelten season ticket or borrow one, and avoid weekends and peak hours.If you choose a day when there is a bit of swell, it can be very entertaining.

Manly is terrific... the ferry ride is a great start.. Having a nice ride across the harbour to start your visit to Manly is fun, and Manly iteslf is a great destination. The ride gives a great series of views of the Sydney skyline, and some great views of the bridge and the opera house in the same frame.
Relaxing and scenic. This was a very nice ride over to Manly! We went in the morning and it was a bit crowded.
sunshine, ferry and lunch. relaxing trip across the harbour to Manly. Lovely lunch at a beachside cafe

Great way back from Manly. We took the city bus #180 to the Spit Bridge and walked the 10km (6 mile) Manly Scenic Walkway....just a wonderful way to see the harbour, forest and parts of Sydney. A truely fantastic walk.Took the ferry back to the city. The ferry is clean, busy, easy to get onto and remember to sit on the left hand side so you can see the Opera House!

Ferry rides are a must do in Sydney - Manly ferry is one of the best. All rides through the harbour are beautiful. Manly ferries go from Manly to Circular Quay. They go past the "heads" which are the entrance to Sydney harbour with glorious cliff faces. They go past Shark Island, the Opera house and pull up next to the Harbour bridge at Circular Quay. If the seas are rough, you could get a bit sea sick as you pass the heads - when the ferry is exposed to the ocean rather than being protected by the harbour. Manly has a harbour and a surf beach. The walk along "the Corso" between the two beaches has a lovely feel. It is mostly a pedestrian walkway. Manly oceanworld is located on the harbourside beach to the left of the wharf as you face manly.

Best way to see the Bridge, the Harbour and the Opera house. A must when you are in Sydney as this gives you amazing views of Sydney harbour. Prefer these views to those from the top of the bridge, and don't need to take out a mortgage to do it
Quick and pleasant. A good way to get to Manly in a short time, avoiding traffic. After getting there, did the scenic walk (10km) which was amazing.
Time Out. Always a great ferry trip to Manley, lovely shops, restaurants & pubs to choose from. A gr8 escape from the city, lovely beaches, walks etc
Only way to go. I love travelling to Manly via the Ferry & enjoying lunch on beach

Go over to Manly on the Ferry!. A great way to see our beautiful harbour on the Manly Ferry. On the way you pass by many of Sydney's lovely harbour beaches.I think the town of Manly is a bit dirty and could do with a clean up, but there are lots of ok cafes, so its worth a visit for a bite to eat, an ice cream and maybe a quick swim at the beach or pool. Such a lovely view when you sail back into Sydney Harbour and see the magnificent Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Well worth it.
Great service. whata great way to get around on the water and to see the Attractions very impressed

Great fun. The ferry to Manly is a Sydney tradition- when you get there, go to the aquarium and make sure you walk along the Corso and buy an ice cream. Finish up at beautiful Manly Beach and swim or people-watch.
Good way to travel. Very convenient way to get across to manly. I liked that it is quick 20 mins no parking worries it was very full an the days went over tho.
get a multi ticket. great ferry service, Manly is so nice, in my opinion better by far than the iconic Bondi

Absolutely Brilliant.. We had a MyMulti pass so $40 or so dollars for a week pass to everything (Buses, Trains and Ferries) so jumped on the ferry to Manly. Great views of the harbour bridge and then onto Manly which is a great area and beach.

Value for money, great views, Manly pleasant. Initially we thought the ferry was a bit expensive, but then we compared the price with the Devonport Ferry in Auckland which travels for half the time as the Manly one. By the time we arrived in Manly we were converted to thinking this was good value. Manly itself is a nice laid back (Sydney style) area with a great beach.
The best way to visit Manly. The ferry to Manly is an unforgettable experience. Sometimes it may be busy, try not to take it during midday though.

Take in the Harbour. You cannot find a better and cheaper way to see the harbour. You can go to Manly check out both beaches, have lunch, and return to Sydney. On the way you pass by many of Sydney's lovely harbour beaches.
Cruising budget style. Loved that we got to see a lot of the harbour at little cost, I could do this over and again and never get bored!
very nice. Great half day trip. beautiful, but it was very windy and chilly in December when we were there !
Simple but Enjoyable. We love traveling to Manley by Ferry and see Sydney Bridge and rest.The cost was AUD 14 return but worth. Its just 30-40 min one way

Manly. Manly is our most famous Northern Beach. It's a great place to visit. You can take a ferry from Circular Quay in the city. Of course, there is a fabulous beach, but there is also shopping, eating and drinking to do! I love Manly Wine - sit back and enjoy the gorgeous view, with a glass of Australian wine - mmmm - doesn't get much better.Shannonwww.urbanchicguides.com

The best way to travel in Sydney!. We love all the boats in the harbour and the downtown buildings. Manly ferry is a great way to see Sydney. And Manly beach is wonderful -- lots of activity and great waves.

Great way to see the area.. The ferry was priced very reasonably and allowed fantastic views of Sydney harbour, bridge, etc.
Get on the ferry early to get a good seat outside at the front.
Manly is a great place to visit.
gives great photos of the opera house+bridge. pleasant ferry ride reasonably priced....shame about the weather but worth it just for the views and photo oportunities

The Manly Ferry is one of the best way to see Sydney Harbour. The Manly Ferry is a public ferry used by locals to get from the Manly area to the CBD. Dont travel at peak time as its busy. Travelling on this ferry can show the best parts of Sydney Harbour at a reasonable price. Also enjoy Manly and the many pubs whilst your there.Another Ferry to try is the Inner Habour ferry visiting Balmain. Another great ferry trip showing another great tour of our beautiful harbour.
Great day out. Great ferry ride to a nice place to spend the day. Good beach and shopping. Lots of places to eat.
great day. Got Ferry to Manly Beach ($21 return for adult and child) was a great day out surfing the waves and trawling Thur shops.

Relaxing Ride. I was surprised at how nice the "slow" ferry was..plenty of comfortable seating inside and out,with TV's inside the cabin,and a snack bar.The ride is scenic and the time flies by. Oh yeah,and there is WIFI. Why pay more for the other ferry?

Fresh air, views and jet lag remedy!. Inexpensive way to get fresh air and city and Sydney views from the water after a long international flight. The 30-minute ride between Circular Quay and Manly is not too long and not too short. The protected harbour makes for a fairly smooth ride, so no problem with motion-sickness.
Ferry to Manley. A nice way to get to Manley, a relaxing boat ride without the hassle of traffic cheap to use and never a long wait until the next one
Very efficient.. Very efficient way to travel to and from Manly Beach. Nice views of Sydney Harbor.

We loved manly. Whilst on this ferry, that iconic australian song was stuck in my head...we had a gorgeous time on our daytrip to manly and next trip hope to stay there for a week. Manly had such a lovely village feel, and whilst our trip was a teeny bit choppy, it was great to experience travel the sydney way. we enjoyed the beach so much more than bondi.

Best way to get to Manly. In 30 minutes you are in manly, it is cheap and if you want it faster you can toake the jet cat for a few dollars more. Good views on the way and usually fairly smooth passage.

A quick and lovely cruise. The trip was quick and very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful..The cost was reasonable as well. It was a shame through that on the day that we took the ferry, it was showerly in Sydney.
A good price for a nice journey.. Really good value are the ferries and Manly was great for shopping and we get to see a different perspective of the city from the harbor.

Manly is a fun outing. Ride the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and enjoy walking along shops and restaurants from the Ferry Terminal to Manly Beach which is a great beach. Also, you can visit the Aquarium and then from the Acquarium walk a path along the water with great views of Sydney.

A must-do for visitors.. The ferries looks quite aged but nevertheless still feel very sturdy and well maintained. They have the sort of settings that make you think about the history of these ferries and the development Sydney has experienced in the past 20 or so years, which is good feeling I must add. There route puts you in a good position to take a good shot of iconic landmarks in Sydney, especially so for the Harbour Bridge. The price of a ticket is fair and worth it. I'd recommend this trip for sight seers.
take the kids. everyone local and visiting should take a ferry ride - best and cheapest way to see the harbour - sit outside and enjoy the view..
Enjoyable ride. I love the Manly Ferry. Each time we visit Sydney we get the ferry to Manly. It takes about 1/2 an hour and the views of the harbours are fantastic.
Good day out. Fairly easy and cheap to get across to manly (which is well worth the visit) plenty to see from the ferry which runs every 30 mins or so. Well worth some of your time in Sydney area.
A "Sydney" must do!. This is a compulsory 'trip' for all visitors to Sydney. Very reliable service, and out of peak hour travel there is plenty of room.
Inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbour. This is the regular ferry trip from Manly to Circular Quay at the CBD. Great views along the way for a fraction of the cost of a tour.

Manly to The Spit. Yes there is the Bondi to Bronte walk but for a 10km challenge with extraordinary views of the Harbour and beaches try walking from Manly to The Spit. Finish off with a swim at either end. It is possible to do smaller sections of the walk but if you have a couple of hours this is just delightful
You just goto !!!!!!!!!!!. This is one of the most travelled ferries but Manly is well worth it !!!!!!!!!!! just go out and do it !!!!!!!!!!!!!

a good way to see the waterfront areas.. Here is a tip. buy an all day ferry pass and you can ride all over the harbor and river all day for $21. they even have 30 minutes of free WI FI on board! almost like a tour boat except without the commentary.

Great value for money.. Going to Manly by ferry is a great day out. The ferries are on time and there is always a place to sit. There are many trips per day so you don´t have to worry about time so much. Safety at the wharf is strict and no smoking or drinking allowed on board makes it even more enjoyable. Highly recommend the trip,,, there and back.

MEDIOCRE FERRY BUT A GREAT VIEW OF SYDNEY. The Manly Ferry takes you to Manly beach. The ferry and beach are very forgettable! What makes this a great attraction is the view of Sydney Harbour. When you leave and return you are treated to world class views of the Bridge, Opera House, and The Rocks.So enjoy the 1 hour round trip to Manly beach as a way to spend a modest amount of money to see gorgeous views. You are not paying for a pricey tour this way and how much commentary do you need when the view speaks for itself. Manly Beach is polluted, not attractive, and crowded. So walk up on the hill above the beach to get vantage point views. Then getback on the ferry to see the views as you return to Sydney. Unless the weather is lousy, sit outside, cover yourself with sunscreen, and try to sit toward the front so you can see both sides going back into the city.

Great day trip for lunch, shopping and beach time.. Take the ferry over to Manly it travels very close to the heads of the Harbour which is wonderful to see. Then walk through Manly's cute down town to their beautiful beach.

Public Ferry to Manly so worth a trip. The beach at Manly was so squeaky clean I had to take my shoes off and walk in water. Cabbage tree Bay was beautiful. Walk along and have a beer at the cafe there its so relaxing.
A great ride. Great trip to a popular beach. Dinner in the local pub overlooking the beach
Great service!. Great way to go to Manly! Very clean and friendly staff!
Fantastic Views. I loved the 30min journey from Circular Quay over to Manly, wonderful views of the bridge and opera house.
Great way to see the harbor. Easy, economical, great way to se the harbor, even if you don't get off in Manly, makes for a nice ride with great scenery there and back.

Excellent Value, Safe and Reliable. The Ferry system in Sydney is wonderful. They are an inexpensive way to get around Sydney and are reliable and safe. $7AU gets you to the town of Manly ($14 AU rt). Also, it is a great way to look back at the city....bring your camera!
Manly Ferry. Manly Island was fun, the beach was warm and inviting and the people very friendly.

Bit uncomfortable. We went on te manly ferry a couple of times, but found it very packed each time. I am thinking the trip may have been more enjoyable if we had a seat near a window so we could enjoy the scenery but this was no to be. On arrival at manly I also found e visitor info centre very crowded and rushed and staff had no time to talk to us about anything in any sort of detail. If or when I visit again, I will make sure I do my homework and no exactly what I want to do and where to go. Will make sure I am at the front of the queue to get a good seat too

If you don't travel on this you haven't been to Oz!. Quick, reasonably priced and a faster way to get to Manly. Many locals travel by the Ferry to get to the City every day for work. better than being squashed on a train any day! At Manly there's a lovely tree lined sandy beach with restaurants and cafes just back from the beach. Picnic areas abound in this area. There is also a lovely walk along the edge of the rocks to a little place called Shell Bay and a nice little very popular restaurant called Fairy Glen, or there was when we last visited five years ago. It's lovely just sauntering along by the edge of the water stopping now and then just to take in the views. On the Ferry you can buy refreshments, but as the trip from Manly to Circular Quay is quite short it's probably cheaper buy something before boarding. Sit inside or outside, the choice is yours. We always went for the seats at the back outside where there were fewer people, most tourists wanting to go up top for a better view. Do the Manly Ferry or you'll miss something special. (visit prior to 2011)

fabulous views. easiest and probably most scenic way to get to Manly, fabulous views of Sydney harbour. Try and get a seat outside on the front deck for the return to get best camera shots of the opera house and bridge. MUCH cheaper than Capt Clark harbour cruises

Wait until it's about to close. The ferries seem old and sedate but are really rugged hard, sailing ladies of the sea, locked in a harbour and straining to be released. Ride up the front in the open at night during bad weather, preferably the trip before they close due to the rough weather, cheapest adventure ride you will ever get as it goes past Sydney Heads. FANTASTIC. On the Manly Ferry: No One Can Hear You Scream!

Great trip at a great value. The Sydney skyline was picturesque, the ferry reasonably priced and Manly Beach and its surrounding shops and restaurant were definitely worth the trip. A wonderful, reasonably priced way to get great views, see a famous beach and generally enjoy a nice day.
Very easy. Easy to get to and it drops you off less than a 5 minute walk to the beach. You walk through shops and places to eat. Really neat place. I liked Manly better than Bondi.
The life blood of Sydney. Super frequent and comfy. Best way to travel to Manly
Great boat ride. 30 enjoyable minutes from Circular Quay on the local ferry to a popular surfer beach

Manly is nicer than Bondi. If you want to see Sydney harbour, take the ferry to Manly. At only A$12 reurn, it is a very good way to see a lot of Sydney harbour. Manly is a very nice seaside destination and better than Bondi. Take the walk to Shelly Bay and look for the water dragons on the way.

Lovely scenic journey. Catching the ferry at either Many or Circular Quay in the city is one of the most delightful ways to cross Sydney Harbour. The journey takes about 35 minutes one way. There is a kiosk on board and also restrooms. During this journey you are able to sit outside and experience the spray from the water or asit inside in comfort and watch the beauitul scenery as you sail past the entrance the Sydney Harbour.
Day Trip to Manly. Great Beach, but walk the trail to the right to the small beach in the distance and you have a lot less people. Very cool town with great people watching boardwalk.

A good way of crossing the harbour - or taking a boat trip. We did actually use the ferry to travel to a restaurant in Manly - but for a touristit is a good way of having a boat trip across Sydney Harbour.Free WiFi is available onthe ferry -a rarity in Australia!
Best way to travel. What amazing views . Ver convenient way to travel. The service is very frequent and hassle free.

Seavoyage, shopping, beaching and feels like a vacation. On a large ferry from Circular Quay (CBD)and you go past both the North and South Heads at the entrance to the harbour. Can lean on the rails or sit inside or out--your choice. Nice views of homes clinging to the shores and some natural reserves,takes a half hour. Then a short walk down The corso of shops to the REAL CORSO -which is the long beach and paved walk next to it. A place to change into your swimwear,a toilet, and there is a shower outside to wash the salt off you. You have a choice of restaurants to eat at, small snacks (pies,burgers,etc) across the street. Many seats under the many tall pines,you can sit on the wall between beach and walkway.There's a fenced walk to another small secluded beach. Then back home on the ferry (or a bus if you desire but a ferry is quicker to get back to CBD. A wonderful relaxed day's outing.

Trip to Manly. Not only does this give you an opportunity to view the Opera House and the bridge from the water but it was a good and relatively cheap day out. The boat has free WiFi but you need to be inside to really benefit. We bought a sandwich from a place recommended on TripAdviser and went for a really good walk.
Manly. Great boat ride, and the beach is amazing, cheap places to eat.
Wonderful trip. Loved going over on the ferry, it takes about 30mins and when you go on the weekend there is alot of activity on the harbour
Unmissable!. One of the great (no, the greatest) ferry rides in the world. Not to be missed on a visit to Sydney and something to do regularly for those of us who live here.

Cheap little harbour cruise. If you want to see the harbour but don't want to pay AUD$30+ for a "proper" cruise, get a return ticket for Manly Ferry. You get to see the whole harbour from a nice ship and while it doesn't take as long as a cruise, it's also not that short. Tickets easily purchased from the machines or ticket booths at the pier.
So much fun!!. The Manly Ferry is a great way to see the Harbour. It is fast and clean
Fabulous ride to Manly!. Manly is a great day out from Sydney and has another spectacular beach, great restaurants and shops. Leisurely pace here!

Best and cheapest ferry to view Sydney at its best. Wow, for a few $$$$'s this has to be the cheapest and best way to see the amazing harbour. Take the late ferry and watch the sun set under the Harbour Bridge. Take the early ferry to see the Sydney siders out in their canoes and cayaks before setting off to work. Laze away on the mid day ferry and wonder at that unbelievable harbour.

Great way to explore Manly. Regular services from Circular Quay, comfortable and very pleasant trip. Day passes available for bus, train, ferry. Great way to explore Manly without the hassle of parking the car!!!

Trip worth doing.. A good trip across the harbour to Manly. A delightful place, calm and peaceful one side, a walk through the town and you find yourself on the beach with surfs. A really pleasant place to visit.

The cheapest way to see the harbour and back again?. Sydney is sooo expensive, but I was recommended by locals to try the Manly Ferry to (1) see more of the harbour across the coast and (2) for a great beach experience whilst in Manly. We were not to be dissappointed. The ferries run every half hour from circular quay from wharf 3 and the return journey was $14 which by sydney standards is reasonable. Once you arrive in Manly it is a short 5-10 minute walk depending on how hot it is to go to the beach and watch the surfers catch the waves. Lots of great cafes and shops to look at on the way and along the beach road. Wish we had longer to stay there, it was a relaxing alternative to the busy city. Return ferries are also every half hour and tickets can be purchased on board and at each terminal. The ferry is completely accessible for wheelchair users.
great way to see Sydney harbour. the ferries were very frequent and it was a great way to view sydney harbor

One of Sydney's best activities. The Manly ferry provides stunning views of Sydney Harbour, the Opera house and Sydney Harbour Bridge, as well as a taste of the swells of the Pacific as it passess the entry to the Harbour. It is inexpensive and if you pruchase a ferry pass you can take not only the Manly Ferry but others that provide unique views Darling Harbour, Luna Park, the Zoo and other beach areas.
A must do. Whether you go by day or night (a good way to see the Harbour at night) a trip to Manly means having fish & chips - a must do in Sydney!
Great trip. Great ferry ride and a great walk down to Manly Beach and back

A great and inexpensive way to see the opera house and bridge. Everyone needs some shots of the bridge and opera house from water and this is the most affordable way to get them. Daytime photos are great but the ones at sunset are hard to beat!
Cheap alternative to the Tours. Why pay $20 to do a Harbour cruise when for about $7 you can take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manyle and see even more!

The true Sydney experience. This is the easiest way to see of the best parts of Sydney harbour - enjoy the view of some of the most exclusive suburbs, the bridge and Opera House - and then when you arrive in Manly there is a plethora of great restaurants and bars on the wharf to enjoy. If you splash out on one of the private fast ferries - they have a bar!

Busy, historic ferry.. Atmospheric ferry to Many, very busy at weekends, where the beaches are superb. Rather too many shops for me, but they were busy so the demand is there. Lots of wonderful photo opportunities on the way there and back.
Manly ferry. Relaxing trip, approx 30 minutes each way, very busy on return from beach.

Spectacular. The best way to see the harbor is othe harbor. Take the ferry to manly (which is another great spot). If you are here on Sunday it is dirt cheap. Look for the Sunday funday family pass for a full day of public transport fun.
Want To Relax. 1hr each way from Circular Quay of sheer beauty of 100 year old ferries crossing the magnificent harbour. Hop off at Manly and enjoy time exploring shops, beach,eateries

Such a lovely ride from Sydney to Manly. On a beautiful, sunny day, the ferry from Sydney to Manly is such a lovely ride. Manly itself is a busy seaside town with a beautiful beach, cafes, bars, shops and restaurants. Providing you swim within the designated areas, the beach is safe, and of course patrolled by life guards. Whether you are just people watching or enjoying the waves, it's a nice place to visit.

Should be on everyone's 'things to do in Sydney' list. Brilliant place to go if you enjoy nature, walking, wonderful trees, a great cafe to eat at in the centre of the park and keep looking up trees to spy kookaburras and cockatoos if you are quiet. The views to the Opera House are wonderful and you can walk beside the water for ages if you wish. Take a picnic and rug like the Sydnesiders do and enjoy..
Cheaper than tour.. Cheaper than a tour and an opportunity to mix with locals.

So fun, great views, sweet beach at the end.. Manly beach is so fun...like a socal beach in the USA. Lots of restaurants and waves and surfers...beautiful sand. The Manly Ferry was a sweet way to get there...easy to grab a seat and watch the city disappear from the back of the boat while the seagulls fly along the side of the plane.

crossing the harbour. This is the best way to see Sydney harbour by water.Views of the Opera house as you cruise past,great harbour bridge photo opportunities.It is a half hour trip one way,just beautiful way to travel to Manly.
Wonderful Views. The views of the Harbour during the trip are fantastic.

A must do for first time travellers. I got myself a MyMulti2 Weekly travel pass, and made use of the opportunity to take the ferry to Manly to do a bit of exploring. Being a monohull ferry, when the swell got up a bit, the ferry did rock a bit, but at no time did I feel unsafe, and it was a truly enjoyable way to spend the 1/2 hour journey time.
Great trip. The ferry to Manley takes in lots of the harbour and gives you a real sense of size and different neighbourhoods. A must for visitors
Great ride to Manly. Great ride to Manly beaches and shopping from Circular Quay

See Sydney Harbour at it's Best. For the low cost of a ferry ticket, you can get a wonderfully relaxing 45 minute ride across Sydney Harbour. People pay big bucks for this on private cruises. No frills here, just a birds eye view of the finest city & harbour in the world.

Great way to see the harbour from the water. The ferry costs $7 each way. we sat outside at the back as it gets windy and cold at the front. It doesnt turn around as it leaves the harbour so it must have an engine both ends.Manly beach is great and guess what, you can refill your water bottles from numerous drinking fountains along the front. They are trying to reduce the use of bottled water. we went during the surfing championships

If you are a visitor to Sydney this is the best value thing you can do! Fabulous!. Sydeny's harbour is the best in the world, and it is what makes Sydney. (Unfortunately the vast majority of Sydneysiders don't get on it much so the are just living in another bloody city.)You do not have to get a guided tour. Just jump on the commuter ferry to Manly, walk to Manly beach, have a pizza and a beer on the Manly wharf, and catch the ferry back to the city.And you'll probably do it again, and shake your head and say "These people don't know how good this is." But you'd be wrong. Commuting every day doesn't make it any less wonderful. They all know how good it is and how lucky they are!

Great day out. If you have never been to Sydney (or even if you have) take the ferry to Manly. On a fine day it is a great experience on the harbour to / from Manly - and Manly itself is OK for a walk around and some lunch.
The trip on the Manly Ferry was sweet as!. The ferry ride was pleasant and easy. We experienced a few swells from other large ships in the harbour, but nothing caused any problems. All was good.
Manley Ferry. FANTASTIC views of the Harbour and Opera House and a really pleasant way to get to Manley.

Iconic. Visitors to Sydney MUST take a ride on the Manly Ferry. Manly itself is nice (walk to the beach side to appreciate it properly) but the ferry trip is the best bit. The views of the harbour, Opera House, Bridge, city, etc are spectacular, and it's a nice trip whether you're a kid or adult.
Just take the ferry!. This is always a wonderful trip - we've done it many times and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Sydney. Don't worry with a harbour cruise, just take the ferry!

Good views; cheap as well. The ferry is pretty cheap when compared to other ferries elsewhere and Manly beach is definitely worth a visit on your trip to Sydney. The harbour views from the ferry are pretty impressive and at some distance you can get both Opera House and the Harbour Bridge in the same frame, so that alone is worth a lot. The beach itself, on a weekday afternoon, was not too crowded and was decently clean and a must visit in Sydney according to me.

Nice trip, even without the destination. Manly is a "must" destination in this area. The regular ferry service runs every 30 minutes (you must arrive more than 2 minutes prior to departure or will have to wait for the next ferry) and the ride takes 30 minutes. There are also "fast ferries" several times a day that take only 20 minutes or so. But, the ride itself is worthy of doing even if you go to Manly just for lunch or a brief beach walk. The views along the coastline of the different flora and housing types is interesting. Plus, you pass through the Sydney Harbour and pass by Fort Dennison. Very scenic. Tip: Purchase a "My Mulit" ticket to get unlimited gov't transportation by ferry, bus, and train to save money on individual return tickets.

A good trip with spectacular scenery and Manly is lovely. An enjoyable morning trip on the ferry to take in some of the scenery and then to visit the beach at Manly both the walk through the shopping centre down to the surf beach with its pristine sand, surf to rave about and a long walk in the sunshine. An easy morning and early afternoon. We then caught the hydrofoil back to reduce the time of the return trip to Circular Quay. We had a light luncheon of fish, chips and salad. Just special

Love the ferry ride. What a great place we stayed here for a week in an older style apartment right in the middle of the action, just walk to the ferry to the city, and the beach is on the other side, excellent facilities, nothing historical to see just a lovely beach site.

The place to go. Manly is a very cool little beach town across the Sidney Harbor.
Lots of waterfront places to eat, benches facing the beach, water fountains for kids to play in and shops.

Enjoyable day outing. The family pass was great value, and made a great way to see Sydney harbour, and to cool off in the summer heat. Manly Beach is a nice spot to walk, and quite relaxed. We came back on the dusk ferry to see the city lights and Sydney harbour bridge -- all of which worked out fabulously and we had a magical view. I'd do it all again.

A great way to get to Manly Beach. From Circular Quay - a great way to get to Manly Beach - the iconic ferries of Sydney Harbour are a great opportunity to get fantastic photos of the harbour area, and get to the beautiful suburb of Manly, a short walk from the iconic beach.
Nice way to see the area. Just get on the main commuter ferry & enjoy the ride / views of the bay as you progress. Great chances to take good photos of bridge / Opera house & bay views.
Always restful. No matter how much one rushes around the city, a trip on the Manly ferry always calms you down. Time to sit and relax and roll with the waves.

A great photo op!. The 30 minute ferry ride provides an excellent view of both the opera house and the bridge from the water. Go early and enjoy the beach, or ride later in the day to enjoy the evening view. We rode the ferry to Manly for dinner one evening. If you are taking other transportation as well, ie, bus, train, look into the multi-pass. It can save you money.
In place of a harbor cruise. See the harbor cheaper than a tour boat, with great views of opera and bridge and city. Plus, you get to spend time in Manly, a cool beach town which is easily walkable.

A leisurely ride to Manly. This is a great day out but make sure you go in good weather. The trip over allows great views of the landscape and waterside suburbs and at the other end, Manly offers the Aquarium and many coffee and dining options, as well as the beach and North Head. Manly has been improved in recent years and is a lot more salubrious than it used to be, however, taking the ferry is far better and easier than driving as parking can be a nightmare.
O.K.. The ferry ride gave us a reprieve from the rain! Have always enjoyed going on the ferry to manly only this time we has to stay inside sheltering from the rain.
Manly Ferry. Great way to go to Manly. Great Harbor views. Plenty of things to look at when you get to Manly. Very busy on Weekends.

Best Value Harbour Experience. Don't pay mega bucks to do a Harbour cruise in Sydney! Take the ferry to Manly. You can sit outside in the frech air and sunshine, watch other boats go by, see the parks, seashore, houses. There's a cafe to buy a coffee or a beer. And when you get to Manly you can explore the Corso nd the Beach. Magic!

Good way to see Sydney Harbour. If you are in Sydney for only a short time, 1/2 days, the easiest and cheapest way to see the harbour is to get the Manly ferry from Circular Quay. Make sure you get one of the old ferries not a Hydrafoil (too quick) and sit on opposite sides for the two trips and you will see all of the harbour...you wont get a commentary but I am sure if you ask one of the locals they will point out places of interest. At Manly go for a short walk .plenty of cafes and get the next ferry back...about two hours .
Cheap and Cheerful. Buy a day pass and you try all the ferries ^^ definitely worth going on a day pass, as it includes ferries, trains and business. If a solo trip its expensive.
Nice ferry ride. Manley isn't worth the visit unless you want to surf and look at beach shops. Disappointing

Great view of the harbour. Manly is a destination - great beaches and a few fun shops. Through the years the town has transitioned from sleepy bedroom community to hip place to be seen to kind of seedy after the economic downturn. But the 30+ minute trip from Circular Quay to Manly ferry dock is a beautiful way to see Sydney's river sights. You get an unobstructed view of the Opera House and Hanger Bridge, plus the small islands and trendy, exclusive suburbs along the way. Well worth the time and much less costly than a harbor tour.

An affordable adventure. great ferry ride to Manly. smooth and quick all the way, enjoy the views of all the Sydney bays from the deck of the ferry. hold on to your hat though. grate filming and great photography opportunities on a sunny day right from the start to the end of this fun half hour trip
Sydney waters. A good tour along the Sydney harbour and a feel of Sydney foreshore.

Ferry cross the water. What a great and cheap way to have a cruise on the most beautiful harbour in the world (or certainly one of them)! Head for Manly on a nice day and walk through to the ocean, find a nice place for lunch (Manly Pavilion is great) and ferry back to the city.

salty brease. we loved the boat trip and the smell of salt in the air was exciting it bought back so many memories of fishing in the ocean on this day ther was a little swell so it was rocking back and fouth but we loved it!

Good ferry ride. This ferry ride gives you some excellent views of the harbor bridge and opera house. Once you're in Manly make sure you check out the Four Pines Brewery for some excellent local brews!

A highlight of the city. This is a great way to see the harbor and gives you great panoramic views of the bridge and the opera house. Make sure to make time for this. Try and get seating outside in the front as it offers the best views.
Excellent value for money. Got to visit Manley which is a lovely seaside town and also got to see the beautiful coast line of Sydney without paying harbour cruise prices.
FERRY. FAST, reasonable price, fantastic views all around you

One of the better deals in Sydney, but go early. This was a nice little boat ride from the Circular Quay. We took the first boat out on a Sunday morning and it was relaxing to just sit on deck and see the nice view around you. I think it is one of the best deals in Sydney. It docks in a good location, convenient to the beaches and the aquarium and walks. I would recommend this excursion to everyone.
Wonderful trip in Summer or winter. Try the ferry in winter for some sun and a bit of adventure with a swell

Exceptional Service!. Bought the weekly multi-pass for trains, ferries, and busses. During the week in Sydney we travelled 4 times to Manly and the ferry service wasfantastic. Sat outside and watched the sites go by during this 30 minute ride to Manly. The trip after dark was awesome!

Big and crowded. My experience on the Manly ferry was average and thats because i have never been on one before or ever been on one during week days. I did not hate it but were not liking it that much either. the weekend ferry was extremely crowded either ways and many people were standing. I believe that the ferry should run more often there not too many people are waiting and therefore less crowed. The price was reasonable and the duration of travel was great.
Nice Views. The Manly Ferry is a must. The views of the Opera Houseand the Harbour Bridge are great! It is a pleasant short tripto Manly and an inviting beach and lots of good shopping.
Best Value Harbour Cruise. I take the ferry with the kids - cheap and easy cruise. I'd take it to Manly and have a look. Why pay $50+
I can recommend this trip. Go on the ferry to Manly and visit the town and the nice beach. On the way you have a perfect view on the Opera House and the rest of the city harbour.
Surfing Excellence. Great beach, good for a walk along the promenade. Not expensive for the ferry and you get great views of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and harbour.

Sunset cruise. While in downtown Sydney, definitely take the ferry out to Manly for some awesome views of the harbor / city. Even if you only have an hour or so, it's worth the $14 roundtrip ticket to simply take the ferry out and back without spending any time in Manly! We timed it so we caught the sunset on the return trip to the city. Absolutely fantastic sunset/views of the city.
A Great Ride. A must do in Sydney for a fantastic view of the City and surrounds from the water.

Mini cruise on Sydney Harbour. Not the first time, and definitely not the last time that I took the ferry to Manly. It's feels like you're on a holiday the moment you board.... and off course Manly itself is really worth the trip. A must do when you are in Sydney, also gives excellent views on the harbour, Harbour Bridge and Opera House
watch sydney locals on a ferry. great weather great views yes we really liked it, we liked the pub at the end of the ferry ride best
Easy to get to Manly and view the heads. Wonderful leisurely trip from Manly to city or other direction. You get a great view of the Sydney heads out to the open ocean.

Cheap way of doing a harbour cruise. We were restricted with time so we just jumped on a ferry to Manly which was a lot cheaper than an organised harbour cruise and we could go when we wanted and saw the beautiful harbour and the sights. Manly is always a lovely place to visit also.
Great way 2 see manly. Cheap n good way to get to manly n see amazing area n enjoy views of harbiur

excellent way to travel. If you are in Sydney you must get a ferry pass. We were here for 6 days and purchase a week ferry pass which also gives you free use of the trains and buses within quite a large area. The ferries are very regular, are a very comfy way to travel and go to a multitude of places - Taronga zoo, Manly, Paramata, Darling Harbour, to name a few. We also used them at night to take us to different areas to eat.

Best Water Views of Sydney. Coming into Sydney on the Manly Ferry is awesome. Best viewed outside if you want to take pictures of the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. One of a kind water views and great value.
Iconic Manly. Brings back fantastic memories for me as a child to be on a ferry going to and from Manly Beach. Do yourself a favour and buy a ticket on the ferry. Fabulous photo opportunities.
Gotta do this. Iconic great price, do it. Easy to take to the Zoo and get great perspectives of the Bridge and Harbour.
Great summer ride. Brilliant view and nice way to get to Manly on a sunny day.

Nice day out!!. take a trip over to manly on the beautiful harbour, its a lovely way to spend a day in Sydney.
lots to see when you arrive as you walk around the shopping esplanade at manly.

The best location for your Sydney photo-shoot.. A pleasant 30 minute ferry ride to Manly beach from Circular Quay provides an endless vista of photographic opportunities, including the Opera House, glistening in the sunlight, its sails erect, and the "Coathanger" Bridge embracing the Harbour. Manly itself has delightful coastline walks for which one turns left off the ferry, or the main beaches if one turns right. Linger longer and do both!

Beautiful ride!. How lucky the Aussies are who get to ride this ferry as their daily commute to work. The scenery is beautiful and the ferry system seems efficiently run and very prompt. Manly Beach was a highlight, too.
Best way to get to Manly. Relaxing trip to Manly with excellent views of the opera house and bridge.

DON'T MISS THIS!. Whatever else you do in this magical city, there is one thing you must not miss in Sydney. Take the Manly ferry from wharf 3 at Circular Quay for a half-hour voyage across one of the world's greatest harbours. Get on the top deck forward facing and for just $14 return you will have an unforgettable experience.

Slow, smelly, old but great scenery. If it wasn't for the view the tourists would probably rather take a bus, but it also happens to be the quickest way of getting there, even if it does chug along. Some ferry's newer than others. Tip. Hold on to your hat!

Great destination - each way!. The ferry ride will keep you interested enough to make the trip worth it. Manly is a relaxed beach spot that you have to walk to as the ferry docks on the harbour side of a thin spit of land. The walk across is through the Corso, a shopping mall, full of shops, restaurants and people.
Seven miles from Sydney and a thousand miles from care.. A cheap excursion which offers the sights and sounds of the Harbour at their best. Good lunches available at the Manly Wharf Hotel.
Very regular service. We had bought a multi ticket and so using the ferry was of no extra cost. The ferry is clean and regular.
