A great day or night excursion. In the day, the ride and then the walk to the Spit (from where you can get a ride back by bus to the ferry or do the walk back too) is a great day's excursion. At night its a wonderful way to have a nice half hour ride (one way) on the bay. Watch out on Saturday night coming home as there are lots of folks who've had a few too many on board. But the worst part is the noise of the drunks. Still worth the trip
Well worth a visit!. Manly is worth a visit on the Ferry. Lovely vibrant place with nice beach and street entertainers. Good selection of bars and restaurants.

A great service and nice ride. I mostly wanted to catch the Manly Ferry so I could annoy my wife with my singing of "Reckless", but also to get a view of the city from the water. The ferry ride was nice and the weather was good, so we sat outside. What an awesome way to start the day.
Never been to manly before. Pleasant "cruise" over to Manly, short walk to beach, then dinner there [ $10 for lovely steak meal] before getting the ferry back to Circular Quay/ Darling Harbour.

A great morning out. We spent the morning taking the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. We got off and walked around Manly all the way to the ocean side of Manly. A great morning. Buy an all day pass that's good for rail, busses, monorails and ferries. Only $31 AUS.
Ferry trip to Manly beaches. Half hour each way. Get on early to grab outside seats. Boat has 2 bows (ie doesn't turn around). Great for going to Manly or just the ferry ride.

Very reliable and very cheap. Great value for money, they leave every our and take 30 minutes to get to Manly fro Circular Quay. Very busy on weekends though but don't worry, the boats are huge and can hold hundreds of passengers.
Surfers paradise. Went to see the World surfing championships - fantastic!

Manly delight. What a great way to get to Manly beach. The ferry is comfortable, fast and enjoyable. The ferry has a recharge station for the more popular mobiles; free wi fi, toilets and re freshments.
Ferry with wifi and safe. you can goggle on internet from your phone, ipod and laptop and enjoy the trip. drinks and food stuff for sale inside.

Must-do activity in Sydney. This is by far the best way to see Sydney Harbour - go on the public transport ferry to Manly from Circular Quay; it costs hugely less than seaplane / speedboat tours; has free wifi on the boat; and gives you the most amazing views on all four sides. I'd advise sitting outside at the front or back for the best views.

DIY Sydney Harbor Tour. There are some great tours of Sydney Harbor, but if you're a DIYer, then grab some harbor sights maps, and get onboard the ferry at Circular Quay for a trip to Manly. Round-trip is less than the cost of lunch, and you arrive in Manly within 45 minutes, having a waterside tour of the Opera House, the naval bay and the cliffs protecting Sydney bay.It seems incongruous, especially with high prices throughout Sydney, but the dock-side Aldi grocery store has some of the cheapest supplies you can find - don't miss it before catching the ferry back to Circular Quay.

Lovely Ride and fun Trip.. If you have a morning to spare - tale the Ferry to Manly. If you are a Senior you'll get an all day pass for around $2.50. This will also allow train and bus travel for that day.I emphasise the Ferry - not the Hydrofoyle. The Ferry is slower but better for the day tripper.Manly can give you 2 to 3 hours of just looking about. Maybe lunch or dinner - or brekkie.Well worth a trip.
Great way to see Sydney Harbour and visit Manly beach. Cheap way to visit Many, a good place to get fish and chips and Ben and Jerrys ice cream

take the slow boat and love the view all the way. it is pretty hard to beat the spectacular sydney harbour and the manly ferry is an awesome way to see it. Plus you get to go to manly, walk along the beach take in some fish and chips or sit down at an excellent cafe.

Cheap Sight Seeing. Travelling on the Manly Ferry is a must for visitors and locals who have forgotten just how gorgeous our harbour is. Sailboats glide by and friendly locals wave hello, champagne in hand. Feed the seagulls as the accompany you and soak up the glittering view, or enjoy a sunset as you return towards the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. For the adventurous, catch a ferry on a wild day and brave the trip through the heads, a favourite thing to do when we were kids. And remember 'Sunday-Funday' Adults can travel for $2 or so with up to four kids all day on all transport in the Sydney area. Cant beat that for value.
A great way to see Sydney. A visit to Manly is well worth the time and the ferry offers a chance to see Sydney from the water
got to love it. The surf, the surf. This is the Aussie dream, go seek..

Great ferry ride.. We travelled on this ferry several times during our visit as Manly Wharf has a clutch of restaurants that are varied, interesting, reasonably priced and with loads of atmosphere. It's a very realaxing way to get to Manly from Circular Quay, rather than driving. The views at night are equally as beautiful as the views during the day.
mini tour. its a great trip out to manly very scenic and a must do comming to sydney,you get to see so much

Clean and on time.. There isn't much to say about a ferry. It was a pleasant trip. Actually, one of the most spectacular views of the city is heading away from Circular Quay. The skyline set against the harbor is phenomenal. Great for pictures as well! The ride is about 30 minutes. Quite enjoyable.

Great Ride!. We live on the waters on Puget Sound - Washngton State so are familiar with riding ferries. The Manly Ferry was an excellent ride over to Manley - I enjoyed the rough water from the ocean, I didn't know the ocean was that close to the Sydney area.
great way to see the harbour. great way to see the harbour and then when you get to Manly its lovely. Also seems there is a great selection of restaurants there and it has a lovely beach

Best views. Top tip for avid photographers and people who love a good view.. One of the best/cheapest ways to great shots of the harbor bridge and opera house at sunset. Simply visit the gorgeous Manly beach and wharf during the day and then get the ferry back at around 6ish depending on what time sunset is, be first in the boat so you can get a front row seat up on deck on the ferry and then snap away as you approach into the bay. You can get some simply stunning shots this way and it costs practically nothing as the ferry is very cheap.
Fun ride. Nice trip out to the beach, lots of scenery to see there and back.

Most cost-effective way to see Sydney. From Circular Quay, its AUD$11.20 for a return ticket to Manly, this is the most cost-effective thing you can do in Sydney. As the ferry leaves, you get great views of Circular Quay, the Opera House and Harbour Bridge from vantage views you can't get on land. Enjoy the rest of the ride on your way to Manly Beach. On your way back, if you time it right, you can watch the sun set and take stunning pictures of the harbour bridge as the sun goes down.
great fun. enjoyed the ride, not recommended for anyone who suffers from sea sickness as it was a lively ride!!
I love the Manly Ferry. there is nothing more relaxing than sitting outside on the Manly Ferry on a beautiful afternoon.

The best way to see the harbour.. The trip takes just over half an hour and its the best way to see the harbour (you can also do a harbour cruise, takes half a day and costs a lot more). Manly is worth visit, nice parade and beach.The locals claim it to have an European atmosfere, Its relaxed.Catch the ferry back at sundown, the view over Circular Quai lighting up is spectacular!!
Great ride. The manly ferry is a great ride. Great scenery, smell the sea air. I just love it.

Make sure you have enough free space on your camera!. It's a bit of a tradition of ours that, when we have first time visitors to Sydney, we take them on the Manly Ferry. You get the best views of the Bridge, Opera House and City that we hardly get a word out of them for the whole trip as they are busy snapping away taking photos.Then, once you've docked you're at Manly with its great beach, surfer dudes and amazing cafes and restaurants.Plus, there's free wireless on the ferry so you can upload all your pictures to Facebook on the way back.Superb!

Great way to see the harbour.. A 20 min journey over towards the mouth of the harbour. Visit the tourist info building by the ferry terminal when you arrive for a map of the Coastal walk to Spit Bridge. Takes about 4 hours & then catch the bus back to the Manly Ferry terminal for a great day out

Great view of the Sydney Harbour!. Save the money on the cruise and take the Manly Ferry out to the beach. Stay for dinner and then ferry back after dark to get a spectacular view of the Sydney Harbour (the bridge & opera house).
We love Manly!!!!. We both just love Sydney,and we enjoy the ferry trip across the Harbour.

Great way to see the city!. The ferry is clean and comfortable and is easily accessible for wheelchairs and buggies. It offers great views of the harbour bridge, opera house and surrounding areas. Free wi-fi is also on offer on the top deck which is excellent! The whole thing is well organised with prompt service and i'd recommend it to all who fancy a trip to Manley.
loved it. quick, reliable and fun. we went to manly twice while we were there. just beautiful

Best way to see Sydney. Proabably my favourite beach in the world and the best way to get there is by the Manly Ferry.They may be old but they still have character and it is certainly an easier way to get there than the traffic snarls that so often mar a trip to the northern beaches.
Excellent relaxing trip on Ferry. Loved just cruising on the harbour watching all the activity on land and water while crossing to Manly.
Well worth doing. Great way to see the harbour, bridge, Opera House, Botanic gardens and so much more.

My kids favorite. Do you want to see the beauty of Sydney from the water for as little as $3.00? Hop on a piece of working history, the Manly Ferry. The ride is a great view into the little coves and harbors that make Sydney so special. You also get to catch glimpses of Sydneysiders passion for all things aquatic as you pass kayakers, fishermen, yachts, "16' footers" (skiffs), seaplanes and much more. Ebven better it drops you conveniently into Circular Quay (Americans say "key") gateway to the CBD.
Can't miss this if you visit Sydney.. Love the ferries; this is a great way to explore the city and a trip out to Manly has to be a right of passage for most visitors to Sydney.
Rock and Roll. It's a fun way to get to Manly but if the heads are bobbing the ferry will be rocking, so be prepared.

Cheap and easy way to get from Manly to Sydney. We stayed in Manly with friends of ours when we visited Australia and so we used the ferry almost daily. We bought a weekly pass which was very inexpensive and also included the buses and trains in Sydney so came in very handy. The ferries are very regular and ferry times are available at the terminals. There are some fantastic photo opportunities on the ferry for toursits too and the first time we came round and the Opera House and Harbour Bridge came into view was very impressive.Manly has a fantastic beach, one of the best in Australia so if you are staying in Sydney it is still worth the trip over to Manly for the beach and the shops on the Corso there.There is also free wifi available on the ferry which came in very handy for me to check emails and keep in touch with people at home in the UK much cheaper than calling or finding internet cafes. Food is also available to purchase on board the ferry.
Fun. Great trip across the harbour, worth doing, great scenery and coffee.
Great way to see the harbour. A trip on the Manly ferry on a warm sunny day is quintessential Sydney. Great views of the harbour foreshores and fish and chips on the beach at Manly at the end.
Man o' Man. I love the Sydney ferries. I am happy just to go on them with no actual destination in mind! Manly Ferry is a nice long trip.

Nice views of the Opera House, but there are better vantage points. The ferries were on time and felt very safe. If you have done a lot of cruising, it may not be worth it to take one just to see the views, as there are many and better vantage points from Sydney, in my opinion. Nevertheless, gets you where you need to go in a timely fashion.

Gain an appreciation of the entire estuary & Manley. I took the ferry ride to Manley. It afforded fabulous views of the extensive estuary that forms Sydney harbor. I had no idea how the metropolitan area sprawled along the water for miles. Be prepared: the ferry can be windy and cold (I was there in winter). Manley, itself, is an quaint town with an extensive beach on the ocean side of the town. There are good walking paths along the beach the venture throughout the town. The downtown area is also a pedestrian mall with lots of food offerings and plenty of tourist shops.

A simple, inexpensive way to see the world famous Sydney Harbour. Some people commute on this ferry to and from work every day. What luck! Forget the jet boats, take the Manly ferry for a simple, inexpensive way to see the sights of the world famous Sydney harbour. Manly beach surfing, swimming and walks are thrown in as a bonus.
Better than getting a sight seening tour. Perfect to see the harbor bridge and opera house and you get to see one of the best beaches in sydney

A cheap harbour cruise. You can book a three hour cruise of Sydney Harbour where a guide will tell you what to look at and that does get close to the shore line at times, or you can hop on a Manly Ferry and see most of the harbour on the way to Manly. Apart from being cheaper (if you get a return ticket, or a DayTripper ticket that includes trains and buses, it'll be even cheaper) than a cruise, you'll end up at Manly which is (I think) a must-do destination in Sydney.The Manly ferries have small shops selling drinks and snacks at reasonable prices, and there are plenty of places to sit/stand to take in all the views.The starboard side (from Circular Quay) will provide you excellent views of the city, Eastern Suburbs, the Heads and then Manly, so try to grab a seat downstairs outside. Coming back, sit on the starboard side (this time it's the side facing west) to get great views of Balmoral, Mosman, Cremorne and Neutral Bay (and all their harbour beaches) as well as North Sydney and the harbour bridge - oh, and this is also the warmer side in the afternoon unless there's a southerly wind blowing!If you like rough weather, get yourself to the front of the ferry and enjoy the ride! In really rough weather the front of the ferry will bury itself in the waves.Have fun!
Best way to get to Manly.. The Ferry is the best way to get to Manly. You can enjoy the bay and send your iPhone pictures to your Facebook friends as you take them.

Lovely Impressive a must DO. If you visit the city of Sydney is a must... in my opinion the best and cheapest way to see the harbour, check for the weather if is not very good there is a patch of open sea and this means big waves, you will love it not for cardiac patients, live here for 30 years if I have the time off I go, get the return ticket from Manly or Circular Quay, at Circular Quay specially on weekends there is a lot to see didgeridoo players, buskers, the whole lot will come for the tourist.

Love sitting on the upper open deck in front in a high wave day. If you have a chance, let try sitting on the upper open deck in front in a high wave day. The ferry will be thrown up and down the you will fell like riding a roller coaster in the habour. But sometime the wave spash up to upper deck. I love it.
Seeing the Harbour. The ferry system is very efficient and is an excellent way to get around while seeing the sights at the same time.

do this during the week, pack beach gear. Manly is a stunning seaside retreat, but can get a little manic and packed during the weekends as sydneysiders all head to the beach. This said, Manly has a stunning beach, and the township has some great cafes and bars
In my view the best way to view Sydney Harbour.. A trip from Circular Quay to Manly enables you to see the many beahes, bays and Defence facilities Sydney Harbour has to offer.

To Manly we must go. If one visits Sydney and does not take the Manly Ferry ... Then it hard to say they have visited the real Sydney. The Ferry is a peaceful and cheap way to see the Harbour and the beach bums at Manly. This is where the Sydneysiders travel and it is the best. Get the real feel of the Syndneysiders here.

cheapest way to travel. Get a multi 3 pass for a week @ $60 from the train station you can catch this ferry plus all the others It also covers all trains and buses all week for the one price at this price it is a great trip ps very busy on the weekend when sunny may have to wait in a line for a bit but worth the wait

Manly Ferry. This is a ferry ride just like any other, excepting that it plies between Circular Quay in the city and Manly which is slightly to the north of the North Head - the entrance to Sydney harbour. The ferries are ageing but they are reliable and comfortable and offer the best way to move between the 2 places..

Take any bit of time off to do this. I slipped this in in the middle of my business trip. Well worth it. Fun to see the Sydney Opera House from the other side.I came back just around sunset and it was good.As I was short of time, I just strolled down Manly beach and attempted the start of a hike before it got too dark and I had to turn back.Because it was cold, this tourist attraction was not as touristy - just the way I like it.
So much FUN!. Take the ferry, do the walks, eat a seafront food in Manly and remember it forever.
My favourite place. 40 minute journey from Sydney Harbour, very efficient and smooth crossing.

A must do. We spent a rainy morning on the ferry to Manly and walked around Manly. The ferry was one of the cleanest I've ever been on. Since it was rainy, the water was rough and ferry was rocking! Great views from the ferry. After about thirty minutes, we were at Manly. Do not mistake the little beach as you get off the ferry as Manly Beach. You need to walk past shops and cafes to get to the other side and see Manly Beach. The ferry is $7 each way for adult.

Fairly cheap and easy way to get to Manly. Sydney Ferries provide a great service from Circular Quay to Manly. It is the most scenic form of transportation and you can see much of the harbour along the way. Best to get a seat on the second level towards the back along the outside edge, this way you maximise the view and in the right position can sit outside without the hindrance of the wind. They run fairly often and take some time to get there, but with a beautiful view with many photo opportunities with the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and other scenic backgrounds. Highly recommended as the cheapest, most scenic and convenient way to travel to Manly.
Take a ride to Manly Beach. Its a short ride to Manly Beach where many locals hang. There's a delicious upscale restaurant on the beach, open air, white interior. I wish I could recall the name....

Manly - I wish I lived there. It's February in Canada, and I wish I was in Manly now!Manly was a great beach for walking, swimming, and for my husband to learn to surf (at Manly Surf School). We came to this beach a couple times, it's easy to catch the ferry over and spend the day.

A wonderful trip...great views!. A must do in Sydney! The ferry takes only 25 minutes each way and provides the best views of the Sydney harbor. Manly beach is really cute, almost like South Beach in Miami, with pine tree lined beaches and restaurants galore! Eat "croc and roo" at Manly Grill.

Best Way to Get Water View. The Manly Ferry is the best way to get great water views of the Sydney Opera House & city skyline....for a fraction of the cost of one of the tourist boats, you get the same views for simply riding the water taxi! Plus, Manly Beach is a worthwhile trip by itself.
Its about a 30 minute ride each way.

View Sydney Harbour from here. If you would like a good view of Sydney Harbour take the slow ferry to Manly....you will get a great view of the Opera House/Harbour Bridge leaving Circular Quay and the harbourside suburbs along the way. Manly has many restaurants/cafes etc for some lunch and the beach is one of Sydney's best if you fancy a swim...

Always fun. This is a fantastic way to while away a few hours on a sunny summers day. The trip takes about 30 minutes each way and when the weather is bad or the swell up it can get a bit bumpy at the heads near Manly.

Make the ferry trip...it's worthwhile.... Good value for money, great views of the harbour, half hour trip, plenty of services running at good times...worth it. Get a seat outside to enjoy the views or stay inside for the air conditioning if it's hot!
Escape the City. Excellent value for money and great way to get views of the Bridge and the Opera House. Manly is a lovely town - have an ice cream at the beach and watch the surfers ride the waves.
Great way to see the Harbour. A trip from Circular Quay to Manly and back gives you a very good impression of Sydney Harbour.

Cheapest way to get around Sydney. We were staying in Manly for a week so purchased a MyFerry 2 ticket for $48 which covered all our trips. It was great value and as we were walking distance from the ferry stop meant we didn't have to hire a car so saved heaps. Highly recommend staying in Manly, great beaches and easy to get into Sydney and beyond via the ferry
SYDNEY ICON. Our Manly Ferry is a great leisurely way to travel - even better on a day with a big swell when passing the Heads! Try it & see!
have to do. Its fun, its old school and it makes you feel like yo are going somewhere special

Another Treat for our Overseas guests.. What better way to enjoy our harbour that a trip on the Manly ferry.
No food or drink except at either end ,but you get right into the hustle and bustle of a magnificent harbour and then you have Manly to delight you on the northern side. Way to go !

Best way to get to the Northern Beaches. A fixture on Sydney harbour, this ferry was the only way we contemplated getting to Manly on this visit to Sydney. Previously we have driven and it is not nearly as good to be stuck in snarled traffic.Ferry services are well run and the signage/directions are easy to follow.Gliding past the posh suburbs of Sydney is good too to see how some of the other half live.
Cheap and beautiful. THe way the luckiest Sydneysiders get to work everyday. A great harbour experience for a few bucks
Just the ride itself is great!. I always enjoy taking the ferry to Manly and return. ITs great to be out on the harbour, with postcard views in every direction!
Great!. One of the longest ferry rides from Circular Quay. Great for sight-seeing and pictures. And Manly Beach was spectacular.

The cheapest tour of the harbour. Manly is worth visiting but if you are short on time take the ferry at sunset for great views of the habour, bridge and Opera House. We came straight back and then saw t he view in the dark. Ferries arecovered in the inclusive travel ticket so excellent value for money.
an excellent way to spend an hour. very cheap way to get across to Manly, can be very busy at peak times and very popular with tourists
Take the ferry over foer Lunch. Took my mates on the Ferry to Manly and went foer lunch at the pub! Great atmosphere, bit pricy but what the hell. The ferry ride is the best part tho!
efficient way to Manly. it runs frequent enough between Circular Quay and Manly Beach, it's very well maintained, staff keeps passengers informed

A must do if in Sydney! Manly is a beautiful place. Hire a bike and cruise around to Shelly Beach - scenic ride. The approach into Manly on the ferry is beautiful. The short walk from the ferry through the mall to the beach is relaxing.

What a perfect way to see the Sydney harbour!. If you are looking for a cheap way to see the Sydney bays, then this is perfect. The 30 minute trip from Circular Quay is just enough time to see everything you need to, and the return trip back into Circular Quay provides the perfect opportunity to take photo's of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Taking the ferry is as close to having your own boat as you can get - without the cost!
love it. manly has got it all for the whole family so go and enjoy yourself

Great way to commute. We stayed in Manly for 3 weeks and took the ferry to Circular Quay several times. Definitely beats fighting traffic and the views are stunning - the best pictures you'll get of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House for sure. Ride takes about 30 minutes (there's a different, faster ferry during commuting times). Alcohol is not allowed on the boat (faster ferry serves it on board). Tons of fun for our toddler, who loved sitting on the upper deck and pointing out all the other boats. Highly recommended!
Best view of the harbour. get a travel card covering all buses, trains and ferries and you can enjoy several trips and views.

Perfect little jaunt to get out in the harbor. This 30 minute, one-way trip to Manly is a great way to both get to a really fun beach area and boat down most of the harbor. Lots of good photo ops along the way
Frequent and good value. Great way to get to Manly. Lovely views from ferry and Manly is a great place to spend the day.
Comfortable but busy!. This was a nice ferry with comfortable seating but it can get very crowded. Particularly outside. It is a punctual service and is a great way to see a different part of Sydney!

Great way to see harbour. Caught the ferry to Manly. It was clean, the staff were helpful. The ferries both ways left on time. The cafe on board the trip to Manly looked to have a good selection of food and drinks if you wanted them. It was raining the day we travelled and when we crossed the Heads the water was a bit rough. Always enjoy a ride on the ferry.
a must do. its a scenic ride and very reasonable too , rather than spend a packet on the paid for cruises ...you get to see all the sights and sounds of sydney along the river
Inexpensive way to see the harbor and city. This ferry is relatively inexpensive and is a great way to see the harbor area and the whole city. You can also check out the beaches of Manly.
loved it!. great view of the harbour! manly is beautiful its great to get out of the city, very cheap and quick
An experience. Swings around the heads and gets very rough. We loved it!

The best way to get there. The ferry ride is a sightseeing trip in itself. Get up front for a half hour of picture taking, or stay inside with a coffee and admire the views, Manly itself is well worth the visit

Great way to get to Manly. This iconic ferry is always busy but the ferry is huge, so don't be intimidated by large crowds- you'll still find a seat. Be aware that the bay can become rather choppy as you near Manly. We found this a lot of fun.

Short and Sweet. We travelled over to Manley by ferry.
It was very quick (approx 30 mins).
On arrival we went straight from the terminal up the high street and onto the other coast.
There was a lovely little cafe there where we had a lovely meal.
Lovely day out and not too long.
it just gets better. the best view of the sydney harbour you can get ..but then you get to beautiful manly and your day just gets better !!!

Fun trip in Sydney Harbor. The ride to Manly Beach is worthwhile for the ferry ride alone...about $12 US. One could do that in an hour if your time is limited. We ended up spending a half day, however. Just outside the Manly Terminal is a visitor center with a variety of helpful brochures. After watching the beach activities, we used the walking brochure to explore a nature area as well as neighborhoods of the town itself. Many outdoor restaurants and retail establishments line the beach street, as well as the walk to the beach from the ferry. The ferry was large, and people on it seemed to include locals as well as tourists. Our ride was thrilling as the ocean swells at the harbor opening were large and provided a salt water experience for those of us on the outer front deck. Take a camera as you will go directly in front of the Opera House and you will also have great views of the Harbor Bridge and Fort Denison.
Great harbour views. Relaxing trip to Manly with great views of the city & harbour shoreline. Great beaches at manly.

Local Sydneysider. A great way to see Sydney city from the water. Ferry travels between Manly Wharf and Circular Quay. Join at Circuar Quay, travel to Manly and enjoy lunch there at many eateries not just around the wharf but walk 5 minutes to the "corso" beachside and there are many more places to eat. Great swimming at Manly Beach. Ferry ride takes you past beautiful foreshore homes and Sydney Opera house which of course is alongside the harbour bridge..Or do the ride from Manly to Circular Quay where the Rocks area is a 5 minute walk from the Ferry terminal. Some great eateries tucked away, including a place called Pony. Can walk across harbour bridge from the Rocks or do the bridge clim if you are more adventurous.Ferry Rides are great in the evening too with city lights.

Good cheap way to cruise a beautiful harbour. If you want to avoid an expensive cruise, the Manly Ferry is the cheapest way ($14 round trip) to get a 30-minute ride (each way) on one of the world's most memorable city harbours. Manly is a slightly rundown beachside locale populated by takeout and ice cream joints, average restaurants and tacky souvenir stores, but the beach itself is pretty nice. Worth a day-trip.

Seven miles from Sydney & a thousand miles from care!. A must for all visitors to Sydney!
A relaxing wander around the Harbour, & then a short walk down The Corso to the ocean beach side of Manly.
Lunch at a variety of eateries, then a wander back to the wharf for the return to the city....a great way to spend the day!!

Relax on the Manly Ferry. If you live in Sydney or just visiting doing a trip on the Manly ferry is a great day out on the harbourThe ride takes around 1/2 hour is not dear and the photo opportunities are excellent This ferry goes directly to and from Manly leaving from Circular QuayManly is surrounded by beaches so there is plenty to do and see From where the ferry docks walk along the beach to the Manly aquarium then have some lunch in one of the many restaurants or a club After which there is always shopping and a walk to beautiful Manly beachBefore returning for a relaxed harbour ride back to the Quay

Use your My Multi Pass!. If you have a weekly travel card ($43) you can use this, otherwise it's a rip off at $14 for a return trip. Manly is nice for an afternoon, the beach was quite crowded but good for a day trip.

Great way to see the harbour. Fast efficient way to get to Manly and also a free tour of the harbour/bay - just wieh I had this trip every morning to workBest view on the tradirtional ferry but the seacat is quiker but not much to see

Ferry to Manly. For a relatively modest ticket price you can become a member of the seafaring community on the water and drink in the wonderful sights of Fort Dennison, the Sydney Opera House, the Harbour Bridge and numerous exclusive foreshore properties as you cross perhaps the finest harbour in the world.

Great cut prize views of the Harbour....... Go to Manly Beach, great beach, good cafe's and so much less full of itself than Bondi. The view from the Ferry at night is great for pictures and ambience. Good service and reasonable value. What is not to like.

Great trip and one adult gets two kids on for price of one. Very reasonable trip over to Manly for surfing. Goes every 30 minutes and takes 30 minutes, $14Aus for adult return and $7.50aus for kids return, but each adult can get two kids for the price of one, so great value
Great trip. Brilliant way to get on the water and see the sights without breaking the bank. Load of photo opportunities. Frequent service very efficient.

A Sydney must-do. ALL the Sydney ferries are a fun and unusual way to explore for a visitor, but the Manley ferry is the longest trip (20 mins) and the most iconic of them all.Go mid morning to miss the rush, visit the beach, enjoy a lunch and a few drinks in the sunshine (we went to the sailing club, just keep walking to the right you can't miss it - excellent) then take a leisurely ride back to the City for cocktails and dinner. A great day out.

Not To Be Missed. Not to missed. If you can only do one thing in Sydney this is the one to do. Magnificent views of the Sydney opera house and bridge only the Staten Island ferry in New York compares with this experience.

Great tour of the harbor. Our ferry ride to Manly gave us a great view of the harbor for a cheap price. Yes were did not have the narrative part that you get on the high priced tours but the view is the same.
great value. why take a tourist ferry when for 10% of the price you can take the manly ferry, see all of the harbour sights and go to manly beach as well
The way to see the harbour. Save money on the expensive Captain Cook cruises and get a ferry pass. The Manly ferry is the thing to do to see the majority of Port Jackson.

A delightful short cruise through a gorgeous waterway.. You can sit inside or out, the views are splendid, right past the Opera House to the Harbour Bridge. I caught the ferry Circular Quay to Manly with a foreign visitor just after 5pm. The commuters removed their ties, rolled up their shirtsleeves and drank their beer or wine, full of camaraderie. Best commute home from work on the public transport you could imagine.

A ride from City to Surf. The best way to see Sydney Harbour, sitting outside on the Manly Ferry. Experience the bustle of the central harbour, out past National Parks and natural foreshore, ride the swell of the Sydney Heads and arrive at Manly Beach where you get a glimpse of Sydney's laid back beach lifestyle. Best rides are had when the ocean swell is up, where you can surf the waves in between Sydney Heads on the Ferry.

Short ride. We went both ways from Circular Quay and takes about 20 mins. The ferries are quite old and chug along smoothly. Great way to get to Manly rather than a bus as there is no train services to Manly. We purchased a day tripper fare which allows bus, train and ferry transfers at AUD$21 each which we found good value for amount of travel we did.

Seriously. Ride the Ferry.. I've stayed in Syndey on multiple occasions, and the unlimited transit pass is the first thing I buy when I land in Oz. I first found the Manly Ferry when I was staying in Manly, and it took my breath away. It's a scenic and marvellous ride to an adorable town with astonishing beaches and rich history. If you're visting Sydney, save a day for Manly. And for heaven's sake, ride the ferry.
Cruise to Manly. I take visitors on this trip...cruise to Manly, a meal on the beachfront, visit the aquarium and home and all for a few dollars only.

Best way to see the harbour.. I recommend the Manly Ferry to all visitors, as a cheap way to see the main part of the Harbour, from the Bridge to the Heads. There are usually a variety of inside and outside seats available, as well as a canteen, and it runs regularly.

Good service. The ferry to Manly was something we had been told you had to do to see Sydney from the harbour, and they were right! The service was timely (as all the ferries were) even though it was very busy. We had bought a week Multi Pass which means we didn't have to queue - would definitely recommend this as you can travel on bus, train and ferry all on one ticket. The views from the ferry were lovely and we took many pictures of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge.

An excellent way to see the sights of Sydney. When visiting Sydney this is something that you must do. It is a fantastic way to see Sydney harbour and plenty of photo opportunities and you are rewarded with a beautiful beach at the end.
Great value. Easy way to see Sydney Harbour bridge and get to know the locals. Free wi-fi on board
vlaue for money. Efficient way to travel around the city, if not a little busy at peak times.

Great way to see the harbour. A good way to see the aussie's relationship with water. Great views of the harbour and all the activities on it. A very cheap way of seeing great views of the opera house and the bridge.

Be your own tour guide for very little cost. We took two visitors on the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly in November for something to do midweek as it is less busy than on weekends.It is a great way to see the harbour and cruise past the Opera house and Harbour bridge and the many interesting harbour sights without paying for very expensive tours . It was a first time visit to Sydney for our relative from England and she had a great day on our beautiful harbour.
Manly Ferry. We dropped over to the Rocks for a few hours and ate at a highly regarded Thai restaurant on return to Manly.
The ebst short crusie in the world. For $14 dollars return trip, you can experience the most beautiful harbour in the world. You can also order a coffee and cake at the on board cafe. Wow!
Very convenient, easy, clean comfortable and safe and also easy access for disabled. Ther was nothing to dislike,and fares were value for money
great way to get to manly. brilliant the ferries are so eassy to use, they are very in expensive, just get very busy depends on time of day
The best of Sydney Harbour. Take a day trip from Circular Quay to Manly and enjoy the harbour and Manly all in one.

Travelling by Sydney Ferries is a must for a visit to Sydney. Travelling by ferry on Sydney Harbour is a must. Whether you travel to Manly, Taronga Zoo, East Balmain or elsewhere, a ferry trip on the Sydney Harbour is a wonderful thing to do.

Great ferry ride. This is a ferry ride must do if your into that sort of thing, it gets fun too when the ferry comes to the point where it's crossing open sea the up and down rolling is fun. Not very good food and Bev facilities so don't expect to eat well on board.

Get some nice photos of the Opera House from Manly Ferry. My husband and I bought a day pass for public transportation which allowed us access on the Manly Ferry, transit buses, and the CityRail (I think it was $20/person). Manly Ferry leaves from Circular Quay Ferry Terminal and it takes about half an hour to get to Manly. The ferry goes right past the Opera House, and you can get some great shots. The ferries themselves seem kind of old, but not unsafe. There are benches outside if you don't mind being in the wind, but there are also indoor seats.Staff was friendly and efficient, and I would use the service again if I returned to Sydney.

A scenic alternative to bussing. An excellent, scenic way to travel to Manly Beach is the Manly Ferry. The trip offers wonderful views of Sydney Harbour, Cirucular Quay and the Sydney Opera House. The time spent on the boat is a great way to relax and get some fresh, ocean air.
Always good.. Took a teenager who had never been to Sydney across to manly on the ferry, always a great experience.

Trip to Manly. The 2nd trip I've had to Manly on the ferry and can't fault it. You get spectacular views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Manly is Beautiful and well worth a trip. Bondi Beach gets the name but Manly beats it hands down.

The best way to see Sydney. AWESOME in the most literal sense of the word. From departing at Circular Quay until arriving at Manly Wharf thirty minutes later, passengers are treated to the most delightful vistas on offer in Australia's premier city.It is from the deck of the ferry that you see Sydney as it has been seen on a million postcards - the gleaming opera house jutting out into the harbour with the huge steel Harbour Bridge serving as a prominent backdrop. To the left, the CBD shoots high into the sky. There is no better way to view the city and, for a tourist, this ferry trip should be top of one's list of to-dos.Manly itself is no vulgarity. Without delving too much into the beach-side resort itself, the landscape at the other end of the ferry ride is vastly different with sparse houses perched in amongst lush vegetation and towering over steep rocky shorelines.Between the two, passengers are treated to a beautiful view of Sydney Heads and one's mind wanders off to the vastness of the ocean that sits just beyond that towering cliff side. The boat charts its course in amongst dozens of dinghies, sailing boats, speedboats and jet boats and thus offers a spectacle on each crossing. It is one of those ferry rides where you could happily lay back and look at nature's finest offerings in the archipelago that is Sydney Harbour or you could intently look out over the hive of activity that the city's waterways offer.It is $10 per ride and the ride takes 30 minutes. In all of the time I was in Sydney, I am not sure I spent a more valuable tenner or thirty minutes than I did on this ferry. Though I should sound a note of caution that the boat is susceptible to a slight bit of movement as it crosses the harbour and thus those highly sensitive to travel sickness ought to be wary and place themselves appropriately on the vessel. For me, nothing beat sitting at the front on both legs of the trip for the stunning views of Manly on the way out and the impressive Sydney on the way in.
Great. Great experience, i was nervous at first but its finem manly beach is beautiful.
A must for tourists. I have lived in Manly all my life and still love the scenic tripGreat day out from the city or from Manly

Best boat trip in the World. The Manly Ferry is the best boat trip in the world. It is a 30 minute journey across the most beautiful and scenic harbour you will ever see. Sit outside and relax and soak in the glorious weather and views Sydney has to offer. There is a food ssop and toilet facilities on board. A must do for tourists and locals. I love Sydney and I love Manly and the Manly Ferry. Please do not miss this experience
A must journey if visiting Sydney.. park the car and have a day out or even just a ride on the manly ferry. You'll be surprised.
Manly is a cool place to visit. The ferry is same as any other, reminded me of the Star ferry in Hong Kong. We enjoyed Many, nice beach, easy to walk around, and a ton of dining options.

Cheap, Fun and Fabulous Views. We've done this trip every time we've visited Sydney and it never gets tired.The ferry runs like clockwork, very efficient and leaves EXACTLY on time, so don't be late!Ride is very smooth except for the small section where you cross into more exposed waters just as you are about to get to Manly, but just a few swells and rolls - not anything to get seasick over.Try to get a seat on the outside, so you can get better unobstructed views for taking photos (especially on the return trip as you approach the Opera House).The ferry can get pretty crowded at weekends and holiday times, so be prepared for a bit of a crush getting on and off. Lots of food options at the Manly Ferry Terminal, if you want to grab a snack or an ice-cream for your stroll down to Manly Beach. If you are only in town for a day then I recommend you get an "all-day" transport pass http://www.cityrail.info/tickets/which/mymulti_day. You can also get them for a week/month, etc if you are staying longer. You can buy the pass from the ferry ticket sellers, or any train station & it gives you unlimited rides on buses, trains and government ferries (but NOT the catamaran/fast ferry to Manly) - it pays for itself easily and certainly saves your feet as there is a lot of walking to enjoy around Sydney :-))
Quick and Cheep. This is a really good thing to do if you are looking for value for money. Not sure what day the markets are on, but it is worth a trip for the coffee and beach!
Must do. A day trip to Manly via the ferry is a must do with any visit to Sydney. Inexpensive and iconic way to travel and a great day out too!
Fantastic!. Great ride, really deserves to be as popular as it is. Fantastic trip across teh harbour, with great views.

Clean, cheap, on time and great view. We found the Manly Ferry was included in our Zone 1 travel ticket. So off we went.The ferries run spot on time, the ones we travelled on were very clean, they have free Wifi on them and the views are terrific.We made a decision to go to Manly for dinner one night and were on a ferry 10 minutes later and in Manly about a half hour after that.

Cheapest great tour you'll take in Sydney. Take the ferry for the scenery. Enjoy Manly. The beach is huge but busy. There are loads of great restaurants but sunset at the Bavarian Bier Haus right at the Manly ferry terminal is perfect. Then chill out while riding the ferry back. We did a dinner tour of the harbour and it was a waste of money. Half the views, average food, no interpretation.
Efficient and fun. A great way to travel - get's you there in good time and is also relaxing and provides a beautiful view along the way.
Worth the trip. Manly is worth the trip over. Grab lunch or ice cream and hit the beach. The ferry gives you hundreds of photo ops too
best cheap harbour tour. This is the best cheap harbour tour, you can go all the way to Manly and back, at least an hour's sailing, for just a few dollars, it's a great!

Can't beat the view heading into Sydney. For a few dollars this is a really cost effective way to get the pictures and views you came here for. Manly itself is worth a visit, but going out past the heads and rolling around in the swell makes for a fun journey! Just beware of rush hour when you will be lucky to get a seat with a view

A must do when in Sydney. This is one the most economical ways to experience Sydney Harbour (the most spectactular harbour in the world). Best times are early morning and as the sun is setting and the lights of Sydney are coming on. Best fun is the extra rocking you feel as you go past "the Heads" - the harbour's opening to the Pacific Ocean. You are not a Sydneysider if you haven't been to Manly on the ferry at least once.
A day out. Taking the ferry to manly harbour was a great idea, we got loads of really great photos of the Opera house and when we arrived at Manly we had a great selection of places to eat & drink.

Best City View - Bonus, Manly is a Great Beach. Many folks hop the Manly ferry just for the fantastic views of the city, but the destination beach is great in and of itself - much nicer for families than Bondi.

Amazing. We love the journey over to Manly, using the MyMulti ticket which really is totally worth it although we first thought it is a bit pricey.You get astonishing views, make sure to get a place outside(DONT if you don't like sun ;-))

Best Harbour Cruise. Great boat ride & at the end you get a stunning ocean beach & heaps to do & see. Do the Manley - Spit Bridge walk to see even more or walk up Shelley Beach to the headland & watch the surfers
Seven miles from care.... Relaxing and worth the time and money to float across the Harbour

A Must Do in Sydney. Circular Quay to Manly Wharf, an iconic ferry trip out of Sydney Harbour that provides a great view of the coastlines, on a nice day make sure that you sit outside.. it's a more pleasant experience!
Manly Ferries, Sydney Australia. Great way to see one of the most beautiful harbours in the world ( if not The Most Beautiful )

Lovely Cruise over to Manly.. The Manly Ferry is pretty big and has good comfortable seats both inside and outside.
There are wonderful veiws of the Harbour on the ride over to and back from Manly.
The ferrys run regularly about every hour, and are quite reliable and depart right on when the timetable says that they will.
Iconic. A must do on your visit to Sydney. The harbour cruise, Manly and then you MUST come back when the sun is setting over the harbour bridge. Spectacular!!!!
Manly and Ferry Trip. Lovely place with beautiful beach. Ferries regular and reasonably priced.
Sydney Ferry. Take the Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly, Sydney's closest northern beach. Crossing the heads is a must!!

Nice cruise with a budget price!. Just hop on the Manly ferry for 13.2 AUD return and enjoy the sights of the Harbour, take fantastic pictures and then enjoy the sun and sea on Manly beach - a great day in Sydney!

A must do for any tourist. Manly is a lovely place to visit, particularly if you walk through to the beach .. but getting there is half the fun.This is the cheapest and one of the best ways to see the beautiful harbour. This way you can also see the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and the city from the water, without the expense of a harbour cruise
Big and Clean. The Ferry always punctual on depart and arrive, also they keep their cleanliness, there's deck on top outside which made us easier to take pictures. keep it up !

A cheap way to cruise the harbour. Suggest going to Manly to enjoy the ocean coast, then return after dark to enjoy Sydney night skyline including Opera House & Harbour Bridge. A great venue to enjoy a drink is Manly Warf Pub where you can enjoy reasonable priced food and Manly harbour views of ferries coming and going. Plus you'll know your ferry is there when you've finished with Manly.

Worth every cent.. It's worth it just to go to 4 Pines, that brewing company is amazing. Once you're in Manly, you're pretty much on the beach, and you can go for some amazing (if not 100% legal) rock walking (NOT climbing) up at Queenscliff. Great stuff and everything you need for a day out!

manly. $16.00 return fare is pretty good value. Takes about 1/2 hour. Walked down the street to the beach. Had a great lunch in one of the local hotels. Awesome coming back as hit some waves and those out the front got wet!

A ride of a lifetime - if in Sydney you must do this as a priority. Sydney Harbour is one of the main things that draws me into to this wonderful city. I never ever tire of being on the harbour and I never tire of viewing it from any angle that reflects the water. make sure to do the Manly ferry, you will not be disappointed
Great Ferry to Manly Beach. It was very affordable and had a good,convenient schedule. Nice way to see the harbor, Bridge,and Sydney Opera House while sailing. Manly Beach was very pretty.
Beautiful Ferry. A must do for any trip to Sydney. The Ferry takes about 30 minutes but the views are spectacular! DO IT!
Best/Cheapest way to see the city!. The best ferry in the world. Stunning views and Manly is a great spot to visit. Do drinks at Charlie bar with a view of the Pacific while in Manly
the wind on your hair. Free wifi, great views, going to one of the most renouned beaches in the world. What could be better.

Great ride and great beach. The ferry to Manly is very clean and enjoyable. The beach at Manly is large, clean and beautiful. There are many nice restaurants and pubs to choose from that are directly across from the beach. There are also shops and delis galore. Don't miss the bakery shop of one of the most famous pastry chefs in Australia. The shop has a very small sign - Zumbo Pastries - on a small side street in the town a couple of blocks from the pier.

Something worth doing!. Caught the fast ferry over to Manly on a beautiful hot day. It only took 20mins and I was able to see the amazing views of Sydney. You can sit with upstairs or inside below and both had tv screens for entertainment. It was a great way to enjoy the wonderful sights. The price was great too!
The best public transport in the world.. The best way to view the harbour with the added bonus of getting to sample the town of Manly with its awesome beach.

A very interesting trip. Many people take boat trips at a large cost but the Manly Ferry was just 13 dollars round trip from Circular Quay and it was about a 30 min. journey and Manly was a beautiful place with a lovely beach and coastal walk and we had a very enjoyable day there and would recommend this trip.
A great journey. Manly is a must visit whilst you are at Sydney. The ferry is very popular but runs so regularly that is it not an issue. It is also very good value!

A Great Way To See Sydney Harbor. When we asked the Concierge at our hotel about the best tour operator for a tour of Sydney Harbor he recommended we try the Manly Ferry which runs from Sydney to Manly beach. The round trip affords great views of the entire harbor and is inexpensive when compared to organized tours.
Enjoyable. The trip was enjoyable and had great views. Staff were friendly too.

A must do in Sydney.. A beautiful scenic ride across Sydney Harbour from Circular Quay to Manly or vice versa. Approx. $14 return. Lovely to sit outside and get fantastic views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. An exhilarating experience in rough seas - beware if you're prone to seasickness! There is usually a snack shop open on board as well as toilet facilities which are usually well kept.
What a view. cheapest way to get on the Harbour, the views are fantastic, any where you want to go around the harbour for a very resonable price
Tip from manly. Caught the Manly Ferry several times on my trip and it was great. No problems on any of my trips

Worth doing just for the harbour views there and back - and you get time in Manly thrown in as well!. You can sit inside or outside (depending on how quick you are to board and grab the best seat) and see a wide range of passing harbour traffic as the ferry chugs out and back to Manly. There is a small onboard cafe offering basic food and drink options (no bar).
Nothing better than ferry ride. It's cheap and fun and you can't beat a walk around the Corso at Manly. Get on at Circular Quay
Fun on the ferry...... Nice ride, safe feeling, quite prompt, a great way to get from harbor to harbor and see great city scenery.
A nice day out. A lovely outing going by Manly Ferry for a stroll along Manly Beach, a swim if you feel so inclined, a leisurely meal and a repeat viewing of Sydney Harbour on the return ferry trip.
must do. Great to see Sydney from a different perspective. The beaches were awesome. Had a beer in pleasant sidewalk pub and walked through residential areas.

gave review above, but the slow ferry to manly was the way to really enjoy the entire harbor....... Loved seeing all the sailors going around us and viewing all of the waterfront real estate around Sydney harbor. Beautiful homes and a wonderful outdoors feeling prevails in Sydney and it's all there, right on the water.
Good for a nice view of harbor. Good place to walk the beaches and get something to eat

Great Harbour views. Not only do you get to see the Harbour bridge and Opera house in one vista you also get to visit Manly, a great little town on the oceanside reminds me of how seaside towns used to be and a great beach to boot.

Thought we were going to die!. This ferry was like getting a regular bus except that it lurched terribly when in open water. Felt like it was about to tip over on several occasions. At least they warned passengers not to go outside.
Fun on the water. Our children love to get the ferry to manly. There is always something to look at on the way over.

Views!!!. Manly ferry is probably the best ferry trip for tourists (not only) offering fantastic views of Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay, Woolloomooloo Bay and whole Sydney. And it takes you to Manly where you can go down the beach and enjoy observing people surfing.
Manly is a must visit destination. Ferries are cheap, comfortable, inside or outside and the view is incredible.
Great way to see the harbrou. The ferries are regular and are a great way to see the harbour.
Worth the Visit. We took the ferry to Manley and enjoyed the ride and the visit to Manley. Manley is a cool little beach town with good restaurants, bars and a nice beach.
Relaxing. I loved our trip on the Ferry. You get to see the harbour and surrounds and take in the fresh air.
Nice ride to another side of Sydney. This 40 minute ride is nice for views, but gets really crowded on busy days!
Convenient and nice way to get around. Nice trip across the harbour and a convenient way to get around and see the sights.
Must Do. As stated earlier it is a must do lovely place. The walk round the headland is very easy and you see much more than just on the ferry.
Nice!. Beatiful journey through the bay. Perfect to see the bridge, opera house and various spots in the bay. Prices reasonable!
Manly Ferry. A great way to get to manly and enjoy seeing Sydney harbour along the way, good for a rough ride if the seas are running a heavy swell.

See the sights of Sydney Harbour. Take the slow ferry to ensure yo have enough time to take pictures and take the 6pm or 7pm ferry rides from Manly back to CBD to get a dusk view of Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The sail boats at night are beautiful too.

WIFI onboard. We took this ferry for our day trip to Manly Beach and we were surprised at how nice the interior of the ships were. The wifi onboard was pretty fast for a public service. Very relaxing and plenty of places to sit.

Our favourite ferry trip in the world!. Taking the Manly ferry, drinking in the fantastic fews of the harbour and then strolling to the beach, stopping for a $10 steak @ Ivanhoe is still our favourite day out on a weekend.

A must do. Get the Manly Ferry, have breakfast on the seafront strip, Poached Eggs & Crispy bacon. Swim & then have Wine at the Restaurant on the beach & watch the Manly Surf Club go through their paces!
A lovely trip. An affordable and lovely boat ride when the weather is good. Manly has some great cafes and restaurants and the beach is gorgeous.

experience the soul of Sydney by taking a ferry. A must do to get the feel of this city on the water. Take the ferry over to Manly and have dinner and then catch a later ferry back. The return trip makes a perfect night time photograph opportunity to take pictures of Sydney from the water, all lit up.

Enjoy the harbour views. It's well worth doing a day trip to Manly on the old green ferry. Sit out on the deck & take in the amazing views while grabbing a few happy snaps. Approx 30 min trip each way must do on a sunny Sydney day.
Don't miss the ride to Manly!. Easy to find, get tickets and board the boat. Took lots of photos during the ride. Try and sit outside on the front of the ferry. Great in every way.

best way to see the harbour. There is nothing like the view of the harbour and the heads coming across to Manly. Its cheap, low cost for kids, accessible, lots of room, no problem to navigate luggage or prams, cafe on board and WIFI available.A must do for any tourist. Check out the Walk on Water experience at Manly Wharf, until end Jan 2012 - heaps of fun for kids and adults as you bop around in a giant bubble over an inflated pool

Great ferry ride. Probably the most well known of the ferry rides, by tourists. Regular trips from Circular Quay to Manly can be most enjoyable. Go late morning and take lunch at one of the nice waterside bar/restaurants at Manly.

Great day trip. Take the ferry return from Circular Quay to Manly and spend the day at the beach. It's quite a long scenic ferry ride. Manly Beach is an iconic beach like Bondi Beach, but quieter, longer and tree-lined. There's a nice promenade with cafes and shops near the beach for refueling during the day. The beach is an ocean beach with good swimming and surfing.
Ferry. We had a lovely trip on the ferry to Manly. Great place, will visit again when we have more time.
good service a bit pricey. good& regular service,but a bit pricey. worth the view if coming back after dark
Choose the right ferry. We should have chosen the slower ferry. The ferry we took was much more expensive and it is a fast ferry and probably not so suitable for tourists.
Great way to view the Harbour. Remember to take the camera as there are some fantastic shots to be had of the Opera House and city skyline.
A cheap way to see the harbour. Manly itself is worth a days visit but the ferry ride is just as interesting, going past the opera house and across the bay for a fraction of the price of a cruise
Amazing Views of Sydney City Skyline. Short ride to and from Manly Beach and great views of City! Very enjoyable ride, and worth the trip
Best thing I did in Sydney on vacation. Great views, relaxing on a sunny day, not expensive, and you can easily walk from the Manly ferry terminal to the beach on the other side.

Best Way to View Sydney Harbour & City Skyline. Excellent way to view the sights of the harbour.
Snack bar on board.
Various public transport ticket options depending on the length of your stay.
Take your camera
Many places for a coffee or lunch at Manly Wharf or along the Corso.
Do not forget to view the beach and or walk along the beachfront.

all about the photo opportunities. It was fun on the deck and a lot of photo opportunities of the harbour bridge, Sydney Opera House and other sailings in the sea. At the sunset, the city loomed from afar. We really enjoyed that moment.

I'm loving it. I bought the one week multi pass which allowed me to travel unlimited times. So, by taking ferry is totally cool experience.
You can enjoy sight-seeing relaxingly

11 miles from sydney and a thousand miles from care. This is one of the best ferry trips of the world, particularly if there is any swell on. Going past Sydney heads is a spectacular and exciting trip. The best Sydney City view you can buy.

Beautiful cruise to a beautiful beach. The ferry is orderly and on time. Basically, you know what to expect. It was also a beautiful mode of transportation...meaning, a very scenic ride to Manly. You can take the ferry to Manly and see the Harbour for much less money than you would pay to sail around the Harbour...and then you get to walk around Manly, too. Fun day!

Easy way to get to the beach!. It was so easy to pick up tickets and ride the ferry to Manly. Make sure that you take the time to take this trip. Manly is a wonderful seaside town and the ferries are a good value, clean and on time1
My favourite ferry trip. Try and get a seat on the upper deck but carry a jumper because it does get cold.Time your return trip to arrive at the Sydney harbour at night to see the Opera House lights.

Nice trip out on an afternoon. We did the tourist thing, and took the ferry to Manly. It was very pleasant, and a great way to spend the afternoon wondering Manly. The views on board are terrific, and you can get some great shots of the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge both to and from.

Nice trip during the sunset back to Sydney circular quay. We came from Manly to Sydney during the sunset.It was lovely, amazing all thèse Colors, it was lovely time.The ferry order is clean, the poeple are respectful to others. There is différent langages spoken in the ferry. Its cosmopolitan City!The ferry is on Time That is important. It s big i don t Know how passanger can travel in.
Modern ferries. Went to Manly as a child on the old ferries now they are so comfortable and modern and have mod cons such as wi fi
Fab views of Sydney Harbour. And so much cheaper than expensive boat 'tours' of the harbour...

the best way to get to Manly. Being a foreigner, I just had to see Manly beach. I was surprised that the ferry was inexpensive and ran so frequently. The harbour views are great, and the ferry is comfortable, with a basic selection of drinks and snacks. Do it!

Relatively inexpensive way to see many aspects of harbor. You can sit inside or outside the boat. Enjoyed watching many sailboats and other vessels along route. Ferry trips run frequently. 5 minute walk to Manly beach with shopping opportunities along the way.

Ac Sydney Must Do!. the cheapest way to see the harbour. Spectacular views on the way from Circular Quay. Stop in Manly for lunch, the pubs near the terminal are all good. Jump back on the ferry and back to Circular Quay, satisfied and content!

Great day trip. Did this my first weekend in Sydney. Wonderful views of the harbour, bridge and opera house on the trip over and back. Manly is a lovely place with beautiful beaches and views of the ocean. I did a 3 hour walking tour that was in my tour book - all around the coast areas, up through the neighborhoods overlooking the ocean (with incredible homes). Lovely seafood platter lunch at a restaurant (Manly Wharf Hotel) by the harbour. A great day outing. Highly recommend.

To the beach and back. The Manly ferry is BIG and a great way to get to the beach quick from the city in Sydney ( which is called CBD Central Business District ). Takes about half an hour and on a Sunday it is only 2.50 return each for a family of 4 . It's called a Funday Sunday ticket !

Ferry to Manly. Very easy to catch the Manly Ferry, and cheap too, with great views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Make sure you take your camera, as you won't find better opportunities.

Why go on an expensive cruise?. Instead of an expensive cruise, catch the Manly ferry from Circular Quay and then after a walk around Manly, return at twilight for some perfect Sydney Views. (In the Jacaranda season, head down towards Parramatta to see the spectacular purple trees everywhere along the river.)

Interesting Journey. First time I took the ferry there was stretch where the ship rocks quite a bit. Looking around, no one else seemed to be worried, so I figured it just does this. I later found out that this stretch is called "the heads" and is always a little bouncy.

Best and Cheapest Harbour Cruise in Sydney!. Great way to see Sydney's famous landmarks, Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Fort Denison and Spectacular Sydney Harbour all for the price a ferry trip.
A must see on any visit to Sydney.

Excellent Day Trip with Lots of Photo Ops. We really enjoyed our trip out to Manly by ferry. You sail past the zoo, the Botanic Gardens, the bluffs above the Harbour, etc.
Lots to see during the trip and well worth the time even if you are in Sydney for a short visit.
You should take it. You must take it to enjoy the approach to the harbour from the sea.

Great way to get to Manly. This is a cheap way to get to Manly Beach and is much faster than driving. If you have a MyMulti public transport day pass, the cost of the ferry is included so it works out quite well. Make sure you sit on the same side on the way there and back (i.e. left on the way there and left on the way back) so that you get a different view each way. Got some great shots of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House
Top range. Friendly staff and superb timely service.Could not do better.
Enjoyable. the journey on the Ferry is a great way to see the Harbour, Bridge & Opera House. by taking time to head out to Manly, you get out of the city and away from the madness.
A Tourist Must. I had some friends out from Japan & they loved it. Its a great way to see the harbour,we had lunch at Manly was a great day would highly recommend this trip!
Spot On. We travelled to Manly and although we had mist to the start of the day, when it lifted and the sun came out it was lovely on the beach.

see the harbour. Great to see Sydney harbour and stop off at different stops.
Regular service and helpful staff.Use vending machine to purchase tickets
Day trip to Manly. A great trip along the harbour and you get a fantastic view of the whole city with all the little beaches. Would recommend this trip for everybody.

must do in sydney. great cheap way for visitors to see Sydney from the water. Manly is a good destination for lunch.
Ferries are the basic commuter style so they can be a bit dirty, and if the seas are rough you will bob up and down like a cork!
Great Ferry. On time, Fast. Highly Recommend using this ferry to reach Manly from Sydney.
A must do if you're in Sydney. Nice quick, easy and relaxing trip. You can go the beach or shop and be back in a few hours to Circular Quay.

A nice trip. We went on a Saturday morning, it was very foggy at first but the cloud lifted as we sailed on. A very nice calm trip into Circular Quay and a really nice way to see the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge from the water. Kids loved sitting in the outside sections of the ferry. A good touristy thing to do! Definitely recommend it!

Easy and Fun. The manly is a scenic route to allow those to comfortably and enjoyably head to the city from manly or other way round. It is quick and a good experience to pull into sydney harbour and see the surroundings. Beats a car any day!

Great value and a wonderful way to see the harbor and beyond.. This trip is definitely well worth the trip. It gives you a great view of the bridge, the harbor and the bays around Sydney harbor.This ferry is part of the public transport system , so get yourself a day or week pass and take advantage of all the ferry trips
Manly Ferry. We arrived early and got a seat on the front of the Ferry - the views were amazing leaving the harbour - The small town of Manly was worth the 45 minute ferry ride. :)

great trip. brillian ferry ride right past the opera house and fantastic photo opportunity of the city bridge and opera house. an hours ride brings you to manly a lovely little town with shops and grear smoothies too. lovely beach more family friendly than bondi great day out.
Nice. This is a great way to get to Manly Beach. I saw people using the internet on the way across the harbor. I don't know if it's free or not, but it was definitely available.
Ferry to Manly with free sightseeing. A great chance to see Sydney harbour and the sights on board the ferry to Manly.

The cheapest way to get a harbor tour. First, you should go to Manly just to see or walk the beaches. The restaurants there are great too. Besides going to Manly you get a tour of the harbor. While there isn't a tour guide giving you a verbal tour, you don't need one. Just seeing the harbor (especially at sunset) is amazing in itself.
Iconic. took a trip to Manly - had breakfast, went to the beach, visited Adriano Zumbas shop. Lovely!!!

Great day out to Manlya and Back. A must do for any visitor. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly, walk around and have lunch, shop, swim at the beach, then make the return trip. Cheap and great day out.
Great ride!. Super easy and great views of the Sydney Harbor on the way over! Saw dolphins on the way too!

Cheap harbour tour. I think it was like $11 return to manly, when you consider a tour does the same run for 60 its a deal and a half. food and toilets on board- sit out side in the sun and wind. lovely time.

Best Harbour views. if you are seeing Sydney Harbour for the first time this is the best way. Just buy a return tickets (about AU$14) and you'll have great views for pics of the opera house and bridge. In tourist season the outside decks upstairs get packed so queue early!

Some of the best views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. In addition to the great views from the boat as it leaves Circular Quay this is well worth taking for both a nice out at Manly's beaches or cafes.
manly Ferry. Good trip over to Manly on the ferry, good opportunity for siteseeing also as you travel on ferry.

Great views. Manly is a bit to the north but so worth the journey! You enter into a shopping area when arriving in Manly and an information center just out the front door. Be sure to cross through town to the ocean side to enjoy the beach, waves and swimmers.
great way to get there. fast, efficient, good timetable, reasonable value. Very crowded, but to be expected on a sunday
great fast ferry. the time to get there was reduced because of the fast ferry

A fun trip for local and visitor. Using the Manly Ferry is quite an experience in both good and bad weather. In good you can sit outside and get a great view of the harbour, in bad weather you can enjoy the fun of big waves and great swell as you cross the heads - maybe the rough seas are not exciting to everyone, but certainly are to me.
Great day out. Well run ferry...on time everytime and great views from the ferry
A must do when in Sydney. Everytime I am in Sydney, I like to take the ferry to Manly and often end up having a meal there. Likes: Ferry runs regularly, on time.
Brilliant. Great trip across harbour - takes 30 minutes - Manley is stunning.
what a day. the Manly Ferry was prompt and kept with the schedule. The trip gave a great view of the harbor and the boating activity. Very reasonable price.

Nice Trip. We took the Manly Ferry at Circular Quay around 11 am. The cost of the ferry was $13.20 AUD return. The trip took about 30 min to get us to Manly Beach but it was a great way to see the Harbour and the ferry offers free Wi-Fi.

Best views of the Bridge and Opera House. This is always one of my stops when I am in Sydney. You catch the ferry at Circular Quay which is well serviced by trains and buses.If this is your first trip try to get a seat outside at the bow so that you see the Sydney Harbour Bridge to your left and the Opera House to your right as the ferry heads out to Manly.

Sea the sights. loved the return trip in the evening opera house harbor brige and city at night is wonderfull. great trip for seing the sights in the day too. Manly is a lovely little place (good icecream too) the ferry is rather windy tho.
not to be missed at all. its the best ferry ride in sydney,...take the normal giv ferry and youll love the ride to manly and back. Extremely scenic

A great introduction to Sydney. We had a day to explore Sydney, and our cab driver recommended taking this ferry as a way to see the sites. It runs from the Circular Quay to a nice little oceanside town on the other end of the harbor. The half-hour ride gives you outstanding views of the the famous Sydney sites, and Manly has nice (though crowded) beaches, pleasant places to walk and eat, and some more great views. The ferry itself is nothing special, and outdoor seating is limited.
A MUST DO. The views from this ferry ride are breathtaking. It will take you right past the Opera House for the most amazing photo-ops!

Beautiful afternoon out!. It was a perfect opportunity to see all around the harbour. Views of the Bridge and Opera House from the ferry were amazing as well! And Manly is a very beautiful place! I am very happy that I did not miss this activity in Sydney. PS: Make sure to have a seafood lunch in Manly, it is totally worth it!

Nice ride to see city, the harbor, the boats. Great views at night when returning from Manly. The beach is a lot of fun just to hang out and ppl watch. A lot of surfers bit it was too cool n windy to swim. Water is cold anyway. Walking around the town was fun too. Many well dressed young ppl going out this sunday night; maybe to watch the Rugby final?

A nice experience of Sydney harbour without having to spend a lot. I always enjoy the cross from Circular Quay to Manly, even though I must have done it at least 10 times. Day or night, the vistas are exceptional. For tourists choosing the evening fare, I suggest they get to the seats at the back (Circular Quay end) and admire the city lights/opera/bridge while the ferry departs. Really nice! I do not like the fact that they have deleted the fast (15 minutes, instead of the usual half hour) ferry CAT. I probably didn't make money, I guess, but it was excellent. Hope they bring it back.

Don't waste $$$ on a cruise. As a Sydney-sider my advice to all visitors wanting to see the harbour: DO NOT waste your money on a 'cruise'. Pay $8 and get on the 1/2 hour ferry to Manly. Explore this awesome beachside spot, have a great feed (Wharf bar, Hugo's or many others) and grab the ferry back whenever you want)...every half hour! Awesome
Manly ferry. Cheap travel to manly from sydney.Go on the ferry rather than pay for sight seeing cruise as the ferry goes right past the opera house

Choppy but fun. The day I decided to catch a ferry to Manly, it was pouring rain so the ride was rough but somewhat fun - you get to see views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera house. Very punctual and cheap! We bought the Sunday Saver ticket that covered trains, buses and ferries for $2.50. That's value!All I wanted was to get some Macarons from Adriano Zumbo's Patisserie. Mission accomplished and the journey was enjoyable.
I did not realize that it is different from Sydney Ferries. I really cannot comment on transportation I ride on for 30 minutes. They are relatively punctual.

Top 10 must do list. This ferry route from downtown Sydney (Circlar Quay) to Manly Beach is basically a 30 min non-expensive mini-cruise line! The first 5 min of the trip is golden period, when we can see all the best of Sydney, such as Opera House, Harbor Bridge, downtown buildings and Kirribilli (North Sydney). Not to mention all the harbor boat traffic, including sail boats on weekends. Then the rest of the trip is the silver period, when we saw suburban Sydney, including Double Bay, Rose Bay, Watsons Bay, and Mosman. Before docking at the Manly Wharf, the cliffs at the ocean entrance to the harbor are spectacular. It is just not enough if you ride only once on this ferry!
Nice trip. Had a lovely ferry trip to Manly from Circular Quay. Ferry was very clean and tidy. Wifi available if necessary.

On a mission. Manly Ferry is always an adventure. People from the Manly area don't seem to always appreciate the precision and passenger safety procedures that are in place to make the journey so easy and enjoyable. It is so pleasant to just get on the ferry, which is clean and spacious with hundreds of people, knowing that within half an hour you are at Manly and a world away from the city chaos. I think the ferry operators from the ticket office to the on board staff deserve more recognition for a great job.

A firm favourite. Manly is a favorite spot to visit when we are in Sydney and the ferry is the best way to arrive. The boats are full of character and getting on early ensures a seat outside - where the passing scenery is amazing. If you only do a round trip and don't get off, whilst you will miss Manly and the excellent Movenpic ice-cream, you will have had some fun.
Nice trip. Well run, clean ferry. It is a nice change from hustle of downtown Sydney to sit back and enjoy the sail and the views.

Took ferry on recommendation & were glad we did. Ferry is frequent and inexpensive and takes you to a cracking beach on Manly ( although a school of sharks kept the numbers down in the water). We also followed a scenic walk trail for an hour or so alongside the beach. Good selection of shops at Manly and a pal tells me the Pizza restaurant by the ferry terminal is the dogs whatsits - sadly we were out of time

Definitely give this a go!. Spectacular views of the opera house - great for pics and a quick journey. Go and see Shelley beach or just potter around in the shops and Cafes. We ate at Hugos at the Ferry Terminal which was delicious- try the pizzas there!
Great for a afternoon trip. We visit Manley during the week in the afternoon. In the weekends it is very crowded.

Yes, Public Transport is an Attraction by Itself. It may seem odd to write a review of public transportation, but the Manly Ferry qualifies as an attraction worthy of review unto itself. (The destination, Manly Beach, is also beautiful.) The ferry is relatively inexpensive, runs on-time and with efficiency, and is the best way to introduce yourself to Sydney's amazing harbour. Sit outside, if you can, and as you leave Circular Quay snap pictures of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, and CBD. Then, as you keep sailing, you'll get great views of all of the waterside homes built into the cliffs on the harbour. Sit back, enjoy the sunshine, and have a great ride!
