If you can, catch the ride back to Sydney on one of the ferries that leaves before sunset; the views you'll have of the sun-setting in the harbour are very picture-worthy. Each time I take the ferry, I think it's about 40 mins. of paradise.
Quick and efficient service. Easy booking. Staff friendly. Third time for us and still enjoy the views especially coming back in the evening to the lights of Sydney Harbour.
Easy and cheap transportation. runs on the half hour. Amazing views, so don't forget your camera!

Cheap harbour tour. for a commuter route this was a great way to see a decent portion of the harbour. We did it on a weekend so there were boats all over the place. Makes for great sightseeing. the walk from the dock to the beach is maybe 15 minutes.
great scenery. A great way to see the harbour and harbour bridge. A great experience

The best view of the Opera House. This is an absolute must while visiting Sydney. The ferry leaves about every 30 minutes and takes approx 25 minutes each way. If the weather is nice, sit on the outside facing the side of the opera house. The boat does not turn around, it goes back and forth without turning so sit on the side of the opera house for an incredible view. Amazing photo opportunities. Once you reach Manly, walk straight up the street and after about 10 minutes you will reach the beach. Lot's of great restaurants to enjoy, then head back on the ferry. Great experience.

Time it right and it's worth 10x this. I was in Sydney on business alone but someone here told me how much I would enjoy the Manly Ferry. I took a ride on a whim while out looking for cheap dinner and was so pleased.I left Circular Quay at 6:30pm when it was still daylight everywhere. I got great photos, even with just my iPhone, and a chance to experience a little of what Sydney is like outside of the CBD. What was even cooler was on the way back the sun was setting and I got amazing sunset shots and great photos of the city and harbor bridge at night. Highly recommended, but check the sunset time first.
Worth the Trip. If you go to Sydney you have to go accross to manly and dip your feet in the ocean especially if you are from the other side of the world!
lovely and cool on a hot day. $13 for a return one hour trip on the harbour? Priceless!!
Very Pleasant. Very leisurely trip across the harbour - very pleasant, and very comfortable - lots to see
A great way to get to Manly..... Nice trip, good price and great views of the harbor. Highly recommended for a nice day trip.
Manly Ferry is a no brainer. It is quick, inexpensive, and on time (like clock-work).
Best way to see the Opera House and Bridge. Best way to see the opera house and bridge. When you get there, walk over to Manly beach and Shelley Beach.

Great way to drink in the views. The ferry to Manly is a great way to experience the natural beauty of Sydney's natural harbour.If you're taking the ferry, try to take the seats outside, and most of the views would be to the right hand side (if you're traveling in the direction of Manly). I'd think the best seats to take are the ones on the rear, to your left since you can look back at the city when the ferry travels to Manly.There is a cafe onboard in case you want to get a drink or some nibbles.
Be careful if it say's rough sea's warning........it means rough!. We travelled in July on a blustery day and when it crosses the mouth of the bay it was very rough for about 5 minutes.

Awesome way to see the bay. The Manly Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf was brilliant. At just $13.20 return, a ride is a must if you visit Sydney. To start, the ferries are wonderful old things, distinctive green, and provide a stable enough ride across the bay. And what a ride. From Circular Quay, you sail next to the Sydney Harbour Bridge, literally circling around the Sydney Opera House before heading towards Manly. The views of these icons, as well as the Sydney skyline, are just stunning – make sure you bring your camera! Get up close with the yacht and luxury boats as they enjoy a day on the water, and enjoy the sights of the Sydney harbour, all the way to the mouth of the harbour, where the open ocean beckons, before turning up to Manly.  Absolutely brilliant! A great ride, a sightseeing experience in its own right and a great way to get over to Manly. What more could you ask for?

Take the early evening Ferry across to Manly for a Sunset to die for..... Ditto all the comments of the reviewer below...Manly is a great spot to go to for good bars and restaurants or just to spend time on the far bay and has actually been improved a lot since I was last there.But one tip is try to time an evening visit for when the sun sets (this was the 5.30PM ferry when I was here in end of March) and as you pull out of Sydeny harbour, as well as icon vies of the Opera House and bridge together you will be rewarded with a sun set to die for as the sun drops between the sails of the Opera house and the sky turns orange..for the record its 30 minutes across to Manly on the old ferry boat (which is the one I always do) and I think you cut off 11 minutes if you take the fast cat, but personally i would leave this one to the commuters..

Best Harbour trip you can get. If you in Sydney make sure to take a ride on to Manly on the ferry. It's like a harbour cruise but only costs a fraction.Spectacular views of the harbour and of course the Harbour Bridge and the Opera (city-bound trip even better for obvious reasons)Manly is worth a visit anyway, but if you are shaort on time just take the cruise

Ride the waves en route to a cornucopia of delights. Travelling on a CityRail train is an interesting prelude to joining the iconic Manly ferry service.The latter takes half an hour each way. A typical frequency is a ferry each way every half hour although this varies slightly in peak hours.Passengers can view the world famous Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge, Fort Denison, the entrance to Sydney Harbour, bushland and residential development along the way.Cresting the waves is a compulsory addition to some trips, but in really bad weather, the ferry may not operate. In lieu, the Manly JetCat will provide a partial replacement service but the current NSW Government has decided that from 31 January 2009 the JetCat will cease operations.The ferries have some outdoor seating and a small onboard cafe.A holiday-like atmosphere prevails among many passengers outside peak hour.With Manly being a great destination, a trip on this ferry is highly recommended.
